text: I think Matts has had his minutes of fame, note to the owners, your food is quite good, your staff is excellent, so please save your money and move to a better location right now, you are next to a run down hotel with police tape everywhere to appease the local residents who are seriously begging for any customers waiting outside your place, just sad, I won't be going there again, I won't recommend it either, good luck This summer, the heat will melt all the customers in your waiting room.

on the way to the airport I decided to stop at Teds for a bite to eat since I live very close to this place and have never tried it before I thought it would be a great time to check this place out, it was good, nothing special inside and although I wasn't blown away by my experience here I really enjoyed myself, we waited in line and I ordered a giant beef hot dog with some Chili Austin got a sausage with some of the toppings and fries, we both liked it and plan to go back. soon pretty good

the roads are good, the service is not that good, this place is a tourist trap in every sense of the word, the restaurant and gift shop are overpriced for what you get and the ice cream is nothing special, the staff service needs to be much better and treat the customers the way you want, always understaffed, always waiting for food, been there half a dozen times, no improvement comes to the area for the beautiful views, not for the food or souvenirs, a excellent road for motorbikes in summer, outdoor cooking.

I have known my way around Sky Harbor Airport since I was years old and the terminal was a real terminal since then their attempts to improve transportation, parking and the airport terminals have made it extremely confusing to take the wrong lane and end up in the parking lot when all you wanted to do was drop someone off at the departures curb. The terminal remains the most accessible with parking located across the street and few airlines parked there as only a few airlines now use this terminal. pizza and doesn't seem clean, the terminal is a bit more complicated although they have parking attached to the terminal allowing you to enter any level via the elevator, more airlines use this terminal and it is much smaller than the terminal making it easier to navigate oh terminal you are so nice, new and clean, you have access to great restaurants like Flow Shanghai Café, Einstein's quizzes and more. at boarding you have tons of stores from border books to local tourist trash i would like to love you but you are just a mess it is very difficult to navigate your lanes to get to where you are going to pick up and drop off is dangerous because of people walking away from the curb into the lanes without looking and security is a pain not only is there always a long queue but the tea attendants regularly yell at people to be careful i am afraid to walk out of the terminal because that I have to leave very early because there are airports much easier to navigate and use, but we are stuck with Sky Harbor. I can only hope that the light rail access once completed will help make this a friendlier airport.

I had lunch here today after hearing all the colossal raves about it, but once I walked in I realized that any semblance of having an authentic Chinese meal had gone out the window, no offense to my hungry white friends, I decided to try it anyway. I was seated by a friendly waiter and ordered the hot and sour soup which they were able to put in chicken instead of pork as a bonus and the waiter recommended the house chicken. spicy, look, damn, I'm brown people, that's my problem anyway, the hot and sour soup arrived and it was excellent. I was happy that nothing ruins a Chinese meal more than starting it with a bowl of hideous soup, then came the homemade chicken with added green beans for steamed rice costing another dollar. service, the waiter noticed that I was not devouring my dish and offered to replace it with any other dish of my choice at no extra cost. Who does this nowadays in a Chinese restaurant, no less extra stars are from the bay area like me, so he gave me information about good Asian food in Phoenix for dims, he recommended the Golden Buddha first, the Great Wall, second and third, then for Vietnamese he recommended a place on the avenue between the Indian school. Phoenix is ​​a bit of a letdown compared to California, but almost all Asian restaurants, he admitted, including China Chili, cater to their core customers who, by their demographics, are virtually non-Asian. He told me that China Chili is where people go for Chinese food, including Chris Bianca of Pizzeria Bianca, the mayor, the Channel News people, the owner of the Diamondbacks, and so take that for what you will when I asked if this Chinese chili was affiliated with the one in Fremont no but people say this place is good and classy and has an electric piano bonus points for knowing that either way he recommended I come back and get the mongolian beef next time which i will definitely do more the hot and sour soup i didn't mind the large open seating area many chinese restaurants are like that, loud and raucous, the chinese chili is a case where the service overcame the food again, how often does that happen to come back and give it another chance and there you go

ok, it's a nice place but I'm not sure I'd go out of my way to go there. I was in town on business and thought I would give them a try. The food was good but not great. The shredded beef taco was typical and the shredded pork burrito tasted more like beef. that would be where the service was then, so maybe it was because I was in a group, whatever the reason it wasn't happening, hey at least the salsa was tasty

the only thing this crispy cream place has to offer is a convenient location and passing by you won't see any donuts made here which is kind of part of what the crispy cream experience should be like seeing them being made ordering them as they come out so they are still warm for your first bite now so let's take this review as if it were a regular donut shop and it doesn't hold up either, the momandpop store that i have closer to me actually tastes better but that's probably because they make them then and there I guess they transport the ones they sell here from a different location or a centralized location where they make them which completely explains why the frostings and taste like they've been sitting for a while they're still ok donuts the other thing this place is lacking is in the coffee. I ordered a coffee and the person had one of those oversized half and half containers from clover farms and asked if I wanted some in my coffee and to tell him when to stop, I'm sorry but who puts anything on their coffee without even tasting it first, not me, it's definitely the worst experience having coffee here, bottom line the donuts here are not going to be what you expect from a crispy cream and forget ordering a coffee which will be to your taste

In a kitschy word, this pink palace serves a number of ice cream dishes, including favorites such as banana splits and brownie sundaes, as well as build your own creations. The ice cream itself was disappointing. I was expecting a homemade recipe, but was a little surprised when I saw bins of dryers being brought into the front dining room given that it's located in Old Town Scottsdale, a venerable dumping ground for knick-knacks galore. The sugar bowl was exactly what I expected in terms of decor. and kitsch kitsch and more kitsch atmosphere where is the elateride parmalat when you need it

It saddens me to say that this is not the worst Mexican restaurant we have eaten at that is on Oahu near Waikiki Beach, but it is close, hell we had to drive by arrobas to get to this place. I had a chimichanga which was a little anemic, although the filling was ok, the beans, the tasteless rice looked the part, but as spicy as your average meal of boiled meat and root vegetables, the fajita salad also lacked pizzazz with all the appearance of being tasty. bland chicken generally unless there is an attempt to chew rather than cook I will order a basic dish but I don't shoot the chef and trust me these guys are safe from sand agents very safe first timer and if the beatrice sucks no comeback overall it feels like space aliens are running the place and they learned to cook from pictures this is definitely a mistake we we will not repeat

I've been living in Mark Taylor properties for about five or six years now and I have to say they've gone down considerably over the last few years when I started living in my first property in MT. The front desk staff took the time to get to know you by name, kept up to date with any ongoing issues, and were proactive about things. years extra charges are even added for services you may or may not use anyway you have to pay the only reason I didn't give them a star is because of the maintenance staff they are what the front desk staff were friendly polite and very responsive to your issues they actually have a pretty similar opinion to the front desk people that's pretty telling

I'm new to the Phoenix area and was in the mood to have someone else make my breakfast for a change and came across all these rave reviews of Matts on Yelp. Normally I find the reviews on Yelp to be pretty much accurate and very honest. This is my first case of the opposite. extra star for using local ingredients, this place is below Waffle House and others on my list, the hash browns were more like a hash brown omelet that needed a few more minuets. I mashed raw potatoes in the middle, they easily take over a little too serious. the bread was good, nice thick slices of what appeared to be locally baked loaves, the jam that came with the toast was good too, but it was snatched away before I could finish. Overall this place is good for sheep who need to eat downtown but lacks anything for a reason to come back or recommend to anyone if you are in the area and considering eating here try somewhere else. options in the area give a chance to someone else who isn't counting on you to eat there because they were about to

inexpensive for early bird special for combo plates which include spring roll soup rice and your selection if the food only had more seasoning or flavor it was very bland and flavorless I don't usually use soy sauce but I had to use it to add something to my dish with a pond of ki inside with a bridge over it

this place was horrible i will never go back it was overpriced and the best thing i ate was the cornbread you get before the meal i had the filet mignon stuffed with chorizo ​​it was like chewing a piece of rubber stuffed with soy my girlfriend had flavorless tacos with stale corn tortillas three words it sucked, sucked, sucked

we wanted to take you for your last few dinners we were thinking about which place had specials on a Tuesday and I remembered that the copies had a special and a food challenge and that's how I ended up on copies on a Tuesday that they were featured on. I think it's man versus food but I'm not sure I'm into their food challenge on Tuesdays, they have an ace special of Jewish fries with the purchase of a drink to keep in mind a plate of Jewish fries, I've been told the specials here are sliders, the sliders themselves are a decent size, I say maybe it's the same size as the small mod burgers but the larger Jewish sliders have cakes in them potatoes. Western sliders don't make breakfast. Sliders are something completely different. friendly ink, I think most Arizonans in general are friendlier than the Californians I meet daily hahahhaa and our waitress did her best to split the checks for our group, that was pretty cool of her, I'm glad I went here for the experience but I won't be back, lesson learned, don't trust a bunch of inflexible boys hungry after the gym to choose a place for dinner

so going at Christmas was always a risk, there was a wait and the parties in front of my group left there, we people were waiting for their order for more than minutes but when we asked how long it would be before we sat down and got our food we were told a few minutes, he was true to his word that the food was good, the spring rolls were awesome, we didn't really have a waiter to look after us but it was ok, the bus gave us more of water when we asked, I would probably go again if I was in the area but I would just as soon have the panda

a no frills hole in the wall burgers the burger is made to order delicious and the perfect mix of juicy and slightly fatty so you know you are eating the real deal the fixing bar is an interesting concept that I like because I can stack as many treats as I like the bar gets a little messy at times but hey whatever, the burgers aren't the cheapest but then again if you want cheap you go to a dollar menu no it's worth it and fight some of the students across the street at Phoenix College for a bite at the burger factory

this place is hit or miss for me, I always ordered the feta gyro and either fries or a small greek salad, why is the soda machine always broken, I wonder what is broken and not fixed in the kitchen. I ate here for the th or th time on Thursday. with salad

when the Tempe Market was being put together, wow, a classy place where college kids and casual adults could get together and have fun. The Cadillac Ranch was under construction and the hype was hot enough to make you buy a meal in advance, read the reviews but I thought they were trying it and now I see why it has two stars. to myself at least the food should be good, the sliders meal may have been scarce on meat but the slider patties were the size of silver dollars, tasty but small, yes the service was slow, my glass was refilled faster by the gentlemen than the waiter himself. The happy hour deal seems sort of appropriate, I recommend it if you're stuck hanging out in the Tempe market and you only have a few bucks and you're feeling like it's almost full and now I think the Tempe market has taken Mill Aves Lovely, they need to step up their efforts to compensate by killing a once ornate chill out spot because and shopping in Tempe is a goodie, the deaf might replace cr with maybe the banana that knows goodbye for now

My colleague and I met for lunch this afternoon, the restaurant was understandably busy and there was a delay in the delivery of our food when my pear and potato omelette arrived, this caused mixed reactions. The omelette itself was served hot and loaded with bacon and cheese. The potatoes served on the side were still frozen in the middle. but throw some fresh potatoes on the plate the waiter said if the kitchen had to make the omelette again there might be a long delay, I could only respond with a shrug, he left and went to the kitchen with my plate several other people touched and forked the plate and potatoes before replacing them, he then took the plate back to me at the bar and not to my table end result good omelette potatoes mediocre subpar service and poor follow-up

Ronald's Italian Deli is a really good lunch spot if you're in this area and looking for something a little lighter than a burger and fries. They are conveniently located near the corner of Deer Valley and next to Dunking Donuts. They are open for breakfast, lunch and early dinner. I recommend going there during breakfast or lunch if you are interested in the daily specials that are on their hot plates. cut salads loaded with just about anything you can imagine, they also have a small selection of homemade pasta salads, I also had their rye pastrami with their spiced opener and horseradish vinaigrette, the pastrami was very good but had to be heated in the microwave. deli in Phoenix but much better than any deli chain, it's a good alternative to burgers and fries

my name is christi and i'm addicted to bread with my pasta my lovers fancy pizza crust yes hash browns with my french toast i tried to quit but i can't and i also resigned myself to the theory of life so what does hay bring to starch i almost had a salad at bar louis because it was a pretty late dinner and i wanted to save room in my belly for the dirty martinis but they have a appetizer that I couldn't live without trying a hot pretzel sticks huge hot soft pretzels covered in salt served with simple cheese sauces and honey mustard dip but during my care I opted out that evening it was the tastiest thing I have ever eaten I can vouch for the pretzels but other than that the service blew pieces in minutes to get photos impatient when we were the only table in our waiters section when people impatiently order it means they are on a mission so give it to them quickly we canceled our drinks and left to drink wine in our hotel room we knew we would get drinks quicker there if you I'll go get the pretzels not for the impatient

horrible, I had a gel manicure, the teacher didn't let my old gel soak long enough so she scraped and filed so hard to remove it that it left my natural nail extremely thin and fragile. The new polish that was applied was thick in some areas and thinner in others. I didn't realize it until I got home. I grabbed my purse and almost broke my naturally long nails because they were so fragile. What happened was that the gentleman who answered the phone told me that I was wrong and that they would not refund my money. I'll never come back and I'm sure I'm sorry I did in the first place.

this place has no idea how much men's items are priced and I wouldn't recommend them at all. I consigned a leather briefcase worth close to it and they priced it for giving me a huge take home price. I understand the need to move merchandise quickly and naturally this sold out in a matter of days, but I can't understand why they wouldn't try to get more money for the item. I can only assume they didn't do their research before setting the price, consignor beware.

I'm moving to Phoenix in the winter and thought I'd check out some fish while I was visiting, which led me to reef farming in the first place. I was positive seeing some nice displays and use of LEDs, but that quickly changed upon closer inspection. Many tanks were infested with aphasia and bubble algae and coral prices were extremely inflated compared to other prices in the area. to get their attention, I was belittled and treated like a child who knew nothing about the hobby. I have had marine tanks for over a decade, ranging from large gallon to small, after that gross and humiliating experience I continued to go through the last few tanks and came across an anglerfish. slammed the phone, snapped his fingers at me and told me to stop harassing the fish, keep in mind I wasn't tapping the glass or pushing anything as I'm quite short and could barely reach the high tank where the anglerfish were much less within reach of harassing any fish after this rude treatment I quickly left this kind of unprofessional treatment of guests is shocking and unacceptable, let alone the tanks infested with bubble algae, a spore of this on the water you put your coral in and your tank is also infected, I will not do business here when I move

I think the lady behind the counter didn't like me, maybe it was me, I don't know, that's exactly how I felt when my boss first told me about this place, I thought he said al Molina and I was like you mean the guy who played doc rock in Epidermal. I've been here several times today, this was my first time in El Moline in about months. My office, one thing I really didn't like was that you had to ask for the key to use the bathroom, it's something very typical, like a gas station where the bums use to shit on the floor. I went to the bathroom and he told me I had to ask for the key. em but don't you have something chips that I can buy for a dollar that comes with a much more reasonable serving size I have all these chips in the fridge at work that won't be edible on Monday probably the burrito I got was very tasty the salsa they gave me was also super good nice and smoky and spicy seriously man that shit was spicy I kind of have a sore throat today so that spiciness felt really good I had to laugh when I opened it my togo back once I got back to work because I actually thought maybe I hadn't had salsa but when I took a look they gave me so much I did a little spin next to my meal like a stonehenge of three star heat good not great bathroom weird unfriendly lady good food overpriced

Came here the other night at a party, overall the experience was satisfactory, the waitresses were nice yes, some had serious cleavage and they were mostly on top of the situation, they ordered the kids' plates first and got drinks. the hot sauce overall it exceeded my expectations which weren't too high given what i read here the plus was the entertainment value with people trying to ride the mechanical bull only one person in our group did it after pictures of jack daniels overall it's a great place to go if you're looking for a casual place with decent food and side entertainment

star for service and attitude the food was delicious but the staff was very hateful I'm writing this review I don't remember the name of the waitress but I remember she was short hispanic and was pregnant at the time she was incredibly hateful, hateful and rude to me and my parents. I dress differently, more manly, different waitresses, same good food, same hateful attitudes. I will urge everyone reading this to save your time and money and go to another pizza place or pizza place to get better service.

I bought a deal from Living Social and waited a while to call them, thinking they were swamped with business now I can't get them to call me back so I can use my deal note. There were no reviews for this company on Yelp prior to the Living Social offer. Of course Living Social doesn't help, their website says I need to call a consumer advocate in my area, that sort of thing, I predict this will be the demise of every dealoftheday site, the company selling the deal is at no risk of having to pay refunds if the company supplies the goods. or the services are not working, I have since canceled my subscriptions to all dealoftheday emails, lesson learned on two unethical companies

I was a little disappointed after reading the reviews here. I had the fajitas, my wife had the tacos, I didn't think the green inferno chiles were that hot, the taco meat wasn't spicy and bland, the best part of the meal was the bean dip and chips, even the salsa wasn't anything great, at least the beer was cold in a pitcher, it better be

I went there tonight before the game, the best thing about the whole bar was their shirts, I really wanted the shirt that said you looked like you could have a drink anyway, I had the nachos, bad choice, drenched in cheese sauce and melted cheese, beans, cheese, peppers, cheese, tomatoes and oh, headcheese, it was a soggy mess and it was huge. I have to give it minus another star for the horrible music they play seriously. If I'm going to see a game I don't think house and dance music is the way to go, but also to each their own, but I had to shorten the time during the game because I started getting soggy nachos maybe.

first of all the hours this place keeps the most absurd hours for a restaurant serving students and faculty, I can't tell you how many times I've gone to get a sandwich and the bags have been closed, they open in the morning and close around or in the afternoon. I can't say definitively what the times are because they don't list them on the bags website, apparently they are trying to keep that a secret. I understand that a sandwich shop in downtown Phoenix is ​​keeping these hours, but here is an update for bag owners as students and faculty are not keeping bank hours. food quality is poor but sandwiches are reasonably priced

well I wouldn't have the dragon lady roll again but the humans were good and the rainbow roll was good, too many cream cheese and mayonnaise rolls on this menu, not even busy on a Sunday night with the bus game in town, nice atmosphere

a nice place to watch a game, it's open enough that you can keep an eye on the game while you consider your many dining alternatives. They also let in natural sunlight and keep the place cool at the same time. Anyway, I don't have a good reason to give this place one star or five stars, so three stars.

I had seen them before, but never stopped with a drink menu and was quite happy with a good selection of margaritas and such. The dinner menu was good too, the drinks were excellent and the food was tasty. I will make a return trip if for nothing more than a drink, ask.

pretty decent place right in the heart of the action, saw some separate arrests while drinking beer on the patio, they have a few different peaks, those facts alone made it a successful venture did I mention it was midday on a Friday

First, I hope the management of La Fonda reads these reviews and takes action to improve their restaurant. Second, we also miss the Bloody Mary Bar, my husband I visited a few weeks ago on a Saturday night for dinner, we asked the waitress a general question about a beer and she made up something that was ridiculously wrong, okay she doesn't know beer, we liked the chip salsa, that was a good start, then I took a sip of my water, I know what tap water tastes like at tempe, but it was weird the aftertaste. made me cringe I couldn't drink it even with a slice of lemon in it maybe it was the ice cream my husband ordered chicken enchiladas which he orders almost everywhere and it was so bad he didn't finish it my meal wasn't memorable either I wanted to like this place or at least that way we left there terribly disappointed I doubt we will return
for a small sandwich with an egg, two greasy strips of bacon and a stale muffin, they say it's expensive because they buy it locally, it must have substance to be considered something so gross

Honestly I love cupcakes like I said in my nasty bakery review eating a cupcake unlike a slice of cake gives a feeling of accomplishment I love cupcakes I love the feeling of accomplishment you get from eating a cupcake you may have had a hard day but you finished a whole cupcake which is validation it makes me happy. light chocolate cake style with cream cheese frosting, I disagree, I don't detect any cream cheese flavor in this frosting, the first time I devoured a chip cupcake it was magical, I was particularly impressed by the dark and white Belgian dark chocolate with creamy vanilla frosting. my car, a baba subaru and the cupcakes seemed quite big again, I have to think consuming a sprinkled cupcake in the sun wouldn't be a good idea, the cupcake to eating space ratio would be quite bad for real cupcake validation, I'll drive the miles to the bad guy, ok you caught me, I might pass as an emergency fix if I'm around but I'll think of the bad guy's slave and consume my confection in a small space

I liked the concept, the staff was very good, the food tasted like it was reheated in the microwave and cold on the top and hot on the bottom after watching our movie. We wanted to buy tickets a week in advance for another movie. We went to customer service and asked if they knew if the shade would be played on the bride and groom. and hard to order tickets, I looked for tickets for tomorrow and it says show time is not available, looks like they don't want anyone to come see movies after spending on food and movie, I think I'll try another place
they have great promotions and if you like mexican diving grab some outfits there are much better places that aren't a chain

I'm a book addict, I'm sure libraries are my Mecca, but I'm hard to get a spy card, it was a breeze. I only needed one proof of residency, even though I brought all three recommendations, including a Netflix envelope, once I had my card I was ready to explore. I first headed to the public computers that help you locate books. Yes, with pieces of paper and mini-pencils at hand. I found my book morphing into another section, from fiction to large print, I decided to turn this hunt into a tour, so I wandered the aisles, studied the section names, and finally got acquainted with the library system. Don't get me wrong, it's not rocket science, nor is it pop rocks having found my books and some dads that I checked out very easily too. ready to find at least one of the books on my no list, so I put a few on hold for myself and wandered around very disappointed. That's when I started not liking this library, any of my books, really, this library is not user friendly like others, I saw even the library in Stillwater Oklahoma was more comfortable than this one. a man who volunteered there showed me how to use the self checkout system, he was a friendly man who assumed I knew nothing about self checkout machines and probably doubted my ability to read as he explained to me step by step what I needed to do to check out my books at least the lesson was in depth enough for me to fully understand it and more so the next time I went to snoop to retrieve the books I had put on hold I used self checkout I was in and out in minutes so let's recap the book slip slip doesn't always have the books you want sad face you can renew online create a profile and share reviews you can place books on hold from any computer if you are logged into your account the people who work there are friendly it's easy to get a card just bring your sip bill like I did it's not an easy place to navigate the spy doesn't make you want to spend hours there there are private rooms but you don't know how you book them there are monthly activities at the library but mostly about holdfast diets and how to use microsoft word there is free parking in the shade you can check your items yourself with their self checkout it's quite ugly inside the lifeless dull brown seat

if your products weren't my number two love I would abandon you, I'm only saying this about this place, an associate was so arrogant I wanted to punch her and I'm not a violent individual, the fashion square gets my loyalty

do not do business with this unethical company, my savings account was recently robbed for a month for account inactivity fees, they are a bunch of scammers, it seems you now have to nickel and dime your customers with their fees in order to stay in the closed business account.

a little disappointed, we were waiting for the right time to visit this place and today happened to be that day, first of all the location is in the middle of what appears to be a ghost town. The interior had lots of character with items like the family John Deer tractor. Anyway, we had the full slab with sides, a bottle of ginger beer and a drink. Honestly, I expected more from this place. same price, sit back and relax while they serve you and the food is better, a little out, priced for a cafeteria style, I think it's a bit too much food, not the least important to us, very classic decor and full of character. I just received a very nice message from the owner, Joe, I think it's wonderful that Joe cares about each customer's comments and reviews, even though my review wasn't very positive. happy

I had dinner at Rama Thai a couple of days ago, it wasn't a horrible dining experience but I'm not sure I'll go back my friend and I ordered the spring rolls sorry I don't remember the name Thai and they were two pieces small but the price was then what I expected and an average filling that I would expect from frozen spring rolls we are both vegetarian and were happy to see a vegetarian section on the menu but were slightly disappointed with the options three of the items included oyster sauce and the other three were either vegetarian fried rice or rescreen vegetable curry. I ordered the green curry vegetables medium hot and my friend ordered the red curry vegetables mild and she stressed mild. We waited a few minutes for our dinner to arrive. I didn't mind my dish, it was way spicier than average, but I didn't mind a little heat. The sauce was very runny and the vegetables were soggy and looked like they had been sitting in the sauce for quite a while. it was worth it the service was slow but the waitresses were very friendly overall I probably wouldn't recommend this restaurant to a friend

the food is simple, plain and simple, you taste and hopefully enjoy every ingredient, but as with most minimally processed cooked foods they don't travel well so eat in, luckily the decor is modern and complements the menu well making eating in a pleasure. My only negative note is on the service. If you are not careful when entering the restaurant, you can enter through the invisibility door and will become invisible to the employees. your invisible fades based on my late lunch experience today the dust takes a few minutes to remove email replies or texts from the iPhone unfortunately I only had three unanswered emails in my mail and had to leave before I could be seen by the employees on a positive note when you leave no matter how long you waited the invisibility dust seems to be removed I know this because no one honked or yelled at you my car while it was leaving without a driver
yuck the service and food was lousy, never a win

I don't understand the concept of a good vegetarian restaurant, but the need to create a mockery and make fun of the fact that the word mockery appears in the menu no less than many times and it made me want to run away, tell, tell mach, I don't care, I understand this from a marketing strategy aimed at attracting and/or converting carnivores and omnivores. I guess meat eaters feel better about eating something vegetarian as long as it's shaped like a chicken wing. medallions, I am also aware that we eat with our eyes have preconceived notions about certain types of cuisine and yet I strongly believe that if an establishment uses vegetables, legumes, tofu and the like and gets creative instead of trying to reinvent the wheel of meat, the end result would be much better, for example the mexicali hamburger, no reference to meat here, how about listing something like whatever it is served at the parmesan way, I stopped here for lunch yesterday as I was in the cool space corner, it was open colorful and inviting a few lines of organs a small space in the front, nice mild funk flavor in the decor, the order is done counter style and they present it to you, you instead go behind the counter to get ice for your drink which I thought was a little weird. stunned me, I think it may have been crispy long before it was served to me and microwaved, the texture was just large amounts of rooster sauce, uh, Sirach saved it from Blandsville, I'm not saying I'd never come back as I tend to give places more than one chance. I like well-prepared vegetarian dishes, but don't make fun of me.

I had never been to Rainforest Café and I'm glad I got to try it because I like to try things at least once, but this will also be the last time I go there. We will start from the beginning. The atmosphere was nice for the jungle but it was so loud I couldn't hear my wife talking to me. It was too much chocolate syrup and it was expensive, we sent it back so she could have water, later food delivery was quick and my burger was pretty good but it was simple and so expensive for something so simple I got onion rings for a few dollars more they were okay but worth the extra few dollars, my wife got an extra plate of fries and they were a few dollars but they didn't give her more than ten. I'm sick that night, not as amazing as I thought after seeing it several times in Vegas

maybe it's because I've never met a bowl of someone I didn't like, but I could gulp down this stuff all day, the kitchen does a decent job with them, the broth is so delicious and soothing, I've never had that in all the Vietnamese restaurants I've been to and here's what I didn't like about the kitchens with a view, the chicken is a bit dry and tasteless, the broth has a ton of flavor so when you take a bite of chicken with the broth is good, but eating it alone is way too much. all they have to do is season it a little before cooking it. The spring rolls were also very fresh and excellent dipped in the sauce without the sauce, they would have been a little dry too overall, this is my place for that as it is so close to home.

the kids and I love Starbucks but this one leaves a lot to be desired, we have been here a long time and every time I wonder why I go back to this one, the service there is almost rude, they seem bored of being busy, they never seem happy to serve you, the drinks take forever to make even though they are not as busy as the others, we won't even get into the fact that my order was ruined the last few times, the main problem that I have is the fact that out of time when to sit and relax with a snack, someone really needs to sweep the floor near me while I sit there, there are much better Starbucks and I think I will try others locally, kids and I went today for our snack, I wanted to say things were better today, I won't change my rating until my next visit
it's a salad bar

the food is okay and pretty cheap, the only complaints I have about it is that the place is pretty small and can get crowded, they don't serve alcohol but there is a liquor store next door so I can eat and then have a beer, but sometimes it's nice to have a margarita with your burro and not always but sometimes a particular lady who works there can be a little rude and can mess up your order even though I enjoy their food and that it is within walking distance of my residence

Breadfruit is a nice place, the interior of the place is well decorated and they only seat people creating an intimate and pleasant ambiance. I really appreciate that they serve locally grown organic produce and that their chicken is all natural and cage-free. Any downtown Jamaican restaurant addition deserves at least three stars in my book. I liked that the wonton was baked and not fried, the presentation was nice, the mango chutney was fresh but the buns themselves lacked flavor. I really wish they would have combined other fruits or spices to add more contrast to the dish for my main course. the chef owner came over and asked us how we enjoyed our meal and explained his philosophy behind the food. The service was excellent but compared to other Jamaican places I've been this really only deserves stars sorry.

not a good experience last night at Eastward I'll start off by saying I've been eating here for over years when it was Tokyo Express and now eastward I was a weekly customer when I lived closer now it's every day or so we went to dinner and it took way too long to get seated in the half empty restaurant we were seated next to a family that must have been friends or family with a server as she was constantly at their table she was there while we waited and obviously saw us before finally showing us a table. The waiter was a guy who must have been new because he seemed very nervous and didn't know the menu, so we ordered the sushi sample for me and the Korean beef and vegetable roll for her. I got the sushi but not the salad and soup which came with the vegetable roll turned into an egg roll, it all arrived at once and the waiter didn't come back until we were finished after consulting with the waiter he took away the egg roll and our drink guess that's supposed to make up for it.

I stopped here one morning and was told I was a little early. I was used to cafes that open earlier I guess, but they were nice and invited me to sit and wait. I loved their stacks of Latin American fashion clothing and the artwork on the walls was beautiful. They also had ice water to serve you. My favorite thing to do was go down to the Danielle store downtown and get some coffee at the Royal and some of their rosemary shortbread cookies, it doesn't look delicious but trust me they are sure to ask for it the moment I went, the place obviously wasn't crowded and I received attentive service.

solid, we started the happy hour which includes alcohol and tacos as I had the duck with shrimp and the pork civil cochinita, they were smaller than most of the street style tacos I've had and boy did I eat a lot of them cali at my and even a little soggy, the duck was my least favorite as it had a rubbery taste and texture, the shrimp was in demand but for my money the cochinita was definitely where it's at with its super porky delight we also shared the quest funding rich in chunks of cream cheese what it was really tasty but could probably double the spackle in a pinch, the most successful item of the evening was the churrs with goats cheese caramel between my buddies and myself we made quick work of this dish each of us had our house margarita which was strong just the way I like it but I'm not entirely sure I would order this drink at any unsatisfied prices but one of the big downsides was our waiter was really in a hurry and we struggled to get his attention overall I think I'll be back to try other dishes the chicken la taupe looked really appealing be warned although it's a common expense expect to pay for most starters on a postcard restricted budget it's definitely a splurge we loved the mural hinterland and groovy art inside
I thought this bagel shop was okay, the bagel sandwich I received was relatively lackluster. I think I'll stick to Einsteins for now.

stars went to the flamenco show last Sunday a brilliantly talented company of dancers and musicians the center just completed a year-long renovation, all seats may have been completely renovated, railings added and handicapped accessible seating on the orchestra level and upgraded their central air conditioning system the Chandler Symphony offers free concerts on a monthly basis the center's programming schedule can be found here

mi patio is a star restaurant some days the food tastes better than others and some days the entertainment value is better than others but it's not a chain it's within walking distance and has very affordable margaritas there are no bike racks and the iquitos are basically a carne asama taco with no toppings which I like

Jerry ugh I try to love you since we live so close to each other but ugh I've had many irritating experiences at Jerry's in a nutshell I'm using red prismacolor pencils I'm running out and I'm going to Jerry's they don't have them I don't know if they carry them and and no one can tell me when or if they might reappear why the seemingly standard answer is because the order is from a company in North Carolina or somewhere far, far away where it there is no phone or email access, I will buy Sculley gives the same answer as to when he might return. I need Pitt brush tip markers in Castle fiber, same story with airbrush equipment, come back Tuesday or Thursday or call us and we will check if it is there. I can walk to Jerry's without thinking, but I'd rather go to an art center or somewhere else than have to call in overtime. the clerks I have dealt with are some of my rants from the handful I have dealt with mostly in the morning and day, it seems like they don't really know the store that well or don't care to give any insight into their products or business, they have a large store and I understand there is a lot of inventory to know and locate but that's your job, it seems like no one I have dealt with there really knows their stuff. I talked to a girl there who was really chatting to me. her recent art party where she painted this huge room and blah blah blah but when I asked her if she knew when they might have more brush tip markers she was mom no idea Jerry just clean it up and ask your people to act towards you and your customers with the same passion they have with their own art do it and I will try to love you again

thanks to Sarah L for bringing to my attention that the lunch menu from which I got my crab cake information was for the Nyx location, but I noted that the crab cake appetizer in Scottsdale was probably a smaller portion than the lunch entree. Yes, it's Barneys and I understand the high price.

terrible service, they replaced my phone screen and it broke, the phone wasn't dropped or mishandled, it's just cracked and the owner didn't honor their warranty, they only accept cash which should be a red flag if you're considering a company like this.

slowest ride ever also the quintessential short bus location I frequented this place at dinner time as it's the closest to my house on several occasions and every time it's between a minute ordeal when I worked at Mickey's this was in the early years we had what was called the dry purse ho from order to pickup shouldn't be more than seconds this shouldn't be practiced anymore I have to say hello when I'm driving up to the speaker due to no response then I get someone who is rude and says yes I order the Big Mac deal buy it for an employee says they don't offer I advise their menu at the front does it after a minute of silence and the cars back up I feed to make sure he is still alive to see what is happening total lack of service just he had to ask the manager to show him how to call him no excuses or whatever be it, this happened every time I went there, crook

I'm a fan of taco stands in general, but this place constantly ruins my beloved bacon, potato and cheese breakfast burrito every now and then, they nail it perfectly, but most of the time there's something missing, the bacon is often burnt and the eggs, poor eggs, are browned beyond recognition and sometimes just a thin layer of bubbly burnt stuff.

I went there because several people I know have raved about this place because I'm an inactive vegetarian and still trying to get back on track and I heard the veggie sandwiches were amazing and because I'm a malt freak and found out they had malts there I was disappointed and my friend I was with who had been one of the die hard fans of Sticklers said that although everything was fine this time the place seems to have gone down hill the Sticklers wasn't busy at all maybe tables of customers and people queuing but even though there were lots of workers behind the counter the service was very slow we had to wait a long time for our veggie sandwiches now my friend was there when it was busy and she said the service was much faster then so maybe the staff were exhausted from the earlier lunch the bread was nice crispy on the outside and soft inside but the veggie sandwich itself was boring it's supposed to have swiss provolone and american cheese on it i couldn't even taste the swiss or provolone at all the american supercharged the sandwich and i was more like a cheezwhiz guy, i'm always looking for a good malt that really tastes like a malt and not a shake, my chocolate malt tasted more like a shake and i didn't Was impressed with the ice cream, my mate loved his vanilla malt, but the only thing I liked about Sticklers was that they have the little bags of Miss Vickie chips to buy it. carried in certain delicatessens and sandwich shops

just so you know phone calls now cost pennies for minutes, so proclaims the hand-scrawled sign behind the bar next to the cashier, even dive bars need a little order among the chaos that hid here for a cold drink after walking through the festival being moody. I'm just a sucker for a dive bar once my eyes got used to the darkness, I saw an amazing mix of people, almost hipster Indians and a traditional barfly, the gear back was freezing and cheap, there was a back door for quick getaways or to smoke. Times are really tough as I noticed on a trip to the men's room that three of the flies were passing around a handmade cigarette

I'm sad to say I wasn't in love with the macalpines, the fact that the building has never been restored is cool in a dirty way, the floors will never be clean enough as they are so old it might seem ridiculous but cleanliness is important to me when eating somewhere, our server was strange but helpful and attentive, we spent a lot of time ogling at the random items displayed everywhere and had fun with our surroundings. The food is where I saw the problem, my mac cheeseburger was bland and tasteless, my broccoli and cheese soup was below average, I wasn't impressed at all, we ended up having dessert, I opted for a single chocolate malt brunch ball, which I had never had before and didn't like total personal preference as my friend liked it, macalpines are cool but I think it's purely a place to get something sweet

I like the idea of the sidebar but I don't really like the place where the drinks are decent so I would go for that although I never found it very fun once I went in and had an amazing bartender from Sanfrancisco I really enjoyed that visit but the next time I had this bartender and he was really tense and condescending every time someone asked him a question it really bothered me and it made the experience less fun, I never went back.

I don't drink, so my opinion won't be influenced by anything other than the building. I gave it two stars for the building. They did a beautiful job with the renovation. I'm a fan of mid-century and I'm a fan of food. I have to admit that I'm particularly hard on restaurants full of scenesters. the price of the food, as long as it makes you want to eat there

see the huge sign outside that says yes, it's for shirts only. I was caught off guard when I brought my skirt and got nailed for about 10 minutes while I unfortunately handed in my bill. The lady at the counter said a lot of people told her they felt betrayed by the sign outside, no kidding. alteration service on site and maybe it was worth a dollar uh oh I picked up my skirt a few weeks later with a jersey chick at the counter and was told I owed another one refused to pay twice she yelled at me chased me to my car took down my license plate and said the police would visit niiiice

the staff were very rude, the bowling alley prices were not displayed to the best of their ability, the extreme bowling itself was overpriced almost per person, the only thing about their extreme bowling alley was that it was extremely hot temperature wise, they had many ceiling fans and none of them were on and the bowling equipment malfunctioned three times during our games, it was not a pleasant experience and I don't believe we will return to this establishment

the novelty of this place earns it some brownie points and you definitely don't come here for the food yes, scantily clad nurses will happily serve you your food and chat with you and agree for a photo shoot at the end of your meal. a bit lame, although I admit I liked the huge bottle of well chilled coke, but that's about it, the fries were kind of limp and stale, the burger didn't seem that fresh or special and it was relatively expensive for the amount of food you get, although you don't need more than a single bypass burger unless you feel like being useless for the next few hours or you're a gorilla, but the clever presentation of what might seem like a bad joke makes this place worth visiting with some friends, you'll have fun and you'll be quite full at the end

I went to Woke Express this evening as per my friends suggestion, if I'm craving Chinese food I usually go for a taste of China, but I wanted to try something different so I asked around and was asked to wake up, the food price is great at dinner. I had a large chicken plate combo, which means it came with rice egg rolls and crab puffs, all that cost but the chicken was overcooked and the batter the chicken was fried in was soggy and mushy, there were no carrots or peas in the fried rice. which is a big deal for me for some reason so overall if you are on a budget and want good chinese food go and taste china

was in the area for a grad interview and had a craving for red meat came here based on the Yelp reviews left quite extensive content on the catering service was quite friendly but had a hard time communicating what we wanted we opted for the kali bulgari and the Riley steak meats with an order of tofu soup it was all good but I think the only thing that stood out was the Riley normally we like to cook the meat ourselves but as we don't didn't want to stink on our flight back to Cali we decided to let them do it for us, the side dishes were standard with the various pickled vegetables, kimchi potato salad and the servers were pretty quick to offer us replacement side dishes since we aren't very familiar with the area. Stars are a good service being open at odd hours.

the ever changing menu changes again but a coupon made it a decent buy, I admit my coworkers for the coupon that's why we opted for this medium per burrito over the usual range, what I didn't like was that my veggie burrito didn't have any veggies in it, it was just a bean and rice burrito with guacamole. refilling or more towels is almost impossible. I like that there is cholla sauce in addition to the red and green tabascos and I also like that the chairs aren't as bad as the ones at Chipotle. The best advice this time is to get in early, otherwise be prepared for a long, long queue.

I found this place on yelp and went there for the lunch buffet after reading the reviews. I had very high expectations for this place, but was very disappointed. Watery sambar and doses of hard slow motion radar with a miserable amount of potato stuffing, James from the Gulag, was nothing like James from the Gulag, inattentive and too few waiters and disgusting bathrooms.

I really wanted to like this place. I'm Greek and my family cooks a lot of Greek food. Their tzatziki sauce was runny and not flavorful. Everything was just really commercialized, nothing tasted good or even close to homemade.

the food is great but the service is terrible the waiters are rude and it took a few minutes to get our drinks and another for our food. I really liked this place when it first opened, we live in the area and were hoping it would be a regular place so we could come for a drink and meet friends. I hope the management will resolve the issue with the service if you are going to try this place I suggest you sit at the bar for better service.

I went here because of a restaurantcom coupon, the menu was expensive which made me think it was a fancy place but it turned out the food was expensive because it was a restaurant in a hotel, it was inside the sheraton and I didn't see any sign outside saying it was there. We made reservations as it was a Friday evening but they really weren't necessary as there were only two other families in the restaurant, we were dressed, we were the only ones. full bar wrapped along the back side we ordered the pandered cheese which was basically fried cheese poppers delicious but definitely overpriced considering only one of them came on a plate as an appetizer my date ordered the barons burger your basic burger and I ordered the valley ribs the ribs were a little dry but I really loved the arizona croquette that came with them it was fried crispy on the outside with a mash of creamy potatoes inside with the restaurantcom coupon the meal was reasonably priced but without it I would have felt a little ripped off

just ok but like pizza and sex there's really no harm in it, I think there's something lost in the translation of its Texas roots to a past, it's the allure of the gas station dive atmosphere which seems a bit phony in a fairly new building. The biggest issues I have with the food are the overwhelming mesquite flavor and mediocre sauces. nice for a range of contexts the sauces seem a little amateur I know Rudy is not an amateur in the business but I think they went too early for their signature sauces they taste like the first ones I made in my garden if a true amateur I can upgrade to better sauces so Rudy can now I have to stop at the new B joint next door to see which one will get my dollars stay tuned

not the newest or nicest but everything you need and usually no wait for the machines, the staff is super friendly and there are magazines to read while you're there if they could just turn up the air conditioning a bit and put spy on more than two tvs

their food isn't bad, it's pretty hard to mess up gyros, rice salad and fries when it comes to this type of food, it really depends on my preferences. I don't care about this place. I like crispy fries. Their fries are soggy. I like beef and lamb gyros. Looked good if that's your thing

this place wasn't quite up to par for me I had the enemy sandwich it was pretty good but I was still hungry later so I topped it off with a chocolate croissant which was also good definitely a cute space with above average food but in the end there just wasn't enough for my money

this place is not bad the place is quite big and i love that they have a drive thru. I like coming here on the weekends especially when I need to study especially in the vault, sometimes they have live music which can be good or bad depending on if you are there to study or hang out, they have decent coffee, not the best but not horrible and I'd rather go to Starbucks any day.

the pizza here is average, it's not bad but it's also not the best pizza I've ever had, was it worth it for a personal pizza no, I paid with a fox restaurants gift card so I can't complain too much about a free meal for me, I probably wouldn't come back if it was on my dime also my pizza was a little burnt on the crust, it was edible but I was surprised they served me a pizza slightly burnt my fiances price wasn't actually they redid his entire pizza and didn't even send it to us because there was a hole in the crust

there's a casino my tia doesn't go to but she can't remember the name guess what i think it's the place i thought wild horse pass casino was already open not until october i think wild horse needs to reword their billboards so we drove around for a few minutes and ended up at the gila river casino next time i'll pass by very small security and the machines literally suck the machines inhale your money like it's money the water I spent in the mind without gaining anything. What had me scratching my head was the configuration of the machines you'll see. a row of penny machines then a random machine in the middle or a row of machines and a random machine thrown in, what else am I going to spend on the Gila River

I haven't screamed in about months and have been waiting for a place to impress or disgust me. This place was bad first impressions were good, the outside bar was neat with nice views of downtown and the fire pits were good, no beers on tap but seriously what is with the hiphop club at 1pm come on guys way too early for that it didn't take long before three of us were seated and after about a few minutes our waitress came over and asked if we were ready to oh wait that's right no the menus yet good job ok so I ordered the Thai spring rolls which were filled with lettuce a single strip of carrots and noodles seriously the main course I ordered the curry which turned out to be the worst curry in the world I don't even know if it was curry it was more like a bowl of thick yellow soup with a few pieces of chicken and a few vegetables mixed in yuck and then they only gave me a small bowl of rice I'm sorry isn't that supposed to be the opposite of My friends were totally okay with how bad the place was, I think they had some sort of stir fry which they said was bland and unnecessary, so yeah I don't recommend this place, head to the Roosevelt instead for good draft beer and good food.

this place was not that great for the price i spent on mini grilled cheese sliders and a tea, basically overpriced bar food, not much choice on the menu and the portion size was not equal to what i paid for the crowd is very scottsdale and the staff was not very friendly, i will definitely not go back
the best thing was that the shrimp for dessert was okay, nothing was missing about the wasabi chicken

I really like this place one night by accident as my friend and I were put off by the lousy service at the other bar in the same mall as it had a nice atmosphere of jukeboxes playing to people shooting darts, we felt totally comfortable and found a table to sit and catch up the service was really good. The bartender while waiting for another customer made eye contact to acknowledge me and told me she would be right with me. and cold, my friend ordered a vodka and orange juice and commented that it was a nice stiff drink. We both said we were glad we came across tons and will be back.

stars all because the hot sauce sucks now stars for a buckeye icon and for the most part the food is not bad the service is bad and the slow servers are not trained in good serving skills the dirt parking lot sucks be careful not to fall in one of the holes hope you are not disabled and have to use the bathroom is outside and left surprised the building service old this place

the premier hotel chain continues to be my favorite properties among mid-range hotels. The only issue I had with this one was the noisy air conditioner in the hallway right outside the door, other than it was clean with friendly staff.

so I don't know how to rate this place, the starfish, because honestly there were a few things that were stars and there were a few things that were stars, so let me explain. We walked into this cool little place on the Sunday before Memorial Day and it was about half full, it looked like it was very groovy, but I seriously had to use my phone to walk around because it was so dark we were sitting at the bar and none of the bartenders spoke to us for a few minutes, maybe they couldn't see us anyway, the wine list is interesting and I had a hard time choosing something the bartender who was ultimately waiting for us had no personality I asked for a taste of a few things they had by the glass they looked very interesting but I had never heard of a lot of them and I pride myself on knowing my wine the first one I tried was a Sarah blend which had something to do with chocolate and it was just a chocolate tattoo my friend ordered a glass of Justin cabernet which is always a safe bet I then asked for the tannate they had by the glass It was horrible it was like if it had been open for days I told our personality challenged bartender and he went to talk to us maybe about the manager the manager then came over and was pleasant although a little condescending at first he said well have you ever had a tannate and I said actually all the time I know what they are talking about and it's not a tannate he then agreed with me and said just tell me what you look, I told him I wanted a cabernet franc or a pomegranate which they didn't have either by the glass. he ended up serving me something really delicious, he definitely redeemed the evening because he was professional and helpful, we then ordered the platter with pesto and a few different cheeses and it was seriously one of the best platters I've ever had.

this was the second time I placed an order over the phone that was delayed over an hour I was told on the phone that it would only take me a few minutes to pick it up I arrived a minute later and my order was still late I ended up waiting another half hour to receive my order the pickup service was the worst I have ever experienced

I don't know a single Phoenician who wasn't absolutely thrilled with the opening hands, we were all excited about this cool new destination, the hubby and I were the second pair of people to walk through their doors, there were literally hordes of employees working at the time. of this place is beautiful, cool, clean and modern, the music varies from being too loud and inappropriate for the setting to being perfect with an eclectic mix but well mixed the pizza is ok but very appetizer it is thin which turns a lot of people off but I really like it the onion strings are to die for when they are not completely loaded with grease it's not really consistent I don't like their sandwiches they are unimaginative and bland there really is no lots of choices on the menu unfortunately both times we brought friends with us the place was a buzz kill and I'm not really sure why we might try this place again now that it's been open for a while hope hands have figured out what it wants to be when it grows up
the only thing I like about Fez is the food from pomegranate margaritas could be better

probably the most overrated place in the Phoenix area, the pizza tastes way too much like their canned tomato sauce and there is always a wait to be seated, that being said the food overall is ok, the meat salad and calzone are good and the servers are friendly to all people which gives it more than stars, try other pizza places like pintos la grand orange pizzeria bianca

I had some time to kill before the ultimate yelp event and wanted to share my love for noble dark chocolate mousse with green tea ice cream and sweet orange peel with my cousin happygolucky who has never been here before, so we stopped at p to find out that noble wouldn't open until p, so we waited outside in the cozy patio after seeing a few employees adding lanterns to their outdoor umbrella tables. and I showed a troop that I didn't like the energy in that room so I asked if we could sit somewhere else and he said to choose where we wanted to sit, we were the first customers so we chose a fourth knowing we wouldn't take up a seat for very long anyway, glasses of water were delivered and soon we met our waitress whose name on the receipt reflected but when she set out the menus I told him that we would only have desserts and that we could see the dessert menu. she put together the dinner and drinks menus and said we didn't have dessert menus because we only had two and told us about the orange almond mousse and donuts. She walked away and as we were loudly discussing our loss of interest in dining there, she returned with napkins and utensils and asked if we had decided what we were going to have. I wanted to send it back where the pretty bowl was and was the presentation of the last dessert I had here serious in presenting us with this stale mousse with cracked edges and the green tea ice cream had ice crystals on it I don't know about you but the only time I saw crystals on ice cream was when it melted slightly and put it back in the freezer to refreeze for me seeing crystals on the ice cream is a sign it is old I brought the container over and showed it to the male host who assured me that all the mousse is prepared daily and it is normal to see cracks and bubbles in the mousse so I decided to try it if only to have something to report here. The dessert definitely didn't live up to the lovely bowl I had on our October in terms of taste and presentation, but it was ok. the dish because the sound of chocolate and green tea together didn't seem like a good combo to her, I told her to trust me, she also never enjoyed orange and chocolate together, but she liked it in this dessert. I understand that having to serve only dessert instead of dinner and dessert which results in a higher table bill can be a little disappointing but why do you have to show your displeasure to your guests but you were lucky that my cousin even left you change for a tip that she didn't want to give you anything and you definitely didn't deserve it when I told other friends on Yelp about the subpar service and dessert we just have one who responded that she didn't enjoy it the last time we had monkeys here I think it was around Halloween and first Friday neither cousin and I found it in very poor taste that our server gave us this horrible condescending look after finding out we were just going to get a dessert we didn't deserve I will never recommend noble to anyone again. i need to find somewhere else to take her i don't want to risk getting the same treatment but or from another server should we come back here sorry noble but i won't be back

you're in a Scottsdale climate and need a change of casual clothes, a bite to eat, and a refreshing adult beverage. Tommy Bahama can do it all under one roof, a clothing store downstairs and a decent, predictable place to eat and drink upstairs. I will work with you Tommy, there is nothing special about this place except I found their service in their retail space and restaurant superb, try their grilled crab cakes and twice shaken martini.

i enjoy bop as my friend calls it on the same level as i enjoy pizza it's good but it's not my desert island bar i go here to meet friends i've never been there alone because let's be real i'm not likely to get caught trolling in scottsdale even in scottsdale by my loner the atmosphere is comfortable and welcoming which turns me off a bit i like my bars a little seedier but yes it's your thing so I'm cool with it I hear the food is pretty good for English fare, but hey, who wants to waste time eating when you could be drinking

no i shelled out for a mac and cheese club sandwich and a large pepsi, the mac and cheese was good and the sandwich was just ok, i say take your and go to texas grill, much better food and for your sake you can get dessert too

so i went there twice and i hated it the first time i don't know if i got a bad cut of meat or what but my burrito was a bit too greasy i think it was the red chili burrito or something, that said i recently gave it another chance and opted for the carne asama burrito very very good the cut of the beef is a bit thicker than the usual salazar or burrito but it was definitely well whatever oh and the beans in there were awesome too it didn't have any guacamole and I didn't notice it until it was too late but I'll be sure to get some next time overall I'm giving it stars because I really hated my first visit but their carne asama is totally legit

B&B has got to be one of my favorite foods and when a co-worker suggested this place I was all for it, living on the west side it was pretty tough but being that I'm a B&B fanatic I had to see what it was all about first. Lucille is in a good location, it's located near Dave and Buster's in Tempe Market, the look of the place is gimmicky but in a bit of a famous way they have old school signs to drink from and all the little fake things to make you feel like you've been to Memphis or wherever they were trying to transport you, the service was absolutely terrible, took a long time to get drinks and even longer to get refills, attitude all the time, here's a tip if you want a good tip then you will have more money to pay your tuition. Half the staff are students and don't roll their eyes when I don't want to try your suggestions, they tell you they smoke all their meats in house. chicken tips and ribs with a side of greens and sweet potato fries the chicken was good it had smoke on it and was tender no real complaints portion size was good the brisket was dry and you couldn't cut it with a fork that hard maybe too many smoked portions tiny strips maybe or inches long the rib tips were dry and covered in sauce almost no meat on them most places in the valley charge you for rib tips when you order it's cheap meat but not this place you get a spoon full of disgusting collard greens cooked in weird pork parts and they were bitter the greens aren't supposed to be bitter if they're cooked properly sweet potato fries you can't really mess with them they probably came frozen so I would recommend them over regular fries the starter of a biscuit with sugar on top was just weird weird weird weird and the biscuit Wasn't even hot enough to melt the sugar I mean apple butter one last thing the house and hot sauces the main ingredients are corn syrup that the way they thicken it seriously that should tell you something overall two thumbs down stay away there are plenty of other great ones there are places in the valley

first of all the woman who answers the phone is not impressive at all, I called to consign my furniture and when I asked her about the store she said do you want to consign your table or not rude enough it was a turn off for me the next day I went to the store for some information but when I walked in I knew it wasn't the right solution for my stuck table, the place had older style furniture, dated sofas, floral purple, there was one accessory that I would buy in the whole store, needless to say I won't be coming back or trusting my table or anything else, gross stuff, disgusting stuff, what more can I say

I finally saved the amount I'm willing to spend so my yard doesn't look like a tent city. Mind you, I've never been to a tent city, but I have a feeling they're similar, minus the pool. My garden is laid out where the pool takes up the entire yard and then maximum feet surrounding the rock space around the entire pool. Welcome to my garden, this makes planting difficult. all summer, I'm not judging, I wanted oleanders because they looked like a perfect match for my lack of green thumb, they're cheap, they flower, they grow fast and they're impossible to kill well. I discovered that the oleander roots are too aggressive to be this close to my pool, so unfortunately no, I only have them, they need them. I called Moon Valley for ideas so I could research the root systems. saying in the cheesiest voice known to man oh yeah come down we have hundreds you have hundreds of plants that are identical to oleanders minus the roots and similar in price really please list them so I can know if you are a big liar no I didn't list them I only wanted to take me there I decided not to go because it's raining he lied and said the oleanders are fine I just have to have the drip system on thanks for your fucking help he's a liar so even if I went they would lie to me I hate liars I went in the past and told them what I wanted they gave me a free garden design and they totally didn't listen to me and made a garden that cost k who do they think I am I live in Mesa for crying out loud not Paradise Valley I wasn't going to let them waste my time like that again if you're wondering why I might give them a chance after this it was this time I was going to wear the pants in the relationship you might have I had my entire Valley of the Moon on a low budget but refusal to help or be honest means I'll go somewhere else that will straight up say I can make your dreams of diving into intimacy come true while making your garden as pretty as possible and I won't destroy your pool while I'm there

Second time we messed up our order the boneless wings have bones and no carrots or celery again a burger with only tomato cheese and sauce it had onions and lettuce when we specifically said no lettuce or onion allergic to onions and don't like shredded lettuce thanks to the tiler for messing up our order again we will not return

good Chinese food good value especially for lunch, Chinese village is one of my usual haunts for Chinese food when I'm in the neighborhood, the building may look run down but the food and service is good
shocked, this place has stars first, you can always tell if a mexican restaurant is good based on the beans and salsa, guess what both eat at El Motions and you will never come here again

Cherry on Top is a rare example of design by a market analysis committee that couldn't decide on a single concept, so they decided to borrow from all their competitors' styles that turned out at least as good, if not better, than its individual inspirations. The result provides practical answers to the following questions about frozen yogurt. from nuts to the big brand crushed candies available, the quality is pretty close to that of most relevant competitors as long as one doesn't demand the desert honey sweet Republic pie variant, but correctly and perhaps intentionally, the value proposition is that most customers won't mind the slight drop in exchange for the flexibility of purchasing only as much yogurt and toppings as desired while still satisfying one's acclimated children with a frankenstein of saccharine flavors and unwanted toppings as well as city guests looking for the nearest ink with an original tart plus kiwi ripe strawberries and pineapple

A few Saturdays ago I went with my mother to have my name added to her accounts if the unthinkable happened, we went to chase first which took ten minutes, the personal banker was out of pocket, then we headed to her credit union around morning. They were quite busy. Apparently when we arrived I heard grumbling from other customers and asked how long the wait was. the front desk turned her away abruptly in front of a lobby of customers, my mother is sweet as tea in Tennessee, so hearing her call out in front of a lobby full of people for a disturbance was upsetting a few minutes later, I went to ask her if it would be much longer. Jennifer said sharply that we are busy, apparently on Saturdays they are busy and you should avoid doing business there on the weekend. I don't remember being spoken to so rudely, even in a fast food restaurant, in recent years. make another appointment I had made I was told it would take another two minutes because I had to go through their background check to be a member, they were having difficulty with my Washington driver's license and the strange characters, there is an asterisk in part of the number after all was said and done over an hour later I was approved to become a member and was successfully put in as a signer on my mother's account. to this I received a response, she didn't have one, the woman sitting next to her informed me that she was the assistant manager and they were busy on Saturdays. My biggest problem was if it was going to take an hour to speak with someone, tell me I can make other arrangements or come during the week and first telling me it shouldn't be long and then saying we're busy is no excuse. the line or not open on Saturdays as a 1 year veteran in the service industry I am very disappointed in the level of service Arizona Federal Credit Union has provided to my mom and I but also everyone else I have seen being laid off as if the credit union is doing them a favor after looking for a new home for moms money they can get a much better rate at an upcoming four letter bank. I'm normally a big fan of member-owned institutions, but based on the incredibly rude service I received from the Arizona Federal Credit Union, I say go for a credit union or bank where the employees read the mission statement painted on the wall behind them

I just ate Daphnes for the last time since we ordered from them, they can't seem to get a simple order, a kids burger with apple slices, no, a side of hummusnope, but they rush to charge you for the order, then you call and talk to a girl named Liz and she starts telling you that they are right and you the customer are wrong, even though I have all the food in front of me, no, still no kids burger nor side of hummus hmm, keep letting her answer the phone and you'll see. your takeout customer base is decreasing We are an office in Scottsdale that orders lunch for the office every day. Daphnes has officially been removed from the menu, good customer service

unfortunately with the new owners there are changes to the menu, my bbq chicken salad no longer has a trace of the same taste, it should now be called tomato flavor, it's also sad to find out that the most outstanding vegetarian sandwich now tastes like it's from another country, not a single hint of similarity of the same flavor, I'm sure many people will love these new changes, but I'm sad, it's not the same anymore, I woke up today dreaming old vegetarian sandwich, no joke
