fuck you we hope you die that's the war cry of the Trojan horse wow I can't believe someone yelled dad my first year my science teacher was arrested for embezzlement from the strip club she owned we then had a different teacher every other week for the first half of the year when we finally found a permanent teacher the damage was done. School when I started on the Bell campus we called it PA Prison because of the tall iron spiked gates and the security in the golf carts patrolling the campus looking for potential escapees. I remember before they briefly closed the campus for renovation, a girl falling through the auditorium wall and pieces of ceiling falling on people's heads before condemning it. more and more buildings kept collapsing, they decided to close the school and reopen it under the same name on the new campus, they spent a hell of a lot of money on a very high end theater in exchange for letting it be used for official government events, no one knew how to use it, that was one of the best things about it. morning video announcements because we used the phrase coming out and they thought the phrase might be offensive and then that same week the football team had a video where they were all pretending to be gay, talking with a lisp and waving limp wrists when I went to the office to ask which they told me, that football players didn't need approval for anything they did. often and it never showed up in my file, I remember when Miss Lee would dress up as a hard rocker with tattoos for Halloween and the administrators would make her change it because the costume was a bad influence. I remember my friend's boyfriend got suspended because they searched his car for drugs on an anonymous tip and found a box cutter in his trunk that he used for work and kept in his trunk because he went to work straight from school. the inspiration for the film turned up the volume which was filmed in the general area when I left the softball team the coach school counselor kept sending people to pull me out of class to try to convince me to play again when we took pictures for the badminton team we didn't have enough uniforms for the whole team I felt like I was in a prison or high security mental institution. i had worked to keep patients calm i never had a chemistry class my two history classes consisted of a teacher who spent a whole year talking about shakespeare and another who said slaves didn't have it that bad my biology book was so old it had my friend's mother's name in it years ago and that same friend's mother warned me against my biology teacher mr h if he ever tells you to be alone after class, don't do the good things i remember mrs total sp a very good and supportive english teacher miss lee the best photography and video teacher I always had the best Halloween costumes at lunch under a tree with the boy we called Rico Suave who said he lived in a box and told stories about the horny lady sneaking off campus to go to Barrows pizza. My friends wore boxes of cut-up Trojan condoms pinned to their shirts during forced spiritual assemblies and chanted our own spiritual chant of fuck you all, we hope you die, that's the Trojan war cry, time has a way of blurring the past and making it less disgusting, but my sister is a professor at North Canyon and a few years ago I went to visit her on campus the second I walked into the main building, I literally had a stomach ache. I've heard they've made improvements since I graduated and I hope I don't want my niece and nephew to be forced to survive in another drone factory.

after our faraway Mongolian place closed I was determined to eat Mongolian the night we came across as it was ok, seemed a bit overpriced, the soft serve was a bit disgusting and the chocolate was out of order, the unlimited soup looked like it had been sitting there for a good few hours, will I go back maybe I was impressed, not really I left full yes
for selling broccoli at a good price, I gave them a chance to sell celery that was already rotting, I won't do it again

one of the reviewers said this owner wants to run a restaurant, I totally agree, it has good and bad sides, sure, in short it's not a palette we stopped at for brunch last Sunday, the French toast is challah which I love, cooked in the restaurant I think and apparently not fully cooked, the center was dough, the scrambled eggs were adequate, the salsa verde made in the restaurant was excellent, the sausage schreiners as expected, it was all we had quality, not a compelling reason to return until the service was considered, timely and friendly. I will come back to try dinner

oh my gosh I usually like a lot of enthusiasm but no today we had a take out order maybe it was a mistake number no I really got the nachos you can't mess them up or so I thought I mean Filbert would have been a better choice. Can you say cold, soggy mess, maybe it was my fault. number treslemme just said burnt tasting chips as opposed to my soggy nacho chips and left a sour taste in my mouth and the most offensive guacamole I have ever had let me just say my coworker and I eat here often enough that we can order for each other we also know how to order our guacamole without the stare from the tall sailor on top with great enthusiasm you let me down a lot today I hate to leave a bad review without complaining to management first, so expect a phone call from me shortly
bad customer service, no one at reception for thirty minutes and they left the phone on the counter so when I tried to call their phone number they kept ringing and ringing sadly

things that could happen at the bikini parlor you might watch your friends dance with a bum in front of the jukebox you might drink way too many pitchers of par you might have a fit when you realize it's only money the bikini parlor is probably the shittiest place known to man i mean it's in a shitty neighborhood where you could die doesn't accept credit cards and only has bags of chips for food so why would i go there go back because hectic things happen here don't go here if you want to have a quiet night with a few friends and go home and go to bed go here if you want to show up to a bar full of pitchers of per until you and your friends are all sick then walk out and forget where you are and turn left on grand avenue only to find out you're not near home when you get to the burned down church at avenue and monroe and a tramp asks you for money after that you get into a taxirikshaw on a bike and tell the guy you can only pay him in cigarettes then when he agrees to take it takes you to another bar instead of home and then you will be further away than you were at the beginning when you finally get home thanks to a caring homeless man who actually has money you find out because he has a car and takes you home you wake up the next morning wondering why all your money is gone, how much you drank and where your friends are if this is the kind of night you're looking for at a bikini show, right
the waiter could have been better, she spilled a coke on my lap, it made me late for my movie, the wait was solo, but the food was cooked to my liking, I will return

ok let's review this Walgreen, they sell drugs and cigarettes, all they need to add is sex and rock n roll and they would be all happy. I've never really understood how a pharmacy, that is, any place you would think, cares about your well-being. They even have a health clinic at this particular location could sell so many things that are really bad for you, it's time to get off my soap box. waiting in line at that particular location to pick up medications, nothing like standing in line outside a health clinic full of sick people waiting to be seen by a health care provider, i.e. a nurse, waiting to pick up my monthly supply of Viagra and a six-pack of Walgreen's brand beer for what can I say I'm a cheap drunk

I really wish I could give it a but I can't do it in good conscience, the food was excellent but the service was downright terrible in a fit of random adventure. I thought it would be fun to try a new type of food for me. I'm generally a weenie and afraid of anything weird, so this is a big deal for me. were at our table we waited too long to get menus even though we knew what we wanted we waited too long to place our order you get the idea luckily the food came out quite quickly I ordered the vegetarian plate which had green cabbage some sort of cabbage carrot potato red lentils and beans carrotion as with all the dishes it was served with a strange sourdough pancake inside I was a little weirder that the bread was served cold but I got used to it pretty quickly Everything on my plate was delicious but if I had to rank it my favorites would be the lentils followed by the green cabbage then the potato then the carrots, eating here was a fun experience for sure and not having silverware definitely made for creative eating procedures. I would probably come here again if the mood for Ethiopian food struck me again, but I really hope the service would be better since everyone mentions great service. I'm going to assume we came at a different time.

bacon madness huge french toast cute little pigs decorating the walls orange oink is a friendly and bouncy place to go for breakfast the food is pretty good the place is happy in everything I would say it's the perfect place to wake up to in the morning the only annoying quality was our server who seemed very nervous checked on us at odd times and said you were welcome too often I didn't know that was possible but it was I enjoyed the jalapeño bacon and the french toast oink cinnamon rolls were also tasty but my group was disappointed because of the eggs benedict, I would say the food could be better but it's just great to have a local breakfast somewhere in my neighborhood now

I don't understand how a second restaurant was opened in Tatum, my husband gave these places too many chances and each time the food was not impressive the margaritas came from a recipe stolen from the piñata neva but too bad they didn't bring the recipes with them I hope they understand that maybe if you put little quality in the food people will come back

this fresh baba really didn't impress me it's expensive considering all you get is meat in a tortilla it doesn't have that Mexican feel and isn't original there were bugs on the wall the food is good but nothing special though since it's a corporate chain you can't expect sizzling flavor but I wasn't satisfied there are better places to go for Mexican food

maybe their dogs are better but the breakfast sandwiches at Nathans are disgusting the English muffin was spongy the greasy eggs the bacon undercooked and all remade and packaged ready to melt into mush with the cheese yuck

this review is based solely on the service and not the food. I'm sitting in a booth at Ra as I type this, that's how upset I am with the reception staff at Ra. I called ahead to inform the restaurant that we would have a party when we arrived. The girls in the front were so rude I almost walked out. didn't feel welcome me and my girlfriend went to the back to use the bathroom the host followed us and asked what we were doing not to help us find the bathroom but just to be snobbish from now on it's ruined for me

we went to this place to buy some gear before the fiesta bowl, yes the stuff is way overpriced but that's the premium you pay for licensed merchandise. One good thing is they had a purchase offer, half off, it was good for our large team, nice selection of rubbish gear and friendly staff, good location if you feel the need to buy some licensed sports gear when you are in the area, worth a look

don't go to this car wash, I dropped my kids off at choir and thought I would run for a quick car wash, oh no they locked my keys in the car, I couldn't unlock my suburban because it was under a huge awning and I couldn't get a signal instead of calling a locksmith, the car washers tried and tried to get in through the window, luckily my husband was able to leave work earlier go pick up the kids from choir practice then come save me to the car wash with a spare set of keys i was stuck there for over an hour the manager then had the audacity to get mad at me because i was upset at their incompetence they didn't even come to the car wash if you go here don't pay for your car wash until your car is finished

this is the worst pizzeria I have ever been to, I was not charged for something I didn't order when I asked for this to be corrected, it was still done poorly given the wrong change and the drive door slammed in my face, I asked to speak to the manager and he was extremely unfriendly, he took my change receipt and my food after a while I asked for a refund and was told it wasn't possible. I left the food at the restaurant because I wasn't comfortable eating it after he took it back to correct his mistake, I'm not sure what could have been done about it, the girl at the window made a mistake twice, but the example set by the store manager is poor and that's the problem.

this address is the one next to Panda Express, not Walmart, this place sucks and it doesn't even come close to another McDonald's. How the hell can you have so many employees working and have a line of people waiting for their food, it's like there are retarded people working there and they all have special needs, this guy was just waiting for a nice meal and had been waiting for minutes before I even got there, it took about a few minutes for them to give me my food, a Mexican kid who was working was too busy flirting with this girl in front of everyone while his dad asked why the food was taking so long making the dining room dirty after I got my food and sat down they should fire the manager and everyone who works there they don't take pride in working there and it's sad to see that no matter what they are paid to be there it's still a job and they are paid to be there I will not return to this place

this gas station is like the Bermuda gas station triangle I came here with a friend on a first Friday she was doing and I was her passenger and I ride and I ride I drive through town back and forth until we finally reached e and we were desperate for gas like a suspicious siren. grimaced at their misfortune we filled up I wandered inside to pay for my friend Kathy's gas and grab some snacks I go back to her car and pump her gas we chat and make jokes while I notice Kathy is so sketched a case of suburban white girl out of her comfort zone late at night in the city the gas is pumped check we get back in she turns the key in the ignition and dead silence a simple click and then nothing sshhiitt she starts to panic, I can only help but laugh at our misfortune, two cars at the same gas station broke down, our situation only got worse as time passed and every car that came to Sinclair refused to help us or just avoided us with some lame excuse. It wasn't until two young Mexican teenagers came to our aid that we were able to move the other car. At the quarantine, we said our thanks and shook hands, then took the teenagers home, much to the protest of my frightened white associate, without these wonderful people we would have been stranded at Bermuda Sinclair perhaps until daybreak.

ok so i like the canteen and all but dear lord let's turn the music down a notch these guys are having a great happy hour but actually i wouldn't come here without it. I really enjoy the small rib bites, the portions are so small but since they are half price during happy hour I get two orders. solid stars from me

I stayed in a high altitude hotel before they were pretty much the same. My King room was clean, modern and well maintained. I went in winter but if it had been summer I probably would have taken advantage of the pool and outdoor lounge, even the gym looked inviting and that says a lot.

we ordered pizza to go and it took almost hours, we were told within a few minutes that we had not received anything when I expressed my displeasure, they offered to give me a credit for my next order, I asked for it in writing and they gave me the we cannot provide it in writing. have zero tolerance for businesses like this, please spend your money somewhere else worth patronizing

the banana pecan french toast was excellent, order one order and share it with someone else for desert breakfast, the rest of the food was definitely better than ok, but I dropped my star rating because the restrooms were not clean and had no hand soap, where do the employees wash their hands

I'm a little confused as to what this place is, is it a coffee shop yes, is it a Welles ice cream parlor, is it an anteroom to the hair salon upstairs, kinda apparently the pink dot laughs tries to be several things at once and vaguely succeeds in those goals. I love the pink spot laugh for a number of reasons location convenience ambience selection in all honesty it's not the best coffee the area offers but it's another option and that my friends are a cornerstone of capitalism's consumer choice now I won't make the pink spot laugh my local haunt this place is owned by Lola and I would never cheat on my beloved grandmother but for those special nights when I feel the odd urge for a simultaneous brain freeze and with a scalded tongue, I will descend on the pink spot, laugh

quite a large group of us came here for my brothers day and had a great time. We had made reservations for a Saturday evening and when we arrived we were immediately seated. Our server was friendly, prompt, and did a great job attending to our large party. The vibe was more relaxed and less pretentious than I expected considering you are in Old Town Scottsdale so I appreciated that parking was easy, I don't know how we lucked out on great parking spots on a Saturday night in the area but we had my sisters coconut fish which was very tasty. addictive probably because of the creamy coconut milk and sugar they obviously added, still delicious my pork lettuce wraps were tasty and I had the option of getting them with collard greens which was a nice change, the meat was flavorful and well seasoned and my portion was so big there was no end to it. My seafood curry was a hearty portion, as were all the other dishes in our group, but I wasn't a huge fan of the flavor. I didn't enjoy the bite I had, I'm not sure how authentic this Thai food was but it was tasty, Thai food is quite healthy yes I believe the coconut fats are healthy but all the added sugar to enhance the flavor of the curry isn't very Thai or appealing to me for an occasional occasion I go for it but it's not really on my to-do list unfortunately

the burger I had there was tasteless and had a strange texture, the fries were ok and their signature rooter was delicious but I've definitely had better elsewhere in all honesty I haven't tried their frozen selection so I'll definitely be back to give them another try

I had a hard time even giving this place the third star. I had high hopes as I saw this place go through renovations over the past few years. We were there on opening night and fell in love with the decor. The place was stylish and cool. Concrete, leather, more glassy, ​​retromodern. The people who renovated and redesigned this place deserve five stars. The people who work there deserve one on opening night, though. I forgave the delay in service. I forgave them because the onion straws were so good that we went back a few nights later after being cheated out of table scraps in Sens, it took almost twenty minutes to order two pizzas and onion straws and then the pizzas came out before the onion straws. How to cook pizza faster than frying an onion. The waiter lingered around the women in our group and was just plain incompetent. dark and the music was too loud but again the service was slow and boring then the waitress argued about the pizza ingredients with our group. Several people told me the service was good as long as you ordered at the bar they told you to get up and go tell the bartender what you want. and a Loretta

I've been here twice for lunch it's ok but I won't come back the portions are small I had one of the curries and it was good but I had the pad thai which according to the menu has chicken and shrimp not a single shrimp on the plate cheap bastards one of the lower quality Thai restaurants I've been to in Phoenix next to the Thai hut

wow, after eating sushi from all over the country, I have to say that Scottsdale Geisha a go go surprised me to an ultimate level. Andrew, the manager reassured us that we had something wrong with our taste buds for not tasting how fresh the fish was here, insulting to assume it wasn't recommended.

overall I like this place, a little hole in the wall place with cheap, non-greasy Mexican food, I can dig it, I personally think the one down the street is better, but I'll put up with it until the growing pains come, since this place has only been open for about a week.
as much as you don't want to like Wally World, that's what's crazy

I'll start with the positive, they have friendly staff members, that is to say you might catch an infection from the staff here so be careful, it's like a shack that somehow got a bar license. I have a friend who drags me here from time to time as it's his favorite dive, it's a false look away from a fight every time if you like the danger and excitement of drinking a beer in a building that may collapse go for it, otherwise avoid the dregs of society and go elsewhere.

we decided to take the wine Wednesday which was happening at the tastings courtesy of Knot, here's where the event is from, so we arrived maybe a few minutes after so we could get a seat just in case it blew up, we walked in and the hostess, she looked like she was the manager or owner, asked if we were there for the event and then pointed us to the back room where the event was being held. we had to wait about a few minutes for the waitress to finish up with a table to see if we could sit on the patio for the event, she said yes and that she would be there to help us while we waited, another woman and her friend also took a seat at a nearby patio table. A few minutes later the hostess, owner and manager, came out and asked if we had been helped, but we said no and she left only to return with a small happy hour flyer menu that she just put back in distance and didn't even come to our table I know you are I was wondering why I was waiting the minutes but I really wanted to see how bad the service was going to be and frankly I just wanted some good wine it had been about a few minutes and the same woman came back with full detailed menus and I asked if the happy hour flyer was the event deals and she said yes then she asked if we were ready to order um you just us give the menus a few seconds ago, I'm ready to just order and take advantage of the event meal deals, I look at the happy hour flyer and see monkey deals they said there wasn't that much of a special appetizer menu, but whatever I could handle, then I see the drinks section, the claim for the event was glasses of wine. I was excited to try some good new wines at a low price, but again, not so much actually, it was glasses of house wine that only consisted of three different wines that weren't really what I was looking for right now. The other women who were outside decided to leave after having enough of these shenanigans. monkeys and having our own wine Wednesday at home, I bet there are plenty of people who will have good experiences here and happily continue to visit, but this experience led me to write them off for good, which I don't usually do after one instance. I wish I could actually review their wine and food, but the service was so poor and substandard that it's not worth giving them my money. I understand that if the food isn't good at a restaurant, some are just better or more talented than others, but any business can and should have good customer service. I think that's where the cliché that if I could give them less stars I would comes in, oh yeah and I slapped a card that was shouted at you as I was leaving, take these tastings

fajitas is one of those places you can go to occasionally for an unforgettable lunch, nothing is disgusting, nothing is exceptional, everything is good there. I've tried different variations of the fajita theme over several lunches, vegetarian chicken steak and they were all ok, not a huge fan of their tortillas, but if you work near there I say go for it, it's a safe bet for lunch, you won't vomit or curse the world, but is this a joint where I say man you have to try this place. no, you've had better fajitas elsewhere, stars

it was the perfect place for the family after a day at the resort the food was good especially the bbq chicken the kids menu was wonderful my only complaint was that the waiter really couldn't answer questions about the menu

narcissus is really an interesting place, good food and pretty good service, the servers look good and keep up the image, that's all that's so important here in Scottsdale, working for this place even though the looks outweigh the quality of service, the late night crowd is the stare at me type and makes this a good establishment for people watching if you don't mind the huge egos that come with it, the food and drink selections are impressive if you can reserve a table for dine and drink with friends, do it while the place fills up and leads to an entertaining nighttime experience for the crowd above
good food bad service does anyone speak english here

we have been here many times with our kids and grandpas it is a good place for families but the service is ok we love the fresh fries and the wings are good the salads are me we will come back as it is a good place for kids but we will come expecting poor service

I took my cat to the low cost heat spay event and she came home with a bruise on her ear that wasn't there when I took her there in the morning surprise surprise they can recommend a vet to take her I'm pretty angry about this

selection of beers, but the service is the staff lack of knowledge on the products the promotions are not mentioned the waiting time is long the staff makes you feel like they are doing you a favor by taking your order

the food is good here, I ordered the mole enchiladas with no complaints but we also ordered a skinny margarita which wasn't very strong and the regular margaritas are good and decently priced but charging without warning is wear and tear. The service was okay, not great.

Minnie and I stopped at the Papago dog park today on a whim, it was a beautiful day and since she was such a good girl in the car with me and at my afternoon meeting, I wanted to reward her rather than take a detour to go to the Chaparral dog park, our usual dog park destination. not the healthiest I have seen, unfortunately there were several areas that the owners didn't clean up after their dogs too, come on owners, you are giving us a bad name anyway, we had a lovely minute visit, Minnie sniffed a few other dogs from behind and then they returned the favor, don't you love the way they socialize with each other, so cute anyway, will this become our dog park of choice no, is this a viable option if you are in the area

the food wasn't very good but that wasn't my main problem it was the unwelcoming feeling I got I won't be returning the owner was friendly to everyone in the restaurant except my boyfriend and I he went from table to table and talked to people and greeted new customers and acknowledged them when they left.

it's not that i don't like this place, it's just that it's very ordinary, the buffalo witches do the standard sports bar thing cut into the college watering hole, that's all that can really be said about this place, you can't really hate this place for that because that's what it is a milquetoast place in its most average form

I hadn't tried this yet on a food truck Friday and the line was short so I went up, it's Filipino food I've never had before and I wasn't sure what to order so I just said something I hoped was right, turns out I got the pork egg rolls. I enjoyed the buns even though they were steaming hot but the pork inside was delicious, the outside was very crispy and flaky, I loved it

I really wasn't impressed, I came here with friends to get takeaway and nothing really made me smile. The Al Pastor was me at best, the carne asama wasn't particularly remarkable and although the vampire was tasty there was nothing very redeeming about it. dignity I wish I could come back here and give it a better review because I'm sure next time would be better but as it stands I'm just not a big fan sorry guys

The first thing I respect about Rule Bull is its ability to attract customers while keeping a low profile, no flashing lights, no bouncers with angry looks and no promotional cards shoved in my face from down the street. I walked in and liked what I saw, it has an old school feel, there was a live band doing Lady Gaga covers and it looked like karaoke, I wasn't impressed so I ordered my reasonably priced Jameson and went out to the patio, it was a nice patio with a seating area in the corner, it had a different feel. and I appreciate how casual it was but I felt like something was missing. I went back inside, admired a much better Michael Jackson cover, and realized that the one thing I couldn't find here was fun for a Westsider like me. Tempe is a mecca for mischief, a place where I can have one too many and come home with a story to tell. lack of pretty here it's like everyone who was too old or uncool to go anywhere else came and had a guinness in peace i came here expecting a fun bar that wasn't a blown club and instead of having a happy medium i ended up with a boring dive don't get me wrong i love dive bars but i don't go to mill avenue for them the rule is a good place with a good history i can't hate on it i love the interior and i saw me coming back during the day it's just not worth going out my way on a Saturday night

busy right after school which was normal it wasn't very clean which is disappointing especially for an ice cream parlor where we stopped to try the new soft serve ice cream with sprinkles that give the ice cream a new color I don't know if the boy behind the counter was stingy or what but the kids only got a few sprinkles which didn't even cover the ice cream which was disappointing considering they charge for them all we won't be returning to this place, we prefer the one closer to us, happy

the pizzas ok, nothing fancy, I sat on the outside patio which is on the main street so whilst having fun I watch all the people walk by and there is a great variety if you are tables just along the outer edge of the patio which I wasn't you might end up interacting with the people passing by so I was able to watch everyone go by without having to interact with them which suited me just fine because I like watching the people.

we were driving around chandler area to find a decent place to eat and the sushi caught our attention oh ok i thought and walked straight in we were greeted right away by a nice waitress but somehow i found her voice to be really annoying the food came out after a few minutes and i was disappointed with the dashiki it wasn't as fresh as expected the soy sauce tasted very weird and by far too salty it's not not the most decent sushi restaurant I've experienced kabuki and mass sushi is still my best choice so far

not only was the music the worst I have ever heard, the waiters were as annoying as ever, like a fancy place in a mall that smells like fish and plays terrible music, the food was so-so but overpriced for what it was

so I had to attend this important event in California and I already spent a lot of money preparing for my trip earlier in the month. I had received a coupon for any service at Epic Salon, that's a lot of savings and I could definitely use to save money. Epic uses Goodwill products which are my product of choice. I just needed a touch of tint, so I went to this salon. i tried a new salon as i had already found one i loved again even though the coupon lured me in anyway i left with the worst experience ever not only was my color wrong i am a golden blonde and she colored my growth ash when i came back to explain what was wrong a few minutes later the receptionist was rude and cut me off while i was talking to her this was not the best way to deal with a pissed off lady especially about her hair I gave them a chance to fix it and the only thing they did was put gold polish on my hair that didn't help at all the styling sucked also I just left I didn't have time to see if they could fix it again I will not return to this place for any service not only because the hair experience was bad but because the receptionist did a bad job impression of the place even worse with its nastiness, I will give this place one star only because on the coupon there was also a product saving

I used to frequent this restaurant years and years ago when I was a student at Deer Valley Airport and eventually became a flight instructor. It was a great location with great views, food was always good, service was great, nothing too exciting but a great place.

Long story short, this place just wasn't the place for me, maybe I'm just a dad buddy, but it seems the clientele is older cougar women with bleached hair and sequin tops. I was expecting a quiet wine bar, but instead it felt more like a loud nightclub. My husband and I visited the lounge on a Saturday night, so maybe the whole wewishwewereaclub thing was only once a week and maybe I'm not cool at all, but we have no plans to return. and the price was good, the food was average, we had a variety of bruschetta, a tuna salad and a strawberry salad, way too much dressing on both salads, it took a long time to get a feel for the table, but it was Saturday night and it was busy so that was to be expected once seated, our waitress seemed more concerned with anything other than serving us, she wasn't very attentive at all, she asked for my order and walked away. remote, my husband was like umm, I kinda wanted to order too, the overall vibe of the place is pretty neat, it's a smaller restaurant with a lot going on. The outdoor patio seating decor is large, heavy curtains and lots of couches, hence the lounge's name, but as I mentioned earlier, the music was ridiculously loud. They had difficulty playing music so loud that it was impossible to have a conversation and we ended up sitting quite far from the speakers which we left as soon as we finished our dinners.

On atmosphere alone I give Sapporo five stars, the restaurant offers modern and trendy decor and is spacious enough to accommodate the ambiance you are looking for, whether it is an intimate date, the sushi bar, a group hibachi table or a large party on the terrace and the servers are all magnificent. Yes, this is the place to see in Scottsdale. the veggie roll and the Kobe beef sliders, the tuna was okay nothing to write home about the rolls were really small also there was so much eel sauce on the chenille roll that when I went to pick up a piece it fell partly into a soggy mess in my soy sauce that splattered all over my freshly dry cleaned cream colored silk blouse the lovely spicy salmon was standard nothing special I enjoyed the veggie roll the most the biggest of what we ordered it was crunchy and tasty the Kobe beef sliders were delicious but seriously who spoils the Kobe beef there is one thing that bothers me when dining at a sushi restaurant asking for more ginger emphasizing a lot more ginger and not receiving it or receiving a small pinch I made requests to two waiters and after minutes of waiting I was brought literally three pieces call me picky but seriously the ginger is fucking Japanese condiment, show me the silver or the ginger in this case I wish to come back to try some hibachi, the aromas wafting around the place from the hot tables were intoxicating, maybe they will redeem themselves with more ginger

this time we didn't really do better when eating there, this place is like Pei Wei, very large pieces of vegetables with meat, never like Pei, either priceless warning, hot tea is available for brown rice instead of white, soups are also terrible

awesome place cool soothe chopped salad is by far the most amazing salad I have ever eaten in my life but Wayland I mean way too small it was double the portion for the price I would probably visit plus I had a flight when I was there took forever because I know flights are supposed to everything it was ridiculous the buffalo meat is so disgusting reminds me of when a stray dog visits my lawn the B sauce is goodbye the staff is just ok nothing of mind blowing I think the staff at a place with an expensive menu should spoil the guests a big deal, a free desert when you know the service and meal is right, it may cause your clientele to come back just because you redeemed yourself in the end, overall it's a cool place that fits the downtown Scottsdale lifestyle, but stay away from the buffalo because it will give a whole new meaning to the doggy bag

I've been here a few times because it's about a block from my house, it's your typical neighborhood bar that isn't crowded, average prices are okay, happy hour, their menu is bar food, burgers, wings, fries, etc. the service is pretty bad if you are in the restaurant part the only time I ate at a table the bartender was also our server needless to say slow is an understatement the only reason I go here is so I don't have to drive anywhere because I have had better much better my experiences tell me the waterfront is just a corner bar nothing special

I really can't believe this place has received such rave reviews from people, my lady and I walked in and were greeted rather rudely by a snooty female dog at the front with a monotonous name please instead of a warm and friendly French style welcome to this rather lovely place. upon arriving at we weren't really looking to go out, it would have been awfully nice if the helpers had advised of the need to make reservations before entering here because if you don't you are automatically shit according to the staff sorry I don't plan much in advance next time I will and he won't be there anyway after debating for a minute or two with herself the hostess decided we could sneak in and sat us right above from the other couple inside the restaurant she informed us that we could cork our own wine for their low price low fucking dollars in words that only office space could adequately describe taste taste what exactly are you doing the food was good nothing spectacular for a plate we had a salad with apples, walnuts and blue cheese that was served hot now this is the first hot salad I have had in my entire life and I am in no way a kind from an expert in worldly cooking but I believe the salad should be cold and crisp not soggy and hot yuck the cordon bleu was tasty and plentiful however the wobbly table was an extreme nuisance when cutting through the chicken but this was remedied mercilessly to the staff by placing a jackinthebox gift card under the leg. I admit the mashed potatoes are some of the creamiest and best I've ever had. My lady had the pork tenderloin which had a strange peppery and sweet accord that I didn't particularly like. overall this place was pretty disappointing, i honestly thought it would be much more cozy and welcoming inside but it really wasn't, it presents itself as being so upscale and french and oglala wee wee, but in the end it's still located in a little shack of a house down the street and in the highlands, maybe if it was located in baltimore i would give it a little more credit

let me first say that we are fans of the W Hotel and have stayed at many of their hotels across the country and are overall happy with the accommodations and customer service. I am a local Phoenician who resides in the Arcadia neighborhood and frequents many of the wonderful restaurants and hotels that this city has to offer after hearing many negative reviews from my colleagues, family and friends. Visiting and local friends we chose to try this place as we approach the bar entrance, security tells us we are not welcome here as one of our group does not have closed toed shoes and another does not have a collared shirt. The outfit our group wore was more than appropriate for any Phoenix Scottsdale restaurant, let me remind you that it is July in Phoenix and it is over a hundred degrees at night time. popular restaurant, the staff were downright rude not only to us but to other people wanting and willing to spend money and support the local hotel. I strongly suggest not staying here or supporting the quality of business they are running here in a time of downturn in the economy and tourism. Many businesses are forced to rely solely on the best possible customer service to attract and retain business. to live so don't settle for this place

I am confident that anyone who gives this airline more than one star is most likely associated with them and is concerned about their work. I have been flying with them for years so as not to see my aging mother. I fly the same flights every year. The service and attitude of employees gradually deteriorated. I am also a pilot and understand weather and air traffic control very well. This rant is not about safe operations or delays, but about customer service by pissed off employees. I believed what happened, I forgot to buy my own bottle of water before I got on the plane in Charlotte, the drink service went on for hours after the flight, this old grumpy guy came and said what do you want, I said I would like to have a soda and a water, she said you can only have one or the other. shockingly, the check in personnel was just as rude if you look at the news on the internet, a few weeks ago there was an article that rated customer satisfaction and we had been at the bottom, I for one will never fly with them again

damn spa I'm I work in the industry I live in the industry and I've been breathing the industry for the last few years so I know spas after a stressful few weeks of work school and planning a wedding I suddenly remembered that I'm a better version of myself when I take adult time out my corner so to speak was at Joy Spa I remember a travel diary purchase I made a few months ago for a massage or a facial at the Joy Spa at the Montelucia Resort in Phoenix, I was excited I called, I made an appointment with a male therapist and started preparing for my next big spa adventure after eagerly waiting for Sunday to ride, I finally found myself walking into a Moroccan paradise the space was mesmerizing from the moment I walked in, it smelled like a spa and helped set the mood for my relaxing day. I was given a full tour of the facilities and allowed to set my intentions with small crystals in a round room and then taken to a room with a giant crystal used to help calm the intention and awareness of your visit and yourself. The woman who showed me around was very professional. and thorough although informative, I was expecting a warm connection from him and I never received it after being shown to the locker room, I changed into my swimsuit and waited in the ladies lounge for my provider to find me and take me back for my massage experience. I chose a male provider knowing I had tension knots and stress. I was hoping for a slow, firm relaxing massage. I've had many massages and this one was actually a bit disappointing. the relaxing experience I was craving my massage therapist was very kind and genuine in his approach I was just hoping for something more I definitely didn't let my treatment ruin my experience the facilities were amazing they were clean and always stocked with towels I have to say the spa attendants were rocked I couldn't believe how efficient they were I observed on some occasions yes every time a shower was free an attendant was there to clean it every time a towel was on the floor she was immediately picked up they worked together like a well oiled machine and I would love to give them props for making me take note of the work, do I plan to come back I may not get a massage because of my experience but I really enjoyed the facilities and staff. I'm even thinking of booking a suite for my bridal party to enjoy the day there. in the end, if you know massage like I do, beware, you may not get value for your money in your treatment

a group of four of us went last night for the first time i had bought a group and was looking forward to checking out a new winery the service when we arrived was terrible it took a tour guide from another group to get someone's attention we had reservations but they were surprised to see us given all that if the wine had been great we could have forgiven the service wasn't great i don't expect the wine to be dad quality or sonora but at least make up for it with your disappointing service and i will stick to other local wine bars on the move honestly i can't believe this place has a star average

canfield is acceptable for routine checkups for maintenance and preventive care, which is why they offer a wellness plan when it comes to your pet getting sick. I would go somewhere else, it shouldn't be called a hospital. The doctors are there only for profit and do not show any care to your pet.

I don't know why I've been here more than once but the parking is terrible and the food is solo only, lots of color and flash but not much, the baba sauce is great but I seem to get sick later in the evening when I eat it, I have to learn from the experience
what the heck, prepare for sticker shock, I walked into the store and made a hasty beeline back to the exit and across the road to the checkout barrel, ah much better phew

I went there with a friend last year after reading so many good reviews the service is good we didn't have to wait but I didn't like the food I ordered I got a salmon with caper butter sauce the fish is not fresh at all and the food is too easy for me
the establishment is very clean and I was in and out quickly but the staff lacks personality and friendliness

I'll be honest, this place is good for Americans but not good enough for Chinese. The waiters were rather rude to us despite our ability to speak their language. Also, what kind of authentic Chinese restaurant serves dinner on plates, blasphemy, our table had to go out of its way to get bowls. I'm surprised they have chopsticks, otherwise their fake food was salty and mushy, perfect for Americans looking for a good replacement for orange chicken. flavors and intense action of the pepper afterwards

so I recently went here with a friend of mine because they were craving a store and I didn't care if we were going to eat as long as there was food. I had one of those new healthy choice menu items, the balsamic chicken and my friend had the club sandwich with a side salad and a side of pancakes, don't ask, the food was surprisingly very good and the service was excellent.
I liked the theme, didn't care for the execution, portions were scarce, prices didn't match the value, all three diners were disappointed, still hungry.

Buck di beeps is literally an Italian restaurant, you know how all the big chain restaurants throw trash on the walls trying to make the space look vintage. Buck di beeps throws trash and kicks, trinkets, statues and anything Italian they could find in the Chinese warehouse where they loaded these goods. Alfredo sauce thick slices of lasagna with less flavor than I can get from the frozen section of the public I went there with a large group and on the other side of the table bland food when they seat your group they walk you through the kitchen where the cooks play along and say a welcome hello to the back you know they hate it why are we in the kitchen sure it's nice but I prefer to let them concentrate about making food and making it good, of course, the food at Buck di beeps seems to be way beyond any point of returning to good taste, it's just dead food, no life, no flavor, no emotion, I get more flavor from the Michelin frozen lunch packet, far from claiming anything authentic, the Buck di beeps even tasteless bread, eating at Buck is like eating food at an assisted living facility, no salt, no sugar, no butter, no fat, everything comes with everything that tastes like it, sure the Buck has huge portions and the setup is nice for big parties and families, but they could just as easily buy the family packs of pasta from the frozen section and cook it at home, even that would be better and they wouldn't have to pay the obligatory tip to say what you want about other Italian chains like Macaroni Grill or Olive Garden, at least their food tastes like something thing

We visited Frank Albert on a Sunday afternoon for lunch, there was hardly anyone there as it was around noon. We had lunch there a few years ago on the terrace and had a great time, but the temperature was that particular afternoon so the terrace was not an option. We were the only ones there besides the guy who talked on the phone the entire time we were there. was on the money, I received two soft tortilla shells of tacos built in the shaper with cabbage and only no fish, two large fish fillets were on the side, it was really messy, I had to tear the fillets with my fork, mash some fish into the tortillas full of cabbage and complete my own taco, sad I gave up on the second one and ate the veggie taco and fish separately. I can't say, I won't order them again, I ordered a sandwich and since he has to be on a special diet he can't eat mayonnaise, he reads the ingredients very closely and asks for things he can't leave out, his sandwich came covered in mayonnaise even though it wasn't listed on the menu as an ingredient when we looked for our server he was nowhere to be found, so while I was munching on messy tacos I had looking sad for the next few minutes until we finally saw the waiter and reported him. The server was great at making the new sandwich without mayonnaise and we even got an extra order of sweet potato fries with sea salt, they were delicious and when you see their homemade chipotle ketchup try it, I looked for it in the gift shop in Baltimore but they didn't have any for sale. Well, I don't swear off Frank Albert forever, but since I'm only in Phoenix a few times a year, it'll be a while before I go back.

this place is a glorified garage sale it smells and no one speaks english the kids run around pulling clothes off the racks and crushing people if you are lucky you can find shoes but i have never found any shit for clothes just go up to the marshall and save yourself

i have been here a few times for lunch and had the pizza today my friend decided to try the sandwiches very disappointing i got the roast beef my friend had the turkey both were lackluster and covered in gooey roasted red peppers if you are going to humble pie go for the pizza and happy hour

I admit I'm not a huge fan of be as it usually makes me want to explode afterwards, but as my restaurant partner loves be we've eaten here a lot, the meat is pretty good but at least one of the meats has been dry every time I've been my favorite has been the ham, the spicy be sauce is pretty darn tasty too, I found myself putting black pepper on the mac and cheese to spice it up and I wasn't very impressed with the rest of their sides either, I'm a big fan of sides even more than meat. so when the sides disappoint I get sad, I downed their homemade root beer after one sip, I don't know what was in it, but it was very bad for me and I really love root beer, my dining partner loved it, so ehh maybe it's just me the place is very interesting inside, the decor reminds me of a mid century cafeteria, but more modern, they have a huge mural hand painted farmhouse and a large outdoor seating area so parents can let their kids run around while they eat. outside on weekends, I don't think it's worth waiting for minutes in line, but then again I don't think many places are worth waiting for a cafeteria style dinner

gary bet ratings with southwest dental group in phoenix ahwatukee dr bet was nice but the office well it seemed like the most unfriendly and cold dental office I have ever been to in my life. everything was rushed, we didn't review my story or much, but we'll see if the next visit is better postscript after we get home from this apartment and read the horror stories on various review sites relating to all the dental practices in the southwest. I changed my designated dentist and went to Foothills Smiles instead, please see my review of Foothills Smiles on Ray Rd.
Me

I didn't go back, the haircut turned out worse than I thought, being quite unmanageable. I ended up going back to the local Mexican barber who charged $$$ for a pretty decent haircut. I think they gave better massages than haircuts, but it wasn't a bad place and could do worse.

I have never eaten at this place the two times I have had it, it was take out the first time I had a pulled pork sandwich and a side of beans, the pork was extremely dry and tasteless without the sauce, the sauce I found was overly seasoned and the beans had way too much pepper the second time I ate it was a work lunch which we had delivered once again, the pork was completely dry but not as dry as the shredded chicken my coworkers were complaining about, I'd rather be on this place for sure

I hadn't been to an oregano restaurant in years they seem to pop up everywhere around here so my boyfriend was coming from out of town and he wanted to try so why not I'll tell you why not we got two thin crust pizzas and I hate even calling them that more like crackers with melted cheese and toppings it was one of the worst excuses for pizza I've ever had. better than thin crust god it couldn't be worse it only deserves 1 star for good service other than that it's another overpriced and overpriced gourmet pizzeria if you want expensive and good pizza there are many good alternatives pizzeria bianca grimaldi and

I had received an email from a retention student telling me that I still owe money for my two week time in attendance, even though these idiots canceled my financial aid. I would sue this school if they even tried to collect money from me and I withdrew from classes at the right time, but this rep told me the withdrawal deadline was January.

who would have ever thought the combination of chicken and waffles was crazy but it sure is the hidden location inside a large plaza of Alberto's Aces Hardware gas station and so much more it's really hard to find unless you've been inside the mall. As a bonus, the chicken was tasty even though I'm not normally a fan of fried chicken. I love waffles, but it seemed like the waffles came out cold, like they were reheated or Eggo waffles. I loved Eggo waffles growing up, but I don't expect frozen waffles at an establishment. I'll stick to chicken and call this place lo lo chicken coop.
I love Richardson's cocks and and but come on, I'll look for server managers with customer service skills

This is my first time using a band, it's a way to enjoy various cultural experiences without investing too much money just in case, obviously the restaurant could benefit from the exposure without costing them too much, it's a voucher that I paid for in advance, the restaurant only received I believe and I screamed a lot before pressing the buy button. I understand it's hard to find authentic foods back home, everything is Americanized for one reason or another. i know it's hard to get the same fresh or processed ingredients and spices from my home country, those are my pet peeves, okay and there's one more before we get to the review, the comparison can be deadly. I have tried Latin American foods including Yucatan Oaxaca Belize so my knowledge is zero on Venezuelan foods but I have taste buds and experiences of various food cultures overall it was rubbish I was referring to the variety of tastes and uniqueness it was not worth my money my friend and I asked the media to lump the regular portion together for the large plates came with a large portion of steamed white rice small cups of black beans sprinkled with cheese half a fried egg avocado regular Chinese style I cooked all the time simple areas round flatbreads a chorizo sausage a blood sausage pieces of shredded beef a small steak a few green plantains and a few sweet plantains the blood sausage tasted burnt tired I had blood sausage much tastier, softer and more colorful than the blood sausage I grew up with delicious, maybe that's why I'm being vicious now heed my warning it's not good for cholesterol the steak has a savory flavor it's regular although I believe it's reduced to an ounce the shredded beef reminds me of sloppy joe it's good for the taste sweet plantains are regular fried plantains like you find in some Chinese buffets or regular dessert menus it's good for sweetness but nothing more than that in this restaurant if you give me a steamed bun or a roll of silver thread both are steamed rice paste I can tell how much salt it contains the satisfaction of chewing the freshness and the distinct aroma steamed and I can eat it in single areas that is to say it's a tasteless and odorless fluffy treat that didn't excite my taste buds a bit boring honestly I didn't have no idea how special it was supposed to be it tasted better after stuffing the avocado and shredded beef inside the green plantains were like hard cardboard fried care no taste but it has a green tinted color my friend also ordered some really tiny tequenos fried breaded cheese sticks for each chinese egg the rolls are each twice as big and they are fattier and tastier i'm not a size queen the quest for ham empanada was so small with a bite, come on you're kidding me, the calzones are more complicated and much bigger with ham and cheese and even more ingredients for a similar price. serve, pay a salary and rent the space, we were the only table that evening, the wait service was ordinary between a bus boy and minimalist, the ambiance was simple and it wasn't a place you would expect to pay for two before the group, so diners get the chance to have a different cultural experience. You should try it due to lack of familiarity. The food tasted bland and boring. problem with this restaurant and I have a totally different experience than the helpers here

for some reason it reminds me a bit of the Dukes of Waikiki, the food is ok, not bad, nor good, the service is ok, not bad, not good, the best part about this place is they don't have cover and it's easy to pop in for a beer on a pub crawl or to sober up for a few hours. A coworker of mine literally comes here every week and I don't think he's ever had a free beer.

i wish i could have reviewed this place in service but i couldn't get one at 1pm on a sunday afternoon for a jedi manicure the front nail master told me to sit down i understand i walked in on a sunday afternoon so they are going to be busy and im fine waiting my wait turned into minutes and no one said a word to me then the front nail guy tells me it will be a few more minutes before someone can reach out, you know your salon, you know your technicians and how long it will take they had to do a service as well as the number of people in front of me, so it would have been nice to have a scheduled wait time before wasting an hour of my time. I ended up leaving and going to another salon who saw me right away. The place in general was dirty. Spilled nail polish on the wall and dust everywhere. I didn't get to see how clean their baths and Jedi chairs were, but the waiting area and reception area were dirty.

finding this quaint place wasn't too difficult, I like that there is parking just north of the place as well as street parking, glad you walk into the place and wow it's a completely different atmosphere, low lighting but in a calming way rather than scary, they have to do the music makes the decor but to be honest it was a bit strange for my taste our waitress was very nice and helpful automatically served us cucumber water which tastes amazing and then asked for our drink orders, a good waitress can seriously turn everything upside down or completely make your visit you know, that's a pet peeve of mine, customer service, every table had a pink candle lit, pink lights hung above the chefs area, it was so relaxing the mirrors on the wall around this cool splattered paint I was digging everything on their menu is served as appetizers, which kinda sucks, they're all at least bucks at least from what I saw and the waitress said she recommends people to have at least one wow piece on the drinks, it's a bit expensive for me, luckily we shared everything. the lemongrass chicken can't remember the full title was amazing so good the gooey meatballs were good a little too minty for my liking we had this other thing where they bring you the hot stone and you cook your own meat it was good but the stone only stayed hot enough to cook the meat rare I don't like my meat to moo so it was good but I prefer it to be well cooked the beef wrapped in grape leaves good I was so excited to try them but I was sadly disappointed they were so fiery and spicy I almost almost had tears in my eyes I never said about the spicy menu after a waiter came and saw us out of breath he filled us up and said oh yes they are quite spicy wow that's a good thing I had a lot of belly in the whole atmosphere was amazing the staff were fab the food eh the menu is crap if you're going to serve food spicy you should say it's spicy isn't some sort of health risk and it's a bit pricey I think I would go again but I don't think I would opt for there are many more dishes I would like to try maybe somewhere different would be better

the place has a nice little vibe and they have some unique items, but the reason the rating is so low is because there really aren't many options that don't involve fake meat. Aren't these people vegan, don't they hate the idea of ​​poor little animals being our food even if that's the only reason they are alive, so why so much fake meat, I will never understand the craving for meat, vegans and vegetarians. not as healthy as lean fresh meats like chicken and fish Friday I love meat but every now and then I like to have a vegetarian dish another negative is that almost everything is fried, I guess they are busting the myth that people are vegan because it's healthier frying things is the cheap way to create a healthy and tasty meal. I'll give them one star because what we chose was pretty tasty, but with almost every option involving fake meat and tofu, it's definitely a disappointment. If you want legit vegan food, try Indian places or the Ethiopian places are very creative and use spices to flavor a vegetable dish. Fake cheese and meats are for meat-envying vegans, not omnivores who just want a good meal, keep your expectations in check and you should be fine.

what's with the cheese, it's not even velvet, it's liquid cheese food and it belongs somewhere other than on my burger burger and fries, it's a good deal if if it's a lot, it's just liquid cheese food on a hamburger patty, mcdonald's will make a burger and fries because it's tastier than this dump

lot of enthusiasm is very bogged down, let me first say the place is cute, the staff is friendly and the salsa is good there, I'm not a total idiot, but the food leaves a lot to be desired, I didn't find much to like about my chicken tacos, they were ok but the meat didn't have much flavor, there was no cheese and they were pretty stingy with the guacamole and choosing what What really got me was that they didn't come with rice and beans instead I got a nice pile of cheap bagged romaine coated in some sort of cesarean dressing, sure it had a few cubes of cheese and a slice of tomato on top but go for a few naked tacos and a pile of romaine for that much they could have at least removed the white parts of the lettuce from my salad or I don't know sprinkle a little cheese on the tacos, the story was pretty much the same with the fish tacos, only the salad was different, the enchiladas seemed to be a hit and those were served with rice and beans. and beans for his meal and they're not kidding when they say it's a side dish. I think my cat's food bowl is bigger, they charge per bowl if you want more chips, I know it's no big deal but it's just the principle.

I ate here months ago, I was excited to finally find a Phoenix sushi restaurant and one that also offered brown rice as a sub for sushi dishes, but since it's been several months and I may remember another place, one item impressed me and that was the free appetizer of tempura chips with maybe a side of squid salad. I should have ordered another portion instead. expensive considering the very small portion given, I was so unimpressed with its uninspiring flavors that I don't even remember what type of roll I tried, quite sad I know, I told myself I wouldn't go back, but I would like to try again, maybe for lunch, dinner honestly with a group of friends and having monkeys and a winemaker

Hey Thai elephant stop sucking you were so good why are my spring rolls cold why don't you take a fork with my food after asking why don't you make me tiger on fire for lunch when I had it last week for lunch and it's on the menu. When did you decide to cut my portion of curry in half almost when did your service start to suck Hey all the people who decided my two tops weren't important enough to attend why did it take a few minutes to order my drink then another ten minutes to get my drink the way tiger beer is on your menu if you're not actually going to offer it then you need to take it off your menu I can't believe we got to this point I loved you you broke my heart for the last time

quest is ridiculously good seriously and the homemade tortillas are also exceptional, other than everything is average at best, as mentioned by others it's Americanized Mexican food, it's not authentic, Mexican mi amigos we had been to before and really enjoyed the food, making it a point to return on our last trip to Arizona. We started with the chips and salsa for the delicious table. disappointing I made the joke that it was leftovers from the kitchen and it looked like a light tomato broth with a bunch of veggies a piece of cheese and a small cob of corn on top yes a small cob of corn is on top it was lousy and I wouldn't recommend it we ordered a pound of chicken fajitas and half a pound of veggies thanks to the vegetarian fiancée it went surprisingly far for five of us but the veggies weren't grilled much, which is sad because they were otherwise delicious. Also the chicken fajitas only had one piece of green pepper and one red on top, they should be lush with peppers and onions that were grilled or maybe even caramelized. Onions Daniel e wrote in his review the same concern that there should be more than a pile of onions which he expected. At least a few green, red or yellow peppers. on almost everything it's such a shame that this place has to be Restaurant Impossible with Robert Irvine this time, the service was really lousy and my fiancee found a bug at the bottom of her water very disappointing. It was dirty on entry and exit. Sad to say we probably won't be back in the future. I don't know if our family and friends in the greater Phoenix area will either after the bug incident.

this place was good but not as good as I had hoped based on the reviews I would have given this place because I can't I decided to balance another reviewer who gave the place stars but also thought it deserved positive ratings the hot sauce had some bite the chips were good Cameron's chichi had wonderful sauce lots of fresh limes served with the meal full bar not so positive ratings the shrimp in Cameron's chichi was overcooked cardinal sin for a seafood restaurant the shrimp cocktail was just ok good sized boiled shrimp but not too much flavor if I'm passing by and hungry I would stop there again but not if I have to drive too far

It's refreshing to find unique places, God knows Phoenix needs more of them to inject some personality into this generic chain of malls in every corner of the valley. Finding this unique sandwich shop that is located in a house that has been converted into a restaurant is indeed a welcome find. Real estate is limited, so parking is compact and circles around the back of the building. bowls and salads, the food was pretty good although it didn't knock my socks off. I ordered the baba bowl which is described on their online menu as southwest chicken over garlic rice, black beans, monterey jack cheese and topped with lime sour cream and pick de gallo. helped me with the flavor but I had replaced the rice with organic brown rice which didn't add much flavor the sour cream wasn't lime there was a small slice of lime served on the edge of the bowl I wouldn't bother ordering it again especially if I'm craving southwestern food on another recent visit I ordered a wrap called prince de thais spicy peanut chicken with baby spinach garlic rice ginger salad fresh slice of cucumber and red onion wrapped in a spinach tortilla that had better flavor than the baba bowl the vegetable ingredients were fresh and good again I wasn't very impressed with the chicken pieces, one thing I think a wrap needs to address is the use of Styrofoam cupsapteral, their slogan is healthy food for a hungry planet and they have a link to a new green restaurant for vegan food on their website for such an artsy and earthy place, I would have thought it's a wrap would have made more conscious ecological choices for that reason and the bland chicken, I only give them an average rating

after searching for a car wash vacuum in the area I selected Francis Sons, I checked their price on their website but when I received their price the price they wanted to charge was much higher, they kept trying to sell upholstery cleaning and then said I didn't take care of it so there would be extra to clean the black plastic exterior parts. I highly recommend avoiding these scammers

am i missing something here, i actually returned to the americas twice after my first visit, convinced i had accidentally gone to the wrong america or perhaps stumbled into a nearby taco shop, alas the helpful yelp photo informs me that i have in fact now eaten at the famous american taco shop three times. I lived in San Diego for three years and certainly had what I would call good Mexican food, the same can be said for a number of American burritos, I'm sorry to say, but neither your tacos nor your burritos live up to the incredible hype that surrounds you now, even though the salsa was really, really good. I'm always on the hunt for the best burrito in Maricela County.

lost stars sat in the restaurant for minutes no waitress no water no nothing we left the saddest part was there were people who left then came back and got service before us the guy who came in after us sat down hot tea and his order was taken while we sat and waited seriously we will go back now if you have about an hour to kill you can wait for your catering service there

I was really excited to try this restaurant since it is so close to where I live, I just thought it was one of those places that looked like a dive on the outside but served a slice of heaven on the inside once I read the reviews on Yelp I was convinced I had made a good real estate investment maybe my expectations were too high but I thought it was just ok I liked the chips and salsa and the service was friendly without being in your face we ordered a round of margaritas which were good but were really weak in terms of the amount of tequila my dad had the garlic shrimp and octopus which were really delicious I'm going back that's what I ordered I had the fish cuilichi was ok just a bit heavy and not really something that excited me the girly girl in me said not worth the calories I think I'll try it again in the future maybe it was an off night
food was good, service was not good, only one waitress for the whole restaurant

well apparently Netflix just wasn't down with the overall customer base being extraordinarily happy and offering great value for money, a business model I praised in my previous review, they are now changing their pricing structure so the one doing both an unlimited plan is and the watch unlimited plan is also so together they were together. value of a month's unlimited netflix package rather than just renting blockbuster or rewatch movies, so yeah I guess they are fine, the instant watch service is still a good deal, but one fact at a time is a total scam and I never thought I would use the word scam to describe netflix

I love the atmosphere and how hip the place is, so the place kind of reminds me of how they set it up. I had my strip steak and I don't think it was worth the price, the steak didn't come with a side, the sides are ordered separately, great customer service, but I don't think I will eat here again.

am theaters has the distinct disadvantage in phoenix of operating in a city with a local provider of high quality hawkins entertainment and they really pale in comparison tonight we went to the am in central arizona which is literally right next to our house but we have only been there two or three times in as many years why because am no longer offers a senior discount for am management did you know there is a huge population of seniors living in condos in downtown Phoenix who are going to be moving three and four times a week I think it's absolutely ridiculous that I can go to a Hawkins and see a movie for two, but when it's a movie theater in the morning, it's do they think they're so special that they justify that extra tax. The theater is generally clean and nice but the soda and popcorn prices are too high combined with the fact that they don't offer a senior discount, please just fold up your tent and leave, we don't need you here.

you need to know what you are looking for to find that place. I've passed this place dozens of times and never realized that a restaurant bar was located underground. The bar was packed but we were able to comfortably enjoy our food and have a conversation. anyway I know not to order wine here overall it wasn't too bad an experience next time I will go with a beer instead of the wine and try to sit in the dining room, return postman

I thought it was ok my husband thought it was spectacular I tried to order my standard soy vanilla latte but for me they were out of vanilla it's like a burger without ketchup so I got a mocha instead nice coffee flavor but the chocolate didn't taste that special my husband had a cappuccino and would definitely have it again
