I am a very loyal customer of Pure Sushi and have been for over years until about a few months ago. I might have given this place stars, but with the horrible service I've experienced over the past few months, I only give it normally. I order my food to go to the bar and take it home and eat it but for the last few months when I go to order my food at the bar it's always the same bartender working and she is rude the last time I ordered food I ended up going out and not ordering anything. seems to be her friends at the bar, I always know what I want as soon as I walk in so there is no need for a menu, she greets me and hands me a menu totally ignoring me telling her I already knew what I wanted, then she proceeds to talk to her friend or someone at the bar for a few minutes before taking my order. I recommend this place now, I completely understand if this happens from time to time, but it has happened every time I have been there over the last few months. I almost feel like I've been betrayed. I was such a loyal customer and referred so many people to Pure. I just hope they don't receive the same type of service I did.

food was ok waitress forgot my guacamole waiters continually bumped into our table excellent wine list nice decor may or may not try again not impressed with food I go for daffodils or real food instead

stars for guests who attended generally nice appearance friendly and almost no douchebags stars for cleanliness I was there last night for a booked catered party and even though the food had flowed it was of course on the terrace no one cleaned it fantastic decor coupled with disgusting, stale food stars for bar service ordered drinks three times and despite the affront had to have a drink each time which was generally undeserved and overpriced and this time waiting wants just because the sex girls were getting served the bartenders were just so poor stars for the music vibe of the whole stars club vibe with places similar to this like labels and an i rob wouldn't come back to this place unless invited

so there are no negative stars too bad I tried ordering take out before eating there to try it good thing you couldn't pay me to eat here the only thing about the colossal cobb salad I ordered was the price and the change for lettuce just enough to cover the bottom of the styrofoam with a sprinkling of toppings where they get their chilis from the chef what a disappointment all the reviews say a lot of food for which a baby that i also ordered some caramelized cookies didn't know either fried greasy disks of oatmeal harder than concrete were called cookies, hell the bakery wasn't even good i had to spit those things out before getting out a topping the only good thing about chandler's copies is jason deli right next door

it was my first time visiting the tandoori after seeing it advertised on a group i was thinking of giving my friend a try and decided to go for lunch to celebrate his birthday it was very busy which promised the waitress was on her second day working there and didn't know the menu but she was friendly the house salad was mediocre the starter algol gobi was delicious but the desserts were terrible the mango ice cream was a neon orange and had no nothing like mango or any ice cream flavor I have ever seen actually tasted a little vanilla a little vomit yuck the rice pudding was not worth eating either the worst part of the experience was followed in the parking lot after leaving the group and a cash tip only to be told we had to come and speak with management about not ordering at least the value of the food. I told the waiter that we had spent a little more and obviously didn't expect a cash refund from the group. was actually kinda saving them, he finally understood what I was saying and left us alone. I ended up calling the manager, but who was not happy to hear about our experience with the stupid waiter, I don't plan on going back.
average sushi but great fun I love just taking things off the conveyor belt alcohol is also a bit expensive

my honey loves this place so much supposedly because they have a but that comes with an avocado and a half cooked egg on it mom ok when he finally dragged me here I realized he probably loved it because the waitresses hit it, the bees if you're reading this they will do anything for a tip anything. the juices from the burgers just off the grill uh disgusting, that alone brings the rating to two stars and I'm not even a vegetarian on display it's just disgusting the English muffin was this weird little hockey puck that really served no purpose other than as a vehicle for the tasty homemade apricot jams that came with the chocolate and cherry scones were delicious and the coffee was pretty good the stand next to us had three things two guys and a chick gobbling down some still wasted mimosas from the night before, who thought it was fun playing with their cell phones at high volumes, it was just boring as fuck later, when I visited the fancy bathrooms, I saw the girl crying in the lobby, I guess the swordfish didn't end well, I'll go back so my son can keep getting his ego stroked and his cholesterol levels raised, but I stay away from things on the grill

disgusting there was a group so my daughter and I tried it very old fashioned and the gaudy style interior made me feel like I was in an episode of sopranos the food itself was pretty bad we ordered some pretty plain dishes but they just had no flavor after trying it I'm positive all the good reviews here are employees or owners who create them

I'm always perplexed when staff don't know anything about their online promotions this time it was the yelp advert luckily this was quickly resolved by the bartender this time which was refreshing. The place itself is a pretty generic bar. I just had a few drinks with the crab cakes which were actually pretty good.

my friend kept telling me how good their lunches were I tried it but it did nothing for me the sandwich tasted like something you can get at Safeway but twice the price for being called a fine purveyor I was expecting the food to not taste like any regular sandwich what I had ham, cheese and portobello mushrooms on a pain with sides of pasta one was du parmesan and the other was macaroni maybe it was the sore bread I think the parmesan pasta was made there but I know for sure the macaroni wasn't made there, it tasted like something I ate at a picnic that was in a box, it was nothing to brag about. I discovered that the head chef had made sure my sandwich was kept in the kitchen and away from customers, with no personality. I asked for his suggestion and his reaction was good normally when I go to them for their desserts. Their desserts are fabulous and you can get individual servings for a reasonable price. I can take an assortment home and have them for later. Our company uses them for their catering and I have received many compliments on their dishes but leave aside the lunches

this gym is good, I thought from the outward appearance it would be a lot bigger, but it gets the job done, the staff are friendly and welcoming. I rather enjoy all the classes here, especially rumba. The instructor reminds me of a young Richard Simmons.

if you like sushi go elsewhere, I was extremely disappointed with the quality of service and food, I decided to take my family here because the other reviews seemed good, but either my experience was an anomaly or the other attendants in Phoenix and I have stark differences in taste. The staff had big smiles but lacked follow through. We had to ask for water and extra ginger twice. of their rollsone was named climax disgusting and just plain unpleasant, the decor and ambience leaves you wanting to have three different wallpapers hanging and the music is overwhelming even though it's the only sushi bar surprised I will happily head to Peoria or Scottsdale next time I have a craving for sushi

it's this place next to the red one on Southern Avenue, no real ambiance or service to speak of, it's just a little burrito joint in a strip mall, I ordered the devil's burrito or shrimp burro or something I don't know, I don't suppose, I stopped to think about the exact meaning of the word devil in the name but found out it means hot like hotter than hot pepper spray and yes, unfortunately for me I know what it tastes like has pepper spray, I had this friend in college in Austin and one drunken night his crazy little brother Michael slipped me a shrimp which he doused in pepper spray, let me tell you it was pretty hot but not even close to Devil's Shrimp at the Nazi taco, I'll be back but only to take Michael there when he comes to visit next month, beware of Devil's Shrimp

Last summer when I was in a hotel I ate here several times and it was always great. I love the pulled pork sandwich I had here while I had family in town a few weeks ago and it wasn't like it used to be. The sandwich lacked flavor. They didn't have the same support as before.

we ordered by the first day in our new house also the first lousy Sunday of this season, I was expecting about an hour wait, they quoted me a few minutes for delivery and when the doorbell rang after that I thought it was lawyers or maybe neighbors coming to greet us in the neighborhood, I was pleasantly surprised that it was our food, we ordered mushroom pizza and chicken wings and fillets both very tasty, we are used to it to thinner crust pizzas my style I guess so it was a bit doughy but the garlic and herb crust was delicious nonetheless not sure if we will order from here again unless we don't find our place my style but it was still good
I go here a lot, service is getting worse and worse, food isn't as good as it once was, happy hour is amazing though

the sellers here are very knowledgeable and helpful, they are also very friendly and give recommendations. I know it's a comic book store, but I've only been there for books, supplements, and the occasional anime. I'm pretty sure their anime is pirated, but because of its low price and the fact that you usually can't find it elsewhere I don't care, they often come in complete sets for bucks which is great for a whole series. I have sometimes had a hard time looking at them on the mailbox but because of the price I keep coming back now otherwise in the next part they would have a star which they no longer sell and books or dice games which break my heart they have always had the best selection in dice and I haven't managed to find another place that carries more than both out of all the atomic comics I have been to I like this one the most the people there are always fun and inviting, I can't stress that enough

I had to give it up to the stars, the food was the same quality but they no longer bring out big bowls of white and brown rice, they brought out small bowls of rice when there are a lot of us, are we supposed to share or have our individual bowls, we had our usual chicken fried rice, ok, Mongolian beef, good chicken chow, good honey crispy chicken, good orange peel chicken, me, spicy chicken, too spicy for me, but the group said it was the good main reason for the stars was the lousy service, we literally had to get our servers attention for everything that was filled. no more boxes of togo rice and we waited for our server to collect the check which he never showed, so we handed it to another server and asked if she could help us, he came back to the table only times we can get his attention, we were always out of drinks, I haven't had such bad service in a long time, I won't come back by myself, but if the family wants, they can drag me away kicking and screaming

the food was tolerable and tasteless the chips were actually tostadas which were extremely hard almost stale when eating the starters we ordered were bland the rice and beans had no flavor at all maybe it's a baba style of food but I couldn't find the flavor anywhere the service was excellent and the ambiance was wonderful but I don't think we will return to this place

I'm furious the last few months I've had at least scheduling issues from them calling me on a Saturday morning my day off to cancel my appointment last Saturday when I walked in only to be told that someone had made a mistake and had actually booked me for the next week and although I drove until morning they couldn't get me in until maybe that evening and then not with someone who had experience in medical deep tissue massage, I was irritated and ready to ask for a refund on my membership at that point, but Ashley, the clinic manager, promised to give me my appointment next week for free and personally make sure there were no more problems because I literally couldn't turn my head to the left because of the pain. I saw a show here last night, the stage is raised to a suitable height, the acoustics are pretty decent and the sound system is adequate for the live acts. Three trapezoidal speakers placed above the stage provide good coverage and clarity. There are a few subs hidden under the stage, they have moving light mirrors that don't move the heads and some LED monitors per cans are on the stage floor and are capable, so they look decent if it was up to me to throw more cans on the front wash and add some side wash. the staff are attractive and friendly, know the area and restaurants well. There is also a patio where you can smoke outside and they have heaters so they don't freeze your drinks. The drinks are reasonably priced for Scottsdale and they had some good specials last night, ranging from beer to whiskey to cinnamon to vodka, so your bases should be covered. on all kinds of people as they left old town Scottsdale, so tell the wise guys not to drink and drive

the employees were so busy talking to each other that they couldn't remember what we ordered and still couldn't understand amidst the three employees continuing in their personal chaos. My husband finally said ok, I'm the customer, I'll make our sandwiches and then I'll take care of your problems. They stopped for a split second, all three looked at us and then basically ignored us. I didn't order it and after telling the girl she said I thought you said the order was still wrong, phew

I really wanted to fall madly in love with this place, I mean a British themed pub in Heritage Square, so promising that when you walk in the bartender is standing behind it in an elaborate wooden bar structure, it made me think of a publican instead of a bartender, as at my mate's I'll have a pint and have rooms available on the day, which is probably the idea, as there was a lovely selection of dry ales. We wandered over to the bar on the right and ordered a few pints. I ordered a boddingtons. It was nice if they had some old weird on tap but you can't have it all because of the combination of things cooking in the kitchen, it smelled a bit like my grandmother's house, this prompted us to head out to the patio decorated with very heavy wooden furniture. I suppose this is to discourage thieves from selling their tables and chairs on the black market. The pipeline music selection that evening was a bit compensating. Wham and Depeche Mode, I assume George Michael and David are British, indeed, Wikipedia has just informed me that Dave Than Born May, in Upping Essex, England, is the baritone singer of the English electronic group Depeche Mode and is also an accomplished solo artist. Now I feel better. the British expats in the valley are very happy, I'll probably come back to try the food at some point but for another round of drinks I think I'll wait until a Friday or Saturday night when things get going

yes I am a vegetarian and I am reviewing a steakhouse, although I have eaten their steaks they prove that their spinach salad is very good and filled with goodies such as goat cheese, dried cranberries, pecans and mandarin oranges and it is just a miserable person. I ordered the trio of sides which included mushrooms, steamed asparagus and sweet potato fries. vegetables

our group was not happy with the quality of the seared tuna salad everything was low quality and just not tasty and the quality of the velveeta grilled cheese sliders the cuban sandwich was pretty good but not enough to make us want to go back for more on the good side our server was really nice and sitting outside was very nice and breezy hope the food improves

I don't usually complain about bad food, but the fish and chips gave my wife a serious case of food poisoning. If a manager is reading this, please check your fish supply or change the cooking oil. She never gets sick and was sick all day in December because of the December meal.
well i just wasted money, never again

I ordered the chicken enchiladas when they arrived, there were tiny enchiladas with an ounce of cheese inside the soggy tortillas and the part with chicken apparently meant a few pieces of chicken would be thrown on top. I was so disappointed but hungry so I ate it, the guacamole was really disappointing too, I don't think we will go back.

Durant has this dark musty old mafia I love the atmosphere and charm, we mostly sit at the bar but we dined at happy hour the specials are good and we threw a few in here to have some good chats and enjoy the atmosphere now for the bad. prices from this point of view, however, if they want to stay in the game they also need to keep the food up to star level and for relaxed ambiance, throwback feel and great drinks, one star for food and food prices but a major landmark in Phoenix so please check it out, we never know how long these staples will be around, I would recommend just going for a drink and maybe sharing a aperitif, this ignites the romantic mood and will leave you reflecting on those good old days

hire a waiter, I had to say it, I had to take these photos, this is my third visit since I updated with the same result and I can no longer keep it to myself the staff is neglecting the dining room period. Customers often have to move dirty plates, stacking them on another table's trays just to get seated. My recommendation to the owners is to install trash cans like every other place in Eastwood self bus and have us do it if you don't. I have to wonder what happens to all these half-filled salsas. are squirt bottles left on tables unrefrigerated for so long refilled and put back into service or are they emptied and washed before refilling? I sincerely hope that very soon I will be able to update this review again and say that things are back to normal by then I must advise you to drive a little further south to my patio or north to Sylvia la Canasta.
this place is overpriced and the service is terrible. I went there with my friends and the waiter was very rude and degrading.

the manager of this place is a pretentious jerk he is condescending and immature i will never come back to this place or recommend it the food is delicious the ambiance is sophisticated but the crowd is lame and the management is even worse spend your evening and your money elsewhere
it doesn't matter, it has nothing to do with San Francisco food

ok I'm very surprised by the reviews here I'm not one to want to write negative reviews but our food was so bad I couldn't help it maybe this place had a night off tonight but their pizza barely had any cheese on it and the crust was soggy unfortunately the pizza was better than the wings which were over breaded and soggy too thank goodness we had a group and didn't have to pay full price we won't order from here again disappointing sad

I've only eaten the buffet here and it was good but nothing special to be honest, most Indian buffets are quite similar, it's only when you order from the menu that you see if the restaurant is truly remarkable, so I'll update this review when I've been there for dinner.

I hate to give this place one star but my recent experiences have been horrible. I used to dine at this restaurant often with my family, the more we went, the more we went, the service got worse, our water cups never got refilled the last time I was there. be back

ugh, a minute wait greeted us before anyone acknowledged our presence, we were offered free champagne in consideration of who drinks champagne, we were allowed to order wine before hearing about the chef's feast which offers a wine pairing which is stupid, we ordered a head cheese plate, it had head cheese in it, hmm overpriced and overrated a few minutes later our salads arrived, the salads were ok and unfortunately the highlight of the meal a few minutes later our main course came overcooked, uneventful, lame I can't drink alcohol and ordered water twice I went without water for long periods both times I was forced to ask for water there were no towels in the unisex bathroom it's no fun drying your hands with toilet paper the best part was saved for the last quiescence automatically adds a tip which is ok assuming the service is at least adequate it was no further as our waiter lowered the bill he explained that this was going to the house and anything we could add although not required is most appreciated eg why does the house need a service charge with the wonderful markups they charge for their normal catering service and why do they put their staff in this position of shaking down their customers for tips even though it is a very pleasant and calming setting I found myself at wanting to leave after the first happy food service and the accessories were just awful, stay away you will spend your money on much better almost everywhere else
unprofessional, disorganized and extremely low-end care

I think I would have liked the food if I had actually eaten it was seated quickly which was good given an excellent reserved table on an open table so I was surprised the salads arrived quickly but I immediately noticed my lettuce wasn't washed but no waiter could be sent away a little later. the food was sent back and we were given our bill for our drinks what they wasted an hour of my time serving me cold food only to deposit a check for my drinks I would not have had the second glass of wine if the food had arrived in a timely manner I would go to Houston better food and quality wait staff management

I so wish you could do stars, I would give it a good Chinese style in Nyx, if you have lived in or around New York you will totally understand that I love the fried dumplings, they are so good, I highly recommend them, the pork women are good for take out for sure, it's not really a place to sit and eat, you can do that, but it is more suitable for take out.

I know I might get criticized for only giving this place stars but it's really no different than change if I could give half stars I would give it a why because I think it's better than change it's exactly the same menu just not as diverse but cheaper if you're at this place try totes instead I bet you'll start going there more often than here

again yuck and in this Barnes Noble bookstore it sucks to sit and relax and try to read, I know it's not a library and I don't expect it to be but come on you can at least feel like you're trying to keep the noise level down and have comfy seats and yeah the people here are disgusting they had chairs to relax in and they were in all their grossness and they were reading books magazines of all things to buy it and go home and let your kids go cartwheels there, so those of us who actually I imagine the waiters think part of their job is to do a drum solo every time they dump the ground coffee into the trash can, which was about every minute. Luckily I had my iPod, it was exploding and I could still hear them banging, it wasn't a very clean place either. I was going to ask if they had a wife but I just took it out of there, instead this place is small too and their book selection is limited, I was looking for a place to go to read, work and drink coffee in my area, arrowhead and this one is definitely crossed off my list, come here to try and find a book, but don't expect to relax and enjoy your novel or whatever if you like people watching, although it might be at you, there are all kinds here ps and i left my coffee cup far away in this shitty place like i would go back and get it, i think i would burn it first, too bad
way too expensive for a hot dog, it's confusing to eat there too, unless you speak Spanish last time I checked I wasn't in Mexico

my wife and I were downtown with friends and decided to check this place out. I ordered a pasta lunch and chose penne all campagna and another penne with tomatoes and mozzarella. For me it was just ok, the food was just ok, rather bland and a bit overpriced. I grabbed a small slice of pepperoni pizza from one of the kids at our table which was actually the best part of my meal.

this review is for the chain in general, the place we went to is new so it's not in yelp yet once it is i will put this review there too, we were there on friday at 5pm, the reason i gave it stars is because the burger was very good and it was done as i asked, my husband's burger was not but the waiter and fries left a lot to be desired, let me start by saying that we had been to several other places, i like my fries crispy, i ask for them well cooked extra crispy burnt tortured hollow tubes, whatever their buzz word is for well done, the location will conform to all the other guys but not tatum's and she said the company said they shouldn't cook the fries that way so if we had to put up with soggy fries, yes soggy, then we didn't want them, she also interrupted us several times which is rude then she went to call the company just to check for us and she came to the table and said they weren't supposed to cook them that way seriously we didn't ask her to do that she actually accused us of being undercover buyers we started to say something then again she interrupted your listening if you explain that our choice is not the way the company wants to present their product and that we always choose to have them in a different way, you must comply, it is after all our money and our decision. go to Paradise Valley Burger Company across the street and Bell, you won't be disappointed

best in Phoenix I hope I'm not fooling you now what I had was pretty good but it's about right here is what I tasted and thought the tasty pulled pork sauce was ok not fabulous the meat was good quality and was cooked appropriately the pulled sliced beef my meat had been a good cut but was dried out and a little tough again the sauce was just ok tasty beef ribs the great meat sauce was again ok the mac and cheese the most disappointing item of the meal tasted like kraft on the box of greens it was the best part of my meal cooked appropriately and spiced very well, the banana pudding was partially frozen and watery, the biscuits were soggy watery mush, the first refill on the sweet tea was pennies then you have to buy a new cup if you want more we already pay extra for everything and you are going to cheat us on the refills of drinks honestly there is absolutely no reason for me to go back, I don't know if this place had exceptional q and now only serves this mediocre stuff and it's raining in the dough or it's pretty disappointing and I wasn't even the one paying

what a crap airline if I could give them zero stars I would fly from Phoenix to Denver to New Orleans the gate screening staff and flight attendants were rude and abrupt the flights all left at least a few minutes late it was the worst flying experience I have had I was lucky that my return from Denver to Phoenix was nous Airways I never thought I would say thank you nous Airways for at least that part of the flight not being a nightmare I wouldn't will never fly United again

drunk people go here the service is good depending on who you get the burger according to a ark b can't taste his burger when ask the waiter how come my friend ark b can't taste his burger why you had to be there to laugh what a fun night don't order the pancakes they aren't very good the chicken strips were requested

a family was in town and are blackjack fanatics desperate to watch the game, this was the only place in the east valley we could find with the crappy ice pack in the center, although the girl who answered the phone had to ask someone else what sucked not only were they kind enough to put the game on, they put it on a flat screen in the corner of the patio and we were able to get sound on it shoots, it scores, the shepherd's pie was good, the beer was cold and the waitress was very attentive, I will stick with it because or the basic pub for draws, although there were lots of TVs, most of them were small old tube TVs, my uncle asked why they didn't show the score of a basketball game and I told him it was just cut off by the screen of the old TV

It was an interesting way to spend an hour, lots of exhibits but very dusty inside the display cases, quiet and peaceful, a nice place to spend a while. I arrived a few minutes before closing and she didn't charge me but I donated as they operate on donations only. The table set with rocks and minerals was fun to check out.

so Chase Field you get stars, here are the issues I have with the venue or cons so to speak, money only almost anywhere for a stadium named after a bank, don't you think anyone would have taken the financial practices into greater concern, maybe Chase just wants to suck you in more by making you pay their fees if you aren't a member, which I consider a greedy fat cat, there are no real options when it comes to regular park food ball, the kids are a joke and on the money, they don't even offer peppers and onions, strange that it shows it in the menu picture other than that, it's just another typical, let's capitalize everything we can with your typical crappy Friday panda express chains and that I find pretty disgusting, the beer value is okay when does a beer have a dollar value, I mean seriously, considering I just paid dollars for a kid which is pretty pathetic at least like the decency of having a good size beer to help wash down the boiled piss Frank I just overpaid for to sum up the value of the beer is tiny and the only limo worth buying is the ounce in dollars or even better the corona ha here are the pros a damn good deal on the price of seats we sat in the lower level outfield section for dollars one person not too shabby the stadium is pretty nice for a stadium who is there is a pool in the outfield cool idea parking is pretty cheap and never seemed to be a problem traffic control before and after games is surprisingly smooth overall stars i just think they need more originality instead of what Joe Bipack wants while charging him Paris Hilton prices

wanting to purge my guilt from constantly requiring one of my suburban friends to come downtown every time we go out I recently dragged another cento friend to the suburbs so we could visit him in his homeland because once San Tan Brewery was our chosen destination I will one day come back here no unless the guilt consumes me again if I lived in Chandler I'm sure what choice would I have food an Aegean stuffed burger with fries was good the beer was even better the service was annoyingly slow due to understanding or inattention the crowd was large and the place was packed when we arrived but on a Friday night it was completely empty

considering what is considered the standard for workout facilities this place is way behind the times, this place would be amazing as then it would be considered clean, tidy and cutting edge. There are some real perks about this place, they have daycare and lots of mirrors so I can watch my fat move while I run on the treadmill. gutted and totally renovated, you just feel an unpleasant humidity when you walk in the door which only gets worse the longer you are there and it's even worse during the summer, the guys always have the weight benches dominated, there is never any availability for machines of any kind from the afternoon onwards and then it starts to clear up bla la la bla considering it's the Baltimore location, a huge disappointment

agree with most posters about the setup left a lot to be desired I was smart and arrived before the afternoon so I could jump in early for a few short and quick lines, my son told me he was with me and he is quite a picky eater, that was one of the reasons I brought him along so he could see there are other foods he might like if he tried them. the trucks deliver the samples faster, I don't know how maybe get them an extra staff member but the samples on some trucks were coming slowly so need to improve a better location, maybe not on land and maybe a bit bigger once the lines reached the people, travel was cramped and it took a long time to get your samples, maybe a lower price for tickets seemed a bit high for the amount of food each person was getting in Overall, I enjoyed the food but the rest of the logistics not so much

not a big fan of lee lee's bob tea house I like their very trendy decor but their milk tea mix wasn't great it was like basic sugar water I've had better ones in lollipops or quickly at the it's quite a busy place as it's next to lee lees but unfortunately they're certainly not there yet with the competition
stopped for some macaroons and a coffee, food and coffee was ok, the place itself was a bit dirty, spots on the floor saw a few flies and sat on an uneven chair

new and big yes but not my favorite stars spring training park for being big and roomy and also lots of grass in the stars outfield for being almost like a major league park it feels like you are at a crowd regular season game they lost the small spring training feel and intimacy of the stars for being the only cactus league park I visited this spring not allowing you to bring food like candy, peanuts or sunflower seeds, you realize why when you see the expensive beer and food vendors inside

so I'm not a big fan of Chinese food but my husband, truth be told, it usually makes me sick, but if I had to go to Chinese food dragon palace this would be one of the places I would go, the food is decent and there's a lot of it. I'm not sure I would make a long drive to the Dragon Palace as chances are you have a comparable Chinese food restaurant nearby but if you live in the th and third ward it's definitely a Chinese food place worth trying as far as the food we ordered the Beijing dinner for which came with wonton soup a pu pu platter consisting of won tons yum sign up a small fried shrimp a beef skewer glazed and honey chicken Peking fried rice fried rice with shrimp chicken pork and beef Mongolian beef and the homemade chicken as an aside and a disclaimer, I prefer it at the moment and have developed a severe aversion to chicken which means I of course hated chicken dishes, my husband thought it was okay, I really liked the wonton soup and Peking fried rice after dinner, we had the requisite fortune cookie, express yourself now what and a really delicious banana wrapped in a won ton and fried with sugar glaze, overall it was a good time at a very good Chinese food restaurant

don't go here, one of the worst restaurant experiences I've ever had, the setup is a bit like Pei Wei where they take your order, give you a number and bring the food to your table, placed our order and had to hunt down other tables and fly past people eating trying to wait to get a table waited a long time while others who ordered after us found seats and got their food before us. I finally found a table then continued to wait and wait for our food which the manager claimed he made them redo because it was cold, my food arrived and it was cold and disgusting, we had to go because we were going to a show and my mom's food still wasn't there. The staff asked to see his receipt because they couldn't find his order. cash and we left, my mom never even ate and my food was horrible, I would not recommend this place, it's horrible

I honestly don't understand, I went to dos gringos with a good friend last weekend, I had never been to Phoenix before so I was excited to see what the city had to offer after walking into dos gringos we sat at our table for a few minutes before a waitress came to our table, she brought us beers and never came back after a few minutes we decided to visit a new bar as we obviously weren't welcome on the backs of gringos, so we went up to the bar where I waited a few minutes so the bartender could get some. pictures and pictures with his friends what I didn't understand was that maybe there were only people there and at least people working if I was the owner or manager I would be embarrassed to say that you run this establishment I will never come back and I highly recommend you stay away from dos gringos because you will be disappointed

I went here on Wednesday to take advantage of the certificate, it was very busy which probably shouldn't have been a shock place so I had to wait a while but that's the risk of not getting proper bookings. Anyway, I spent some time at the bar, which was nice. believe the other rolls were $$ at worst they also have appetizers not of this type there once we got a table we were matched with another group which was actually a pleasant experience as I like the communal type seating given if you have a small group and aren't a fan of eating with strangers this may not please many as it's a place I always consider more of a show so the food will start with this first show was eh they do some knife play stuff and a few things here and there but honestly it wasn't that exciting like the other place I was samurai at, the chef was friendly though and the waiter was friendly so that's a plus otherwise I was a little disappointed with the show part of the meal as for the food I got the filet mignon and the lobster tail the filet was supposed to be average but came out more average in my opinion it was slightly seasoned, leaving mostly beef flavor then everything else now it had a nice beef flavor so in no way complaining like a little more seasoning personally the lobster tail was nice buttery from the butter but more importantly it's nice and sweet with other lobster tails I can't really tell you because I don't eat them a lot of students don't exactly have that kind of money you know but still a times I thought it was good, it wasn't fishy and nice and sweet at the end it came with a choice of ice cream. take a photo which they give you with a code that you can access for several days. I think for downloading it, which is a good idea for the price, I really wouldn't go unless I had the certificate, but I would go back for happy hour, probably my favorite thing of the whole night.
order was supposed to be ready min aglet, still waiting, not even busy

We have been using Elias cleaners for almost three years now and for the most part we have found the experience to be very good. Yes, like most cleaners, they make blunders from time to time, like sometimes killing the buttons on my dress shirts, but here's the difference, they will fix them for free. Yes, just ask the staff, they are very helpful.

as far as basic burgers go it's an ok option the flavor is ok and the basic toppings give everyone enough choice, better than McDonald's yeah and similar to the starter but nothing really special the price isn't cheap for a burger so I would expect a bit more but not more fries as they give you a bucket full and more

my husband and I were planning to go here and see if it was anything like Hong Kong fine dining, so yesterday for lunch we decided to try a huge mistake, the food was literally inedible, everything was either too cold or burnt, nothing tasted good, we decided to try the desert and the cream puff, I don't know how you can ruin everything, was petrified and the cream was so disgusting I spit it out, the smell of the flan actually made us vomit, we had such a horrible time that I complained to the manager, she didn't even seem to care and gave us lunch that we didn't even eat, we were disgusted by this place and will never go back, don't do it, you will regret it

I came back here after a year away, I understand they have had a change in management, some for the better, some for the worse, new general manager and now the service seems much more friendly and efficient, new chef and now the food is slow to arrive and not as good as before. The steak was charred, the mashed potatoes were lukewarm, it took several minutes for our food to arrive, I hope it was just an off night for the kitchen, but the overall impression was that they lost attention to the small details.

a nice place in the land center but went down hill from a previous visit good house wine near the carafe we had the French merlot food quality very inconsistent I had the spinach and frisbee salad the poached egg was overcooked so no yolk to add very dry salad not enough bacon grease to wilt the salad properly an average quality lamb shank with no evidence of the olives and other seasonings promised my friends the filet of beef was ordered medium rare and served me fine rather dry, they refused to substitute it for the Brussels sprouts, the waiter came back and said they could do that after all the soulless deserts were ordered by two diners, both were dry and flavorless, they need to pay more attention to the cooking overall, a very average experience at an above average price
your typical Tempe boozatorium, it has a generic and unforgettable name probably because the name describes everything about this place if you walk around there you won't remember much more than that

I'll start with our experience from the moment we walked in, the customers sitting in the restaurant looked and some laughed, I guess we missed the one white sign on the front door but my husband and I like to try new things and don't care what people think, the hostess was nice and pleasant though. was awesome, not too sweet, not too salty and the meatloaf was refreshing, my husband also enjoyed his filet and fries, it was seasoned perfectly, the lean is if you don't mind being treated like the th amendment was never signed by Murphy's customers and you want great German food, this is the place to go, the staff here was great though

first of all I have to say you can't beat the price here come on now but I didn't really like the food itself I mean it was ok but I don't need to drive minutes just to be able to come here for lunch we are in the area and yelp showed us the spring roll wasn't super fresh but it wasn't fresh either hard to explain but I definitely wouldn't find it here and the peanut sauce was actually not good at all. the flavor was good, I definitely think the place is good enough to try but when we are in the area which is not often we will find another place to try the price and decent food you will enjoy

I read quite a few reviews on yelp before checking this place out with a group of about we arrived and the table wasn't ready yet we ordered a variety of cocktails off the menu, mixed drinks, beer and wine. I always had a street beer a good choice. more stern, our waitress was cool, she put up with a lot of conversations in our group, sometimes loud and not paying attention. I would go again but most likely for lunch, hope you get the same meal for a few dollars less. By the way, I had the pasta with rib eye steaks in it, forgot the name and my wife had the carbonari, they were both good.

if we could give stars i would ask to give, i live nearby and am sad to see that a coffeeshop that sells such terrible coffee is still in business in my neighborhood, not only was the breve mocha i ordered disgusting, as was the process of watching the batista prepare my drink, they use hershey chocolate from a dirty nacho style pump with chocolate sauce dripping down the sides and coagulated in a thick cap at the end of the nozzle, disgusting, the espresso shot was made with no care or concern that it was made way too quickly and with espresso grounds that were ground long before I walked in the door, possibly long before the batista started her shift, it's disgusting and finally the milk, she steamed the milk with the auto steam wand, this was a huge red flag, they are notorious for burning milk and making disgusting drinks well, the two were accomplished, the steam wand was stained white from lack of cleaning and the worst was near the end of the wand there was a black cheese that had built up from burning milk and not cleaning the wand after each use which is freaking disgusting, I wasted money on an overpriced small mocha and threw it away after taking a sip. Hundreds of businesses in the area close every year and there are more real estate signs in the malls in this neighborhood than actual storefronts and I really don't understand why this place hasn't joined the many defunct businesses and starry-eyed entrepreneurs in the unemployment queue if you own a coffee shop, coffee should be your passion if you own a bait shop, fishing should be your passion if you just want to open a business that reflects a popular chain nearby, short and tall, please stop wasting space in the mall and get a day job in a cubicle never coming back warning my friends about this place and I will probably contact the health department on Monday

disclaimer, I'm a Thai and a connoisseur of Thai food, it's extremely average Thai food and overpriced for white people to enjoy, sorry to be frank, but that's all you get in a real Thai restaurant. The spring rolls were very bland and only came with a tiny bit of sauce for dipping. skip it again, it's what we would call a Thai tourist in Thailand, small portions, good friendly staff if you're looking for authentic Thai try one of those pale crowns tum na thai or royal thai grill

Mulligans is that place in Scottsdale you don't think to go to when you want to dance, that's mainly why I go out in Scottsdale at night but I always end up there before or after my dancing outings. I love the atmosphere of Mulligans. you feel at home, mulligans kind of have that dive bar feel but don't make you feel like you might get mugged and stabbed in the eye

my niece wants to go here for her birthday on a Friday night the wait was about minutes the onion flower wasn't as crisp as I remembered but still pretty good its horseradish sauce was stronger than I expected I had to ask for a side of ketchup my steak was cooked as ordered medium rare but lacked flavor somehow the lobster tail was grilled right my niece's steak was overcooked my daughter's steak was like she liked it medium rare for dessert we shared a gigantic scoop of ice cream cream and whipped cream and an oreo waffle with more ice cream and whipped cream we couldn't finish the service was good our waitress was very friendly

these are not real French treats, I'm surprised some reviewers say they went to Paris, first of all, these are not macarons, they are Jewish coconut cookies, they are macaroni a o and they are the most amateurish macaroni I have seen. Buttercream like you use for cupcakes, the chocolate croissant was okay so I'll add a star for that.

it's baba fresh, what can I say, it's clean, they're fast and it's way better than McDonald's. I usually call in my lunch order from work and it's almost always ready and waiting when I arrive to pick it up. I have to say their pick de gallo is excellent and I could probably live on that for the rest of my life, I get extra cups of it and eat it all by itself.

beautiful church my husband and I were registered members and regularly attended mass here fr john the author gives excellent homilies the Marian gift shop has lovely religious gifts we were married in this church but unfortunately we had a bad experience the communication with the church staff was poor and we received little support during the stressful planning period we have since moved to Gilbert so now we attend St Agnes

and i went here this morning for breakfast after finding it on yelp i thought it sounded good and i love trying new places so we went the place was busy we almost left because there was no parking left luckily we did one more pass and someone was just walking to their car to leave there was a bit of a wait but not bad so the inside of this place is really cute with the wood paneling and all we had a nice little stand, we both ordered coffee which was very me, really watered down coffee and cost a cup for breakfast I ordered the spanish omelette and got biscuits and gravy, the omelette was really good, it had some sort of spicy sauce on it which was tasty and I added cheddar which went really well with the sauce, the potatoes that came with it were nothing special, not real flavor, it also came with toast, that was what it cost, he liked his b but thought it was a little salty, it cost about with bacon overall, I say the place was good but not great for the I spent after tip, I could have gone to liberty market which is much much better so I probably wouldn't stay here again

parking is my problem with this place why does a customer have to pay every time we park in the garage if you move in and out three times it's for parking yes my company was paying but it was just stupid and I wouldn't make my company pay for it again. I have been to Phoenix twice since and avoided this place and stayed at the much better Marriott.

the grand one was just ok in my opinion, I met some friends there for happy hour on a Friday night and it was packed, we got the drink specials and all the food we tried was just ok, the atmosphere was your standard fashionable clothing market.

this place sucks, it really doesn't deserve any stars, you can only like this place if you don't know anything about Vietnamese food, which I tried, the tint bun broth doesn't even taste like spicy tint bun, but has no flavor. galore, not even a hint of anise star in the broth, how can you specialize in that if you can't even make the broth taste right, the service stinks, I hate when the waiter holds the bowl in such a way that his thumb is inside the bowl while he serves it, the guy never refills the water, ask how things were going and the vegetable platter wasn't fresh the bean sprouts were starting to turn brown if you can't cook something, why even bother serving it to customers, I don't know what other dishes they offer, but I won't come back to find out this has to be one of the worst Vietnamese restaurants in the valley, check out my long list of Vietnamese restaurants for suggestions of better restaurants

cool atmosphere very relaxed environment good prices on beers but all I can say the waiter was pretty awful, didn't continually check back with us and wasn't friendly, we were among us and we were ordering food at the start and the orders came within minutes of each other. I think that would be the thing they would be proud of, but not that night, the rest of our group ordered food and these two orders came out at different times, almost minutes apart and one order was just a side of fries. It's a good atmosphere for drinking and a cool place to relax but I wouldn't expect great service and great food.

Bite Mamas is not my mom, my mom wouldn't have made her hungry son wait forever, she wouldn't have let me leave thirsty without refills, she makes a good bowl of salsa, so it's okay, I took my real mom there for lunch. eat the shell she's old school made a damn good cheese enchilada and the beans were tried again with the red chile I swear no one except canasta can make red chile while the meat was tender and the sauce was smooth it had a weird orange color and the meat tasted good wasn't beef I ever had on the way to the counter to pay my bill. I noticed that almost everyone was eating chimichangas well, so it looks like I ordered the wrong thing. and mom will be just fine

good service the waitress was friendly but the food was just disgusting and the place smelled like sewer pipes I had a glass of wine there was no way I was ordering a cocktail while she was tearing down the bar I didn't feel good after eating the food I had a coupon so that made the total bill cheap but I would have left if I had to pay full price because the atmosphere they are bragging about should offer better food no not good don't go there not

I wouldn't go here actually, I considered attending AI of Phoenix for a graphic design degree and decided it wasn't the path I needed or wanted. The decision came, but after a few months of trying to sort things out with them, I applied. I met with a guidance counselor. degree, I was looking to combine my past experience with a design degree to enhance my career, I also realized that I was not willing to work with professional students, they did not take into account your work schedule as much as they should, especially if they wanted to appear accommodating and understanding to students who are really committed to going to a real case in order to get the request to only take credit hours per semester. the classes are stupid and I didn't like being treated like an idiot, I mean do I have to tell you over and over again that I already have a degree and I know what to expect when it comes to paperwork and financial aid, can't you see I'm annoyed by a yearly who can't use a computer to tell me what my cost per semester would be can't you tell I'm upset when I let it be known that I'm on lunch break and I'm told I'll have another hour until we're done, I don't like anyone wasting my time, that's true. I can be impatient but this was ridiculous, that's when I decided this place wasn't for me, I heard good things about it but people who went here told me I could have gotten a comparable degree and built a better portfolio elsewhere.

ok, I loved this place so much during my visit last year that I planned my best birthday party here in August this year. I flew specifically for this event. There were some of us at 1pm called to put our name on the list a few hours before because they were so disorganized it was horrible. food wise the hibachi popper was by far my favorite the huge disappointment other than the horrible service in the first few hours was the elimination of the pb jelly roll it was the only reason I chose this place and they don't have it anymore if I didn't have shots I would have been furious the management was kind enough to take a few shots off our bill for the chaos we had endured it was appreciated overall we had a great time even if it took forever to get here

terrible experience here, they cut my foot trying to remove a callus and they also told me they used shellac when it was really delicious, I wish I could recommend it but I wouldn't want anyone else to have the same experience

we were here for a weekend during spring training and St. Patrick's Day, good location walking distance to Scottsdale Rd and also comfy camel beds and friendly front desk. The only issue we had a handicapped room I'm sure is ADA compliant and that's great but having an open shower in the bathroom that has slippery tiles can create a safety issue with slips and falls since there is a drain that isn't raised so we had to lay towels on the floor that were soaked with water when we showered next time I would like to stay in a handicapped room reduced also on weekends, try to extend breakfast hours beyond please
not a company to do business with in my experience
the veggie burger is fantastic, make sure to ask to try all the different aioli sauces, especially with little ones

it's a shame that their menu only contains sandwiches. The food was good, although it left a lot to be desired. It came on a plate with a few olives and nothing else. I was expecting more for the price, they advertise themselves as a sandwich shop, but I don't buy it anymore, so it was a hipster hangout where it seems people are going to look cool considering the few items they had were pretty good, but I was just expecting a good turkey sandwich, but that wasn't happening. The service was on the verge of being incompetent, but the owner made it happen. pass by with a loaf of bread too bad we had to ask for oil at the counter to dip it in our waitress was absent, their water was nasty and they didn't have lemon-lime-orange or anything to make it a little less offensive. my friends who live in Phoenix have told me that's just the way it is there, overall I definitely won't rush into it but there is a lot of room for positive improvement
The only reason I'm a star is because I was arrested here for underage drinking years ago. I'm blaming the Diamondbacks for no legitimate reason.

I have been to this place twice and had both extremes the good shannon california bar michelle managers customer service the bad fried calamari our last waiters are breathing first visit to this establishment was our meeting with shannon shannon was a pure delight as our waitress made our first visit absolutely fun my wife had a titanium dish which she wasn't really in love with but I had the california sea bass and it was very good in fact it was so good that I regretted not getting a glass of chardonnay to accompany it, the fish had a very pleasant texture and taste. Our second visit was our first encounter with the fried calamari, as our guest so eloquently said if it was my first impression of fried calamari I would not have liked the calamari to be overcooked and there was so much oil leaking onto the plate that we brought this to Michelle's attention and she agreed that the dish was not prepared properly, she gave us a coupon to come back there and eating at any time however our waiter's breath was a different story every time he spoke I could smell his pungency, believe me much better than I really meant, breathing to the point I almost put on a gas mask, there are very few things that would make me lose my appetite, his smelly breath and the squid with more grease than a lubricant in a jiffy accomplished the feat

with airlines, by far my worst experience on a flight is excellent on the following US airlines. For our most recent vacation, we were shipped quickly and efficiently to the Turks and Calicos. Our flight was canceled due to a mechanical problem, but we then spent an extra night at the Beaches Resort. hand and hand en route with or more airlines, unless you are in first class you are nobody

Personally, I like other crackers so much more. I think this is the best customer service. I'm never really impressed with the services here. It's either okay or a little below expectations. Something always happens when I come here, something is forgotten or the wait is ridiculous just for the check to be picked up or paid or something I can never tell you because it always changes food. the pan with caritas eggs and potatoes this time it had chorizo in it so it made my potatoes soggy, sad, these things are another reason for the lost stars and also because I don't care about chorizo and all its oils for food and serving, it's unusual but it happened so I always remember if you want the best you have to go to the best and this place is not the one in mesa behind Home Depot and next to Holiday Inn

this place was pretty cool we first got there on a saturday night the place was dead but that's to be expected for a nightclub the drinks are expensive but tasty the decor is amazing the couches are comfy and there is just enough seating without it going over the joint we ended up leaving after one drink and came back a few hours later and the place was busy busy busy they had good music and the dance floor was full one downside is i hate when you go to a bar and the bathroom has an attendant who you have to tip, they hold everything you need from soap and paper towels. I think I shouldn't feel obligated to tip someone because I wanted to wash my hands after using the bathroom. Overall the place was ok. I'm new to town and I'm sure there are better places to have a drink. I will probably return in the future, but I am in no rush to do so.

ugh, I've never been to a waffle house, but my southern friends who frequent them a lot at home convinced me to try it for a late night. The food is just mediocre and stays hard in your belly. All I ordered was waffles and I was not impressed. I like that they're open late, so I won't throw the baby out with the bathwater. baby

this is going to be brutal hide kids if you have been to chipotle you will feel right at home at the quota until you start eating a complete and utter rip off of the concept except for the part that matters the execution where chipotle passes the quota fails miserably the ingredients are orders of magnitude crappier the burritos are just plain bad my burrito was loaded with rice and beans and very little meat basically the opposite of what you will get at the other place on top of that the rice and beans sucked and if you know you know he likes his beans but that's not all they're good for it's a huge bean fart shortly after ingesting that shit if you want to know the root cause of this debacle check out who the parent company is it's Jack in crack pretty much explains it all avoid at all costs gets breaks the dreaded exam the aerostat is rounded to because yapping does not allow a zero

well I guess the bar is much lower in Flagstaff so we went to their restaurant in Glendale for breakfast it was less than mediocre starting with the coffee which tasted horrible was very bitter and watching the waitress pour old decaf coffee into a regular coffee maker unacceptable. I had bacon and eggs. chicken fried steak with gravy you could have covered a house in gravy as you can see we won't be back. The reason we went was because of their article in the paper this week, it just goes to show that you can't believe everything you read. My husband jokingly suggested we cancel the paper.

why review a fast food chain for me, this particular Sonic is close to where I work because there aren't many options when I'm pressed for time, I'm able to walk or drive here and grab a quick bite like most fast food chains, it's all about consistency knowing what you're going to get and getting it quickly, that's what this Sonic location does well and can pass up the hot and crispy Tater Tots stars because that in principle I think this is what any fast food establishment can reasonably expect

I had dinner there the other day again, I love the design and ambiance, the service was good but the food is not worth what they charge to start with the kids option. I ordered the pasta with marinara sauce which the server told me would have short noodles for easy scooping by a small child. a crispy sand experience, then we shared the corn flatbread which looked and tasted like airport food, we decided to leave and received our check for what we paid so much for, it was a big disappointment, they didn't even take the people's kids pasta dish really, I won't go back unless it's for the drinks, only the two stars are for the design location and decent service, the food deserves one

middle of the road food, staff are rude, seems like it starts with the owner, i think she makes the staff pay for everything that goes wrong so in turn they don't want to fix the problems with bad food and i think she tends to forget that the customers are actually what keeps a business open for a long time, this was the only choice in the area now, there are several choices if you are in the area, chilis or convoys are much better in my opinion

It pains me to say that it's fun due to the fact that I love the local businesses in my neighborhood and I fully support them, but here's another restaurant that I wish was better. yalu upon entering I noticed the decor was another warehouse like restaurant trying to be modern it's not neon lights under the bar to wood paneling to tin like tables chairs and bar stools this has been done several times I wish it had more character a little more distinctive we are in the arts district I don't want to walk into a restaurant that looks like the ones already open in the same area pretty good with the fact that the artist in me is rambling again sorry to go back to the food review the menu for me was a little confusing for being a sushi restaurant there was so much other stuff also mostly star dishes I decided to stick with it I came here to try sushi I ordered a squid salad to start I shouldn't have ordered that to start the salad was so salty and it was drowning in dressing bad start then I ordered some dashiki including saba sweet shrimp and of course my favorite too I was a little disappointed they didn't have union can't you have uni savant bad foul tasting sweet shrimp toroc couldn't even bite through a good joint must have fresh hook sushi must be executed by a sushi chef with good knife skills it's that simple as when your fish is not that fresh and slicing techniques fish from your sushi chef are not there, you have a losing combo, my friend out of frustration asked the chef to bring us something out. mushy drinks prepared beers infused vodkas prepared cocktails good points nice staff cool teapots and clean toilets overall I guess I was hoping for a more innovative and creative sushi restaurant with equally good skills to execute maybe I'm being too harsh or maybe I'm just saying how it visa I left the restaurant I felt like I've been to a sushi restaurant like that so many times before I hope they succeed with less judgmental customers unlike me, good luck

what happened to the coffee plantation? I have been out of the valley since yes and the coffee plantation has always been a very good place for baked goods and sure enough the coffee shop when I last visited the store was dirty the entire menu was gone and the coffee was burnt. I went to Baltimore and, alas, that place was gone. Where did my old coffee plantation go?

remember how I said the quiz was the best thing about this place, well they got rid of the long time host Dave who was introduced back in his college days and was the best thing about the quiz with no waves personality, this place is not enough, he will never come back here again, too bad

While the idea is not new, an updated outdoor shopping center that mimics a European open-air commercial and residential district on common ground is similar to West Village in Dallas or Santa Clara Row in Santa Clara, California, but in the Scottsdale version it is completely stripped of any personality and design, perhaps to better blend in with the desert environment. A trip to this slightly more interesting center Parking can be difficult, but there are lots lining the back of the center as well as a valet parking lot in front of the central park that people watching is quite entertaining, from children frolicking in the fountains to desert Barbie siblings. The independent dining options are a bit more interesting, like the Green House and Zinc Bistro, although again the usual unimaginative chains are represented here, including Change's and the Cheesecake Factory, while I don't find most of Overland Commons' retail offerings particularly compelling to make several repeat visits, I'll return for the more independent dining options

I went there last week for the first and last time, read the good reviews so was expecting a lot more. I am a first generation American, both my parents were German and came to their country. I lived there for a few years, have eaten German food my whole life, and have been to many German restaurants in many different states over the years. the waitress came she would forget the things we asked her the waitress didn't understand german as in the german menu options so i ordered from the menu using the english translations and she was still confused i had to show the options yes there is definitely cucumber salad on the menu the bread was stale the schnitzel was hard there was a hair in my cucumber salad and my potato pancakes were just disgusting they also gave me fries instead of the usual sides, I guess they just reheated leftovers from dinner the night before because that was exactly what it tasted like and in fact I was charged the wrong prices like the lunch salad but showed up on my bill because I was too frustrated to even talk about it and just left disappointed, waste of time and money.
this is my favorite Vietnamese restaurant, it's small but clean, their soups are great, they serve fresh and tasty food, the portion is not big enough for me, although I wish they served bigger meals

so i was meeting some friends here last night for drinks for a friend's birthday where we were supposed to meet but it was about when we got to the bar we walked in and had our IDs checked then stood awkwardly i don't know why this happened but after a few minutes we were asked if we needed a table yes thats why we are here so we were seated near the bar the place is big and the decor is good but the music they played was mostly from the years and made the place less hip, I guess not that I know much about being hip, we waited about a few minutes for someone to recognize us, the waiter finally came and took our drink order, I had the agave and basil margarita which was so good I was very happy with the drink, the birthday girl had a blueberry bliss which wasn't what she expected, I tried it and thought it was good but it was definitely more like wine than a cocktail, the others got beers so the real problem for me at least was my second drink, I got a tropical margarita, it was one of the worst drinks I've ever had and it was a challenge to drink, it was so sour and just plain nasty, I swear both drinks wouldn't have couldn't have come from the same placebo they did, this is a huge red flag for me, why do restaurants think it's cool to not price their signature drinks, why should I ask how much it costs? As the food goes, one of my friends had a side of fries that were pretty good and came with sauce, but other than that we didn't eat. I heard good things about their food from other people after we finished our second round of drinks and the fries we decided to move on to another barbet we couldn't because we had no control our server who was almost harassing us at the start of our night had completely disappeared he finally showed up a few minutes later and smelled of cigarettes there was no way he only smoked one because I could almost taste pretty disgusting for one server anyway, our checks were brought pretty quickly after that and we were finally able to come to a conclusion. Be very careful what you order, it's a totally mixed bag.
fast and a car ride, what's more

i had a chicken sandwich and all the bones came sick complementary i almost broke my teeth when i bit into it the service was even worse the manager i think stopped me from ordering while he was talking on the phone about football for about the starter

poorer after receiving two dry cupcakes with hard frosting, I don't know if it's because I had refrigerated them for a short while until I finished my dinner, but I don't think the frosting should make an audible clicking sound when I sink my teeth into a cupcake. The quality of my cupcakes was comparable to baked goods purchased at regular grocery stores.

I've been to Bookman several times and have mixed feelings about it. If you just want to look around, it's fun to see everything they have between the movie selection, books and trinkets, it was fun to shop for, but as someone interested in selling to them, I would never do that again. I wanted a total scam if you ask me and a waste of time waiting for them to go through my stuff. I'm not sure I'll come back soon

the theater upstairs is quite nice, there are some nice semi upscale restaurants here, there is also a very nice classy and somewhat hidden bar here so why only stars good because it smells like that, that's where all the diarrhea in the world goes to die, especially the parking lot if you can escape the smell, even though it's a nice place for a date, the problem is when you walk him to his car you have to try to figure out how to get through a good night while your nose tells your brain that you're swimming in a septic tank, the new waterfront mall corridor stinks like that too, maybe that's where the term "dirty rich" comes from, what do these people eat

ra sushi offers average quality sushi this restaurant chain offers a hip atmosphere with loud music and a great place to have a few drinks while eating asian. I'm a little more passionate about the rating topic of ra if you don't have much to say about a restaurant, consider giving it four stars.

When I worked in retail, my paycheck was spent before I got paid, so I relied heavily on coupons and sharing meals with all my other poor friends from college. I hit the jackpot coupon for a treat. The photo on the coupon showed everything we would get. stand and just looks at us one of my friends looks around a bit and our other friend then back to the waitress I get a diet coke then our waitress writes it down and doesn't say anything but look at my other friend I lost it and started laughing why isn't she talking to us it's so weird we ended up asking for a different waitress then we found out the coupon was a big liar you didn't understand all that it just says you have it but you don't, the food ended up being nasty probably one of the worst meals ever given as we leave busy chats, lots of waitress trips because of my friend and it was too embarrassing as I couldn't control the laughter, horrible food, horrible service and the bathrooms were some of the most disgusting I have ever experienced if Walmart ran a restaurant this would be it

hello my fellow Arizonans, my review gets stars but I really should give it, I'm generous, I'll always start by saying I'm the pickiest person I know and although food is a preference I know what I like, we went on a Saturday around noon and it was packed, there were several larger tables open but nothing to accommodate people, so being the outgoing person that I am, I invited a few people to join us so we could have a bigger table what a great way to meet people and they were great stable mates the food is good i only have a few downsides no low sodium soy sauce and most dishes are very salty the choice is not great no calamari or pork and several other dishes i enjoy the only dim sum restaurant i have experienced here is c fun gourmet their selection is bigger but their downside is the food is usually cold to lukewarm and the place is getting worse and worse and the owner just doesn't seem to care if you like dim sum I recommend you give it a try and see what you think and until then enjoy your meal

we were always looking for new Mexican food and I read about this place and it was also recommended by a friend. It was average, not very New Mexican. I tried the Pecan Grilled Shrimp Tacos and they were good. My boyfriend got the stacked enchiladas which was just ok, always looking for good new Mexican food in a

if i came to your starbucks for x months and you still don't bother to learn how to pronounce my name correctly then i don't know what to say i always order the same drink quad espresso with white mocha pumps and time they don't get my order correctly the aristas always ask me if i want water or milk with it seriously i ordered a damn espresso for some reason if i wanted water or milk then i would have ordered something else and not an espresso and my drink is one of the easiest drinks to make too just make it the shots are mixed in white mocha syrup and add ice but they always mess up somehow asking me stupid questions if it wasn't because this sb was the closest to the school I would definitely frequent the Thunderbird location

ok so we came here twice in total the first was a very good experience not memorable but ok we went back last night for mothers day my dad wanted the trout so bad so us mothers gave the only good thing to say about them was how nice they were we called to see if we could have dinner at 10 they closed at 10 they said it was no problem I was quite impressed, we called other restaurants and they turned us away in the same scenario when we sat down, we ordered right away, it took a while for us to get our food, I eventually had to flag down our waitress and ask her to bring what was ready when it was ready, my salad was probably the best thing I had that night next to the water, but since it's hard to mess up salad and water, my dad had the trout, he finished it but said he wanted the best, my mom had the chicken parmesan she chose around the stuff she didn't like I ordered a coconut shrimp appetizer it arrived cold the bill for two adult entrees and an appetizer a small cease salad and a kids meal we still got a tip but for one of the worst meals in a long time it wasn't worth it we won't be back at least for a while

me I'm surprised to read all the reviews about the clean store that everyone talked about in my experience the toppings area seemed to have all merged into one big nest there were also stains and slips from everywhere imaginable on the counters on the floor and I wanted to try some flavors but there was no one around to help also the cashier was so dreary with her monotonous apathy that she made me feel as depressed as Sylvia Plath just kidding but she couldn't have been more of a slump if she tried, I usually go to the Yogurt Shop at Town Country Mall on camelback, just east of this place, it's always amazing, spotless, clean, well organized, always a peppy guy by the machines with little sampling cups, a guy who had one red bull too many and almost throws at least one sample of every flavor to every person who walks through the door with a funny, witty little quip and a big personality and way too much energy, but that's good, that's what I had in mind when I discovered this place. i was excited, it was so much closer to home, great location, stupid layout, although prone to human traffic jams, i really really want to like yogurt, but i just can't convince myself of it, the price was good, aside from the fact that i had a hard time getting toppings without being too grossed out because it was a mess, but that was about it, they're lucky i'm feeling generous today and i gave them stars because I really had to talk myself out of just giving them Jessica

I stopped and tried their sweet potato fries and zucchini fries, much more fond of sweet potatoes, the others were a little heavy like previous posts, I didn't like their dips, I also loved their freshly made lemonade and the great outdoor people watching place

if you go prepared and early, you can be in and out in less than an hour. If you're not sure what you need, go online and check before you go, saving yourself the time and hassle of a not-so-bad second trip overall.
ok the experience just reached a point I no longer wanted my membership and it was complicated to stop everything I just didn't like the autopsy commitment

I don't think anyone has ever had Italian food in Chicago, I had a hard time giving stars but I thought the wings were ok, no celery salt on the dog, no cucumber on the dog, worst of all the gyro wasn't on the spit, it was also processed for years in Chicago. wings are absent, there is no deep dish pizza offered or thick crust. I apologize, they are now downgraded, please change your name, you are a disgrace to Chicago, I don't think I will give this place another chance, for no reason.

not clean, worst gel manicure ever and ruined my nails.
