Jimmy finished it, his wife started sanding the nails too fine and they talk to other people and look away while they file and sand and cut, they have cut twice now on the side of my thumbnail causing it to snag and pull off the same day or soon their or their old daughter brought the colors to choose from, she is way too precocious to be customer focused, she is a narcissist and I want an adult waits for me, they have to open bottles to look at gel color samples. The drying machine sits on a priority mailbox above a chair in the customer waiting area. Pedicure ok I won't come back to this place, as many Vietnamese people want your money, they don't understand the service or cleanliness in this one and why we really come to these places. I'm surprised it's still in business, unfortunately it's not in a category on its own, although the others are cleaner. Jimmy should stay away from nails and customers and keep quiet. The girl might be cute with some customers, but I'm not going to have a year to wait around, no thanks.

I have visited and thought and visited again and thought and finally after much deliberation I am ready to render a verdict ruling that all is well and a worthy stop in Scottsdale for an appetizer, sure I could load my review with spicy adjectives, over inflated superlatives, a bit of forced humor and throw in an extra star and hope for a drive, come on, don't pretend you don't know the formula but I don't sell my stars for a day on big screen if this has been said once twice and even three times need to repeat it yes because it's true it's not a post and besides it's not ka it's a good local place to have a glass of wine maybe even with your mom who may not be hip enough to relax posting on central which really requires a bit of hipness I mean they let me in or your dad who may not be able to read in the dark at ka or maybe for that friend of Gilbert's who you know wants to follow the broad straight path of predictability, predictability is no basin in this case, that means a good wine selection could run a fuller bar, usually a good draft or two of decent cocktails and decent food, the food isn't really what you come for, the bruschetta is below average, but the salads are above average and I must add hummus without flatbread or pita. they also have live music that ranges from the somewhat awkward jazz guy who won't stop talking to you to the Motown wedding singer who, on at least one occasion, brought Elaine Benesstyle close to dancing now which was worth the visit and pending grape crushing

let's just say I was not to please with my nail experience at our home after two days my nails were lifting by the end of the weekend I had nails lifting so I went back and showed them and she was like that's normal no it's normal to lift but not after days they fixed them for me for free but were very rude to me I won't go back or recommend any of my friends there

I'm totally perplexed as to why this place gets such good reviews. I've been there several times because it's close to my work and I received gift vouchers for my birthday, unfortunately after the last experience I can't go back even though they are very nice and have great prices. I have to reveal the ugly truth, they make no effort to sanitize the pedicure tools or bowl. explains why my scars cracked so badly after my pedicure that they started bleeding. I had to use peroxide newspaper and bandages for almost a week to get them to heal. They diluted their nail polish so much that it destroys the bond and the polish never dries. I hate to disparage a company with good customer service, but these practices are simply unacceptable. I obviously won't come back.

although I'm a red blooded American male I find this place a bit below average yes the waitress walks around in shorts that would make a cheerleader blush, the bottle slim blondes do nothing for me nor the food itself. I have eaten here twice the first time I ordered shades ranchers and coffee today. the manager who located my server for me, the food itself is not bad but nothing to write home about The protein pancakes were huge and dense but not as tasty as one would expect from an item filled with almonds, blueberries and cinnamon, as others have noted, they will serve you on side orders, sour cream, tomatoes, guacamole and the like will all cost you a pretty penny for the unevenness, well, it doesn't affect the food, but the decor is garish and simple, remember the first apartment you had after college with the white walls and beige carpet is basically the USA. egg aesthetic
I have literally never seen this place open and I live two blocks away

for a chain or restaurant in general with a wing in the name, this place really doesn't impress if all you're looking for is standard draft beers, mediocre wings, and sports, sure I'll fit that bill, but it won't hold up perceptibly. the wings are just average sized, the sauce selection is good, the hot one is quite hot but not extremely flavorful, I guess it's just there to burn you twice, you know what I'm talking about, I won't continue to promote a bunch of local bars or chains that do the same thing with wing beer. and sport, oh okay I'll do New York zips and teakwoods originally from Hazelwoods, all do something better than wild wings
so I went there because of all the hype, I immediately realized how overrated it was, the vibe is like chili but I'm trying to be Mexican
way too expensive wide selection good to browse don't buy check out your local mexican market

I have to admit I can't stop going to Carlos even though I know I shouldn't be good, I can't get enough of the Cape Cod salad, it's really something special which is no lie and the soup is always tasty, it has nothing to do with the food, it's all about the atmosphere which is oppressive in some way, the staff is pretentious and lazy, they think they must be pretty noble individuals to work there but that doesn't mean they like to work for god's sake the owner she is quite friendly but mind you she is the one who created this environment and it becomes easy to believe once she starts bragging about how she is sold so congratulations everyone we support these immature little weasels who look down on this crude human ritual we indulge in being a customer and apparently we have made the owner a rich woman but shhh she is still the most recent keel update received an annoying email from the owner's husband who asked me to give constructive criticism and not comment. I don't know John and I don't know Carla. I only know what I experience when I have lunch at their workplace. The staff was rude and lazy. The owner bragged about the food which I always order. in fact he goes into detail about how great Carla is, it's nice to see a man standing up for his wife, that would almost make me add a star up there, but sorry I can't make his inappropriate use of the possessive apostrophe repeatedly undo that, ok now that was insignificant, my bad id advises John to focus on things other than trolling and chastising his own clients whose business supports this luxury painting and the famous zombie staff, maybe the staff is just following John's lead when they're not focused on creating. a positive experience for their customers I honestly remain perplexed as to why John would bother bothering me. I go to a small restaurant to find the owner bragging, this is part of my experience and I will continue to post reviews featuring the owners and how they behave regarding the personal attack on Carla. Once I doubt anyone reading my review would call this person a braggart based on my experience and as I said before it hasn't stopped me from going back, I will come back, I will order the food and I will enjoy the food but since that is not the only part of the dining experience I will tolerate the negative things because the food I order regularly is always good.

horrible food horrible service I ordered chicken fried rice the waiter brings me a bowl and says chicken fried rice it's true I look in the bowl and it's a bowl of brown rice it must be a joke I tell him it's wrong and then brings me a bowl of apparently fried rice with vegetables and no chicken I take it back to the counter and say my order had chicken bringing my receipt so finally they bring me a bowl of chicken fried rice or at least their version, I didn't think it was possible to screw up something as simple as chicken fried rice, the rice itself was cheap long grain rice, it was inedible because of the way the machinist absorbed absolutely no water and the rice was all covered in something that made it very wet and practically slimy disgusting. I have no idea how people can eat this, oh and this waiter who brought me the brown rice and claimed it was fried rice tried to bring lettuce wraps to the table next to me saying it was their salad, there is a nice picture on the wall that shows you what the salad is supposed to look like and it's not lettuce, the best thing about my meal was the fountain drink which cost circle k on the same room for bigger cups for pennies

listen it bothers me that you have to give even one star i can read the other reviews and i have been here more than a few times but tonight was just beyond a bad dinner yes we were the people table around noon yes we were a group at the high tables that were close together we should be remembered because we were the table that had a server it was so nice of you to take the time to take our order and then let the server go home because that he had been there since lunch you know what sucks more than working How about being the last table for the guy who was working shifts it was so nice of the manager to let him go but hey how about taking the time to have someone finish the open orders just the food wasn't good and you are overpriced but the worst part is your staff is just not good at their job they don't care and this is the result of management not caring.

it was ok the white chocolate beer was delicious i will be back for a bit more i can't wait to go back for a happy hour the steak is steak for me it wasn't amazing but it was good the sides were just beans and bread the beans lacked flavor but i might just be biased my dad makes a mean pot of cowboy beans the whole restaurant is very kitsch it's all about the cowboy theme this place would be great to take tourists for undercooked steak for tasteless beans

typical taco bell with a typical taco bell menu other than the popeye fish they serve in the same kitchen counter, not sure if some people in the kitchen spoke English, an employee on break was sitting in front of a small one in the seating area which was very loud and annoying, every table was dirty even though it wasn't very busy and the condiment bottles at the repair bar were dirty, can't beat the prices, although as usual I left stuff for two bucks

despite the name giving me pause to decide if I wanted to check it out, Extreme Bean is a hip coffee shop with a college feel, they even have a study room with quasi-cubicles that is ironically placed in what was once a bank vault, for those of you who spend hours in coffee shops they have a free woman, coffee flavored coffee and tropical iced tea are good. very reasonably priced compared to the corporate cafe, as of this article there is ragtime piano on Monday nights as well as performers on the weekends, they have a drive thru window, oh yeah they don't seem to have updated their website in a while, most importantly their hours of operation, the website says they are open on the weekends but I think they close at noon in the summer, go for the pumpkin muffins, they are the most excellent, due to the recent increase in popularity of this cafe, I can no longer get my beloved muffins as they are all selling out. outside well before I arrive in the evening, oh yeah and all the employees probably think I'm that shrugging muffin nut, I'm officially downgrading my review from a to a because it's now hard to get a table inside and I have no interest in sitting in the smoking lounge which is their patio sigh

I always hate giving bad reviews, but our service left a bit to be desired. I can normally dismiss such things, but it became clear that our poor service was no accident. We arrived and were told the food would only be served until that was no problem at all except our waitress didn't come back with the menus until almost 2 hours in and then came back to take our orders just a few minutes before the place had other customers, but it certainly wasn't busy enough to take an hour to receive our orders, unfortunately on each of our visits. the waitress was half listening and seemed easily confused the food itself was quite good the shepherd's pie was hot and tasty and the bloody marks were actually perfectly spiced and not worth getting excited about but they were certainly ok and reasonably priced considerably later in the evening our waitress came back with the bill there was an extra drink on the bill which no one ordered and she was perfectly friendly saying to take it off but we had a good five minutes so that she kept getting lost in our seemingly very complicated instructions on the credit card, the rest in cash which she continually read back to overly complex scenarios and we asked her to simply put twenty on the card that was it when she came back she had taken our money for the bill charged to the card and kept the rest in cash as a tip which is just below the tip she assigned herself. We spoke to the manager who couldn't find her for a while and when she arrived she blamed us repeatedly, she finally refunded the card and brought us our new bill with the extra drink, it wasn't worth chatting at that time, the saddest thing is that everyone at my table and our surrounding tables started telling similar stories from past visits. I suppose this type of service is not uncommon.

me, as my colleague told me a few days after eating here, no brilliant review, I'm shocked I didn't jump on writing this review because I was pretty disappointed with the experience, the ambiance sucks, the service wasn't very good and the food was totally average. weren't ready, does it feel like I moved my menu in seconds since you last checked and then disappeared when we were finally ready, the food capriccio isn't bad but does it seriously have to be so huge that the two of us didn't even come close to finishing it. the mediterranean pasta is about the only one without a cream sauce on the whole menu, they shared it for us which was nice and it tasted good with mushrooms and chicken and stuff, the tiramisu came out frozen, they were super apologetic and didn't charge us for the replacement but it was still awkward, they obviously just heated a piece which made it melt and it's not that great so yeah, that's it

can I just say I hate everything about this store if you're too lazy to go to goodwill and dig it up yourself for a third of the price then I guess this is the place for you if you're trying to sell something good luck their lopsided fashion sense will make most of your products obsolete unless it's cheesy regurgitation the chick actually told me the band shirts I was trying to pawn were too much out of fashion while I had a Bay City Rollers and Rocks modern life shirt in my hand rack, they are insanely overpriced, the staff has an elitist air for some reason that you think would be hard to wear in a tutu, leggings and cowboy boots, saving grace they have cheap old punk and skateboard shirts for the guys and girls, but the only time I go here is when the boyfriend decides to check out the vinyl catalog of Astride Records in its entirety is like a cupboard for Lady Gaga.

I know, I know it's Phoenix but I was expecting something much better, maybe my mistake was at what looks like an old fast food place, it's a no frills, no cart, no frills dim sum experience, I don't think I'll go back for many reasons, but if you're craving something bad or need a dumpling fix this place will do the trick, don't wait much

I'm pretty undecided about this place the hygienists are great and the staff is very nice and accommodating every time I need to get a tooth filled yes I'm totally that person I feel like I have to go back because something is wrong for example not being able to floss between the filled teeth because the filling wasn't filed properly I also don't feel like the dentist is really listening to you when I felt like having a problem with a tooth he told me everything was fine and the next time I went back he found a huge cavity in that same tooth and told me I might need a root canal because it was so big, what a pain

this place screams no indoor seating no I ate outside in hot water no I asked for a cup of water with my meal and was told they only had bottled water and soda for sale straws no I walked to Safeway to get a gatorade and they don't even have a straw to use can I use the group now for pizza not only good for the group was unclear and the cashier didn't didn't tell me that after ordering and purchasing the group I told him about when I walked in the door to add insult to injury all the toppings cost more, some each plan on spending a lot of money and being disappointed with a mediocre pizza if you don't heed the warnings posted here

I've been to several Buck di Beeps locations in several cities, it's a good place to go with a large group. We went to this place with a group of nine people. The menu was typical. We ordered the seafood trio which was good and the fried mozzarella which was also good. The Caesar salad was also good. of us ordered wine with dinner all the drinks arrived with our starters we didn't get enough plates we didn't get enough wine glasses and had to wait for three more three starters arrived together and we had to wait about five minutes for the fourth to arrive we had to ask three times for boxes to put our leftovers in we were never asked if we wanted dessert if the service was perfect the bill would be much higher but I can't justify it

I would much rather drink here than eat here, sometimes it's the only place close and I decide to order food and I always regret it. I'm vegetarian so maybe I'm too limited and the burgers are awesome so stick to the traditional dishes, the salads my daughter and I had yesterday were pathetic.

not impressed and probably won't return I came for lunch and was immediately turned off by the lighting and decor I sat down and started to look through the menu when I saw ask the waiter for the folded box selection I asked the waiter and he looked at me like I had grown a third eye he told me they don't have folded boxes I showed him the menu to which he said huff that's weird none of the lunch items on the menu didn't strike me so I ordered the lunch special I got the chicken matsu it was over fried and dry the side dish Mom's roll had an overwhelming mayonnaise flavor and guess what it came in a curved box. There are a ton of great sushi spots in this area, so shogun really needs to step up his efforts to be in line with his competitors, thank goodness for ass.

I've only had a chance to experience the Arizona vs. Boston amber lager and pizza so far, but that's enough to make me want to come back and try more. Many flat screens should be a great place to spend a Sunday afternoon watching football in the fall.

having a miserable experience flying from Boston to Reno, my connection was in Phoenix and the flight from Boston was a little late. I asked both flight attendants if it would be possible to disembark before the other passengers as I had a very close connection to make one. I actually made fun of myself and was told I would have a good hours and a horrible night's sleep because they didn't offer me hotel accommodation and two delicious meals at the airport later I'm sitting in the terminal waiting for my flight from Phoenix to Reno to board sorry buddy it's not really okay I missed my flight by a few minutes I would have been fine if US airlines offered their customers with close connections the option to disembark first, as every other airline I have flown with does, will avoid them at all costs.

the beer list here is great seriously if you like craft beers go here the food is me there are a lot of really interesting combinations but the execution wants the best the service is also me we all had to be suspicious when our waitress came and told her so and so needed something too she would seriously take one or two orders at a time even though the beer is awesome

not a fan, I was in Baltimore yesterday shopping with my dog and I decided to go buy him a few treats so I picked out a bag of about some baked treats my total was about I didn't have any cash on me so I took out my plastic money, debt card and they wouldn't accept it telling me I had to buy a few more things because they have a minimum what the store has a minimum these days, service customer also lacked luster the store employees dogs jumped on me which I found a bit annoying unnecessarily to say a store I loved I won't go back there are so many other great dog stores

dine here since wings big and full of flavor special wing prices on mondays some of the biggest wings around include celery and ranch or blue cheese pizza four star wings delicious an average is and the crust is thin and pliable new york style with lots of cheese hot four star pizza fried zucchini total disappointment for ex something you get small zucchini rounds dry chicken tenders inadequate little pitcher of beer ice cream delicious pressure atmosphere mom n pop shop this place permeates the family property there is usually only has people working one in the front and one in the back definitely the kind of place where you don't want to piss anyone off and they might have a shotgun under bar service the waitresses are attentive and very close if you need extra service I will be back yes I love those wings ugh and the pizza yum I just won't order appetizers

it depends on what you are looking for, I guess I was preparing for a new house and needed some household items and miscellaneous items to make my house feel more like a home. I also would have liked to find some toys and furniture for the boy. They're pretty well chosen and for the most part the price, hopefully goodwill, varies greatly from location to location. The store on Chandler Boulevard in the Ahwatukee foothills has some very nice falls. in an area where there is too much competition from other thrift stores for good donations and where thrift stores are so well accepted that they can always jack up their prices on whatever they get, I think there is a condition in shiv called thrift store delusion complex in which people happily pay prices almost equal to new and think they are getting a good deal, I am all for helping the disadvantaged but the idea of a thrift store is hmm.

some highlights loved the daily special, red velvet pancakes, the breakfast with cream cheese topping yum yum yum, the corned beef hash is canned not homemade, sad sad face, the fried chicken breakfast is a huge portion very well tasted, but really sad that they only have sausage gravy, would love it if they could offer a pork free gravy for the non-oink eaters overall, it was delicious simple menu great service thanks to the waitress Kelly she was really nice and would much rather support local restaurants than shop or dennis anyway

I was a lot of local sombreros who started going there before they were at their current location in recent years a lot of sombreros have raised prices and the food is not as good the ratings are below average now a lot of sombreros are not up to what it used to be the food is still good but is no longer great all the big things are changing and I am sad to see a lot of sombreros changing for the worse the original chef owner Jeff Smedstad left and started elite in Sedna, I have to try there because here, that's what a lot of sombreros were

avoid at all costs terrible service, slow as hell, only uses disposable plastic plates to add insult to the obnoxious food, even though we told them we were in a rush to get on a plane and multiple assurances that the food would arrive in plenty of time, they let it go and I ended up paying to be seriously pissed and hungry without bleach

I arrived with high expectations, beautiful surroundings, I love the New York concept here and the area attracts a superior quality of people which appeals to me, the place was packed on a Friday night, sure, the drinks were good, lots of attractive people and a fabulous band playing, but the vibe in the room didn't match the energy of the band. about dancing in a group with strangers I was there with my wife and she doesn't really dance so I tried to join a group of or and there was no welcome I was disappointed so we left after maybe a few minutes never to return unless people started raving about the place which will either mean people have changed or new people have discovered it

probably more star worthy, hell the yelp constraint market was quite busy tonight now that you can actually go out in the evening without a slight breeze making you feel more like a blowtorch in your face despite that our wait to be seated was pretty quick but where was our server outside listening to the band we need a liquid refreshment finally our server arrived and apologized for the wait at the same time the manager arrived and also apologized and we offered an appetizer wow we weren't even complaining we had the hummus which was very tasty but a bit thin and a mango tandoori chicken pizza a lovely combination of spicy curry sauce with sweet mango and the grilled chicken service was excellent once we got over the initial hump while I don't usually plan on going to CPL it's good to know this one is there

the portions are too small the plastic utensils just remind me of a jack in the box the serving tray is straight from a mall food court and the menu selection is drastically reduced you can't really enjoy a conversation or relax at lunch listening to the kitchen shout order numbers to customers the soft drink flavor mixing machine is fun but gimmicky the quality and flavor of the food is mostly the same but you leave wanting more I won't be returning to this place

great concept my nephews asked me to take them there when I was coming from out of town, we really had a wonderful time. I just wish the staff were a little friendlier for the amount we paid to be there. I get it, it's boring to explain how the process works for every person who walks through the door, but I've never done that before, so I was asking questions. the children were very calm and therapeutic and allowed your inner creative side to shine through a large amount of colors to work with and provide. I would do it again with them, but I hope the person at the front desk can smile more often.

decent place for legit Chinese food with the usual quick service and decent prices, we were able to enjoy roast duck, pan fried crispy noodles and honey walnut shrimp, all winners we completely devoured, it's location is convenient and parking is easily available.

I live nearby but I will stop eating there the service was slow my friend complained about an order he had and they said ow next time tell them to make it different for you really so I ordered another simple California roll took forever the sushi is okay but the overall experience is worth driving somewhere else you lost me

I really wanted to like this place but the service ruined everything. I went there on a Sunday afternoon when there really weren't many people. I was seated directly at the bar and always had poor service. The server probably walked by several times while my glass was empty before she looked me in the eye. It was a bit ridiculous.

I had lunch at Zinc for the first time recently as they were opening given they weren't busy yet, we had pretty poor service to begin with, we weren't offered any bread as it was our first visit, I wouldn't necessarily have assumed we would have bread but I noticed other tables had it so naturally I felt offended and then the cardinal sin of serving I may have been eating when our server appeared with our check and asked if we wanted dessert well I don't know I haven't really eaten yet my husband hadn't even finished yet and he is eating like he was still in it Needless to say the army just took the check and cheated on his tip in exchange for the time I was apparently allotted to eat as for the food I had the macaroni au gratin with smoked ham as well as their parmesan truffle fries sale. aioli or some other special dipping sauce, I'd rather just have the fries without all the other crap. I wouldn't necessarily object to a return visit if I'm in the area, but I wouldn't break down their door as well, I doubt they would care
the soggy, flavorless pizza served on an unheated carbonari ceramic plate was watery and made with cream instead of eggs, the gnocchi was tough rather than light and airy

I see one word come up over and over again in the reviews about this place, cute, well it is cute, the lighting, furniture and concept is cheerful and nice and inviting in an innocent way, the patio is cute too and it's not often apple seeds, I'll be with a group of people trying to decide where to eat and drink, someone will say apple seeds in the center and camel, there will be groans, then someone will think of corn across the street and the answer is well, it's not apple seeds, so we're going there other than that. good mom

for cheap pizza it is also good because there is more choice than other cheap pizzerias and the quality is much better the wings are delicious too especially the cajun flavor if you are looking for something like one of the big chains then go for it but it is good for the money if you want a gourmet pizza then go pay for it don't look for it in the cheap places i paid for an al pizza with two toppings and wings and everyone was happy just know that it is a very quick pizza but it is better than the other big ones

this place is great but not if you have kids, it was mentioned on yelp that it is kid friendly but they don't even have a changing table in their bathrooms. I was there with my year old nephew and had to take him to the car to change his dirty diaper. If you're calling a kid-friendly place, you might think about accommodating and having a table changer in your bathrooms both in and out.

I called last night and tried to call ahead for a party. We are in town and are here to see friends explained to the hostess that some of the group are elderly so they would need insurance when booking. I was told to call back in an hour. The thought process on her part was that it was too early to give me a time and they weren't very busy yet so I did as I was told and called back and after about minutes of confusion and further waiting I was told that we couldn't sit before or that we could have separate booths, I explained that we needed to sit together and the times were the best she could do, I was so frustrated that I told her no thanks we will find other arrangements she said ok and that was good job Texas Roadhouse no there is no excuse for not having a reservation system in place like an open table one day there won't be any customers to disappoint so maybe you'll get it

When I walked in we were greeted instantly, the place smelled a bit like a hole in the wall but regardless we were happy to come to albi's happy hour for whoop, luckily we were the only ones there as there was only one server. I ordered the albi and the parents ordered the bulgari, they also ordered a mango and mocha bob ten minutes later more people arrived and that's when the service started to get slow, we got our appetizer no problem then the side dishes ten minutes later the starters were ready but it took him a few minutes to get our rice, another waitress came in and we thought things would go smoother. We asked for our bob and his response was that he was alone and working on it. I didn't like this response considering we had already been there for a few minutes without any drinks we had ordered. Overall we enjoyed the food but just weren't impressed with the speed and service.

I have been an ultra customer for a long time but had never tried the salon until recently, it was a horrible experience. My stylist Delia was a few minutes late getting me started and several times during the haircut she stopped and kept looking around, she made various strange faces as if to say my hair was a mess, not only did she not listen to what I wanted but she shot down the one thing I asked for. the store front after which I waited they then sent me back to the salon for the price correction happened twice then I asked for a manager who was completely unprofessional and I would never go there again

there are two ways to look at this place, one is to get quality food at a good price, the other is to get a lot of food at a cheap price. I prefer the first but those who prefer the second will not agree with my opinion. I thought the hustle I had was okay but nothing fantastic. I really didn't like the cookies. character but I'm glad I tried this place
excellent service good food had baked scallops reasonable prices
this place is consistent with good chinese food the staff is courteous the place is clean i want takeaway chinese food in tolleson come here

we got together with Mike C to go to a Thanksgiving buffet today we tried the Golden Corral down the street in Gilbert but the line was far so we got here where there was also a wait but shorter it was good as always but there were a few negatives this time the soups there was regular corn chowder weak cream of broccoli regular chicken noodles they should have done better than that for Thanksgiving there was no cottage cheese they don't always have it but at these prices they should have today there was turkey but breast meat only no dressing at the dessert bar there was no hot fudge it didn't look like they were sold out but rather they just didn't have any today there were no sundaes I had to go get a bowl of soup to make a sundae there was a hot lava cake or a hot fudge cake I think they call it here but it was severely lacking in lava so it's a matter of stars for this restaurant which was not as good as it should have been for the money Thanksgiving buffet sr

i love the mac and cheese i like the dark these facts make me love this place the service was good the prices were reasonable they had a good selection of craft beers, local wines the dark colors and candles were comforting but that atmosphere makes the headlights of the cars parked against the windows a little more intrusive a solid star for me i wasn't blown away but i wasn't disappointed ps i think i might miss Lisa GS

Big fan of their Chicken Caesar Salad and Fire Roasted Tomato Soup, my favorite sandwiches are the Chicken Bread, Cranberry Turkey and Teriyaki Chicken Wrap. I love both wildflowers and heaven, but the heavenly bakery has the best cookies and while I don't get them very often because it's a calorie killer, the chocolate cheesecake brownie is to die for.

I came to white tacos during restaurant week, the guacamole they served with the chips was so delicious, the flan was also delicious, I will come back just to eat the flan, the scene was pretty cool, fun, people watching the environment.

worst service I have experienced, my son and I sat at a Texas table, we were ignored for a good few minutes until my boyfriend had to ask the manager to get someone to get us something to drink once we got our drinks, it took another few minutes to order our food at that point, another family was sitting at our table, my son, my boyfriend ordered a meal from the Texas menu, I had sushi, all the everyone on this table got their meal and I still didn't get my sushi I asked the waiter to bring it and she brought someone else I had to wait a few more minutes for my sushi the family on our table was very angry with us also the food is excellent the service is so poor I am disappointed I advise everyone who comes here to sit at the sushi bar and deal with the chefs they are great I spoke to the owner and she was as bad as the waiters I then tried again I met my girlfriends there we had dinner we then moved to the bar and were completely forgotten about we asked the owner manager to please have someone come and look after us and we were told they were worried because we were drinking and had kids with us, one of my girlfriends had her kids but she wasn't drinking I was offended that she tried to cover up the bad service with her worry called, the food is excellent, the service is lousy, I'm so disappointed and I won't go back, I'll look elsewhere for my customer rolls, I hear blu at the wigwam, it's really good and the servers are hospitable.

the food was okay my friend and I had the meatball sub and the chicken marinara sub. I know it's a stereotype, but being served food, my real Italians, I expected more spices and flavors in the food. The alcohol selection is small but contains the bulk of beer and wine. I want to go back and check out the pizzas before I write this place up.

I went there and waited a few minutes for someone to appear to ask us for our order and even after we said hello they didn't acknowledge we had to repeat the order several times, it was very frustrating to see that nothing seemed to be in stock. No Philly cheesesteak or soup was available.

I've been here several times and the food is always good, they have a fantastic selection of cheeses and it's a great place to try boutique cheeses. The current rating is due to the service we received last night. The hostess was very friendly but our waitress was sorely lacking after our food arrived and two members of our party still needed silverware. We informed her and she never came back with any silverware. We ended up stealing it from a nearby table. no calorie cheese while we're pretty sure it's triple cream if it had had an iota of personality, the joke could have flown but it fell flat and left us perplexed wondering if we had really just ordered no calorie cheese, we enjoyed our evening either way, the service could just use a little work

rip, i pass here every day, but i looked and saw the dark place inside and the torn signage, they never really recovered from the roof collapse, it was the only vietnamese place near my work now, unfortunately there isn't one, they should have offered a bank lunch

Cummings took over the company we were originally using and since they took over we have had nothing but problems. I haven't seen a single bug in years in my house and as soon as we started using Cummings we found a bug almost every day and not just bugs but cockroaches. I called Cummings to ask why this was happening and the receptionist was extremely rude saying they hadn't done anything wrong.

sadly disappointed I have come across Lola countless times and every time I thought I had to try it I finally did this evening and was terribly disappointed for everyone who has been to Firefly in Vegas there is just no comparison the sangria was ok but nothing special and the tapas were just so busy the atmosphere was busy and our service was lousy but it was a very unique and cool environment

be very very careful asking for a sandwich as a wrap I ordered a ham and cheese make your own sandwich I ordered it as a wrap to go I got home there is lettuce and mayonnaise and what is that I see in this sandwich there is the tip of a finger cut off from someone's glove lodged between the lettuce at least I hope it's the tip of a finger from a glove I'm not even going to think about the other thing it could have been gross i didn't finish the memo sandwich to myself i never get an einstein wrap, especially not the shea one, is disgusting if this ever happens again i'm calling a local news station to report it then i'll call the state health department.

It seems like dining rooms are popping up all over the valley these days, Studio Movie Grill in north Scottsdale recently opened its doors. The theater has a much less luxurious feel than the Esplanade Am or even epic theaters instead of comfortable reclining seats. You're stuck sitting up straight and you won't have blankets to keep you warm. Although ordering food or drinks from your server is as easy as pressing the button on your seat, they will come pick up your order, the menu is full of Esplanade-like American dishes and they will deliver them to you throughout the movie. Movie tickets are Sunday, Friday, and Saturday, which is much cheaper than Epic and about the same price at the plaza. beer which I thought was a good deal considering we had two beers each to eat. I had a grilled cheese sandwich with fries. I actually really liked this grilled cheese sandwich because the bread was thick and there was lots of cheese and the seasoned fries were thick and tasted good. Some regular movie concession stand items at non-dinein theaters are just as expensive, so I thought the food prices here were really reasonable even though the food and prices were satisfactory based on the less cozy atmosphere I always choose. I am on the esplanade of the three restaurant-theaters that I tried

after reading Lindsey's review I had to think twice about my original review of this place yes I was back and gave it another chance yes maybe I was a bit of a jerk in my previous review this place is definitely a great place if you need a quick lunch and you are on the go it's a pretty comfortable place to eat and it's better for you than a baconator although it sounds delicious at the moment they tend to water down their sirach but this might be more of a hot thing rather than a cost cutting thing, the sirach may be a little spicy for some the spicy chicken bowl is the way to go, try it, don't listen to my old review, I was probably having a bad day at work

let me start by saying I never had been, I didn't like having been, I could live without it, but never that I didn't like, I went to lunch today and I was the only customer so I figured I would have good service no matter what the girl sat me down and was very pleasant and indicated that my waitress would arrive about ten minutes later, watching her talk on a personal phone call at the bar the whole time time the girl who sat me down came to take the order she walked over didn't say a word and just stared at me ok I can live with that it was just a minor inconvenience I had the ground pork sandwich for lunch with beans and lemonade and it came out very quickly maybe because the beans were bush or something they tasted like canned baked beans heated in the oven microwave, not cool, the sandwich was ok at best thinking back to honey bears stays and other good places, this one wasn't even in the same arena, I will have to go back and try a sandwich with the correct sauce on it, there was a sauce on the table which after reading the reviews here I had assumed was the B sauce, it looked a little watery but I thought that didn't matter, it wasn't a style and maybe it was because it was a little vinegary on the way out, I noticed that all the other tables had a red sauce labeled B so I guess they have two different ones. I would have preferred the red one. I guess there was no atmosphere. they're going to lose money today, they don't know what it will be in other days, but they better get their act together quickly or it's going to fail.

leave it to corporate America to capitalize on an epically great idea and roll it out by getting everyone rolling in the way of reserving your spot in advance using the Fandangos website. Mobile site integration is not working at the time of this review. I love, love, I know my seat is mine and if it's not available I'll just have to look for another showing, choose from the exclusive movie suites, think first class airplane seat then some or the more standard and rowdy, efficient and hardworking waiters and food runners, the concept is great but with the food quality dropping this could die quickly, why should I pay for a cracked plastic bowl of popcorn, good blood, chicken wings have gone south, they are the fatty, mushy pump, full of antibiotics, while I'm in my own shit, while the steroids are pushing me bigger than my body was ever going to grow, I feel a lot of meat, chicken shit, that means they're cutting other corners too, yuck, the food often arrives very cold, send it back, be careful when ordering, many items are similar and your server will take dinner effect while you watch literally put every restaurant nearby out of business the plaza is a ghost town note to tenants to always put a clause in your contract that competitors in the same property must be approved by you.

I rarely disagree with average ratings on Yelp. I tried Blue Adobe based on great reviews but was very disappointed. I really can't find a redeeming quality about the night I had their killer margarita which is a cheaper house margarita. menu and I couldn't get past them, I couldn't think of a way for someone to make a tamale with lobster and do it well, so I was really excited to see how they did it wrong, that was how they did it, the lobster was overcooked, there was very little of it in the tamale and the biggest problem was exactly what I thought it would be the mass of corn that just overpowered the little lobster that was in the tamale, they would have could put imitation crab in it and save a lot of money and it would taste the same doesn't work, it had a raspberry chipotle sauce on the side which was very good but again it took away the whole point of the dish the lobster tried a chimmichunga anyway, the service not special was not good our waitress was very frantic I felt like I was a burden or inconvenience to her and no I don't am not, I spent years in the restaurant business makes you very nice to your server, it seems the snow birds keep this place in business, the restaurant was full of them, they must forget what their experience was like. summers
great to see a total wine closer to me great choice and decent prices I used the newspaper discount coupon to buy a good papa cab this afternoon
air jordan need I say more

I went there for a quick bite before the theater had the sloppy buffalos and they were disgusting buns, thin sliced ​​pickles, then the duck spring rolls were also bad, then in an effort to eat something we could tolerate we ordered the lettuce cups with shrimp and they were just adequate, very disappointing

the sushi is absolutely nothing fancy, they have happy hour all day, every day which is a great way to start your evening. Korean pork tacos are bomb, great location in Old Town Scottsdale, love the staff and atmosphere.

first time we tried this place was Saturday night and a minute wait refusing to wait, we came back on a Wednesday night and sat outside which was quite nice, we were really looking forward to this based on the Yelp reviews but we were all disappointed. overwhelmed by the subtlety of the feta and klamath olives, we won't be returning. Can anyone tell me where to find good Italian pizza in Scottsdale?
minutes without food, you be the judge

if you don't want to read the whole review I'll summarize it in one sentence via delosantos only uses yellow cheese. I went here about years ago for a celebratory occasion and was afraid to eat the food because of the smell of old grease and the look of the starters on the tables around. We ate on the patio which is directly on central avenue and after the horrible smell of the grease exhaust pipes I couldn't wait to escape the place last year I was unknowingly taken back to this same place, years had passed and I had completely forgotten about my vow to never return this time I was glad, it probably helps that going in my expectations were very low I was immediately drawn to the Mexican artwork kitsch, their extensive tequila collection on display and of course the Christmas lights, the salsa seemed fresh and was just the right amount of spice, they keep the salsa chips runny so be careful not to overfill the margaritas are really sweet but they are cheap and will get the job done, it's the kind of place where you stick to the basics, don't get fancy or try to order something healthy grab a shrimp enchiladas chimichanga burrito or a chili ellen and if that's appropriate get that miller style of enchilada make sure you have your belly at the ready when you're done if you think you can eat a whole plate by yourself the portions are huge and totally appropriate oh last tip don't get the guacamole it's super gringo and has a ton of sour cream I'm giving this place stars because it's good value for money if you share, their atmosphere is very comfortable, fun and the service is very accommodating

I've been wanting to try it for a while, but never got around to it until today. I had a side salad and the said favorite, I have to say I'm not impressed at all. The salad was made from what looked like a bag of pre-shredded lettuce and not very fresh either. The pizza was just ok. I had much better, very sad and disappointed, unfortunately I will not return.

the jury is still out on this cleaning product took lumps I was expecting to pick up six pieces the next day they did a good job on all six items of clothing ranging from men's pants to sport coats to dresses but one destroyed dress shouldn't have put it in the dryer who knew I expected Catalina to know the problem is still not fixed so it's a mixed review very happy with the work I've never had a cleaning product done sport before, but I'm still looking for closure on the latest article who knows they could delight me

the new leaner breakfast sandwiches are good, they basically take the bottom and top of the bagel and you end up with smaller ends of your sandwich, an easy way to cut calories without losing the taste

this pizza always tasted good but lately i feel like they have cheapened their ingredients, i realize it's a pizza but it just tastes different to me now, without the flavored crust i wouldn't go back but the main reason i haven't gone back to hungry peeps is because the last time i wanted to place a take out order i was turned down, asked for a reason and was told they had received a very large order from the company and they were not taking regular orders at that time, you would think they would be able to accommodate everyone even if a large order was placed

I had the chicken burger today, it's pretty good grilled, juicy and cooked just right, the fries are still hot and crispy, the wait for the food took a little longer than usual, but I know they are very busy, too bad our service this time was totally botched at first. cup which is great but I would have liked to have a drink with my food instead of choking it down

the same club is under a ground beef recall, call the store for details, it's about Friday today, they said they sent paper and e-mails but I didn't receive one, I just got lucky and am returning the dark ground beef I just purchased. I'm rarely able to find fresh ground meat or chicken here, but their roasts have always been fresh and very reasonable. to get meat here, although for the hassle it's definitely not worth it, if for some reason you don't like the club itself they will refund your membership, look it up, it's on their website where they try, but beware of the minced meat and chicken there, they're often not very fresh, but I can sometimes find fresh organic produce here, nothing really last time it was spinach, it was really cheap though and getting organic produce at wholesale prices is rare

after all the ravings I heard about Matt's big breakfast and the long wait, I was so excited to enjoy my food that the quality of the ingredients was high, but the service wasn't that good. I felt like the waitresses were trying to get us out of the restaurant.

first of all if you go here please make sure you check your bill when it comes honestly we have been there every time we have been overcharged either the menus were out of date or we were past happy hour it's oh and the other excuse we just changed our menu blah blah blah then they always have to get a manager to come to the table which takes forever. The second time it happened, my daughter who had just returned from a Navy deployment wanted to do something special for us and took us all there. My husband looked at the check and remarked that it was crazy what we were thinking while we were there for happy hour. The waitress had to call the manager which took more minutes, give me a break. price when we got the bill it was almost twice as much we waited for our server to come back she never did she totally ignored us i tipped her in dollars which is not like me i tip very well and i wrote on the receipt why she got so little money as a tip if you are looking for a fun time go to the caddy corner at san files this place is fun and the staff is friendly and fun, we much prefer it there, we never go to cardiac ranch again, they say the third time's a charm, well it's a charm to know you. they spend too much and it's a big gimmick and they don't care oh and if I hadn't had to give one star I wouldn't have done it

I had lunch here a few days ago, the place was dead, only one other table had people at the table, service was quick. The Reuben sandwich I ordered was delivered quickly. The meat was tasty but not really plentiful. I'm used to a New York style Reuben with lots of meat. The potato salad that came with the sandwich was very good. hour or dinner than for lunch, in the end it was ok, not bad, not great, I'll try it again, but I wouldn't go out of my way to eat there again
if you want a dog and you're in the area it's a very good decision, that said it's probably not worth a special trip, you can find a better hot dog or brat at a ballpark or at the supermarket
good customer service clean atmosphere good margaritas delicious burrito asama carnal

I have visited this restaurant several times while in town for Padres spring training in recent years, it is a great sports themed hangout for large groups, TV service is very good, food is decent, great variety of drinks, but it can get a little pricey here for a casual place. The location is convenient for those hanging out in the franchise capital of the world, Peoria.

service was very slow people at several tables waited too long for drinks, checks, food, table had no bread plate, no salt or pepper, no napkins, we had to ask for everything. The busier ones didn't seem to understand how to set a table. sure your food tasted good and was not toxic with the salt she informed me it was served blackened does not mean covered in disgusting salt my husband ordered capelin the shrimp were undercooked and not fresh there was very little tomato sauce it was bland greasy and void of any redeeming qualities again like the beet salad the vegetables were not prepared properly huge chunks of tomatoes do you mix how do you serve pasta with no sauce overall I would say the chef is not talented no one bothers to prepare properly no one tastes the plates as they are so bad it is impossible to believe the menu is being checked and corrected in the meantime come back for a glass of wine and an appetizer may happen as there is potential just a glimmer and in a few months if enough people look into it and finally if the owner is smart enough to stop this unfortunate stunt the patio is nice I hope that someone will care enough

My husband and I both rate the food as good but not great. Fresh vegetables and pleasant flavors don't know if the bread is homemade. The bread on my sandwich was falling apart, making it difficult to enjoy. I think the owner or manager was there and I expected him to introduce himself or welcome us in some way, but he seemed to be working hard. I think as a new business it would be a good idea to be more welcoming to people who are willing to try something new. i was stubborn while we were ordering which was very unprofessional and unsanitary especially if the owner was there, i also wish we had soup without broth made from cream, maybe we would try again for breakfast.

boy is the name a temptation seriously happy I'll try to be fair but I'm writing at a time when this restaurant has truly been life changing so much so that I'm buying a dining room table extra equipment for the kitchen and I'm not patronizing any chains while I'm in my hometown based on the strength of this experience even in a good mood this place wouldn't break a I'm not in a good mood pretty tasteless Texas cheese fries crispy steak fries that are supposed to be du cheddar and bacon from Monterrey Jack either the cheese mixed very well or that's not what I had bacon my that's a very generous term for toenail clippings that ended up on top. white film on it sorry you just earned a star you should have come out didn't have sad starters the cajun steak claims to be marinated in spices which I couldn't find they may indeed have shown them a picture of the process in the recipe but I couldn't find it supposed to be medium rare but was medium on one side rare on the other close although happy sirloin steak cooked as requested a little over seasoned sides baked potato if you ever want to open up a mine of salt these guys will do it for you you want an idea of what it is the texture was twice chewed would be a better name hot vomit with bacon bits would be a slightly more colorful and bigger term the fried onions came with everything stuck on the grill they came foaming the mushrooms were the only thing that was as tasteful as expected they looked very consistent although canned regardless they were edible the steak surreal plus a stewart tasted pretty good overall the service was kish but accompanying the child to the toilet twice the staff just seemed to want to get where he wanted to go and not care about the toddler walking down the aisle to the toilet in front of me this is for this occasion only twice passed it has been great fun for the child rounded up for the carrots

I walked into this lovely little establishment with a friend, we were seated fairly quickly and took drink orders. I had the iced green tea and she had water which was garnished with a slice of cucumber. I thought it was a nice touch. We both started with spring rolls. She had the salmon. I had the barbecue pork. the only complaints were the little things i had to deal with in the back of house for a long time so i know how much it costs to prepare this food, i just felt like everything was expensive for what it was, it's not a high end restaurant, it's a small hipster vietnamese place with minimalist decor, it's a lunch place, basically my menu was printed on paper which is pretty common these days so no big deal unfortunately the menu had looks like it has been used several times, I understand that reusing menus is quite common not to do. ecologically irresponsible, it just looked really very used and abused and my ramekin of dipping sauce had a huge chip in it to be fair, I'm hyper critical of everything service wise just because I'm from a restaurant, the rice paper gets stars from me, it was eh, luckily I had good company, probably won't come here again though

friendly staff and clean office from what I have seen quite frequent turnover with the sec I have had at the moment I have Dr. Susan she is concise to the point compassionate easy to understand the oral surgeon Dr. Lillian does her job well I had my wisdom teeth removed with no complications or infections later healed quite well scheduled quite far away so difficult to get an appointment if you have specific availability capabilities some staff could use more training on the procedure and techniques to speed up the process and minimize prayer time for radiation Julie is doing a breast cancer walk so make a personal donation check out and get a teeth whitening kit for dollars about the staff kendall is very friendly and professional noreen seems to need more training several times praying with bite tabs but she was friendly overall the process took a little longer than expected suggestions train the staff thoroughly with the technique and procedure so they can speed up customer service especially with the bite tab as well than the other type of red circular, guests like to minimize their radiation exposure time clean office and helpful front desk staff Dr. Susan was on point and very clear about what she wants and what to do next planning for falls can be somewhat difficult if friends have specific availability abilities, but in general the front desk staff are very helpful

the sandwiches are pretty decent and tasty, but they don't include drinks, salad, just a small cookie on the side, we just ordered sandwiches and sodas a little overpriced, the total is just right for that, the sandwiches are gigantic or whatever that leaves you just a little hungry and disappointed

me, I'm torn, I found this store a bit of a walking contradiction, okay I don't walk, but you dig what I'm saying, it reminds me a lot of myself, it's not all that's good, you see, I recycle everything at work because the cute little receptacles are provided to me by waste management, which leads me to not really think about what I'm doing and I manage a high rise building in the city center and with all the movement green, we would expose ourselves to major problems if we did not meet the demand and of course, that is just the case. it doesn't really make sense at home, not so much and to be frank I don't really think twice about it, go hate it, that's how I feel about hybrid parking easy and cool, fun, ridiculous, but no bike racks, tons of bullshit organic and no preservatives, but everything was super sealed in weird plastic containers.

so i am an occasional shopper here at this market for several reasons we love their homemade corn tortillas they have a good selection of mexican treats bimbo breads and coconut bars and if i buy the conventional stuff their prices can't be beat also their pan broth is really good and cheap and their leches cakes are really good ok so here is where the less comes in the big less my husband and i used to go every now and then for the breakfast I usually order simple and straightforward things like carne asama tacos don't make it get much simpler than the meat in a corn tortilla well last time we did that I found my meat ready I wait until it was blue and purple in color I had dark meat but I had pieces of it that were blue and purple no joke I thought it was an eye trick but I looked at it closely and I took this shit that was blue and purple. I don't buy my next cut of beef here, I'm cool with their breads, cakes, tortillas and such, but if it comes to meat I'm out the door, I much prefer the pro ranch market, the real ranch market

I was craving some noodle soup, I thought I would check this place out after seeing the reviews upon entering, I didn't like the air quality which smelled like dirty frying oil while browsing the menu and looking at other diners' food I realized it was mostly tempura duh fried, yuck I'm not a fan of deep frying but that explained the smell I opted for shrimp on top of the soup, it wasn't anywhere close of the wonderful soup I had experienced elsewhere especially this great Japanese restaurant in Chang Mai which had these amazing moats around the sushi chefs floated the sushi on little boats you could choose very disappointing broth noodles spinach green onion and shrimp I had an added bonus of deep grease smell covering my clothes

this place is whitewashed chipotle the food is mediocre at best i mean seriously how can you get up and steal from chipotles idea there is no creativity there the habenaro salsa is flavorless and not hot at all seriously i asked for hot not a yellowish tomato concoction for people who can't handle real salsa at least chipotle has hot salsa not too hot either but good best for quick Americanized Mexican food of course, I much prefer to have the real deal but I like the citole for what it's not that crap that quota is trying to serve, the chicken is over seasoned and very spicy, you can barely taste the chicken, the vegetarian fajita was the same, the product looked very low quality, the oxidizing guacamole and the lettuce, the meat looked unappetizing too, but not at Chipotle level, although I have been here twice, this is the last time for me going to a restaurant in Denver and for some reason I thought it was better, so maybe it's the management, but I can say the food is far from good, I would much rather go to citole than those wannabe employees were dumber than a bag of frijoles, this place has the worst Mexican food I have ever had next door of a burrito or taco bell burrito, just disgusting food

I tried to eat here Friday night for the seafood buffet, we waited in line for minutes before finally giving up, it would have been a lot sooner, but the drive from my house is almost an hour. They have three lines ranked according to the level of the players' club card. dozens of people were waltzing in the diamond and platinum lines, what a fucking joke to ruin my entire evening hiking there dreaming of crab legs just to be snubbed by them never again

When I bought my house my real estate agent recommended these guys for termite inspection they found some old inactive shed tubes so I paid them to treat the house and I purchased a year warranty included in the warranty is a free annual inspection and all necessary follow up treatments sounded good first the good part the treatment seems to have worked very well as I haven't seen any new evidence of creepy crawlies munching on my casa which is good for three stars, I guess, but here's where I have a gripe last fall or in the new house it occurred to me. by the way, I've been here a year and I should expect some sort of contact from the termites to schedule the annual inspection a call a letter something saying hey you're due I don't think that's unreasonable to expect from a service oriented company. I can't remember if the first letter has it paraphrased as how we would like to schedule your free annual inspection or if it came in the th letter or the st or the th call or maybe it was the th letter and the th call it was definitely around the time your warranty expired but if you respond right away we will reinstate it for you and schedule your free annual inspection letter but which frankly irritates me a lot I won't renew not my guarantee with this company as my experience has shown. I won't pay anything summary treatment good it was effective I no longer have any signs of bugs horrible service they will ignore you unless they want your warranty money I'm not saying it's a scam but uh I definitely didn't receive value for the money I paid them

it's just not very good, I don't understand why people give this place even three stars, it's rare that I give a place a bad rating, but my big Greek restaurant is now just a gimmick and has gone from bad to worse. for lunch the other day and I just got to the point where I wouldn't even go back for a quick bite, we ordered the garlic hummus and it was too full of garlic and not homemade, it seemed to be loaded with garlic powder as opposed to the fresh hummus which just had roasted garlic in it. The olives we ordered were rough at best, even considering them over seasoned and not very fresh. a less critical rescue but I think an overall representation of what happened to where the menus were totally destroyed as tattered and dirty, the lamination was coming off and they were dirty, do yourself a favor and go somewhere else

my wife wanted to go there a few weeks ago for her birthday so we went on a Saturday afternoon, parking was easy to find and there was no wait to get a table, I wish it was a bit cooler but it wasn't so we decided to eat inside. I don't remember what my wife had, I had the chicken and sausage pizza, it was fine, nothing to write home about, basically that's how the whole meal went, but it didn't blow me away, not that I'm a big organic and healthy foodie type, although I guess I'll go again, but I probably wouldn't suggest it, I thought the music was a bit loud.

one word to describe easy disappointing this would have been a good place for breakfast without all the hype i have been trying to visit this place since i found out it was on drive thru dinners and dives so when i saw the deal on doozy of a deal i bought it straight away i made my own omelette with chicken garlic and spinach the chicken was overcooked and the omelet and my apples of hash browns were terribly greasy, my cousin ordered the wool pack and was also disappointed with her meal it just didn't seem up to par for a place that was on the food network, the icing on the cake was the easy ice cream, their iced coffee, they could give me a cup of water and cardamom and it wouldn't have tasted any different, we couldn't wait to get to the car to get some gum to get the taste out of our mouth and even that didn't help after reading other people's reviews it looks like they barely had any cardamom so looks like too easy have to find a way to evenly make their coffee sorry for you easy were pretty disappointing

there really isn't much i like about Michael's to begin with, i especially hate them for using my name and underperforming, but this place has been a particular disaster, clean out your aisles for god's sake, i feel claustrophobic with all the crap lying around, it's like the clothing section at kmart but maybe worse

I'm not coming back here, the shoes seem to be poor quality but I haven't actually kept a pair of shoes and I never will because I'll never come back. I bought a pair because I thought they were cute but quickly changed my mind so I returned them. Do you know how many people asked me why I was making them very rude, literally every single person that worked there not only made me feel uncomfortable but they also lost a customer because of it.
The worst enchiladas ever and the setting of an attempt at a Taco Bell Mexican restaurant are a step down, but if you like soupy enchiladas drowning in joy, this is the place for you.

you see a continuing trend here when it first opened it was a featured place but since then the pizza has been inconsistent and going down the hill the last pizza I ordered the crust was soggy and there was too much yeast the cheese was also too rubbery and tasteless. I went to get a small cup of ketchup to get some wing sauce and they said it was pennies, another person came in and they gave him a hard time because he didn't have his coupon on him even though he read the coupon code on the phone, he had that high school vibe, you know the one I'm talking about, I owe you dollars and I'll pay you back tomorrow, that vibe comes through when you park there, parking is limited as is and regardless of how much parking they have, there are signs that limit you to minutes of parking, almost implying that they don't want you to do it. eat there I was too scared to get napkins because I'm sure there was a price or limitation like everything else I ate here many times and came to this conclusion eat there but don't get pizza here they specialize in slice and drink their short slices are well cooked and if you don't eat them hot when they come out of the oven they lose their flavor quickly. moist like a steak, it's a great place for a breakfast or business lunch, but I wouldn't order multiple pies if I was having a Superbowl party or had people over

the lemongrass pork is disappointing on a generous day as they tout their Vietnamese selections as specialties the pork was tough and the noodles were meaner than the vermicelli type rice noodles I was expecting the portions are certainly quite generous I like that you can make your own rice bowl this is the direction I recommend if you come here

the pedicure was nice i'll give them that but the lady must have wanted to close the store early that day because i told her i wanted a jedi and an acrylic manicure when i first walked in she asked another customer to come back the next day while i was getting jedi's needless to say i didn't get my acrylic set and towards the end i could tell she was doing it and it was a lie dear i want really say for removing my nail polish i would give this place one star but they did a good job on the pedicure not coming back here
it's great if you're in a hurry, they have slices and salads ready to go above average quality and a nice open space too, perfect stop before or after watching a movie next door

this goodwill is good i went to improve their selection is ok cleanliness is ok and organization is ok all goodwill prices are the same as far as i know the staff is helpful and i never have trouble finding someone if i need help

what happened to this place the first time I went there about a year ago the food and service was excellent the second time last time I ordered the same dish and it was horrible drowning in sauce but at least the service was ok I just went a third time and it will be my last. Halfway through my meal after I asked him in the meantime I counted at least one staff member hanging around the kitchen which is open so you can see them and half of them were folding napkins. My food wasn't very good and actually made me a little sick. It's a shame, especially because there aren't many places in Pox that offer vegan choices, but for the price you pay, I would expect a lot more.

stars only because the house margarita and guacamole were so good the food was ok fish tacos however the atmosphere on the patio was a bit dull I understand it's more of a bar than a fine dining restaurant but the patio tables had no condiments and just cheap metal tables and chairs also there was no music there just this incessant hum of an alley generator the service was a bit sporadic on the patio also we were asked by three different servers if we had one server but not much organization maybe the management just hasn't managed to fully organize and furnish the patio yet. I hope they do as they are in a great location and the food and drinks give them a lot of potential.

I tried several different kinds of pizza and they were all good. A few people had told me they made amazing pizzas, but I didn't really think they were very good pizzas. What I liked was the fresh tasting vegetables that topped some of the pizzas. The cheese was a bit disappointing, especially since I don't think you can really go wrong with the cheese, it just lacked flavor, overall I probably wouldn't go backlit, it really wasn't that impressive.

first time ordering a squid salad that had a strong onion flavor and a weird taste being brought up on Vietnamese food, the strangest food has been in my mouth but I think this falls into the category of acquired tastes, I never took a liking to this pad thai, it was okay, the noodles were a bit over seasoned, felt like I should eat them with rice to tone down the flavor, the papaya salad was good looking of this authentic unwatered down version but just like my friend's mom makes it yum thai omelette good the people were really friendly too which helps but you know I'm all about the food I had to go and the box for the squid salad read happy carimali salad I love it

I first visited Daily Dose about a year ago after a night out I was only able to stomach a little coffee and a few bites of breakfast nachos that morning so I wanted to come back for a real sober meal, alas they made a better impression on my first visit. to the front patio and a waiters station but I gave up my son knew he wanted a cheeseburger and I ultimately opted for the anchovy corned beef sandwich with sweet potato fries yes it was going to be a cheat day our waitress seemed weird and lacking personality she didn't take our menus after we ordered and there was nowhere to put them on the small table so they ended up propped up against the window same thing with our cups in paper that we had brought from outside, they sat next to the menus for the entire meal, the wait as our meals were a bit long in my opinion, about a few minutes during that time our waitress was completely mia and our drinks were almost empty, luckily the guy who finally brought out our food was nice enough to refill them, so I thought the corned beef rubbed with anchor chili spice and topped with sauerkraut on rye was going to be bomb of spicy and tangy flavor, but not at all, what the hell do you do to the sauerkraut to make it bland, how do you make these delicious ingredients completely flat honestly, I was pissed, I wasted so many calories on this sandwich, I ate half of it because I was really hungry but didn't even bother to bring the other half home on a more positive note. The sweet potato fries were excellent, I felt unsatisfied. the tastiest part of the burger was delicious a few minutes after our food came out, the waitress finally came, I asked her for a box for my son's burger and the check she brought us at the speed of light. I was very surprised to find that I would be charged for a glass and a half of weak, lukewarm iced tea if I had known that I would have ordered a Hecate Light for the same price anyway, I had the distinct impression that she wanted us to leave so that her table could be re-seated with people drinking and rack up a larger bill for her loss, as I usually tip very generously when I go out with my son overall I was completely disappointed by the daily doses of food service and value and disappointed by my Yelp review which deserves only stars

I was really looking forward to eating here because I had read good reviews, maybe we had a bad day, they were very slow but it took way too long to get our food and they messed up my friends order. I had a carne asama chicken and fish tacos, the chicken was the best, I didn't care for the carne asama or the fish, I guess the fish tacos are far superior.

I had very high expectations for the breakfast because many gave it stars which means as good as it may be boohoo according to yelp, my experience wasn't up to par but I'm willing to give them another try. This place used to be a bar that was converted into a breakfast restaurant. The current bar is still there with a flat screen in the middle, but surprisingly the shelves are still empty to the ceiling, they've only been there a few months so maybe that will change as they settle into the location, it has a very clean upscale feel. this is something that is not out of place in north Scottsdale, it is also easy to find once you are on Raintree then north straight it is on the right and shares a parking lot with Golds Gym which is easily visible from the road. I found the eggs good and I recommend heading towards the omelette choices from the south. covered in sausage gravy, the pancakes were not served hot with the other foods and they seemed to have settled and were a bit soft and springy. The menu was pretty simple and plain with divided boxes with a nice highlight of their stuffed apple crepe. I thought the description of the ham falling off the bone was repeated far too many times. Prices were very reasonable for Scottsdale. The freshly squeezed orange juice was excellent. give it another try with your friends and family

the Mill Avenue Farmers Market is the bantamweight of the valley farmers markets weighing in pounds in this corner of the valley we have the Mill Mill Avenue Farmers Market getting ready to haggle when we arrived around morning there were about stalls one with small sized produce comes to mind.
