I say the Mill Avenue Farmers Market had a great game today at the Kiwanis Red Center and is now celebrating over gatorade and granola bars in the picnic area. You get the idea that we left for coffee and came back about half an hour later to find more vendors.
the buns fall apart and you end up eating your burger with a soggy bun. The staff don't seem to know what's going on and they aren't well trained and can't think for themselves.

I had a quick Asian salad, I read the ingredients no peppers, I'm allergic, awesome, I ran like to terminal B to grab my connection and sit down to eat, there were at least red pepper slices that I had to choose from, that usually does the trick, I guess since it was packaged it contaminated the rest of the salad, yeah, instant allergic reaction wouldn't have wanted to sit next to me on the plane, it was tasty, fresh and fast, please check your labels white, spare me and others who may be allergic to unlisted ingredients.

this would actually be another star experience but i went ahead and rounded it up to the stars because i'm in a good mood, we came here after going to chelsea kitchen down the street which was super crowded for the night, i get easily annoyed by the free valet parking because i almost never have cash and i feel weird if i don't tip the boys and girls, but i digress from the concept and look of this place is really fun and different, it felt like a modern barn, we went in and put our name on the list and I was surprised that it was. it's all done by an iPad and you get a text message when your table is ready, good thing and I remembered our phones otherwise we would have been out of luck, the wait wasn't horrible, we went to the bar and had a few glasses of wine. The bartenders didn't seem really eager to help us, which annoyed me a bit. lots of tables in a small space but at the expense of the customer our waiter was friendly enough but not as friendly as with the group of ladies that sat next to us nothing like treating all your tables the same eh we ordered an appetizer the yucca chips which had a decent flavor but were a bit burnt we ordered main courses which were a chicken dish and their version of spaghetti and meatballs the wait for the food wasn't bad either but i hate it when you as a customer have to ask for a wine list because your wine was empty for a few minutes but the waiter didn't ask you if you wanted anything else because he was focused on the women's table next to us sharing an appetizer. I had the pasta and the meatballs, which was me, the pasta was a little mushy and the meatballs really didn't have much flavor.

they don't have lunch specials on the menu and won't tell you about them if you don't ask, so make sure to ask that the sandwiches don't come with fries and their fries are overpriced because they aren't very good. The pulled pork sandwich is good and so is the sauce, also expect a long wait especially if people are ahead of you.

I wanted a restaurant within walking distance of our hotel so I chose this one, there was nothing bad to complain about but it really wasn't anything to write home about either, there were better restaurants to choose from.

aside from the treats you get an adorable and stylish interior that is very comfortable and pleasant to live in and fun to people watch to boot, it's a bit pricey for the drinks which I think comes with the territory

it is what it is, no frills, good reception staff and overall cleanliness, I felt safe and the bed was comfortable, I will tell you my favorite thing about this place is the bar bar at the end of the parking lot, breakfast shouldn't be, it should be included. I did, however, have a fantastic breakfast sandwich at the Safeway just down the street.

ordered a large cheese pizza the crust was ok not very tasty the pie was covered in a pool of grease this pizza had a bland sauce and very little it just seemed like minimal effort had been put into the pizza this pizza is not worth a second visit

let me tell you the bar at hand is one of the nicest bars in Phoenix, this sparkly square shaped thing gets an A on presentation and they make great cocktails, the rest of the place doesn't agree with everyone so much, they have a great concept for a place where they left the skeleton of an old department store intact with a completely unusable second floor, but the results aren't spectacular. we won't get steak here, prime rib, a good grouper fillet, maybe with such a nice space and prime location right in the heart of downtown I think the hands could step up the work in the food department, it's like this place doesn't know who it wants to be a neighborhood restaurant or a fancy dining destination
If you're looking for a dining experience in the deli area, you're better off going to a real sit-down restaurant. The fried meal style food in the deli area is substandard at best.
good but the salad wasn't as good as I remember, I still think it's a great place in Scottsdale

seriously, the best quesadilla I've ever eaten was big and gooey with just enough browning on the outside of the tortilla to make it a little crispy, bonus it was a little cold outside so it made a great hand warmer. Why only stars, ok you have to sit at dodgy outdoor picnic tables and I don't want to think about the cleanliness of the kitchen, but the entertainment value of watching drunk people stumble around while waiting for their food can't be beat.

after a bad experience i will never come back it's terrible because they didn't meet my expectations and the price is outrageous the hardest part of that is the red broth from hours of preparation and it tasted like water i had to add all kinds of condiments to save it but i can't even eat it the restaurant is very slow now and this confirmed what i meant with an asian restaurant if your fellow asians don't frequent the place it's because your food didn't respond to our expectations, try across the street to Kim Thanh rice plate for their rice dish it's day and night

We went here for fabulous use as the restaurant is often empty Julia, although it would be nice to give them some business but in the end it was our group who ended up being given the business. The words highway robbery come to mind, but I guess we weren't actually on the highway. The prices listed on the menu really didn't seem out of place, a little expensive, but nothing alarming. the sauces with stuff in theme had shrimp, one had chicken, one had pork and one had chihuahua oh wait I think it was the cheese on top anyway the plate with tablespoons of sauce wasn't worth it, oh wait we got some the waitress also managed to slip us two orders of guacamole for a piece as for the starters the portions were small and the food was nice of me the mole was way too much sweet for my taste, the biggest disappointment of all was not the alcohol to match the appetizers it would have been much better if they had been washed down with frozen margaritas and a few pitchers and they could have slipped us some flan regardless of the price and the food was mediocre, it was well worth going for the amazing company of the wonderful assistants in Phoenix, I don't think I would go back for the food though

I went here a few weeks ago and had the sesame chicken. I was disappointed when I saw that it wasn't chicken pieces but a piece of boneless chicken that was breaded, fried and then cut into strips. The sauce wasn't that good anyway, I won't come back.
slowest commute ever

two stars for bad service and damn I have to tell the truth, lousy appetizer had to start with the braised leeks which seemed to have been made less leeks and more of a fromage blanc which I can only assume had been left to congeal into a rubbery mat under a heat lamp, it was literally impossible to cut into detailed pieces and was tasteless, then after at least half an hour of waiting the chanterelle pasta the rooms were great and I have to say I enjoyed the fennel for the first time in my life but the pasta was huge and there was loads of it but one of my friends had the fried green tomatoes which were wonderful and another had the Russell sprouts also wonderful and the caramel pudding dessert with the nutmeg whipped cream was just divine they were very busy our reserved table was a few minutes late and the seats were still warm when we sat down so I think they were just mad to their feet i would give them another chance oh and a delicious arizona avignon blanc i was told they only serve arizona wines which is pretty cool

you would think that with today's economy it would be easy for any establishment to hire semi-intelligent people to run the register. I went to Sprinkles to sample some of their fall specials and walked into a scene that was beyond depressing. My first experience with Sprinkles was when I lived in Los Angeles, you couldn't get a cupcake without waiting in line for at least a few minutes. at best I ordered cupcakes, no rocket science, there was another woman waiting for a big order, at least a few dozen, the dingbat who called us tried to charge me for cupcakes whoa, are you sure they're mine, her response was is your name Susan no, it's not she gives me a blank stare like she's seen a ghost, so it's uncomfortable, I gently nudged her telling her I think my total should be in the range, I only have cupcakes, the label says you have a dozen, I can't remember the exact value now Red Velvet, remember the theme the shirts try my patience, it's always Susan's order, oh duh, now we understand after all I take the cupcakes home and they are drier than a disappointing popcorn fart

I have no plans to return, but based on how we were treated by the kitchen earlier this week, my rude self doesn't really feel welcome anyway, but I'm not entirely convinced that's my loss, it had been almost a year since my first visit to Breadfruit, which didn't overwhelm me, as you can judge by the fact that it took me a year to return, but I enjoyed the Caribbean food option since a friend and I were going to be in town for an event. supporting locals by offering them the opportunity to purchase wine at the nearby public market and waiving the already reasonable corkage fees was a bonus as we had really enjoyed a few wines from the bastion of Arizona at a recent fob wine deal and thought they would pair well with the Jamaican heat while the scallops were delicious and perfectly cooked as per scallop is a bit stiff in my book, we also shared the jerk chicken salad and jerk shrimp on the grill, here are the ultimate rub from the bottom of the menu does not indicate any substitutions or modifications because when is cutting a kfc sized corn on the cob a modification at the same time the menu describes the restaurant and it offers like nothing out of the ordinary just good food that nourishes and rejuvenates the body it is like cutting something in half so we can easily share it especially after the plate has been delivered to the table so we can appreciate its beauty and after communicating to our server and demonstrating with the first two courses we are splitting the items is in the vein of nothing out of the ordinary how about providing the customer with a proper utensil to cut it themselves then the fact that the chef stubbornly refused to cut the kfc sized cob of corn that came with our entrée screams pretentious and grandiose and tainted our entire experience to quote my dining companion you are not James Beard and James Beard would have cut the corn

well it dropped me a star and I'll tell you why I ate there probably in the last quarter I had all you can eat bowls of sushi, beer in the desert, I ate alone, I ate with Sandra Kate, I ate with my son and family including my one year old grandson who plays the drums with the drumsticks, I had a party on Saturday for the yes's otherwise I can't not complaining, there are bright spots first, it's close to my neighborhood, a start and there is more than sushi and it's useful when you don't have such lovers with you the bowls are very good and you can order them in the heat index, you like funny names, like the take out bowl or the classified bowl with this description, don't order this bowl of squid salad is super super super calamari ok hey they put a lot of thought into their selection of beers and it's cool and their dessert sushi is very unique because for sushi now there are way too many sushi restaurants to try and they are all rushing for your business. the economy continues to slow and people, let's face it, are moving backwards. This isn't a place for a sushi purist, but give me good food, a cool gathering place near my central Phoenix abode and I'll be there. The sushi needs to improve so I can get a higher rating and win my business.

I've lived here for about months, the place is okay, I guess the floor is clean which I like, but the staff seems a little disorganized, they got the move in dates wrong which thank goodness I'm an early mover and didn't wait until the last minute and then when we finally moved in we got a different apartment than we were originally shown. breaks our shower broke twice the closet light broke the wall the bathroom light fell out of the wall the stove and washing machine have all been broken since the time we moved in last May the only reason I give it stars is because I know there are much worse apartments but my house still falls apart when I go to the office I feel like they are always trying to rush me because I can finish my questions it's really boring so be careful when looking at these apartments when looking for accommodation

so yesterday morning i actually had a craving for the press, i was in the mood for a smoothie for breakfast, my traditional breakfast of oatmeal or yogurt wasn't going to do the trick baby wanted something else, i head to this Jacinthe box that is close to work, i order my strawberry banana smoothie and i am quickly told that the machine is broken, it sucks, i go up to the window and the person tells me that the machine is leaking at least I think that's what he said, but it would take about a few minutes and it would be up and running now, knowing the smoothie issues I had this morning I don't think the machine was broken, the product just wants to be ready for now

my god I should have run for the hills when I walked in and saw people working there with electric shears in their hands I refuse to call them stylists I mean all I wanted was a cut for my one year old just a straight line I hate to see her take a sobriety test

i just ate the ice cream at that time, i didn't know where to go for ice cream, it tasted artificial, much like everything else, there was also a strange feeling about the place, too subconsciously cute, suspension of reality, almost like a crime was imminent, like a bad show, looking at the rest of the food was almost disturbing, like school cafeteria food, but worse, well, it discouraged me from eating anything or for the rest of the day.

I've never written a review but the food at Havana Café was so disappointing and not at all good that I feel obligated to share it. I ordered the Apollo polls which actually were a pile of salt with a side of chicken and rice. I opted for Arrow Con candles instead of the white rice because it had been years since I had that delicious Rica puberty side, the whole thing was almost inedible. I came home and brushed my teeth immediately, it was so bad my husband had the polls. Cuban, which was equally disappointing and nothing we couldn't make ourselves at home. The restaurant gets an extra star for the wonderful Cuban coffee and extremely attentive servers. I had high hopes for this place, but next time I'm craving Cuban food, I'll head to Cuban Workers.
Many people have graciously reminded me that a bruin is a type of bear sorry guys I'm a native we don't have bears here in Phoenix with the classic of a happy school system

when I walked through the swinging doors around noon on a Sunday, I walked into Hooverville, I think of silicone fake tans, bleached hair and teeth and caked on makeup and the men here overdose on testosterone, full of volume and attitude, think of side baseball caps, ripped jeans, flip flops and gold, even at noon on a Sunday they were out hunting, they joined me in alienation. I had the buffalo chicken sandwich to match the theme here, it was the biggest brisket I have ever seen, the sauce was super hot and flavorful, the baked beans had a southwest twist with cracked pepper, my friend had the chili which he said was slightly spicy, but not hot.

I highly recommend this place for two situations: you're on the west side of town and want reasonably priced food, you've never had Vietnamese food, and you want to try it in a non-intimidating environment for both of those things. Pa is great, nice people, decent food and very friendly environment, but their food doesn't measure up to the standard bearers in central Phoenix. I guess their score is artificially low due to the category they compete in if they were the only game in town I guess I would have rated them a lot higher just to get my hands on a barn every once in a while

I was very disappointed with this place I had driven far to get here I live in Gilbert I had the picket beef menado and the adobe pork their portions are very miserable they are overpriced and their food wants very good tasting or authentic at all the only thing I liked was the adobe pork
we had fun but it's definitely more for children and younger people. The pretend store was fun and we all had a great time playing in the noodles.

amazing, so angry and dismayed that I took my or my old mother to the salon for a manicure after the pedicure she got the manicure and she asked for advice in French the daughter claims she asked mom if she wanted gel nails she didn't understand the girls English and couldn't hear so I guess she nodded after mom paid the fee and I came to pick her up normal fees are added for French and he said to come back because it was a mistake we made and the whole group of techs said it was the mother's fault for saying yes and that she would not concede at all, not at all. I thought it was horrible and Mum felt very exploited. I will never go there again and I warn hearing impaired customers not to use this business for me and of course mom it was such a slap in the face the elderly mother is a visitor from the east coast and at her age does not need to be treated this way. very bad deal

There are few things I can't stand more than eating out for pizzabytheslice, it's slices so big they contain a whole day's worth of calories and charging extra for traditional toppings while I understand the appeal of this centralized pizzeria, a slice is the pizza itself, the crust is a few inches tall and the pizza itself is barely an inch tall. did not appear to be working properly during their stay, including their ice machine and sound system cutting in and out. I was also not impressed with the fact that I never really heard what the employee said before making it seem like a chain of a few go to their website and you will realize that otherwise this location is franchised. I won't come back unless I don't pay instead I will try one of the multiple fast food options in this area

I'm a fan of a themed restaurant, I've wanted to visit this place for a while because of their whole gimmick, when you arrive a nurse checks you in, gives you a hospital bracelet and seriously dresses you in a hospital gown. I love a gadget more than the next person, but the heart attack grill is a gadget and only good food. The menu consists of burgers that vary only in the number of patties fried in lard. We were completely disappointed because we wanted to order the huge burger and split it different ways. We ordered plain burgers. One of our trio boycotted the burger because of the no sharing policy. Unlimited fries, vanilla shake, coke full of sugar and one by the burgers were ordinary. yeah I get it, it's a gadget heart attack big lard waitresses dressed as nurses cook dressed as doctors sweet beer whatever, it gets old pretty quick

I went here this morning for breakfast with them to use our living social agreement. We had been to Black Bear before about years ago in Glendale, and then again maybe years ago in Washington State. The last time we went we weren't too thrilled with the place. Anyway, we decided to give them another chance and it was pretty okay. I liked that this was an option on their menu because most places only have one vegetable scramble recipe and there are tons of vegetables added with no reason for those vegetables to go together. Anyway, breakfast came with a ton of country potatoes which I liked more than the typical hash browns. In some places the service was also good but I thought it was so weird because our waitress kept calling us kids and calling me honey princess and honey. I find this somewhat condescending, not that I think that was his intention, but I think it's unnecessary. but I know people like giant portions, I would probably come here again for breakfast sometime because it's reasonably priced and has decent flavor.

really mixed feelings here I met a friend here on a Thursday about the place was busy but we were able to get seated straight away as it wasn't totally full and even not being at capacity it was incredibly loud naturally I expect a beer bar to have a relatively high volume but this place was ridiculously loud to the point of being annoying the beer selection was good although I'm not sure that made up for the volume and atmosphere which seemed a bit off very lit and the decor was of the variety of signs bought new but made to look old almost like some kind of fake bennigans and why, oh why, a place that specializes in beer and seating, so many people only have one urinal and one stall in the small men's restrooms, I hate queuing to pee, but then again, maybe I'm aging happily by the way, obviously I have no experience with women so I can't answer that, sorry ladies I'll try again even though the food wasn't good it probably won't be a regular hangout as it's not near me and it wasn't worth going out a way to consider how many other beer brew bars exist in the city with better ambiance

I must have looked like a poor ugly person the other day, seriously, no one helped me, no one even said hello to me, I was there for an hour too, I decided not to buy anything because the service was so bad, it's a bit like operations, I didn't kill my wife, but if I did that's how I would do it, if someone had helped me I would have bought cutlery, rugs, chargers, napkins and napkin rings. even say hello or ask a girl carrying a ton of cutlery if she needed help, so I just put everything I had gathered over the hour in a pile and left, you are welcome, the employees hope you had fun putting everything away, I also hope they work on commission and regret not saying hello to me

well everyone there is pretty nice i got some gel tips from them and i beat them pretty bad at work and they hold up like they should they were reasonably priced there is an asian lady i really like i forgot her name although my fault i also got a pedicure from them too they did good perks cheap good selection of colors nice people tv available though some of my tips are longer than others when I had a pedicure the water was so hot it burned my feet and they came out of the water looking like cherry tomatoes every time I feel like give them the tip from my visa they almost seem disappointed because it's not cash I don't have cash and I won't start anytime soon the language barrier but it's no one's fault the massage Jedi chairs are made for people bigger than me sigh because the cons outweigh the pros it gets stars but you still get really good service considering the price you pay and I will continue to give them my business because the lady who gave me the pedicure was really nice and she did a really good job getting rid of my calluses and it didn't torture me too much I'm extremely ticklish

apart from the very good happy hour prices it's hit or miss with this place more often a sad failure the food is below average the drinks not strong at least they are cheap but the service is really hit or miss I will pass

I enjoy coming here with a group cooking our own food and playing in the sand April evenings and can be great as can September and October the winters are a little cold after sunset and summer I don't need to explain that there are no good deals on food or drink but I come for company and I don't really mind ordering a few pitchers and your food to cook then pretend you are at home with no service required.

I wanted to love this place so much, I had heard good things about the food, I loved the concept and was looking forward to having a wonderful experience, what a disappointment we were seated within about minutes of arriving which was great given the crowds, it was nice to have a place to wander around and we were able to help ourselves to tea and coffee while we waited once seated, but it took a few minutes for someone to take our order and another for the food to come. the scaly home fries were a bunch of mushy potatoes and not seasoned enough we were offered jam when the food arrived but the waitress never came back with my husband asked one of the other staff if they had jam received a curt yes in response but they didn't offer to help in any way for average prices plus for a self serve drink. but there are lots of nice patios in Phoenix with much better food and service

humid, I don't like it, I didn't hate it, I was indifferent, I like the decor and if I could give it half a star just for having an outdoor dining area, I the menu left a lot to be desired for me, we went there at lunch time so I don't know what the dinner menu is like, it was just ok, nothing blew me away, it's nice for people watching and it has a very nice location.

don't get your oil changed at Walmart or any Walmart, we did an oil change and they dented our oil pan and now it's leaking and they don't take responsibility for the damage they caused. I only had my oil changed last year here and they are trying to pass it off to someone else when clearly no one else has done our oil. Walmart insurance won't even look at my vehicle and had already decided they were not at fault. I had a third party evaluator look at it and they cannot determine that it is from an oil change. I have no choice but to consult a lawyer.

mixed reviews from my husband and I his comments the salad was good we had the spinach and gorgonzola salad the pizza was really good but overpriced plus it was the thinnest type so you wouldn't expect to pay that much the servers not good atmosphere nice enough has a my type feeling too expensive to go back my comments the salad had too much dressing it was dripping with balsamic stuff I don't like the soggy lettuce pizza was just ok it was good for us served quite quickly considering the place was packed but it wasn't hot plus we had to flag down our server to ask her to reheat it, she didn't seem very happy with us and didn't apologize for the cold pie after all this place is called humble, the pie servers are not good, not very forthcoming with the menu and only seem interested in ordering with the staff should be humble enough to ask the customer if everything is ok once the food is served which never arrived even when she brought the check, we didn't have anything too loud atmosphere and the dark tables and chairs are tight in this place so plan to share your space. with others not in your group, we definitely won't be returning, we paid plus tip for a small Caesar salad pizza with three toppings, a soft drink and a glass of wine, too much money for sister food

have you ever had lean kitchen chicken enchiladas have you ever been to a super obnoxious sorority party where all the blonde bimbos are tanked and dancing on tables and have you ever been totally ignored by the waiters and bar staff even though you doused yourself in lighter fluid and set yourself on fire so you went to San Felines inferior to mediocre food except for the grilled fish tacos so the stars don't aren't when I was living in zero, I thought this would be a cheaper, less formal place to hang out with my mom rather than grab a quick beer here, I'd rather stay home, eat Doritos and watch a sorority movie, what do Kristin and Pierre say to me yeah, that's me

I give this review 1 star in total if I could, I would have rated 0 stars, I would never recommend anyone to live here, the office staff are horrible and made me feel uncomfortable the entire year I lived there due to their mistakes. I can't express how disappointed I am with the way they treated me.

I enjoy falafel and my boyfriend really likes gyros, so when we received a coupon for Daphnes Greek we were excited to go check it out. What I noticed right away was that it has a sort of Eastwood feel to it and I thought ok, it was catering to people on their lunch breaks, but the food itself is like Greek fast food for people who have never had truly Greek food before and so they wouldn't know any better than the plates are statically nice with everything nicely arranged. well it amounted to nothing for me when I was able to eat, I want a lot of food and I want the quality that is expected from the type of establishment I eat at at Daphnes you get a few small thin slices of what may or may not be real gyro meat the falafel meat is kind of on fried discs, that's right, discs not balls of falafel meat where the outside is slightly crispy and the inside is meaty and moist the pita bread is not it's just flatbread cut into little triangles, the tzatziki sauce is what that stuff is in that little paper cup, the vegetables were fresh, there's more to complain about this place but you get the picture, I think anyone who likes it here just doesn't know what real Greek food is like
it's not a bad place to go but it's not my first choice the food is good but nothing unique or special

I am done with Classic Car Spa, their mediocre car washes and shady business partnerships whatever you do, do not have your windshield replaced by the auto glass shop that Classic Car Spa allows on their premises. I hold Classic Car Spa responsible for placing their customers near criminals, while these auto glass shop men are friendly and seem helpful. my insurance company they still give me a run for it so even if it was free I will now have to foot the bill to fix their crappy craftsmanship after trying in vain to get the auto glass store to fix my windshield. I spoke with the manager of the classic car spa. I don't think I've ever met a manager with a more relaxed and uncaring attitude, this place is a joke except I'm not laughing.

My favorite thing about this place is the decoration, it's crazy and beautiful. I also like that you can get better than average food until late and there are so many places to sit that you'll never have a problem waiting. Their food is okay but nothing spectacular. I lived in Arcadia and miss it every day if I had to go back to Phoenix Scottsdale I would never even consider a different neighborhood in every way. This is the friendliest and most beautiful neighborhood in Maricela County, that being said, the big one represents the lame element of the neighborhood. people with too much money and bad taste, I think someone else called it schmooze and that's exactly it, as a neighbor we usually rode bikes so I can't talk to the parking lot, don't they have the shuttle yet, give me the great escape, or messages any day

much better than the frozen variety, somehow better than the quick service store at the fashion mall in Vegas, from what I remember this place was exactly as I expected lots of people at lunchtime, overpriced pizza and drinks and solo service the pizza I had with a wheat crust that included eggplant, roasted red peppers and goat cheese was pretty tasty I guess when you consider I had a second meal with the pizza, the price wasn't too bad

yet another phoenix joint with hip decor and a solid menu nice gold color scheme on brown soaring ceilings nice marker board to write all over as much as you like the food some of the best glorified bar food in town although expensive sampled several top notch martinis the smoked salmon monkey good chicken burger and sweet potato fries the place also has a bocce ball which makes a fun diversion my biggest complaint is the terrible acoustics it was so loud my ears hurt and I felt like a hundred people were simultaneously shouting a steel drum, we can put softies on the wall or something but then again it's a bar

my nephew just moved to Scottsdale recently, so me and a group of friends brought him here to show him a local bar where he and his girlfriend could come and play pool, watch football play volleyball, etc. annoyed too but didn't say anything then happened, she said you better behave or mom will be fired, holy shit it works even worse, shame on this owner for allowing this to happen and this employee needs to recognize this, you work in a barnet, daycare

an ugly coyote but a cool place the ladies were friendly and there was one who could seriously dance her ass off on the fayum even though I was the classy black symbol and had a great time except for the one lady who seems to get attached to me weird to say the least overall a cool place be warned don't try to take pictures in this place they will hunt you down and arrest you especially if the ladies are playing at the bar a big none

this place needs a facelift, the whole concept and decor is outdated and needs help. I think their sushi and other food items are okay, even though they try to be so hip and in reality the menu is pretty bland, it's a fun place to have a drink and sit on the patio, but the excitement and trendiness of this place is completely gone.

I wish I could rate negative stars with so many choices of bars, this place is by far the worst. Last Saturday a group of friends went out for a friends birthday party in Scottsdale and decided that if we split up we would meet up at the end of the night at the engine boss's house, it was becoming increasingly obvious that the staff was hostile and irritated that they couldn't close up early. extremely agitated at our friend and asked him to put his drink down and leave, my friend started to explain the reason why he doesn't let his friends always in the bathroom, but was quickly cut off. I watched from the patio at the two bouncers both visibly larger in height and weight, then my friend quickly stopped talking, grabbing my friend under the arms and starting to carry him as he was carried backwards, he lost his balance and fell with both bouncers on top of him, the bouncers slammed him head first onto the cement outside the establishment. The establishment pinned him with their elbows and hit him at that point. I ran behind the bouncers and was yelling at them to get off. I had already taken out my phone to call and quickly tried to take a photo to show that they were using excessive force. We asked to see the director. At that point the bouncer said he was the manager and refused our request. the police arrived and took down the information about the bouncers and said they would record this incident. I am absolutely categorical in saying that neither I nor my friends will ever patronize locomotive customers again. We were treated disrespectfully by untrained staff who were either too eager to close to go home or gain high power by manhandling the non-physical non-threatening patrons of their establishment based on the behavior of the two bouncers. I guess this bar operates without any written guidelines on how bouncers should behave. human rights and I intend to write to any regulatory agency I can think of, these people are giving a bad name to all bouncers who conduct themselves within the guidelines of the law

don't eat here if you think a bathroom has anything to do with food preparation cleanliness, there was literally dried feces on the toilet seat and the floor looked like it had never been washed, of course the toilet cleaning checklist wasn't initialed all day, oh I almost forgot there were no paper towels to dry my hands. the gossip burger was overpriced, the milkshake was ok and no napkins in sight on the tables or at the bar. Apparently towels are something you need to ask for because whoever owns this place needs a better manager at this establishment because they are losing money with all the one-time customers who will choose to go elsewhere next time.

Me, I've Known Better pretty much sums up my experience here tonight, I have a sneaking suspicion that this is the perfect sushi place for people who either don't know anything about good sushi or have no taste buds and money burning a hole in their pocket. I didn't really know what to expect from this place before we arrived, I had never heard of it before and the only reason we agreed to go there was because it was close to my boyfriend's house and our friend said it was pretty reasonable in terms of price and quality of food. My boyfriend and I arrived before our friends and walked to an almost completely deserted restaurant, there were really bad techno remixes of popular songs playing in the background and an episode of Dr. Phil on the TV. I sat in one of their ridiculously high bar chairs while my boyfriend went to get us a menu that we could peruse while we waited for our friends to arrive. Most uncomfortable chairs ever. It's hard to describe how or why they were so uncomfortable, but if you've ever been here you know what I mean, they clearly chose these chairs based on aesthetics alone. Anyway, our friends arrived and we all ordered our food. I decided to get the ultimate salmon roll and I believe it was called the sunshine roll. a sun roll and a vegas roll, these two rolls and a drink were more than enough, we spent more than I like on sushi. I would be more than happy to pay these prices for a plate of delicious fish, but what came out was not what I expected for the price we paid. My rolls looked pretty but they were almost inedible. fresh salmon that was laid conservatively on top, I switched to the Anysun roll and it was a bit better but still lacked flavor and texture. The dashiki was just awful, it didn't taste like fish, it tasted almost like nothing and the texture was really weird. finish the plate, the staff was pretty nice, I mean they weren't going out of their way to be nice to us, but they weren't rude either, I'm saying this visit and the food was a total failure. I feel like the only saving grace of this place is that it's clean and it's in a pretty convenient location. I would have liked to give this place another chance and try a few rolls before writing my review, but I was really disappointed with the food. I have trouble even using that word because it was barely edible. I ordered it wasn't the worst sushi. in the world but it wasn't the best at all and with the prices they charge for these lackluster buns I really don't see myself ever coming back here.

so everyone in old town has been waiting for a good sports bar forever when everyone heard Thunder Dan was coming to town the excitement started to really buzz this time Thunder Dan didn't hit that buzzer first it has two stars for a reason so let's start there the atmosphere is great the venue is super cool and there are tons of TVs which about where it stops the food is not great and is relatively slow. I had burger wings, the chicken quesadilla and a few other things that I wasn't impressed with and the service was great. slow, reminds me of the super exciting Sunsbulls series but just misses the mark of greatness, I'm sticking to my old faithfuls two blocks away from the zippers

As I approached the front of the building, I was immediately impressed by the theatrical lighting on the exterior of the building. The lobby is grand ruby ​​red and created a grand ambiance when I entered. They even had large crystal chandeliers. The theater itself is a good size, not large but on a medium scale. My seat for the Christmas production of The Nutcracker was third row center and the view was beautiful. There didn't seem to be room for a band or orchestra, but the sound system was full.

I enjoyed my nights here, the facilities are clean and very well maintained, the housekeeping staff are fantastic, they were not intrusive and they were hospitable, but the only thing that bothered me was the reception staff. I was mistreated. I say this because I asked the reception staff a question about pool timings and the answer I received was are you a guest here followed by because we get a lot of people here so that answer is completely understandable. I should point out that I arrived an hour early with the same staff in the office, maybe it was me. this seems like a retype of self centered person but no i felt like the receptionist was categorizing me because of my age and because of my appearance i guess i just look like the guy who would crash in a hotel pool mind you this residence hall is adjacent to the mayo clinic and the desert yes the only two things within walking distance are this hotel and the hospital so apparently this hotel pool must be the hot spot for pool accidents must be all the sick patients who want to swim in the pool then on the same occasion the same reception staff told me they don't have a bottle opener at the reception there is a small grocery store next to the reception that sells wine, beer, water, sodas and I bought a beer and I asked them if they had a bottle opener so I could drink my beer near the fire pits and they said no it had been lost some time later. a little disappointed that the front desk staff was childish and rude to me, I felt like I was being individually discriminated against, it's a shame too because I love my Marriott rewards card, the rooms are big here, the elevator takes forever, I suggest the hotel adopt elevator music to distract from the slow speed of this elevator

I just want to say that I actually think the food here is pretty good, no matter how brown the guan looks. My problem is the service. Everyone who works here is either lazy or a combo of both on the subway, they at least pretend to be helpful here, they ask you the same questions over and over. don't worry, they should change their name to porthole because it's run by a bunch of assholes
Sherwin is old and not very reliable but he's a really nice guy, I'll give him that too, a very good optician

le duce is a disaster as an Arizona native and downtown local, I'm looking for cool and interesting places downtown, I wanted to like this place the first time we tried le duce, I was extremely disappointed with the customer service, the parking is atrocious, it's like you're bothering the staff by asking where you order food, they were out of everything we wanted to order so disappointing, but I decided to give them a second chance, all world had a rough night we went to an event there last night entertainment by scandalesque was amazing same terrible customer service from duce management staff must wake up great concept horrible customer service and staff

i waited for mad man characters to come in seriously, went there last night for the first time, ordered the stuffed lobster stuffed with crab scallops, lobster was tougher than nails, scallops were tasteless, crab was ok, charged extra for this stuffing, but neglected to tell us until i questioned the bill. what I can say is the bread was excellent, I wasn't going back, it seemed the crowd at the bar was well over and the crowd at the restaurant was mixed, reservations weren't necessary at all, the place was empty

for my husband and I on a Saturday night, Grimaldi's turned out to be pretty lousy, the restaurant is well decorated and the hostess was friendly enough but the pizza itself was so boring that I seriously took one bite and wondered if I had completely missed the slice. I will say I tasted a lot of garlic but that doesn't count for much when the pepperoni is bland and the sauce is useless now I'm a deep girl at heart but I had an amazing thin slice at a classic Italian pizza in Tempe this place made me feel like I wasted my money and I would never bring anyone here again including myself

the service was quicker than some of the other but better Indian restaurants I've been to in the area the food was solo nothing special I enjoy spicy Indian food but the hot wasn't the only reason we ate there was buy-one-get-one-free in the Phoenix area coupon book no it was good value

I called the council dump to ask if I could come over this week and interview them for an English newspaper about a small local business and the owner was incredibly rude, she wouldn't even let me finish telling her it would take five minutes of her time, instead jumping in and telling me to go somewhere else when I explained that I had heard wonderful things about their business from friends and it had piqued my interest, she told me to go somewhere else, I'm not never even been inside and I'm sure I won't go now, maybe it's just me but I don't like shopkeepers. who growl at their customers

ez buffet is a Chinese buffet that recently opened in my neighborhood, it was about to have dinner, the place had a bunch of tables so it was easy to sit down, you can also get takeaway, they have a lot of food to choose from typical Chinese dishes, as well as sushi, fried chicken wings, roast beef salad toppings, fruit pudding, they also had ice cream for dessert, not soft serve ice cream but hard ice cream. I love the scallion chicken, pork and their freshly steamed green beans. the place is worth a try if you go please write a review i love knowing what others think
absolutely horrible, these guys have no idea what they are doing
I will never eat here again the sandwich was meteoric and overpriced on top of that I was charged more than I was told the total was horrible first experience

after seeing her win on Cupcake Wars I was determined to find this place, it is very well hidden and taste the cupcakes, I have to say I was not impressed, I make better cupcakes myself, more creative and not so sweet, you will go into a diabetic coma. I had a California, but also and it was a good sandwich although the bread was a little too toasty for my liking.

I received two more messages from Yolanda this morning, I thought some of you might enjoy reading them, I'm definitely never going back south, I hope this information helps some of you bow down, don't you just love orangeheads dishing out insults, it's so much easier when you hide behind a mask a few minutes ago, obviously the rebuttal is not your friend but jealously your neighbor it A few minutes ago I thought the drink was for your gentleman friend but you're the one who had to give up, you really shouldn't have your picture posted pug, I mean, easy tarts go to the yuppie west side
descent food of course it's not authentic free chips salsa woman though

I have dined there several times, the bar is great and the drinks are decent, the outdoor patio looks cozy and inviting, it has a large outdoor fireplace, the indoor atmosphere is busy but fun, the food is always good, the fish and steak tacos are fantastic. look if this bothers you too, stopped going back, very inconsistent dining experience, overpriced and extremely uneven service, waiters seem completely untrained and unaware.
My mother always told me that if I don't have anything nice to say, don't say anything.

we went there for dinner in April the dishes are hit or miss and all are overpriced my wife ordered pad thai and it was horrible instead of the traditional savory dish with peanuts and bean sprouts this flux dish is just a salty chicken noodle my wife and I both took a bite we had to send it back it was not edible too salty only chicken and rice noodles there was no peanut no bean sprout no pepper no of egg no basically it was not a pad thai at all positive my son ordered a sweetsops chicken and it was better than most places where they used fresh pineapple based on the quality of the food, ambiance and dinner prices. I say there are tons of other places that are better
more than the food, the place is cute, what it looks like from the outside doesn't do the inside justice, very Americanized Asian food, so if you're looking for authentic, don't come here

stars if you're rich and like to throw away your wad one star if you're on a budget and think plastic surgery is terrifying stars if you like to window shop, gape at the snobbery and scoff at the fact that some people will spend on an ugly brown canvas handbag with little ones printed on it because it makes you feel good about yourself stars if you go during a megasale weekend when normal mall chain stores have bath and body clearances but they also have a hm overall if it's a show see for better and for worse in the end it makes me want to escape to hills where people value the important things in life and not the brand of your sunglasses

we were excited to check out this new restaurant we were extremely disappointed we sat at the bar to watch it would have been nice to be able to hear the game over the discordant pop rock music at a Mexican establishment but I understand you are not a sports bar it was Monday night and except for a large group of blue hairs celebrating secretary's day the place was empty the bar managed to fill up because the cardinals were there and it seemed like the high tops and patio were as well busy. The bartender Amanda was very polite and eager to sell us their flavored tequilas and specialty cocktails. You can tell she was a little wet behind the ears but she was trying her best, nothing a little training and experience can't fix The wait time to receive a cocktail was excruciatingly long, although being a former bartender I understand the complexity that new bars have to develop new and unique cocktails. as much as I could Tola had to offer so we ordered the salsa trio and the Quest Chicken Tortilla Soup Cold Habanera Dip sweet with a quick kick after quite a bit of guacamole good but it was gone after the bites I guess they feel if they place the guacamole on a bed of shredded green lettuce it will seem like there is more than what was delivered. The white and dark meat chicken exploded Amanda offered to take it off our bill but I insisted on finishing mine because I was hungry, I pushed hers to the side and meanwhile while we were experimenting with our starters we managed without cutlery or napkins and at this point Amanda being the only bartender who managed to be inundated with specialty cocktails in the well thus not being able to properly supervise her customers at the bar. The crumpled black napkins used in place of the real ones were all in tatters on the edge of the bar, waiting impatiently for a bus boy to remove them from the starters. I ordered the carne asama steak, my girlfriend tried the chicken habanera platter which was delivered to them by Tola's manager Joe who decidedly opted out of enjoying the football match to speed up the food. and politely piled them up for our fictional busboygirl to remove properly now in my story with management a decent manager would offer to remove the crockery collection but instead he decided to ask us if we needed anything else because the look on our faces was disgusting. We opted instead to inform Joe that we would enjoy our meal a little better with cutlery and napkins. the waiters who informed her that what she needed was more important than delivering two setups to some new customers so they could enjoy their increasingly cold food at this point my girlfriend's temper got the better of her and she jumped up and grabbed her own cutlery from a table in front of Joe and a waitress eager to salvage any heat that might have been left in our entrees we were digging into carne asama was tender but lacked the wow factor the habanera chicken tasted like a brisket of chicken smothered in their hot fire roasted salsa what happened to the habanera where is the heat bland i hope they get better but until then hands have never seen joe touch tables never offered to help a bartender who was swimming in an olympic sized pool every now and then the servers would come behind the bar and help us this is about the time our starters chips soups and starters were all taken out of the barton fri joe's stand the hostess can stand alone you don't have to stand there and maintain it, keep an eye on your staff and customers and offer help where they need it so people are happy to come back and give you a second chance

We came here on a Friday night, my husband ordered a dirty martini and it was so dirty it looked like a glass of olive juice with grenadine in it, it was actually red and it was the first time in his life he spilled something. and the heirloom tomatoes they weren't if they're not in season that's fine but tell people when they order we still had the special cannelloni with sausage sauce nothing special here the kicker they charge for the bread no special bread just bread and for the parmesan to put on your pasta in all honesty they give you a piece of bread with your pasta but if you want more you pay let's be serious the name of the restaurant is a pasta bar and you charge for grated cheese, it's like going to a sushi restaurant and paying for soy sauce or a burger and paying for ketchup, cheese is currently on the menu as a side, are you kidding me, we're not talking about special grated cheese, it looked like something from a green shaker bottle, I wanted to add salt to our appetizer but there wasn't any on the table, I didn't have any didn't ask because I was afraid they would charge for that too, I'm actually surprised they didn't have it on the menu, we won't be going there again
I've been going here for years and it's pretty much the local circle staple, not much to say, I love the traveling beer cooler, but I also wonder who the hell buys the banana bags

My boyfriend and I were looking for a dive near our house in Old Town when we just weren't feeling the typical Scottsdale vibe, I have to tell you I think we found it, we wandered over on a Thursday evening just to have a few drinks and take some time to talk. I immediately realized this wasn't an old town bar. nice foggy which was great because it was the day before July and everyone was pretty stuffy, the drinks were stiff and not too expensive and the crowd got younger as the night went on, I didn't meet a ton of people but the ones I did meet seemed drunk super friendly or both not a bad combination. incredibly cheap cover and drinks until someone breaks the seal I'll be rubbish but I'm sure plenty of people took advantage of this interesting special drink

a very good sandwich shop my boy and I stopped here after a movie in the morning they have a neat concept with the bags on the wall where you mark your items my only wish is that they had cold sandwiches as well as the grilled variety I'm not always rarely in the mood for a grilled sandwich the Italian sandwich I had was delicious no no no

I decided to check this place out after receiving a coupon in my Savvy Shopper magazine. I'm a fan of all the little self-serve yogurt places that are popping up, but I have to be honest, this place is no different than any other, be careful not to overfill your cup or you'll end up paying a lot by the time they weigh your dessert.

normally I have had great food service here but on Father's Day Nicole H was just horrible, rude, slow, unhelpful and just a total failure, another food delivery guy took out food and auctioned it off, I didn't know who had what and asked for a refill on my empty water glass but he didn't bring it after a few minutes and Nicole didn't notice so I had to talk to him about it.

this place has a lot of potential, I really want it to do well, I went there Saturday night with my husband around noon and it was packed, good for them we felt a little out of place as it was a much older crowd in capri shorts and flip flops. no one makes an effort anymore in this part of town I guess anyway we had a nice stall but it was right opposite the pizza oven so we were quite friendly nice waiter good busserfoodrunner keeping our waters filled we decide to try the bruschetta for a starter and the Riley dinner for two for an amazing price the bruschetta was quite good and good value and with good mozzarella and balsamic drizzle was tasty les reyes on the other weren't that nice but I have to point out these meals were each, what did I expect the steaks were big and tough, my husband said his old taste, yuck, mine wasn't that bad and the potatoes and vegetables were tasty, our thoughts assuming we were running this restaurant would we have offered a much smaller but better quality piece of steak thinking we were saving in our opinion on quality over the quantity each time we ate we were able to keep an eye on the drama with the staff, watch how hard these boys in the kitchen were working, it was really busy and they all seemed to be working well as a team leader included at one point, a lovely young waiter came back with a few plates to the manager, I guess someone sent food back there and burst into tears ah we felt so bad I hate when customers make the waiter cry and if the food wasn't good, how the hell is this his fault, major points from the manager who gave him a big hug and went to tend the table. I was impressed also by the live music which was very enjoyable, we left feeling like it was an ok place that I liked better than my husband but something was wrong, maybe they are having an identity crisis, are they a wine bar or are they trying to have good food anyway, I definitely want to go back soon to try something else on the menu, if only for how nice this manager was to the waiter I worked in the industry and were treated like rubbish in the same situation, so well done, your staff looks happy

nothing like capriottis in other cities, they don't have the same menu offerings as east coast places and even though I ate here when I wasn't busy, it took a very long time for the food to arrive. Parking is also frustrating due to adjacent Starbucks customers taking up so many spots, a very poor selection of chips, and only two choices of actual chips.

ok the potstickers were pretty good i didn't really know what to expect it met my expectations the lychee pork was good and worth the second helping the selection was impressive and the stuffed mushrooms had an interesting stuffing spam was it some sort of sausage or other processed meat which made it a delicious surprise
the food is good, don't take the kids even though the kids pasta was without accompaniments

ok, this was very surprising because it was just voted best food in the southwest in pox mags Best of the Valley magazines, so that made us want to pay a visit. I love the southwest woods. I was very disappointed with this place. I feel like I should give it stars. no, I got the salmon that the waitress recommended and it was so disappointing that there were way too many conflicting tastes that didn't seem to mix at all. I lost my appetite after a few bites. My boyfriend had the shrimp tacos which were just average. We were really disappointed once again. The crab cake appetizer was great and the two margaritas were also the tontorita and prickly pear, both very very delicious, but overall if the smallpox man keeps recommending more lame meals I'm going to have to start using it. as wrapping paper instead of a guide to good meals in this city

wow the waiters were a bunch of stuck in original corsets, they didn't eat but wanted to see the crowd on a Friday night, they blew a typical crowd of gym jockeys in affliction shirts, two sizes too small, ladies from the end with enough twos to watch early and a few lost items stretching to pay for a drink, the cover band made an easy decision to bail and save the night at Eddy vs with good oysters and live jazz from real musicians

I went here for a business conference, granted, I just came back from a really nice place in New York, but I was still expecting something amazing since it was called the Grand Resort. I have to agree with my colleagues, it seemed a little old fashioned. I didn't like the rooms. There was a baby sink and mirror, junk bar in the living room that just didn't seem to fit. very helpful I needed a sewing kit to fix a button that came loose later I had a little thread thing some baby scissors and a needle the drinks and food were very high we ended up walking to a small Mexican food restaurant nearby I don't think I would go there again

since I worked at a casino I always look at others and enjoy gambling, this place is nice but seems to lack personality, it's new so it's a very clean wall, new machines, the few employees I dealt with seemed extremely bored and a drinking girl was nowhere to be found because this place is new and on the edge of the pox zone, they don't have to try very hard and I think it shows

if Einstein Bros is the gold standard for stars then the buggers barely earn any stars the customer service is poor only one girl I've seen multiple times smiles makes eye contact and seems happy to work here everyone is embarrassed by the fact that I'm here if you order a simple cream cheese bagel you'll be fine they're not bad but nothing special if you order a bagel sandwich make sure you bring a napkin because they leak a lot and become soggy after a few minutes, the coffee is ok but nothing special in store cleanliness, the drinks counter with the lids and coffee creamers could be better and is often messy and sticky. I noticed there was a duplicate entry for this place so I'm sticking this review on the other one as well

worst slow service ever especially with hardly anyone in the place the food was average at best and that being kind avoid it if you are looking to eat or have a drink just an update as well as a friend who wrote a review of the day have been contacted. I would

It is with great regret that I give House of Tricks three stars. I have been here twice the first time friends invited me and my wife here for dinner seeing the patio. I thought oh that's really cute once I sat inside, I thought oh that's really cute when I saw the prices on the dinner menu. work colleagues in tow, the lunch prices were certainly nicer and we were all looking forward to an enjoyable meal, suddenly this gem of an exchange happened between our waiter and my boss Debbie Debbie, how big is the quiche, I weigh pounds so I'm a big girl, we laughed, Debbie loves to joke, the waiter, well it's not as big as you, bad shape dude, bad shape, you're lucky we paid the lunch menu prices
the only good thing about this place was that the bartenders are on their game, otherwise leave it to the Jersey Shore wannabes and shooters who get turned on by extra extra average shirts

I prefer this location in Senora to the one in Scottsdale, the Chandler location is less busy and more spacious than the scouts location when I first started going to this location I thought it was great because the staff was much more helpful and willing to give samples. I now find the staff a bit annoying, they are great but as the hours go by I look at something they come over and ask lots of questions or try to get me to buy a particular product it gets a bit annoying having the smokey eyes pointed at the main thing. I go out at least three times every time I'm in the store, I love Senora, no matter where it is, it's heaven on earth for most of us girls, yes the products are expensive, but they are quality products that you can't get at the drugstore. hmm, this review must seem confusing. I say I prefer this place, but then complain about the eagerness of the employees.

bags is a great little place and I know that doesn't seem like a bad thing at least if you are the owner but it's a bit too busy for me I can never find a parking space or seat the sandwiches are good and I like them but I admit sometimes I don't go there just because of the crowds the food is good I like that they have a variety of sandwiches and they put a lot of stuff on the sandwiches that can easily be removed for picky people like me unlike others places where things are mixed in and not removable if you are looking for a tasteful sandwich this is a great place to visit if you are looking for a nice relaxing lunch where you can find a seat to move around
everything was average, quite clean, the Leo bank had too many bean sprouts, the proportion of vegetables to meat was bad
the food was ok it's a little expensive I liked the big wooden boat they served our sushi on it's not my favorite but I don't hate it either
my wife stayed here during the transition to Arizona and enjoyed her stay. The hotel seems modern and they are currently renovating the place so far so good with the improvements.

I have eaten at quite a few yogis grills since they started opening in Arizona a few years ago, their chicken teriyaki is pretty good and you get what you pay for, but two things no matter where I go the service always seems to be poor, it seems everyone who works at the yogis grill just doesn't seem interested and doesn't have the ability to be friendly. ridiculously overpriced, I can go to bona grill which is a good restaurant and get much better sushi for almost less. I just can't get past the price of their rolls and they don't taste much better than grocery store sushi. I will always go back for the teriyaki but not the sushi, it's just not worth it.
great food and awesome service, even better that the chef came and personally checked out our experience, I will be back for an even more delicious stay

so my eye has been bothering me for months now and i decided to go there to have it checked again yes again i went there when it started and if there was nothing wrong here are artificial tears lump ok months later i still have pain so i call and ask for an appointment with another doctor i show up there fashion min early check in put my ass on the chair and wait and wait again for the total minutes ok i have had worse wait first so i walk in and a super obnoxious lady asks me some questions and leaves then the doc comes and does what he does over there of course there's another elderly chick there for some reason just standing there looking at the geese what's up with that so anyway stars for the long wait and the super nasty stuff where they found these witches anyway it's ok
contemporary atmosphere good range of Italian dishes attentive wait staff portions generous prices reasonable food good I will return

I am an avid quilter and moved here recently. I'm looking for a new quilt store and went here despite the name being grandma's quilt store. The staff were very nice and helpful and friendly. The store is a bit small, which surprised me to find that they have a very decent selection of contemporary fabrics. kinky fabrics and home dec too, I will definitely go back

note to others, check the zoo hours before going, apparently they close on a Saturday when the weather is nice, maybe that's an obvious closing time for everyone, but we were definitely disappointed, I guess there were a whole bunch of things we missed seeing and some of the other exhibits we saw were closed for a wedding, I guess it's cool to get married in the orangutan exhibit or else the orangutans get married were marrying maybe those antigenic marriage people were right in that it would lead to animal marriages anyway, we all know that's not the case. Best of the zoos because it's very hot half the year and it's not very pleasant to subject a lot of animals to degrees but it's a pretty decent selection, they have friendly staff, it's clean and they have free parking. Damn I love me, free parking, learn more by pressing that button, things didn't work, at least one water fountain didn't work, but hey, it was conveniently next to an overpriced soda machine like most other zoos, they make you exit through the gift shop so your little ones can skip the car ride home. crying about how they didn't get x overpriced toys, a stuffed animal, I think if your kids are young enough you could probably just take them past the ticket window and check out the animals you can see under the bridge, the water, those ducks, fish and turtles are free to see and anyway, what age needs the whole menagerie

I had breakfast this morning while waiting for my windows to be tinted on my car I had a build your own omelette I got it with chorizo ​​peppers and cheddar it was pretty good and the portion was big for the price they had fresh squeezed orange juice also not the best breakfast I've had but it was good

I'm a steak lover but I have to say this wouldn't be a place I would recommend our steaks were poorly cooked, they tasted pretty bland and we sat in the restaurant for a minute before anyone asked us about the drinks. The drinks were and were supposed to be top notch. entertaining, I wouldn't recommend anyone to go there, there are many other options nearby that will satisfy you
stars for the ride through everything else this starbucks leaves you wondering why don't you get back in your car and drive down to the other starbucks on Daisy Mountain

us egg is located right across the street from Dennis, a nicer and fancier environment than Dennis but the quality of the food is similar, slightly better and a little more expensive, the service here was really friendly, but I ordered the triple play pancakes, eggs and bacon, but I replaced the regular pancakes with their famous protein pancakes which are filled with blueberry oatmeal and cinnamon bacon and the eggs are still good, hard to mess up. poured onto the griddle actually ruins the fluffy texture I enjoy every time I eat pancakes if you're really into breakfast and brunch and don't want to eat at a national chain restaurant it might be worth checking out this place, just temper your expectations on the protein pancakes

no if you ask me about eating at papaya thai thats what i will say stars for the one staff member a little scattered and scruffy stars for the cook who can't prepare an offering from the menu as the menu describes in this case i was left with two untried thai restaurants near the valley metro limo and both in tempe the other half was in tampa and since he doesn't care much for thai i have a chance to try some one. hooked me up with another limo on Broadway, traffic to get to McClintock took almost minutes getting out of the limo. I walked about half a block to the restaurant upon entering the restaurant. I picked up a menu and rang the bell and a slightly worried member of staff came to greet me. He asked me where I wanted to sit at a table with a bench facing directly onto the side of a huge fish truck. Contain people in the first three tables near the door, you have to do your business in spurts and keeping only the active tables works for you, but again you're telling me you're the only staff member, that doesn't surprise me. The help wanted sign on the door was more than an indication that help is needed when I was seated. The staff offered to bring water. Thai, I have already experienced the traditional Thai meal, everyone enjoys every dish served because of my proximity to the aquarium. I was pretty up close and personal with the fish. The water is probably not dirty, but the plexiglass tank doesn't help the perception. As the cell phone chime reminds me of the passing of an hour, I wait for water and a staff member who can take my order. he refilled my glass and asked if I was ready to order I said I was and ordered som tom the Thai name of the green papaya salad the staff replied that he did not know the Thai names of the menu items the phone rang again the staff's attention was no longer on me the phone his Pavlovian stimuli had taken him away I asked him if he had heard me he replied that he had to go answer the phone he Asked me if I minded waiting as he was the only staff member I said I would wait he left looking for electronic interaction, afternoon staff came back apologizing for the phone delay and asking me about my order. I ordered the papaya salad without the green beans and steamed rice on the side. The staff took the order and went to the kitchen. The phone rang as he left the table. His pace quickened as he approached the phone. The door opens and potential customers enter, the bell rings and staff rush to the resistance to greet the new customers. which has no place in the salad, som tom has no cucumber shredded lettuce or cilantro when returning the original preparation the staff came back with the original preparation informing the chef said it was a traditional Thai presentation of the dish. I know I got up and left while the advert in the window of the establishment says they have the best curry in the valley, they won't get a second chance to prove it to me. Despite all the phone activity, no one came to pick up a takeout order between him and the somewhat frozen staff. I wonder if this place is a front for a drug trade.

a little surprised by the high prices but I thought the trendy factor in the old town and the atmosphere was the reason because the small portions of the food and the quality is just good like good egg not great not bad just good no happy hour and too dark inside lots of pretty waiters my first suggestion would be to grill the may tacos and not beat them they were not that tasty the side dishes of street corn and potato chorizo were very good I wanted to try the guan but dollars for an avocado with garlic and cilantro, how about trying to make a good one, my husband and I thought the rubies are great in comparison, we love the shrimp tacos and the Pablo and Portobello tacos

these were definitely stars and I'm rounding for a few reasons that I'll now elaborate on. The area could be in any sheraton anywhere in fact it is surprisingly similar to the rum fire the trendy restaurant at the Sheraton Waikiki where I stayed for a few days this summer before my family arrived and we stayed moved into the family home the floor the red circular lounge the live music on Thursday night was all the same even the menu was the same the difference was that in Waikiki there was a Hawaiian side to everything and the live music was much better and good Sure, the beachfront setting, I feel like they're trying to sell themselves as a downtown restaurant more than a place in the Sheraton, but to be honest, it's your quintessential trendy hotel restaurant. the charm of a historic home but I also like the clean, modern lines we selected a few small plates or starters depending on which menu you are looking at the crab cakes were good if nothing less than predictable and the chips and dip were surprisingly unique a dill dip and french onion dip provided a nice departure from the usual spinach artichoke. price of the hotel, I think for me the area will remain just a place to have a drink and small bites. I'm not going to lose my mind over this place, it's not that great, I'd say it's pretty generic but the staff were friendly and it's within walking distance of my house, I'm sure I'll come back for a drink.

I'm from New York and have been living in Phoenix for a few months. This native is within walking distance from my hotel. I've been going there for about two months on Friday and Saturday nights for drinks and karaoke. Food was ok. The drink specials were good and the service was also good. The problem is that when a confrontation broke out at the bar, the staff did not respond quickly to notify the police. before and after the episode they said they hope it won't affect me not to come back, not even a return or something like that, just an I'm sorry for what happened, I won't come back at all, I looked at my nine charges on my statements and saw that I spent for their loss there

I'm torn about cream, I've been to the usual clubs and lounges in Scottsdale enough to get sick of it and cream was something new. I like that Cream imitates Vegas style nightclubs but it's obviously trying too hard. the walls are covered in white leather the tiles are white everything is white I get it white like cream I appreciate the commitment to color but the theme is very different the hard surfaces make the place look cold and very hospitable like I would have liked to see softer lines and softness in the design more fluid like cream the atmosphere loud music and techno I'm so tired of hearing the same stupid songs on the radio I love the change of scene phoenixscottsdale is so bland in terms of music it's a nice change but it's too loud when you can't even order your drink i literally had to hoist myself onto the bar i'm tiny to be able to give my order directly into the bartender's ear they also had a really cool entertainment number a girl hanging from a hoop hanging from the ceiling wearing a white bikini she was clearly good at handling her hoop and was fascinating to watch but as i said, this place is tiny and there were several instances where she was inches away from kicking people and it would have been worth the ridiculous cover I didn't charge for, I'm trying to find a way to not drink overpriced and horrible drinks, maybe the bartender thought she heard me say I wanted a glass of piss vodka because that's what it tasted like. I doubt there will be any improvements that will make me like the cream better, but I hope

why for me, the repair state of the games made it a journey of discovery, for example with a 1 hour unlimited card I could figure out which machines were actually working, I'd rather have a broken machine than something that is unplayable, but maybe I'm just unlucky to have hit the games with glitches in my first few plays, the ghost recon gun on the left won't hold steady target jumps anywhere in front of it, the need for speed, carbon has a intermittent brake pedal that won't let the car go too fast, mechwarrior head unit, horribly slow jump frames hydraulic jerks broke after playing, can't get the steering on the left side of the jack, gave up and played Malaga after that, happy yeah, left and right fire that works, variety is dull, gunshot driving and oh shoot and drive that's about all you get with rare fighting games, not a single vertical horizontal stroller

Total bait and switch sales will tell you one price over the phone then give you another price when you arrive, this has happened to me personally times I have purchased from Scottsdale BMW, one quote, one price done, buyer beware

it's ok good for a quick bite i don't understand the almost cult like follow made a mistake and got the shake instead of pop and was sick for hours the staff was very friendly but they needed someone dedicated to keeping the place clean
the large fries are good but that's probably it, I had a turkey burger that didn't taste much better than something I could make in my microwave.

I feel bad giving these stars but I'm basing this on other burger restaurants in the area. I recently had a fabulous experience at Limburger which is why they get nothing but stars sitting at the bar and ordered the cowboy burger and adult chocolate milkshake quite expensive and tasted just like a regular chocolate shake, the burger bun on the bottom was extremely mushy and didn't get eaten overall. I won't go back
