ok, let me be honest with you, I hate paying full price for anything yes, I'm one of those people, I love coupons, I love discounts and I love a good deal, but I don't like feeling dirty when I leave a store. discolored, not sure of the original color, parts of the store floor were sticky, many of the clothes had indiscernible marks, probably from the dirty sheds and shelves they are stored on, they were skimpy, there was not a single shoe bag, sock, wallet or home decor item that caught my eye. The trip was a waste of an hour that I will never experience again.

they are really slipping now with dinner you get coleslaw you can upgrade to soup or salad for more really i have never heard of coleslaw as a bonus before having the french onion soup it is actually better to imitate they put way too much cheese the bread is pathetic and there are almost no onions in it the prime rib comes with very weak horseradish and cut with butter i have never heard of it previously luckily I had sour cream with my baked potato and asked for raw horseradish so I can whip up mine wasn't the best but way better than butter the bbq chicken was ok I've had better from diners they didn't really season the bird just threw bbq sauce on it at least it wasn't very dry I don't think I'll be coming back to this one no
I really wasn't impressed with the service or the food

I have been back to this place several times after my last review, the wait service was always inconsistent, especially with the stupid waitress whose restaurant was often out of food a few months ago, the stupid waitress didn't tell us the appetizer was out until the end when I started the inquiry. not only us, the food came out quickly and the taste was good this time, they were out of eggplant, we didn't tell them that the ranch supermarket was at doorstep, so diners I still consider this place a good choice for authentic food, I will give stars this time

I say I've been to the clubhouse several times a year for the last five years or so, does that make me the most knowledgeable person in the room, definitely not but there are some very common themes among the shows I've seen here even though the artists were different genres, different crowds and even at different times of the year the sound quality is terrible. If the band isn't happy with their sound they will be very motivated to play, maybe this is a slight observation but it seems like the only bands that come back to this venue are the ones playing music where sound quality is, let's say, sacrificed or, just as importantly, metal hardcore thrasher hiphop, whatever you want to call it, the venue is also hot. great advice, the last show I saw here was in June, I know it's Phoenix in the summer, suck it, but when you leave the venue and it's visibly and much cooler than inside the venue we have problems. Can't they afford to run the air conditioning? The answer to this question may not be that the bar is understaffed and customers seem to be lining up all around, sometimes you have to spend money to make money. can sell more which means you will make more money which concept hates just destroying a business but I hope they take the feedback constructively until then remember if you ever wanted to hear the artist you are going to see in a stocking format here is your chance if you ever wanted to give up wearing those pants I support you and lastly you should create a clever way to hide a vial as you will not be served although it may be difficult without stockings

stars I have to say I'm a total fan of their golden wing zips gotta love their reverse happy hour ordering their wings over medium heat is smart move their wings are already so flavorful and sweet it's a shame to go any hotter because you'll mask the inherent crunchy juicy flavor I say pass on the fish tacos and if you're into a burger place order the jalapeño burger sampled their beer quite a bit of breakdown golden wing zips a must try fish tacos yawn the sweet potato chips could make the jalapeño burger taste again Overall it's a relaxing place with better than average bar food
i love the charm of the place, i only wish they had a burger that didn't taste like mush and yes i have tried this place many times wanting to like it

the decaf coffee was the best thing here, a large cup of super hot and tasty white flannel hash was a miss for me the flavors were too salty and way too garlicky for my taste the service was polite but a little slow for how empty it was if you like garlic and a heavy hand with salt this might be your place

came by for a manicure and as soon as I sat down my manicurist started speaking in fast Vietnamese, I couldn't see her headset so I thought she was talking to me but obviously that wasn't the case, in fact she never looked at me during the super fast manicure except in confusion when I said I didn't want her to cut my cuticles, just push them back, she really didn't understand that and asked me in a broken english why I was getting a manicure but I wasn't getting my cuticles cut, she had no attitude about it but I was really confused, I think after this exchange she mentioned it to the person on the phone, I also thought it was strange that she asked me to wash my hands after giving me a hand massage with a motion, which defeats the purpose of applying lotion to my hands first place, the whole experience was superficial but didn't make me want to come back for a manicure without asking for a great nail tech, but it would have been nice if she acknowledged my existence other than doing my nails and especially if she asked me if I wanted them cut round or square because I wanted them round, I would have interrupted her phone conversation to tell her my preference but she was so quick to plunge my hands back into the soaking dish that I didn't see what they were like looked like

I love browsing Buffalo Exchange, but every time I bring clothes in for store credit, I'm disappointed that they seem to give you very little credit for good items and they are very picky, so I clean out my closet, take it to Buffalo Exchange, and come back with the things discouraged. I put it on my floor and it stays there making my room dirty for months. are in season, so don't clean your summer dresses before the wedding if you don't want to have to take them home

I wasn't really very impressed, the radio isn't bad at all but it's definitely not really great, the prices were a bit high for what you get and all keep in mind it's Mexican food was strangely sweet for some reason that struck me strangely the burritos and such served in a very chipotleesque manner but for a few dollars more than chipotle I don't think I'll be returning not because it was an exceptionally negative experience for me

I went to try it yesterday morning the service was solo it wasn't too busy and it took me a while to get noticed and I'm the curls the coffee was great I ordered the eggs, pancakes, sausage patties and bacon strips as everything was fine except the sausage which had a special flavor the bacon strips were thick and tasty the eggs were ok and the cakes were very good with an interesting twist instead of the normal butterball on both cakes there was one on top and one between the two cakes made for easy the butter on the bottom cake was worth trying again it could have just been a day off for the sausage I wish it was closer to home

I decided to visit this place for lunch yesterday, the decorations were very modern and I really liked the outdoor atrium that you can eat in. I ordered a burger and my wife had the hot chicken sandwich. My burger was good, nothing amazing but hey, the wife enjoyed her sandwich, although she overlooked the fact that the guacamole was spicy. I think this might be a good place to come for wine and appetizers, I look forward to coming back late on the weekend, the open kitchen is a bonus.

I'm not going to complain about the quality of my manicure they did a fabulous job however their customer service was a little disorganized and they just couldn't get it right, it took them forever to help us since we didn't have an appointment and aren't regulars

I work in fine dining and this place would have failed any buyer, the waiter never showed up and was negligent towards us. Food portions were so small. I was very disappointed that they charged so much. Management was scared and hesitant to check us in and mostly paced the restaurant, dreading any social interaction. the big chunks of cheesy kale were tasty if I ever go back it will be for their bar only

my office moved around the corner so i was driving and saw the sign best sandwich um no if you want i can go in there and show you how to cook a chicken cheese steak first don't pack it and let the sandwich sweat and make the bun soft and chewy second put some meat on it it was bun it should be toasty and crispy and the price of the chicken cheese chips and a drink is are you kidding me for that price i was hoping for it best I ever had change it capriottis or word will get out and it will all be over in this very difficult market
it's the kind of place where you can be sure the employees won't spit in your food, best taco bell I've ever been to
a knockoff of Mehdecent Filbert, but the place seems like a major health risk considering how new it is, just think Filbert with less quality control and smaller portions

oh it was not good food not tasty too expensive not tasty food if you are going to pay for a crab benedict it should taste like crab and not be cold too busy too long waiting too hungry to change other items tasted at our table didn't get much better reviews can't remember what others ate actually there wasn't much to remember

we had planned a happy hour here last Friday night, I had heard good things so was really looking forward to having fun with good friends and good beer, unfortunately I was radically disappointed, the service was absolutely terrible, the question of what you have on tap shouldn't be hard to answer. look around if we wanted but she didn't think it was possible to accommodate a group. We asked about the floor and she told us there was a private party and there was no room. A friend of mine came up anyway to see a perfectly open table with cute chairs. us i waited tables for four years and i consider it a no brainer with such a big party and such a hefty bill to offer separate checks before i could even ask the single check was abandoned with a tip added at strike three the food was average at best i had better potato skins at ti friday it's a shame because this place is a cab ride from my house and i really wanted to like it i will make the drive to rule on this place any day

The main reason we missed out on a star was that the one we ordered, the lamb with mint, was a little dry for my taste and no mint at all to the taste. For dessert, we had the apple one and it was much better. I would like to try another one another time and compare good environment and for groups friendly staff who would explain to you what they cook.
pretty nice for an airport bar, I just had a Bloody Mary but the food looked good

thai really i love thai food and i couldn't be happier to try a new restaurant wow it was a slap in the face on so many levels the hostesses were the rudest i have had the displeasure of having to interact with we ordered take out and while we were waiting for the food from the kitchen the hostesses made us feel uncomfortable like we were imposing upon entry the food was not spectacular we ordered the pad thai was very dry but not horrible the sweet and sour beef was watery and more fajita like with way too many peppers no sticky rice green papaya salad laboratory

now that this place is under new management it has improved, I went there once before and it was a bit nasty now, it's cleaner and has a better selection, it's hard to find edible Chinese food in Phoenix, this one is one of the best now, I think it's renamed Fuji Buffet, it even had a sushi bar, not a sushi eater, but it had one and everything was as fresh as you would expect, great selection of shrimp and chicken, pizzas and things for kids, stay away from desserts even though it's not that great

I don't understand, my husband, daughter and I went to eat at the restaurant because we saw a menu at the hotel we were staying at nearby. The menu mentioned that the show for drive-in diners and dives had done a show about the place and pointed out the menu items that were highlighted on the show and were supposed to be delicious. I knew how to direct someone to get there from the hotel after several times explaining the side streets and the name of the hotel we were staying at, explaining that we were just north of the highway and that we were about to give up. The girl was finally able to give me directions, it was an omen of things to come, the first irritation we encountered was waiting in line and trying to decide what we should order when there was only one cashier. a few questions about the menu, we feel like we have to hurry because of the eager looks from the cashiers, we ordered a variety of things for the three of us, the foot burger, the pulled pork sandwich, the onion rings, the sweet potato fries and the fresh beet salad, with the variety of what we ordered you would think at least one of the three of us would try something we liked, but the only adjective we could come up with for everything was blah, I'm not exaggerating, we were all starving and we're not picky eaters, but we just couldn't get a good bite of anything. Also, when I placed our order, I asked for add-on orders of onion rings and sweet potato fries, but the cashier called them full orders, which I didn't realize since my husband paid the bill without knowing it should have been cheaper. Our bill to us was equal to what we would pay in a restaurant with someone serving us. a few small pieces of grilled pepper and the base cheese, the burger was so plain I don't even remember if it had any greens on it, no, I would describe this burger as dry and blah, the onion rings had such a crispy exterior that it really hurt our mouths to bite into them, plus the onion pieces were so thin you could barely taste the onion, it was like eating a basket full of crispy fried breading, the potato fries soft and the white potato fries were also just blah. can you ruin fries after much thought we decided it must be the type of oil they were fried in it was just tasteless even salt and ketchup couldn't help these fries the pork sandwich was just ok as was the coleslaw there wasn't much to say about them. why the weird sweet and sour flavor combo, there is only one drink machine and condiment bar and it's outside so to refill your drink or get your napkins and ketchup you have to go out the door and wait in line then try to get back in the door while juggling everything irritating. just bored and frustrated trying to get a good bite in, we even tried to fix stuff by dipping our fries in B sauce and adding ketchup to the burger but we just couldn't fix it all, we left feeling ripped off, sworn to never come back and decided we deserved to stop for ice cream somewhere on the way back to the hotel to get that irritating sweet and sour dirt flavor of our mouth, pay attention to details would be my recommendation to the staff at this place because everything really adds up or take away from the dining experience, we were overcharged, irritated by the atmosphere created and the flies and we were still hungry when we left. I am submitting this review because I don't want other people who have never eaten here before to be fooled by the food network. show the hype like we were. The only reason I gave two stars is because I love the concept of farm fresh and wanted to give the place credit for that.

We have a friend who raved about this place, so we went for a sandwich before a movie recently. I have to say I had an excellent Ruben sandwich which I was very happy with. I'm not sure I'd venture out to the area just to have this sandwich again, but it was super tasty.

I went to this place once and the owner tried to sell me a big box to ship a guitar for dollars. My wife has already been there and the guy is really laconic and surly. He has hired young people who seem friendly and helpful. I had to pick up a fax from an insurance agent there recently, but I wouldn't go out of my way to do business there

I feel like this is strictly a local central Phoenix bar, anyone coming from out of town probably wouldn't enjoy it as much as a local until they started coming here. I've heard it's a grandma's bar, which it certainly is, but plus on the weekends you'll only see one or two hanging out. Its karaoke place is almost always extremely busy, leading to long wait times to sing, but that's okay because the people there are pretty friendly. is high on drugs, I wish they would do a better job of deporting these people. My second complaint is the very small and generally dirty toilets. I like this place because I know the bartenders and people who frequent this bar, others may not like it as much.

on an evening stroll down Roosevelt Row during the monthly First Friday event I heard what could only be jazz funk coming out of the door right next to me and someone sitting in front of us invited to listen to their free music event once inside the wife's and I was greeted by the snack bar ladies asking if we wanted one of their cookies, candy or soda in the bottle we got a diet coke for a the nash a decent sized room with about four tables to sit at none of which are particularly better than another, the tables at the front being the only exception, the music was good if you like jazz music like me, but I think the band playing tonight put on a strangely slow paced set with more blues and experimental jazz than I would have liked to hear given how many people were coming out during their set. It was First Friday after all, this place could really use some cool and maybe even some gang. I guess music is subjective and changes event by event. I think they could really improve the quality of food, snacks and drinks. The venue seemed more aimed at a teenage crowd, especially since their food choices were chips, candy and no adult drinks in sight, although I don't see many teenagers running out to listen to a night of jazz, I could be wrong, but if I find someone worth listening to playing nash, I'll probably leave again. but I don't think I would randomly come over for a happy Yelping Phoenix jazz night, I can't get enough of this funky stuff

substandard food overpriced never encountered a cheeseburger didn't like until now not liked small portions tired room temperature fries chicken tenders with bacon burned so bad they couldn't be penetrated with a fork poor service didn't bring kids meal cookie waste of

I love greasy burger restaurants, so I wanted to try the smashburger. I took my order to go. The store layout is different than most burger joints. The service was rather minimalist. The service was quick and I received my food in a reasonable time frame. It was hot and cool. I ordered the smashburger with everything and the smashfries. overall it was just ok, it's not a Lenny Burger, I prefer to go for the burger then the smashburger, the fries were crispy and flavored, they were good when I first saw them, I thought the portion was rather small but when I took it out of the box they came in it seemed like a normal portion, I won't avoid the place if people want to go there, I won't make a special trip

a friend and I stopped here today for lunch, for some reason I thought it was a strange choice but seems to go there often and enjoy it. In fact, the woman taking the order told him not to stop by today, looks like he's famous in the Whataburger world. The people who work here are very friendly, if not a little disconnected. I ordered a Whataburger with cheese and onion rings and a small drink. but since it's onions, lettuce and tomatoes fall everywhere, the meat was dry and lacked any particular flavor, the onion rings were very generic and rather soggy.

I ate here for the first time a few weeks ago on a Friday night Saturday morning after seeing a show at Tempe Improvement. I arrived around midnight and the place wasn't very busy. The waitress was quite nice. near the kitchen and noticed a guy in the back washing a stool in a sink near where the food was prepared. Needless to say, I won't be eating at Mermaids anytime soon

I tried my first quota burrito last night, I went with the Quest steak burrito, the burrito was hearty with lots of meat, rice and beans, topped with pickaxe and cheese and sour cream. My wife enjoyed her chicken burrito bowl with similar ingredients. I've eaten many burritos, from taquerias to burrito chains, the quota falls somewhere in the middle. and we were in and out for our takeout order within minutes

Heard a lot of good things about pets, I'm from the gulf coast and didn't expect to find anything that could compare to the delicious fried seafood back home, I'm glad I set my expectations. The pet fish is ok, square, almost like processed, but not strange, but the tasty fries taste decent like the typical oneida frozen fries. The onion rings were good, super fatty, although my biggest problem is that I'm a bit of a traditionalist. the red sauce is good with their fries and rounds and maybe shrimp but not on the fish, that's the only sauce they have. I hear the burgers are good and I might go back if I'm ever in the area to try one. I wonder if they have mustard. Maybe they're trying to do too much here. the prices are very reasonable but they only accept cash. I would not make any effort to eat at pets again.

although I love the food here it seems like the service is really hit and miss a few nights ago and after waiting a few minutes for my food I was informed that they were out of what I ordered and then they were out of forks and fortune cookies, that being said when they have my order the food is still fresh and tasty the management seems to realize that there are issues as they provided free starters and such when we were not happy in Overall a decent place but we may have to start trying other places.

my husband and I ate here for lunch as we were waiting for our room to be ready we arrived early the restaurant is very welcoming and I liked the decor we had a great window seat the view of the outdoor patio and the mountains in the background was lovely the hostess was very friendly and our server was attentive and quite friendly I ordered the beet salad with goat cheese with grilled chicken and it was quite good although I really liked it I would only give it to her because that they didn't use roasted beets believe they were the canned beets are still good but the roasted beets would have knocked it out of the park the salad had spinach sweet goat cheese tangerines red onion and delicious candied pecans with a balsamic vinaigrette it was a very good salad I wish I had ordered the small portion as it was a large salad my husband ordered the grilled chicken sandwich with fries the fries were so good the sandwich was just as good but spicy because of the roasted pablo that was on it netnet it was a very good lunch but I can only give it stars because it cost us a salad, a sandwich, a soda, I had a watering tip for lunch, it should have been exceptional, not just very good, I understand it's in a resort but still
they have rude employees it's unbelievable, I try to give them business and I ordered smoothies and the cashier and her employee gave me a dirty look, not customer friendly at all.

Lately I've been on the hunt for a good shrimp po boy, I'm not sure if this compulsion was driven by homesickness for New Orleans, the food challenge show featuring the famous Nola Po Boy joints or both, but it seems like the last few weekends I've found myself dreaming of that crusty bun topped with lettuce, tomato and mayonnaise and fried golden Gulf shrimp. the po boy and I weren't sure when or if I would have the opportunity to return to the town and country mall any time in the near future, the inside was empty but they have a French quarteresque patio with a wrought iron fence and I both ordered the half pb with a cup of gumbo. I'm a bit of a gumbo snob because I feel like I can make it better than any restaurant, but theirs was really good, they had different kinds which were good and it was seasoned perfectly, there wasn't a bite that didn't have meat in it. and the broth was just right, the prawns on the pb were succulent and almost tasted like they were breaded in a beige mixture as the fry was light and airy. I didn't indulge in any libations but they have Anita and a few other New Orleans beer classics. If I find myself in the area I'll probably return but this time I'm ordering a whole po boy.

I love Chinese food and for such a big city I find Phoenix, or at least Scottsdale, lacking in options, either because they aren't the friendliest places or just because there aren't many of them compared to sushi restaurants. of enhances the flavor, I wasn't too hungry and decided to have the chicken fried rice. I have to say my favorite chicken fried rice is from Titties in Scottsdale which not only is delicious but always gives me leftovers for lunch the next day the portion was ok although the fried rice was a little sweet and the person I was dining with had the chicken lettuce wrap which wasn't too bad either the service was disappointing as our food took about a few minutes but I have to say the staff was helpful when I was asked where to get take out boxes as well as a coffee cup take out, I give it stars if after a handful of experiences I had peewee on my must-have list, but with pita jungle sacks metro ruby and nearby, the competition for fast casual is tough and pei wei just doesn't suit me unless I'm really craving Asian food that day

this place was pretty good but I think they may have changed ownership recently over the last few months or so we have seen the food quality and service level drop to unacceptable levels. The food is overall average, the fajitas are mediocre and the drinks are very inconsistent. blvd and find much better at better prices

the food leans southwest and is located near old scottsdale the place has a few patios as well as couches, chairs for seating, a large curved bar with tvs, tons of tequila, the place tends to get busy due to its location but the food is nothing special.

I want to like this place because it's in the neighborhood and there aren't many other options here but it's probably the worst restaurant I ever had the misfortune of going to on my last trip. I sat down to order a beer at the bar. The bartender takes about five minutes to bring me a beer even though the bar is almost empty because he was too busy for me with his time and concentration, he instead spent flirting with one of the servers. I drink my beer and want another. The glass remains empty for about five minutes while he paces. the bar I try three times to get his attention and ask for another one the guy just ignores me at this point I guess they don't want my stuff and I'm just leaving he can have the pennies he owes me in exchange for a tip I just want to get out of here I feel bad when I leave he even got the pennies from me I hope he spends it well on other trips here my wife and I have had the food it's not any better than the service unfortunately i have an english bulldog at home with a poop eating problem and i'm not sure he would even find this food acceptable overall it's just the worst restaurant around and it's no surprise the place always looks so dead in front of anyone because it's just horrible avoid at all costs i wouldn't eat here again but i would give the bar another chance if i heard replacing all the help which the owner of this place needs to clean the house looking at other reviews here I see I'm not alone in my feelings about the service get rid of these people already just sad

I went to this place for the first time the other night. The biggest advantage of this place is that it has its own parking lot with someone checking that you are there for the restaurant. The only thing I hate about downtown is parking on food. A basic dinner of Chicken Pork Fried Rice, Chow Mien and King Pay Chicken, it was ok, the Pork Fried Rice was basic and the Chow Mien was too gooey. the place is good for quick and cheap food, the staff was helpful and nice and the restaurant had a nice downtown vibe with a random birdcage in the middle overall I would try it again but I will try something different on the menu

I just finished my friends meal that I ordered to go actually I just threw it away it was horrible and by horrible I mean shamefully bad and by shamefully bad I mean obnoxious I had a very disappointing experience here about a year ago but I thought I would try again I should have proceeded with caution when I asked the more senior employees at the blockbuster next door what was good and to the person they all stuttered and didn't answer seriously zero out of four could give me a good dish I lived in both Mils Chicago and my ex was traveling to the Orient and we were always surprised at how poor the quality of Asian food was in that area and why people here seemed to like it, it's absolutely baffling. I had the orange beef spring rolls, the orange beef looked scared straight out of the container but when I ate it the texture was all off and the sauce it had was these big clear gelatinous ugh ugh ugh I can't even talk about it like biting into a scoop of cornstarch orange extract I'm still sick from those few bites really and while I ordered the vegetable spring rolls I got what had loquacity burger meat taste actually, i finally identified the flavor and texture as sausage, it was like an asian spring roll with pieces of italian sausage inside, how come for a combo, my stomach turns, i'm sorry, i'm a single parent and i'm usually grateful to have someone who cooks for me, grateful even when i pay, but in the hard times i treat myself and collapse for a yuck inedible it's totally unacceptable shame on you George for offering such little quality control and not aspiring to a higher standard overall no wonder the place wasn't hopping on a Saturday night simply one of the worst meals ever

don't understand Brenda as your server didn't ask us if we wanted another drink after we decided to stick to the starters, she didn't seem to know where the water was or remember we were at one of her tables, the food was good as always

when I heard about this place I was really excited because it's hard to find really vegetarian friendly food in Tempe, the atmosphere here is great and very sunny, it's in a strip mall which takes away a bit but the interior has a great feel. I still want to like the food but something goes wrong every time the black bean burger is good but it comes on an untasted piece of wheat bread that gets all soggy and falls apart everything else is ok but why do they do that it's disgusting to put it on a bun like normal people

which is not to say that Stingray does fancy sushi and happy hours very well, it's the only sushi chain I will eat at, I can't stand the sushi at Bona or God forbid, I've always found the sushi to be fresh, especially the salmon skin roll which for some reason is missing at many establishments. is a nice variety of sushi rolls and monkeys which is somewhere between oh and sake bombers too, we went there specifically for the fact that their happy hour lasts until the afternoon and they have a great patio, we always received attentive service and when you sit at the sushi bar you get free mess and miso soup although their version is rather salty and not my Friday favorite and I had drinks from the yoga sushi rolls to the fried squid and salmon nilgiri for not bad not bad at all the Baltimore location is where you'll find me

after a movie at my mom, dad, aunt's house, I decided to have an early dinner here, I've been here many times in the past, but it's been a good few years since my last visit, I forgot they had paper on the table for you to doodle on, it's always fun. oil my dad ordered red wine not sure which one i ordered the ultimate leaning bellini dad enjoyed his wine had glasses loved my cocktail so delicious for our starters my aunt prawns portifino damaged beef fillet mom who was speeding originally wanted lasagna but they were out for the next hour ugh so she settled for chicken scaloppines myself lobster ravioli my aunt loved hers dad loved her mom didn't didn't care about hers kept eating off our plates I loved mine too I don't know how authentic their Italian is but hey overall we enjoyed our dinner would definitely go back

I haven't tried any food but this place seems to have a split personality tons of TV showing sports so a sports bar at the same time there is blasting club music there weren't many people dancing we went here because the place next door had a huge line a plus is there is a second bar near the patio we stuck to this place to waste myself

ciao is a really lovely place but I can't say I think it's amazing the atmosphere and ambiance is totally five star but too many things go wrong after that to give it an overall five star food. I've been there twice and both times I loved it but it wasn't a love, we had the bruscetta plate and I wasn't really thrilled. except they present the toppings in a strange way, for example if you order the vegetarian rosa pizza if you like zucchini everything is cut into two slices and so on, it doesn't really make sense to top a pizza in such a way to me, I prefer draft beer to bottled beer and everything they offer is bottled. less than we had to wait so we tried to get a drink, the bartender was cool about getting our drinks on time despite being busy, our current server was super attentive at first then lost for a good portion of the time too, hit or miss, ciao is a lovely place with a great ambiance but it's not that great when it comes to food and service

The crazy breakfast staff, one totally bossy and the other over-the-top, were nice, but both were in a frenzied, caffeine-excited state of mind. There was still a huge queue at the breakfast club, so we tried the fix. The eggs were broken and our server was confused at the request to have eggs on my toast. I had in the valley for a regular fast to show me at the restaurant but for the pancakes only I would definitely go back

I came across this Friday while walking around Phoenix on a Sunday afternoon, just wanted to go up and have a drink and then take a few photos of the empty baseball field. Phoenix was completely empty when I got closer to the hunting ground, there were more people and I realized there was a match going on. I didn't think I would be able to get in on Friday because of the game, but there weren't many people. the open tables overlook the ballpark, so basically you can watch the game for free as long as you order things. I thought it was pretty cool, as for the food, I ordered a daiquiri when I sat down, it was pretty bad, almost too mushy. Jimmy even came and talked to me for a little while, I will definitely come back here just for the view
these donuts no longer taste good, they have an aftertaste like they used a different type of oil

let me first say that if I could have given stars I would have my wife and I went to this place and we were extremely disappointed that we had gone to a different poncho many years ago and we were hoping it would be like the choices were very very limited and basic. There are so many amazing Mexican dishes, but my only choices were a horrible tasting tamaletaco and enchiladas. How does a Mexican restaurant not offer burritos? the only food here worth eating is the baby churrs and sopapillas which were actually good, unfortunately I didn't go to this place to pay so my wife and I could eat sopapillas, please listen to my advice when I tell you to avoid this place, take your money to Taco Bell and get much better Mexican food at a fraction of the price
good food small portions expensive for the amount you get

the latest Consumer Report magazine gave this restaurant a higher point value than Houston, we disagree, they tried to be but couldn't even come close, we were very disappointed with the lack of timing in serving the food and food hostesses were seen drinking bottles of gatorade from there.

I've always said if the guacamole chips and salsa aren't good the food probably won't be good either, I was right the guacamole wasn't very good at all with the salsa the rest of the food was just ok but for a restaurant in Baltimore I expected a lot better just as a note when it comes to Mexican food I'm very critical this place will probably get higher ratings from people in the Midwest.

I love that walking through the doors of the sugar bowl is like taking a step back in time but what I don't like is that it looks like it hasn't been cleaned or there hasn't been any restoration work done since the day it opened let's be honest even though I didn't come here for the decor I came for the ice cream I was very excited when I saw the ice cream sundae covered in chocolate cherries and marshmallow cream I love the marshmallow creme and chocolate always a recipe for success when these two ingredients are combined well no luck they were out of marshmallow creme I got a brownie sundae instead I only ate half of it and decided it was only ok I probably won't go back to this place there are too many good dessert options but if my friends insisted I would probably oblige

great cafe with tasty options for lunch and dinner very good coffee and cozy atmosphere some reviews I found the lunch and dinner menu a bit overpriced for what I received I often stop early in the morning for a coffee and a muffin I live in the area the muffins are excellent unique and tasty when available it doesn't seem like the pastry chef starts early enough in the morning to have pastries ready to go or most of the other niche cafes I have been to in the Phoenix area have fresh baked goods ready to go early in the morning for early commuters like me
this place is closed, good riddance
good place to fry fish, i also had monster burger relish there

my boyfriend myself and his one year old adopted sister met his dad, his mother and his one year old adopted sister, we were all going to Prescott last Saturday to play in the snow when we arrived they were already prepared with drinks strange but greasy pancake balls delicious, they also placed our orders as they tested us for them while we were still a minute or so behind them, the food was good, the service was just ok this time as I don't remember if someone came in to give someone drinks before, I know they walked by and asked if everything was ok a few times but it was always friendly staff, the bathrooms were nothing spectacular but it's a Dennis bathroom anyway, we all left full and continued with our day

sorry banana leaf, I'm not usually picky at all, but the Thai curry tofu and vegetable dish I bought last night was horrible, really, it was almost inedible, the packaging wasn't great so it kind of spilled a bit in the bag, not a good start maybe the curry is the yellow curry Jenny R is referring to in her review, maybe the chef should taste it before serving it, it was really mean, I ate better Asian food from the mall food court before saying you listened to my request. for adding eggplant to the dish, thanks, but if anyone asks for eggplant you might want to make sure it's cooked through next time I had a barely cooked bite, it was crispy, so needless to say I don't think I'll give you another chance. First impressions sometimes last a lifetime sorry banana leaf

I have been back several times since the last review but the stand out was seeing take a trip it was great no complaints there Bar Smith although they failed on so many levels I got there between and and there was about a minute wait outside not the end of the world or anything but after finally getting in there was a sea of bodies and another very long wait for people to be lined up by the staircase waiting to go up there was a bouncer that didn't allow anyone on until people slowly figured out why they put the trip on the patio, I don't know, it's the size of a shoebox and was clearly at capacity before the afternoon. refunded, they clearly oversold the event and didn't think much of their customers who paid money to see this, they were going to put all the bodies in this place if it killed everyone else's demand after they finally went upstairs, there were so many bodies no one could move at all, it was total shit. I finally got to the back bar and waited in line for minutes just to find out their card reader broke earlier in the night. down so forget about having to pee during the hours you are there if you had to go you better hold it otherwise you are waiting for another few minutes just to get back up at the time travel time the sound was low and slightly distorted. I walked to different parts of the patio but the sound didn't get any better so my partner and I said fuck it and went downstairs for the rest of the night, luckily they were playing his set downstairs and upstairs, at least people could move around easier downstairs and the sound was better and the bathrooms were actually accessible even at the end of the night there were people queuing and waiting to go upstairs. Smith's bar has a huge f as far as I'm concerned, I won't come back to this place for a headliner, they obviously don't know how to run an event

I had every intention of giving this place a chance, mainly because it doesn't look like the kind of place people rave about after a meal, sometimes a snap judgment is entirely warranted. We were initially given a server who was not at all confident in his ability to perform his job even at the most basic level. When asked about the specialties, she shrugged her shoulders and told us she didn't know what ingredients or sides were available. or God knows what she was going through that day and then the baby started screaming in the booth next to us and all the servers in the place ran for the hills leaving the problem unanswered. If you have a baby who cries for love, take the poor little thing outside and solve the problem, don't force unsuspecting strangers to listen. We opted for a change of scenery in the restaurant after five minutes of incessant crying and were moved to the main area of ​​the restaurant and reassigned to a new server. earlier I finished reheating my coffee, I use that term loosely because it looked more like colored water before I glanced into the grill area that opens up to the entire restaurant to see that it was the nightmare. I saw a fairly large cooker with a tissue paper plug in the nose. Anyone who has ever had a bloody nose knows that it's one of the few things you can do to drain the running blood. visit this place again in the meantime, may I suggest food safety training

the pintos have a great red sauce for the pasta but I prefer an earthier pizza the high schoolers love it although this restaurant used to be a chili place but they renovated and did a fabulous job the take out door is discreet and the bar is big and comfortable the food portions are quite large and they have a nice selection on the menu

the place was great the first time I went the second time one day some fair weather buddies thought he was a big shot they disrespected a good friend because of a misunderstanding that could have easily been resolved by civil conversation but he tried to be a big shot the food was good but not good enough to put up with that shit again

I went to Pei Wei last night for a casual girls dinner, it was a perfect place for a group of girls as the following is cheap, it's fast and casual so each person pays their own bill and then sits down stress free when the bill comes as is often the case with groups. I found something to eat last night, I ate the teriyaki shrimp bowl with brown rice, the shrimp tasted like it came from the freezer, probably because it was, but the veggie rice and sauce were all pretty good. the concept is good, don't compare it to a high end restaurant and enjoy it for what it is. Ps, well done to all the girls who came out last night, I had a lot of fun seeing you all and I can't wait to see the next one.

Overall I liked this place and I'm glad it's in the neighborhood, the carne asama burrito was good and the thing was pretty tasty, but it seems like that's about all there is on the menu. I wasn't a fan of the restaurant setup, it was way too busy yes it was lunch but the flow could have been much better overall. I'll come back when I'm in the mood for carne asama, hopefully the issues will be ironed out in time and until then I look forward to supporting a local restaurant.

very bad service below average sushi stars the stars are because the quality of the food is below average and not great the salmon looks like it has been on the plates forever and has a really slimy look i have had much better sushi in some places where you can eat all you can eat basically the only good thing is the gadget with the conveyor belt i would advise the reader to save more money for a better sushi place like kabuki the next bad thing about this place is the service atrocious, they never bring you the drinks or seat you on time, god knows what the waitresses do there, they run around like it's their first day on the job and never do anything like clean the tables, get checks and I've been here several times and saw that the 2nd time the customers weren't even waiting for the waitresses, they were forming a queue at the cash register like Dennis

this is the other coffee plantation that I always forget about even though it's right next to where I grew up weirdly, huh, actually it's not weird because this coffee plantation blends so perfectly into its mall surroundings that you totally forget about it. This is where they take absolutely no chances with decor or ambiance, as far as you know it's part of the laundromat next door, the coffee isn't bad and it never seems to be too busy so it's actually a great place to do some things without worrying about distraction, I'm not sure about my wife's situation but a good book on a rainy afternoon and this place would suit you well

I had a very disappointing experience today. All four members of our party were disappointed with the quality of the food, especially the overripe cantaloupe and soggy potatoes. The place was busy, which won't be the case for much longer if they don't improve their pricing. The service staff were friendly although I found it interesting that no one asked us about our experience if they were interested now they know.

i marketed my car near the street it's friday night with nothing to do how about a show maybe the one that got in the jeep went to the street went to tempe and went to the big top psycho that's the band i went to see they sing a funny song about crazy people and tacos and beer the two songs i heard watch out for the narc five dollars to park the well stocked bar is good to know go with friends bring home a ho steal toe boots dyed hair with roots enter the booth the guy who knocks repeat

not the worst place but far from the best place I have ever been to in January for dinner on a rainy night with my beau, it took a few minutes for our waitress to stop acknowledging our existence and take our drink order at that point we had decided on our food order and gave her that too a few minutes later we received our drinks a few minutes later we received our order and my chili cheese fries were decidedly bland while her burger was worse than that of McDonald's less than their usual fries were actually good, I'm pretty sure this will be my only experience at Sass, but the decorations were pretty awesome

a very inadequate and expensive meal for the poor quality food you receive ordered the veal sorrento and it was not pleasant to eat very dry the hardest and hardest caesar salad was also disgusting and unpleasant saturated in dressing I liked the casual and comfortable atmosphere knowing that briony pasta is down the street I will not go back

so it's so hot in a place I didn't mind another frozen yogurt shop opening in town, I stopped by on opening day to check it out, the place seems really small compared to the yogurt and zoo, the yogurt is the same, but they had these cute gummy butterflies as a topping that I loved, they were supposed to give a free gift to the helpers, but when I asked for one they told me to come back in a few hours because they didn't didn't give them right away, yeah, that's right, this place is not worth going out to
nice place, need more restaurants, quite huge airports, long walks

this place doesn't need another review but I'll chime in anyway I've been dreaming of coming here for several months after countless hours drooling over their website I went for a late lunch with the wonderful chatter we had the restaurant to ourselves it was quiet and cozy I ended up ordering a salad it was so hot surprise and I just wanted something light I had a diet coke and the Caesar Romero salad see the photos it was mixed greens with a vinaigrette with coriander grilled chicken leg with lemon herbs cherry tomatoes and grilled pesetas it was really good I like the mix of greens instead of the usual romaine and although I didn't taste much of coriander it had a nice taste our waitress wasn't very attentive at all when she came to take my empty glass of soda she didn't ask me if I liked another one instead she brought me a glass of water with a insect in I give stars for now but I will return because there are still quite a few things on the menu that I would like to try

I think the reviews of this place are based on happy hour experiences. The food was incredibly hot and quick out of the kitchen. I think there is heavy use of the microwave inside the restaurant, dark and fancy, but the food is mediocre and overpriced. In fact, the Roaring Fork became both a barometer and a joke for the remainder of our visit to Scottsdale.
good food but I don't care for the super fast waiters, that's one thing but walking away while I'm still trying to order is rude
I was going to take the time to write a scathing review but honestly I can't even bring myself to do it, star, that's all I can say

ok here's the deal, I'm sad to only give ground control stars because it should be much better, it's walking distance from my house and I come here almost every day, eat coffee muffin salads etc. the coffee is generally good, the muffin was great, the salad was so bad and the service is a bit strange. by you, the salad I had there was really bad, the lettuce was wilted and brushed with dressing, I sent it back and it looks like the chef just put it on a new plate with some fresher lettuce and a lot more dressing, I wasted my money, please, please ground control, get your act together so I can give you more stars.
soggy, overpriced fast food burger with lots of hype when you have to cover the walls with quotes about how great your product is then you have to have something to hide

the stays are so cute I stopped in and it's a little shack with some limited seating outside it seems like most people get their food to go but you are more than welcome to eat at their table if you want when you drop your order off at the window and they prepare the food for you while you wait there was a few of us hanging out in the parking lot at the time which was kind of fun I got the brisket to go and it was good, I loved that it was smoked and the sauce was on the side so I could put it like as much as I like the menus a little limited but good and the prices are fair so I was checking out their makeshift dining room and I had to laugh because there was a spray painted sign above that said the cave lot place is cute I recommend doing it and the parking is a little tight definitely a cute place and not a bad place

at first I was happy to find a dry cleaning store that was on my way to work and had good prices, paying for everything up front and only accepting cash or a debit card with a penny fee for debit was a bit inconvenient but it was ok the first few batches of items I brought turned out great but then the quality started to deteriorate. I was touched at all, eh, a low price isn't really a good deal if I have to iron everything myself once I get home, thanks but no thanks

after waiting over a month for this place to open constantly annoyed by the sign on the door saying training in progress I was expecting something spectacular, the name itself redo burrito revolutionary mex made me think I was walking into a revolutionary burrito joint, my husband and I were disappointed to say the least that he got the pachuca chicken burrito which the girl at the counter said was his favorite and it was well just a chicken burrito at best, there was so much liquid oozing from the bottom of the wet lettuce and wet pick that he had to move his chips to another plate because they were swimming. I had the black bean burrito, the menu said the beans were slow simmered in garlic and onion seasonings, but it was like they walked by Safeway and bought a can of black beans. bean cheese burrito I like to have at least a small amount of cheese I guess their idea of ​​special cheese is magic the disappearing cheese the rice with corn a drizzle of cream was especially delicious the fresh squeezed lemonade was tangy perfectly sweet we also liked the decor the windowed kitchen for the price you pay for a very simple burrito that doesn't offer anything revolutionary their menu is overpriced I would rather go to baba Fresh or any other Mexican restaurant in the neighborhood

you know when you make a copy of the original and it's not quite the same, the edges are a bit fuzzy, not as sharp but usable, that's what I felt at the new market bistro location, the similar vibe that I enjoy in the original isn't quite as pulled together in this location maybe the lack of a seating area or the strange chic particle board tables or the fact that every table was dirty except for one near the main entrance to the blast furnace maybe the grease was dripping onto the glass in front of the grill no forks im sorry if i sound like a knock on mb but these are things that can be improved on the gentleman and i shared a salad and a cuban sandwich the control freak in me of course went for the salad it was probably the best salad made to date you should be able to patent your creations the sandwich Cuban was ok the ciabatta rolls are so thick and soft that when you take a bite the toppings come out of the back for a Cuban sandwich I think it had some sort of Asian spice like cardamom in it anyway the gentleman didn't like it at all it was his first time he didn't understand why I continued until he took a bite of my patent pending salad then it all made sense to him the salads are so filling and delicious. I can't wait to come back. I just hope they can make a perfect copy of the original or go for a completely different feel.

five guys offers a decent burger but it's definitely overcooked, they pride themselves on serving them well done and there's no doubt here that's what they are but I much prefer the meat flavor of the smashburgers five guys seemed rather lacking in any significant seasoning or if it was there it was killed in the well done, I also didn't really like that it came in the form of two carelessly charred mini patties instead of one burger well cooked and seasoned as far as pillar burgers go I'm at the next smashburger chuckbox in n out five guys burger and chuckbox and smashburger are awfully close I've been a huge fan of chuckbox forever so much I love the novelty of the smashburger but damn is it tasty I also prefer the smashfries to the chuckbox fries but I think I prefer the guys fries to both finally the price is obnoxious you don't get much in the way of a burger to drink cheeseburger fries you get a mountain of fries but i don't need that many fries you can also top it off with just about anything but i don't want to subsidize other people's toppings let me pay less to get mine with lettuce ketchup and mayonnaise overall not a great burger but better than a burger if i don't want to walk to the university for a great burger oh as for the atmosphere, it was like a club in there, i really don't need to be bombarded with music at lunch when i'm going to talk to someone, i hate shouting and the few times the song changed and the grill went silent was like the eye of the storm, turn that shit down

my rating is based on the fact that as a vegetarian they charge for a mediocre small bean burrito, maybe if that bean burrito was exceptionally good or large in size, but that wasn't the case either. I'm not saying that if your idea of ​​Mexican food is chipolata you won't find what you're looking for and won't be happy here, but if what you offer your vegetarian customers removes the meat and adds nothing else and charges full price, I can get a lot better elsewhere and pay a lot less gringos take away the chipolata. blindfolded go to a real Mexican restaurant and see what real food tastes like
bad food was horrible, don't waste your time or money

i love the cornbread and butter but the rest can do without it the plates are so huge and super sloppy the lettuce wraps are not good i liked our waitress but the blonde haired bartender was super bitchy to the other staff it was annoying

I am writing this update purely based on the feeling one gets when going to Spitfire Grill, the food and drinks are always good, our complaint about Spitfire is that the owner and staff are never very welcoming, my fiancee and I have been there several times and there is never any acknowledgment from the staff. The owner is still there and he never introduced himself or thanked him for coming back. The restaurant is just around the corner from our house but we look to other restaurants further away with a more welcoming atmosphere. For example, last night we went to the House of Tricks in Tempe. It was our th visit when we entered. Three of the employees greeted us and made us feel welcome. The bartenders remembered what we were drinking and asked us about something we had discussed the last time we were there.

a really good place for a relaxing Friday night dinner, I really loved the atmosphere, mantas has an upper level where each table is set up like a balcony overlooking the main level, it feels like a courtyard, the only thing missing is an open look at the sky, there was also a mariachi band playing during the night which added to the appeal and to make things really cool, at least for me they did a Mexican version of the theme song from the godfather I loved the chips and the salsa came right out the chicken which were good too the food was good but not good enough to make me run back the service was excellent our waitress was on top of everything despite the fact we were on the upper level we looked over and felt a bit bad as she had to go up and down the stairs she usually took the stairs which weren't as visible but you know what happens to get everything for us I could imagine if a waiter was having a pretty bad day he would just bring people up and wait we just randomly chose mantas because we were in Mesa Overview I enjoyed my experience there while it's not a place I dine at to try again if anyone suggests Mexican and we are nearby I recommend it

I like this mall, it's located in a decent location, there are a lot of good stores and the customer base here is bearable. I always thought about this mall just below Scottsdale, but without all the silicone and snobbery, we went last weekend to kill some time and were a little surprised to see it was overrun with screaming toddlers. anyway, the store selection is pretty good here, I just wish they would add crate, barrel and lush, then I would never have to visit Scottsdale again

I don't usually write reviews very often actually, but I felt like the stars currently don't reflect my previous sushi experience here. First of all, the service was really good, the waitress was really nice, very fast and courteous and delivered the food quickly. The food itself was well prepared. I usually eat a lot of nilgiri and the pieces are decent in fishy quantity. The rice was well packaged and the quality of the fish was good. I don't come for happy hour which ends relatively early at noon. I go to a lot of sushi restaurants and for the amount of fish provided I expected it to be cheaper as well as the cost of the damage, even the miso soup is not free considering the above average price. I have been to too many other places that have the same price, same quality and provide basic necessities for free. this yen sushi was ok, the other two people in my group except the kids also agreed
as good as it gets for surprise Chinese food right now

wow, this must be a first mall experience for the reviewer before me, five stars for Arrowhead, are you kidding, I find this mall average and boring with many middle of the road stores, dullards looking for holes forever, you can find elsewhere in other Nestor malls in the valley, nothing really stands out to me about this mall, other than the fact that it is the nicer of the two indoor malls on the bestride, so for people it's the only game in town unless they are willing to drive east the mix of stores and food court is pretty typical in fact I rarely go here unless I'm in the area I need socks or undershirts I try to avoid the lines at the other Arrowhead Paradise bakery.

it's a supermarket where i go to buy what i need and go out, it's convenient that there is a wells fargo in there but there is one across the street also negative experience my sister was talking to my niece but not in english a caucasian lady walks by and says rudely you can't speak english do you take sb in your own hands it's like you're trying to make every race hate you even more i will encounter this arrogance everywhere I go, I haven't finished reading yet my my niece had a dollar in her hand and was pointing at the lottery scratch off machine, we know you have to be a certain age to play it, one of the employees there rushes over and tells me in a loud voice that her niece can't play it, calm down. Children are simply innocent and don't need this extra verbal abuse in their lives.

I have traveled for work and we have a corporate agreement with them. I arrived at the hotel and was informed that they did not have my King bed available. I never figure out how to book a room and then they are out. I asked if I could get an upgrade, which they obliged and put me on the executive affairs floor. The floor smelled of cigarette smoke. the deal is supposed to have a bed with sleep number, it is even advertised, no, not in the executive floor rooms, that makes sense, my mattress was worn out and not comfortable at all, the worst night's sleep of my life was not rested for the big meeting the next day, ask for the sleep number

I think people tend to overrate this place because it's the only restaurant like it, don't get me wrong, the pâtés are excellent, but there are several reasons why this place isn't a four star restaurant, it's overpriced, you're paying almost dollars for a lunch originally aimed at minors, it's cramped, good luck going there with more than one other person, it's a bit grimy, someone said the atmosphere is awesome, I don't know why a dark, six foot wide, crowded dining room can be considered a nice atmosphere, unless you grew up in a sewer, also make sure you get there early if you want a table or food in a timely manner

whatever you do, don't waste your money here, I'm not the person who likes to send food back, in fact I hate doing it, I had no choice here, it was by far the worst Mexican food I've eaten, the food has such a horrible aftertaste, not only did I hate my meal, but I also tried my boyfriends and it was still horrible.

l'orange is a popular and famous restaurant in my neighborhood the pizzeria is connected to a small bakery and deli limo it is overpriced and overrated the parking is usually impossible and often dangerously full of gargantuan cash and expensive sports cars there is valet parking available sometimes which is also overpriced pretentious and unnecessary the parking lot is tiny and I need a valet to park my car what racket overflow parking is available in the street in the cycle path thanks a lot to the people I used to have a coffee here in the morning on weekends in the beer garden but the place has become a neighborhood nuisance. Orange caters to a customer base that largely seems to consider themselves that most likely they should be located in Paradise Valley instead of Eastern Phoenix. I'm giving it three stars because the food is good, the facilities and company leave a lot to be desired, but if your idea of ​​an enjoyable experience includes good food surrounded by female football survivors with their ears glued to cell phones, this might just be the place for you.
I prefer to go to Native or Zips. We've had bad experience after bad experience here if you're craving wings this is not the place for you.

I went here for a bar crawl after being turned away by a crowded blackbird during one of the Cardinals games. I was surprised to find the place almost empty when just down the street people were falling out the door, but after ordering a few drinks I quickly discovered why the place was empty. The bartender and manager were annoyed at the size of our group when most empty bars would probably have people walking in the door wanting to order drinks. The Stoudemires staff seemed overwhelmed and bored. The restaurant is nice. and clean and the drinks were good but overpriced, definitely wouldn't recommend for large groups for people looking for a good downtown sports bar head to Merles as the customers seemed to be having fun and the staff seemed to enjoy doing business.

this place is solidsolidsolidplus it's right in front of my disgust the crunchy tacos with chicken corn salsa cheese lettuce salsa verde de gallo and guacamoleyum yum yuri love their dressing so i like to put it on my tacos too it gets very busy during lunch so expect there to be a line don't worry they move fast and it doesn't won't take too long, they are very friendly there and I can't complain about anything, I just can't say it compares to some of my reviews and stars.
decent upscale place in Tempe good atmosphere outside on the terrace service is very basic sometimes good sometimes bad never great

Mixtec was ok, sort of a cross between baba Fresh and Roberts, the quesadilla was ok and the beef tacos were good too, nothing spectacular. I would go back up the street to the crumbs for something better don't accept amen sad.

I have been to Gloria twice with people from work both times I was disappointed the first time I went the service was good they were great at bringing out chips with salsa and bean dip and refilling drinks the second time I came the service was horrible we were there for more hours because we had to wait for everything and there weren't many people I was not impressed with the food they seem to put raw onions in everything including the cheese enchiladas, I really don't like raw onions and I'm a pro at finding dishes without them but you can't escape it here, the rice and beans were good but I can't say much else positive about this place, I won't be returning

I like Goldstone like no other but this place has very bad mixers. I arrived late afternoon on a weekday, no other customers to serve placed my order and I figured she would give it a nice solid mix. All she did was put my brownie in my ice cream a few times, sprinkled with nuts and stopped, it was sad that I had to eat all of my brownie at first because it ended up on top.

the stars didn't really care about the interior and the tables outside weren't appealing either it was very antiseptic and cold inside with only the hand written menu on the chalkboard the plain looking pastry case devoid of any ornamentation or even sign of an effort to make everything presentable inside and what seemed to me an antique espresso machine on the counter to give decoration to the allanite interior it was also very noisy inside despite the fact that there were only a handful of people ordering the mascarpone and fig jam marbled rye and lox with cream cheese and tomato or as well as a sugar free latte the coffee came in a paper cup why made me feel like she wanted me to leave I loved the mascarpone and figs so much that I quickly acquired a jar of organic fig jam from foods whole but I need to find some good marbled rye toast the lox was disappointing though while I found the flavors pleasant I thought the strips of lox were too thin I had lox in the real kitchen foods that were wild caught and larger for only a few dollars more and the cream cheese rectangles looked strange with their right angles after seeing such a beautiful presentation made with the mascarpone and jam Figs made me wish I had two sets of toast, it was nice to see they still roast the coffee beans on the side, I only wish success toasting but I won't be going back at least not for a long time
angry professional bar please go here if you wear medium affliction shirts you will love the bar is lame kid you haven't had five minutes go by without two people trying to fight
not bad for a channel

for some reason these people seem to think it's okay to price a tank top that probably has less thread than my thong and costs about pennies worth of labor to make. They also seem to think that dressing their models like blind grandmothers in paraplegic colors and patterns gives them business, oh wait, because it's temple and temple because I can't repeat too much, it's the devil
excellent breads and sandwiches nimrod employees
i think they need to hire a better chef, the food doesn't taste good, my mom said she can teach them how to cook for free

I love Matts and think everything about this place is immaculate, but unfortunately the small seating capacity and over an hour wait always puts me off, I would be there more often if I didn't waste my weekends sitting on a hot bench

I stayed here last month, it's your average motel since the doors face outside, not a hallway and the breakfast buffet is okay scrambled eggs hash browns sausage links bacon cereal paste for making waffles and toast provided the walls are really thin, so thin that the guy snoring next door kept us up all night. make a list of what you are dropping off then sign I was uncomfortable making a list so I decided to forgo this process on Friday if you call the front desk to order you a taxi they actually order a car service the car is an unmarked multi colored Lincoln sedan to go to the street sports bar down the street cost us about compared to a real taxi which we ended up taking later we didn't want to drink and drive so not bad but be aware just that the hotels in the area don't order taxis, my main complaint is that we didn't have housekeeping the whole time so the two stars we left for lunch from noon came back but housekeeping never arrived, we left at noon for the rest of the day and housekeeping when we checked into the room after midnight hadn't come. I called the front desk to have someone bring towels, but as there was no one to cover the front desk we had to go get the towels ourselves. overnight at the much more expensive Hilton Resort down the street, not too bad. I would probably stay here again for the simple fact that the location favors our activities, but if I could find another hotel nearby with a similar price, I wouldn't mind staying elsewhere.

I wanted to add a review to the company website but couldn't figure it out. I'm curious where all the testimonies come from. I have mixed feelings about my experience at the end. I think I ended up with nice windows even though my salesman was very engaging. I felt pretty confident in my decision to go with American vision windows. After this first experience, there was a communication problem regarding the planning of the measurement, but this was resolved fairly quickly. four days after that date when I called them to find out where my windows were, I was told they had just received them and could schedule my installation in weeks since I only had the Saturday installation available, which was understandable. The Friday before I moved in, they called to reschedule until the following weekend because the rain storm that had just hit that day had put them two days behind schedule again. given the delay I don't know what to say about the installation, there were two guys, one seemed to know what he was doing, the other I had less confidence in the work, it took hours to install Windows during the whole transaction, I was never told how long the installation would take, so I don't know if that was normal or not, the two guys actually seemed to be fighting during the whole installation, I believe the leader was joking with the other in him basically saying he sucked, I think the other guy was really getting angrier and angrier. Honestly, I was very uncomfortable being in my own house during the installation. I was a little disappointed with the cleanup of the job. I ended up having to clean the inside of the window tracks and window sills on the inside and brush the window sills on the outside. I don't think I should have had to do this before they left. I received a survey to review the entire installation process from the seller, I think this is a horrible practice that needs to be changed. is waiting for me and then I give it back to him, what this has caused me to do is exaggerate my review because I'm not going to give installers stars and give the paper back to the person I just reviewed. I can't say I would recommend this company, but I think the way the customer service went is really a coin toss on what you will get from any company. understand that when installing windows it is difficult to pay attention to the foliage under your feet, but I think an attempt not to trample the plants would be very appreciated, for example when washing windows I think an effort can be made not to stand directly over a plant and twist your foot back and forth. I still hope I don't lose a few plants due to the trauma they suffered.

Talk about disappointed, I had high hopes for this place, with its location and idiosyncratic name, but after about an hour and a few drinks, I couldn't get over the feeling that permeated both my inner boredom and this bar as a whole. included, you loved it once you'll love it again, a bit like Coldplay's pomp and circumstance which is ultimately soulless, the lawn accountant fails to be authentic on any level, it's all carefully crafted to give you a mix of near high end Irish hipster cool, but it just fails to deliver, I knew it was time to go when I heard Chris Martins vocals if you find it moderately boring I suggest moving on Turf.

wow, is this the new barcelona yuck, scuzzy old men and middle aged women with fake tits falling out of their painted on dresses, all the bars were completely understaffed on a friday night, we waited for minutes at the front bar until we were continually ignored and we became so frustrated that we headed to the round bar and it seemed just as understaffed. for service and she was completely rude and totally lacked desire to help us, we will not be returning due to lack of service and efficiency, this place needs to hire more bartenders and needs a lot more help, welcome to North Scottsdale Barcelona

Honestly the drinks are overpriced and have a hint of rubbing alcohol, honestly my lunch was just ok, honestly they have a drink called the stigmata, honestly I'm dreading having to give them stars given the hype but I'm supposed to be honest this place has been buzzing since before I came back to the states. watching would have been great, the only people watching I had at rn were the gorgeous waiter outside our window on the patio, but even his body of art work won't bring me back the first clue really should be the overpriced drinks we started with. was enjoying his blue moon until he lifted it to take another sip and the whole bottom of his glass fell out yes fell in one piece onto our table what happened to the contents wonder who went all over the table in someone's wallet and on an iphone and my face the waiter didn't even really apologize about it other than giving us extra cloth napkins which didn't soak anything at all no of wet rag no come no excuses just another glass of blue moon that we hoped wasn't bought at a joke store. and a sticky table, faces and sunglasses the chicken lollipops were not what I expected but really weren't bad I enjoyed those I also enjoyed the presentation of my fries a nice silver bucket tons of fries couldn't finish I ended up having a chicken sandwich that had brie and other goodness on it I totally forgot to order it without a tomato but I took it off easily I know what you're thinking they serve breakfast here until noon why the hell didn't the breakfast queen order breakfast honestly none of that wooed me enough to make it look delicious they I had a make your own omelette which was on my short list of things to order but I'm glad I didn't after seeing a coworker with a small omelet and bread with no other accompaniments because I highly doubt their Amish French toast is all that is Amish. I loved the bread, it was delicious, I also appreciated that although they didn't have honey mustard aioli or anything else to dip my fries in other than the ketchup and bbq sauce that came with the sweet potato fries, they tried to make me honey mustard, unfortunately it was just honey mixed with bottled mustard ketchup. it was like the beautiful model who has no brains and I want a little thought before I start my cooking experience, don't try to woo me with simple sex appeal, one of my colleagues commented that maybe in the months when the pans are well seasoned after being used the place will be worth trying again, I told him that maybe I should amend that someone on our table had also gotten terribly ill.

the office layout presentation gets stars the customer service you receive from the corporate office center employees is negative, they will scare your customers, scare your own staff and make your life hell, their offices and space are beautiful, but if for example a customer shows up at a time other than the scheduled time they will be told to leave, they will be told that you do not provide any service at the locations and if anyone can single-handedly ruin your professional image, the office centers can do it for you, be afraid they are dedicated to working versus not with you
for mall food this place is awesome, I love the pita rice and delicious potatoes

after a business trip I really needed a massage facility, it was good, I personally think it needs an upgrade right off the bat, the area with the lockers and really the place where you could undress is very public. This is the first area everyone passes through the outdoor lounge area was also very small. hot naked person walking around and if a woman gets naked, do some basic maintenance first, although so much hair makes it hard to see everything, so it can be a blessing, you know what, stay clothed please, but my masseuse totally made up for those amazing minutes.
