you can go there and check the car if you want to buy there it's a bad decision if you even want a car service from there you made the biggest mistake of your life I had time to ask my girlfriend to take my car there for an oil service guess what they scammed my girlfriend by lying about how bad my car is now if without fixing the problem could cause a serious accident so she did what they said tires new timing belt new brake pads you know why it's the worst of all those above I had just changed months before which trash seller it's people it's better to go somewhere

nice shop excellent selection of cupcakes friendly service but the real question shows do the cupcakes taste pretty good I tried the flavors and they ranged from ok to delicious vanilla with chocolate buttercream was ok the coconut was good a little dry but decent flavor the carrot was very good and the mocha was delicious they were all super sweet although my husband and I both had a quarter of each flavor and it was more than enough from a variety of flavors point of view and from a taste point of view, the sprinkles are however I really can't justify spending on cupcakes, they are expensive so they can cover their overheads and the rental costs are not due to exotic ingredients or special decorating skills, don't get me wrong I'm sure they use good ingredients but the wrappers are simple, there is no special piping or fondant work and the flavors are standard, they are just plain good cupcakes.

a handjob with gardening gloves I went looking for a Scottsdale car show to get a quote for hand wash tint on my new mini today finding it broken I took out my iphone ape handyman looking for a replacement nearby to at least do the wash and found a classic car spa expecting to pay a little more for a traditional hand wash. and exterior details, my son and I watched the car move through the process and saw that at least the wash part was done by hand, but they used the same gloves from the dirty truck that had gone through the previous star. After seeing this I should have looked at their interior details more closely when I picked up the car, there were dirt lines on my white roof and water spots on the accent chrome when we got in the car, there were still pieces of chips on my sons seat and floor mat that had spilled over the day and it was obvious that the dashboard and interior had not been detailed unless they refrained to use any product inside the car, the dashboard and steering wheel were dry and dusty. I should have told someone, but my husband and sons' hunger took over and we left happily.

the food is good, the ambiance is a bit strange and the prices a bit high for what you get, you get a sandwich and a salad, the sandwich was good but it was just a sandwich without accessories, the salad was also good but it really could have used a meat on top, you had a choice but the salad was already a bit pricey to begin with and the addition of meat would have worked on a salvadoran lunch

I came here last Saturday to see what it was all about but I really wish I had come Friday instead. The crowd was a bit strange and mostly made up of older people. They played a mix of top charts and hip hop while on Friday night it was mainly hip hop. The drinks flowed about a piece and the bartender who helped me was very friendly. time spent sitting in their outdoor patio, love the decor and ambiance but really wasn't feeling the scene on Saturday, I'll have to come back on a Friday evening to see how it's going

I must be spoiled and realize this isn't a big grocery store. I tend to think the store is a good place for Asian ingredients, mainly Chinese and Vietnamese products, for those looking for Japanese products they may have to go elsewhere, that's great, I hope with local support this store can improve.

after hearing a lot about all the mbfgrs that are in the valley i finally got the chance to go there recently as part of a family reunion which was a planning fiasco and a logistical nightmare but i digress this place was fine let's just say it wasn't too crowded and it showed in the very kind and attentive service they were very patient when our group was supposed to be people then exploded towards people then unfortunately one of the solutions to accommodate us was to put a few square tables attached to our eight person round table, I hate that, it's just inconvenient for at least half the people, then people getting stuck at intersections, that sucks, we ordered monkeys, although the only one I tried was the nagasaki, it was really good and the pita bread that came with it was nice and warm for a meal. well, apparently not, I've probably had gyros in ten places in the city and this was definitely the worst I've had the pita wasn't particularly hot and the meat was a bit tough the tzatziki was good but I found it a bit odd to be on the side the service was good and patient but the lame decision to combine two different types of tables when we suggested moving and bringing several squares closer together made them fall a bit but not as much as the not good one gyroscope probably closed to one but rounded to

I've had five guys in PA before and thought it was good, no better or worse than the appetizer or burger, I tried this place the other night and was disappointed. The lettuce was soggy and the patty unit was inconsistent. I'm not writing them completely, but I won't be in a big hurry to come back.

Monday night at p the streets are empty, walk into the bar looking for a happy hour beer while we wait for a yelp event to start a few doors down, noticing a few people on the sidewalk we expected more people inside the crickets chirping, you can hear them if it wasn't for a few TVs that had the volume turned up, the inside was welcoming and clean, why are we the only ones here, the bartender was pretty uninterested and wandered around like if he wished he could be elsewhere too we had a quiet beer and went out. We may have to revisit this place if I find myself in the area.
I don't understand the hype, it's very typical American Chinese food, I tried the bourbon chicken and it was nothing special, it was very teriyaki.

quota is an upgraded version of chipotlekokopellis, you walk up, choose a delivery method, burrito, nachos, salad, burrito bowl and you get a choice of meat, chicken steak, then you choose your toppings, different salsas, lettuce, cheese, we all know the principle, I will say one thing, quota is much better in taste than kokopellis and chipotle.

i mean it's a bar, they have drinks if that's what you're looking for, cool, you can catch a game there, it's not like it used to be, it's a bit quiet, the crowd is like a band and a good handful of random creepers checking out the service staff there, I wouldn't say I wouldn't come back, but it's definitely not first on my list for the kind of bar scene I normally look for, the service was good, but because that he wants many other people to serve the day I went

Hawkins is just like every other Hawkins theater, a huge, contextless concrete box in the middle of the desert that shows the same movies as their competitors. I saw the Simpsons movie here tonight and just have a few thoughts to share about the Cine Capri screen. you know, the one who laughs as loud as a megaphone repeats everything that happens on the screen and occasionally shouts something profane or derogatory. Now imagine a theater where all the guys are this guy if it weren't for the coolness of the big screen and seeing a movie I've been waiting to see since childhood. awesome just awesome getting out of the parking lot was a disaster. I don't know if the whole Tempe Market complex could be more poorly designed
ok, not great for what is supposed to be a good steak, not much atmosphere and the food was good, not great

I tried to contact this guy in vain no personal message on his answering machine at all the site sucks for information to let me know what kind of work or the quality of it he does I tried to call here this evening and against we pick up the phone so fed up with flaky contractors do they want work or not

this place is located right on the mill with a patio that is right in the action, they gimmick of this mostly college bar are their frozen drinks that are thrown around in squishy Klikemart style windows behind the bar that you can see, they come in lots of flavors like red green orange and seriously they all taste the same to me and after a few couples they only become recognizable by their color, the frozen drinks are loaded with sugar and always clear as octane high so it only takes two to feel super drunk and have a real bad stomach ache which is even worse the next day they also have regular beers and liquor and even a menu which I never realized until someone sitting next to me was presented with a burger at their table overall this isn't my style of fancy obnoxious comedy and I only end up here when someone else wants to go for a reason I can never understand

I've heard so many good reviews about this place, so who wouldn't have tried it, I should have realized before having my meal that it wasn't a good choice. The location is right next to a smoke shop and gas station across from a mobile park. city side wobbly chairs wobbly table I ordered the chicken teriyaki I didn't think it would be bad I mean who can ruin teriyaki again with chicken fried rice how the hell can you ruin fried rice the chicken tasted like it was frozen and thawed all day such a horrible taste the fried rice also tasted thawed somehow had a gross tangy aftertaste there were also no spices or of eggs in the fried rice just a bunch of onion greens which technically isn't fried rice, this meal may be related to something you get in the frozen section of a grocery store, they also give you a Snickerdoodle cookie which seemed like the best thing on the menu until I noticed it wasn't fully cooked, but the icing on the cake was pure, like gray hairs, which I found floating in my teriyaki sauce, so the meal expensive definitely wasn't worth it and I'm sure when diners were driving in and diving the food was great but today it was the most disgusting thing I've ever had

the experience with the hostess was unpleasant the service with a frown our waiter also had the attitude it was a birthday dinner and we were very healthy this review is written with clarity the margaritas were strong ok there the shrimp appetizer was different and very good and for four shrimp we ordered two May May dinners each and they were rancid yeah I said rancid we asked if the shrimp fajitas dinner had the same jumbo and they said they should charge extra each entree was priced we had to pay extra for the beans and rice they left on the table which was cold by the time the shrimp dinner came with shrimp and onions poor service with an attitude poor food say head was overpriced will never go back

the service is excellent the food is ok the salsahorrible please rethink your salsa oh and if you order a side of jalapeños they charge i have never heard of a mexican restaurant charging for jalapeños overall just an ok place there are better options on and around the mill

closed after enjoying this beautiful starry place that we regulars called Eastern Buffet Tacky Swameet for over two years, I was sad to come here today, I find them sad for a similar place nearby, I went to the new china buffet today, I enjoyed it, they are on n th street
disgusting and tasteless food good margaritas

I received two pedicures and a manicure at this location. I generally prefer a more spa-like experience, but the cost is low and I was trying to save a few dollars. Cutting costs may not be a good thing to do when it comes to body care. I will not return because I am concerned about health violations. the massage felt more like a kick about an hour later my ankles felt like they had been rolled, it took almost two weeks for them to feel normal again. The shipment in the store is false nails. If everyone wore a mask, I would want one.
not great I had the drunken noodles and pad thai not the best but not the worst maybe I will try them again and update my review

one of these days i will learn not to take out of town guests to places i haven't tried first i was pretty excited that one of my favorite people was coming to visit only to ask for sushi while i have my list of absolute favorites tokyo lobby toyama banana rent bozo stupidly i decided we should try a new place after reading a lot of good things on hand the choice was made upon entering the bob place with our kirin michigan in hand we were ready for a good evening too bad that's not what we experienced after being ignored for a few minutes by everyone who passed by and even the person behind the counter I found someone to say there were two of us and we would like to sit at the sushi bar even though there were free seats we stood there for quite a while would you like to stand with a package and not even be offered a bottle opener once we were finally seated we were not told about any specials on offer water or even glasses for our beer, deciding to make the most of it we ordered yellowtail dashiki the best item we had spicy nilgiri scallops good unsliced dry dashiki albacore leaving us with the first choice of overcooked pieces fresh water eel nilgiri dry crumbly rice falling apart when touched scallop dynamite takeaway really the female sushi chef was nice but our waitress was non existent other tables and the sushi bar patrons seemed to have decent serving water getting their beer wine from the fridge but we were left without water refills once we finally got some and didn't even think about getting another one of those bob beers we brought even took a while to get the unused bottles back as we tried to leave lackluster food and non existent service at a high price, no thanks

this store relies on the hope that they are the only place to buy what they are selling, the manager at checkout was not only snobbish and unhelpful but at the same time rude, I know Christmas time is hard for retail employees, but I was in many other retail stores today and their mars and employees were extremely friendly. amazon, as I stand in this parking lot, I know business is good this time of year and maybe this company's business is always good, but the post office and Sears were also king. I could explain all the facts of the situation, but I'm sure it wouldn't make any difference because I'm convinced that's the culture of this store.

I'm usually a big fan of dive bars but I wasn't impressed at all, one of the kegs was empty so my friends didn't get their favorite beer, not a big deal but not a good thing for an afternoon on a Friday. The servers seemed really overwhelmed and that was probably due to the fact that there was only enough for the whole place and it was really busy on a very positive note.

i came home for two nights and would do it again it is extremely close to campus it was clean the people were friendly and i got a free ride to the airport it was a very good price normal mirage hotel with no great views it has the amenities you need for a quick visit including a pool and gym the free continental breakfast is ok especially if you just want cereal i wouldn't order bacon not worth extra

mid afternoon is definitely different from dinner, it's still good, we usually get the layered dip, it's totally messy and not as good as I think it should be, but I like it anyway, I have the durango burro and Matt gets a combo monstrosity serve, the average island quest is tasty

I made fair trade sandwiches there better than Safeway anyway, only stars since I didn't know about the free soft service so I didn't have a chance to try there must be a good New York grocery store west and north of Thunderbird isn't there, it doesn't have to be very good, that would be wonderful

I don't understand the hype but then again I'm not a regular the beer selection is excellent the sandwiches are worth the prices the cheesecake really shouldn't be drowned in chocolate syrup but regardless it's a really cool place to people watch I enjoy the well put together menu and can't say much more it has reliable service and hipster sandwiches and good beer the lack of surprises makes it a good place to get out for the owners to see downtown and show off to people on First Fridays if you want to brave the potential expects noise levels and lack of parking on busy nights

I parked in the lot, had my parking ticket validated and still owed money for parking. The parking validation was worth the price of parking, it was with a credit for the validation, no, I was promised I had paid the rest of the fee, but the machine didn't give me a receipt. I will never go back to this place, it's not on my radar from now on.

my experience was on a random Saturday afternoon and I think that might skew my opinion a bit during my visit, we were the only guests at dinner, there was a guy at the bar who was friends with the employees, the atmosphere is mellow and I imagine it's a pretty lively place on weekend evenings, the prices were a little high for what we ate, I had a pita sandwich and it was just below lunch, the prices are a little high, the food Was ok but I won't go back again and again.

I ate here the other day with a friend for lunch it was my first time there I ate the Tom Ha gas soup my friend had the Thai fried rice with tofu each was hot Thai we shared a delicious dish of fried rice was large we also shared some mini inscriptions mini I think my soup could be denser with lemongrass and cilantro but it was delicious either way I guess it is cut I am a fan of this dish I think that it is much better at mailers in Scottsdale but you pay more the place is spartan, not luxurious, there is damage that looks like what you would expect looking from the outside, I'm not picky as long as the place is not a complete dump, Thai restaurants to me don't have to be princess palaces, I have enjoyed the floats for years and it showed its age but was not in a state of disrepair, they also have beers on hand, the menu has a variety of curries which I can't wait to try, I would love to try this place again, I just don't have much else to say. for the moment, apart from I spotted a few dishes on the way to their tasters and they looked attractive and practical, worth a try, not bad, you know, if that was the case I would tell you to try for lunch on weekdays, they have a special lunch menu
slow service inside somewhat rude cashier and, for no reason, small and awkward layout inside, especially for the limited seating and limited standing area to take a sub-par order until McDonald's

not so good not so bad solo more or less stopped here for lunch the other day had chicken lunch overall pretty bland taste but maybe that's just the style if I ever end up here I may try something else but I won't go out of my way to do so

it was the last casino in the valley that I hadn't visited yet, I should have left it alone. The casino had a nice range of machines but they need to clean more often or maybe customers need to use an ashtray more often. Yes, there is a lot of smoke smell but they have a small non-smoking area. They also have what seemed to be very good coffee.

I've never had any real problems with this store, it's your typical low income neighborhood grocer, what really bothers me about all chip shops is their waste with receipts, call me a hippie, but over half the receipt paper has nothing to do with my purchase. the least of these companies waste problems but it's a problem that comes to me every time I shop there looking me in the face I don't like it and I don't like to support it

I always wanted to go through this and try it. The only thing that stopped me was bad rumors about how clean they were, but then again how clean all the places we eat at are, so I had their meatball sandwich, that was my second choice. I will probably come back

I was stuck between wanting to give a two star three star, the concept of this place is a great idea, I have to say if you go on a day where there is a big party it's a bit like you are an unwanted fly on the wall, this game town is located in a large older strip mall that blends in with the other faded store fronts inside the owners seemed to be very nice although stressed about having a party there I was very disappointed that the jump house was removed was the reason everything was fine. if there were themed little houses to play in, but the whole place looked like it needed a good fresh paint job as well as cleaning

I like any airport restaurant that doesn't feel crowded or cramped, we usually have to stop in Phoenix for our layover to and from California from Texas so I think this might be our new dinner spot, it's big, lots of seating and clean I love the affordable menu options, especially for being in an airport, my husband and I have both had the taco plates, my steak and fish which comes with two tacos of soft corn tortilla, black beans and rice, the tacos were tasty but the rice and beans were flavorless and the rice seemed a little undercooked after dousing everything with hot sauce I was able to finish my meal although I love cheap food options for a taco or burrito meal the drinks were very expensive our bloody mary was my non-alcoholic mango fresco the service was good and we don't really have any complaints it's a good option for someone looking for something not too greasy or heavy

I would rather go to Benihana to be honest, I've been here a few times because it's very convenient but it's never been worth it. I've eaten here and had take out dinner, it always takes forever and it's not cheap. I expect cheaper if there is no atmosphere or really good food. and avoid taking the risk

wow the worst food poisoning of my life I ate here Saturday night for my birthday I started not feeling well a few minutes after Sunday I never left bed except to go sick I lost five pounds in one day I stay away from salmon I for one will never go back I'm really sad too because I decided to use it from the reviews another reviewer said he was disappointed with the recent quality I should have listen

I'm pretty sure these bagels have never seen boiling water and to be honest, they reminded me of nothing other than the tragic frozen bagels of my childhood. I suppose our first warning should have been the exceptionally alarming cappuccino poster in the window showing what appeared to be coffee and chocolate milkshakes with whipped cream and chocolate sad two stars because it was technically an edible bagel although my husband and I only managed to each finish half of ours.
ok the food is super slow, employees and customers and I couldn't believe how long it took for a quesadilla that was cold when I got the tithe, the tacos were ok but try it and you decide though

I don't understand what people like about this place, it's usually crowded with rushed service and the food has yet to impress. I tried at least twice, maybe I'm ordering wrong but I really don't understand.

the food was ok but I am writing about their underhanded business practices, I ordered a travel voucher for meals included, it consistently said that what we ordered if had been ordered from the regular menu would have been about right, but we were charged tax on the full second, even though on the voucher it says to tip the full value of the check, implying that the tip is not included and we can choose the tip amount and nowhere does it mention the automatic tip, even though we ordered the maximum value of the food, was automatically added to our check, even if you had ordered the most expensive options, the highest amount possible is not that it is mathematically impossible for the voucher to have any value, but that is what they add tax and tip to the fourth after telling our server we were using a voucher, he seemed less interested in the level of service at our table, which I later realized because that he had a tip guarantee.

I've been here twice. The first time it was prompted by a rumor that they were making their own root beer. I love homemade root beer, so I had high hopes that this place would become a favorite. My husband and I were so excited when these huge glasses of RB hit the table and then we were confused. is made with Stevie, not sugar, I'm sorry but I have to say it's the lamest root beer on the planet if I'm going to treat myself to a tall glass of homemade root beer I want it to be delicious, sugar and high fructose corn syrup and no bloody artificial sugars and yes I know stevie is natural but who gives credit it tastes terrible anyway after the root beer debacle it doesn't didn't get better the food was meh the service wasn't that good there were times of it's she always comes back I say go here for the rootless beer but that's it otherwise skip this place and drive to four peaks you'll be happier all around

well the view is obvious, I mean it's pretty high up and gives you a good view of downtown, but I don't know the view from the Arizona Club is better. We went there after watching a show at Herberger and I was expecting an upscale and expensive dinner, which is exactly what I got. The service matched the price, which was nice to see, but the restaurant itself was disappointing. totally, I had the drunk shrimp and they were pretty excellent, the sauce around them was really good and they sat on a piece of toast disguised as a crossing. I also took a few bites of the lava cake, but since it was buried under a pound of powdered sugar, I couldn't eat any more. I guess I just agree with Beth SS's review, I just don't see what justifies the price. it's not that bad

no frills, nothing fancy, just some honest to goodness burritos and tacos voted best tacos by New Times a few years ago in the 90's, not sure I agree but they always satisfy, they also do a hearty breakfast burrito if you're looking for Sonoran or team or anything beyond what you might find at Filbert, try somewhere else, the red burro combo is my favorite, it's cheeky enchilada style and just-spicy-enough bottled beer available

so i admit i'm addicted to bunks, i really crave this food and i'm not really sure why my mom says she ate jalapeño nachos regularly while she was pregnant with me, maybe that explains it anyway. I've always wanted to try this place because they claim to have the best tortillas in town. tank at fourth avenue prison a good friend spent a most unfortunate night here and described it in detail the cold stained cement floors, nasty old cubicles and McDonald's style plastic swivel chairs that probably needed a new coat of paint in the early aughts I opted for a green chile burrito and my companion ordered the chorizopotatocheese egg burrito after waiting about a few minutes our number was called, the first thing I noticed was that the burritos were quite small, I knew however that I was in for a treat with the freshly made tortilla, super soft and piping hot and I was not disappointed that the green chile, although tasty, had too much liquid and after inadvertently puncturing my tortilla I ended up with a handful of sauce. I certainly felt more than safe inside this place despite the somewhat scary clientele based on the table of twelve Phoenix police officers sitting across from us overall. melting pot known as the Phoenix of the South
same merles menu as other places, ok food, especially the wings, but high prices for food and drinks, good service, even overly attentive on my last visit, great setup for watching football games

Saigon Nites is one of the few to frequent the north of the city. I ordered myself a bowl of who, as usual, but I think the waitress made sure I knew what I was ordering, so she repeated and asked for beef noodle soup yes, beef noodle soup. I forgot that I'm in Scottsdale, where the culture can sometimes be lacking. the who is fine i'm a bit of a who nazi and this didn't really pass the test my iced coffee was excellent why it was served just not too strong nor too light i'm really used to having it strong and simmering it with a little water to weaken it not today the service and vibe my friends are ok i'm really enjoying the vietnamese art here, especially the portraits of today's daigirls oh my god

when you walk in it's dark and relaxing, the atmosphere is nice, calm with lots of dark wood highlighting the place, the food is good but be careful as the price can add up quickly, this will always be a restaurant I go to with burgers, steaks and spinach dip. The best way to think of this place is a lower grade of Houston, it's almost there but not quite.

even though it's my home gym where i train for my shows i'm really starting to dislike the people here it was very cool with me and since moving to a new gym nothing is the same no more everyone here is a witch which i don't like

the food was good nothing special I like that you get guacamole with your meal and they have lingua on the menu I will have to go back and try it the things I didn't like if they sat our group right next to the server station it's awkward to hear their conversations the service seemed a little lackluster it was almost like they weren't interested in a large group coming in our server was pretty good but not too friendly I will definitely try again this place and update

sam is a man i was very impressed with the fare here i had a bowl with noodles and chicken on my first outing and it was awesome another time i came i was very hungry so i ordered the sumo bowl whoa the bowl is a one ounce bowl i could have had all chicken even though the beef is me i agree with another assistant that the entries are poor they are grilled i guess i don't know lame at another place they had these carnival cookies which were awesome another variety of cookies were butterscotch om amazing so yeah Sam is a man

I have two thoughts on what to write for a review so here are both and you can take your pick dear sir and madam we regret to inform you that we would like our menu to come back sincerely or stale bread yes please

no one so where do you want to go for lunch no one hmm I'm not sure anyone wants to go to heaven no one no we've been there three times recently no one and the subway no one I'm so tired of the sandwiches no one well here's the quota no one quota ok I haven't been there in a while we can get in and out pretty quickly and get back to work that's pretty much how no one really plans to go out and eat at quota it's one of those places where you decide to go on the fly or because that you have eaten everywhere else mexifood is just nothing special nothing bad nothing to stand out there are tons of Mexican joints within a ten mile radius that are better but the quotas here in this mall haven't eaten here in a while and I don't want to drive any further this will make a good alternative and then you will be good at this place for another six months or so

a group of us were there for drinks late Saturday night, the bar is really cool, well thought out and decorated, the drinks menu, cocktails and draft beers are all exceptional. The only challenge was that it was almost impossible to get the attention of the bar staff. I'm not sure that since we were a large group and had a running tab that only one Batman could serve us, but it was really frustrating that the bar staff ignored us, otherwise the place is great.

I spent most of my first year of legal drinking age at this wild college bar, it was fun at the time, but I grew up, it wore on me, it's a big bar and there's no escape from drunk college kids. The guys can usually be found on the patio barking lame pickup lines at passing women and the ladies are usually grinding it out on the small dance floor on weekend evenings with the summer heat. On Shrove Tuesdays, frozen drinks are popular, but if you don't want to drink them with the college crowd, hit the bar during the day or early evening

I'm happy to report that these cows did their best to get me to eat, thank you dear moo cows, thank you, these burgers are meaty, damn recently I went to lunch with my sister and my mom on the fly for her day because her first choice couldn't be open on a Sunday afternoon, it's not her fault, their site said they would be bastards open shaking my fist in the air didn't update the site double mistake I suggested as we were nearby so this is my third time at this place although expensive the portions of everything are large in charge good the ingredients are fresh the meat juicy and the fries are crispy as they should be in my opinion note to your mother don't waste gym time with the cream shake it's nothing more than a fancy name on a plain old vanilla shake that said I'm a fan of the cream rule so maybe this is a downfall I was expecting grandeur and fireworks and I got a really good vanilla shake but don't get me wrong but call it a vanilla shake don't market it as a cream shake how to improve it and bring a tear to my eye put a cream hat on it give me the crunchy candy I'm looking for and demand to put something on it to give it that ruler feel or call it a cream shake vanilla the best way to explain my feelings would be to say it was like setting up a date with someone online and popping him up and it's clear he's photogenic but maybe a little edited and not the hogtie in his profile pics he's someone with a great personality and decent looks for sure but the hogtie hasn't had a good time yet but my expectations were totally different the banana cream pie shake is delicious and the burger to take away if you want a healthy choice, opt for the tuna also very good and served perfectly rare my my good
this place is pretty good, better than average, but not good fish fry on Friday, it's ok if you like battered fish, good atmosphere, lots of quiet beer on tap on tv

bad store, rude owners taking advantage if you want to improve the Phoenix community you can start by not playing music loud when it's obvious there are musicians trying to play their sets that people paid to see at the well respected venue next door

the food is a little more expensive than standard chilis but it is in an airport so service is expected to be good, the food comes out quickly and to order make sure you stop before going through security

as i promised myself i will go back to try again yyeeaahhsoothe the food is still not good i had the mongolian beef and it's like it's really that girl i'm a fan of chinese food this restaurant i'm not a fan of
very good happy hour, it's dark inside but the beer prices are good and they have free chips and salsa

Stingray is pretty good, the location is nice but there is never any parking because of the other businesses around, it's no fun walking there in happy heels, the dashiki was pretty fresh but the miso was a bit too salty and they also gave us cold oshibori napkins when we sat at the sushi bar. I think I prefer the new pure sushi location next door once I was able to find it, very modern and cool feel and delicious food, I heard Stingray is opening another location near me in the Baltimore area, maybe the parking will be better.
crust is soft, pizza is below average, good owner though

Zips has good bar food but the service is generally terrible, the waitresses rarely come to your table but what really bothers me is that many times when I pay the bill the waiter doesn't give me the correct change even though my change is a penny.
don't waste your time, arrowhead mall on the other side of town is so much better

not impressed the young lady behind the counter asked me like she didn't care about my shirts I had to drop off I had used them before and no one ever smiles at you when I asked her about the prices and how they protect against shrinkage she said we can't guarantee anything good I can guarantee I would go elsewhere you would think based on their price they would care more

it is absolutely no fun having a connection at this airport, it was definitely not designed to be post friendly, let me give you an example so you know what I mean, we are flying from San Francisco and are told we will have to go to another building via a bus. fix the gate and go through security again flash forward days we are flying and going through customs this arc was a great experience as we were the only international flight to go through customs we rechecked our bags and were told we had to go to another building yeah you know what I'm about to say I floundered having to ask where to go several times finally we found the right place and got on the bus then went to different parking lots to drop off and pick up other passengers, my husband and I looked at each other worried that we were on the wrong bus. Since it was already noon and we hadn't had lunch, we were very worried that we wouldn't have time for lunch. Finally, my husband asked the driver and he indicated that we were indeed on the correct bus. We continued to drive around the parking lots until we came across another bus. The driver told everyone on our bus that we could sit and wait for a few minutes or we could get on the next bus and get there faster. We entered the terminal and hopped on an elevator to take us to the security line, there were just lines and of course we waited in line with family who had to go back or sometimes because they were trying to get through the security line with belts on their shoes and liquids in their suitcases. who was the boss

this star is extremely generous, I want to know why I read my party and a baby arrived at pappadeux in the surrounding area, we were told it would be a minute wait, it ended up being over an hour, we were standing right outside the hostess station, but no one ever came to give us an update on how long it would take for our table. a few minutes later they were still waiting for a server in what universe does it take a restaurant minutes to find a server to clear a table we watched group after group after group sit down a group that came after us was seated before us we ended up being seated next to them as we received our menus they were finishing their meals once we were finally seated we waited almost a few minutes before someone came to our table to introduce themselves as our server when he asked us how we were, we kindly told him we were a little frustrated because it had taken over twice as long as we had been told and we were told twice that they were waiting for a server to clear the table. The waiter said it was a busy night and said he wasn't paid to deal with unhappy customers. that things got a lot better, the manager brought us a plate of appetizers to take home, our food ended up being really good including the alligator, I had shrimp caramel and it was great, the gumbo wasn't that fabulous overall, everyone was happy with their meal, we had three different drinks and they basically tasted the same as cherry nyquil.
tonight at Nova Phoenix no dinner waited for hours with no communication only to be told they no longer had the fish I ordered, left the restaurant later, very hungry, very disappointing

we had a mixed experience at happy hour him and dinner quick summary follows the hits the food was tasty the ambiance was pleasant the waitress never got to bring last call she offered no explanation or apology asked me if I minded the anchovies on my salad I said no but didn't realize there would be a charge until the final bill arrived while in the bathroom I observed one of the staff members go straight from the cabin, no urinal to the kitchen, no handfasting, not even a break near the sink, there was an appetite

this place is a dump, I'm a widow and have a longer chronic illness, but they allowed their tenant to pick on me, throw a bottle at me, then their maintenance man told me the lock was never changed, they didn't paint but lied and said they did, it was totally drug infested, they don't keep their word, I would ignore it

after hearing all the hype about diners driving in and diving in and reading the notes on the yaps we decided to try it, we waited minutes for a table, the place is small and outside of a muck motel, the service was extremely fast once you walk in the door and the servers are very friendly.

good luck waiting in line for a guy behind the desk, the other two salespeople were too busy pretending to be customers in an empty store to recognize the only customer that was there, it's a real change from other Verizon stores where someone greets you gives you a number and the associates talk to customers and want you to buy their products, weird vibe in this store

I don't usually rate based on a single visit, but when the experience and food is this bad, I will make an exception. This place gets two stars for multiple big-screen TVs. If you're here just to watch sports and have a beer or three you'll be happy enough, but I came here for a bite to eat and that's when I ran into problems. from time to time and I've chatted with some customers about the food, how can you ruin coleslaw, what more can I say beyond that, if you're in the area to watch a game, it's not a bad choice, just stop by McDonald's or wherever for dinner

stars, really, i waited for the review because i surprised myself by paying for a macaron, really, i did that, it was tasty, but and that doesn't even count my breakfast for a piece of quiche and a salad which i didn't want, i just wanted a piece of quiche, i don't mind paying for good food, anyone who knows me knows that food is pretty much what i spend my money on, but i have enormous remorse of buyers for my meal, something is wrong with that

after reading all the good reviews we were looking forward to eating here but were a little worried because of the few bad reviews because of the disappointing smell the smell just killed it for us right off the bat immediately after walking in the door the pungent smell of backed up sewage hit us like a ton of bricks we did one and walked right out I couldn't sit through a meal here while breathing in that funk get the smell and we will give you another tasty Thai shot

this is a huge improvement from the last bar that occupied this location, they obviously invested a few dollars in the renovation and added pool tables, the problem is when a band plays here they totally dominate the conversation and if the band sucks please install a smoker friendly patio right now.
I hadn't eaten in about hours since we were in the hospital having a baby and this pizza still tasted horrible fast food quality and taste barely ways to avoid

We received a coupon online to try this place and went on a Sunday around noon for dinner. The decoration is very cool. Flower stands with plastic covered beer taps on the stands, a stunning mural on the far right wall. We both enjoyed our margaritas which, for the size, were fair value. The food was tasty but not original. without as there aren't too many fat free or fish options on the menu, the crushed plantains and pumpkin seeds were a nice touch in the salad but it was missing something special that I can see coming here for happy hour or for a first drink in the evening, they had a prep stand which was cool but and I may sound old for saying this, it was just too strong for a Sunday night dinner
I was not impressed, the dressing tasted like a store bought bottled dressing and the tomatoes were very very mushy

last night Friday night was my first time back to Myst in years, the club is nice but the Friday night promoter is urban and not urban chic like a bit urban but I have to say it's a pretty mixed crowd, black and white Hispanic. the cover was and for rip which gets you upstairs, it's not worth it, it's a recession and the dance floor is downstairs, I'm not sure who it was but he was really good, it was like all the best Gucci Mane and all that southern type club music, really good stuff, I gave it a star rating, even though it's not a place a lot of my friends would want to go to looking forward that night it was a decent night if it's the crowd you're looking for, hey people I don't do much judging

ok they should be happy to figure out the flying virus that landed in my dessert and died before it was served yes i found it while eating the dessert it disgusted me but it's not necessarily their fault. The manager came over to apologize and took the dessert off the bill and offered me another one anyway.

I live a stone's throw from this Safeway and never end up here for groceries based on my experience if I haul my lazy ass to fries at Thomas and end up spending about less on my shopping trip than at this Safeway everything is ridiculously expensive even after the club card savings. I have no idea why it's because it's in Arcadia, is it the extra maintenance expense involved in overstocking the wine section or the fancy olive bar or the gourmet cheese selection or maybe it's the extra cost of employing cashiers by not installing self-checkouts, do I really have to queue for ten minutes behind a commuter with screaming kids just to buy a few sticks of outta and i understand carding, but do you really have to take out the book to copy my information and then make me sign my name three times because my year old signature doesn't match my yearly scribble, c'mon now that's excessive, i appreciate that you think i look young and crafty for my age, but i'd rather hit the crack pipe selling alcohol paloozas along mcdowell than deal with this nonsense, unless I desperately need an ingredient or need something special like their amazing selection of Mediterranean olives, I stay far, far away
pretty good coffee nothing special but far better than Starbucks

I loved the room and its functionality, but this same room made me want to punch myself in the face. I'm a young middle aged professional who likes to party and understands what the W brand offers, especially on the weekends during winning times, but when they do it on Saturday night it looks like it's shooting from your bathroom, it makes it difficult to stay. just a few rooms but it's a wrong number here

I had a good bad experience at the Cadillac ranch the interior design was pretty cool and it had comfortable booths which I like we ordered three different entrees that were on happy hour before our entrees the wontons the quest dip and the chicken tenders the tenders were good they were beer battered and tender the quest dip was pretty bland and the chips were horrible they were not stale but obviously very poor quality the wontons were obviously frozen and sitting on a bed of syrup it was like having desert and appetizers at the same time, when it came time to order appetizers I was the last one to do so so I asked my server for an option between three appetizers and she danced around them all, suggesting I have a pulled pork sandwich which was clearly cheaper than the rib steak or taco plate I inquired about. cover up the bad flavor my server Liz was awesome she was attentive and friendly she noticed I hadn't eaten my starter and took it away the manager came back and apologized he offered me another starter and I took lying advice and got the pulled pork sandwich it was much better the staff was good and did their job very well it's not their fault the quality of the food is so bad

the burger was great but the service wasn't so good when I was thumbing through my wallet for money the owner rudely interrupted me and told me he doesn't accept cards only cash payment when my friend asked me what he would recommend he shoved a menu in his face and said I recommend looking at a menu.

uhh, these are supposed to be carne fries because the boys think they are the best carne fries. I don't think the carne fries are boiled meat and the order is wrong. It's supposed to have the guacamole on top of the sour cream on top of the melted cheese on top of the meat, but they just threw the boiled carne asama on top of the sour cream. disappointment but I ate everything anyway because I'm that big
the descent is not clean and the food is not what it used to be

I was really excited about this event, maybe my expectations were too high because I was really disappointed, very little shade was running out of water by the time I got there at noon, the other vendor obligations were out of food and by the time I ate everyone was already out of money for it I don't think so and when I mentioned it to the manager he was condescending invalidating and kept telling me what point the chefs were happy, I am your big consumer sorry devoured, I wish it could have been better what food I I tried, it was pretty good
great sushi not so good in speed cute place friendly staff try the vegetarian goya it's great the sushi rolls are a bit big for a bite asked if we wanted a tea refill as we were leaving eh

it's a japanese fast food restaurant i am very impressed with the service the owner spent some time greeting everyone i ordered a bowl of teriyaki beef but the teriyaki beef is a lie a bit overcooked and the smell of burnt beef just overwhelmed me the pinko breaded fish plate is one i recommend to try they also have the seaweed salad which i found good and they also charged for the soda refill

this was supposed to be my journey to have the best pizza in America so imagine my disappointment that they don't even serve it at lunch what human who eats pizza thinks it should only be served at dinner which I have since been kindly corrected by another assistant that this restaurant is not the pizzeria my group was confused since the waiter said they served a pizza dinner the focaccia soprassata sandwich was good but overpriced approx i don't live here to try it again so first impression is the only impression I'll leave it to all you greedy hipsters to improve the rating.

what a lame store the employees didn't say hello to me once and were totally unhelpful, their dog food selection is ok but their dog toy selection is worse than foiled, shame too as good quality pet stores are hard to find, there must be something else here and I would go out of my way to find it

I've never been here before so I didn't know what to expect every time I heard the name duck jug I imagined a cute stop joint with waiters and pictures of hunting stuff on hunter green walls, that's definitely not the case, I realized as I walked in, it's just a sandwich place that also sells a bunch of random bricabrac, it's basically picnic stuff, I guess I don't know, it was really hard to get a feel for the place, it was pretty hit or miss for me, but anyway, about the food I ordered, the duckling sandwich was one of their signature sandwiches, it seemed like a good choice because the name of the sandwich and the sandwich itself had duck in it, as did the name of the restaurant, but the sandwich was just okay, nothing special, not worth the money, just a few slices of meat between pieces of bread. my wife ordered the chicken salad and it was very very good, I will order it if I ever come back to this place, she ordered the sonoran with spicy oil vinegar, it was very tasty and no mayonnaise or any of the bad stuff, the service was very friendly but it took me a while to get our sandwiches, there must have been a big order in front of us or something because there weren't many people in the place, I couldn't imagine there go on a weekday during the lunch rush as the queue would probably be out the door and take forever to get your food, luckily for me I went on a hot Sunday afternoon

I would not recommend this place to anyone I went there looking for a gift I received no help the girl was too busy helping baseball players' wives I guess you need a big bank account to receive help at this store and they also didn't have a very good selection of items I think I will take my stuff to other stores that care about their customers

I waited months to finally come here and it wasn't everything I had hoped for. I went for my birthday and had the garlic bread appetizer which wasn't very good and there were crumbs all over the table, it had a strange burnt taste. I had the mushroom and steak calzone which was huge and filling but very fatty and took a long time to get to the table. price, I probably won't come here again because some of my friends don't like this place

I returned to the cork and experimented with the fall menu. I'm afraid my second experience wasn't good as my first, the service was wonderful at the restaurant, but the food didn't make me say yum yum with every bite, like on my first visit we had the risotto and neither of us really liked it. a desert to get real cork, I'm afraid this will be my last visit, there are too many choices like boys, asian fusion food, boys are more consistent and supportive and reasonably priced, sorry cork

they have good baked baguettes and the price was last month but raising the price per roll during the holidays is ridiculous the cashier was short and unprofessional while I was waiting for the rolls she was rude to the next three customers spending the money they need to work on their customer service and I vowed to never go back

I have eaten here a few times but none as bad as last night, the service was excellent and the very attentive food absolutely terrible. I expected them to serve steak on par with their seafood after all they were charging $$ for a Riley. What I was hoping for was a thick steak cooked Pittsburgh style, since I ordered what I received. no it definitely wasn't fresh besides the bad food we were crowded into a small room where we were crazy with other tables listening to conversations ranging from someone's recent bout with pinkeye and another couple who chose to speak entirely in French until the waiter showed up it was like they turned off the French switch and suddenly started speaking English I have had it with this place if I had to pay money for dinner I will be at idiots or at maestro where the steaks are cooked to perfection and half does not end up on the plate in the form of fat and gristle

I'm leaving this store angry and can't stop myself from writing a review, the staff is incredibly unhelpful, you can actually find someone to help you, the store is huge with very few signs to guide you so I'm still wandering aimlessly looking for the one simple thing I stopped for even though I tell myself I'll never go back without someone to help me today, they were out of an item I bought last week and need more to finish my project. the lady at customer service was actually a reasonable age and when I asked her to call the Indian Bend store she gave me her number and said can you call them, I stormed out, so angry and this time I promise to never go back there in the leisure lobby or Michael is worth a visit

they added roast chicken to their menu i love me roast chicken so i went to investigate i don't like their roast chicken to me it tasted rubbery and had a strange smell and it was so salty that an hour later i could still taste it i ordered a few pieces and ate some of it then i ran away i can't speak to anything else on the menu their garlic knots for what it's worth were good

I wish I could give this place a higher rating but my blow dry is terrible I asked for a bloody with lots of volume and curl it seemed like the cross between hold and cosmos would be perfect my hair is flatter than what I came in with my hair is curly naturally so has decent volume but for some reason it's flat also the stylist pulled my hair a lot during the blow dry and apologized for hurting me which I appreciated but I have never experienced with a bloody before i don't think i will come back sad as i love the concept and the salon is lovely update they offered me glowing makeup i decided to try the place again thinking it was a coincidence that my damn mistake was so horrible not only was my second bloody here poor i ended up paying for the service i wrote to their manager who had offered the free bloody but no response

thanks mobile yelp ape without you I would have been stuck in Phoenix with no idea where to get Thai food for lunch which was near a light rail station in tempe I arrived at thai rama around morning walking in there was no indication of waiting to be served and no one visible from the staff so I chose a table and sat down my waitress came to the table and asked if I would be more comfortable at a table sitting at the location of the seated table I had chosen as there were about tables available of various sizes I declined and told him I was comfortable where I was seated, there were other active tables in the restaurant so I didn't expect the restaurant to need my top before I was finished. The waitress put the lunch menu on the table and went to get a glass of water. the menu and directed me to the third page for the salads there first on the list som tom I ordered som tom the standard by which I measure every Thai restaurant spicy made my nose run made my forehead sweat and brought tears to my eyes leaving the green beans and shrimp and jasmine rice the waitress asked me if I wanted anything else to drink but I said I'd stick to water the ambiance here is quite simple and the paper napkins are not of the highest quality the decor reminded me of a formula restaurant like an apple seeds or chili peppers with a hispanic twist I watched the chef as he walked out of the kitchen and made a loop around the dining room as he passed. i needed something, i asked for more chili and lime, she came back quickly with red chili and lime slices, i tampered with the order and fell excitedly for the price, the adequate jasmine rice was about a cup and not too sticky, the waitress was good at keeping my glass of holland water in phoenix which is important to finish my lunch, i sat and waited for the waitress to bring my bill, i didn't see anyone for about minutes then the chef came out of the kitchen and took another tour of the dining room in which he asked me in English if I enjoyed my salad, I replied in Thai that it wasn't spicy enough and I was surprised that he used red chili instead of Thai chili, he laughed and replied that Thai chili was a little more expensive I asked for my check and he said he would send the waitress for it exceptional convenience for the next experience I will be sure the chef will see me before placing my order as the wait on the bill is a bit too long

where I live in Tempe I can walk to the end of my street in an orbit that takes me to the main bus depot or drop me off closer to the Mill Ave light rail stop, not bad, in fact I like the clustering of a real bus depot away from a residential area with lots of security lighting and enough public space in an easily accessible location in Tempe. my bike here either the buses themselves are fine, I had some really bad times on the bus with the passengers, the first time I got on a Phoenix bus a knife fight broke out and I had to stay for a police report another time, two guys were reading hard core porn right in front of me but it's quite nice to mix with people rather than being in a cartoon, what I have a lot of problem with is that in most bus stations, I've had bums passed out dead on the seat met with a single no seat sign in the hot sun I'm looking for your seats in Scottsdale no shade around fights break out in the stations I try to call the subway they say it's not their problem they say it's not their problem they say it's the jurisdiction of the subway for this very bad situation alone I don't ride the bus at night because all the stations close to the art zone and downtown are not well lit, full of sketchy people and the buses take too long to arrive if they even stop for that, I'm grateful for the light rail for Phoenix night excursions, the metro still has a lot of work to do, but considering the improvements I've seen in public transportation and cycling awareness over the last few years seem to be going on the right track

while I am in no way a federal employee, Memorial Day seems to be a time when restaurateurs think they deserve a day off, leaving me with few lunch options and relegating me to the worst of the worst eating at an airport restaurant, turns out the tavern wasn't as bad as all, the bar is nice to spend a few hours waiting for your flight and the titular blue burrito, while not blue in any shape or form, was not too bad by fast food standards and pretty filling for what I spent on it and if you don't like it if you can cover it with cholula, close your eyes and pretend you're eating somewhere better

My wife raved about how luxurious it was, she said it was the best burger she had in the area. I finally went with her and was in no way overwhelmed. The burger was good but not the best I've ever had, the burger wasn't much better than something you could get at cheeseburger cheeseburger chilis red robin cheeseburger and in my opinion I think I would actually prefer a burger from those places to deluxe, maybe my expectations for this place and this burger were too high and I was disappointed with the end product, the sweet potato fries and the gravy were very good the service was excellent however limited seating and was basically rubbing shoulders with the person next to you because you are so tight the lighting in the bathroom is very dim, I'm shocked that techno wasn't playing when I walked in, I didn't like the hip nightclub vibe of this place
the food was good but for the price there are much better steakhouses for that price I would suggest Donovan or Maestros

I spent half my salary here making out under a palm tree that's no longer there and eating tofu and salsa with my girlfriendboyfriendperson I needed to impressfirst dateexbossloverlandlordtwitter boyfriend it's edgy and modern and makes me feel like my blouse was worth it and that I'm worldly and cultured and blah blah blah blah blah there's no fighting what looks like a petite legion of wannabe hipsters and pseudo romantics who can't get enough of this place or it's food and who apparently feel good about eating ounces of food very impressive good for you in my opinion that's not all you have to first pay attention to the number of fried items on the menu fried tofu fried quail fried wontons fried chicken wings fried pork on candy cane yeah there are a lot of fried items they do even fry some of the shrimp in their salads I'm told hmm a bit overpriced for what you get some items are either smothered in gobs of duck breast in soy sauce or have so little flavor they need the sauce the spring rolls ditch the anise basically you pay higher prices for striped fried appetizers even though they are funny tapas how many people write reviews of this place stating they were wasted when they went maybe because we naturally crave fatty food when we're drunk I've had friends who go there and love certain items lime mint beef red curry miso tofu and don't like the others fried pork yoga overcooked fried wontons I also have Friends have told me they've seen everything from cooks picking food with their fingers behind the counter to death stares from chi because they were snapping their chopsticks too hard or asked for their food to come out on time. Seems like he's not the little darling some make him out to be the music some nights can be good at times but also gets repetitive and loud at times this place is trying too hard to be New York while existing in the remote patchwork of dirty lots that make up the Roosevelt neighborhood or as some call it cento, still seems like a lot of empty lots to me and occasional hour long wait times, what is this big human, it's a little food, get over it, it seems like a lot of people need this place to be something, it's just not for whatever reason, you're a fickle, mysterious and too often lemmingesque crowd, my dear phoenix

I really want to rate the place higher, I like what it is about instead of tearing down the building and rebuilding something in this space it was converted into a community space. I went to see one of their cult classics and the staff was ok, it was a completely amateur hour, I guess that's ok for the type of movie and the problem was it was a sold out movie and the staff brought out folding chairs to sit in to watch, which would have been fine before the movie started, but they did it one at a time making noise for the first few minutes of the movie. the movie was whispering and then they kept getting up and down, their seats were pretty bad, their low seats reclined normally, that's ok, but there's usually a bit of spring, they had no support midway, my back hurt and I had to readjust, but there was no comfortable way to sit on the chairs.

very clean store but I guess when you pay more than anywhere else the place can afford it, the people at the front are pretty friendly, there is a lady in the grocery store, she is pretty friendly, chatty, there are people walking around the store with name tags on, they are not friendly or polite, I just can't get over the expensive price of Safeway.

horribly overpriced for a big topping that I had to make myself, the pizza itself was better than average, but if you're not going to cook on site, at least make it cheaper than going to Pizza Hut and having it delivered to my door ready to eat. I'm glad I had the experience but I don't see at all where the advantage is, it's not more profitable than going to the grocery store for a frozen pizza and it's not much better than frozen on the plus side, the girl at the counter who prepared my pizzas was very nice but she's a shame I don't see this kind of business surviving I probably won't go back I'm quite disappointed

stars we decided to check this place out after all the waves the space and decor is nice and cute and girly we arrived for a sunday brunch and there were plenty of empty seats so we could choose a cute patio also i had the french toast with fresh strawberries and chicken and apple sausage but the menu said with raspberries i didn't really care for that, the toast was thick and soft but wasn't that outstanding. spinach and tomato omelette with feta cheese I didn't take a bite but she really enjoyed it came with potatoes and fresh fruit our waitress was nice but the service was slow overall we had a nice little trip it's definitely a good place for a girls day

not good, the patio is top notch for relaxing if the weather is nice but I couldn't shake that chain feeling when inside the table and chairs there was a slightly sticky feeling, the food was typical, a dollop of too much grease and cheese heated in the pre-cooked oven, not impressed, it's a shame as the garden and even the nachos salsa had me expecting great things

After checking into our lovely suite at the Montelucia, my husband said he was in the mood for guan chips and a margarita. I think he had Scottsdale confused with Mexico and unfortunately the restaurant at the Montelucia Prado had none of the above. We enjoyed a glass of riesling wine for me, a bowl of gazpacho and shared the red snapper service was a little slow, but the tasty food made up for it. We met at the Prado the next morning for breakfast. hungry after a camel trek or a game of camel riding, I was a little disappointed with their breakfast menu, they had very little to choose from other than the breakfast buffet, I wasn't in the mood for buffet but it didn't seem like we had a choice, but I seemed to get the most out of my face after stuffing myself with a mini breakfast omelette burrito fruit yogurt parfait and our waiter made a bit of an act of disappearance but luckily we didn't need him much for the buffet, they have good food but could use more options and better service

I live down the street from Casey Moors I have been here three times in total the first time a group of us just ordered drinks and the margaritas my friend and I ordered were so awful we sent them back the second time I went with my husband and I ordered a crab salad sandwich again it was so awful I had to send it back. I'm not a picky eater, nor am I known for complaining about restaurant food or service. the place was already two for two, alas my husband begged me to go back one more time, he was craving oysters and as it's an oyster house I thought it wouldn't hurt to give them one more shot, it was last Thursday night and the place was jumping this time the food was ok not good but decent enough where I might have given Casey Moors a fourth chance if I had been impressed with the service but the service was terrible our waitress brought us our drinks and didn't come back to take our orders for another few minutes we sat there awkwardly waiting for her to stop and although she quickly passed us several times she never even acknowledged us with a simple I'll be back with your orders when she arrived a few minutes later she asked if we were ready to order without even apologizing I'm not kidding when I say she acted like she didn't want anything to do with us she was very monotonous and never smiled with us, I would like to pass it off as her having a bad night, but when she went to her other tables full of men with drinks she suddenly lit up, laughed and had a good time with them, it was so awkward to the point that my husband asked if maybe we knew her and had upset her in some way in the past, but no, it was the first time we were meeting her, we were pleasant customers who didn't complain about mediocre food or slow service, we were polite and left a good tip, we pride ourselves on being fun, engaging and polite to our servers since we go out often, but let me tell you right now what makes me the most angry, we live so close to this place and would have loved to be regulars, it's such a shame that Casey Moors has now given us three good reasons not to never come back and I can't find any information on their website on how to contact the manager about this, so I find myself ranting here on yelp, a completely unsatisfied sigh

well, let me start with a confused look at the overwhelmingly glowing reviews of this dining establishment, raising a left eyebrow and a smirk, but you already knew that first impressions were of a confused club type vibe with a bit of prideful haze. The music was the only positive part reminding me of the hatred of selling out New York. The servers seemed somewhat confused as we had servers at one point, but the bussers were excellent. the menu and associated prices quickly gave me a bad feeling, I'm too used to excellent sushi at reasonable prices as well as happy hour menus with all the favorites, especially the yumzoid dragon rolls, we then ordered a few starters and a handful of rolls none of which were memorable in a positive light. which tasted like breadcrumbs, the spicy tuna had to be the only one that was acceptable and it was interesting to have tuna thrown in compared to the usual smoothie, the soft shell crab was weak and the spicy amberjack was spicy but quite off-putting and not satisfying. We decided to pay our bill then go straight to one of our favorite sushi restaurants to satisfy the sushi craving we definitely missed by hiring a sushi man, let me tell you I threw a back roll and a crazy roll and renting sushi was indeed the sushi hero of the day.

I'm giving the stars only for the reason that the veggie sandwich normally only has one waitress taking orders, so expect a slow turnaround during breakfast at lunchtime to avoid crowds, I pick up a flyer in the morning, call around morning, order for pickup, if I didn't have time to wait to check out I would just ask for delivery, girls must happily eat.

the organization is big with a ton of choices but the employees don't care about customer service, it's very surprising with the number of unemployed people in the city, they have to hire the most incompetent people, I'm not going to be ignorant and say they are all bad, but a few in the group seem to make it difficult to be a repeat customer. change their policy there and hire people with a better level

I visited high reviews I think it's a bit overrated but hey nonetheless my burger was a bit overcooked the food was overpriced but the service was top notch great service exciting atmosphere although a bit cramped I would go back with the hope of a better burger

My husband and I heard great reviews about this restaurant and decided to give them a chance. One word can describe this disgusting place. The food looked great, but then you took one bite and were disappointed. The salsa was lame, the fries were stale. There were only two good things about this place, the soda and the waitress was nice, other than that, don't waste your money, go to Abuelosit, it may be on the west side, but it never disappoints.

I gave it stars but my partner gave it, keep that in mind I wanted to check this place out from the first time I saw it and when it appeared in a group it was destiny. My partner is a sandwich lover so it was perfect. At first they didn't have many vegetarian options, which I found disappointing. they mean whole tomatoes on bread now, I'm ok with a few slices of tomatoes here or there, but giant, limp tomatoes looming over a few pieces of fresh basil and fresh mozzarella, so not appetizing, I ate what I could but wasn't impressed, my partner however made her own sandwich with turkey cheese and vegetables and she loved it. not very accessible for disabled people, I wouldn't plan to come here but if we were in the neighborhood I would pass by here

I recently attended a conference at a hotel and stayed at Squaw Peak. The grounds were very beautiful and with all the activities on site this hotel would be quite appealing to children given I don't have children and it was too cold to go out by the pool. Activities on site were quite limited. The gym facilities and comfortable bed made up for the lack of adult festivities.

having grown up near this little hole in the wall this place was a constant stop for my family it's really good greasy Chinese food that tastes like you would expect now that I live further away I always crave their delicious orange chicken and chicken fried rice if you're nearby during lunch try a lunch special at really great prices

avoid these Einsteins at all costs, I stayed in bed throwing up for over hours because I ate at that dump because I know it was them, my daughter is lying next to me throwing up too and the only place we both ate together less than hours ago was there, the incompetent staff at this poorly functioning business can't tell the difference between a large drink and a medium and takes over minutes to make two identical sandwiches afterwards we came home and ate them fast forwarding hours and we were both throwing up. our brains are out, the most common reason this happens is when an employee doesn't wash their hands after being given feces, then they touch my food and I get sick according to the staff that day, it doesn't surprise me at all. I would recommend starving and never going here again. Now I'll go talk to Ralph on the big white phone some more.

they close earlier than most major book retailers, it's a major disappointment for those who like to go to a bookstore late at night, but if the club is in the lot it seems like I usually can't find what I want at that particular location, it's in my area or I'm probably completely passing it on, this review is location specific, I like bookstores in general

totally excited to try this place my grandparents, mom and I came here for Korean food, it wasn't too crowded, just pairs of people from neighboring offices coming in and out unlike other Korean restaurants, their lunch special selection is very limited. Partly, she then asked my mother: are you Chinese even though it was my mother who looked at me all perplexed because what does that mean? The lady then pointed to the seafood crepe section on the menu and said I don't know why but you Chinese really like this crepe, luckily my mother didn't hear what she said otherwise we had the spicy chicken lunch special, a bulgari and a beef yakisoba. The cool thing about this place is that it has a mini kimchi buffet bar with marinated tofu potato platters. bean sprouts kimchi broccoli and some other vegetables it also has this delicious house special hot sauce by the time we finished a dish of kimchi the food arrived so it didn't take long the spicy chicken came in a bowl the size of an instant noodle bowl but slightly deeper was tender with rice underneath the chicken was really well marinated but the last two pieces had tendons and big chunks of fat what a bad way to finish the bulgari also came in a bowl with rice under the beef was definitely not marinated the color was super light and the beef was almost tasteless, the biggest foodie disappointment was the beef yakisoba, the noodles taking up most of the styrofoam lunch box were sweet, then there was a glazed rice ball topped with chunks, I'm not kidding, three pieces of dogtags superbly meaty in the end, we just decided to take the barely touched yakisoba home for my youngster brother well teenagers tend to eat everything while my mom transferred the noodles to the plastic bowl from the styrofoam box didn't have a lid, I went to ask for a plastic lid, that's the best part, the same lady looked at me, pointed at the salad bar and said you can't take it home, I thought there was a miscommunication so I asked for a lid again for the noodles. noodles at home ok she hesitantly gave me a lid hey hey you we white people no stealing the kimchi started confucius saying no to stealing the kimchi only if I told her that to her face oh and when we got home my brother aka our dumpster took a bite of the yakisoba and never touched it again conclusion if you want amazing korean food and friendly customer service just go to choking choking is way better hands down

Friendliest airport in Americas, really, I disagree, I haven't particularly noticed anyone being overly nice or particularly friendly to anyone else here, what I have noticed is that they have the same selection of mediocre and overpriced, we have a captive audience so we will offer them crap and charge them an arm and a leg for it.

even though they didn't have what I was looking for the help was friendly and the store was very well maintained and they had a decent selection of course everything is a dollar so I said you are fine in my book ask one of the good guys so I won't rule them out when looking for dollar deals.

are you serious about domestic beers during the usual happy hour time that includes old style, we were there for the small game at grocery stores, you can get a pack of old style and charge crazy corona, world famous sliders, they were the worst sliders ever, i think jack and the box sliders are best almost for six southwest sliders with a half dollar sized patty that got lost in the small bread, a jalapeño, a small square of cheese and salsa to make the bun soggy, I know they have a prime location being right outside the ballpark and practically, does that really give them the right to charge whatever they want, they're going to make money regardless, they don't need to be stingy about it

I don't know where to begin the official opening took place in September. We went to try this new dim sum place in Mekong Square as they were advertising it a lot in Chinese newspapers and were advertising it when I arrived. The biggest horror is that they tried to make their part of the food court into a regular Chinese restaurant, so imagine the image of chandeliers hanging in the middle of a food court in the mall, it looks too cheesy. I thought they should go for fast food type dim sum like in San.
