Gabriel California when checking in with the hostess they don't even give a number they only call you by your name so it was already quite different from the way a usual Chinese restaurant handles things totally inefficient at all once we finally got a seat things got worse our shrimp dumpling was raw the skin was thick and lumpy the shrimp was very undercooked we asked them to exchange it for another one and it was still raw, we also had to swap the shrimp egg roll as it was also raw, their excuse was they were too busy and did that. no time to fully cook the food ok how are other asian restaurants able to serve dim sum at a fast pace with fully cooked food which was probably the lamest excuse the brand beef internal organs which i always like to order was pathetic they charged the high price for a very small bowl it was only a few tendons and mostly filled with daikon the pork bun another staple of dim sum wasn't that good either it was almost no char in the bun and the outside of the bun was not fully cooked I understand it's their first weekend of operation but the idea of a cute Chinese place in a food court just doesn't work, in my opinion they even offer wedding banquets here too. I don't think I will come here again unless they really improve the quality of the food. The idea is definitely new but will be a difficult sell.

nice location good service but a little slow i have been here twice so far and both times the food i would give stars but both times they messed up our orders and the burger was cold they took off percent for the problem and it was good overall i enjoy the food and would go again

it was by far the worst restaurant experience i have ever had i paid for a show and dinner i only got the show because it was from an outside source the show went on for hours and by the time it was over half the restaurant i told people still hadn't been served they didn't have enough menus for people to even order from a guy in shorts was walking around with buckets of silverware wiping them on his shorts then placing them on the table the show started at I still had no food the people who got food complained that maybe it was horrible I should be glad I didn't get any food when I asked for our order again the waitress said she would take care of it the guys in the kitchen were heard saying ok these people no more orders not only did we not get the dinner we had already paid for they flat out refused to give us the dinner or our money back we ended up in Dennis eating eggs seriously I have never had such a bad experience in my life can you imagine paying for dinner then being denied dinner or an amazing refund
bad food but lots of food if you are hungover and need some fat this is your place other than driving a block and eating very enthusiastically on the street now it's real mexican food

it's like Filbert's Eastwood Mexican food, it's really good and tastes pretty authentic to me, my husband and I stopped for a quick bite to eat and went there because he heard it was good from his coworkers. I'm a big critic of Mexican rice and beans and this place said it. good salsa bar with all the trimmings

it is unfair to rate this mall on what it was since it is no more and what it is is not as good as what it was, it is also unfair to rate this on what it will be as it is not yet today, it is a mall that I rarely visit other than a few stores that I would visit out of convenience or necessity, there is not much on offer compared to what it once had, the fantastic movie theater jutenhoops alpine ski keller bear blanket and even ed debevics are all long gone oops there I'm going to bring up the past seriously even though it was painful to lose them one by one so today there are linens and things which are hardly unique and a trader does which is nice to have in the area and also an attic and a cupboard of high end thrift store sisters which add some much needed flavor the chillies, booster and black angus are still there just like the jewelry store which never really offered a compelling reason to go in they stuck at the fitness here and they also added a preview and arbs all very healthy choices in addition to all the generic stores and restaurants and standard offerings there are still some unique experiences although nothing like it was crap I'm going back anyway so there are a few places that don't scream standard mall like pita grill a pipe and a tobacco store, you have to spell it that way in this case, a place to buy glasses and other uninspiring small businesses in that sense, I guess it's become a decent and convenient neighborhood mall, it's a real shame because it's missing most of the key elements that made it truly special, it's still a beautiful outdoor mall and the architecture alone makes it a unique alternative to the cookie cutter malls that strategically litter the American landscape. I worry about what they'll do to the architecture when they renovate this place one day, but I think the fact that this mall isn't that interesting in general anymore means it won't be missed so terribly when they lose this last piece of special.

best place to avoid work and play some wacky golf in the spring and summer, sure it's a little run down but it's a slice of my childhood and at least it's still there, I can't find the courage to ride the roller coasters anymore and the bumper cars just aren't as appealing as they once were but the two story arcade still kinda makes me scream a little, the golf is great too I would suggest from playing courses one to three the last two times I've been there we've played courses four and three and four has the least attractions. two are the busiest so it's a choice between being stuck behind a group of kids or in really fun holes oh and they have a black and white photo booth

the food here is good, it's not outstanding or anything extraordinary but it's tasty, the whole making a tortilla in front of your eyes seems a bit itchy to me but so what everyone must have a marketing ploy, I've eaten in and out and the quality of the burrito is about the same personally, I like the chipotle better because I like the dressing on their veggie salad, my one beef is fun since I only get the beans, it's that they were a little too light with everything I had almost no guacamole or sour cream and that's really what helps make a delicious tasty burrito in my eyes I will definitely go back if it's on my way and I'm hungry will I choose to pick it up probably not

we went in April and also Sunday April I went to your restaurant twice and was told twice I couldn't use my logo coupon the first time my mom went to pick up our order she was told we didn't order the right food and had to order off the main express the second time we ordered I was told we had to order from the dinner selection menu I didn't have my coupon handy and when I was able read it it says specifically offer valid for one free selected dinner with the purchase of another free entrée at the selected dinner must be of equal or lesser value to purchase an entrée valid entrees include signature entrees, bowls, salads, dinner selections and lettuce wraps so why on two occasions were we told conflicting information and not allowed to use the coupon thus spending a small fortune on food twice your customer service is way off to be what it was and I doubt you will get more of our business anytime in the near future

I went there first thing this morning, ordered plain sandwiches, took more than a few minutes for the workers to lounge completely ignored, totally disgusted with their service, overpriced food was ok and I felt worthless when I left

I really want to give these sprouts stars but over the last few months when I get a deli sandwich the bread has stale beans in it I'm here so I can't do it if these sprouts still can't give me stale bread I'll be happy with the rest of the store. Cabbages is a great farmers market with a great selection of produce as well as excellent meats, seafood and cheeses.

this place sucks, I moved to the valley and haven't found this Chinese place yet so I decided to try this place, I called in my order and the employee assured me all the food was made to order, always fresh, so I picked up my food and what do you know, I had old jazz fried rice with microwaved shrimp, I give this place a review and I wouldn't eat here if I was hungry sad hostage

Went there for Sunday morning hangover breakfast, the mariachi band while maybe nice outside or not that loud was so overwhelming we couldn't talk, the trumpet was terrible for hangover ears, not peaceful or quiet at all so we sat outside, food was good, service was okay a little pricey but okay because that's what every downtown restaurant has to do, I wouldn't go back anywhere near this mariachi band

I'm going to take it easy since they just opened this place, the onion ring batter won't stay on the onion, the onion was a little raw too, try soaking the rings for hours in buttermilk then coat them twice, season the flour with garlic and pepper, it works for me. lack of seasoning the menu is way too big a reduced menu with better quality would be better the nachos are mean with that quest cheese people love the traditional nachos stack them high and layer them with cheddar all the toppings you are a sports bar limo drop off all the steaks and from the menu you are a sports bar leave that to the maestros and flamingos who want good bar food at a sports bar bottom line I love the ambiance the food is ok the beer was cold the price is a bit high for what you get the menu is too big the food quality is ok what would I do interview a new fresh chef to make some changes good luck I will come back for happy hour and give you another try cheers

this was my first restaurant in Phoenix, I was taken here for lunch before an interview, I was pretty nervous about the whole situation so I don't remember too many details, but I would recommend this place if you are a sushi lover or on the go and need a quick lunch to eat at your desk, the service was great too

I understand I'm not a guy and so I'm not here to declare your twin peaks but that being said I'm there to buy a beer and when it takes the bartender minutes just to get a beer I'm done with it so I was never going to go back but I was forced out with a group of friends who wanted to eat and were just as upset as the first time the fries were soggy and our server disappeared we all decided not to go back just because your handsome server doesn't don't give an excuse to suck

Earlier this week we used our handy Google mobile monkey to locate what we hoped would be authentic Mexican food. We were craving some tasty salsa and spicy meat dishes after a long hot day in the desert. What we found here was slightly different from what we expected. The chips were made from corn and flour tortillas, which was a nice surprise but way too filling while waiting for our food. as much as you want, crispy or soft with different choices of toppings, shredded beef tacos with helperesque hamburger taste, according to my teenage son, oops sad, I ordered the award winning green chili sweet tamale, I'm afraid they left the winners to the judges as they didn't arrive at my table. Plus, we've been in town for a few weeks and will be able to try it one more time since it's close to our accommodation, but with all these Mexican flavored and team houses to choose from, it will take a lot to convince us for a better review.

how does this restaurant generate so many ratings and stars? I know it was on the food chain but honestly the food was mediocre, maybe it was just an off day but I have a feeling it wasn't, the prices weren't outrageous but it wasn't cheap either.
it's not a bad place, it's definitely more team than authentic, but they have Mexican beer margaritas and are well located

the promise of homemade turkey and roast beef dismayed me greatly, it is shredded as Ramsey would say like a dog's dinner, I had the bobby with roast beef so I could taste both the bread was good, the stuffing was cold, the meat was muffled tasting dry dry sawdust, I'm sure the other unshredded meats are great on this bread, it might as well have been the stuffing and the cranberries on the bread and the manager was bragging about how he stood there and did nothing but micromanage the asses I get this guy to clean the toilets

wrong or rather condescending service from the service manager and he didn't even acknowledge me when I asked about the status of my car um more like ignore ended every sentence with a no mama or yes mama rude basically the guy was a real jerk they couldn't even figure out how to fix my car even when I told them what was wrong was diagnosed at the dealership two guys were sitting there staring at the computer like it was going to magically talk to them, at least they didn't charge me but what a waste of time waiting for minutes

just like the other yogurt selection places, good news they had a vegan type for those of you who care to be honest, I ended up getting that one, I'm not vegan at all, but I like a more icy texture and a creamy lesson when I have a cold dessert. One negative is that they are understaffed, they are busy on Sunday afternoons and only one kid working there felt bad for the poor guy but I didn't feel bad for too long after as I mentioned to him that the mocha was bad and didn't really taste like it, he said yeah it's not the normal rainbow kind but that's what I call albino mocha, I tried not to laugh at that comment but yeah, normal, it's her albino mochi, anyway, I don't get the mocha here, something is wrong about it, I can't put my finger on it, it's like a Sophie's child between a marshmallow and an albino mocha

no way around this place is overpriced, from the menu prices to the plate spread fees to the extra ingredients on the sides, the food itself is good, not great, blue burger confirmed to me that they use specials and happy hours when they first open to drive traffic, but take them away once they reach the critical mass they want, so don't get addicted to everything you love about these places

I love Greek food but I need to stop letting my friends drag me to this restaurant. The staff is extremely friendly and the place is comfortable but for me the food is always a disappointment. I know it's a chain and maybe I just have high expectations considering I'm from the back east where we have small family owned Greek restaurants on every corner.

I love Hawkins theaters in general, but this one just doesn't seem to be maintained as well as most, it's a bit dark. The bathrooms are generally not in very good condition. The screens themselves are a good size and the chairs are really comfortable, but the concession stand guide looks as clean as it should be and it generally has the sticky movie theater floor. Hawkins, a mill is definitely in demand, but there are enough other theater choices that I usually do this one

scrambled eggs, toast and hash browns, simple, basic and exactly what you want for an early morning breakfast, it's kind of like having breakfast in someone's kitchen, I recommend starting and sharing one of their cinnamon rolls, they are big and covered in icing, good stuff

As for the food, this is my favorite Lenny's place, they do the perfect jalapeño cheese burger, the fries are really good too, the location is pretty bad, it's surrounded by a greyhound station, a liquor store and some kind of hall, I need to say more.

it's a great place to have a casual meal it's obviously a pub atmosphere but it's big enough to seat a lot of people without it being too crowded they also have lots of conveniently placed flat screen tvs i just wish they would turn on the closed captioning it's one thing if you're watching a sporting event but when they have an analysis show i want to hear the analysis my husband had the beer sampler and enjoyed most of the varieties the raj spa was his favorite the beer of rue and the kiloliter are the most popular we had the soft pretzel appetizer which was ok but I am spoiled when it comes to pretzels having lived in Philly and having lived there for my entire college career I wish it came with a honey mustard for dipping and not just regular spicy mustard. I had the French dip which was solid, not the best I've had but still pretty good. Peaks hi are you going to show the Red Soxyankees game yes definitely even if it's blacked out yeah Fox won't show the game because the Diamondbacks game is on at the same time you're getting an east coast feed from my feed or from Boston yeah you know you're getting the Fox affiliate feed in my or Boston um we'll definitely be showing the game ok drive to Four Peaks hello welcome to the Four Peaks table for yeah somewhere we can see the Soxyankees game oh sorry it's being hidden but I called a few minutes ago and you said you were showing it, no sorry the Diamondbacks game is at the same time so we're not getting the Soxyankees game that's what I said on the phone and you said you were showing it.
nice resort located in downtown Chandler, rooms are spacious and quite comfortable, relax by the pool and sip a margarita at the pool bar
very noisy, crowded and quite unpleasant I felt very cramped and the environment was very uncomfortable

this airport is the most confusing airport i have ever been to, obviously it was supposed to be small and was probably very efficient originally but as they added terminals it makes no sense and you will see the sign you need when you pass it instead of having a sign about a mile in front of you saying you had to go there
the pizza crust toppings are great but the pizza sauce was too salty, I'm willing to try again later
long waits and teenage workers with bad attitudes, said
poor quality ingredients I ordered a red curry beef and the beef was terribly tough I tried to chew it for a minute and decided to give up
glorified apple seed, I think they want the beer meter to cover up the lackluster food services

if you have to be somewhere on time don't use them, I called at noon for a taxi to arrive, they were calling me to say it was right around the corner and gave me their location, Estella called several times to verify my address, I called them, canceled the taxi and asked my neighbor to drive us. at least at the end of the story I was late for my class again, I paid money because I wasn't allowed in and the money is not refundable, so thank you, Estella wasted my time and cost me money, worst taxi service ever

I'm never working again, I've been to this place many times, my friends love this place and I really wanted to at least like it, but here I sit writing my review and fighting the urge to double bin at my desk. I don't remember the last time I felt so sick. Some things about last night's dinner are negative, but I'll start with the positive that moved the review from star to positive. Our waitress was very friendly and negative, but alas it wasn't enough, we ordered damage rolls and a few sakes. bombersum but the shot glass was too big to fit in the glass which didn't work, the waitress asked if we wanted everything to come at once or if she had to take them out as they were prepared, we never got our messes, it took a few minutes before the first roll came out with no wasabi or ginger, the next rolls took additional minutes and the th roll took about a few minutes after the spicy yellowtail roll visibly turned, it smelled like bad fish which I unfortunately didn't realize until it was already made, it instantly felt sick to me and I haven't had it right since, meaning I haven't even had the chance to taste the roll because I didn't trust it anymore. She removed amberjack from our bill, which appears to be a breeder, but you never know these days. finally and this is just a matter of personal preference, I'm not a fan of the seating arrangement, it's set up so that you're around other parties and you can't avoid being all in their positive koolaid at the moment, I'm still alive, which seems negative right now, but I hope this current wave of nausea is the last

I work right across the street and a few of us went here for lunch one afternoon. I ordered a salad to go as soon as I saw the guy getting some shredded sandwich lettuce to make my salad. I almost told him to stop but I didn't. the moment when colleagues opt for this place

nee Hopewell, I just wish they understood the concept of customer service, I tend to feel second rate when we go to dinner, I really love the food, but after attempts at dining with crappy service we decided it was best to just have take out.
nice and beautiful food the bathrooms ki fish cheerios are out of catalog, I want to walk at a snail's pace because it's not very big when you finish going down to the pita jungle or lola cafe

I had high hopes for this restaurant but to be honest it let me down. The wild mushroom and goat cheese salad was phenomenal. From there the atmosphere was great, although I think they are trying too hard to be a steakhouse, but considering it's a seafood restaurant they definitely didn't know how to cook my fish, it was fried and greasy and wasn't marketed that way on the menu. I wanted something light and felt like I ate a ton of bricks. oh and the prices are set as if it were a steakhouse, also note that if that were the case it's not mediocre at best
the restaurant itself is good, the service is friendly and good. I'm not going to go into food other than to say no, well, and all I can muster is a no.

so weekends are usually my husband's choice and he decided to come here, I don't mind coming here. I really like their mac and cheese, you can get it with or without chicken. Years ago the chicken was this really thin sliced peppered chicken and I thought it was horrible so I have since forever ordered without chicken but today my husband chose the chicken mac and I was surprised that now they use real pieces of shredded chicken breast say what and improvement it was really good see the pictures I had the turkey bacon cobb sandwich minus the layers of juicy bacon oven roasted turkey breast on toasted sourdough bread with slices of sweet pepper bacon, slices of avocado, roasted tomato sprouts and mixed greens topped with rosemary vinaigrette and blue cheese crumbles see the photos it was better than I expected they forgot to put avocado on it and the bread was really very good and to be grilled it wants to be too saturated with fat the onion rings could have been crispier but were ok lame waitress today, she was new but whatever she sucked

stars because I really liked the eye doctor I saw, she was great, I thought I was off to a good start on buying new glasses, I picked out my frames while waiting to be taken care of, oh wait the eyeglass gods had something else in store for me, the person helping me couldn't get an authorization code from my insurance company because it was after hours, he gave me some actually said I had to pay full price or come back tomorrow, now keep in mind I've had this insurance forever, I never had any problems before after hours on the weekend and so I used my cell and called the insurance company, I have someone on the phone trying to help us, I put the remaster guy on the phone and he actually fought with the woman on the phone, he gave it back to me and said here you him talk, I'm done, so the lady gave me the authorization code and an explanation that this doesn't happen because most eyeglass providers can take care of everything despite the insurance company being closed and she also asked me if I was sure I shouldn't change my remaster location because of this guy's behavior, but I thought I was done, I have my glasses picked out and I needed them to drive, so while she was talking to me, the remasters guy was throwing insults loud enough for the lady to hear so I wasted an hour of my time and I think the worst is over. The damn glasses gods can't get them in an hour because it was too late in the day, the guy tells me he has the right lens and it was only pm, I'm coming back tomorrow, so I called today and was told the time and they will be ready, I drive there at lunch time and guess what they aren't even close to being. ready so I wander around the mall come back and guess which single pair is ready which would normally be ok but the attitude of the two guys working is arrogant and not very customer friendly I laugh about it and leave so what are the chances I will get my glasses after work today one can only wonder horrible service unprofessional and unpleasant to experience

pretty good Mexican food in the I had two carne asama tacos and a chili dependent plate the meat in the tacos was tender, flavorful and plentiful accompanied by cilantro, onions and hot sauce, typical ingredients but well made, the chili dependent had a tasty red sauce the dough was not too soggy the chili was well cooked not crunchy not overcooked and the cheese flowed when the chili was cut in this dish came with the standard rice and beans neither the other which was remarkable in any way, minus two big stars for what they consider guacamole, it wasn't thick, it had no taste and it seemed like this essential Mexican staple was only there as a topping, no bueno if it isn't thick and flavorful green, you better hit the drawing board, you feel me

slow service staff need more training, there are like managers and none of them know what they are doing. I don't think this place is going to make him sorry, but you lost some very good customers Saturday night because of your poor customer service.

so our teenage daughter is out of toilet paper no problem I'll just use paper towels for days yeah it was a mess and Root Rooter only fixed it so they come back the next day to put a camera in the pipes I think maybe they were looking for trouble because they got them a quote between five and eight thousand dollars to fix some pipes uh I don't think they did a good job with the problem at hand, yeah were they expensive yeah i guess i think they are looking for an extra paycheck now what do you think

eh this place is ok i wasn't very impressed the food was ok i wasn't blown away after being seated we sat at the table for a good few minutes without anyone noticing no one had come to our table once we had to flag down a waiter once we actually got a waiter the service was good. up

I love all restaurants, that being said, I think this one is my favorite, which means it's still better than most restaurants I've had the pleasure of dining at in the greater Phoenix area. I had the chicken sandwich and it was good. I think I could have found something on the menu that I would have enjoyed more, but for some reason I wanted to try it, I think I will have to try the pizza next time because it looked amazing. a while to get a table and order my food sometimes I just want to sit at a table and ask the waiter to come to me after a long day, that being said I would love to try this place again, especially for breakfast

we got the back door pizza for a village and in a nutshell I think the spinach was frozen and not fresh, the prosciutto had an unusual bitterness or was it the sauce we also paid for two boxes of lettuce with bland dressing on one or little to no dressing on the other and maybe some cheese shavings so not worth it

I was so disappointed after drooling over these pictures and rave reviews for weeks, I finally drove ten miles to get my fantastic pizza, imagine my surprise when they handed me this little box weighing almost nothing, I actually asked the waitress if she gave me the right order, it's funny, she asked me where I heard about this place and I told her on the internet, she said yawp sic yeah most of them are family or friends we have stars or something that explains a lot good thing me and my husband weren't really hungry twenty bucks for a snack not bad quality but tiny quantity for the price the sauce is a little raw get some wine and exactly two nickel sized slivers of garlic sausage per slice of cheese it's good quality I can see why the place was empty at noon on a Saturday if you're single or on a date and the high prices don't bother you don't bother, go ahead

the service was excellent until we left, Matthew, a young man in his twenties with brown hair, was fine for the first few minutes of bagging, but he asked if I wanted my pizzas in a bag. I assumed they would be bagged per pizza. They were Livorno pizzas with sticks or wings. Matthew told us they wouldn't fit in a bag, so my boyfriend said it was fine without a bag, but I knew they could bag one per box, so I asked for a large paper bag. Matthew handed the box to the bag. and told me that wouldn't work, I stood there and continued putting groceries online when I noticed he put one in a bag and inter in another plastic bag then things got hostile between the Breton cashier and him they continued to discuss work related topics it sucked because at checkout the cashier seemed irritated about the day the bagging area was overcrowded and backed up seemed to mean something after that I noticed he was doing a terrible job of bagging which caused the bags to rip. a large variety of packages in a bag, Matthew's attitude also changed giving a sarcastic goodbye to the clean store but the carts were hard to find when the store is busy overall I like having a market near me but it was surprising service at the end of my trip I will be back but hope I can get a better bagger

after living blocks away for over a year I finally took the plunge and decided to deal with the long wait to try this place, I arrived on a Tuesday evening, an expected hour wait, but still pretty ridiculous, I went to the Bianca bar next door, ordered a bottle of wine and patiently waited outside. I think the expectation is part of the appeal for people. excellent the tomatoes are very very fresh and tasty and the basil was great also the waiter didn't make any recommendations on wine or food a little weird considering the wait is hours and it's expensive for a pizzeria you think the service would be excellent not at all this guy acts like everyone here is a regular the reality is with hours of waiting for a table I don't have time to be a regular at this place we ordered some pizzas to try biancoverde and wiseguy they were still pretty good with good ingredients I would do it I'm not saying it was the best pizza I've ever had but very tasty, I asked for balsamic to go with the snout and tomatoes had to ask the waiter sometimes, finally we caught a food runner she got it for us I shouldn't have to ask for something sometimes I mean really this place only has tables watch out for guests. wait is it good yes is it worth the wait no
I will never return to this establishment because all the bouncers and servers are unfriendly, unprofessional and disrespectful

an hour that's how long we waited after ordering before deciding we would rather eat anywhere that wasn't here an overwhelming and disappointing experience due to lack of service we arrived and found we had free valet parking with a small parking lot it works thanks a good selection of indoor and outdoor seating also a plus in terms of candor of waits taking care of waiting customers fail on a beautiful fall morning we came here but we are entered the rocker we asked to be reseated outside as the inside of the rocker is dark as a tomb and we had a loud conversation intrusive music we were reseated near the fireplace and a waiter came shortly to take our order, everything is fine for now so we thought after placing our order I ask another waiter to check the status of our food and he smartly asks what exactly we ordered. a few minutes later this guy comes back and says our order is almost ready and should only be a few more minutes soon after our server stops with comments of I don't know why it's taking so long and I put the ticket in right after taking your order son a waiter maybe it might be part of your job to check the status of an order saying after you bring it to the kitchen maybe what do you think fifteen A few minutes later we still hadn't of food and I had enough at the door, we went on a comical note as we were outside for another minute waiting because the valet had parked our car somewhere in Egypt or tandem, our server came to us to let us know our food was ready if we would like to come back inside, oh really, the clue delivery train will be visiting you shortly. we found i'm stunned at how good reviews they have there must be a serious drought of sit down restaurants in this part of town because this shit would never fly where i live i can't tell you how much i look forward to never coming back here ps they own restaurants apparently richardson rokerij and dicks hideawayall right in the same area rokerij and richardson being attached pops they all serve the same menu it's not amazing I've been to dicks before yes it's good no my socks didn't come to steal the profits from the pops go down to central Phoenix and go to Durant Portland Switch or Fes all these places offer exemplary service and food

I had a smashburger for the first time a few days ago and I wasn't impressed, my burger was way too greasy, the smashfries were good but they were greasy too. I don't expect my burger to be dry but there is a major difference between juicy and fatty and they have gone into the land of fat and they have been heavy handed with the salt, unless I want my sodium intake for the week I would suggest they move away from salt, they are similar to five guys in that they don't have combos but they have more options, I can see what the appeal is and maybe the cook was passing a bad day, but between the grease and the salt I won't go back unless I have a death wish

ok so I get the peanut wood accented atmosphere, good service although sometimes rather in front and the dining room bar crowded even on a Thursday evening, what I don't get is the terrible food, this was my first and last visit to this franchise restaurant. How they convinced franchisees and the general public to invest and vote with hard earned dollars is beyond me. the appetizer as well and I was very disappointed with the batter and the two dipping sauces watery ranch and thousand island I really couldn't say that even a franchise like his makes them much better wow on the main course the baked potato with butter and cream cheese was overcooked or something I have never had a potato that looked like it had been soaked in some type of brine then baked or something the color was grayish and the taste like that of a fish sea salt moving towards the broccoli I was greeted with a yellow looking lounge room presentation, I couldn't tell if it was cheesy cauliflower or wow, the taste was again that of something really overcooked or underripe. The last chance for redemption came with the portion of rib eye steak which was medium sized and easily divided between the two of us, great wholesome beef taste and great texture only to be riddled with heavy saltiness. I don't know where this was picked up from, but maybe hanging out too close to the potato, I'm really normally a friendly restaurant patron, but after shelling out, including a tip for two for sharing food and getting served which we did well, you get my signed drift for never setting foot in the truck stop again

I've been craving sushi regularly for about two weeks so I decided to try a new place, this place is right across the street from my work and the reviews here were a vote of confidence. I had shared the cherry blossom roll and the rainbow roll and the hot green tea. The cherry blossom roll was good, not amazing but good. was pale yellowish brown in color and not as moist as it could have been the crumbled macadamia nuts were and an interesting and quite fun garnish the mess was tasty not overcooked but could have used a little more salt the green tea was steaming hot with the kind of nutty aftertaste you get from a good green tea I was disappointed that it came in a single glass not in a teapot diffuser with a cup of tea like in most restaurants my girlfriend had pork matsu the drizzled sauce was mild and vinegary but not too overwhelming considering she ate it all I guess it was pretty good the salad that came with it was a little strange the iceberg lettuce and a cream of sesame dressing the miso soup on the side was better than the little packets I get at the store but didn't taste homemade it wasn't too salty but the tofu had to be dehydrated it was in little little squares shriveled at the bottom of the bowl the staff was very attentive and friendly it wasn't too crowded when we went towards the afternoon the music was typical pop music but luckily unlike some places for example it's not loud I would say it's definitely not the best sushi I've ever had, not even the best I've had in Arizona but it was ok the rainbow rolls in Kobe are better

first of all, I'm a regular here on Sunday afternoons at Charlies, it's something like church to me in Arizona, cold spring beer, good friends, warm sun and boys playing volleyball in the backyard, although it bothers me to see so many of them playing barefoot in what amounts to an oversized ashtray, please keep your shoes on boys, it reminds me of playing volleyball in a huge litter box for cat. Charlies is not for gays who like to put on their tightest shirt, freeze their hair and act like they just saw someone. they know they can do anything except make eye contact with another human being it's for gays who are comfortable with themselves and enjoy talking to other gays who are sometimes cowboys sometimes drag queens but are almost always friendly even if they are a little tanky the little sunday pitchers have somewhat become a tradition and it's fun to watch the crooked people on weekend nights cons sometimes the crowd looks like the crowd at the rescue mission the Arizona smoking law doesn't apply to the covered patio out back so that makes it uncomfortable to breathe there and please take a cab if you've had too much to drink the cops are waiting to catch you later at night Overall it's a staple of gay nightlife in Phoenix, albeit a little tired, there are also branches in Chicago Denver and it was Vegas and it's always a surefire hit with straight sisters, brothers, kids and moms yes, I said moms who come from out of town, especially if they got twisted

I have a new crush and it's pizza from Christopher's restaurants. I have been keeping a restaurantcom gift voucher purchased for use at Crush Lounge for a long time now and decided it was time to use it. I arrived with high expectations in terms of ambiance and food and was not very disappointed. The service was a little spotty at times. seated elsewhere but they were not seated at the food bar lounge or outside in fact it seemed they were the only ones in the room apart from the cooks in the open kitchen. The servers and bartenders bread was delivered but we were each given only a one inch slice of baguette, this is strange especially when the butter pot contained enough butter to spread on an entire loaf, never mind two of the three dinner courses which were relayed to us with the promise of coming back to tell me about the scallop dish but when our server finally returned. about ten minutes later he asked me if we were ready to order so I had to remind him about the scallop dish, what was in it and how was it prepared and how much hmm maybe he was ready to go home came with mom so we had to try the calamari. I also chose the pizza with duck, candied goat cheese and figs for dessert, we had the profiteroles. the tentacles so these were soon finished at least half of the remaining pieces the sliced ​​bodies were undercooked value for money from the menu and I was charged on the ticket the pizza was awesome I loved the thin semolina crust and the duck confit gave the starter a great smoky flavor. the profiteroles were also fantastic, three slices of choux filled with dark chocolate sorbet, vanilla and chocolate ice cream were placed on a lovely display of chocolate panache and whole blackberry and blueberry crème anglice and a sliced ​​strawberry plus panache was poured on top of a profiterole during presentation. I asked if I could have more panache and our server quickly responded thank you. I tell you if I could lick the plate I would have a great happy dessert. I totally recommend the well reheated pizza, still as delicious in flavor and just as crispy as it was when it was first delivered, can't wait to go back and try the other varieties happy hour use anyone

the property is nice and clean the restaurants were great the problem is the snobs at the front desk have no personality they messed up my reservations my family and I found our own hotel for the night they messed up they didn't even try to find us another room despite me paying any price after a long day of traveling with a baby and my wife the last thing I want to do is look for another hotel at 6pm to come back the next day, the attitude of the reception is sad and horrible.
I know it's going to be super girly but I love the four top peach beer and the beer battered fries are amazing

Take into account the negative reviews, this restaurant can be summed up in two words mediocre, overpriced, I wish I had followed my instincts and given more weight to the negative reviews. The positive reviews of the spring rolls attracted me, much to my disappointment, for a spring roll, although we luckily opted for happy hour and only paid for what was still too expensive in my opinion. nothing positive about the rolls I had the lemongrass chicken for dinner the chicken was overcooked and dry and absolutely flavorless and the noodles were too sweet I couldn't detect even a hint of lemongrass the presentation was not appetizing with the overcooked chicken just slapped on the side of the noodles I'm not going to speak for my companions as they were there at my invitation and probably didn't mean to be negative but none of them commented positively on their food as I said watch out for the negative reviews if you like bland and overpriced food you might like this place but otherwise I don't see anyone coming back for more

hey no I stopped here for a quick take out one day while at work they didn't have sushi at all even though it's on the menu and the menu itself is not very well presented to understand what they have what is included I wasn't there to eat on board but good thing very few seats inside the food wasn't that good and if the customer says to go you should put utensils and napkins in the bag for me the place didn't seem very clean either, it's just not a good experience to go anywhere else
a little too expensive but these are teas to die for

betrayal, look it up, let me preface this review by saying that mine is not an indictment on this particular place, but for every change I have had the misfortune of being dragged into, it is in fact the cheesecake factory of bad Chinese food with the downside of not being as capable of delivering passable food, they market themselves as an Asian dining experience, which is a bit ridiculous when they turn around and sell you their equally awful frozen starters straight up in the convenience of your local Walmart everything is bland, overcooked and ridiculously priced once you almost pay for their orange peel chicken you can privately hope they have the audacity to include fried rice this is your second mistake unfortunately the bistro calls you out on your bullshit you get white or brown rice is several dollars more and not worth the money at all everything seems to be cooked just wrongdoing that shouldn't be is overly juicy stuff that should be sauces are overly dry things that should taste good make you question the will of the gods while you find there is no way to escape the betrayal, things get more and more frustrating as you dig deeper the change while having a vaguely asian sound is an all american creation it was founded by paul fleming in scottsdale actually with someone with some asian influence to spice it up a bit named philip chang they literally cut the poor bastards to make it fit better on the signs or as I like to believe, not scare flyovers from white states so it is highly Americanized and yes I have eaten Chinese food in China but I have also enjoyed good American Chinese food here to the point of being bland and regrettable and it is so expensive that you might find your credit score taking a hit after eating a plate of wok charred beef listed as one of the most expensive foods salty foods from America. The decoration is clunky and their famous inclusion of terracotta warriors are literally symbols of Jennifer Lee's death. The restaurant Jim said to me while showing the statues, it's not luck, it's something you put on a grave site, but in the United States they think it's a Chinese thing from the Chinese point of view of change, it's decorated with death, which is very good because everything there tastes of death anyway.

I've been wanting to eat here since it opened and finally got the chance, the ambiance and service is great, but that wasn't the reason I was there. I was there for the food that many people loved. I read somewhere that hanging steak was their specialty and I don't disagree. the side orders were also nothing special and yes the fries were like everyone on yelp said they were good but just like the starters but cooked a little longer the side dishes were ok at best and were a little smaller however the potato gratin was amazing and better than I have had at any steak so far while it is cheaper than the mastroscity hall I think for a few dollars more it is worth it to go to a better place in my opinion, the mastroscity hall has much better steaks and better side dishes but j g it has a better atmosphere

I think the zips are fine, I remember perfectly well that it was the only decent restaurant near me in north Scottsdale so it was this or nothing, the food here is good although they messed up my order and put sour cream on the item but that's a common mistake anyway, I'm not really a sports fan and it was loud here which is normal so it's not particularly my taste but I found it to be made up of friendly people, which bumps it from star rating in my book

We tried this place after reading most of the reviews. I had rice noodle soup with fireballs, shrimp veggies and squid and my husband had a shredded pork sandwich, both were good and there was plenty of food, the pork sandwich was so cheap it was hard to believe it wasn't a typo, it's a subway anyway, the neighborhood is a bit sketchy, but if you don't mind the service was fast and we will definitely come back to this place, the People flocking during dinner hours can't beat the price.

I went there last year when I was in a I thought it was God's gift for Mexican food I was a little drunk last year when I went I went back last week it was eh don't get me wrong still good but not as wonderful as I remembered not even close we had to wait an hour for a table the waiter made us wait like minutes no joke for water and salsa chips seriously minutes you are stupid the desserts were super good even if that was the advantage

As I write this I'm waiting for the toilet in the room above me to stop filling up and for the man to the upper left of me to stop his muffled singing which puts me in a strange headspace even though this hotel is only three years old it looks like it might as well have been built in the s I can hear all the people's conversations in the hallway I can hear people walking in the hallway above mine and for the past two days the person's heavy footsteps above me woke me up well before my alarm Normally I'm pretty lenient with things like this, but this is a roadside haven aimed at business travelers and tourists, too stupid to see that this hotel is almost nothing. You try to visit Arizona so you can get some shut-eye. It's a little difficult in the current conditions, apart from you know, sleeping. The rest of this courtyard is quite pleasant. The interior and amenities more than make up for the absolute desolation outside. too small to handle the number of people who have to park inside anyway it's a newer yard. Marriott is radically trying to modernize its older chains to compete with Hilton and hates the lines of business. This renovation or new construction in this case includes the addition of a breakfast and dinner restaurant and a bar across the street open from ppm, thank goodness for both of these additions as the selection around the hotel is slim as a Calvin Klein model, I think there is a chipotle around the corner, I haven't seen you jump for joy, which is not impressed, the rooms are modern courtyard style with flat screens, shampoos sophisticated, interesting artwork on the walls, wired and wireless internet, etc. this place has low tiled showers with glass doors, I'm used to the sliding curtain that ends up soaking the floor since it's all fabric anyway if they could fix the sound issues, luckily I'm on the side of the hotel that doesn't face the highway, I easily give another star the proximity to anything worth having is pretty bad, but the purpose of this hotel seems to be to house workers in the local warehouses nearby, there are plenty of regulars here week after week, as the bartender told me a few nights ago, a definite draw is that their workout room is top notch and sure, dead, you can easily be the only one there night after night while people who really need to use a gym will walk by you with their minds on beer looking out the window as if to ask why anyone would try to get rid of the food they're eating hmm, I wonder that the interior of this courtyard more than compensates for the desolation

good salad options, it's really hard to mess up the lettuce and veggies as for the rest of the selection we must have just come from a bad night the pasta was overcooked and mushy, not even close to the dense selection of fresh fruit only fruit, not exactly a huge choice if you want a good salad this is definitely the place to go

solo mexican food, I've heard people rave about this place and I don't really get it, don't get me wrong it's better than textbooks or hazelnuts but that's about all I can say, okay their survey funding is good but not great as you'll get just now but let's talk about the purple and teal accent colors that scream, I was remodeled in the bad, good chips and salsa but the smallest bowls oh and don't expect to park in their small parking lot during dinner, the surrounding neighborhood is also defiantly the ghettoize of the valley of the moon area

I was an avid shopper at Buffalo Exchange since I work at a boutique, it was nice to be able to bring in grandma's goods and get cash when I needed it. The majority of the staff knew me and were always very friendly. I don't know if it's new management or new policies, but things have definitely changed there after yesterday's experience. I will definitely take my clothes elsewhere. First of all, the service took way too long. compared to the shirts the attitude of the staff is quite compensatory and it makes it seem like such a task but they fixed the girl working near the fitting rooms was very friendly and helpful I don't want to sound like a hater but as I was quite a loyal customer it was quite disappointing especially in this economic crisis where customer service has never been more important than for those working in retail.

new n scottsdale bad location there were staff members crowding around and there was no manager in sight for a mediocre burger with an uncooked and tasteless bun not big enough to encompass all the arugula they forgot the sauce which is apparently the main ingredient the upgrades are ridiculous here for the cheese on a bow burger already good price fleming blue cheesebacon burger best in town here for the fries and these are the same two hispanic guys who have no idea about cooking inspired by the chef in the kitchen like everyone else restaurant there is no chef for the price you want to see the chef owner represent especially in a new location and you want a knowledgeable staff that treats you like and not conversing with other staff and you want to enjoy what is supposed to be one of the best burgers in town what a disappointment the lack of care and supervision from top down management is reflected in all elements of the bad experience let it go

wow what a lively place we came here while visiting Scottsdale we are always up for a good breakfast and it seemed like this was the appropriate restaurant to try this place reminded us a bit of a great little creperie in Anaheim ca called the original creperie it is much larger and modern so it lacks charm but the food is better than the standard fire that said the creativity is good in their menu selection but poorly executed I had the banana french toast and was a little disappointed than the banana bread bananas used was good but too dense for French toast, there was barely any egg coating to really classify it as French toast, they serve huge slices of raisin toast, but bigger is not necessarily better, the very dry and not flavorful eggs were good and the service was good.

have the owners here ever had a back east bagel that definitely doesn't taste like that and they also charge double what they do back east no thanks the search for a good bagel continues for now I will just continue to have them shipped direct from no

everything about this company sucks, Walmart treats their customers and employees horribly, I mean horribly, they are destroying the communities they sit in, I am done never shopping here again, I don't care how cheap something can be, there is a high cost for low prices

hellish hellish summer weather from March to October it hurts my lungs to breathe I couldn't get transcripts because I had a parking ticket I had to pay the problem is I don't own a car I don't drive I don't even have a driver's license aside from this minor incident I paid us a semester to receive such an education I graduated with a Claude magma cup I attended other universities but couldn't fail to notice the gap in the quality and variety of courses offered for example you have to be a finance major to take interesting upper level finance courses the business school was so and so a lot of repetition very little hanson and help with internships way too much core work and freeride they don't have many good employers at their biannual recruiting events oh and the professors rarely teach the courses their assistants teach us also there is a lack of courses transition between lower level and higher level classes the junior year when you are admitted to the professional program the level of the classes and the transition is not too smooth the campus tutoring program is very helpful for general courses, if you have problems with the courses, usually lower level, there are not enough chairs and desks in some classes, students sit on the floor and crowd on the stairs of the lecture halls. Additionally, the classes don't teach you to think critically, which I think is crucial in college. Don't waste your money, especially those of you from out of state. get me into the classes I need the advisors are walking business school advertisements they aren't knowledgeable enough to inform you I got kicked out of two required prerequisite courses so I couldn't move on to the next level even after preregistration I got screwed and ended up having to take an extra semester to graduate tuition went from one semester in the fall to in the fall one thing I loved was the student theater performances admission was reasonable and quite entertaining the college of architecture and environmental design the studios are pretty good and have good security like it's not the safest neighborhood I was approached by a lot of shady people don't live on campus especially the dorms on north campus they are beyond crap and overpriced you have to share your room with a roommate in most cases for undergrads the first year experience is bullshit they are pulling you, don't buy it and please, please don't move into many Manzanita stores with triangular windows. place yourself on campus again, don't bother wasting your money, especially if you are a foreign or international student, hope this helps you

I love this place because of its originality and the menu has something for everyone, unfortunately it is tucked away in a hard to spot location and therefore continues to be a big secret. I would recommend anyone who lives in Arizona to take a trip and see what this place is all about, I think everyone will be happy with it.

overpriced, misleading, rude, I should have read the reviews before coming here, I got a bridesmaid dress so the top was inches, not much, I asked her how much it would cost, she assured me it wouldn't be much and she did almost nothing, I couldn't even steam it, I was angry but I calmly asked her if she could charge less and she yelled no, she said that it was because the dress cost more which matters, a guy was there dropping off pants that needed to be removed which is a lot more work she charges him for each pair, I don't know if it's much good for pants but his price range seems way off before, I went to avenue alterations and they charge me for a floor length bridesmaid dress that they took in the whole thing and steamed it, they are also polite and will work with you on prices and communicate with you beforehand, definitely worth the extra few minutes of travel

shaved noodles shaved noodles I'm also lazy if I only choose shaved noodles the dish ordered with hand meant I had to hold chopsticks in the air trying to separate a portion of noodles onto our plates not bad but it wasn't special but the shaved noodles loved the chewy texture I shamelessly used my baby godson as an excuse to get a mini noodle pulling show at the window I'll eat my way through the fresh juices I had used to drink every day when I worked as an expat, talking about what the bathrooms are so he's great friend and I think overall the stir fry dishes were a little greasy and the flavors ok but the draw here is the shaved noodles can I plug that in plus and the fresh juice

We've been wanting to try this place for a while, we went there for lunch and had a cheeseburger, fries and coke, it's all a la carte which makes it a bit expensive. The burgers are ok, not bad, but not as big or as fantastic as I was hoping. The fries were really good, but extra crispy. but not as good as I expected, we will try it for breakfast but sometime as the ratings for it seem pretty good.

great atmosphere and amazing location they work really well with a large group delivering orders to the right person without asking who likes this kind of service and not once the service people didn't call any of the guys in our group ok ok a pet peeve of my pet peeve the horseradish potatoes are a bit salty and the portion of prime rib is definitely less than generous saying that the fish and chips were excellent as was according to one of our group the pork desserts and with beans are a huge part with or others

I'm not giving this place any stars, they have karaoke which would be nice except the co-host is mean, the rest of the bar is typical with pool and poker, the food sucks, don't bother going there unless you like being pitied by a lousy faggot at night. I know it's hard but the co-host is really mean

please for the love of god don't microwave eggs if it wasn't for that this review would be a star(s) but seriously eggs don't like microwave they just ruined the whole pain egg sandwich for me the coffee was pretty good they had a selection ranging from light to dark which is good a lot of places have the choice between full city and french which is frustrating. you should expect to see some people picking up the bagel barrels, they mentioned how their office would applaud their arrival and put laurels and accolades on their shoulders, they boasted that their next performance review was sure to be positive with such accolades, I smiled at them and wished them the best in their fantasy worlds, Scottsdale I think is full of fantasy in this desert oasis

We finally visited the new restaurant years after the Richardson Fire. It's pretty amazing how similar the new Richardson is to the old iconic restaurant. Their service is excellent. We ordered a pizza and a salad. I should have known better about ordering pizza at a New Mexican style restaurant. Roasted tomato sauce with New Mexico sausage and mozzarella. This brought back memories of conversations with my father wondering whether press or rabe was the best canned tomato sauce.

I don't often review places on yelp because of the time commitment and because usually I'm just looking for a good bite to eat this time, although I think I would otherwise have to balance the ridiculous number of stars bouncing around for this place. another place I tried in Phoenix that would be considered class St. Francis I could justify a meal again, I feel like I've had times before, in the end I guess I'd say if they took each plate out and cut back on some of their pretentious attitude I'd probably offer a much better review. I don't plan on coming back anytime soon

good flavors quick service I love their green curry excellent happy hour where the starters are off regular price the downside is that most of the starters are fried. I like lunch better than dinner because they offer a good salad with the meal

this dog park got one star why because last time I broke into almost every car in the parking lot stealing whatever they could, lots of broken glass on the side windows everywhere, everything was fine before this incident but a busy parking lot in broad daylight and a vulture is waiting yeah I'm done here
weird place with good food don't expect environment, it's poorly decorated but looks like there's a rocking karaoke setup there, I still liked it

I've never written a negative review but unfortunately I think this place needs to get its act together, it's in a location that never seems to get it right. I'm drugging my husband looking forward to trying it and hoping to see improvement, no luck, no vegetarian starter, not really kid friendly.

maybe the food is great but I will never know the delivery ordered and the chef who doesn't speak English couldn't find my apartment complex even when I went out to the street right next to the distant he said he was there but couldn't tell me where he talked to him on the phone for ten minutes then hung up on me when I guess he was frustrated and wasn't answering my calls he was called back to order food for my visiting family and was happy to find this place but this chef is horrible the owner apologized profusely to me and that It was a nice gesture but waiting an hour for a guy who hangs up on you and can't find a place looking at the exit is ridiculous don't use them for delivery never call breakfast their owner is awesome and delivers to you himself and he actually knows the area can't express my frustration with this restaurant service I never use it

cheap cheap cheap everything here is disposable from the furniture to the linens to the silverware, the silverware rusts after a cycle in the dishwasher, so if you like to redecorate often and have a minimal budget this place is for you as far as their food goes, I only had one cinnamon roll here and it was stale, my biggest annoyance, here are the people who seem to wash up on all the sofa beds, you don't have no house

the pretentious and bad service attendants are totally clueless, although I sympathize with them if the management makes them wear the suits they wear, overpriced fashion brands if you want to spend on a flannel there are much better options, run and check out the sales rack otherwise avoid this place like the plague
if you like the uptight Scottsdale vibe this is a good place for you, food is not impressive, nice outdoor seating

the festival seemed a bit smaller than I expected and I didn't find much to wander through when I wasn't looking at various food stalls. They had a lot of local Japanese restaurants selling dishes such as Nagasaki Grill Paradise Be and Arabic Pastry which was nice, but I'm close enough to all of these restaurants that I could purchase their selections at any time at their restaurants. I think I was overly spoiled by the Japanese festivals in San Francisco because the food selection here was more limited and there weren't as many stalls to buy things. I liked the cultural performances such as the taino and martial arts demonstrations and the shaded area with the bonsai and akita was nice, I think in general if you don't live near Japanese restaurants or don't have a lot of immersion in Japanese culture it's a good way to introduce yourself to it here in Arizona.

it's like a thumb led up to a crack den something good located in a shady spot i ran around to the other side of the street for a late night pepsi diet yeah i know how to party and i felt like i was in an episode of the wire about to do a hand to hand drug buy the hotel is decent nothing special on the outside bed was damn comfortable so i guess that's all that matters wife free throughout but good luck getting anything above modem baud rate my inner nerd coming out make sure you stay on a Wednesday there are free drinks and appetizers in the courtyard get out your flak jacket and sprint to the lobby and you will all be well served by a free shuttle to and from the airport.

This review is for the bar only. I had a date last week and was looking for a local bar to have a drink. I called Cycle on Wednesday and was told they would be open until at least midnight Friday and the guy was very nice Friday. I take my date there and when we walk into the bar the bartender makes a face and says they're closed for the night. to reopen the bar but I was done with that, well done cycle

this review is for the chain in general, the place we went to is new so it's not in yelp yet once it is i will put this review there too, we were there on friday at 5pm, the reason i gave it stars is because the burger was very good and it was done as i asked, my husband's burger was not but the waiter and fries left a lot to be desired, let me start by saying that we had been to several other places, i like my fries crispy, i ask for them well cooked extra crispy burnt tortured hollow tubes, whatever their buzz word is for well done, the location will conform to all the other guys but not tatum's and she said the company said they shouldn't cook the fries that way so if we had to put up with soggy fries, yes soggy, then we didn't want them, she also interrupted us several times which is rude then she went to call the company just to check for us and she came to the table and said they weren't supposed to cook them that way seriously we didn't ask her to do that she actually accused us of being undercover buyers we started to say something then again she interrupted your listening if you explain that our choice is not the way the company wants to present their product and that we always choose to have them in a different way, you must comply, it is after all our money and our decision. go to Paradise Valley Burger Company across the street and Bell, you won't be disappointed

west, sit at the bar and ask for the joy of the bartender, she is a great place for a late afternoon glass of wine with an appetizer, generally poor execution of the kitchen, excellent service, hummus appetizer with a sample of olives, excellent selection, crispy plantains with pepper, tasty and fun. to joy she is a keeper first visit we had a hard time making a sapphire martini properly but that was mainly the fault of our servers communication skills working with machine made ice you know the thing with all the stains and chips that water down a good martini she primed the ice with a strained squeeze of lemon then primed the glass with vermouth in and out then poured the stirred sapphire in a drop by drop drop, congratulations my lady if you can get past the girl's chosen wallpaper. and faux Perfectsphere table plants from the restoration, the tables of different heights blend the room together perfectly and give it a shabby chic look without white saying hello to joy.
clean store good parking fair prices also with gas points the savings are a nice bonus

I don't expect much when eating lunch in a mall, but I expect better than that. The seaweed salad was a generic disappointment with excessive soy taste. The rainbow roll was barely worth eating. The shrimp on the roll tasted fishy. The fish had a mealy texture and the rich was soft and overly sticky. real eternity tea refills, good luck catching anyone's eye as the interior is a dreary, cavernous sports bar room that basically gives no redeeming features here

I couldn't agree with David, the more the owner is really an interesting person, the more money she thinks you make the more she will talk to you and like you, so tell her you are rich, sorry, that's true, as for the food, the food is high for what you get, the prices are very average and double the usual price, they don't charge a corkage fee for Bob which is nice

I loved quizzes I would go out of my way to get a turkey bacon guacamole sandwich any day at this point in my life I will not give any more money to this sorry excuse for a sandwich shop the staff are rude and careless I was given an obviously bad guacamole which I didn't realize until I got home I took a bite of my sandwich to get the taste of poultry in my mouth I had to think about taking my sandwich there was only a couple in front of me i'm done with this place i should have gone to paradise bakery across the street

I always used to go here for tires until my mechanic noticed my tires were the wrong size. I will fix the problem and they blamed me. I was told that I had to choose the smaller tires to save money. I ended up having to spend a lot of money on five new tires, my spare is also a normal size three weeks before Christmas. I wrote the company a letter telling them how bad I thought the whole experience was and never heard anything back.

what were dunk donuts thinking when they brought out the donut selection and only offered one choice before you couldn't decide which one to buy now you just have to settle for what they have these new and improved dunk donuts are the worst I will come back for coffee when I get the emergency ever for a donut oh and another dunk donut thing had basin taps inside that went away too what were they thinking

I wasn't sure what to expect it was a stop on the pub crawl, there was an ego couple in a booth, a table full of customers, they looked like regulars, the artwork on the walls was dark and eclectic but the place didn't have a dark atmosphere. I can't say this would be my bar, but if I was in the neighborhood I would go to this bar for a few drinks and hummus.

my husband I had dinner here a few months ago we have never been and thought I would try the decor was lovely the staff were very friendly and the food looked spectacular now you would think my star rating would be better but unfortunately that is not the case even though everything looked amazing the food was actually tasteless.

it reminds me of camel time, similar layout, I noticed the all hour employees reminds me of jocks well, at least in Arizona, anyway I think they need fans in the bike room, no wonder it's so hot in there like all the hours I've spent in Arizona, it's so hot at least this one doesn't have a chloride or funky smell at first, the employees are receptive when you have questions.

I have to say I'm not a big fan of dibs food, usually if I'm here it's to have a few beers and remind my husband how good at skill I am. Overall, it's a cool vibe with lots of different games to play, the drinks are affordable, and you can't beat the Tempe Market location.

the pizza here is very good but I would warn anyone considering having it delivered to think twice, their system appears to be manual and we were actually asked if you were in our delivery area after a few minutes on the phone I gave up and decided to save the delivery fee and collect it myself. overall customer service is low enough to bring down a star spot to a

torn mango slices add an extra dimension to a traditional papaya salad dish, the original typical traditional Lao papaya salad is garlicky, lemony, sour and peppery, varied, the way this dish was prepared lacked all of these characteristics, but the substitution with ripe mangoes solved this problem and gave it the flavor it needed by design. I expected that to be the intention of this Americanized dish. different for a change the mostly non-minority American diners would enjoy the papaya salad is generally considered an appetizer a feminine dish usually prepared by a woman is also blasphemous to a male cook and I don't want to know but it's the best dish I've had at this place the others were pad thai and a mix of chicken with broccoli both tasted very Americanized the pad thai is reminiscent of a takeaway from the panda not bad but not special overall in its Americanized Thai design that attempts to tone up the flavors of the dish and the way the ingredients are prepared, this creates a different twist to traditional dishes because for example you can't throw canned fish sauce into these dishes like you would in an authentic Thai restaurant which would smoke the whole place up in my opinion. the place is remarkable, both of these factors outweighed the dining experience, parking can be a walk since you are in old town Scottsdale depending on individual preferences looking at the food alone, it would not be a place I would come to repeatedly, it does not offer traditional flavors in the sense that lao thai, thai sean or thai hut do for the same price nor does it expect one to follow traditional food etiquette which is the essence of the food of this region, but it would be a place where I take those who cannot stand the traditional flavors. we should eat a little before coming here

Being the only gay bar in Scottsdale outside of the west side, I found myself in a no-go on several occasions. forbidden is an ambitious gay club concept with two rooms and two DJs in a town not known for its gay nightlife, unfortunately forbidden does not deliver the club is usually quite busy on a Saturday night but the crowd leaves a little to be desired the patrons are mostly unattractive, trashy in fact and not very friendly, I believe the DJ in the main room doesn't change on the weekends where he spins top dancepop to a crowd of drunk students in the oz room the smaller room they have different local DJs who, from what I've seen, spin a variety of different types of music, sometimes it's circuit music, sometimes it's 80's music, it all depends on the DJ for that night, the oz room has been pretty empty the few times I've been there, the sound system in both rooms leaves a lot to be desired from a place that calls itself a club, the drinks are reasonably priced for a bar in Scottsdale. the decoration is ok but not very interesting forbidden is not great it is however simply boring bad music on a bad sound system uninteresting decoration and an unimpressive and unfriendly crowd

horrible service did nothing to correct our experience in July, my appointment and I arrived around noon, well dressed and ready to enjoy a celebratory dinner without any financial limitations, we would have easily spent an hour sitting there reviewing our menus, we were never offered more than a cocktail table around us receiving quality attention from other servers, with the list of favorite house specialties answering questions and we on the other hand were lucky that our server looking at us a lot less takes us to the next stage of our dining experience when the table behind us was seated in good spirits after we had received bread before our appointment and I decided that this was our tipping point and I would not stay any longer when our server came over to ask if we were ready to order we informed him that we would not be staying for dinner and would like the cocktail bill never once apologized the server did not apologize and didn't offer what he could do to make things right and needless to say we were stunned that the hostess thanked us for dining on the way, we both gritted our teeth in frustration but later found out that after an hour of sitting in the dining room we were there long enough to enjoy a meal, it was a shame we never got the chance to do that but what turned out well, trash was quickly seated and the cocktail server provided decent service
I was seriously misled by Frank as it is hot but the food is not bad, it was very cold and by far the worst food I have ever eaten, you would have to drag me here in handcuffs to get me back

I used to frequent this place when there were long songs, the food wasn't good then but it was open and still available since the change of ownership. I have been disappointed several times. The menu size has decreased significantly, which is understandable. The menu of long songs was way too big. They only serve slices of pizza at certain times of the day. I happily take a slice of pizza that was an hour or two old, let alone even at lunchtime, it's not uncommon to have a pretty old slice anyway, the burgers are better than McDonald's but really not that good. they aren't normally like that but I was horrified and didn't try another one, the owner is impatient and you can tell he's really trying to keep the business going but the staff he hires can be very rude sometimes. I heard snotty voices saying they didn't have slices when I tried to order a slice of pizza during off-peak hours and was denied a simple refill of my soda when my order took much longer than expected, which said I haven't been there for a few months so maybe that has changed.

a friend invited me to lunch here at the mission the physical location was great i had the zones which was good not great my friend had the tacos which immediately after serving them he realized he had to order something else a small portion my portion for the zones was plentiful as the Venezuelan sandwich itself is filling but also came with a mix of regular fries and sweet potatoes which were good actually the ketchup sauce was awesome now that i think about it the price hmm a little too expensive for lunch in my opinion but I guess it's Scottsdale that's really what made the difference between one and one star for me here

I am a long time customer of this car wash at this location. I've been going there since it changed from Weiss Guys to Diamond Car Wash and now it's known as Francis and Sons. It seems the service has declined with each change of ownership. Today was the tip of the iceberg and I won't go back. I started with their window repair salesmen I still get the premium car wash a few weeks ago I went there and when I got home I noticed they hadn't cleaned my dash or center console which is included in the premium. I also noticed that they didn't wipe down my tires after applying armor and it all splattered on the sides of my vehicle after leaving, I chalked it up to just a mistake and that it probably wouldn't happen again today, the experience was worse. upswell, I was then pressured to buy it in advance so I could come back another day and get it waxed. No, that wasn't a response to that guy. I had to step away to leave this wave of pressure again.
