I went here with friends last Friday, all my friends and used a yelp at the end of the meal taking into account the costs, we all came to this star place, it was a huge disappointment after looking at the positive reviews, our first disappointment came because they had a limited beer list, my good friend just wanted a spa and all they had was the normal domestic beers and a few quality ones, then the Spanish ham wasn't very good and once as you took into account the price it was terrible, we had a sausage plate where the sausage was dry, the calamari was extremely fatty, the only good thing was the lamb chops, but once you took into account the price which was also poor we all came to the conclusion that we would never go back.
ordered the philly spring rolls, they came out still frozen in the middle, it's random if the waitress will be decent or not

this bar is reminiscent of old pants it's not too tight not perfect just a little fitted there are a few holes in the knees and it's a little faded it's definitely not perfect the mulligans are this bar where you can go and fight with your friends you never know what kind of people you're going to meet fellow drunks bottle rats who have been kicked out of other places the drinks are cheap the beer selection is so so the bartenders are pretty nice but it's not just an average bar but nothing great nothing bad

mini course playable for players of all skill levels if you have never played golf this would be a good course to learn for low handicappers. It's Birdie Paradise. Kenny Mac has a large chipping green and two putting greens as well as a driving range equipped with crappy balls and mats that I refuse to use. The course itself is wide and flat and is definitely not a destination golf course. course plays extremely short bonus star for having cute cart girls

don't bother with this place, I had never been here, my husband and I decided to go get some food to take home, we ordered shrimp tempura appetizer, assorted tempura appetizer, lobster appetizer and yakisoba when we got home the order was totally wrong instead of lobster, we were given mussels which were disgusting instead of assorted tempura and shrimp tempura, we only had an assortment of tempura with that's right, only shrimp in the whole mix, the yakisoba was the only part of the order, they got it right and it wasn't that great, pretty bland, I love Japanese food and I was really excited to find a place nearby and while we were waiting for our order we were excitedly planning to come back and get their sushi, but after this complete confusion and poor quality food I can't not trusting them with anything raw, never going back, such a complete disappointment

did i go to fes last night for happy hour and then back for reverse happy hour we had the poppers the turkey burger special orange margarita beers pomegranate margarita chicken phyllo pastry and the walnut brownie both margaritas were good but the food except dessert was all terrible we have been coming to fes for a while now we normally order just the starters we were surprised at how good the starters were terrible majority of food was not eaten

this place was amazing my favorite memories from years past i go to this seafood restaurant with my parents it's not the same we went there for my wife's birthday my dad decided to join us my wife ordered a steak and shrimp my dad ordered a steak i ordered a lobster stuffed with crab i ate the lobster stuffed with crab several times before we wanted it we got our appetizers dad got escargot my wife and i shared steamers my dad was happy with the snails but then again how can you go wrong with snails doused in garlic and butter the steamers were small clams steamed in a garlic broth they were not longneck clams like the rest of the world calls steamers I wasn't about to argue with the waiter that those were the wrong clams the food arrived and for the first time in my life I asked the waiter to take my meal back before I even tried it, it looked dry and overcooked I told the waiter that I had eaten this dish several times before and that's not how it's supposed to make it but he told me what it's supposed to taste like and begged me to try it, I took a bite and couldn't even swallow it because it was so dry, of course the waiter was left at that point and didn't come back for minutes to ask me how it was while I waited for the waiter to return. jerky and butter, my dad and wife would have complained too, but it's my wife's birthday and I'm already stealing her thunder. I traded my meal for a steamed lobster, how can you waste a steamed lobster, luckily it turned out well so we left hungry and poorer.

I've read several rave reviews about this place. I was disappointed the first time, so I went back thinking I had a disappointing experience. I was still disappointed that I got the meat somehow the first time and the Cubans the second. The food was okay, not bad but not filling and not as good as other places I can name from memory. sorta th st Hatcher El Gallo Blanc Central Indian and El Copalite th St and Thomas
the service was slow the waiter knew nothing about the wines on the menu and knew nothing about good wine service boo
I went there last week and ordered a dozen varieties. I didn't care, they were very dry, the frosting wasn't very good, even my granddaughter or granddaughter spit out her cupcake.

Somehow, while trying to write an update to my incredibly witty original review, I edited the original review by mistake, resulting in the loss of my incredibly witty original review, worthy of many of us. Now my fans are stuck with my new, incredibly less witty review, believe it or not. at home but what do you do when it's August and the idea of ​​adding more heat to the kitchen just won't do the trick and yet you really need a cupcake, you wait in line to pay for the cupcakes. I've been to the nuggets maybe a few times now and they have been pretty consistent. I like their frosting but I find the cake to be a bit dry and flavorless. box of betty crackers, I'm not saying the sprinkles are bad, they definitely have their place in my life for a cupcake fix, especially when I know if I make them I'm going to eat them, but I wouldn't go so far as to say I'm a fan unless they drop their price then I'll be their biggest fan

I was looking at the gyms around the area as I walked in, I was greeted by the guy at the front desk, I asked about memberships, then he said sorry, we're sold out, I stood there stunned, then he snickered, I was joking trying to be a good sport, I went with it, then came the young salesman, he was friendly at first, anyway, showed me around the gym and I was interested in joining then we went to daycare because I have a little one, the children were in the room, but the two girls who were watching the room were discussing it. with each other and ignoring the kids bad sign, I asked the girls if they were certified for their car and if they had fingerprints and background checks, the world stopped for a moment and they looked at me. see the kids area and the kids were completely ignored and we are talking about very little kids when I told the salesman I had to think about it he went into some kind of Dr Jekyll Mr Hyde routine well you only have today to make a decision after that no price guarantee from there he was really rude I walked out of there thinking about what just happened like Sarah G I felt horrible when I left that gym it was an experience horrible, I ended up getting a membership at a tangible fitness down the street, they don't have the same amenities however it's locally owned and the people there are very nice
ordered the steak sandwich medium rare came out cooked medium still very delicious the fries were not good, way too salty the waiter seemed like he didn't want to be there with a grumpy attitude

I have to hand it to Smart Final for providing incredibly economical pricing options for brand name products and supplies. It is worth visiting to save a lot of money while shopping here. This is one of my stops for party supplies like plates, cups, napkins, water and think smart finale like dollar store meets Costco.

random food I ordered the meat plate with corned beef a lot and asparagus for sides the corned beef was way too salty and the same thin style you get on a sandwich I sent it back for a chicken breast in which was the driest chicken I have ever eaten the side vegetables were good perfectly grilled with no butter and came with garlic bread I think this place has potential but I ordered wrong I sat at the bar and the service was poor the price was quite low but it's a good place to watch the game

I'm used to a ranch in northern California and this supermarket was nothing spectacular it's a good place if you want seafood all the traffic was around this area the food in the take out section didn't look very nice the market also has the bakery peking duck flattened duck and roast chicken there is also hong kong express togo food where you can order dim sum noodles bob conger drinks rice dishes and it's right next to the takeaways the most interesting part of the supermarket was selling Chinese pancakes in front of the store, you can order mini pancakes with red bean, coconut or custard filling, each pancake is made to order and each of them I tried the custard and red bean pancakes and it was pretty good. Cash payment only for crepes, you also have to wait a bit for crepes as there is a long queue

I'm only reviewing it with stars because my server was too busy and I don't think it was his fault that we arrived and were able to get seated which is great because when we left there were tons of people waiting we had a coupon to join their mailing list that gave us a free meal with the purchase of another which is great because who eats alone they also recently renovated the interior and it looks pretty good my wife has ordered the usual broccoli quiche and it was only a little warm, I usually order the bacon and eggs which is great but today I ordered the Florentine Benedict and it was very good, the food is always great and the service is generally great except today but I won't blame Kevin as he was obviously supervised. I hope they get their stuff together because I will be going back and I know I can write a better review later since I have been here several times and this is the only bad experience I have ever had.

k i don't understand i go there every once in a while i only ate the pizza it's a step up from the frozen pie from the supermarket i like it because i like frozen pizza but i think the ratings given are a bit misleading it's cost effective and if i think this place could be amazing for stones but if you're looking for high quality pizza this isn't it i would get it over the chain though

Earls is Earls not great, not bad if you are in the neighborhood and have nowhere to go, go to Earls by far, there are better choices but Earls will do when you are in a hurry, typical bar food with no special edge to make it memorable, the staff are very friendly and the service is very good, just average, not memorable

I went here for lunch on a weekday and thought it was busier, the slower setting allowed for more personal attention, although the chef even came to talk to us and gave us free samples of some desserts. The food was good but didn't blow me away. I think it's a good option for a fancier, somewhat expensive lunch with friends.

best beer selection in Arizona but the good features stop there it's the only reason I come back and put up with the following service is often terrible even during the day when there are few customers you often have to go to the bar to order even when there is a waiter in your section it makes no sense for a mug of beer to be empty for more than a few minutes before one notices the food is mediocre and wouldn't get such a pass from most people if this place did not have reasonable beer prices, website is often inaccurate what is actually available

it was just ok, i liked the option of fresh jalapeños, the fries barely had any seasoning, it was a bit pricey, but filling free peanuts, but i wasn't sure if it was ok to throw them on the floor, they use the same color scheme as in n out, which i thought would be many, i'll try it again in a few months anyway

about miles round trip from the maricela ramada, quite a nice little climb, but then you end up on a road towards the summit near the top, you can unload a bit up to the top, you can see it goes all the way to the town center, the total time up and back was a pretty easy hike, this was my third of four mountains on a Saturday in April

if you have been to a cpl you have more or less been to them all, i went through a period where i really liked this place and i still don't mind it, i guess i am not excited about it anymore, the chicken pizza is my choice but the thai variations are tasty also the starters are ok the service is ok but everything seems a bit played out to me i am waiting for cpl to make some moves to shake things up, add something interesting to the menu as I feel like nothing has changed since then I will still come from time to time but I won't be as excited as before

I don't like this place, we went to this one instead of the one downtown on a Saturday night with a voucher from another place from a bad late night upchuck sushi experience with a nearly empty restaurant, we still ended up waiting for minutes to be seated then pushed and I mean pushed next to the only other table in the place. not that hard so shut up and color for Christ sake, our waitress took another few minutes just to greet us, the sushi took forever and if you can believe it the fun hadn't even started yet when we paid the bill, we presented the voucher to the waitress who said she can't take it, the manager came over with a bitchy look basically trying to call her shut bull and kept giving us the degree of it for the next few minutes, definitely not enjoyed it she takes it to the point where she calls the other place we got it it takes another few minutes and finally gives us our bill back only by removing our rolls and nilgiri it instantly created an angry assistant don't bother with this place you might find bomb shards in your soup and they would still not care and for the sake of all that is holy stop with the crazy scene from i amtoosexyformyself you're not that cool

it serves its purpose, its raging waters, it's not a small water park attached to a mini golf course, its slides are fun, the nighttime splashes are great, the temperatures are bearable by the sun and no sunburn, I would definitely never go during the day, I couldn't imagine queuing for hours without shade temperatures and broken misters. the last few minutes of waiting for the wave pool to enter the wave pool and waiting about a few minutes only for the wave pool to never turn on and the park to close, wasting almost a full hour of that night, it was a bit disappointing, I would probably come back again, but only because there is nothing better in the valley

the florist is great but I didn't have a good experience with the night manager, he seemed upset that I was stopping him from stocking the shelves to ask him to place an order for flowers, he said he had no idea how to order flowers and couldn't help me.

I found hair in my burger while it's not completely horrible, I was put off by another thing I saw in the restaurant, they had red buckets of sanitizer sitting on the food preparation counter while I like to see a restaurant clean, I don't think it's wise to keep a bucket full of cleaners inches away from the food preparation area. serious lack of staff supervision

there are definitely better places to go in old town overall, the martini ranch is usually pretty slow and charges a cover to get into an empty place last time I was there my friend and I got our cover back because it was so dead they have good martinis though
the food was good, I ordered the vegetarian combo and was a little disappointed that it didn't have more variety of things, but what it did have was good

the very definition of average brunch, my omelette was pretty decent and it's nice that they let you choose a bunch of ingredients if you want, but the breakfast potatoes are extremely weak, quite bland and under-seasoned and probably not cut and prepared by hand, they are tossed with an uninspiring mix of green peppers. The rest of my table seemed as excited about their breakfast burritos as I was. jump

cold undercooked chips if a Mexican food restaurant can't get this staple how can I expect them to get much more I arrived for a party where my autocross group was setting up every table with chips and salsa on them. Italian Mexican nights, I really love Mexican food, but I left this place hungry because I didn't even want to try any of the dishes other than salad

I have been to the garage twice now and they are fighting for going there on a Saturday for lunch and the food and service was excellent. I had the pulled pork sandwich with sweet potato fries which was original for the pulled pork served on a pizza crust bun. My girlfriend had the Buffalo chicken salad which was really good. to sit on the patio the hostess told us a server would arrive shortly per normal procedure about a few minutes later no server had come and the hostess came back and asked if we had been helped. We said no so the hostess said she would find someone in a few more minutes and no servers were busy on the patio about the tables were all occupied with food and drinks.

I've been going to Boss on and off since they opened, I have a bad experience and I stop for a while then I figure it's just down the street why not, then the disappointment came again on a Friday morning for their special curlers donuts which they only make on Fridays, of course nothing was prepared, they informed me it would take another minute to finish the donuts, very very very irritated. due to my purchasing below when you don't have what you advertise you may want to waive the fee or you will really piss off this customer, common sense customer service is horrible see when I get home I never got the right dozen donuts I ordered I don't understand I'm perplexed I don't think it's anything personal I never get the right dozen they close the box I pay and go home, surprise, the donuts are ok, nothing great and not bad, they are donuts, they are convenient and close, but I have to remember to pass on the pattern. donuts

I've been here twice which was obviously enough the first time before I was old enough to legally drink it became obvious to me that state fairs are only fun for people of more or less age. I came with friends who bought a burger from one of the tents, took a bite and threw it in the trash. One later remarked that it was the only time in his life that he spat out food in disgust while this was happening. his reaction suggested we were crazy for asking such a ridiculous question. We assumed that perhaps because of some strange war injury he hadn't peed since customer service isn't high on the priority list at the state fair and edible food isn't either.

I went there with three other people on my first last visit, the menu didn't describe the item correctly and instead of a pepper dish I got a port dish, it was terrible. The other three I went with were not very happy with their meals. The restaurant was extremely noisy, not pleasant at all. instincts are not commercial, it's a third world country, they can barely afford to feed themselves, they have no history of cooking, I wouldn't waste my time and money in this place again

ok so I think this might be the first company that gets a star from me, I just got back from Israel on this airline, they are pretty sad, I usually don't like to be too hard on anyone, but this airline deserves it, please don't take this review as a complaint, but rather as a warning to others to never fly with us. let's say it's good for them but the service on the planes was not up to par, I guess I was spoiled by the Hawaiian airlines, Nippon Airlines shoot, you can even throw some delta in there, the flight attendants are rude, this is both from personal experience and from my own observation, you know what I could go on and on, but I really don't like crying over things. they didn't treat me well because I didn't shave and I looked like a Taliban, oops

It was the most horrible floor cleaning I have ever seen, we took before and after pictures and I can't tell the difference at all. The guy was not friendly and just wanted our money even though he didn't do his job. I would never recommend this company to anyone we paid for and received service from. I cleaned the floor the day after the cleaner came and got a lot of stains as he easily said. Really
it's pei wei the service and food are always satisfactory
the food is not all that I ordered, a salad that was barely touched, however, the chicken ice cream that my friends ordered was quite delicious, overall this atmosphere was surely nice

Went for dinner here on a Saturday night, we put our names inland, only had to wait a minute, not too bad, the bar was a little too crowded to wait there, so we went a few doors down to spend our time dining, we had a great waiter, he was super friendly and vocal about his opinions. I would love to tell you that all of his recognitions were perfect, but they weren't. and the Caesar salad with shrimp, the prime rib sammie was mediocre, the beef was not flavored at all and when we got the fries they were cold, hot plate, cold footnote, a good sign we got fresh fries. I didn't finish my half and moved on to the salad.

this is the first robin i went to earlier this year, service is still very good, good veggie burgers love bottomless fries, garlic, sweet potato, fresh shakes and mixed drinks, one of the few restaurants that stays open late in this town, a great place to come after a movie in Hawkins.
not bad, I usually leave pretty happy and full

When I saw this place pop up along the daily drive home, I had high hopes as I was counting down the days until I could go to this place for a nice weekday lunch with a name as ostentatious as the Scottsdale Salad Company. I was so happy with a real alternative that I imagined crazy vegan vigilantism, staunch environmental activism, and a ridiculous, gargantuan salad buffet paired with the usual fresh and exotic dishes. whilst retaining a certain personal image of health in the guise of a glorious salad bar, alas I was so disappointed that it was essentially a shell of a quick service Chinese restaurant very lightly skinned to be a basic restaurant the place was virtually empty in Highborn on a Tuesday. I ordered the large Parisian salad and a soda. cabbage bomb in a plastic clamshell oh my soda was a nice styrofoam cup that I filled on the fountain machine all for about the cost of the food couldn't have been any more than even if purchased at Costco next door I was definitely not paying for the lame ambiance a few people there got packaging that looked gaunt and a general poor excuse for packaging that I would like to pay money for at a restaurant I could make the same lame roll at home for about as this place is simply another ticking firebomb of another failed independent restaurant if the owners take a risk and venture into being more than gas station food they might have a prayer

I'm giving this place stars because it just doesn't have any, the energy in this place is lacking the food is nothing to write home about and seriously I could have done better in my own kitchen the con quest spinach dip was ok but the chips that came with it were stale and the chicken avocado sandwich was dry and came out like a burger not a sandwich the skinny margaritas are horrible and lack tequila and the bartender doesn't know how to make a good one martini to save his life As for the staff, our first waitress was a little too friendly and almost sat down to my husband's laughter. I know a little flirting comes with the job and that's what you do to get a better tip, but come on honey, how did you know I wasn't paying for this dinner if I was the only tip you would have gotten it would have been a bit off overall. what she did as far as her work and flirting was outstanding she knew how to do it while still being a classy lady and I respect that as far as the clientele of this place goes it is a younger crowd full of drunk and loud guys at the bar watching the football game which is what you would expect at a sports bar apart from the quieter more tolerable crowd overall I will not be returning nor will I recommend this place to any of my family or friends friends

oh my god I loved this place, it's the closest store to me and I have my Safeway card so I'm good to go, it's a mess first of all, the parking lot is too small for the amount of stuff going on in this complex, I'm shocked there aren't daily accidents in the parking lot, people are eager to drive in the middle of the rows instead of one side. they could move around inside the story, they always seem to be in stock and never seem to be stocked when I go, I can never completely complete my shopping list, there is always something that isn't stocked so I have to come back or just go without, but today I took the cake, it was just after one in the afternoon, every row there was at least one person blocking half the row. I tend to go there I feel like I need to carry a mace or have a buddy, so I can go back there for a quick shopping trip, but for big shopping trips I will leave the house to go somewhere else, even with the gas prices.

I love love, I love consignment, walking into this store, the smell was great, but I have to say I'm disappointed in my sister's closet. I had heard such good things, so I was really excited to go. They had some amazing designer handbags including a Jimmy Chi handbag that was huge and beautiful for the designer section. the items were really dirty and still had high prices, you could see food stains on a looney bag, a black coach strap with white food all over it, still very expensive because as dirty as it is, even if it's a brand, sometimes your store's reputation is worth more than the money you'll make selling something dirty, just my I've seen sensors placed in jeans pockets, wallets in leather and other questionable placements when I asked about this topic the seller just said well maybe there is someone new that is not putting it in the right place that is damaging the items that people are buying and they may not realize the big holes placed by those sensors that I loved there on the web beacons I have never seen that before but they are really pretty and catch your eye if you want to take a closer look I prefer consignment stores to identify the sizes on the hanger by color coding or other for easy searching for my sizes I get bored very quickly trying to find my size as a consumer I would have spent more time searching if I could have actually scanned the shelves more easily to find the size the shoes are well organized and clearly labeled they weren't too crowded so it was easy to see the shoes there are some positives I bought a small le sports bag as it was new so I think it was a good deal but really be careful what you buy the prices on the handbags seemed high for second-hand resale and their obvious stains of use

nice park but people need to keep an eye out for aggressive dogs my one month old puppy was beaten by another dog this morning we were the first ones outside this morning around morning we were just there walking around this lady and her gray and white dog was walking around then the dog came up to us for no reason and jumped on my puppy just started beating him the owner didn't even do anything the dog was almost killing my puppy i yelled at the dog i tried to stop him then he attacked me very hard on my left hand the owner asked me where I was going I said West Valley hospital I was very scared she said she would meet us at the hospital I never saw her appear this kind of aggressive or angry dogs should not be allowed there yes go at your own risk but people shouldn't leave angry or aggressive dogs outside the owner didn't even say sorry or give me her name nothing shameful for her and her aggressive dog I hope she teaches this mean old dog some manners Brenda Hansen the hospital visit was long but West Valley took special care of me thank you hospital
the service we had was good, food was ok, prices seemed high, just a nice sports bar, will never go there again

the services with view and the drinks were perfect but the food was not good i went there twice the first time it was for drinks and the view was wonderful so we went back there for dinner the dish was not good if you want a wonderful meal for your date try somewhere else and go there for the drinks and view after dining there i will not take my guests there except for the view and drinks

what's up with the guy that works there he's really pissed off overtime I actually go there last time I was there I walked out because he was yelling at one of the workers and it made me want to cry I wish she had walked out the previous time too he was rude not just rude but a complete jerk to the people in front of me what a whole star because it's at the bottom of my job and it's cheap and if one of my coworkers goes to get a slice, they always get my Hawaiian pie

came for dinner with a friend with the discount coupon the service was attentive, friendly and overall excellent the English conversation is far from excellent but the fact that they took off from our two meals more than makes up for the fact that it's still a bit pricey for two girls with small appetites but not bad pain poor naan mango lass hot chair tea tick marsala panzer making lamb curry and many other options available I would avoid the crude spaghetti noodle option and clumsy as it seems being another mango flavored fruit cream overall a good one My favorite part is that the dividers still have bears from when it was a black bear dinner.

I know they are doing their job and I can understand that but we couldn't shake our sales person, we finally had to say if she didn't leave us alone we were going to leave, we absolutely couldn't discuss anything because she was constantly there, we even said we would come find you if we needed help, literally any room we looked at was touching or approaching, she was on top of us oh, isn't it a great piece we can set up financing and lock in the sale price and if you buy k worth today with cash we will throw in every item they have I have cool stuff no doubt about it but I know this game and it's no fun it makes shopping miserable plus it's too expensive for us we got the exact same parts same model same sky at pruitt for less than half we would have paid at ashley

I have been going there ever since and have always enjoyed the food on many occasions whether ordering at the grocery store or dining at the pizzeria the music was so deafening it obliterated any ambience or any semblance of a welcoming neighborhood restaurant last night the demographics of the pizzeria during our meal varied by several years several calls to turn the music down just enough to be able to hear the server standing next to me were met with that's how we do it things and there's no point in asking because they won't turn it down even a little, the waiter David said that many waiters consistently relay complaints but the owner really doesn't care, the hubris is so unappetizing, I think the food is excellent, but since I have no desire to support a business that really doesn't care about their customer base, I will spend my money liberally elsewhere.

discount tire is our go to place for tires of course living here with surprise there are not many other options if any we recently received new wheels tires for our truck as well as the boat trailer fast efficient professional service is what we expect at discount the only complaint is lack of follow up most often my husband has to call them to check the status of orders he has placed they say they will call him when this or that arrives, it's always him who makes the calls, I would like to see them really follow their customers because I promise, when the orders arrive, it would make this already very interesting activity even better

the restaurant reminds me of a quaint little countryside, it gives me that homey feeling of being in a family owned store instead of a chain restaurant. I love how no matter what entree you order on the menu, you can get a full meal of it. Each starter comes with a drink, bread soup or salad and their spumoni ice cream for dessert. However, if you want Italian food you won't get it here, it's a very Americanized version of Italian food, they have all the classics, pasta, lasagna and me. i have been here a few times and tried a few of their dishes spaghetti vesuvius cute name to start spicy chicken sausage and mushroom meatballs i didn't think it was that spicy but it was very salty it is a very tasty dish however the individual tastes are all mashed together the noodles are a little hard for me maybe not cooked enough but some people like it a little hard gourmet giant crab ravioli there are not many pieces of ravioli in the dish the edges that weren't covered in pesto alfredo sauce were dry, I liked that they used fresh crab meat in the ravioli, the creamy sauce wasn't bad and it wasn't too strong in my mouth, I could taste the pesto sauce while still enjoying the texture of the baked crab lasagna, it's the best I've had, it has some kinds of cheese, some ground beef and pork. were cooked quite tender for my liking but they were still able to hold their shape and the meat was well blended with all the flavors of the dish. I love the cute little portion of spumoni ice cream. It's a great mix of pistachio chocolate and strawberry and is just what you need after a big meal. Maybe one of these days I'll go back just to try their chocolate desserts. the service is great if you are short on time but the food is just average and not that special
the staff is nice and that's it, they use very cheap tires that only last a year

protein pancakes are always a treat but the California Eggs Benedict were just awful today. The biggest disappointment was the hash browns, even though they tasted like shredded cardboard. I'm tired of going to restaurants sometimes and getting such inconsistent results, shame on you, us eggs.

I have been a regular customer of this salon since it opened, it was super clean, relaxing and welcoming after a few months without a manicure or pedicure. I decided to treat myself to a manicure last week. I went there and a lady did a beautiful job on my gel manicure, she paid attention to details and didn't rush through the whole process. the pedicurist had some sort of infection on his thumb, I didn't notice it at first because he was using gloves, but when it was time to massage the feet he took his gloves off revealing that Tracy was doing someone else's nails right in front of me and clearly saw that he had some sort of sore or fungus on his nail, it was completely black and it looked like something was coming out of it, I was shocked that she didn't at least tell him to put his fingers back on. gloves on the massage he gave me it was barely any massage he did the same thing moving over and over while focusing on the worst the worst part is he gave me an ingrown toenail the whole right side of my toenail is swollen and I just hope I don't get an infection it was by far the worst pedicure I have ever received although I had a great gel manicure here my last experience was so horrible that I won't come back

finally a place to watch local sports with sound, I still find it amazing that many sports bars here in town look beyond our local teams and support the foreign hordes from Wisconsin Minnesota my Illinois and not to Dukeslocal, first go back to your frozen tundras and leave us with the suns, cardinals, devils and coyotes, the food here is good and always fresh and the hot drinks are plentiful and the respectable service would like to see a little more variety on the taps but other than that, Dukes is a great place to catch a game

Came here to order take out, it was for cheese pizza, mom not that cheap, they only use cheese type, pizza wasn't great, I wouldn't go that route again but I'm willing to go back and try the veggie pizza. I surprised my brother with suicide wings. good, meaty and not too vinegary, extra star for making the boys happy with the hot wings from hell that night, they probably use hydrogenated oils here btw, but I didn't ask
too expensive for an average course
the seats on the terrace are lovely

I went for lunch today and had a double chocolate blended mocha the staff was really nice and the building is really cool but my coffee was more of a milkshake than any type of blended coffee. I even asked to make sure it was made with coffee, it had no coffee flavor at all and it definitely wasn't double chocolate. the bakery case it was all sandwich breads and taste that looked good but was also overpriced, they apparently won some awards for best cupcake or something and there were no cupcakes in the case I went in

Sometimes you can judge a book by its cover, it looks like a typical diner and indeed that is what it was although the place was busy on Sunday at breakfast time I was seated straight away, the waiters were friendly and everyone used the obligatory MP to address you and the food arrived quickly despite the busy time. The taste and quality of the food was typical for a diner. pennies short of cash very laid back atmosphere most people here were dressed like they were about to do some gardening after breakfast

I used to frequent Buffalo Wild Wings on Lichfield and Bell and never had a bad experience, whether it was fight night on a Saturday night or a lazy Tuesday dinner. I was never worried about the overall experience at this location. This place, on the other hand, could get some clues from it. heat every time the chicken was overcooked under sauce or both, why can't they make their base product correctly every time, I won't elaborate on the other faults of this place as there are too many, the points are the service is very lackadaisical with everything you sit around waiting longer for the service to take your order than it takes to get it to you on several occasions, one of my friends who I went with each time felt compelled to recite lines of tank dogs when it came to drinking refills they were few and far between, ultimately I don't sit at the bar because I like to talk with the company I work at but it was practically impossible, it wasn't just on event nights, the volume of the speakers didn't vary at all times, not even in the middle of the week during lunch. I really want some good wild buffalo wings in my area. game

yeah, this is the place where pseudo sushi lovers are going to feel like their really exotic food experts if it has cream cheese in it, it's not sushi and this place has that, it's pretty much every happy hour at the bar, it's loud in the bar, not fun, but let's run the bad start rock and top ego rock as loud as possible, seemingly as a catch-all for the only demographic that will like this place early and late and who want to seem like they still know how to get along with the younger generation because it's ahwatukee a sleepy bedroom community that's pretty wealthy overall and likes to remember that the crowds can be even more obnoxious than this bar already is, I recommend it as a place to go and be rowdy so you don't eat good sushi

i want to like turf but the food is just ok i've only been here twice but it wasn't mind blowing i don't like the shepherd's pie here it's the blandest version i've had even in this town the wings are pretty good though i ate wings here with a few harps and had a good time surprisingly good is their hi seared tuna it's pretty weird to think an irish pub would do this well but they do it a friend ordered it and after shaking head and said there was no way it could be good, I tried a bite and had to eat crow peat, it's usually a stop on the pub crawl so I'll definitely come back for a drink

beware, only use a credit card so you can stop payment if you need to. Our salesman encouraged us to pay cash and get a discount. Big mistake. Any problem, you are on your own. Really on our own we spent more in this store and it was a nightmare. Delivery took weeks longer and then our seller said our paperwork indicated there was an error with the fabric. return to the store in person but there is no manager, no one except the commission sales staff and a cheerful voicemail

I don't understand, this place is very busy, no manager in sight and hidden away during the busy dinner hour, no name tags on employees. I was chastised for pointing over the sneeze glass at the sauce I wanted because nothing was labeled. I guess I violated the health code. Thanks for not locking me up. I told my family we wouldn't spend another penny here.

well it was off to Brio last night for a date night, the last time we were at Brio was in September celebrating our th anniversary in consecutive years and it was a great night last night, not so much in all the years we have been going to Brio, we have never had such terrible service, the food was as amazing as it always is, but the terrible service completely overshadowed the delicious treats from the kitchen. a good sign of things to come so I opted for water to come while we contemplated our cocktails so the water came then nothing nothing Nevada after about a few minutes the waiter came back for our cocktail order the longest minutes in history I admit I left to get the drinks a few minutes later they arrived with the bread for the table you were sitting alone at the table not paying attention for minutes now that's a lifetime for a restaurant that earns his money by turning tables when the drinks and bread arrived we chose to put in our dinner order thinking we would get married have a long and eventful night so we ordered I ordered the campanella carbonari but with the spicy pepper sauce from the spicy shrimp and eggplant appetizer as opposed to the traditional sauce the waiter said no problem you want the angel hair pasta with the spicy sauce would you mind adding shrimp or chicken the campanella carbonari comes with chicken, spinach, bacon and parmesan so I explained that it's not angel hair pasta because campanella is trumpet shaped pasta with curled edges, he said oh you want the lasagna noodles of course I just said ask the chef to prepare the starter as he usually would but replace the sauces that Glenn ordered with the same thing but with the traditional sauce we both opted for the wedged salad and requested that our starters not be cooked until we finished our salad after all we all know all the ingredients are remade and just needed to be assembled and heated, phew felt, it was exhausting then the salads arrived frozen, delicious now we are back on track boy this salad hits all the notes that take you back to your childhood, nothing is better than iced iceberg lettuce, vinaigrette with blue cheese, bacon bits and freshly grated parmesan, then it happened, yes, just as we thought, in order to speed up the process that started so slowly. By the way, we were asked before if we wanted anything else to drink, you didn't guess it anywhere, we never asked how our dinner was, you guessed it no now, you're probably saying why didn't you do something about it, we would have loved it, but there was no one peanut, even someone to refill our water glasses, only after we finished with our sad cold starters and piled up all the dirty dishes in a pile on the edge of the table. upon his return we presented him with the discount Brio had sent us for being frequent customers, he took it and never came back after sitting there at an empty table, empty glasses of water and nothing to look at but the crumbs left from the wonderful flatbread we placed in cash on the table and left to try to salvage our evening on the way out. Glenn finally located a manager and explained our evening and that it would be a very long time before we tried Brio again. our evening so he could have done something good, maybe if he walked around the floor instead of hanging out with the ever so cute hostess he knew, do we still love brioyesare, we are extremely disappointed with our service last night

This is a really fun place to have cocktails or beers before an event or game. My friends and I have a tradition of drinking here before games and we still love it. The drinks are reasonable, especially if you ask about the specials and much cheaper than the beers at Bob's. As for the food, they have an awesome menu, but the quality of the food was a little cheap for me, so I don't think it's worth ten dollars a plate, but if you're hungry it will do, although one of the days I want to try eating one of those one pound hot dogs. It's a personal goal, I recommend Fox Sports Mark Beers Grape Bombers

being from Phoenix I almost felt embarrassed that I had only eaten pets for the first time seven years ago, I was coming back from England and trying to recreate the orgasmic fish and chips experience I had there, pets were around the corner from my resort and after all I have seen so many of them that I am addicted to pets. I couldn't even eat them, the two racks of fish I had were fine, but I might as well have gone to Safeway and bought a box of gorgonian fish sticks with the special red sauce and you have to pay extra if you want a lame tarter, not enough malt vinegar, I said why there is such collective forgiveness for this place is beyond me, this is a ridiculously bad example of fish and chips

I went there in March late afternoon, my friend ordered before me and I got a burger meal and the power went out just as I was ordering, my friend ordered about a few minutes before me so I got to eat some of her trieste steak which was awesome other than that, not much else to say, I have to try them again sometime, the hazelnut butter shake looked full of calories but delicious, better luck next time.

one thing is for sure you will be full when you leave the hookers, i think the shades are pretty good but the biscuits and gravy leave a bit to be desired, or that's what my meat eating friends say to be fair it was in comparison to my very amazing freshly made biscuits and veggie gravy biscuit recipe.

I have been to Jade Spirit several times and Kim really does a great job and he has helped me a lot but the problem is the receptionist she is the kids wife and she is very forceful about sharing her crazy sexist opinions and boy can she talk and talk and talk it makes the whole experience stressful and not worth going there on the first visit she gave me this booklet asking patients to be quiet and respect the peaceful place it is supposed to be, but when I'm in the middle of my treatment, I can hear it going on and on. and it encourages patients to go ahead and speak as loudly as they want, so it's not as restful as it should be. This is not an appropriate place for her to socialize, especially if she is trying to impose her views on customers who are there to see her husband. Kim is amazing but doesn't bring in enough for me to be willing to deal with his wife.

I like it spicy, I mean I like sweating from the bridge of my nose when I eat when they asked me how hot I wanted my chicken green curry, I did a double take, it's not a spicy green curry by definition, they told me they make it in varying degrees of spiciness for the crowd, while I don't agree with the dilution of the authenticity of the traditional preparation, I get it, they have a business to run, which I really don't like it, this is how they do it, they make a mild green currier with no green sauce, then when ordering they add a certain amount of red chili pepper. flakes depending on how spicy you want it, not only is it philosophically upsetting, but chili flakes need time to cook into a curry, you don't just mix them and serve them. I have a feeling this problem is rampant in Arizona, I hope to find a solution soon

do to have that review you keep putting it off and don't bother writing that the post office for me you get what you get and you get it here it's like a review of a place that no matter what any of us write I'll never change one thing I love to see especially once the snow birds come back a quick line just a baseline for basic transactions I still use the automatic machines as often as I can but it always seems like the times I have to wait in line it's always at the door and it takes forever to stick to mornings and late afternoons skipping weekends

I worked for a non-profit and knew he was there, he was kind enough to take a few pictures with some of our kids who are customers, which was nice of him, but as far as the food goes, it's bland. I've been here on two occasions other than work and although the atmosphere is wonderful, the seats and cabins are spacious and comfortable and there are even more seats that extend towards the back leading to a small rip-off section, the food is just not that great.

perfect for a nightcap, dim lighting and totally intimate, the drinks are quite expensive and I didn't eat any food but the service was excellent, I loved the atmosphere of the place so much I would go back one day

the hidden house has things you would expect in a neighborhood bar lots of pool tables giant circular bar labeled restrooms friendly locals sort of curious or maybe protective cheap cocktails and beer pitcher specials so there are a few different things about this place a usual mix of suits and sweatpants, old and young, talented pool players and a really nice bartender located in the new city center and within walking distance of my hotel the walk out and back was in As fun as sitting in the living room, parts of downtown are beautiful, especially at night when the lights are on and no one is home

one word sums up this place ghetto the other reviews were right on the money I'm not going to lie I got scarred so I suggest buying your tickets in advance to get the best rate I also highly suggest paying more money to get a priority seat and sit up front and watch your seat if you leave it empty you will get caught be warned people stink apparently other passengers don't believe in showers or deodorant a can of lysol might help i gives stars instead of because the bus arrived at the destination on time both times I used the bus and the second driver was very cool and funny

I have been here for many years, but have recently noticed a decline in the quality of service. I felt reprimanded by the bartender today at lunch. I felt disrespected because the customer service is lousy. Stay away. Bad service, bad review.

let the blue hair attack begin you just can't eat here without being checked by the Sun City West retirees Sun City Grand they have to get to the scrambled eggs before you because you can all take the food from them yeah it's basically okay for a buffet the selection is pretty good the food is hot and some is even tasty the tables are crowded to make more room for the elderly and maximize profits and it's your typical buffet decor did I mention the old farts are like professional hockey players when they approach a buffet it's like a room full of food suddenly afraid you won't have what you want to eat it's absurd go for it if you have to but bring a little attitude and shoulder pads watch out for the old bastards wear an obama shirt that should really make them angry with you

I know this place has been around forever and is well established in the valley, but I think it's time to take a drive. Everything about this place, inside and out, screams old school, right down to the uniforms of the serving staff, gummies, everyone noticed that this place was their parents old stomping grounds, that's cool, but how do you make it inviting to the old crowd(s), I had a prime rib that was barely warm and I swear it had the flavor of a dry piece of toast, the blandest prime I've ever had, the fresh horseradish I asked for on the side it was even bland my friend had the buffalo meatloaf half buffalo half ground sirloin now my dear reader was a home run tender and full of flavor the ribs were ok and the baseball net was even at best also we went on a Friday night and were possibly other people in this huge place the website reads as being delicious when in fact the experience was more like waiting in line at the hot new club only to find no one inside the only redemption was the desert pecan pie and their citrus creme brulee both make you rub your belly, bon appetit

I called them and they wanted to charge for fingerprinting what a joke I found a place on the other side of the air park that did it for caveat emptor if if I could give them a zero rating I would have on the other side of the airport next to GreenwayHayden Loop is Global Pi Security for fingerprinting their address is East Greenaway Road Suite Scottsdale has Globalpisecurity Dot Com good luck

my sweet tooth was screaming at me, I have had to stop four times so far and each time I try something different other than the cheese curds which was totally fine, every visit was for the very rich and creamy ice cream, a little goes a long way. I tried a small berry sundae, a pineapple malt and a small black cherry cheesecake sundae, the sundae was by far my favorite. I like the simplicity, the berries weren't too sweet, strangely artificially thickened, the malt was nice. and malty which I really enjoyed and was quite thick even after melting slightly now the cement mixer was the richest of the rich maybe because I decided to go for a cheesecake flavor to which you can add any other fruit or topping flavor, it was very tangy like cream cheese about as tangy as a good Greek yogurt with little bits of graham crumbs swirled around and of course the blackberry flavor

ok, I said bad, worst negative, five star San Diego, they made us wait in line for tickets, made us check our bags, the baggage agent told us the flight was delayed a few minutes and that we would have to wait in the special needs line because we were going to miss our connecting flight. I drove around for about an hour, didn't take off, kept my boyfriend on the plane for another hour, kicked everyone out saying we weren't taking off on this plane, made everyone wait in a long line that didn't move while we saw a ticket agent to book our flight while I held up a delta lollipop sign made with pen and pencil over my sketchbook hours later, after not knowing what to do with us they put us in a hotel downtown so we had to take an afternoon flight the next day to relax and then him and my layover plane in the afternoon. lax in tokyo expected i land in the far east are you kidding me they lost my luggage another lax incident in tokyo mechanical problems stayed on the plane for another hour they had us transported to a hotel in the middle of nowhere luggage lost on the way it fell off a bus the next morning i'm flying to susan in korea seriously you expect me to go to work monday after all that she is sorry delta, I'm so exhausted, sick and tired of you, fuck you guys and your incompetence and crappy customer service too

Foot Locker is home to the largest selection of athletic shoes in the mall, but the price could be better. Their inventory also includes a dozen Foot Locker exclusives, like several Nike Air Max colorways. Foot Locker sweatshirts and other sports gear are generally durable, fit well, and are well priced. The Chandler store also focuses on team sportswear and various sports accessories. Sales are not so good. New Jersey in July for what's going on I can't call it

very nice and helpful staff, one guy always asks me too many questions but I thought he was just trying to be nice, they are trying to sell you a new phone and service but when you shoot them down they turn on you

as Targets go, this one is standard fare whose consistency is part of their brand recognition, but as part of the upscale Desert Ridge mall I expect a little more than a standard Target, don't they have some sort of flagship Target, also traffic and parking can be atrocious in Desert Ridge, I drive to Targets and Walmart much further from home because the drive time there and back is less when I don't have to negotiate the packed lot of Desert Ridge teenagers, probably safer too

We used to go to this Ups store quite often and were happy with their service, but it had been at least a year since we visited this place regularly. However, we had a really unprofessional experience here recently. Went there for rotating services for a house purchase, which one employee refused to do and passed on to another employee because, under his breath, the notary services were a pain. This employee couldn't help us either because he had never seen anything like this and he didn't know he wanted to have anything to do with something that had a power of attorney. I guess we are one of the first people here to sell a house while we were waiting for this man to do something. The employee who gave us our documents tried and failed to scan a document to email and was quite verbal and apologetic about these stupid machines.
very very average actually disappointed in the braille kelsey with her cute smile and tight shorts would probably make me think about going back and trying something different

this place is cute, affordable, clean and tasty. I would recommend this place for a quick lunch as the service is quite quick and has a simple menu or you can bring your date here for a lovely dinner. The place is quite a quiet place and the lighting is very pleasant.

fez both times I went there it was weekend afternoon both times I was able to enjoy a nice lunch with my sister and cousin then again with my sister the two dishes I liked were the fez burger and the chicken casa blanca the berry shortcake was good but the strawberry water kind of killed the whipped cream and the shortcake biscuit was very good overall the environment at that time was peaceful and calm the staff gave me advice on the menus the price a little high for my wallet but I would definitely splurge again with excellent company

First of all, the restaurant is dark and gloomy, I thought the decor was a little off because they were going for a tropical Vietnam theme with banana trees and a cascading fountain. The waiter there had no smile and didn't seem friendly, looked like it was the last place he wanted to be serving, lousy, I mean come on there were only two tables including mines and at that point he didn't check on us or refill our water and we had to walk up to ask for our bill like you were seriously that lazy bun. the shade was skinny on the meat and there were small vegetables on the side that had a rancid smell the noodles in my sister's bun that were long and watery seemed to be super old overall I wouldn't recommend it to anyone

i wanted thai food near chandler tonight but realized few of them are open on sunday here's how searches in the morning turned up great reviews for thai rama on yelp but no opening times hit a look for hours on the restaurants website strike two calls to the restaurant no voicemail greeting after the bell three i'm looking for a facebook page that despite only having fans includes hours opening as well as good feedback from customers. to get the most basic information

very mundane, solid, nothing exciting or surprising, it's the kind of restaurant that isn't your first choice but when all your other options are closed or too far away or too crowded you come to the village tavern and end up not being disappointed. the hostess and our server were polite and efficient overall, a good place to bring mom and dad on a lazy Sunday afternoon

my friends and I got a karaoke room and ordered food while we sang the room is small in other places I've been it would have been a people room with people there we turned into an airless, sweaty mess very quickly. I ate the mess, they weren't cooked because they were hard and had that slightly spicy raw taste, we went on a Friday and it was filled to the gills with Scottsdale bags, at least the servers were very nice even though they messed up the drink orders once and the bill once
the broth was too sweet for me, maybe just personal taste

in the age old debate about length and girth, Sky Harbor is clearly a proponent of length, I swear this airport is three miles long and if you have a connection, good luck getting through the whole airport, from people mover to people mover, it's a long, long, long line of corridors and movers over and over again, but they have a free woman, oh, that only works time I will, they have clean bathrooms and loads of options regarding airport restaurants, but if you take one thing out of this review, although this length is not always the answer

Oh my god the worst Chinese food I have ever had for lunch with my wife I ordered their cashew chicken dish and my wife ordered the pad thai noodles with barely edible shrimp which makes Panda Express look like gourmet Chinese food before sinking the Worst Chinese Food award went to a Chinese restaurant in Nebraska but it's Nebraska I'm Chinese and I live in San Francisco so I know a thing or two about good Chinese food

this seems like a decent place to have a drink if you want before going through security, the service was average, but I also think our server was in training. We didn't venture very far into the restaurant, just sat at one of the pub tables near the entrance to keep an eye on the security line, so I guess it's good for that too.

I took my family here using a group and it was just ok, we tried to go on Monday but arrived and the employee working the counter informed us that the championship game was going to start at so our hour would be cut short. I was a little irritated with her, um yeah sorry but anyway we opted to come back the next day to get our full hour when we arrived we were greeted by some very friendly gentlemen who provided us with our shows and assigned our lane, we were one of the groups in the alley and they placed us next to each other. instead of giving us some space my wife asked for a glass of water which never came so bowling was fun the service was marginal at best the lane assignment was horrible as we only paid people for the hour including shoe rental I will go again for the same deal I would never go there paying full price which is outrageous
the very average food was overdone and the waitress stopped chewing her gum just long enough to take our order

I had it with the meat department at Whole Foods Market on Scottsdale Rd, Mayo Blvd, they really suck, I gave them another chance out of desperation, really and they blew it. I am so disappointed I bought turkey breasts there for a breast, I came home, froze two and cooked one, it smelled but my husband insisted it was the smoky smell from being in the butcher case with all the other meats. I trusted his opinion and cooked it by cutting it for dinner. I found the free range turkey to be very fatty, it was disgusting but no one got sick, luckily now I just defrosted another one and the same thing but worse it stinks like the dead rotting animal, it's really bad and it gets even worse when I inspected it and opened both breasts. the stuff is everything is gray and rotten, they stuff their turkey breasts with junk to make more money, i've had it with them, i'm not surprised they've always been in trouble, frankly, the manager, he's really not the type of guy you could trust with food, he's kind of scary and gives off a dirty attitude, i don't care, i spent there on whole ground turkey and he still charged me the sternums and another employee told me they usually throw them in the trash. it cannot be trusted and it has failed every time it really is the highest price for the highest waste. My husband thinks the manager has an incentive to sell the questionable meat instead of throwing it away. I'm still nauseous from the smell and from touching all that rotten gray stuff with bleach. I think I ate this in the last one.

as a breakfast snob I really don't like Dennis, they really don't do anything particularly well and I have had inconsistent food quality and helpfulness from the staff on different occasions. I can't criticize this place for a rude waitress, but I can for these inconsistencies and the fact that there are so many other places that do what they do better. This experience, I decided to never set foot in another Dennis

I had dinner there last night, had never been to the service, it's a great atmosphere, free valet and hip, you can't park anywhere in the area, I ordered the blood orange bellini and it wasn't your typical bellininot, frozen and sparkling, it was champagne in a flute with a candy cane, still good but not what you would expect just on a Friday. this may have gone bad, I don't recommend it for marigold lovers, but the organic chicken with pan fried gnocchi was fantastic, I asked them to add a little spice lest it be bland spicy, it was perfect and I'm glad as it probably would have been a little too bland for me. lemony bread pudding but not as moist as bread pudding delicious overall great neighborhood place but not too varied to eat there repeatedly if you like to try different things which is my style too many restaurants in Phoenix to come back to only to eat the same item over and over again

when I was a kid we called it the canal in other parts of town, it's still called the canal in some places, people fish there, I think they die right after eating their catch, that's why you don't see them very often over the years. I couldn't understand what they were talking about, what water then I started to break down when I found out it was the canal, come to Scottsdale, you can put a dress and lipstick on a pig but it's still a pig you're not fooling anyone

I came here once for lunch and sat outside only to get eaten alive by flies, nothing worse than eating outside on a nice patio and being harassed all the time. I decided to give it another chance for happy hour and guess what flies followed me inside too. I don't know if it was the early spring time of year or what, but they definitely need an exterminator

I just don't understand why this place is so highly rated, could it be that people have never experienced barbecue outside of Arizona so they have no basis for comparison, but even that can't be true, we have some in Gilbert and even the famous waves are pretty darn good. for what you get you get a large sandwich that isn't very big, an order of fries and sun brands for a few dollars more I could get a combo platter at the famous wave service it's a deal. I don't think I've ever seen a smile there, but it's quick. The place is generally dirty, but I'm usually there around lunch, so it might be better other times, not impressed at all, but it beats the burger king down the street, which is the worst bk in Christendom, but that's another review.

the place is not bad, I had a sweet and sour lunch combo and it was good, their menus are quite extensive and the prices are really fair, its Chinese food and if you are in the area it should get you where you need to go, it's clean, the staff is friendly, I would come back soon for lunch here

like many car washes they do what it takes to scrape, I'm always looking for a place that puts a little extra elbow grease into it, I'm tired of being respected on exterior waxes and and they can't even take the time to vacuum my seats

preface I'm being kind, stars are a decent rating and I don't want my opinions to skew the rating scale, but a star option, if available, would be welcome again. I'm being nice, this place is horrible, maybe I'm exaggerating. the beer honestly is good, not the grand peaks limo is at least of regular fries I also had the Monkey Shine which has the highest alcohol content, something I support and even after that beer the food disappointed, how can that be, it wasn't that the burger was horrible but it just wasn't anything special, it was bland and I had the western which had tons of stuff on it. The biggest problem was the fries which ironically looked like they came from the frozen food section of a local fry shop. that for what it's worth with mediocre food at best and ok beer I see no reason to go beyond the highs, improve your menu and I'll give you another happy shot

nothing special about this place clean and the food is ok i go there because my only son loves it i have to keep the kids happy i have never had a bad experience but nothing has ever been outstanding either my far dish is the spinach artichoke dip

the music was loud as shit the food Jesus Christ the food lame chips and salsa no joke like the chips were on the plate the salsa was probably one of the worst I've had no flavor at all and the hot salads come out hot I guess that's why I threw up disgusting the hot lettuce server let us know they can make my daughter a little quesadilla only that comes out so greasy our taco plates come out a few minutes more late dinky tacos on every plate that are flavorless and lukewarm at best yes they are spicy no that doesn't mean they are tasty I literally use my cell phone to see what was on the plate it's so dark the mint water was hot gross and not refreshing at all my daughters quesadilla was yes for the tortillas smaller than my hand and cheese I get it I make a dollar but damn don't rip off your customers so too lame neither my husband nor myself finished the meal was horrible the health department should go temper this place not sure the refrigeration is working properly such a disappointment I have been a vegetarian for years looking forward to a new place I will never come back

the food is still great, the Tootsy brand is still great, the music is still great but the service, the service could be a lot better. I came here with my daughter, sister and colleagues. I had surgery that restricted me to a certain type of drink. The server said I had to throw away my drink due to the health code. I was okay with that, so I put my bottle in my purse. my protein powder water with lemon water as well as the booth we were in smelled awesome like dish water, I will still come for the tootsy making and shrimp tempura but I will make sure to always sit outside

this place is horrible i take my fourteen year old daughter for services from time to time and on two occasions here they managed to seat me and bypass it for other customers who didn't have an appointment they won't accept tips from your debit and credit card which is quite inconvenient if you don't have cash they use a cheap base coat in an unmarked bottle which leaves my polish job awesome my mom was a loyal customer until she got a toe infection after a visit, I don't like writing bad reviews but this place doesn't deserve your business

the good we absolutely love their wings and it's becoming a regular for us to go every other Tuesday for their wing deal we always get the honey hot wings and share a side of regular fries or loaded fries the bad I think the wings are a little overpriced even on special days also what's going on with their high school hostesses they are incredibly rude and give dirty looks every time we leave which is now times when someone has really need to get these girls under control, my goodness that's the reason for the stars instead of what i would actually give it stars if i could, we love the atmosphere and it always seems clean and the servers have been very nice so far

oh real food, I want to love you but you make me feel like I'm eating in a cafeteria with such a contemporary menu and a staff full of bright faces, this restaurant is just a contradiction in form, the menu and ambiance just don't match. My advice is to sit at the bar, the drinks are served well by bartenders who are pleasant and do their job, the stools are comfortable and from this location you avoid the experience of dining with a room full of strangers right at your elbow.

I work in the area and I come here maybe once a month when I want and need a place close to work the decor is relaxing and the music is nice I find the service fast which is really important during lunch on one hand the prices are a bit high and on the other hand many of my American colleagues won't go to a mom and dad whose house is a place they would be OK with if you are on that side of town have a craving for that then that kalat will definitely cure it, but don't expect to be wowed by the broth's complex flavors.

I shouldn't have judged this place so early they are close to my apartment which they deliver for but I have been back several times since my first review and I am disappointed here a few weeks ago my boyfriend and I wanted to get a little buzzed at home so we decided on the streets of New York to deliver food we went with pasta my boyfriend got the spaghetti with meatballs and I got the meatball ravioli ah I really hate it say that but I would have had a better time eating a chef's box on board, I don't know what's up with their beef sausage but it still has a funny taste, a bit like when you reheat a burger in the microwave, that taste wasn't very impressed, the salad that came with it was ok and I would go back just for the bread, but even with a buzz I wasn't enjoying my pasta, the boyfriend agreed that it was lacking in flavor. flavor and was gone then yesterday we decided to have another one of those nights and do the pizza instead as our pizza was good the first round I got chicken and pepperoni on mine and he got sausage they charge extra for the chicken uh I don't really understand why the chicken is breaded chicken strips that they just cut up and threw on the pizza. I wasn't impressed at all. The sausage on my boyfriend's pizza tasted weird and sweet, like I didn't know what was going on in this place, so I say if you go with one of their pizzas definitely get a coupon and stick to the basics, I suggest the bacon or pepperoni.

I feel bad for this park, it's really nice, the only problem is it's in Phoenix where it's really hot which means the roof is always closed and with the roof closed it almost feels like you're watching baseball inside an auditorium.

I came here wanting and expecting this place to be amazing, I wanted this place to be stars, I feel like a failure for giving it away, I heard such good things about this place and expected it to be good, but unfortunately it wasn't sad. I walked in and placed my order. toppings and sauce on top, I also got the fries, they came in a brown bag, I guess how they serve them, it doesn't matter if you eat there or not, I was disappointed with the burger itself, it seemed like it came with way too much topping, I mean like an overwhelming amount, I ate it and the burger was ok but not as good as I have experienced at other comparable places. I will say you have a ton of fries, but I felt disappointed and I don't know if I will come back in the future

the sugar bowl ice cream is delicious but what the ice cream is isn't let's just say if I ever wanted ice cream I wouldn't think of coming here specifically for their tubs, very average stuff similar to beer dryers, what I liked was the price, their abundant seating area and their location

had a vinvillage event at this location which I did last night after the glowing descriptions on their website, some of the reviews here and knowing they are located in citynorth I was expecting a lot better walking in, didn't get the feel of a high end sports restaurant on the TV blaring over the bar and in the open dining room did nothing for the atmosphere. The bartender finally played me some wine, answered my questions, and started down my drink. They had a good selection of wines and some that you don't normally find on wine lists in every other place in town. A few others came and we moved to the table. No problem. I started eating, we forgot about the wait, the pâté was very rich and served with soft slices of raisin bread, some were immediately addicted to the bacon wrapped dates, everyone ordered a burger of one type or another, some opted for the pre-selected toppings, others customized and added sweet potato fries. We confirmed that everyone was being screened separately. were the fries but then we waited for the checks and the desert waited seems the staff didn't start trying to sort who had what until at least a half hour after everyone had finished eating and the plates had been cleared and none clearly knew how to use the pop system those with money eventually got tired of waiting and just left it on the table those of us with credit cards weren't so auckland several bills had to be redone because they didn't include the right items I had wanted to go back to try the salted caramel milkshake but that will be the case it will be a long time before I come back

we stopped here on a Sunday afternoon for a milkshake as my sister was visiting from out of town, we browsed the racks of vintage clothing and costume jewelry before sitting at the bar, it was difficult to choose our milkshake flavor given the dizzying array of syrups and ice cream combinations, but after opting for chocolate and wild cherries we were very happy and it was a joyous thing topped with colorful sprinkles of whipped cream and of a cherry. or even gave us a menu or a hello until we were seated for about a few minutes, a group of about a few minutes, including a group of indecisive children, sat after us and were served before my sister and I and no acknowledgment of the wait while we waited. I enjoyed looking at all the cool decor from the past, although I think the whole place could be a little cleaner.

I'm a guy because I've worked for about years in three cities across the country, some branches are better than others, some areas are better than others, they're not better or worse than other national chains that have equally good and bad branches. I chose them because they have a great rewards program and because they have a strong presence in places I travel to often. So it's a bad branch. when they see you looking for something in an aisle, lest you bother them with a question, they never greet you with a smile and a hello or did you find everything you need while you are checking out, they have inconsistent policies on whether or not coupons can be scanned from the iPhone or if hard copies are required. Walgreen's and Rite Aid set the world on fire with their customer service, whether it's if you don't travel much, like I choose a nice local independent pharmacist.
