First time here and I want all of this to be impressed, let's just say I was afraid to ask my waitress when she was due, but besides that point, a bunch of TVs, even though I had to squint to see what was happening in my eyes, isn't that great, but anyway, it was a Wednesday, so they had margaritas and maxi beers on the daily special which varies, the margaritas were pretty quick, i felt almost nothing weak as hell, i half expected to stumble out of the place but in reality i was fine, good selection of wing flavors which i could start to see as a bad sign, i tried the wings here dry and dusty but decent taste with no real kick like he says except maybe in the stomach itself and the extra dollar for them should be a dollar less i can't screw up peanuts, peanut shells on the floor, the novelty was probably the best part of the place because you can't get as messy anywhere else as a baseball game which is an extra star in itself, the rest of the menu looked good so I might be back someday with better drink specials and try something new to eat, I'll update this shit if I do

I visited on a Sunday afternoon just to check it out in response to an ad I saw to visit for free for days, usually when you respond to ads like this at a gym the staff ask for your information such as your name, address, phone so they can sell you a membership later, this wasn't the case with me, it was very informal. I advised that I was not a member and wanted to try their place. after doing my walk I understand why the place isn't very big, they have weights and cardin machines and the treadmills each had a personal tv on the machine. The whole facility looked clean and there were free towels to take with you for your workout. to insert your personal padlock, there was also a small room for classes. I wasn't very impressed with this gym, mainly because it was very small. I came on a Sunday afternoon, when most gyms don't see much traffic, so I don't know what it's like during normal busy times, like early morning and after afternoon on weekdays. and equipment, you might consider this place as an alternative to the big gym chains like Hour Fitness La Fitness or Life Fitness, you can always take a look for yourself, apparently they don't provide too much sales pressure to visitors anyway, that's my word on mountainside fitness at Bell Rd in North Scottsdale, next to the ice rink.

I really don't know how to rate the solos because frankly this place killed me, it was only temporary but I was definitely dead hearted for five or six seconds. The solos are serious, it's so good it was literally just painful. I really don't think I'll be able to come back anytime soon.

pizza is just ok, quite crowded at lunch time and seating is a nightmare. Get the lunch special, you get a personal pizza slicer and a pan would make it go away if I didn't live in the West Valley. Good idea to have a separate takeaway door, but don't count on this place to be acceptable for those of us with disabilities to get around.

your old pipe has a large selection of cigars and a very large humidor almost too big, I say this because while walking around I came across a few boxes of cigars that were way too dry, that said I still found several fresh and moist cigars, what I liked best about you was the variety, they had several cigars at all price points so if you can't afford to smoke an opus x they had a lot of cigars for less than if you are not an avid smoker. I don't know if you'll get any help as the staff don't seem very friendly or welcoming, but if you know what you want, chances are they'll have it.

Having grown up in Tempe I have been to Rooster a few times overall the experience is good but nothing to write about one of my recent visits was New Years Eve. I made a reservation in advance and the process was perfect they said upon check in if there was a wait for tables we would be placed at the top of the list when we arrived. The reception staff said it was going to be a minute wait. on the outside patio to check out the view within minutes our buzzer went off and we were seated our server was fantastic and friendly the food was delicious with large portions and surprisingly not as expensive as I thought my next visit was about a week ago on a Saturday night we forgot to make a reservation so when we arrived we found out it was going to be an hour wait we waited maybe a few minutes before seating our server but it wasn't as wonderful as our visit before he took a few minutes to get water and she kept blaming the bus the boys for everything the food this time was ok my dads prime rib came out cold like it came straight from the fridge all the side dishes were cold or overcooked it was a less than stellar experience this time if I hadn't been here before I definitely wouldn't go back if you want to try I say go for it but don't expect the best meal you've ever had, the view and the atmosphere are what makes the restaurant

the food is pretty good that's why it's such a shame the service sucks every time I've been there, they take forever to get you water, take your order, bring food, even when you're the only ones in the whole place they're still unfriendly, the order was wrong a few times, I really wish they had better service, I won't go there again because of this

it was just ok for me the pizza was huge which was great for the price i would eat there again but it wouldn't make my favorites there is nothing that stands out to me like a wow factor the wings were good

I've been to this place a few times and needed a place to have lunch so I stopped, walked into the restaurant and sat down right away, but then I sat there for a good few minutes and watched the workers walk around and then I could see the owner's little daughter decide she was going to sit with the consumers in the booth in front of me and then the kid started crying and that just didn't need to happen. I was a little shocked, leave your kids at home if they don't work at the restaurant. just have the lunch buffet I had a bit of everything to try I enjoyed the rice and the chicken dishes the fish dishes however not so good the fish puffs were cold and not good and the fish dish super fishy tasting the bread was really good which accompanied the meal so overall I would say I won't go back anytime soon nothing out of the ordinary

ok so the look of the portions in the pictures is very deceiving the waffle and the pancakes are not big like they look but I'm stuffed so I guess the waffle was quite big the food was very good I thought it would be better but I'm not disappointed I would come back here happily the waffle wasn't as good as the farm and the pancakes weren't as good as the first watch but that's just my opinion next time I want to try some of their interference

Since not many places were open on New Year's Day, I decided to cruise around and see what was open since the bookstore still wanted to be pretty open and I had a horrible line. I drove around a bit to see if I could grab a cup of coffee to kill some time. I stopped in the parking lot as there were several stores located in this mall and I shopped at a few stores here before finding this cafe squashed between other stores. It's a very small store with extremely limited seating, I will say I liked it here and really enjoyed my experience. reasons why their prices are cheap as all go out which is great i had an ounce of mocha for awesome service here was amazing and friendly and i will happily go back in the future so why stars there were huge tables to sit inside and that kind of problem i also asked the girl about the internet and she said the signal was in and out and should be fixed a few days after the holiday for me a cafe is a place i like to park at for an hour plug in my computer surf the net and drink coffee I don't like sitting outside because I don't have an outlet and my battery dies after an hour and in the summer I don't sit in the heat so although I would come back for the prices and service I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone planning to stay more than a few minutes
decent food at a good price, special lunches in a good atmosphere

when we lived in a my biggest regret was not coming here i always wanted to try it while doing our road trip this week i was able to park was easy on a weekday i went in through the wrong door oops the server that stocked things seemed surprised but rolled with it she said we could sit wherever we wanted we were a group of three we chose a table so we could spread out a bit and not be so squashed it immediately broke not that it was for people I almost said so don't tell us we can sit anywhere we want I refrained that surly girl almost ruined it but luckily our waiter saved the day I saw the hot doggo know the crazy monster on the menu I shared it with my friend we didn't even finish it it was delicious although a little salty I knew it was salt overload because within an hour my fingers were swollen sad oh salt why do i still love you be so affected by you we didn't finish it but i really enjoyed it if i get this when in town i will understand it clearly and i will always share it with a friend

i enjoyed the dinner on the terrace i had the pad cha seafood dish rated thai hot the hottest dish on the menu the person i was with ordered the ginger fish mediocre at best although it looked great with a variety of vegetables and pineapple i felt the dishes looked better than they actually tasted the seafood mussels squid the salmon shrimp in my dish was very fresh but it was not at all hot thai their patio ambiance was nice and the thai iced tea was very tasty although a little too sweet towards the end overall I will probably try this restaurant again in the future but I wasn't very impressed with the taste of the food.

I've always enjoyed the quesadilla at Chilis, try their happy hour where they offer bottled and draft beers. The chicken tenders are ok, but they are breaded and I don't care for the breaded chicken tenders, but rather the grilled tenders which they don't offer. The salsa here is not very good. I have tried store bought salsa which tastes much better. The best thing Chili's has to offer is happy hour.

the hotel is a step back in time, friendly people and nice, simple resort love the free shuttle around the area. The restaurant is however not bad but the service can certainly be improved, especially at breakfast time.

just kinda there, nothing special about this convention center and downtown Phoenix is ​​pretty boring and sparse except for the baseball stadium right next door with some nice bars and restaurants when there's no game on, that area seems pretty dead, ho hum the nearby baseball stadium is a great entertainment option but can be a pain with all the traffic if you're trying to get out of the convention center in the evening

I had one of the worst vegetarian experiences of my life here. I had been to Johnny Rockets before and had the vegan option, so I knew I would do well here. I was out with my meat eater sister and my pescatarian husband so I thought this place would be best for the three of us to get what we want and I ordered a burger which wasn't the Streamliner's first mistake and I just ordered it with the bona burger, the waitress takes our order, my husband also ordered his with a bona about a few minutes later. the food comes out, the galette looks okay, I was a little apprehensive and should have followed my instinct in not eating here that day, but I ignored it, it had been a while since I had a bona galette for over a year, so I thought it looked good and I was wrong. substitution, I immediately start to panic, we call the waitress and explain that we ordered bona, why does it say turkey, she then tells us it's bona, she just says turkey, I say no, that doesn't sound right, so she goes to talk to her manager, I guess because we never saw her again, the manager comes to our table and apologizes profusely for what happened. I thought that too but the truth is it slipped my mind even though it shouldn't have and it hurts me every time I think about it I will never go back to that Johnny Rockets again if ever one of them because of that experience all I can say is if you are vegan or vegetarian and you go to one of the Johnny Rockets make sure your waitress knows that a bona burger is not meat, point this out to them because obviously they aren't trained to know what the difference is.

I went to dinner today with three friends around noon on Sunday evening, although it seemed quite busy. I was happy to be seated within two minutes of arriving. The outdoor seating despite a hot Arizona summer was quite nice with some shade, but that's where the jokes end. Our table remains neglected for about twenty minutes. the pita sandwiches, hummus and garlic dip arrived relatively quickly twenty minutes later, both were fine, but something is seriously wrong if we all only got one pita with both dips and each dip was more than twice the size of the pita. We asked our server for an extra pita and he kindly agreed that during the entire dinner it never came, refills were also a pain because we were asking someone to pick up our server and he wouldn't come until ten minutes later. sandwiches, I've been to many other businesses that did this kind of order and more in just ten minutes during a busy lunch hour, half the tables outside were already gone, including the tables that arrived after us and we were the last to be served, the food was average quality and I have been better with slightly expensive cheaper prices, I can see it as justified, but many agree that time is worth much more than money. I lost an excessive amount of over an hour and a half in a decelerating Sunday evening. New customers like me aren't immediately put off. I can say with certainty that I will never come back here again and will end up in better places much closer to home.

honey I have cut down on lunch specials and the restaurant too is more about a name for Thai basil now don't get me wrong I like Thai basil the food is ok and the interior is nice but the diners' tables seem to be squashed elbow to elbow spartan but slightly upscale new york style this restaurant always seems to have a wait the yellow curry here is my favorite with a delicious balance of carrot chicken with coconut spices and with potatoes i never seem to get enough and i really mean the portions here are small and although lunch portions are expected elsewhere at change for example they are bigger and cheaper elsewhere the chicken thai be comes with a chicken but with thai basil they give you three solitary strips like cheapo the massaman curry and pad thai are pretty good too but i think they are ok i have had better service it's hit or miss here one thing that is consistent, they always seem to be understaffed one time when I was dining alone at a one person table they had the nerve to ask me to move when I am eating at one person table for me, the Thai basil is style over substance, not impressed afterwards
it's ok the mexican food isn't bad but it's overpriced for what it is I don't understand why this place is packed every night of the week the food doesn't justify the crowds I'm baffled

I'm not sure what it is because this place wasn't great. I had the grilled cheese and it was hard and dry. There was this nasty drunk guy sitting across from our table and it was pretty sickening, I won't go back.

an ode to walmart it's walmart an elderly person handing out carts at the door my cart doesn't roll straight i'm not surprised there are no baskets just carts that's a clue it's walmart more babies than a daycare more seniors than a senior center and tattoos for everyone it's cardboard walmart kingdoms of snacks a tower of cheese balls bigger than your head for each one a wall of labeled ramen cuposoup and a kid putting cheese balls bigger than your head in his family cart this is Walmart fifty hundred plastic margarita glasses a case of dads bigger than my bathtub the pa announces the code of all chargers code of all chargers this is Walmart a pharmacy Vision Center Credit Union grocery store hairdresser automotive section toy store toy store bike store home depot and office depot all under one roof I think I got lost twice this is Walmart's profits measured one cent at a time is walmart a savior for the poor or is walmart allowing the poverty economist to not decide walmart helps the environment by working with suppliers to reduce and remove packaging and engaging in some eco-friendly projects. Environmentalists decided it was a Walmart self checkout with a weight sensor to keep you honest, they never checked my receipt at the exit, is it because I'm white, is it Walmart customers leaving their carts at the bus stop, where did that hour of my life go.

I have been here several times before, the food is ok and the service is mediocre at best, sitting at the bar eating and drinking is not fast quality service, it amounts to inattentive bartenders watching sports rather than clearing plates or pouring drinks. An empty pint should have another in its place and napkins on plates are clear indicators that one is finished fifteen minutes before the plates are cleared. The service needs to improve.

I had lunch at the burger studio yesterday, I always get nervous when there aren't too many people in the restaurant at lunch or dinner, usually a sign of some sort I ordered the studio burger and I thought the onion rings tasted like I drank a liter of oil, which seemed like a long time to receive my food. I was unhappy to see fries instead of onion rings. nice shine, it was delicious and the fries were good too, the owner stopped by, we greeted him, at that point I told him about the friesonion rounds and he immediately gave me an order, they came out and looked very greasy, distinctive beer batter flavor, not the Woodstock one with the fries which are great overall, great tasting burger and fries and compared to the other grind smash burger guys I put it up there and much cheaper

i won't come back here the most cheap mexican fast food places look the same of course there are slight differences in this case it wasn't for the best we had to drive up to the window to order the speaker didn't work what was going on there the chili just didn't sit as well as others I've had maybe it was the spices they used that were different I'm not sure I also ordered a large horchata, I've definitely had better, it wasn't the worst I've ever had, but it needed more cinnamon flavor, it's safe, it's cheap, it's easy, it's quick, it's literally right down the street from me, I still prefer to go to my favorite bunks, but see

This theater is very conveniently located in the Arrowhead Mall, which of course makes parking easy. It's not my favorite in town as there always seems to be tons of teenagers here, I'm sure because it's in the mall and yes I know if they're too loud we're too old anyway, the theaters are busy and the concessions seem very high but I guess it's a trade off for convenience

I'm always looking for quality food at a reasonable price for lunch, there are tons of expensive lunch places and lots of junk food fast food places too when I read the reviews on Chestnut Lane I jumped at the concept, but the execution leaves a lot to be desired. lots of foot traffic trying to get in and out the woman at the register took each order, processed the payment and then proceeded to prepare the drinks and sides for each order. Drinks are somewhat specialty items and require a lot of work, especially considering the order line is at a complete standstill, slow after too long a wait. sometimes a long wait is mitigated by the quality of the food at Chestnut Lane, unfortunately this is not the case, I mean it was a decent turkey sandwich, but when I saw the almost price for a turkey sandwich and iced tea I was expecting something fabulous, it wasn't quite that. If you decide to go to Chestnut Lane, perhaps you could park in the spacious Jacinta parking lot just to the east and grab some breakfast to tide you over during your long wait.
desserts are a bit bland and expensive considering the small size I've had better Japanese baked goods elsewhere

If you want to feel really bad about what you eat, you'll love the rally. Tried this place for lunch after hearing about the baconzilla. I love bacon, so this burger sounded like a match made in heaven to me. The burger itself was ok although I didn't like it. It was two cheese patties and about rashers of bacon. meal there, it's amazing that I lived long enough to write this review, it's a quaint little place where you can either walk and eat outside or drive back and forth, the food is ready pretty quickly besides the burgers, they have chicken strips and a double decker fish sandwich so it's not all about the red meat, it's not high quality and it's the furthest thing from good for you, but if you're into the area and want a greasy burger rally, this is a good place to try

I went to this place after seeing a segment on the Food Network of Diners and Dives. I thought the fusion of Chinese and Mexican food would be good. I was a little disappointed. The food was ok but nothing too special. The establishment itself was clean and the service was prompt, so kudos to them for that.

this outlet in the box location has the worst service food I have found in the Phoenix metro area every time I pass by there my order has been wrong or inedible how hard is it to make a taco without frying it into oblivion the wait times are consistently more than a few minutes I think I will spend those minutes driving to another location just to get the right order of food that is prepared correctly

Check in was smooth and speedy and the price was decent for what it was a big upgrade from a budget property and very close to the airport it feels like a different type of hotel in that everything was outside but the room was spacious and generally quiet the breakfast was solid and the only real downside was the delay of the shuttles some hotels arrived twice in the time it took for this one to show up once but except for that more than adequate experience for one night.

calling all vegans gluten free vegetarians and those who like to eat healthy is probably your garden of Eden hidden in the optima nourishes is a paradise for natural food fans the environment is fresh and clean and the food too when walking inside I noticed how calm and refreshing the restaurant was everyone had the same calm attitude and I could tell that this is a restaurant you visit to relax and still feel healthy when you leave the menu is detailed but not overwhelming the Only overwhelming part was trying to decipher what each icon indicated and soon I learned that most of the food is vegetarian vegan gluten free or another eating lifestyle other than carnivorous, but for those who don't follow an alternative eating lifestyle it is still incredibly tasty and makes me rethink my culinary decisions. Feed serves breakfast all day as well as lunch. are fresh, just like their products, if they push the cinnamon roll at you, it's because it's like a protégé of the cinnamon gods and worth every calorie consumed. Plus, it flows with icing. It has a great patio for dining as well as spacious indoor seating, but the patio is covered enough that even on a hot day it's comfortable to sit outside. In summary, feeding is a good choice if you are looking for a healthy meal that will fill you up. before visiting Nourrir, I was surprised to find out that they open on Saturday but on Sunday
beware of the latte otherwise it's a typical k circle when you think about it the latte is probably also typical of the k circle

super fast sub tasting service, I've definitely had better so the signs hanging everywhere claiming they are gourmet is definitely a bit of marketing yes it's gourmet compared actually I think Subway makes a better sub so I can't really compare it to being more gourmet than anything else, maybe it's gourmet because they put a ton of sprouts and lettuce in the sub, I'll give the place props for the very service quick I ordered my sub and it was delivered to me within a minute another thing I noticed about the place was that it was full of male customers if you are a single woman looking for a manly man come to Jimmy Johns

nice facilities nice air conditioning but two fatal flaws the kids are running around screaming and yelling at all times this is a failure of the parents and more importantly the staff who apparently refuse to enforce any sort of noise policy on the parents and staff this is a library not a daycare the collection here is books from dads and dummies with some trashy novels thrown in for good measure
a good place for shoppers and fries

I was here for a Wine Wednesday event a few years ago, the bar was packed, waiting for a table to open, very uncomfortable as the area is quite small. I remember trying New England clam chowder, but it had too many potatoes and not enough clams.
this place is old but the food is good, the compliments aren't that great, like the basil and bean sprouts they give out, their soy milk is made fresh and doesn't come from a yes.

old town scottsdale has a personality disorder, it tries to be one thing during the day and another at night, merchants are gouged for hellish fees to provide free parking, so the prices reflect this big scam, because some must make six figures a year, no joke during the day. moving around until they've spent all their money, the perimeter of old town is alive with baseball, hospitals, banks and other real world establishments at night, the clubs open and everyone thinks it's the viper hall or the sorry abbey, it's not the high cover for lame drinks and the dead ambiance won't cut it, they make up for being boring with loud music, the rooftop bar concept seems to die after the locals who can't sleep because of the noise take a few shots in the places every once in a while, can't blame them by a mile. the noise from these places is always loud, it must be horrible to be in one of these rooftop bars, but to be honest Arizona isn't known for its nightlife, it's a place where the sidewalks are rolled up at dusk and they try to cash in on big events like the occasional super bowl. ripping off the same crowd next tourist season, many are now corporate owned and local restaurants have had no choice but to follow the downward spiral in search of local bars and by that I don't mean clubs, bars like the Blue Moose are locally owned and serve good food at decent prices. good drinks and offer friendly service. Visa A Line of Credit is the Perfect Place to Be Happy

I was in Mesa for a workshop this weekend and it was a convenient place to eat. I wasn't too impressed. The food was okay and there was nothing wrong with that, but I expected more from Mexican food in a

treated with complete disrespect, worst service I have ever experienced after waiting to see the manager, I was directed to an employee who slandered me very loudly in front of everyone in the store, then the manager intervened, spoke robotically without listening, then was in an incredibly harsh tone and told me to leave, he said leave, get out now, don't go to this store, don't use Verizon

I don't know why I waited so long to try this place when it's literally right around the corner from me, I think it's because I went to the one in Ahwatukee a long time ago and didn't care for the food but I don't think they have the same owners because the websites are totally different but anyway from the review we ordered take out and I was very impressed with how nicely everything was packaged and how quickly it was ready also the woman on the phone was very friendly, easy to understand despite having an accent and patient in explaining menu items that I didn't know, all the appetizers looked so good that we decided to get a bunch so my husband and I could choose from them since he was sick and didn't have much of an appetite, but the portions were bigger than expected so we ended up with quite a bit of food. they really don't have much flavor and they were fried with i believe pinko breading on them a bit bland but the sweetest dipping sauce they came with was fantastic, i loved it so much i would order it again just for the sauce, i also had chicken soup for the sick husband which i didn't try but he said it was pretty good, i added pad thai noodles as that staple dish is always my test when rating a new Thai restaurant, I asked for a four out of five on the hotness scale and it was perfect for me, I was very happy with the heat level and overall flavor of the dish, so many places hold back on the chilies if you're American even if I insist, I want it hot and I never understood why the only thing missing was a squeeze of lime and a garnish of fresh cilantro which I love on my pad thai, you probably could get it on request if you were dining in, it wasn't a big deal for me since I had some at home, I always prefer alphas as the best Thai in the area but I will definitely come back here for takeout due to the fast, friendly service and convenient location. I noticed some bottles of wine in the back when I was picking up my food, which might also entice me to dine at some point.

I had high hopes for this place and it's a shame because I love supporting restaurants in the Phoenix area, especially a Caribbean restaurant, and I had been to the rum bar next door and loved the drinks, but the food was bad, not only was it bad, but you had to avoid the daily market catches. It was not fresh at all, very expensive for almost a simple white fish. juices and when I let the waiter-bartender know he just ignored it and then ignored us until we left, I will never go back for the food, the rum flights are worth the trip but that's it.

I love the location and the historic house planned, I'm delighted that the tortillas are fully warmed like a good tortilla, I should be craving the creamy beans even more than the carne asama digging up the outdoor picnic tables, hesitant to order the corn because sometimes it has too much sauce and cheese that overpowers the pure joy of the grilled corn, not so crazy about my last experience where the cashiers showed more personality when talking to each other or the kitchen team They did this with me taking my order and paying for a burrito. Would it hurt to smile and maybe buy me a beer at happy hour when I come to pick up my takeout dinner?

Mediocre, bland, low quality food, complemented by terribly slow service. I worked in the neighborhood and kept coming back from time to time just in case it got better for reasons I could never understand once the plate of terrible food was placed on the table. The salsa and rice are usually good but that's all I have to offer.

if you're done you're too old to be here first, this place has beer, don't order mixed drinks, don't order wine, both are disgusting, unless your only goal is to get trashed, which is the mission of all the minors and young kids in this bar.
good sandwich better than all the chains doesn't beat Jason Deli would like black tea not green fresh tasting and clean

for the quality of the frozen yogurt I give this place one, honestly it's small, there's very little variety in terms of toppings and the yogurt tastes cheap, probably because it's a big franchise, there's a reason you pay less for an ounce, really you get what you pay for, the concept is for sure, but if you're looking for some spice you should try the yogurts, it's just up the road from Yogourtland anyway, the single star says it all, I don't think so

this review is based on the delivery service and the quality of the food as delivered the second and last time I will order from this location the first time they forgot a few items and were very late for the delivery time tonight. I ordered at 1 p.m. estimated delivery at 5 p.m. from a huge mile to add in and out call them at 12 a.m. now I'm told they're on their way miles away remember to call back at 12 a.m. to cancel my order because I don't want to eat at 12 a.m. they actually come and deliver to me while I wait at 12 a.m. my hot sub is freezing there's nothing like the taste of bacon and fatty chicken and cold near morning on a Monday now Tuesday evening you are going to take almost hours to deliver it at least make sure the temperature is somewhat close to where it is supposed to never again be a money mine never again this place probably has good taste potential unfortunately like most hot food the taste quality drops drastically the longer it sits in an aisle of the fridge or wherever they decided to leave it for close to hours if you feel the need to get food from there for the love of the underkings, please don't get delivered

what I've noticed about cpl over the years, if you want adequate service, show up when it's not busy, because when it's busy, plan on paying full price for drinks and meals that are completely and utterly lackluster. cpl, do me a good job if you're short on toppings for your sangria, let me know I'm looking forward to that dipped pineapple and cherry, thank you so much and please don't think it's bold of me to ask for a dollar off for your mistake. I like it or even just moderately I like it

I would have been stars if I had been more forgiving, I could think it was the end of the day, a large crowd of wayward kids had just passed by or a hurricane had blown through the back of the restaurant, but then I tasted it, looks like yogurt is pretty popular in these parts and I'm sorry to say, otherwise it was like a bomb had dropped. too busy chatting about who knows what to do their job when we walked in there were a few customers tasting flavors among the ruins with no employees in sight we grabbed sample cups from the register and dodged napkins and puddles and other customers to try different flavors. and no one tried to clean it the stuff was really overpowering instead of tasting like what it was supposed to taste like it bordered on medicine or like a poor imitation of what it was supposed to be like cheesecake doesn't taste like that good cheesecake anyway and neither did cake batter or banana where did the yogurt part go and how to mess up cookies and cream exactly the two that were the best and most edible were the irish mint and the red velvet and that's what we mostly ended up with the decor adds nothing to our experience, it's all mint green but it doesn't look retro or even minty, but rather dated and hospitable, some people really like it, but I found it unappetizing. A surly teenager magically appeared as we approached the register only to disappear again shortly after paying. by giving up on this whole thing, I could very well have gotten into yogurt at the worst possible time, on the worst possible day, with all the unfavorable factors, but I won't come back to find out if that was the case

It's not the best burger I've ever had, but it's a fun place to try with coworkers on a Friday afternoon. I had the quadruple bypass and a few portions from the allyoucaneat fry station better than bkmcds but no complaints about the waitresses who were hot and they happily took me to my car in a wheelchair but that's more of an attraction than anything else.
the staff at this location were rude and unfriendly and the store itself was not the cleanest I have seen

Honestly not that exciting, I heard a lot of hype about it from my friends but I wasn't impressed, it was just your regular Mexican food and I didn't like that you ordered at the counter and got your chips in a paper gravy boat. The whole concept of the restaurant would be so much easier if it was set up like a regular Mexican restaurant, but apparently it makes wonderful hangover food, I don't know.

I've only flown in and out of the Phoenix airport via the southwest, so I've only been to one section of that airport, but it's not that great. The food choices are slim and none are fabulous. I mean really, what airport had fabulous food, wait for the dew, anyway, the Sky Harbor has a great view and decently clean restrooms.

I ate at Scramble last Friday and I have to say it was a horrible experience. What attracted me to this place was the separate vegan menu in addition to their regular menu, this makes things easier when dining with vegan and non-legal friends, so I happily ordered a tofu wrap and added some fried potatoes as a side and waited for my food. We started eating and my friend found a hair in his footnote, threw it on the floor and tried to properly drop it moments later. in both our plates I was so disgusted I couldn't eat my food and I was starving. I told the girl working the register about the whole ordeal, she went back to the kitchen then came back to the register and completely ignored me, she said she would come back to my table before leaving. the burritos were pretty bland, needed some seasoning or hot sauce overall, I wouldn't go backless, I'm somehow developing a taste for hair, although I'm sure that won't happen, I took a picture of my food before I tried to eat it and if you zoom in enough you can see some of the hair sticking out of my food, I'll post it
My God, this place has deteriorated, my eyes

horrible horrible it was just a horrible experience I made an appointment for mani and jedi and arrived Friday morning at morning there was only one lady working there no age with her name she said she could take me sooner than I said that was good she asked me to pay cash right away only cash she said and asked me to go get cash. manicure and it took her less than a minute, everything was done in a minute, she didn't even remove the nail cuticle, she just polished the nails with an old file, her work was so careless in everything nail polish all around the nails and my fingertips, I suggested her to correct it and remove extra polish and she only did it on a few nails repeating all the time pretty yes, it was so far from pretty, I'm a polite person by nature and i never argue but here it was just horrible and i paid her first with tips so she took money from me her jedi wasn't getting better at all she was always in a hurry she didn't let my nails dry and started putting my shoes on i warned her that it shouldn't be done yet but she didn't listen she wanted to get rid of me as soon as possible so all the nails became a mess she reapplied the polish but the whole procedure was so frustrating I left the place more than just upset I was really angry the next day the nail polish started chipping off all the other fingers oh I wanted to cry this is the worst mani and jedi I have ever had in my entire life and I do it every month. I wish I had a receipt and could come back and talk to the manager but this lady just took my money and left me with a lousy job, really lousy.

yuck, that pretty much describes this place we went there Sunday afternoon for lunch, only person in line in front of us, I ordered the meat combo, rib tips and hot sides of mac and cheese and potato salad, it took me some thinking to get my food but I figured if it was good it was worth the wait, but by god it wasn't good at all, the mac and cheese had no flavor so none, the potato salad was very flavorless and the rib tips would have been good if they weren't covered in gallons of nasty sauce. the sauce on top of that their sauce is like a sweet and sour saucer not good at all the hot links were mixed with the rib tips and covered in the same sauce so I couldn't tell if they were good because there was so much of that damn sauce the funny thing was the couple who ordered right after me got their food and brought it straight back to the counter and said right away the food was just disgusting I wish I had made the same thing instead of spending on bad things, in short I won't come back here

worst Thai food I have ever eaten, this place was recommended to us by another couple and wow, I was disappointed, everything was completely blah and tasteless, the only exception being the extreme spiciness of my fiancés starter, probably to make up for the lack of other spices, don't bother with this place

I usually get the Arizona smashchicken or the Arizona cobb salad, both are always delicious, sometimes they are very spicy and other times not so much, I guess it depends on who makes it and how many jalapeños are in it. The chicken is really tasty unlike many other chicken sandwiches. Salads where the chicken is bland and adds nothing to the meal. i really like this place but it's a bit pricey for what you get, lunch for two will probably cost you at least it's not too bad but you'll go a lot further in other places

ugh I don't like to give a harsh review but this is a store that needs to fix a few issues, the service, the long lines and rude cashiers, the outdated store, this wouldn't be so obvious if they just did some cleaning and merchandising of the products, maybe in this store they just shouldn't offer to produce, the small corner of the store makes you think it was an afterthought, I think a few things that wouldn't cost much of money would go a long way to making this store a place I'm not here right now.

I ate here last year and this is the second year I can finally compare the steaks to another place I love the decor because they are sports of all kinds there is always something new that you haven't seen before it is the perfect place to eat and study your surroundings I had the parmesan crusted steak I had the tomato bisque and green onions it is good I had the steak and I had felt like something was missing I don't know what as I don't eat a lot of steak the soup was great it was a cup and perfect the onion strings were good the steak was ok I will always go back but not for the steak I also wish their menu was wider with more dishes to choose from

I heard this place was the best burger restaurant so I had to check it out for myself, my boyfriend and I went there on a Saturday afternoon and to my surprise most of the seats were occupied. People were coming and going, so my first thought was that they must be good because they were so busy. The servers were really nice and fast. an order of their smashed fries initially thought the presentation of the burgers and fries looked great after putting mustard and ketchup on it and tried to pick up the burger everything almost looked like it was messy and greasy it totally ruined the experience of enjoying the burger it tasted just like any other burger nothing really special their fries were however amazing on a scale of I would give this place just for the presentation of the food, my boyfriend said he wouldn't go back but I'll try again sometime

I wish I could like this place, it's just hard, I've eaten here many times and just haven't really liked anything about it. My sandwiches have always been dry and my bland-tasting salads have been okay, but I usually feel like I can make them better.

yes I have had better, the chair slats are pretty good but not worth a large which was a large cup size at Starbucks, the prices are exactly the same as Starbucks if not more and they have a credit card surcharge for less than spent. I still don't agree with this, wherever I go too, I liked the local artwork on display, but I wasn't impressed if the prices were lower then I could see coming here more often.
the atmosphere is like I was in a Mexican, Chinese and Jamaican restaurant, the food could be better

maybe it's just me but this store is not up to par in my opinion i always stop here to get rental orders on the way home from work and i almost always have to wait at the counter for or more minutes while the employees are constantly yelling that someone will be with you in every direction the sandwich counter is good even if it says sandwich in minutes or it's free and it always takes longer i never say anything because i don't care i just don't see the point of the sign their meat section is a joke lack of real selection the products are almost always below my quality standards and also lack of selection last but most importantly they still only have one register open and no self checkout overall it's a very inconvenient experience and I wouldn't recommend going there for anything

ah man, I really wanted this to be good, but honestly you end up with something that looks more like a flame burn than the earthy wood-fired images you choose from their corporate-consistent signage menu and decor. too rich, the taste is like it should come from a squeeze tube anyway, it's pretty shitty, better than Pizza Hut, but despite all the fuss and flash you expect a lot more

I decided to give this place another chance this time. I was sober so I have real memories after having a drink. My friend and I decided to head out to the patio. A group of guys graciously let us share their table as the place was packed shortly after. One of the guys pours his drink into the candle holder and storms off. The next table starts fighting over beer, I'm not kidding, I then started feeling really old and overdressed, an employee comes to clean the empty bottles off my table and notices the candle holder full of liquid, I told him about the paid guy, he made a little joke about the guy who was upset about my rejection. Final analysis, the boss has cool employees and not so cool customers.

Been there twice at lunchtime, nice trendy place, sushi rolls are ok, not spectacular, loved sitting on the patio, but there was a distinct smell of sewage wafting in from time to time, didn't know where it was coming from. too expensive for a lunch menu I thought and the squid appetizer was a huge disappointment it was like Friday or something very sportybaresque huge rectangular pieces of squid heavily battered and fried what happened to the light tempura and squid rings isn't this a Japanese restaurant overall it was good I was in good company both times and had plenty of time to spare so the service slow Wasn't a problem but could be a problem if you have other plans, I will probably go back until I am able to find a comparable or better sushi restaurant. I'm new to Arizona.

I used to live in this neighborhood and it was a favorite The place is clean and modern I love the look of the bar The servers are very good and friendly I used to go with a group of friends for tacos on Tuesdays almost every week They have now taken it off the menu but they will still do it for you if you ask what's cool Two chicken tacos and a margarita or a beer so why only the three stars the last two times I've been there the food hasn't been good at all with the tuna sandwich hi which has always been my favorite, it is served rare with that wasabi mayonnaise and so good, but the penultimate trip there ordered it and the tuna was not good quality, it was stringy and didn't smell good, I took two bites and that was it because I had so many good experiences, I tried it again, I convinced myself it was a bad piece of tuna and I ordered it again, big mistake, stringy and inedible, I probably won't go back and if I do I've learned my lesson about tuna.

I still want to love this place, I want to support a local business and yet last year I took my two boys there after a theater performance, the greasepaint was excellent and after placing our lunch orders I brought out our deck of cards. It is a card game that does not use a traditional deck, very fun in just a few moments. no, you'll have to put it away now, I would understand that we wouldn't want to sit and play cards if we finished eating and just held a table assuming it was busy, but it was during the gap between ordering and eating, I know I should just leave so instead I made my kids happy and we stayed for lunch and ice cream a few months ago. like the guy from the restaurant, it's impossible to come here and renovate it. I don't mind the nostalgia stuff, but the place needs a solid overhaul.

I think the lounge is fine, like another reviewer said, it's nothing particularly exciting or mind-blowing, but it's a good neighborhood restaurant that has solid food. I like some of their bruschetta options more than the posts. I agree that the music is too loud, the atmosphere is more ambient and I wish the music matched that. I always forget my server's name but he is very nice and helpful, no complaints.
I never got a chance to try the food because I was so turned off by the way I was treated with my family and would wait for a table across the cheesecake factory parking lot

marginal sushi meets uncomfortable seating, we used the restaurantcom coupon and got stuck with a no service sop, seriously felt ripped off, I think we actually spent more based on that tip than if we had just paid full price, avoid this one just not worth it

I don't know why Sunset Clothing Exchange moved from their much larger digs in South McClintock, but I guess they wanted to be right next to Buffalo Exchange anyway, this store is very take it or leave it if you're going to pass by but I wouldn't go out of your way. I bought some awesome vintage dresses by accident once and they have some really cool art on the walls from local artists, including some work by my Bud Wiley. I think this place has good, if not great intentions, but just doesn't have the purchasing power to keep the store well stocked or interesting

how where am i the view from the top of the mountain is great the city can be seen in all directions look there is downtown and downtown and a bunch of houses under construction and look at that sky wow ok so stopping to enjoy the view is one thing stopping to find out where you are is another don't worry i told my friend this city is laid out in a grid if anything we can go down to the other side of the mountain and cut into the street oh i didn't know let me tell you the story, i went to south mountain twice the first time it was on christmas eve where almost no one could be found, i met a friend there and we made our own path, he always had his jeep in sight so no harm in turning around, i trusted him to be my guide the second and last time i hiked south mountain it was in february, my best friend arrived in phoenix to the weekend for my birthday and since the weather was so nice compared to Detroit she wanted to be in the sun as much as possible no problem I knew where we could get a good hike I didn't know we were going to get lost we parked at the th entrance and chose our way the Mormon trail we were on our way to learn about the religion we joked as we passed several other hikers when we reached a recognizable peak we stopped to appreciate the view then think about our location should we do turn around and go back the way we came were we still on the Mormon trail where were the markers the loops the signs from God we looked at each other each of us having a prisoner personality taken when it comes to conquering large piles of rocks ahead we screamed punching the air with our fists a little later we were once again stopped squinting against the retreating sun. I wouldn't call us lost at this point, but that's only because I'm too stubborn to admit such a mistake. maze, I told him where we parked and he said it was a good hour walk back to our car, another mile or two or so to the third entrance, oh no problem, I thought since the town was laid out like a grid I didn't know there were exceptions to that, we insisted on thanking our impromptu guide friend, we walked and walked and walked passing other hikers and mountain bikers, finally the trail opened up to flat ground, we were close or so we thought when we reached the end of the trail there was no parking or street. Connecting us to where we needed to go was a long gravel road that snaked through a golf course and we started driving down the long gravel road until we reached the baseline in which we were determined to cut back to the west and find my car. I thought it was our helpful hiker friend from the summit, he asked if we needed a ride, my best friend and I exchanged looks. and then another and another until we finally hit the baseline, where the hell were we, that's when it hit us, we would have walked for more miles on foot to my car all these windy, rambling roads, damn golf course, fucking southern mountain, fucking unmarked trails, it should change its name to stupid trail because we just blazed it with enthusiasm, the nice hiker dropped us off at my car and left with a pretty big sigh to cover the horizon we unlocked my car, went inside and drove away from the prankster natural beast of the southern mountains, we counted the miles and minutes it would have taken us to get back to my car, at least another hour, the sun would have set by then and we would have missed our engagement dinner, lucky for us we stopped the right hiker friend at the right time, otherwise I might never have gotten home to write this review.

I hated this place, it looks like a good restaurant for a first date, but the food and price are definitely not worth it. The hot tofu soup was pitiful and my fiance ordered the b and a sushi which were both overpriced for their own good and the sushi tasted like something old, I won't choke again, I'm coming

I took my family here and it was a disappointing experience. The service was snobbish and rude. The waitress was condescending and the food was overpriced. I haven't been to the other Tomato but I would definitely discourage anyone from dining at Chandler Tomato. The service is clearly substandard and snobbish.

if you just need a roof over your head, I guess don't expect things to be easy for you, although I arrived Friday shortly before afternoon and wanted to check in early. The pregnant woman in the office, the one who smells of cigarettes and has marks on her arms, said the room wasn't ready yet. the ones she left me standing at the desk while she went out and found a room that was ready eventually this was the first place I went that wasn't a be converted that had hardwood floors hardwood floors are cute when you stay in someone converted into a hotel but in a real motel it felt like I was staying in a hospital room.

very good food but a bit overpriced for the amount of food you get so the price is the only reason I give it one star instead of one star for a small sandwich, salad and iced tea, all the food seems to be organic in nature so the taste is definitely higher quality.

the valet guys were absolutely great they were the best part of my stay at this hotel the grounds were ok not star quality the room decor seemed old and the colors were dated although most of the staff were friendly we had a pretty bad encounter with the pool manager my husband and I had purchased a bag of popcorn from the grocery store and were snacking on it by the pool the pool manager came to us and informed us that outside food is not allowed in the pool, she told us we had to put our food away, she then left without even offering the option to order Fairmont approved food, it was really strange and compensating, we had been sitting by the pool for over an hour and not a single person from the servers had come to us to take our drink orders. It also seems a bit ridiculous that we couldn't eat our own bagged popcorn, it's not like we ate a big meal and made a mess, it made the resort seem elitist. this hotel above the Fairmont Scottsdale Princess

I don't know how this place stays in business, the menu is so limited, would you like chicken or chicken in a pita, chicken on lettuce, chicken rolled in a tortilla and the pita chips are bland, yuck and the potato salad has something way too spicy in it. I've only been there twice and tried different dishes each time, but I just don't understand anything Greek about this place.
the problem with a place like this is the five star hype of the helps which must be amazing but sorry I've had better eggs benedict for me just too far to drive for the poor food and marginal service

drive thru or dine in waiting for your order might seem like too long, I'm a fan of their carne asama burritos and their very tasty chicken burritos as well as their breakfast burritos, they use real tortillas, not gummy doughy ones like fast food, use all the burritos are huge, really two meals worth of food, but they aren't careful to remove gristle from the meat or excess liquid from the spoon before wrapping your burrito so if you are a picky eater or don't like mess the food doesn't have any kind of burrito burgers and the Philly cheesesteak sandwiches are also very good they have a great variety on the menu actually it's a greasy spoon and I mean greasy but it was a weekly stop when I worked nearby

eh the stars might not be sure yet after looking at the menu online, i really wanted to like this place, the menu has some creativity unlike the north indian restaurant menu pattern you find in many indian restaurants in the valley, besides offering things like korma kadar vindaloos and with a variety of chicken lamb panzer shrimp or fish options for everyone, they also have other more unusual choices like one of my favorite dishes, alai meths, creamy fenugreek and peas and dah vida in the appetizers I couldn't wait to find out unfortunately three friends and I went for lunch on a Saturday and there was a buffet so I didn't get to try any of those mouthwatering dishes the restaurant itself although decorated a bit haphazardly the Chinese paintings are bright and clean there is a to on a wall that was playing one of my favorite Bollywood films I was still excited about where the butter tasted the footmen the buffet was good but no complaints on the plus side again there was something different fish curry also like an Indian style Chinese dish or two so that was cool but the food was just solo. I was there with three other people. One said the cuts of meat, especially chicken, were better quality than most Indian buffets, but he didn't like the sauces that much. Another friend said he liked the marsala tick, but that was about it. For vegetarians, we didn't have much choice. baby food than anything else, dessert was very good too and the rice was very bland so overall I wasn't impressed but I don't want to judge the place too harshly based on the buffet alone after the whole curry house was packed on a Saturday afternoon so I think maybe there is something better to offer me, I will have to go back for dinner and see what their non-buffet selections are like before I totally write this place off my list

it's a fun place it's a great place for a quick and cheap meal is it really authentic it's probably closer to the authenticity of many places across the country wagamamalike maybe if you know how to order you'll do fine here a great addition to tempe restaurants
nice little cafe had tea and sat outside with my boyfriend, enjoyed the weather and played cards very relaxing

the monitor is good and the pleasant ambiance is still not the best service for a diamond property the group we were with ordered portions of good or old scotch direct which they didn't have they replaced it with or old at twice the total price they really should have been informed of the price first they were not satisfied

when you enter Sky Harbor you are bombarded with statements that it is the friendliest airport in the country, what does that mean friendly in a sense that you will always feel at home here, I didn't really know that, but it seems extremely important to their PR group because when you sign up for the wife you can't change pages until you rate how friendly the airport is in a drop down menu, it might be doing a disservice by proclaiming it like the superlative of friendliness the expectations are high at least by me i found the free lady extremely friendly yeah star so i found the check in area different at least in the terminal not so friendly as it left me a little depressed the tea attendant who confiscated my oz apparently it's oz in pox neutrogena sunscreen not so friendly but not malicious and i guess i wouldn't be so friendly if i was tasked with monitoring tenths of ounces hour after hour the spoke security system I found not so user and retailer friendly I never like seeing a plethora of places to purchase items before security leaving you with only a few outlets to browse in your small lobby I hate wondering what doors can buy is my lobby more vacant than the others just put security before all retail and walk around the set for a bit it's not a bad airport at all, the friendliest, I don't know, but the free woman certainly made me leave with a smile on my face.

I'm still not in love with it yet, with the overloads and the employees huddling together to eat and drink and chat instead of rushing and making my drink, it's okay to hurry, it's just my strange city thinking of me

I had had breakfast at Chandler Copies twice and loved it, so I wanted my husband to try them, but we went to Tempe, instead of a much older restaurant, quite worn out and it took me a while to not be put off by the overall bad smell of the place. My breakfast wasn't as good this time and my husband didn't like his either, just boring and non-repeatable hoping he would give me another chance and we would head to Chandler next time.

the service is always terrible, the food is very good. I used to avoid corporate chains and go for local offerings but Balbo has changed my mind, they seem to hire servers who have little to no experience as servers and frankly I have no idea how to provide good service, just order it and you will avoid the downfall of this restaurant.

five bucks for a bottle of miller lite pretty much says everything you need to know about this place also if you plan on going to a show here plan on paying for parking i have seen some terrible sound guys here but it's hard to tell if it's the marquee's fault a lot of bands that would play here touring with sound people the majority of the problems here are problems with venues this size all over the country the parking the crappy beer overpriced the strip search at the entrance the lack of Back to school again if there was any competition for a venue in this part of the valley that could host bands as popular as the bands playing under the big top, they would be hard-pressed to do a less enthusiastic job. Additionally, sloping floors make it easier to see a group from farther away, but they can also kill your back.

I read all the good reviews of this restaurant and wanted to try it since it's just up the street from where I live. I don't think I had a bad night, it was slow, the service was terrible, they mixed up our order with the table next to us. He set down plates of food and left the order. i got up and walked out finally got the waiters attention he took the plates gave us the correct meal and didn't offer to do anything for our entire time he was wasted not to mention the mistake our real meal was ok i tried the tamales werent wowed my boyfriend said his steak was solo i don't think i'll be back

my first visit to the squares was not at all what I had hoped for, it would at all be a few of my friends who have good taste in food and were delighted with it. So I had high hopes. Let me start by saying that I'm not really a fan of gourmet pizza. As a teacher I have a lot of dominos and pizza hut all the time and I can be very happy about that, either that or I love a good slice of New York pie since I'm not a huge fan of gourmet pizza and the overabundance of toppings I've checked out. menu for a good plate of delicious pasta, I was incredibly unhappy to find that they had about pasta and they all looked bland and candid, too strange to order, then I found their sandwich section, I went for their spicy chicken sandwich which looked perfect, but it took a while for our waitress to come, so I had a look at the pizzas and found a few that sounded good too, god thank you, because when I ordered the sandwich, the waitress informed me that they only served sandwiches at lunchtime, which really annoyed me. is irritating is on the menu there is a clear line between the section that says lunch specials and where it says sandwiches I mean there is a real black line drawn between the toto me that says they are not part of the lunch don't you think instead I ordered the popeye and olive oil pizza which has a white garlic sauce spinach artichoke hearts olives klamath garlic onions caramelized mozzarella roma tomatoes and applewood smoked bacon after ordering it i really thought i didn't even want it really was really irritated my husband and i both ordered our own pizza as we couldn't agree on what we wanted so he got the vortex which had basically every meat you could think of for an appetizer we ordered the garlic cheese bread which was way too much of garlic, it came with olive oil for dipping, I would have preferred a marinara sauce or something like that after eating the bread, I really didn't want my pizza to know that it had so much garlic in it, I picked a lot of garlic cloves with most of the other toppings, there was just too much, I know some people would probably like the witch, but it's just not my thing to have too much on my pizza, in Overall, the pizza was pretty good once I removed half of the toppings, the crust was really tasty and had the perfect crispiness and softness. For

I've been here a total of three times and probably won't be returning anytime soon. It's not that the food is outright bad per se it's just that there are a lot of better options nearby the first time I went on a recommendation and the food was good the th time I went the food was only good again the third time you get the picture the first obvious knock against Rosita's house is the chips and salsa they aren't bad but they aren't free given all the competition offering chips and salsa free salsa. I think these should be pretty darn special but they're not good just not exceptional. Second, the rice and beans are just okay, that descriptor keeps coming up in this review. The chicken enchiladas were fresh but lacked any real flavor or spice. The pachuca which is supposed to be one of their specialties was soggy, a big no for a dish which is a specialty of this region. Juarez and Comedos Guadalajara are not that far away

I tried the shrimp and fries and they were tasty. The shrimp was a little salty but with the dipping sauce it tasted good. I really liked the fries after reading the other review. I'm nervous about trying the fish and chips.

don't think about it, my windshield was replaced by these idiots, the morons tore up the interior of my car and damaged a speaker cover. I had to call them three times to replace the cover, they finally did it, then I discovered there was a huge air leak in the corner. They never repaired the interior trim. I called immediately after they left and was harassed by a manager because he had just had hip surgery. Why is it my fault and I couldn't come for a week. The incentives they offer are not worth the terrible craftsmanship and poor service. I am exploring my options with an attorney and have reported them.

if i had to write this review years ago it would have been stars but the portions continue to decrease at an alarming rate today i had the meat plate and no more than tablespoons of pulled pork and brisket were on the plate also what is with the staff they are like robot drones absolutely no personality the flavor and quality of the food is however very good the place is always sneakily clean and of course the decor is great fun being a hungry hippo i would prefer a slight price increase to maintain portion sizes

I eat here often because it's near me, good clean Chinese food but everything is starting to taste the same because they use the same sauce on a lot of their dishes, it wasn't like this before I will continue because it's always good and the best in the mho region but it's time to change the menu to get new flavors for those who eat there often

very well made pizzas like a pizza pillow tasty salty and rather doughy it's not my favorite style of pizza but nevertheless it was particularly good pizza the service staff was top notch and the shop is very warm and inviting we will be back

I was very impressed with their website and services and setting up my files for my cards was super simple and straightforward. I ordered samples before my cards three weeks ago, I haven't received anything yet. Now I know the turnaround time for the cards is a few days, but I received no confirmation that they were shipped or the method by which they were being shipped. the shipping and billing addresses are different, there is a box where you type your shipping address and then it takes you to the billing section when I received my order confirmation I noticed that my billing address and shipping address were the same at the top of the order and then further down in the order section this was where I had typed in my correct shipping address but it was partially cut off. I called them about it and they assured me the shipping was to the correct address. another taste email saying the reason my samples weren't delivered was because I didn't give them the correct address, I looked at my confirmation receipt and the correct address was entered at the bottom of my order, it was a matter of not paying attention. I guess the suggestions would be to either pay more attention to their customers' entire order or work on the billing and shipping page instead of leaving it as a box for typing words, especially if it won't be read. The benefits are that they will respond very quickly and make sure your custom order is correct for printing. the downsides seem to be the shipping and customer service part, will I order from them again, but my trust has definitely been tested
not worth the price, the food was average and the portion was small for the price I paid

on Monday night attracts a crowd of bros and friends who think they are better than everyone else with a few nice people mixed in the bar is small and there is nowhere to sit so be prepared to stay up all night, I will only come here on Mondays as there is nowhere to go

the noise makes it almost impossible to talk the staff looks like the customers or customers are better dressed the staff has sunglasses crinkled on the back of their heads it's hard to know who you're supposed to ask for help once you know they are responsive, friendly and ready to please the food is just right the sauces are too watered down the food is minimal in terms of amounts for the money it's a favorite among the neighborhood but now it's the adults hanging out in the old monastery behind the whitney murphy funeral home i'm starting to think my comrade is a people have no idea what good casual food is about the service in a is horrible all the customer service in the businesses here is terrible the restaurants and retail stores watch out for the valets they drive customers' cars too fast around the parking lot here and the arcadia tavern. I'm entitled to my opinion since I studied as a waitress, bartender, valet manager and deb service consultant.

I don't eat a lot of pasta and I don't come here all the time, but I think the salad with the pesto dressing and the garlic and mithra spaghetti with bacon, mushrooms, brown butter and cheese are very good. I heard the other things are good too. I'm only here for lunch, so I don't know what dinner is like.

I stopped in on Sunday for lunch after a high recommendation from a friend of mine in San Diego, she claimed it was the best sub she had ever had so I had to try it, unfortunately my sub didn't have any taste and toppings when we arrived. ground as others had obviously done from the looks of the ground, I had the chipotle cheese steak sub which I shared with my husband, the bread tasted good but it wasn't freshly baked, they skimped on the steak and barely saw any onions on it for the price of the sandwich, I was really expecting to get more, the sauce was the best thing about it but I wanted more too, I didn't won't go back sad it's not a better first impression

I can't remember the last time I was in a hard rock cafe, this visit was only memorable for Amanda Peaches, beautiful face and voice, jungle like humidity inside the place, our servers were attentive, our drinks were frequently refilled, but it's just not as hard rock when it's so family friendly, it's a very small space and being in downtown Phoenix on a Saturday night in the summer it was also sparsely populated, maybe I I don't understand, but overpriced drinks and signed guitars on the walls don't make my shutters slam.

good Indian food not great arrived on a Saturday night I was craving Indian not busy at all never a good sign the samosas were the best in town very hot with a great filling that evoked species and not very mild like some other restaurants the lamb korma and chicken tick marsala were ok for some reason it didn't pop for me it had nothing to do with the spiciness level it just lacked that extra pop you get from a really good curry I don't know if the spices hadn't been freshly grilled or missing a crucial pinch of love that day but I wasn't feeling it I left full but not quite satisfied from my Indian food fix and the quest for the best chicken tick marsala in town continues I must mention that the interior of the restaurant is beautiful the service is good but the prices a little high for my liking

I'm not a fan of this place, I like to try to stay positive, so here's my attempt at the proverbial positive sandwich, the location is fantastic, I really like where it is, it's a cute little place that's very easy to find the meat of the matter, the food here is strange, I'm very open to trying new things and experiencing different cultures as I've mentioned in other reviews. i was eating an ashtray it was not good the pad thai i tried was very lifeless i asked a friend to have a big bowl of soup which looked good but i didn't try it lettuce onions pickles tomato the service was not good i sat at the bar the first time i went here and we were mostly ignored the bartender who i believe no longer works there luckily sniffed me out when I asked for clarification on something there were probably also jars of really weird floating things at the bar pickled, preserved vegetables, meat, fruit and it wasn't appetizing to be there, I don't have a weak stomach at all, it was just strange the second time I went in the service it was just as bad, there was a table for us for lunch and the place was almost dead and I had to go up and ask them to take our order after we've been sitting for minutes, the menu is small and the prices are high with not much room for substitutions or changes. friendly, I like to believe my taste buds just didn't like this place. I know a lot of people who have very positive things to say about this place. I won't recommend it as a personal favorite and frankly will probably avoid it unless it's specifically requested by a customer. I completely agree with the concept that not everyone has to like the same things. I personally didn't have a good experience with this place, but I respect that the majority of reviews did.

This may have been my worst dining experience ever, the scenery was beautiful, we can't complain that the menu was okay, there was a good number of choices, but the prices were really high. We're just talking about taco burritos here. looks and says most people just use salsa but I guess I can get you a ranch or something great service huh I asked the waiter about the margaritas and he purposely told me the cheaper ones aren't good and are too watered down. and I hope to share my story with many people before they waste their money

I've been to this place several times because, again, right around the corner from my living room, I so want to be able to give it a higher rating, but every time I go the service is really not that great. Last week I went for some Wii Night Cent Wings and Wings, can't be beat. like our food now being in the service industry and having spent many years as a server I understand you think since the bill is so low your tip is going to suck, that's just not necessarily the case, we tipped our server and we didn't even stay there long, you get tables like that for an hour, you are so comforted and smiling, you never know how far it can go. mai was flaky and sweet the crunchy taco tasted sweet with the sauce and red onion not greasy at all the steak was still tender and flavorful even though our service was poor we had already finished our chips and salsa before we even got our water took a long time the same with the food and it wasn't even that busy we were sitting inside and there were only people in the bar and there was only one other table eating now our server was wrote our order on her so she seemed tired and exhausted and we had to bring our bill in at the end to check, we waited a while before doing so, it looked like she might have been the only server in the place but she had help from a gentleman named frenchy I liked the tall frenchy guy but with a dry wit and he seemed to be the jack of all trades of the place, the doorman, the food runner, busier, you name it he did it. the time my complaint is the same, the service must intensify it

I like to call it my bash on the plus side, the wine and beer selection is quite extensive, the produce is fresh with quite a few organic choices, the natural foods section has a number of pleasant surprises and they have added new bulk dispensers there as well. I've had mixed experiences getting help in the meat section, but paying in advance is always quick, much faster than some of the other grocery store chains.

Mathis Place has a good happy hour for lunch but the choices on the menu are pretty limited, the food isn't bad but it's not amazing so three stars for being average, I guess I come back every now and then so I guess that's a plus

i always try to get pumped on a number of services, high pressure too, i usually point out something that needs attention, dog hair in the backseat, crumbs on the floor and they constantly perform a half two star vacuum job because the exterior of the car is usually nice and the interior is wiped down pretty well overall but these guys need to step up their game. i used to bring my car here when it was under previous ownership and was still happy with the service now I would rather travel miles further to get a top quality car wash.

dear yelp why can't there be a star rating I wanted to give this place stars but I will have to wait for another visit to increase it I have never been here before so I consulted my colleagues for their input the service was fast and prompt our waitress was friendly and plus I was impressed with the beer selection although small with an offering of Alaskan amber alarm we decided to keep things simple this trip wings medium flavor a large margherita pizza with garlic on the products I love the mozzarella that they use, I have never tasted cheese this cheesy or this good on my pizza, no joke the wing sauce was also delicious and they provided you with a perfect amount of sauce to cover the wings and the ranch was not watered down which is what I am traditionally used to. Parking sucks, we had to park across the street from their main parking lot to find a spot and the tomatoes on the pizza weren't ripe. day, so with the combination of the two I will definitely say I will come back to give them another sample in due time and maybe raise this star to where I think it should be in my mind
