of us, I don't want to be a kvetch, but I consider myself an expert on Jewish delis as a New Yorker originally from a predominantly Jewish area and married to a Jew, I've had more than my fair share of experiences at their house, my husband and I woke up this morning with a craving for a good rye corned beef bagel and a knish, so I drove all the way to the mall to make it happen well, first of all, the decor is terribly schlocky, it's kind of like the tourist trap, Jewish grocery store you find in times square, it's like a Disney version of my grocery store, I grab my number and head over to the cold case to get a few drinks, of course they didn't have regular lemon snapple and why shouldn't they be like all the pizzerias and deli convenience stores on my haul, but they did betray the Dr. Browns, which is always a welcome sight, another thing they had in the cold case that I found strange was jars of Nathan's pickles. the hot dog restaurant I imagine a Jewish deli would taste like pickles I didn't even know Nathan made pickles it was kinda lame to be honest anyway I go to the counter where there doesn't seem to be anyone working there was no organization so I waited and waited in New York the deli is a finely tuned machine designed to move people quickly copies eh not so much when I finally placed my order the guy who took it a had trouble typing it into the computer and asked me to repeat it several times even though i said i wanted my bagel toasted several times i was given a cold bagel with no taste i waited a little longer for my order to arrive and went on my merry way here is the breakdown of the food we ordered. best in my own kitchen a toasted plain bagel with terrible cream cheese the bottom of the bagel was entirely too thick and very hard they didn't even cut it all the way through probably because the crust is too thick corned beef on rye me corned beef wasn't very good it wasn't corned enough if they make their own they didn't use a fatty enough brisket the rye that wasn't marbled rye was dull it could not stand the corned beef got soggy and ended up falling apart the pickle it came with was the most disgusting thing I have ever seen and it was definitely kosher dill even though I asked for half sour the potato salad was actually very good although the knish was horrible the knishes from my elementary school cafeteria were better than this first of all the outer crust was way too flimsy it should have be much thicker, especially considering the gargantuan size of the knish, we basically ate a large plate of mashed potatoes, the potato inside itself was unremarkable not only do I have this something Jewish going on but I'm also Irish, I've never met a potato dish I didn't like until today, I haven't even finished my half of the knish now for the prices, what's with this meshugah for a bagel with cream cheese it's a bit much in my case they tell you about the corned beef sandwich it was now I paid that much for sandwiches in my before but you have meat labs and several layers of sandwich it wasn't a sandwich I was also going to bring us some whitefish salad to taste but in the labs that's not happening why should anyone come all this way into this heat, schvitzing everywhere for this deck, I don't know

I purchased the Nutria group when it came out last year and had a horrible experience at the restaurant. I ordered a cheese platter, the platter was way overpriced and the most problematic part is that Nutria ordered the food from another restaurant on Mayo Boulevard and had it delivered. The same is true with pizza if you order a pizza there it will be delivered from another restaurant in Mayo shopping plaza. Nutria takes a large markup on food because they pay another seller for it, avoid this. that we were served a disproportionately small portion because we were using a group, we ordered two glasses of red wine, the waiter who was also the owner served us a glass which was of what is usually served, the only positive aspect of coypu is that they have a good wine selection to be honest, you would be much better off going to a more reputable establishment in the area like white chocolate grill, oh also keep in mind that the current owner bought the restaurant there is over a year old, it has changed ownership several times and the overall quality suffers because of this avoid

well laid out zoospore, good for animals, more for kids than adults, the zoo had a limited number of animals that were bored, mostly hiding, the water ponds for the animals were stagnant with algae, overall not a great experience, they are going to expand it seems, but they should pay more attention to the animals they have celtcharm

The Arizona Science Center offers a series of programs called Adult Nights that take place on the first Friday of each month. These lectures cover focused overviews on topics ranging from genetics and nanotechnology to Native American medicinal use of native plants found in the Southwest. offers that allow you to view maximum film and see the latest flavor of the body worlds of the titanic exhibit and after the lecture I would have loved to give the science center stars, but I am constantly annoyed by the inability of the science center staff to set up one of the three microphones correctly for the speakers in advance, wasting a speaker's minutes each month. Beer and wine are available for purchase during the event. Nightly conferences for adults are free. wwazscienceorg adult night out wwazscienceorgadultsnightoutphp
not impressed, I prefer to have a large mac and fries at McDonald's, I don't understand why some people love it

good prices but honestly not worth it, first of all you have to leave your purse at the counter, I'm not comfortable doing that anywhere, the only place I've ever seen that before was a ass bookstore, then you walk into this warehouse that has no air conditioning. a few dollars for toys my dog ​​destroys in minutes but no air conditioning in crazy Arizona

the Vine Tavern, I will omit the word restaurant as I am fairly certain that term cannot be applied to the food they serve at this establishment is some sort of culminating hangout vortex for lowbrow Fred Durst clones and would-be daytime strippers, that being said, this cesspool of a building has yet to burn to the ground, so I feel obligated to warn others before considering spending an evening there being myself new to the Tempe area and a small group of friends decided to come check it out as we approached. the building dimly lit I started to have doubts, my flowery sense tingled more about it later when we entered we were greeted by a lovely bouncer type gentleman who begged us to pay for the cover seriously. We were seated towards the back near a group of teenage mothers and their burly counterparts. We ordered food. The food arrived on time, it may have been poisoned but I was too hungry to care. the frozen food aisle of grocery stores it might taste like what they serve at the vine I had immediate food regret my only consolation was what you call it and the poor old man behind the mic with his acoustic guitar enveloping his surreal set we unfortunately paid and escaped out the back good cheap drinks bad you might get stabbed

you know I could see this place being very inconsistent and I was there one day ho hum, the recommended wine was their chianti which tasted pretty bad, they have a weird assortment of imported beers and like a few other reviews the pizza had little flavor, we ordered a pesto chicken pizza and had to bite on each piece to find the flavorless pesto a bit dry and the pizza was really late and hot late and hot which meant we were there for a while, our waitress was nice, cute and fun, but hey, that only gets you stars, the salad was better than the pizza and the wings were pretty good than everyone else

they are known for their carne Amanda and it rocks but hey this place was spot on and I dine at every turn it's all a la carte and the tacos are so small and it's value for money it should at least come with a small bag of chips honestly the chips were so average it was disappointing the salsa that came with it was mediocre given the holding factor applied the salsa that came with my tacos was outstanding and should be their signature salsa for anything is canned soda refillsgeezz another few dollars later I think I ended up spending more on small tacos and a small basket of chips and canned soda for that price I want more ambiance or at least a bite of taco

ha ha hahahaha pit is real man, this place would have been a really bad idea if I wasn't already expecting a limp now occupying the space that saw the death of not one but two dance clubs and Peach Pit level subsequently, I mean Cherry Lounge and Pit is beyond ghetto opened by the same people who make Sugar Daddy and Dos Gringos, this place has all the sexiness and appeal of a trail commercial, you know, I half expected to turn a corner to see a bleached blonde in a neon colored bikini on top of a motorboat, they updated the look of the logo dancers trapped in cages in mini-panties with knee-length dragon rider boots with fluffy puppet skins adorning them, the children of drunken lounge-goers a la dad and now play on tiny screens on the walls in the hallways and behind bars tactfully interspersed with footage of chicks looking seriously dangerous doing sexy things like sucking lollipops, cherries while winking yes she was winking at you wasn't she inviting you into her secluded lair to bask in the glow of a booze doused club about I'm not sure about the dress code we were so forcefully and largely reminded of in the queue but the girl in front of me was wearing a shirt oversized, baggy jeans and flip flops and they took her and left her with no problem. I also saw a girl dressed exactly like Peggy Bundyno joke spandex black calf leggings long spandex shirt with orange heels and a giant boob girdle it was so amazing I took a picture she wasn't impressed with my sighting so I Anyway I had to sneak the picture take it for what it's a club owned by the guys from Dos Gringos on Mill Ave.

Gallo Blanc cafe has delicious food, but the service needs a lot of help. My first visit was one of the worst customer service nightmares I've ever had at a restaurant, my second visit was much better, but I think our server must have been drugged on my second visit. My friend and I ordered the fried ranchero cheese appetizer and it arrived after our main entree. it's not at least a good experience I won't come back I work too hard for my money to throw it away at an establishment I don't believe in
I only had their pizza once, it was ok but nothing extraordinary I would try again but I will be more skeptical

refused to give a young teenage girl water referred her to the change, olive ivy handled this change pathetically and unprofessionally, didn't even hesitate to give her water, that's why I ate there instead

I have been eating at Goldfish since it opened and after my last Saturday night dining experience, I have to say that the quality of food and service has significantly deteriorated. I know Saturday night is busy so maybe I should give the servers and chef a break. Sorry the menu has changed and so has the quality of the food and not in a good way, let me give you a brief sample of our experience. The tuna tartare appetizer was replaced with a dull combination of flavors. However, there is a complete blandness to the way this dish is now served. The old tuna appetizer was much more tempting to move on to the arugula salad and goat cheese medallion. My salad was served without a medallion and literally loaded with a huge ball of cold goat cheese and terribly prepared mushrooms. What happened to the warm crusted goat cheese next we both ordered the parmesan crusted sole even though the sole was well prepared. There was a lemon sauce that delicately balanced the flavor of the creamed fish and the sole didn't mix well. I don't know if that was a mistake or part of the new menu, okay and for the piece de resistance we ordered a side of snow peas which were actually drowning in a bath of some sort of soy sauce and oil. the poorly prepared food wasn't enough to bring down my joy, so I caution those of you who may have already enjoyed this restaurant like me, to think twice before spending a pretty penny at the goldfish.

hit or miss pretty much the perfect definition of hoo my friend and I like to come before the shows and for happy hour the draft beers and the super cheap wells the well drinks are usually a little weak but being so cheap I can't blame them Tuesdays are taco day and they have pretty decent deals every day of the week has a special as far as food goes the bar food is average to below average there are games and shuffleboard as mentioned in previous reviews TVs are scattered throughout the seating area and a large deck for smokers the bartenders are the real hit or miss part of the experience I have been here and I had great service. I came back to have poor service, it wasn't very busy overall if you're looking for a place to get some cheap beers, we're talking domestics on tap before heading to the clubhouse or heading somewhere else to stay the night and check it out at least once.

and now ladies and gentlemen, tonight's category, the things that make Suwon ask in my book, here we go, I can actually relate to the people answering the phone, the sweet burn on my tongue after eating a bite of King Pay chicken, the lack of lasting astral repercussions from eating said King Pay chicken, the damn huge area they will deliver to for a minimal fee, beware, their website says it's fifty bucks, but the gas crisis affects everyone. tasty pork the place is actually clean the coupons attached to the menus they send to my house at regular intervals i can call to place an order jump in my car to pick it up and come back watch quality reality TV programming within minutes they have mr bibb on tap and the number that makes Suwon ask in my book eight yes count 'em eight delicious soups they will deliver to my door when i just can't bring myself to take off my pajamas

As the previous reviewer said, I too have passed by this place a million times, my husband and I love breakfast and are always looking for the ultimate omelette that we both ordered. Of course, an omelet was chorizo ​​and green chilies and my husband's was cheese and mushrooms. I have to say the food was piping hot which is always a plus for me.

ok i have this thing about going out in scottsdale in the first place because i'm always like that black girl with natural hair in a sea of skinny blonde and tan girls but that's neither here nor there the lodge was ok in my opinion for it to be in scottsdale where everything is super expensive for no reason the drinks are pretty cheap i had a few shots and a drink and went under the bartender was super nice and she knew my name by the time i got back for my 3rd drink, they have amazing food deals like get a burger and a beer, sure it's not top notch beer but the butcher doesn't like burgers and beers, there is music coming from somewhere and it's always pretty legit, a good mix, there's like a sort of intimate cabin area with romantic flickering lights when you first walk in if you want privacy, but we usually go out onto the deck and the People candidly watch people play cornhole. if you're too depressed to go home happy

I went to Susie's for lunch the other day, I had it as I was alone and I don't like to eat alone at the restaurant, there were only a few people inside and the food seemed to come quite quickly if you eat there I probably waited in mind to go eat, I thought the restaurant needed updating but they don't seem to have the best hours as they close at 1pm so it's a lunch place, not a lunch place dinner, I got my food and took it home. they had shredded beef lettuce cheese tomatoes and salsa. I thought they were very comparable to the ones I had before that were homemade. I would love to go back for lunch, but since I'm not home much for lunch it might be difficult, definitely worth a second chance.

so I went to Tucson and now I experienced this one and I have to say I didn't have a drool wow or delicious moment, don't get me wrong it's not horrible it just has no wow factor at all for me and I will pass by next time there is just better Mexican food there the service was on ball though

Fry's is conveniently located at W German Rd and s Alma rd has a reasonably wide selection and the prices are fair when I shop. I research and purchase items based on best value in terms of product freshness selection and convenience. I check the weekly sale announcements and circle the best buys usually from different food pharmacies, as these are recurring consumable items. I will look for opportunities to stock up when good deals present themselves. The site is clean, well stocked and well organized. eggs a surprising dinosaur there is a sushi stand at the back of the store near the packaged meats section, so I buy the freshly made sushi, the spicy crab roll, the cali roll and the tuna roll, it's actually very good, I usually buy products elsewhere, same with the laundry products, beauty products and dog food.

this Safeway is nice and is close to my house but after visiting this weekend I have to stay, I'll stick to the bashes, the prices are definitely higher on my normal items at Safeway too, I know Safeway can't really control this but the vibe isn't as friendly. I don't know what attracts this type of crowd, but the bashes have a much more local feel.

I stopped in for a quick lunch and wasn't impressed at all. I heard the food was good but I've had better subs almost everywhere, they have very limited toppings. I wish I had gone to Mr. Goodcents down the street, much better quality subs.

the grand orange grocery store has a problem she can't decide what she wants to be when she grows up and it makes the overall experience uncertain is it a fast store a grocery store a restaurant a cafe unfortunately it can't be all I love the grand orange pizzeria when it has table service fun waiters and delicious food but during the day on weekends the grocery store is too busy and disorganized to tolerate it's not designed for the crowd they do a poor job of line management and when there is a queue to order the rest of the groceries is impossible to navigate to top it off the counter staff yells at you when your food is ready it's not necessary. I will definitely come back in the evening for the pizza, the delicious wings, and to partake in the adjacent best store, but I'm afraid I won't come back for the chaos of the weekend.

we bought a second Jura compressed coffee machine from sur la table it was an expensive model priced over k after a few months it stopped working the only option they offered was to send it in for repair when I asked to have it replaced I was told the turnaround was hours it was actually weeks when all is said and done I have a high priced item and that type of customer service not to mention an expensive product that can't not last for days, extremely bad customer service on this one

four stars on average why this place is a chain restaurant with a stupid name the family made me eat here and I'll tell you this the only thing four stars here are the tall young sexy fit servers everything else is weak and salty at least they serve bourbon but seriously the cocktail menu was stupid and the preparation by the untrained bartenders was obvious stupid rolls with honey butter oh that's cute the food was apple seeds meets outback one of those menus at taste of the world my dad was stupid enough to order the prime rib it looked like a swanson frozen dinner poor dad it's called white chocolate grill what does that mean oh it means we are idiots and have fooled people into thinking we are a hip restaurant so sad seriously the service is lovely and attentive the food is better prepared and home style with more flavor and less salt. around the restaurant, it's quite strange

Michael C is right, this place is very charming, I love the interior design with brick walls, I love the "No Whiners" sign hanging behind the bar, it's a small place but that's part of the appeal, there's a little patio upstairs with a fireplace that wasn't lit when I went, that might be a good place to hang, there's not much of a view but there's something cool about being at a higher elevation high, finding j chew was a bit of a challenge, we ended up stopping at a parking lot to ask for directions when we arrived, my friend and I headed to the bar immediately, we had a drinks menu in front of us I was more intrigued by the huge crystal slapstick trivia game I wanted to play when I asked about the beer, ah, not a big choice, but I will. as a singles the group of women sat outside on the small patio it was cold and cold in May and they had the fireplace going they also had a few heat lamps working but most of them were out of propane we Phoenix locals were chilling our coconuts if you know what I mean praise Allah for the fingerless gloves which were a big hit that evening but the bartender tried to keep them going so we appreciated his efforts in overall I like chewing but I can't rate it higher than for a few reasons, yes one is the beer selection, even though it's small that's also doable, but their mixed martini list looked disgusting, but I don't do martinis nor do I throw out mixed drinks, but the real trouble came from other customers j chew co, there is something defeated and sad about seeing another man. yell, lock him up at another man during what could be a calm, mature discussion about two sports teams they love and follow individually, there's something even sadder about seeing an aging man with a cigar punching a married woman, he just wouldn't leave our group alone, well maybe they won't be here when I go back because I think if they are I'm going to have to say something about how obnoxious it is if you are in old town and looking for a place to relax this is your place and i loved the music they had on rotation from the humble mouse and post service to the s grunge and alternative rock i loved the tunes with the laid back atmosphere the great service and knowing there was a relaxing place in scottsdale to hang out who knew i just don't think there was a strong enough draw to stay at that place all night, it's more your thing before dinner or before another type of bar establishment, only problem is there aren't many other nice places in the area, I would be interested in going especially on a Saturday night when Scottsdale is out in force

the tavern on the mill is an average sports bar with cheap drinks and we come here to watch UFA fights as they don't charge cover. We always leave at the end of the fighting because there are better nightlife options in the area.

in short and long lines, a complicated menu and a handful of dollars for a hot dog, I guess I never bought into the whole gourmet hot dog craze and I probably would never have heard my coworkers talk about the dogs and on more than one occasion I saw astronomical lines at the counter, so I thought why not, it must be good right, talk about sticker shock and only for one very expensive dog indeed besides this they managed to complicate a simple hot dog, various types of meats and the topping options were a bit confusing, not because there were too many to choose from but because none of them were really explained, it's a bit boring for a first time customer, the dogs themselves aren't bad but I think you have to be a complete idiot to ruin a hot dog, I still don't understand what's so amazing, definitely way overpriced, I won't go back, they can keep their sausages and push them

the food was pretty good but my biggest issue was with the service, we made a reservation and still had to wait an hour, that's not the whole point of a reservation, you don't have to wait an hour, one of the three hostesses tried to help at the end of the wait, but at that point all we were waiting for was food, drinks, overall I enjoyed my chicken and ribs, but I would not go back.

Despite the beautiful layout and variety of stores downtown, I was still deeply disappointed with some friends and was just trying to find a parking space for shopping and things like that when we were informed that it was going to cost us a lot of money to park in a mall parking lot. came up with some kind of validation system to get some of the spit back, but it all seemed more than sneaky in nature, so we decided to park elsewhere everything else this lovely outdoor mall is outstanding, so dad said the estate was creating a better system for those of us who weren't there for the events at the stadium across the road.

so I'm apparently oblivious to the fact that everything with Joe's name is owned by the same person, luckily for me I wasn't stupid enough to order pork again, is Farm Grill a pretty cool concept and probably the only decent place to eat on this side of town since Gangsters Inc closed at least there are enough reviews here that clearly show it's doing something right. damn daycare when we went with brats running around and climbing on everything anyway, back to the food, I ordered a bacon burger, didn't bother to specify how I wanted it cooked and it was surprisingly cooked to a decent medium standard, I substituted sweet potato fries with it and they were pretty good, a little more pepper would have made them excellent, but hey the wife had wanted to replace the veggie fries with hers, but they made us order a side of them, this side was literally kilos of fried vegetables and it was way too much for any human being to consume, they weren't really my thing but the wife enjoyed this place, makes a lot of things but they suffer from a lot of logistical issues, the line is better and it keeps people from saving, but they seem to run out of menus quickly, people grab them, carry them in line and leave them at the window. the counter is outside and all lined up right next to the restaurant door these strange groups of people trying to get a drink or sauce are growing and creating an obstacle course for people coming in and out of the restaurant this brings me to my final problem the indoor pickup window while the summer is long and hot and I'm sure a lot of people are usually sitting inside the day we went and people are finally coming out with food and I know it seems stupid, but the trash can outside has the smallest opening ever, you can't actually put your plastic basket inside the trash can and turn it over to throw out your food, you have to pick things up in the basket and throw them away with your hands. I just finished my meal, washed my hands and now I have to wash them again because I had to handle a piece of paper covered in greasy sauce to throw it away. logistically stressful nightmare for me when you make it difficult for me to get in and out with my food, it makes me feel like you don't want me there, I know they will read this and I know they will dismiss it just like my gripes, but do me a favor when you build your next restaurant, hire someone with a planning degree to help you with the layout instead of just cramming things where you think they will go

British pubs are not my favorite places to eat as I am vegetarian and eat fish from time to time but this place was pretty good the building was cool and full of character and the service was very friendly Kim was a great waiter even though she did it all by herself on New Year's Eve she was very nice and efficient the food was pretty good I had fish and chips but I don't prefer to eat fried things often I have to say they were good although the outside seating is nice but the bird watching is mortals we pooped ourselves over and over again and even our water was tainted, it wasn't the rose and crowns fault but it ruined our experience a bit. This looks like a great place to have a drink and even watch the game. I'm sure it's a fun place but it's just not my favorite.

I really tried to like Maison Gilbert I have been there several times unfortunately I have always been disappointed the coffee is not very good the dishes are unique but lacking in taste I ordered a spinach and goat cheese quiche last Sunday the quiche was cool I was expecting it to be a little warmer and there was only a hint of spinach not what I expected the prices are ok but there are so many good independent restaurants in the corner that there is simply no good excuse for bad food

this place was messy and noisy, the food really wasn't great, and the salsa bar looked like a three year old's. Overall the only plus was the tortilla chips which were free before the food. I won't come back unless one of my friends pays for me.

I moved here a while ago and I like it for the most part, the grounds are clean and tidy, except for some irresponsible pet owners, some of them even let their pets run around all the time or can't control them, but that's not the management's problem. The pros are that the deeds are spacious, the well constructed grounds are clean and the grass is maintained, the swimming pool is well maintained. the parking is extra and not enough anyway, the uncovered spaces are just crowded in the rear parking lot the security gates are open most of the time from the front and have gaps that could let an adult through on the sides the exterior walls are not high enough to really keep out an intruder.

in a republic I voted Abacus Inn best Chinese in the valley, it's sad because Chinese can be so much better but I have to say Abacus Inn does something nice that I don't see too often in other Chinese restaurants, they give you hot tea and water and fresh fried noodles with sauces when you sit down. I had the Chicken Yuri Shan, it was a failure due to the inedible shia mushroom stems in my dish. I have to admit that the sauce was more developed than any sauce dishes I have tried at surrounding Chinese restaurants including Bamboo Café Ginger China Bistro and Shanghai La. I liked the use of cucumber in the dish, it was light, flavorful and successful, unfortunately the white chicken meat was dry, maybe a third cook was on the day I arrived and maybe this dish is normally better prepared. The closed spicy beef was more successful. The beef was very well prepared and unlike the Yuri Shan dish, this spicy beef was really very spicy. Szechuan sauce so I wasn't a fan of this dish here but I note that this sauce was better than what you get in the surrounding Chinese restaurants last time I was here I had the sizzling rice dish and that one impressed me because they cook the rice quickly in very hot oil and fluff up the rice, it's a cross between Abacus Inn and Shanghai The Abacus does more impressive stuff but Shanghai Fluffy Chicken Cuisine

one star would give it a holiday gift for me Copper Star Cafe has been a place where consistency and pride is taken in their food and presentation, unfortunately Circle H Be has nothing to do with the previous statement, my first visit to Circle H centered around ordering a half slap of ribs, they were extremely overcooked, there was more charcoal on the top, back and ends which just wasn't editable once you got scraped the charcoal off the top ends and center ribs there was one that was edible the company offered me a second chance to try their food giving me a complementary full slap nothing had improved they say they smoke the ribs but there was no smell to that effect from the ribs I ordered the second time spending more minutes on the grill after the order was placed bathing the waitress at the counter couldn't even tell what type of rub was on the ribs and what type of cut they were when I asked if they were smoked cooked daily she said some are if you get here early others were from the fridge last night the so called drub seasoning was tasteless the b sauce is very strange bottom line the ribs were not worth the price they charged half for bone in whole, both with sides. I have high hopes for the brisket, but it might be a while before I try this effort overall if they don't change the way they burn ribs, run, or drive really fast to another location. hops for a central place for ribs, I'm still waiting

party please do you have a happy hour yes give me a sign with starters at dollars off ok give me one of everything please I usually save over a dollar at happy hour but the monkeys are good our waitress then explains in Thai to my wife and daughter a few dishes we order and they arrive on time and were all quite a tasty problem. The sticky rice that came with the pork dish was about the size of two of my fingers should have been at least x x as much trouble. the rice that came with our express was good but we ordered extra rice and it only showed up when most of the main dishes were gone, even after asking for a second and third time it took them a few minutes to take it out of the rice cooker and bring it, not cool guys, it's my third time here and it's ok but no stars
simply said a greasy burger from start to finish, not a mathematical place I will avoid while I continue to a really good burger restaurant

yes I can agree, it's not perfect but at least they try to do something different, I didn't eat there and since I was a designated driver I only had sodas, I really enjoyed the stand up, it's a great place to see local artists start their careers

the service at this location was excellent until one of the servers managed to work vomiting into a conversation while I was having a hangover, it's never a good idea to talk about vomiting to a customer who is eating, this conversation led to more inappropriate words from the employee until he finally left with the no bueno special biscuit sauce. the flavorless cubes they put in the fryer should have just learned their chicken and waffles lesson
this is easily the worst burrito i've ever eaten, i'm amazed anyone chooses to eat at this chain, i bet the rations they serve in the back of trucks to refugees are better

i just called to ask when they were open until the woman said they were already closed but the website says open until 1 p.m. i obviously don't care about the patronage the mexican is a penny in the new new mexican thanks next

on a saturday night my friend and i are trying our second attempt at sushi for the night see my review of pearl for first place we jump up we sit at the sushi bar the waitress you girls go order me some sushi i have a sushi menu in my hand yes waitress would you mind putting it out soon cause they want to go home too what the fuck is this bitch uh ok dear waitress i'm sorry if i kept you or other employees around, especially since I finished eating my bread before your kitchen was even closed, it was totally okay to rush me even though I wasn't planning on staying all fucking night and even though a lot of new sushi orders came after mine, I was barely the last customer there, there were people all around me ordering sushi, so I still don't understand why you had to rush me if you were in such a hurry why did it take you longer to bring and process my bill than to eat your food maybe it was because you don't know how to count since you gave the wrong amount of change and I ended up having to say you have the right amount since you couldn't count it on the spot I like ra for the ambiance something you completely ruined thanks for that sincerely morgan

I love the way they treat my dogs, the staff is really friendly, they are really good at getting your pet seen in case of an emergency, the facility itself is nice but it feels like they are always trying to sell me something I don't need, this place is so expensive we can never get out of there for less

I'm going to have to hide this review from my girlfriend who is from Wisconsin and a big Brewers fan to be honest, this is my least favorite stadium due to its location and overall poor atmosphere, it has an outfield but it's a bit boring. Maryvale is a no frills stadium so if you're going to a spring training game to watch baseball this is the stadium to go to if you want to go to the game, the scene and the overall experience, I recommend a stadium in Scottsdale for what it's worth, a friend of mine says it's his favorite spring training stadium, but frankly I think he feels that way since it's the only stadium he played in in college. Personally, I like to go to a game and then go to bars or restaurants, but in this stadium I watch the game and then leave.

the place was quite busy when my husband and I visited one evening the decor was ok but very kitsch my husband and I shared the pear salad although the pears were the canned ones the special that evening was beef cheeks which if you are familiar and like them they can be amazing but I could barely find them on the plate as they were drowned in a heavy and overwhelming sauce my husband had the lasagna which was decent and honestly I had more that my entry for what we had was totally overpriced, I imagine the olive garden would be just as good

Monday morning take out place to improve same brief and terse service too cramped to look around and appreciate their items for sale the food was average but not worth all the noise this place demands I like the food for the most part and you can't go wrong with a red velvet cupcake can you, this place is all hustle and luckily dignity so I guess that's the situation with the crowds I'm sure I'll be dragged there again by another friend in this neighborhood so I will try to look with new happy eyes

I liked the tiki theme and the torch lights in the patio the last few times I came here it was normally full inside and I always ended up finding a place outside as it was packed the last time I came for a drink, it took a while but it wasn't too bad, the drinks were cheap and not stingy compared to the music it wasn't the typical mainstream songs you hear at the radio, which wasn't my favorite and the crowd was older professionals, it definitely wasn't a dressy type of lounge, everyone was dressed casually.

I have eaten here twice and I don't think I will eat here again. I ordered the lettuce wraps and the food smelled horrible, it made me nauseous, I couldn't even eat it, the salad is okay but I still can't get over it.
appears to be closed, phone number not in service went through last week and was fully locked with a real estate agent sign on the building

It's tough, it's probably the best Filipino restaurant in the Phoenix area, but that's not saying much because the few here really aren't good. Compare Jeepney Bistro to any of the places in the Philippine city. Lots of angels and they are blown away and for the record my wife is Filipino and she cooks way better than the chef here no contest a lot less grease oil that's for sure too their portions are a little small bigger than a few other places I could name but still small if you really want Filipino food and you don't know my wife to ask her for it this is probably your best option without driving all the way to LA but don't form an opinion on Filipino food based on this place, go to LA and try Bahai Kibo Nation or others and you will have a much better idea of what the cuisine is like

it was family day the ex and i like to see our son smile and we were starving after driving around for a while we stopped at Arrobas and said what is that also what we said when some of the food came like in what the heck is it so positive first the waiter was pretty quick and he gave refills without being asked for a fish it was ok nothing spectacular but honestly i would prefer in pay one at freaking del taco or ruby, not worth it here, the rice was ok, some flavor, probably converted rice, although the beans were mixed, I don't know about you, but I like to see real beans in my beans, that stuff was like gooey brown, delicious, the beef taco was just weird, I swear to god it tasted like gyro meat, I couldn't eat much of it, last but not least, dom ordered the white sand chimichanga which she looked mean to be honest, covered in a gooey white sauce filled with pork, he said it tasted like a hot dog, um, yeah, he took bites and was full, he didn't like it, I also had a margarita, it was huge and didn't taste very good, I'd rather have one that size which tasted good, well, one star for the chips and salsa like I said the fish taco was ok but everything was way overpriced final verdict we decided to never go there again

I haven't been to a sweet tomato restaurant in years. I've never been to this place before, but the service was good, selections haven't changed much. I was happy to see they had strawberry muffins with delicious strawberry butter. The salads are always fresh and good. I wish there were more non-dairy alternatives out there.
excellent margaritas but a bit expensive for what they have, their food is not that special, sad

good courts signs great pro shop cold drinks ice cream nice clean bathrooms nice people work there bad pro shop seems to only carry women's clothing and old school men's clothing the lights are the second worst in the valley after Indian school park I never paid for the courts because I play in a league so I don't know the prices the courts were clean and well maintained

om every time I'm going to put together a worst bathroom list this place will definitely be near the top, I spend quite a bit of time in this Barnes noble and have used the facilities a few times too, at a minimum there is always toilet paper all over the floor and at least one or two flush toilets with number two really people last night besides the usual mess, I'm not kidding, there was a huge cucumber sitting on the toilet paper holder in one of the stalls and a padlock with two keys on the floor as I sat doing my business, I couldn't help but wonder if these items were some sort of strange clues for a treasure hunt, a murder mystery, or something equally disturbing. Needless to say, I got out of there as quickly as possible rather than looking for more clues other than the fact that it's a typical Barnes noble with a Starbucks coffee. in fact, when buying them, don't stay too long or you may have to visit the scary bathrooms

I went to get acrylic on Friday and it was horrible. I have been getting acrylics for years and it has never been a problem filing them until this time the tip of one finger was filed down so much it was blistered. At least the nail learned to put a little antiseptic on it so it doesn't get infected. When I put lotion on my hands on Tuesday, a lot of my nails started to get sticky and filmy like they were going to disintegrate, which is not normal. I took mine off today and discovered that my nails were finely filed. Looks like they would have fallen off soon anyway, I won't be going back

even after hours of waiting, I loved the atmosphere and didn't mind it at all, the service was good, not too friendly, but everything we needed was on the table, the disappointment was a domestic Kobe burger, it was served with a little pink in the center after ordering it, medium rare, it is served with Asian coleslaw, peanut dressing which is served on the burger, it was way too strong and it took away from the burger itself, it was hard to taste the meat with so much peanut sauce in the slaw if I were to order this dish again. I would ask for coleslaw on the side, the fries were fantastic and the fried cheese was very good. I will definitely come back for more as my friends loved their burgers. The stars are for the fact that the burger was way overcooked and I couldn't taste the main component of this dish, the meat.

horrible experience, we had a home emergency that required us to move for days, we referred them through a friend, we explained to them that we were elderly with limited income but assured them that they would be paid in full, we paid the medical bills and our insurance verbally told them that once the bill was submitted they would be paid, but no no no that's not our policy, they were holding our two children for ransom, indifferent and horrible staff to manage

another disappointed visit I'm starting to think it's no accident and pb has lost its magic touch we went there for my wife's birthday around noon on a Wednesday we walked straight in and sat down we were both shocked as the shortest time we ever waited was well past hours the staff were more attentive to where we were seated than greeting us sincerely even though the place was empty except for two other tables we put in our order for a margherita with prosciutto a wise guy and a caring salad the bread came out cold with a little oil for dipping, I don't remember if it was still cold but it would be nice if they threw it in the oven for a few seconds before serving it to you then our pizzas came out and the margherita was missing the prosciutto, it's okay maybe he didn't hear me maybe the cook didn't hear him my wife confirms I asked for it and I'm not losing my mind the pizzas were good but lacked the usual special touch the crust was the best part which is not unusual but what was unusual was the rest lacked a lot of sparkle even though the shop was dead our waiter never came back to us and was back behind the bar laughing and chatting with other staff. Finally a blonde woman asks us if we want our bill, she brings it to us and when I give her my card I kindly tell her that they forgot my prosciutto and it's on the bill that another guy brings the bill back for me to sign. The dollar prosciutto is still on it, I informed her there was no prosciutto and told the other woman. but it's still there, I don't know if she thought I was just making small talk or what, but I certainly don't pay bone for slices of ham that weren't even on my pizza, he took care of it, here's the deal, I don't know if it's because I didn't wait hours to eat or if it's falling apart without chef bianca but pb has definitely lost his way and is quickly losing the legacy he created, whether they want to acknowledge it or not. was and dealing with hungry and upset customers brings them down but now I know that's not the case they're just not good at what they do and have been there too long just because pb is famous and chef bianca is world famous doesn't mean you're dough is good enough to come back but there's just no way I'm going to queue to eat here again if you read my previous review you'll see I don't hate pb and in fact, I was a strong advocate, I guess all good things really do come to an end

if it was possible i would give stars which i rounded up because the first time i ordered here they messed up my sandwich i ordered a cheese hero and they gave me a ham and cheese hero. Hamstrings are permanent and since I hate ham this was a killer meatball hero sandwich was pretty good although I wouldn't rush out to buy another one when I finally got a cheese hero it was delicious I would rush out to find my husband loves the Bobby the service is a little slow so I'll try ordering from their website next time. Capriottis has definitely earned a spot in my sandwich shop rotation

I like it better than Dennis, so I stop for some breakfast, it's not the best place in the world, but if you have a hard time choosing between late hours with Dennis and Waffle House, I would choose Waffle House for sure.

I went there for happy hour the chips and salsa were good I was a little disappointed with the service we had to ask for everything I sat there with an empty glass for a while the bartender could have had an off night so I'll give them another try

I really didn't think this place was that great, none of the dishes I ate were particularly very good. I think the best thing I had was some sort of sweet and sour meatball. Everything was just overcooked or flavorless. I wasn't really impressed with the options available. It's a buffet but I've had better

I have never had difficulty with Sonic before except for this place they barely speak English they don't know their own menu and they messed up my order deadlines come on your job it can't be that confusing

I have been to Butters many times, the most recent being with three senior golf friends from out of town over the past few years. We tried many breakfast places during their travels looking for a breakfast that would satisfy all of their different tastes. After trying six or seven different places, I brought them to Butters since we were on our way to the golf course. is not as crispy as he asks for, the waitress handled his grumbling very well and even made him laugh. The atmosphere is a little hipper than Butterfields, which was a really big plus for my senior friends. They also commented on the friendly service and reasonable prices. It didn't surprise me that when it came time for breakfast the last three days, they all voted to come to Butter for breakfast. It's worth noting that we came on a weekday when it's not as busy on the weekend as I've been to the area on the weekend and there always seems to be a line. The only thing keeping it from getting more stars is the hash browns. They're obviously prepackaged or at least taste that way and a real breakfast place should have hash browns, but overall it's a nice addition to the area.

I was very disappointed with my last sauce experience. I ordered a spinach and apple salad with chicken. I think the apples were from a few days ago tasteless and the shredded chicken must have been in the freezer and put on the salad. The kids enjoyed their mac and cheese though, the salad was horrible.

I'm glad this place has a new owner, I should probably delete the review below, it's really harsh and doesn't apply to the new establishment, you have been warned. short review, this place sucks, long review, we were supposed to meet a friend here at Draft House Saturday night. place if you are a hiphop fan all night the crowd is fab in the ghetto all the way it seems like everyone is late early and a few older people scattered in the crowd and no one realizes its no longer expect to hear lots of fake bronx style accents and lots of misuse of slang terms it was entertaining until it got boring oh and people will steal your seats or you will say they are saved the atmosphere small crowded dance floor a few pool tables but don't expect to have one some TVs play various sports which I guess qualifies this place as a sports cafe. The service, we had a beer each and the queue was delayed for minutes leaving no queue in sight, just people crowding together trying to get to the front of the queue, oh and lots, the bartenders are real morons. cokes and i was pissed that he was wrong, weirdos if any of this matters to you it's your place, her friend didn't come and we ended up skipping n fans to play pool o we had a great time there o

these people serve a drink on Saturday, they have daily specials and the Saturday special is solo or three olives. Saturday also has a turkey cheeseburger and fries, but I haven't tried it, you can see all their specials by hovering over the day of the week on their home page. who said maybe there was a wait, at least they have a sense of humor, the upside for us was we got to make our choice. We wanted to see the game. There were two Texas Hold'em poker tables which I didn't like so I don't know the details and saw pool tables in a separate area. The photos on the website make it look like there is also a shuffleboard. I really can't wait to go back. nachos are real cheese nachos and I'm a fake cheese nacho girl so I'll have to choose another dish for game day

I actually yelled at this restaurant from my brunch table and my blackberry didn't post the review, so I'll try to capture the original intensity of the yapping. I still love my blackberry and keep it better than the iPhone, in fact, everyone who knows me appreciates how important toast was in my life when I moved to Phoenix to work for a Catholic hospital. My best friend bought me a Jesus toast stamp that puts an imprint of the Mary which appears best when the bread is toasted, I guess she wanted me to fit in, so when I told my server I was having a bad toast experience and he blew me away, you can imagine the impact. I ordered the oatmeal as well as the basket of toasted willow bread served with a variety of Stella Honey jellies and my oatmeal came out with some buttered bruschetta style toast, which was a plate with a bowl of oatmeal and pieces of bread. I asked for cutlery, then brown sugar and milk, then asked about my basket of willow bread. the waiter said it was the toast that came with your meal, I reminded him of my order and he brought me some jam, I decided to stop complaining, I had made ridiculous requests like being served what I ordered and having utensils, I put jam on the toast and it was literally like they had toasted it in bacon grease during that time, the table next to us, the only other table occupied in the restaurant in the morning on a beautiful Sunday, received their perfectly toasted cranberry walnut sourdough bread with all the fixings I told the waiter I wanted toast like theirs and mine tasted like pork, still vegetarian after years and he still said it's the toast that goes with your meal, my friend was embarrassed so I gave up and left how hard is it to bring a girl a new piece of bread ok now all the anger is stirred up, I have to say my florist is one of my away places on weekdays and their pianist is first of all amazing, she really plays with her soul and her personality comes through in her renditions of the classic songs where I've been there since the toast experience but have my friend arrive first to get the waiter with the ponytail

the music is blaring, it stinks of ridiculously strong cologne masking the insecurity of a young adult male, a guy younger than my little brother is walking around with no shirt on, everything is super overpriced for what you get in the grand tradition of overcompensation and fucking branding, there's a name plastered everywhere, no one is genuine in their efforts to help or capable of making real eye contact and stopping the tests. Pimpercrombie bitch, now I remember why it's been at least ten years since the last time I walked into one of these cesspools of humanity and child labor sweatshops maybe next time I'll wait years, they've been that long

I'm a big fan of Gordon Birch microbrews, it's cool, a little hairy but the atmosphere is great, felt like I was underdressed, I had the seafood cobb which was awesome, they use real crab here, thank goodness the hubs had a big burger, he loved it and he loved the garlic fries, I had the hefeweizen and the hubs had a few schwarzbiers, no bad at all.

Marriott's beds are consistently the most comfortable of any hotel I've stayed in. I would not recommend Marriott Phoenix Airport for an extended stay of more than a week, although overall the hotel is nice and the staff is probably the friendliest I have dealt with in a long time. There is no such thing as a free woman and you would think a chain like Marriott would provide it for free. There are also no refrigerators or microwaves in the rooms.

very unpleasant experience scary sex doctor uncaring and unhelpful I went to this urgent care with a swollen ankle so painful I had nausea dizziness and vision problems the doctor questioned me and advised me to get my head checked I'm not kidding mom was right good doctors don't advertise this place they actually solicit reviews on Yelp
I like Rubies in general but this place is pretty hit or miss in terms of food quality and service. I prefer the one on the other side of the i, next to the cinema.

I always really enjoy coming to Lgo, especially to relax on their terrace with good food and drinks. I love that Go sells raspberries and I love the fast-paced, bustling atmosphere, but the time has come for me to drop a star. I'm a regular at Go and have recently noticed that they seem to regularly run out of some of my favorite items. i know they are busy and i know a restaurant can be sold out but it seems to happen so frequently and every time it's a big disappointment and unfortunately the cookie isn't the only item they are regularly short of lately, i have been having a hard time finding the remade salads which i love too, my other problem just happened and i can't seem to get out of the depression it caused, they no longer serve the green chile mac and cheese seriously when i went Stopped in recently for lunch, I was so disappointed that it was removed from the menu that I thought about going out, I know this seems like a silly reaction to the mac and cheese, but their green chile mac and cheese was by far one of the best dishes I found on their menu. Their sandwiches are tasty but almost impossible to hold together. Their pizzas have great fresh ingredients but always seem to be lacking something and now there's more mac and cheese and they're always out of my cookies, it's a sad, sad day for takeout.
nasty workers and overpriced waste

the service was fast and friendly the mixed drinks are excellent we went on a busy Friday evening and lots of family where there is a man walking around doing balloon tricks the sliding stairs are a good idea for kids the food was ok nothing exceptional the view was amazing it overlooks the whole city

strange layout that makes you think you have the worst table in the house, no matter what table you are at, the servers and general manager stand idly in a mostly empty restaurant while the customers wait and wait, the whole thing feels like the biggest tourist trap on Stetson Avenue, even though the original barrio cafe is a local institution and the prices are actually very reasonable, the food and margaritas were all amazing, but when the front of the house doesn't seem to care if I'm here, I won't come back
Unfortunately, this location is far from friendly or helpful. Try the location near the fry in fountain hills, they are very friendly and helpful.

I either have an extreme love or dislike for this place, more love, although I love good wine with all the different prices which is nice, cool underground atmosphere, great bands and entertainment, great cheese board and flatbreads, good prices, things I don't like the service, are you a bouncer, a bartender, will you take me to a seat, can you find me a seat, it's confusing, the staff is not clearly defined not only do they not wear uniforms or name tags but they are rare and hard to find the mix it's kind of a random mix I guess that can be a good thing but I was there once and it was like spring break in Cabo and then the other time it was like snow bird day either one or the other is fine it's just hard to know when to go and who to bring like my mom or my friends they serve desserts but no coffee it's just strange to me buy a coffee pot it has this amazing fondue that would be great with baileys and coffee and alas no strange coffee I know the wine bar but if you serve coffee dessert should go with it at the end the place is cool and they have some of the best entertainment there the atmosphere is nice get there early to get a seat they are hard to find be wary of paying entertainment fees at the door, but it's worth it.

good ambiance footnote so much I recently ate here for the first time and unfortunately I can't say anything good about the food. I ordered a chicken sandwich and was expecting a hot Middle Eastern sandwich filled with flavorful chicken sautéed with onions and spices and accompanied by fresh, crispy vegetables. What I got was far from what I expected. indistinguishable from a piece of cardboard, they didn't even bother to put salt and pepper on this sorry meat, the rest of the sandwich was raw zucchini, chopped tomatoes, romaine lettuce leaves and a few pieces of red onion, none of the vegetables had been seasoned or seasoned. on cashmere, does your cook even taste what comes out of the kitchen, adds a little flavor to your food, you can start with salt, fresh lemon juice, garlic, pepper and high quality olive oil, it's really not that difficult

I'm not the biggest fast food fan ever but I really like five guys and this place is superb they have really delicious fries and they give you so many like your bag is overflowing with greasy buggers say what yeah they are really greasy but good the burgers are definitely bang for your buck not the best burgers in the world but they are fast food not gourmet burgers be mindful of what you eat and enjoy it for what it is That is, pop machines are radical, you can pretty much flavor any drink you like. the staff here are really friendly and that's a plus wherever you go

I like Bamboo Club but that doesn't seem to bode well for purists, it's a very Americanized version of Chinese food with some dishes that work well and others not so much. I struggle with a fierce addiction to Panda Express so I refer to it from time to time but I feel vindicated this time. The Bamboo Club is like a luxury version of the Panda Express. In fact, their best dish is also the orange chicken, but prepared with much more flavor than their greasy counterparts, it's a bit overpriced considering what semi-glorified mall food they offer. but overall, not bad

I cannot rate their technical service because they never showed up or called to reschedule. I made an appointment with Flores Air and was given a time around noon and we will call ahead. I got a call to and they said they were in the area and could be there in about a few minutes after a while I called them and the man said they were stuck on a job and wouldn't make it. no calls from them, I won't call them again to schedule another one, but customer service is non-existent

unique place you wouldn't stop at unless seriously recommended, it's not the kind of place you drive up to and say oh let's stop there, word of mouth is what I guess is driving this business, we were recommended to visit this place by the artist for the evening. Eyes of a Belly Dancer is not your typical restaurant stop. you like belly dancing and the music was interesting our party opted for the super sampler to start and the eye mix to share I personally like this type of exotic food full of spices not your typical meats my wife didn't necessarily find it good but ate some and didn't complain happy I think the skewer made was the best if you go with a group the eye mix was a great way to try a little bit of everything and was plenty of food for our group of

I went online and looked at the menu and called in order where I informed my brothers that I also had a coupon and was going to get the pepperoni pizza and sampler and they said it would take a few minutes at checkout. I was charged for the sampler. I told the cashier the internet menu had it listed as she just smiled and said oh we have a lot but we don't have a menu I said but it's on the internet with your page addressed and she said though I know we get a lot but here is our menu and she handed me their copier menu which didn't even have the sampler listed I politely told her they should take the menu off the internet if it was not correct, the sampler was wing pieces, mushrooms, cheese sticks, zucchini, the sampler was like generic frozen little pieces out of the freezer bag, fried near my house and our family had hoped to make this our weekly outing for pizza, but I will go elsewhere for better food and prices. better, they can learn a lot from their customers

I went here a few months ago and I guess when they first opened in the fall, maybe I'm vegan anyway, so I asked about their vegan options, they said almost everything was made with lard, I didn't know people still used it, but they said they had a vegan burrito. cheese, I was so angry because I was assured it was vegan and didn't come with cheese, but even worse I think they started putting cheese on the burrito and then realized it was supposed to be the vegan burrito without cheese and they just chose the cheese they could remove and left the cheese they couldn't easily remove there. On the other hand he seems to like this place, he gave it stars, he said it was a good place for fatty Mexicans and on Wednesdays you can get a huge burrito for only dollars.

I play squash rackets, a sport favored by the elites of the East Coast, Ivy League schools, those arrogant Brits and the Pakistani leisure class, happy to know why they let me play, I'll never know. Happy last night we had a little tournament where a group of us from the village traveled to the outskirts of Tempe to play against a Lifetime fitness group, happy it was a good show lots of fun and our village group gave the Lifetime group a little cheer, so it was with happy hearts and good humor that we headed down the street to the post-tournament meal at Skip Janet's. I started off by saying that the Lifetime group picked this place and it's almost like they knew they were going to lose and wanted to select a place that would be the dirtiest, dirtiest, dirtiest, most disgusting place to try and make it on earth. just driving into the parking lot, I didn't see much traffic from the crowd of MercedesBMWLEXUSJAGUARs and I may never be happy again After safely parking a block or so away, I walked in and admired the look and feel of old wood paneled tables and chairs from a high school cafeteria, an intriguing mix of regular flat screen TVs and score screens orbs yeah you can bet the ponies here are playing kings in a slightly less than royal atmosphere glad they must have a pool the tables are faded leland a whole group of people playing pool and frankly looking like they're not having fun extremely tight and serious expressions on the faces of the people playing and watching are not games meant to be fun happy i suspect there was some gambling going on happy the smell so can only be described as a extreme humanity few people within earshot did they do it so quickly so they have menus they have some sort of kitchen they have Jagermeister on tap they have a bunch of beers on tap and they had a buffet or swag for my friend Ryan C set up for our group it was supposed to be a happy taco bar so I provided a table full of taco fixins the centerpiece was the hot platter of taco meat what the fuck was so disgusting and sad that they told us it was ground beef but I know my beef and I don't think it was it was a land creature, perhaps some sort of unfortunate, indistinct animal that happened to be near the kitchen when duty called, of course as far as I know it was indeed the beefiest beef, not very good, sad, the hot tray holding the meat looked like a relief map of the Hawaiian Islands. everyone was trying to fish meat out of the brine and using tongs instead. The idea was to try to extract as much fat as possible from the concoction, but in doing so I probably also extracted any flavor. Sad, I returned to the table and tried a nice trinket, added several shakes of cholla and tried another bite. with the wings, but the wing I tried seemed to be boiled, no, not grilled, then dipped in crispy buffalo sarcenet, we will be happy, then they announced that the karaoke was going to start sonant, that was sad enough for me, adding amateur singing to this picture would have been too happy, but it's not all bad. adversity can make teams grow together, so I think I should thank him for making the almost invincible village squash group happy

I had very high hopes for this place after the very good reviews Destiny received and this sense, but I was terribly disappointed that the mango and papaya spring rolls were overpowered by the aniselico flavor. The she mai balls were so hard that even the most hardcore Italian would have said they were too dense. The black dragon chicken was good but not great after we left. try after the lunch I had here as far as atmosphere and decor, don't even get me started on trying too hard to be hip the Vegas blue lighting in the bar the northwest cafe style overlooking the couch in the back the Asian influence I'm not a fan of matchymatchy decor but it was everywhere the service was just okay too I won't be back anytime soon

I ate here after eating at the one in San Diego several times. I was a little disappointed, the place was pretty depressing and slow, but I was there on a Tuesday overall the food wasn't that good. inventive dishes I highly recommend things that look like breaded chicken thighs but are really filled with mushrooms this stuff is tasty
bankrupt

years ago and I mean years ago their location on Mill Avenue in Tempe was exceptional because they expanded the food and the total experience got significantly worse. Why did this happen, they do franchises, I suggest a name change, my big Greek disappointment

I've been to Buffalo Wild Wings before, but my first visit to this location was during UFA. If you're coming here to watch fighting events like UFA, I'd recommend arriving hours before the main card starts if you want an inside seat. I arrived an hour before the ppm portion of the fight started and didn't get a seat until half an hour later and it was outside. minimum cover or bill for the fight also the atmosphere for a ufa fight was really good compared to the other arc I went to in Tucson if you want a place with a good atmosphere for a sporting event you should come bow but your food expectations should be lowered considerably
very dated but clean good for an overnight stop on a road trip free coffee in the morning cookies in the evening tiny bathroom

if you like Houston it's like a scary cousin to Houston that's not entirely true it's Blizzard Houston the food is just disgusting I didn't like anything you get a ton of flyers none of it is good I had the pork tenderloin which was disgusting I ended up sending the meat back and just ate the mashed potatoes with the gravy. colleagues went there too and there were no positive comments about it

my boyfriend and I tried this place last year and didn't go back because the food really wasn't spectacular, they weren't really that hot, the price is a bit high because there is a restaurant with the same name on Southern and Dowson that serves much better food for less, the decor was really tacky and they should paint over the wall mural, it doesn't appeal to their clientele finally the staff was not nice

was it worth it for a salad and a small pizza absolutely not bad service maybe the guys grandma died i don't know i want to tell you what really made me crazy about the experience we ordered the small pizza and the salad and the guys didn't care and took our and we sat down we were looking around and hmm there is a sign saying x large pizza and large salad only wow that would have been nice if the guy had told us i left hungry mad and dissatisfied the owner, teach your employees the value of upwelling and tell the promotions something this small can negatively affect a customer's experience and your salads are very expensive, I won't go back unless I'm desperate

I finally tried the Sucker Punch Sally today and I think it's promising, they're still on the small opening menu so the choices for lunch were limited, but I had the pork tenderloin sandwich and I have to say I was impressed, obviously homemade and not frozen. Good size portion and very tasty almost like a German schnitzel. The fries were solo. I don't care much for fresh cut fries because they are usually limp like these. was very friendly if you live in the area and have thought about it give them a try

my boyfriend and I were so excited to learn that there was a yogurt shop, we were even more excited to learn that they stay open until summer, we are real night owls so we were more than ready to enjoy the late hours, unfortunately we have passed by there several times now and each time they have already collected the stools and chairs and the few times we ignored the signs and went in anyway we felt less than welcome if you want to close at nine and then close at nine and also very frustrated with the lack of water availability. I believe they don't offer free cups to quench your thirst, it's definitely not worth it, it's definitely not a place we feel like we can go to detox and relax at the end if the day is as we hoped.

the parking situation is seriously ridiculous if you can walk, bike, a bus it's not worth the energy effort otherwise another inconvenience if you're not doing numbers you don't plan on buying anything here, seriously nothing lends itself to regular people except maybe the borders outside of the dining options.
absolutely horrible, this post office will lose your mail repeatedly by laughing in your face, lying about it, blowing it up, making it look like it's your fault and making you wish you had sent it

This is the first Springhalt suite I have stayed in. The service was good. The hotel was clean. The room was big enough to work in nothing special. The fitness room was small but it was nice because I was the only one using it.

if you go out drinking beer the papago brewery in the same mall is a much better choice but if you are looking for a real bar with booze and beer the British Open definitely not a big fan of the food except the typical greasy pub fried pickles, darts and pool tables and a good jukebox service is usually pretty good every time I've been there very dark and it's definitely a bar neighborhood.

taco bellpizza hut combo on dowson and typical southern taco bell food and service lunch is very busy at this location as it is walking distance to mic pima medical institute banner desert hospital and billion apartment complexes parking is easy but this mall is very difficult to get in or out during peak hours

the guy working at the front door sunday night deserves to be fired, it was tough, not at all a supervisor had heard how he treated my friend, he would have agreed if we stopped in the car, it looks good from the outside so we send one of the five of us to assess it, check the menu to see if there is seating and normal behavior so my friend K approaches the guy at the door and asks him what kind of food is served here while waiting for a simple answer like american or here let me get you a menu ready for this, his answer human food human food human food k is just an average potential customer asking a pretty easy question to answer, okay being the sweetie, does she go with it, he is a Melanie and asks if there is any seating outside, he mocks sarcastically and downright poorly points out that there is a seat yourself, signs right next to it, how has this guy ever been hired again, a more appropriate answer tool, happy, would have been yes, the patio seems to have room tonight and I'd be happy to go check it out for you or at this fine establishment, it's seating you, but usually the outside turns around quickly on Sunday evening, nice joke machine at the front door, I could happily give you several other decent answers that you could have said to an innocent customer, everyone and their mother has ever been a waiter, hostess, manager, bartender and and in the food and hospitality industry, whether in one location or elsewhere and knows the rule is to be nice to the customer, the customer is always right and to add to this list, answer simple questions from your guests with answers without acrimony granted, this review cannot say anything about this establishment beyond the front door because we have never gone that far

I really wasn't impressed with the pizza here, it's conveniently located but never very busy, although it's conveniently located near a bar, even on a Friday night, cheap slices and easy in and out, but of the many people I know who frequent this area, none of them have really ever eaten there.

it gets all three stars for the view for the prices charged, the food should be so much better and the choice is very limited, but if you're trying to impress a date and aren't too hungry it's a very romantic place

I've had lunch here a few times, the only thing I've tried is the drunken noodles although I think they're pretty decent. I had serious problems finding the right spices the first time I bought them. I asked for the spice level. the second time I ordered them I asked for a spicy level this time they weren't spicy at all they were so bland I mean they still tasted good but they were missing that drunken noodle kick so at this point I don't know what to do obviously every cook must have a different idea of what each number means last time I ordered here I just said drunken noodles I didn't specify a spicy level, i thought maybe this would give me the perfect spicy entre that i so desired when i got them, they were more bland than the level and it was a bit weird, i'm going to give them another try since they are right across the street from my work and i hope we can resolve our spicy issues, stars for service they are really friendly here, stars for food until we can resolve our issues and stars for convenience.
It's a pain to get in and out, I dread every trip I have to make to this place

I met some friends last night at the Cadillac ranch and it was my first time there. The space has a very odd layout but there are two bars, one inside and one outside on the patio and both have plenty of TVs to watch. There is also a very cliché mechanical bull but unfortunately or perhaps fortunately, no one rode it while I was there. that or something would have been missing the two waiters just didn't coordinate very well, luckily we weren't in a rush and were a pretty laid back group. I only ate the Cadillac salad, a mix of tomatoes, cheese and croutons and it was a good size though and maybe it's just a pet peeve but I hate when restaurants put the dressing on for you, I prefer it to come on the side like it does at almost every restaurant I've been to so I can put as much as I want, I've tried a few. my friends got fries and they were greasy and for the fries they were actually quite light as a note for groups they put an automatic tip on the bill it's not the standard most other places do overall I wouldn't recommend this place as a lunch or dinner destination as I wasn't impressed with the menu or entree prices which seemed high for what they were but the three stars I give to cadillac ranch are for their happy hour servants import bottles of fat tires flavored vodka drinks smirnoff margaritas rum captain morgan vodka martinis is a selection of starters, there are about four or five, I'm always happy when I can get Stella drafts cheap, also according to the bartender one of the margaritas they serve can only be purchased a maximum of times by one person because it is so strong.

after hearing for years that it was the best breakfast in town I finally checked it out now I've been there twice and I just don't get it I didn't find anything special about this place it's a lovely breakfast place and the pancakes and waffles are well the pancakes and waffles both times I went we had to wait to be seated and both times I didn't feel it was worth it hardly, in my opinion the easy matte breakfast palette is so much better, of course your mileage may vary

maybe I'm ordering the wrong things but I've always been disappointed with restaurant food, the service was great and I really love being able to dine al fresco in the morning, but does everything have to be dipped in butter flavored crisco?

I came out here this evening with a few customers who I had heard good things about it and they were from the back east so I figured why not, I have to admit I wasn't very impressed with it all. We came here for dinner. the taste of my steak was butter and not meat.
