I almost had to look for a sauce, a cardinal sin in my mind with steak just to make it edible, as we all had a round of golf in the morning. None of us opted for the giant liter beer option they had, but the liquor selection, including wine, was pretty impressive. I opted for the Bull Ride, a nice little touch that gave this place that little something extra to set it apart from other places in Old Town, all things considered I don't think I'll come back here, I can get a better steak at a chilistype place and the atmosphere of mostly your young Scottsdaletypes didn't really do much for me. day

Pei Wei is always busy, that must mean something good, there are restaurants that serve billions and yet everything they serve is a gross mystery. Pei Wei is not a mystery even though the food is cooked in an outdoor kitchen, although if there was an Asian fast food restaurant, Pei Wei would be a cleaner version of it. if you live in America and have American taste buds you will like this unfortunately if you want authentic Asian food you won't find it at Pei Wei, I don't even understand why they even bother putting chopsticks on the table, the rice isn't even sticky enough to pick it up, they are for decoration, they are part of the fake Asian dining experience, apparently Pei Wei serves Canadian style food from Thailand, Vietnam, Japan, Korea and China, in the words of Bill Lumber oo yeah, I'm just I'm not sure about that, after traveling to China I can honestly tell you that Chinese food is different except for rice, the food lacks vegetable oil and garlic in China, these two ingredients are used in many dishes and Pei Wei lacks it when I started visiting Pei Wei. should be dry and what was missing was a catalyst to bring out the spicy flavors and make them more vibrant. Pei Wei's dishes are family style, meaning they are meant to be shared with multiple people. A dish and a drink will end up costing you about if each person gets a dish which is probably enough food to feed a small village in Africa somewhere. out to lunch with people from work, you may not want to share your food with your coworkers, they are not your family, you don't know them. Pei Wei is a modern Asian restaurant that is probably better than most Asian restaurants, although most of the dishes are prepared by maxi, I mean Asians.

the food is ok the pad thai is mediocre the happy hour is very cool baby suburbs around this joint it is attached to the chandler fashion center so it is busy almost all the time the happy hour specials are just ok the drink specials are quite expensive with little taste and even less alcohol and i hate happy hours you can only enjoy in the bar the patio is the perfect place for him and it is noisy not only with insipid chatter but with the constant scraping of the meat chairs on concrete it sounds like I'm being picky but it's one of those sounds that gives you goosebumps and kills your mood instantly, over and over again, anyway, if you're a grand comer and want everyone to know this is the place for you.

we went on a Saturday night and the place was completely dead there was only one other couple in the entire restaurant section very nice decor but the food was mediocre at best the only reason this place gets stars is because the service was exceptional

I was a big fan of this place but it was just ok this time a group of us went there and I ordered their steak for two ounces I thought it might be good it was dry and had no flavor she had asked at first do you guys want one I said no thanks a good steak shouldn't need sauce I should have asked for a ton just an egg we also had their artichoke which was in not too bad I love the one they make at the cheesecake factory if you combine the two you have the ultimate smoked artichoke everyone was ok with their meal and one of my friends loved his he had the chicken fried steak I can't really spoil that I guess it was pretty good I'm going back but I'm not the fan I was of this place

the pastrami tasted good but had a lot of tough tissue and was almost impossible to bite into the rye bread was loquacity the curly fries were tasty the coleslaw was delicious really the highlight of the meal the lemon bar was delicious if a little understated I like lemon for wrinkling my face the brownie was warm and chocolatey but too many nuts probably my only visit unless someone invited me
the cheese breadsticks were delicious, everything else not so much

Yard House seems like a good place to meet a group of people because of their wide selection of beers on the menu and their chat-friendly atmosphere. This place can get crowded so depending on when you go be prepared to wait, I'm not usually into chain restaurants that much but I've been to yard house more than a handful of times and it's pretty consistent so I don't mind going there every once in a while, thing is I now have a favorite item on the menu is the miso iced bar when we went there the other night they were out. too bad, our server was good, not the friendliest, but he took good care of us, we were a group and I wasn't the only one planning to order the tea bags. My aunt and I were both disappointed, but what can you do? I ended up with the shrimp and vegetable teriyaki bowl and my aunt went with the tuna tartare appetizer and damaged the others at the table. The manager Clem came over to apologize for running out of tea bags which was appropriate, we obviously knew it wasn't his fault but the gesture was kind thinking of writing this review. I have to say I lingered between and the stars I ended up giving just because the court house became just another chain restaurant in my eyes, nothing special, the same thing every time, just plain old average, sure I'll come back for group meals but I won't be rushing out on my own or on a date anytime soon, go get a beer, go see a game, go listen to a classic. rock and have an average meal and if you like tea bags and they are in stock go for it

apart from the chips and the salsa stars for the salsa the food is good but not so much that I go out of my way to eat there the fajitas are delicious with mushrooms and the meat always tender but the price makes me cringe there there are so many other places I prefer to eat I usually opt for a cheese crisp with green onions and green peppers and a side of guacamole which is always delicious but expensive and I still pay for all that in plus whatever we drink I love the overly rustic atmosphere but it could really use an update and maybe a good cleaning, some of the servers aren't the friendliest but they are mostly family members who work there and have been there forever so don't take it personally but overall it's a Scottsdale landmark that's fun to take out of the towers and the food is overall good.

so I ventured out here today for a quick little browse hoping to see what was on sale, I figured nothing in these economic times could be too expensive, they had a lot of their items at full price much to my disdain but I was pleasantly surprised to find a large bin on cushions as I personally needed them and I bought super cute ones for each originally yeah, a great deal so I was a happy camper, I even found two that matched that weren't damaged, the score they were making for Christmas so it was a little confusing but they there was some cute Halloween stuff but it was weird, half the stuff was scored and half wasn't, it was so confusing I just passed. I don't like the guessing game, either mark the season or not swim at all, although a typical pier except how disjointed everything was, it was hard to find things and they just don't have the pretty furniture sets like they were sad.

it's not hard to find a steakhouse in scottsdale modern steaks schtick is that it is indeed modern in the sense that it's not in a room full of dark oak with overcrowded booths unfortunately, but modern also means it's in a strip mall ugh pretty efficient otherwise brusque service with pretty decent food I had the salmon with maple bacon glaze it's a bit of a weird combo I'm not sure the salmon really holds up under such a sweet glaze but you can't complain too much anytime bacon is involved happy

I had business downtown this morning so stopped here for lunch right around the corner from where I used to go in Newport Beach back in the 90's. I was a little amazed they were still there, there is one in Phoenix that comes in, it's the most junk restaurant I've ever been to except maybe bazooka grog ribs, it's a big place with soft lighting inside rooms everywhere filled with tons of barrels of furniture, so cluttering up all of them, this is all on purpose, of course, my booth in the middle of all this madness was actually quite ok, the floor elevation is up and down everywhere too, so for the first time in about years I just ordered the classic pasta, rich meat sauce which is their way of saying spaghetti, good stuff. I started with a cup of coffee, it was excellent. a cup of whipped garlic butter all on a bread board with a proper knife for cutting it was great a few things less wonderful a girl from the kitchen brought my spaghetti before I was finished with my salad I thought the spaghetti sauce was ok but not great in the end they give you a lot to eat here my meal included the salad drink or soup the hot bread as a starter dessert it was good filling good value for money for everything happy rosemead ca formerly also west corina

Sometimes the downside of yapping is that you read so many good reviews for a new restaurant and you get very high expectations. That's what happened at Saint-François anyway, our bartender was not friendly at all, the dessert was very good, but I hope next time the service will be better. Sometimes you just surprise people on an off night.

If I had written this review before an incident in September it would easily be stars. The bartenders were awesome. One evening, I was carrying a big trophy. Why, because I own one, I put it on the bar to order beer and they asked me if I wanted a drink or if I wanted them to put it in the trophy. kicked out of bars for drinking said trophy before and it was the first time I had a bartender who was so cool every time I heard the bar staff were very rock even when they are extremely busy I think I ate here once so I'm not going to comment on that but I am here when they switch from neighborhood bar mode to dance bar mode if you are at a table still eating at that time they have no qualms about moving your table if you have lucky they will tell you about it first its a good place to watch football etc. could maybe use a little more music from the tv nothing special it's your typical dance set you'd expect at any college dance bar since the crowd is often recent grads this suits the bar well I don't normally include bouncers in my reviews but after what I saw the last time I was there it affects my opinion of the place and is the reason the place doesn't get any stars that if you kick someone out and they leave peacefully, there is no reason to put your hands on them other than maybe to keep them from falling, so when I see a bouncer aggressively push a guy who raised his hands in surrender and in the process the bouncer knocks over a girl who hasn't done anything wrong, that's just not cool, maybe it's just me, but I think someone who works for the bar should pick her up off the ground instead of almost stomping on her to help the bouncer who put her there while kicking out someone who doesn't give them any resistance on the way out

I can get over the hipster sneer and accept that I'm an uncool flaw in a world full of cutoff corduroys and patterned leggings. What I can't and won't forget is an unapologetic staff whose epic mistake led me to break years of meatless eating because of an ordering mishap. I ordered the Tomato and Red Pepper Quiche after minutes of waiting for the quiche to warm up in what appeared to be a degree oven. I took a bite first, a wave of nausea and panic washing over me after realizing it was a piece of Bacon and Spinach Quiche. I went back to the counter and explained that I had ordered the vegetarian quiche and the chic who took my order asked the chic behind the counter which one she was serving because she was sure she understood correctly. I'm out of it, thanks, I told her I was more upset that I had just put bacon in my mouth after years of no meat than the fact that there was no more quiche, she gave me my money back but no one apologized or offered me a reward.

I'll put it this way, this place is not worth lunch for two two burgers an order of fries a manhattan a beer with a tip nice little place but hard to justify the cost the burgers were ok but not worthy of praise the glass seemed untouched with the manhattan although what was there was tasty if you like to spend too much this place is good if you are more value oriented avoid it

the theater is very nice the seats are not as comfortable as you would think they have like office chairs in every other row and the food is not good and it's so overpriced did you know it costs a dollar to put onions on your hamburger you want cheese that costs another dollar and it's not even good the screen is wonderful and a sharp picture although it was great

I had dinner here last Friday night, I know it's considered one of the best Chinese restaurants, but I'm struggling with the star rating. The registration pot stickers were good. Potty stickers are actually pretty stuffed. My husband's shrimp dish was good too but the broccoli that sounded in the dish could have been cooked a little longer, it was pretty much raw, the table was a little sticky, ultimately I felt I could go to another Chinese restaurant and have a similar meal, maybe Tao would be slightly better or Tao is slightly worse.

I have heard nothing but good things about the food and atmosphere at this restaurant chain. I loved the look of this place inside and out. Stunning rustic barrels and old barber chairs in the bar gave a unique look. The service was friendly and the fast food was not very desirable. The salad was just iceberg lettuce and I got a strain with shredded red cabbage. My pasta dish was spaghetti with white clam sauce. prices are good, it's not worth a subpar meal. The husband was also disappointed with his chicken marsala. The chances of returning there are slim to none.

when I'm on vacation I try to go to restaurants, I try to avoid chains because what's the point of eating local food when I walked in I realized I had been to the one in Long Beach even though the menu was completely different or maybe it was the late night menu but it was decidedly more southwest, well it had been several years and it was pretty late at night so it didn't matter at that point I ordered the green pork toscana which the waiter assured me was very small and the toscana hot wings were huge what a liar yes I treated him to his face I ate a few bites and finished the wings I would have the toscana cold and frozen in the morning before flying off surprisingly the flavors were locked in that way and acceptable as a scarf party minute oh and my vodka tonic was very good not bad and I kind of dug our bench of picnic style high table

save your money and go to kyoto bowl our waiter gave us our metal bowls then pampered my family like we were kids they have all the waiters follow us to queue for the self service buffet they stand there like you are getting out of the line you are bad weird meanwhile the waiter keeps talking about their food and what they have so when you get to the buffet the choices are very limited and the food is so full of fluff you can't put a lot of food in some of them it's supposed to be like sushi isn't cooked but like you put it in a bowl it's cooked with everything else oh yeah and the place is loud you'll have to sit elbow to elbow to hear your family. The new thing about this place is that you can watch the cooks cook your dismal amount over an open fire oven. the price of a bowl if I had preferred to go to Taco Bell

I graduated from Marinello at the end of August and let me tell you I was happy to get out of there as the professors were very knowledgeable in their craft. The curriculum and administration were far from desirable when I first visited the school and started classes in January. I was promised a lot of things to learn, one of them being makeup classes, and to this day they don't have those classes available at the school and those were really big reasons why I wanted to go. There was also a lot of drama in the middle of my schooling, there were several administrators. they left a teacher and they changed everything we were used to, they started focusing on advertising instead of having students use the products and it often happened that school products disappeared that had not disappeared before the change of administration. Besides those things the school is fine, at least it will teach you what you need to know to be an esthetician in the state, but I definitely wouldn't go back and I definitely wouldn't recommend anyone to go there, be sure to look at other schools before deciding what is best for you.

seriously the most pathetic burger I have ever eaten at the level of a burger king or other with tip, I paid for the burger and fries what a waste and they even managed to get the order wrong, a buffalo burger that had no buffalo sauce on it when I told the waiter he compensated by bringing a small cup of pathetic oi sauce

I was looking for Ellen's Chili and this place does a great job making them the way I like it, flavorful and not dry, they also had chips and salsa which I didn't think was anything special and you have to order them unlike most Mexican places where you are expected to serve the drinks. The flan was not impressive.

I ordered a cappuccino my typical order at a new place and it was very good with a cute heart on the top that made me smile the espresso was perfect and required no sweetener I also had a blueberry muffin which wasn't very good maybe it was low fat or something but I'm very picky about pastries anyway my biggest problem with this place is the fact that they don't have no bathroom, the coffee makes me pee and when I found out about this and I had to walk to the baby gap because the place next door with a bathroom wasn't open yet, requiring me to pack up my computer and leave my drink and food unattended, it was a bit unwanted, I know it's a mall type area, but it still surprised me for a place to drink and eat, it doesn't set the tone for a place to hang out a lot of time, which may be their intention too. I love John Mayer but they played his same songs over and over maybe mixing them up or putting on a Pandora station would be better the staff was nice and they have a free lady I will come back for the espresso but I will make it go away

Horrible and non-existent customer service which is a shame considering they have good pizza. I ordered quart pizza wings and extra ranch an hour later the delivery guy showed up with pizza and wings when I told him the order wasn't complete he just rolled his eyes and rudely informed me that their online order was messed up then shoved the pizza and wings at me without apologizing or offering to correct the mistake. I immediately called the store to make sure I would be credited for my messed up order which the delivery person made no attempt to correct I asked for the manager when they answered the girl who answered said to someone in the background without putting me on hold so I heard every word someone wants a manager I guess it's you the manager told him he didn't have time to talk to customers and started yelling at him about all the work he had to do on Friday, my friends, customers are the reason you are in business, so it would be a good idea to make some time for them. The poor girl came back on the phone after being totally berated by the manager and I told her what happened with my order. She offered to credit my card for the order. The only problem is that the processing takes hours. rudely she agreed apologetically, I asked for the owner's contact information if it was my business I would like someone to let me know if my employees treated customers like dirt, she couldn't provide the contact information but offered to call someone named Frank and have him call me back to resolve the situation. I never received a call. Apparently customers aren't important.

a huge disappointment, I was looking forward to arriving in Kiruna and having what I thought was going to be an experience for all the good food service and times spent once on the ground, a dark joke was on me and my friends, I would give the service star, but because a few dishes were very tasteful I give two stars, the waiter was nice but not from the service industry, he called us guys, I wasn't on the beach and he wasn't wearing a swimsuit, no need dude he knelt on the bench of the table right behind us basically breathing down my neck when he talked disgusting he never asked us how the food was even though we were only touching pieces of squid saturated in oil and in desperate need of a few squeezes of lemon he took away dishes that we hadn't finished with the food was good some dishes were excellent and some were not good at all the romeo sauce served with the croquettes was delicious I could have eaten just a side of the sauce alone it has just enough spice and the flavors were perfect on the trout was another delicious dish the fish was cooked to perfection and everything on the plate hit the palette in all the right places the squid was horrible they were over fried and instead of serving with a lemon wedge they were served with a citrus aioli the concept would have been great if it had worked with the dish even after taking the lemon from my water and having it pressed on the plate it wasn't appetizing if you check them out online and want to go try them for happy hour sit at the bar maybe on the patio I didn't ask but we were seated in the dining room and then told the menu was only available at the bar no big deal but not the best way to attract repeat customers the space itself is very nicely decorated it was cozy and had lots of details which worked well with the rest of the decor overall I think they did a great job with the space if they tweaked a few things with some food items they could make it a lot better and as far as service contrary to popular belief just because you are in Scottsdale doesn't mean your staff should wear Ed Hardy t-shirts and call customers dude

my love for sushi she introduced me to it and i have to be critical so many students love ra but it's mediocre at best i'll just list a few things that irritate me i went there during a happy hour with coworkers it was packed good thing good bad extremely poor service when i went to meet coworkers who already had a table the hostess told me i had to wait when i said i had a table she put me in my face I was tired on Monday and wanted to relax I walked past her found my friends and she left me alone, the waitress took quite a while to get to my table and the sushi portions were obviously small. I went to zen and now my choice is sakebomber. Their happy hour portions are way more than that and their prices are better. price so high

I will have to agree vehemently and have informed the principal as well. I chose this one because it was close to the airport and the light rail, the noise from the airport was bad, but it was the train horns all night and morning. When you were trying to sleep I wouldn't choose this one, the neighborhood wanted bad despite what people say but the train noise is just unbearable. I got it for the click through rate which was reasonable, stay elsewhere.

My boyfriend and I were on vacation in Arizona for a wedding. The food was better than an average deli and they also give you a free cookie with your order. It's a shame they don't have them at the malls near me, although I read on their website that they had one at the Galleria, which would have been nice when I lived in Davis, CA for college shopping.

I'm a big fan of chicken and waffles and will try it just about anywhere it's served. I especially like it in the morning, when everyone orders a light breakfast. Expect me to go there for the fried chicken solos, it was just fine for me. I liked the chicken but didn't like the waffles. finger on the taste, I liked the atmosphere, but probably won't come back, I know Mrs Whites Golden Rule cafe isn't for everyone, but honestly I prefer the feel there, it feels less affected by its customers. I guess for some reason I'm having a hard time finding the words here, but I very much feel like it's Mrs Whites more popular cousin, you know the one with the letter in football, either way I'm glad the solos are thriving, maybe I'll try Scottsdale sometime to see if they have another spin on things

Let's start with a subtype question. Scottsdale Stadium at the Park is like the Oakland Coliseum. An Oakland like Brickey Henderson c Phoenix Municipal Stadium d Yankee Stadium if you answered c, my friend, you're right and you're pretty smart too. Give yourself a pat on the back, much like the Oakland Coliseum. Phoenix Mini won't amaze you with state-of-the-art facilities, breathtaking views or spectacular nightlife nearby. What you get here is a simple, functional annual ballpark that serves its purpose, the crowds. here they are much smaller than you would encounter at other parks but it fits people comfortably, unless you are in the premium indoor seats you will be sitting on the aluminum benches or on the grassy mound, pick your poison so to speak, we still have the indoor seats because you can sit in rows behind home plate, I don't care about the bad economy, it is a good deal even if you sit directly behind home plate you will probably have a hard time getting see the small, outdated scoreboard screen in the centerfold, there are no fancy food choices at Phoenix Mini if you're not intimidated by the huge wieners, a footling hot dog might be for you, believe me when I say you won't be able to eat more than two, no matter how much you like hot dogs, I'm also a fan of the small dining area near the left field foul pole, you can sit there at a table with a giant umbrella, hide from the sun and sip your drink of choice if you're lucky you can even watch the game from some of these seats. The people who work here from the ushers to the concession stand clerks are incredibly nice, they really want to make sure you have a good time at the game and that goes to show that parking here is very easy because you can park in the lot right across the street, the lot is rarely full and you can almost always find a spot. I have heard that there are ways to find free parking if you are willing to walk a little more but why would you want to know though that the walk from the parking lot in front of the ballpark will take you about a few minutes, there is no crosswalk on the street and you have to use this ridiculous pedestrian bridge that they put up for the sole purpose of annoying most baseball fans so star for good seats star for cheap parking star for horrible scoreboard star for the pedestrian bridge ask for stars

being a creature of habit every time I want good sushi I go to Tokyo lobby and my group wanted to branch out and try something new so we opted for Banana, not a fan and what shocks me is that this place was packed, the restaurant opens Saturday and we arrived around and were lucky to get the last table open. I don't understand. Messy buns that all tasted the same. mushy mess that was hard to eat tempura bland no bueno I did however have a very good tuna poke salad but I wouldn't go back just for that if you want good sushi on the west side or the whole valley for that matter say no to banana and yes to Tokyo lobby

I met some friends here for lunch, the menu is a weird mix of Italian, Mexican and American foodies, it's almost like they can't figure out what kind of restaurant they want to be in. I ordered the cheese enchiladas, which was probably the wrong choice in a non-medical restaurant, but I didn't feel anything else. otherwise, by accident they prepare a fresh plate for me, my enchiladas finally arrive and look like they fell off the plate. I take a bite and guess what they were barely warm. ask someone they took them off the bill but it really should have been done automatically since the other people at my table had finished eating before I even got mine. The decor is strange too, it's like they're trying to be a sports bar, but maybe they're not sure, as evidenced by the plasma TV sitting in the corner, still in their boxes, if I have any say I won't be back to judge

this place was so bad on so many levels I don't even know where to begin our server kept calling me honey and seemed to be in such a hurry she wouldn't stop and listen to me you know how needy I can be and I need to be listened to too and I heard we started by ordering the baked spinach and artichoke dip. completely inedible, I sent it back and she didn't even offer to bring another one, maybe it was because they were so busy they just wanted the food out so I ordered their famous ribs, I hate to complain too much but they were old ribs maybe a day or before the pork took on a funky taste when its in the fridge for too long, the texture of the meat when you could find it was like jerky, I happily ate my delicious creamed star spinach and didn't eat more than the bones of the ribs when the waitress came to clear the plates, she never checked on us, she asked me if I was full, I told her the ribs weren't to my taste, she smiled and asked if I wanted dessert, I would never come back to Don and Charlies, other than the creamed spinach that I can prepare it myself, there weren't many redeeming qualities, too bad because it's so close to home I don't understand because the yips are so good, maybe they were having a bad night, it was so bad I would never go back to find out.

this place is not that great shogun express has much better teriyaki chicken rice bowls and beyond chicken that's what really bothered me here it was really tough and extremely chewy and it was the white meat they are around dollar bowls which i like but they aren't even filled to the top overall i came here because shogun express was closed and there are no other places for the rice bowls in Scottsdale that I know eh
not bad not super great my coffee rumba burrito was ok the line moved a little slowly but the employees were nice

This place is the least shower filled club in downtown Scottsdale. It's a huge club and in a way it's like a flagship store in a mall like Dullards or Ja Penny. You can get a little bit of everything you want in one place. It has its share of plastics and douchebags, but there are also a number of students who venture far from Tempe to go dancing. it's pretty cool if you can afford the fee, they have the required logo dancers with giant boots on some nights and they often feature good local talent. I haven't had to wait in line to go here in years because I always get invited to go, I think if I had to wait in line I just don't go, don't buy a girl a drink, apparently this place attracts pretty homeless drunks when it gets dark, these girls need jobs not tit jobs that have already been covered up. Myst is big enough that you can go there and manage to find a good time, the drinks are a bit pricey but that's to be expected in the area, it's a one stop shop for all your drinking, dancing and scamming needs. You are also very close to a large number of other small clubs of the same type. If Myst doesn't happen, one of the best parts is that it's across the street from a pizza place near the slice that stays open after hours just to feed the drunk idiots so they can sober up for the ride home. you'll probably either see a fight break out, some drunk chick throwing up on her hair or someone crying over something stupid, you'll also see everyone under the fluorescent lights not looking their best, the shine and polish is gone from their outfit and the product in their hair is gone and the girls' makeup gave up a long time ago and they're too drunk to suck in that gut or push out that chest, it's a lot of fun yeah, Myst is a good place to go if you want to go boxed in Scottsdale, send your out of town. friends here, locals who aren't into the scene will hate it, I kinda do it

I was so looking forward to having breakfast here, what a disappointment, the food is the only thing that gives stars. Good ingredients cannot be completely ruined by incompetent service. The space is nice but crowded and noisy. Counter staff were indifferent after being waved to an open register. The guy behind the counter took an order then walked away, leaving the rest of us to wait in line at the other register to order. your food to be delivered except the napkins are at a completely different station than the money they were out of forks and most of the tables were completely dirty. I watched a waiter randomly swipe the top of a table sweeping crumbs off the benches and chairs, then leave an empty drink bottle on the table before casually walking away. they happen to be out of numbers then they type in your name with your order nothing annoys me more than having my name shouted in a restaurant better yet the waiters wander from table to table looking for their customers lisa is there a lisa here while your food is getting cold inexcusable the only positive the croquet madame was tasty delicious ham bread and a perfectly fried egg but the meager trace of béchamel and a thin slice of cheese was disappointing however the side fruit made me angry a very small metal a creamer with blackberry a few slices of strawberry and pieces of green apple insulting fast casual order at the counter works well when the tables are clean and set and the food delivery is quick and efficient unfortunately this place needs some work to make it worthwhile

I'm not a woman and I don't read celebrity magazines at the gym, so I'm not sure I'm really the qualified demo for this place. Still, despite all the hype and hyperbole, it's a good cupcake when the olive oil and vanilla cupcakes from the olive oil mill are too far gone, it becomes the backup of the cupcake, especially the vanilla, I give this place a better review, but I don't because I consider the cupcake to be the danger field of Rodney's desserts, too many much better after meal options come to mind before I waste my precious calories. attribution on a cupcake

ashcans has great food, but you really need to prepare yourself for the rude artichoke owner and some of the mean, grumpy ladies working behind the counter. This is not a good place to place your order over the phone. food and verbal reviews from the staff working there, then ashcans is your place to eat

I cook better pasta than them and I'm not much of a cook. The pasta I had, I believe it was a marinara dish with penne, the sauce was terribly bland, didn't mix well with the pasta, the texture of the pasta was awesome and hung around on its own. If I wanted bland pasta, I would buy a box of presto and penne pasta, boil them together and add water. The waiter was attentive enough to notice and brought me more sauce. I liked the service and how they had the giant piece of white paper and pencils on the table so I could doodle while I waited the waitress was very attentive and friendly the appetizer the calamari was delicious I just wish they could take the pasta up a notch with richer sauces season the texture more tomatoes and cheese and really mix it with their pasta but I guess that would increase the costs eh
it's not very good anymore and the aura of the place has become a little snotty

I went yesterday for happy hour to have birthday drinks. I had the house margarita for actually I had two they were good. I think I disappointed the bartender when I asked him why his margarita he was pushing was supposed to be so great. special as the way to go was busy, they also hosted a networking mixer right next to the main bar in addition to discounted beer at happy hour, they also offered free food, I thought those days were over but they kept a constant supply of hot chips, salsa veggie platter, cold wraps and one or two hot Mexican items, mini chimes and bean cheese nachos to come. of appetizers makes me wonder how good the menu was so I took a look, it looks pretty basic but tasty, I think it was all or less on the dinner menu according to the sign outside lunch, it may be commercialized Mexican food, but it's a step up from some places like Taco Bell and Baba Express for sure, the staff seemed competent and worked pretty well together even though they were busy, the staff was calm and prompt to serve which is a good thing they seem to recognize some customers as repeat customers which was also nice the lady the room next to the bar was fresh and clean in this madness as was the bar and all the spaces I could see I think I will return I think I might even become a fan of this place over time there seems to be a good mix of people and an awesome straight male clientele worth another look

after reading a lot of reviews my expectations were pretty high, I'm a pretty big burger fan, I'll even order one at a fancy restaurant if I think I'll be good at that particular place, the burger was ok, a disappointment compared to what I thought I'd get actually, it tasted exactly like burger king, it even tasted like a burger king burger which in my opinion is not good at all, the fries were delicious, plentiful and very well seasoned, they did their job pretty well work. dinner for sure is a good time to look at the pictures on the wall they have contributed a lot to the look of the place and it also shows that the staff were quick and helpful and my order was ready in no time and I was there during lunch so overall it's a good lunch place for cheap and a fun dining experience but don't drive all the way here for the burgers if you live far away they are average at best frankly if you are willing to driving and want a good burger you are better at Hamburger Mill Ave or try the burger at Silly Up in Scottsdale very good

after being here a few times I would say most of the reviews were dead on the waiter was a replacement from another chain restaurant the poor guy was serving everyone which wasn't very busy running around apologizing and super fast paced after announcing we were there a guy came and seated us about a few minutes later unfortunately we were told he was the owner not too friendly to be fair they really never had great service the few times they been there, what keeps me from rarely coming back is their drunken noodles, they rock, we also went for the pumpkin curry starter reference, both more than made up for it the extremely slow service and normally unfriendly staff summary of the rest of the reviews the aquarium and others looked really clean although I saw them horrible before the bathroom was atrocious, dirty and disgusting.

I liked the handmade tortillas, rich and salty, I thought the food was okay, I thought the service was okay, I'm not new to Mexican food, I know what I want when I say I want cheese, cilantro and tomatillo salsa, give it to me please, they charged me and an extra dollar to have a handful of quest fresco boo I liked the aqua a la mango and pineapple, super smooth and clean flavor, I might go back

tagged just opened at the end of April so far I've been there twice, once for lunch and once for ice cream, both times I waited about a few minutes it's understandable considering their new one, I wanted to make my own type of sandwich and the older ladies said they don't do that, okay so I wanted to get the Arizona sandwich with a different bread, she says the bread change is really a sandwich and also didn't have any mayonnaise. to know that the flavors I want are gone, I should get backups of their items

I read all the hype so decided to try the cycle, what a disappointment the portions were small and overpriced. The owner thinks she is the best thing after sliced ​​bread. She needs to go back to Vietnam to remember how real Vietnamese food is prepared, forget this place.

shame about the Mandalay noodle world, maybe if they had insisted on better service and played up the Burmese aspect they would have had better luck, who knows, they moved in and they are doing great, my wife and I stopped in yesterday, I had some sort of carne asama and a taco and both were average, their hot salsa took it up a notch, although my wife had something with diabolo in the name sorry, I will have to look the menu when I get home and I loved it, they do the usual menado on the weekends and everything else. the place looks more or less like a filibertos, but there's nothing wrong with that, the whole bill was lower, so the prices are good, quite clean, the cheap food is ok and the service is adequate. I wouldn't go out of my way to make it there, but if it's in your neighborhood it's worth a try, I'll probably stop here sometime.

we had a large group and they honored our reservation by having the tables ready at the appointed time instead of having them ready when we arrived we had a somewhat set menu the tofu balls were delicious the chicken satay was good we had a choice of starters I want to give them higher marks for their service but the spiciness between dishes was very inconsistent you can choose on a scale and finding a dish that suited the spiciness you wanted was hit or miss. is the spiciest too, we had a huge mess with the bill where they put all the appetizers on one bill for one table and none on ours, it was a complete disaster trying to figure out their timing for eating was so weird at the scheduled time had basically finished their dinner then the rest of the meals arrived then again dealing with people is a lot

I went to the grand original and was happy to see they were opening the grand downtown within walking distance of mi casa so far. I was only able to go there on the weekend for brunch. I will say the food is good but the service on my last trip was quite lacking at one point. I sat for almost minutes between delivering the coffee and taking my order, which seemed to be the norm for the day in what was a fairly empty restaurant, which kept me from giving this star for sure.

Rolling Hills is both an executive course and great for a quick and cheap round of golf, it's not an off-owner destination course at all, but a nice little local favorite. The front nine is the old course and is a bit like mini golf, a fun diversion. You can even hear the occasional strange sound of zoo animals hiding behind the trees along a few holes. The back nine is a newer build and is much more challenging and picturesque anyway, they both offer fantastic views across the valley and it's a great place for a quick play after work in just over an hour. I've only eaten at the clubhouse once, but my buddy and I liked our burgers and it's next to the green which is great for a little free entertainment
the food was ok, smaller portions which is good friendly service, not the cleanest but a decent meal with good prices, would get stars if the food had just a bit more flavor
the tortilla soup is not the business, that's all I tasted, so that's all I rate on this place

Amanda B organized a dim sum use here today, they do dim sum from a menu instead of carts and it works great. They also have a picture menu to look at with many items on it so people like me can get a better idea of ​​what to order just by choosing the photo of things they liked on a previous trip. We were pretty much the only ones there for quite a while and we had the full attention of the staff. I liked my choices a little better this time, experience helped and Marian H was helping me with the sauce pairings as there were several to choose from, I almost gave them one but for the toilets the fixtures had a lot of corrosion around them and in general the toilets were showing a lot of wear. the time the floor was quite deep in water I told the hostess about it and they had someone in there with a mop quickly, I would definitely go again
great bar with a friendly bartender named Bob

chicago style hot dog sign me up i just moved here from chicago and i have been dreaming of tortillas since i left where will i find anything even close to that in a i was hoping this would be it the hot dog wasn't that bad the fries on the other hand weren't that good my husband ordered a beef with giardiniera hot peppers and they were far from hot almost tasted marinated and the tiny sandwich was like a sandwich beef I didn't taste it but he said it just tasted like a sammy roast beef not the Chicago beef we are used to. One of these days we'll find a good chicago style restaurant here in a

we went on a Saturday afternoon and this place was incredibly empty, they had brunch specials including bloody brands and mimosas, but we were more in the mood for lunch except for the Bloody Mary, I had to try one, it came out in a full sized glass boo, but it was really tasty, said the husband remembered a sign outside the restaurant a few weeks ago that said they had an arrogant bastard and he got a one ounce bottle for hey that's not fair, next up, the wings which we were a little hesitant to order when the waitress informed us that they were seasoned but not in sauce so they can't be ordered hot, we asked for them crispy and the waitress even asked the cooks to put them back in for a few minutes when they came out not visibly crispy, these non traditional wings were actually pretty darn good the seasoning was a little spicy and salty with just a hint of sweet if I was in the mood for the tangy tangy flavor of the frank hot sauce they wouldn't cut it but otherwise they were good enough to go back for my starter, it was the titania salad and I was a little disappointed, the fish was a little dry and uninspired and the greens underneath were overdressed and wilted. I ate the greens around the fish and chose the almonds and tangerines but had to leave the porridge hidden under the fish, it wasn't bad enough to say I wouldn't go back but I won't look forward to my next trip.

I've always been a fan of Burlington's offerings, but I won't be shopping at this one again. I went to return a belt quite simply. Instead, I stood in the customer service queue for a few minutes thanks to a Burlington employee putting things aside. It took three other staff members to help him.

empty tables said minute wait ok minutes wait near the door bumping elbows with customers at the counter people at the counter were complaining that they had been there for a few minutes we left at that point

i found the doctor through his website and called for an appointment the ladies who answer the phone are nice so i felt i made a good choice i was taken to the room and a lovely girl asked me questions and told me the doctor would be right he came in quickly and asked if i would mind if someone who was following him would be there the other guy came in with a medical assistant maybe no one had them presented. abrupt, it was very irritating as a patient to ask about serious topics like skin cancer and feeling blown away, he prescribed me a cream and came out a few minutes after seeing me and said he would have someone come with the script. He never told me how the cream worked or what it did. I actually prefer that doctors who care to take the time to answer my questions and make me feel comfortable don't take a few minutes to rush me into an appointment

sorry I'm from southern California so I'm used to good Mexican food, we were excited to try this restaurant as we had read good things about it but the waiter was pompous and the food was mediocre. We were in a group of four and we all ordered different meals. The guacamole made from an avocado was the restaurant's in a scary place. the thermos elements at the sanctuary or at the real food kitchen

what are you all talking about, this place is horrible, there is a reason these sandwiches are, I can't believe so many people like this place, even though the place was full of Chinese and they are known for having different taste buds, you get a one inch piece of bread with a bunch of cheap stringy vegetables from what they said, there was meat there too, but I forgot to bring my microscope to check if there was one there, this place is like a middle school cafeteria right in the heart of the Tokyo slums. I don't know any Vietnamese city, please, homeless people save your neighborhoods, you are too good for this place, they have good milkshakes, but if you are really homeless, as you should be, if you go to Lee, you shouldn't buy milkshakes from the rich anyway, stick with the dollar menu.

so a friend of mine went here last Friday and they were charged twice. The bartender took advantage of the situation and threw away the receipt to avoid writing off the amount she claimed and assumed was her tip on a bill. I get tipped, yeah I think I'll skip this place for sure.

i was finally able to get here for breakfast, in my opinion i won't be coming back as we were walking to the place i said, now this is the kind of place we should take our visitors from out of town to and i thought nope, we went there today a wedding, there was no wait and we were seated quickly, we were informed that drinks were self serve as far as coffee, water, tea and lemonade. it was to our liking, I say it's still steep for a self serve drink in a one oz cup, he had the monte crista which he liked but wasn't blown away for the price, I had the French toast and it was only ok, I also ordered a side of sausage which I didn't like and it was for I think the links wow and once our food arrived the fly was everywhere, I'm not kidding when I say that I couldn't wait to get out of there, I left very disappointed and hungry, I will never come back or recommend it, but hey try it for yourself you might like it, I just think the price was too high for what we got

no cover and outdoor misters decent crowd overpriced drinks tiny dance floor good selection of bags for laughs it's a b club in a chain of c hotels in scottsdale iron chrissakes what more could you ask for my only problem was how dark they keep it in there the people in scottsdale are generally nice so a little more lighting in there isn't going to hurt business a bit overall there's nothing about this place that really stands out

We had been looking to purchase a unit here, looked at several units, then decided to rent for a while. We've been here almost a year, loved it at first, but had horrible noise issues for about months. Management will do nothing. The walls here belong to our neighbor who plays her music loudly in the morning almost every evening. to help, the ceilings are also very thin, you can easily hear those walking above you aesthetically, this place looks great, the gym is great too but the construction is horrible

Walking into five guys' house, I was pretty excited and looking forward to my experience. I had never been to five guys before, so it was something new. My first reaction upon opening the doors was that the music was blaring too loud, at least the music was classic rock, which I didn't mind after walking around and looking at the easy to understand menu and waiting in line for a few minutes. everyone was moving a lot slower it was like everyone was moving in slow motion much to my dismay they didn't offer Dr Pepper my favorite soft drink I was surprised they offered other lesser known drinks but not Dr Pepper go after waiting about or a few minutes my food arrived in a bag a bag really I was planning to eat inside not going out even mcdonald's does better than that by rummaging through the bag I took out first the fries which were in a cup and I took a bite my first impression of the fries was that they were nothing special and too salty I like salt on my fries as it adds flavor but there was just too much salt as a result plus the portion was quite large I only finished about half of my fries now on the burger I paid for my meal so I was thinking it better be the best burger I have ever tasted in a long time when unwrapping the product in its foil packaging I noticed that the presentation of the burger was poor the burger didn't look appetizing at all almost disgusting like one in fact the cheese was dripping on the bun and I couldn't even see all the ingredients of the burger taking my first bite it didn't taste bad quite classic American burger I have to say it tasted pretty close to Wendy's at the end of my meal I wasn't impressed my stomach was greasy and I felt the need to go hiking in the mountains a few times, which I did because Tempe Butte is nearby, I felt my stomach almost about to reject it, it was that fat seriously, overall, five guys is way overpriced incredibly greasy and cringe-inducing, the atmosphere is nice, but so the two stars if you had to choose between five guys and participate are clear winners in all categories

the no substance core style can be summed up in their cheese plate pineapple melon grapes flocks of goat babble minis they even leave the wax for you and cubes of pepper jack and colby jack served with sesame crackers i can't win this gold they serve a lot of martinis as the name suggests very few of which actually contain the ingredients for a good martini but then again, now that I've described the cheese plate it should come as no surprise if you, dear reader decide to open a bar it's really quite simple get everyone drunk quickly and hire toilet attendants ready to throw soap in your customers hands oh hell no we are not in a recession the ferrari in advance was paid in cash i'm quite sure and that woman over there really ok that went downhill pretty quickly like my evening if you take it all away and look what it is the blue martini is a classy place to getting drunk to try to forget reality if that's your thing and you want to feel better about your age take a look

wow, I can't believe this place gets so many good reviews. I was hauled here once by coworkers looking for a cheap meal, but what's the value of your lunch dollar when you don't even want to eat the food, dry, sticky rice, white meat, chicken not identifiable as such, and a sugary glaze that provided the only flavor, frankly it was disgusting and none of the dishes my coworkers had tasted better even though they looked good with them. I should know to stay away from restaurants that have pictures of their food on the wall. one star is only for fast and friendly service

the hole in the rock was quite interesting but only for about a few minutes, it's not a hike at all but more of a walk on unpaved terrain once you're up there the view is pretty cool but the crowds of people, kids and rambunctious dogs detract from the magnificence and romance. I think it's a great place to take kids, but because of the ease it's a good thing it's located in Papago Park so you can go see the zoo or gardens or tomb hunt while you're there if you're going just to see the hole. kind of a waste of time
This might be the scariest convenience store I've ever been to, I mean it's sandwiched between a strip mall and a giant dirt lot

I grew to love Apple, even though I always thought their products were expensive. When we lived in Seattle there was a Microsoft bias, but a large group of us all had Apple phones and that's a key part of Apple's history. absolutely brilliant, great customer service, love my new iphone and have had blackberries for years, maybe when they add facets to the pads I'll put myself up to the genius bar

having grown up in Hong Kong and having eaten dim sum in London, my la de and Vancouver in fact I can confidently say I know my dim sum, a good selection of well executed dim sum when the carts arrive and there is anything left in it I give it stars for the food but the wait definitely detracted from the whole experience. the flow of diners throughout the week forces restaurants like Golden Buddha to rely heavily on additional wartime help on weekends. Dim sum takes some serious skill, so the chef always ends up doing most of the work. When we looked into the kitchen we saw a Chinese woman doing most of the cooking herself. relaxed usually no wait on weekends experienced chef prepares all dim sum himself so menus are much shorter but all the classics are on it, anything steamed is cooked to order so very fresh

The manager complained a bit when I insisted he check his shelf before heading out to find a rare item. Their stock had been wrong before and of course it was wrong this time, but no apology of course and no acknowledgment that I was right to have him check his stock, otherwise selection is good overall but customer service can be a little iffy at times, easy access right next to the lake, pleasant walk in the southwest corner.

the wash is not finished the process of doing it is pathetic the ticket writers at the entrance move in slow motion they try to pump at every opportunity four backed up cars waiting to order their maintenance the crew is standing with no cars passing i would rather drive my dirty car then endure the agony of incompetent management
In my continued search for good Chinese food in Phoenix, this place is a speed bump

I've been to a buffet like this before, but I will never go there again. The food looked fresh as we went through the food line selecting our favorites and stacking our bowl to the sky. We selected our sauces and put it back on the grill. The cook splashed our dishes with water quickly cooked the ingredients and put them back in a new bowl. and the sour soup because it's my favorite indie and the drink refills sitting to eat wasn't impressed, couldn't try a second spoon of soup as it was absolutely disgusting the bowl of ingredients were all bland maybe from the overuse of water when grilling and I'm pretty sure the tofu had gone bad the shards of meat my husband had selected also tasted like poultry. the selections that we could have taken leftovers home but chose to leave them are enough to say that I don't recommend it

it was ok, we were a large group and we all enjoyed the starters including the table side, the biggest complaint was the poor stocking of their bar, no chivas, no samba, weak margaritas and although the service was good the food was just ok and the bar needs to be better stocked, there is room for improvement

gets a solid star because they have the saddest, most delicious chocolate cake in the world, the best part is that just the reasonably sized slice of cake totally makes up for the boring, although sometimes satisfying, food, the chi skewers are pretty awesome for two people come with two huge drippings of chilli, cherry tomatoes on a bed of salad and rice pilaf, a lovely savory ruben sandwich is also a hit Friday if you don't like feta, stay at away from this place, they put it on just about anything they really believe in old adage, feta makes a betta

I've never had soul food per se, but my husband woke up craving chicken and waffles and you can guess where we ended up, we were so excited that there was a cool helping on the menu, so we ordered that immediately. I don't know why all restaurants don't do this cool help, it's amazing, the service was okay, our waitress was friendly enough and the food came out quickly. side of the mac and cheese which wasn't great and I didn't eat much of it overall, I give this place a solid identity, I'll come back but mostly because my husband thought it was kind of wonderful

stars for me, my first thought upon entering was wow, this is small, that's not necessarily a bad thing, it might necessarily be a good thing actually, I ordered a blush cocktail, gin, lemon juice, simple syrup and a splash of sloe gin, I'm pretty sure it was served in a sippy glass because I seemed to have trouble consuming it, but what I had was perfect for me and I would like another. I also opted for the special that night which was a filet sandwich with Polish Swiss watercress and charred onion while the Poland and onion sold me on it I didn't really get the Swiss and watercress it was good but could have been better with another cheese mho also tried the flock fries delicious and the mac and cheese not as delicious the mac and cheese was good but lacked the gooey cheese I crave we ended up with donuts Hot and salted caramel donuts were fantastic and it's hard not to love the butterscotch but the salty part was missing a touch more please, I had kind of forgotten about the grind but now that I remember it's worth a second visit

I'm one of those people who talks about birch gordon behind his back but I'm nice to his face I go and I still eat expensive but mediocre meals but like I just said I go my boyfriend once asked me why do it alone when you don't enjoy it. a container i don't even like after paying for it for myself lunch is more about going out and doing something else for an hour a day if anyone wants to go i will happily tag along and eat probably even though i know i won't like it at least there isn't much harm in that except for my wallet ps lori is the nicest and sweetest waitress ever and chatting with her makes up for the crappy food

way too expensive, they replaced the valve under my toilet, the float in the tank and the small water line going from the toilet to the new valve, it took them less than minutes and my bill was barely over. I priced all the parts at a plumbing store and they came out and my retail price they also charged me just for showing up at my house the plumber was knowledgeable I will give them that and if you really want to use these guys try getting a quote over the phone first.

If Star of India is named after the historic ship that sailed from Britain to India, it is best to state at the outset that there is nothing interesting to remember about this place and there is little that keeps you afloat in the quagmire of ordinary dishes like many other Indian restaurants in the valley. The dish with condiments of homemade chutneys is usually the highlight of a meal, so experiences with ordering might be: which is Bryan but then manages to serve a new variation that is nothing more than pieces of chicken thrown into a hodgepodge of rice and vegetables. Discouragement from substandard and overpriced food might lead to the decision not to order dessert after all, as observed in other reviews and on the menu. If you visit this place, stick to the tandoori stuff and chef's specialties, but in that case the excitement of a full menu will be lost.
not really memorable but good reliable Chinese food I also like the space

mediocre food, mine was really really salty, interesting place, but looks like a Colorado lodge, but what does this Arizona setting do, looks like a good place to go after work for a happy hour and hang out with friends solo for a nice dinner

the food was good I had the mare fruit with a red sauce and boy it is spicy so be warned everyone ordered the spaghetti pie which was the special that night it was ok my mom is better the service was good but the wait for a table was over an hour of course if it was a Saturday night and they have Glendale glitter so it was really busy the pizza is good I have already eaten it I am not the biggest fan of pizza at wood fire because it is always burned on the bottom

I was extremely excited to try the lobby given all the great reviews, but was unfortunately disappointed with the results. I'm a freak for chili burgers, good ones are very hard to find and the lobby chili burger was pretty boring with cinch style blah chili and like kind of crappy whiz cheese, I also ordered fries and a Chicago dog, the Chicago dog was overpriced and forgettable and the crinkle cut fries were reminiscent of tacos, which isn't really a bad thing, but considering this lobby is supposed to be a tasty quality burger place, fries frozen crinkles are kind of a half requested approach, the amount of salt on the fries was also enough to induce a stroke x finally, whoever the dude handed me my bag of food he was all like zippy, did I give you a cup of fry sauce, there were two orders of fries, a cup of sauce that was just a basic secret sauce, not a super good secret sauce to boot thanks pro but I don't need sauce favors secret

Overall this place isn't too bad for a quick Mexican restaurant, it's not like eating in a restaurant or anything like that, the food portions are pretty good and reasonably priced. I really liked their salsa and thought it was nice and tasty. I say this place is a small step down from Filbert, the staff here were really rude, they seemed like they wanted to rush everyone.

Dr. Fish is a good oral surgeon but his financial practices are shady, he gave us a high estimate for the surgery k we had to pay k before the surgery, he then lowered the estimate after the surgery but refused to credit our card. We had insurance that paid k two months later. fight him for reimbursement his office worker said oh insurance because I don't like paying hmmwhy contract with them then I would say look elsewhere

Cherubini is a clean and comfortable cafe, the employees are friendly but no more so than any other cafe I have been to. I had a decaf coffee, which was just okay, nothing to complain about but not particularly remarkable. I tasted elevated donuts with maple cherry glazed cake. so I don't mind, it's just a little too much kudos for keeping looking good and a free woman, but I won't go out of my way to visit Cherubini again

surprised this place isn't closed now, I went there once when I first started going because and never came back, their ingredients aren't fresh, the gyro meat tastes old and decrepit, they really need to hire better pita makers who don't look like drug addicts and dropouts, my pita was falling apart before it was even handed to me literally by the time I put it at the table it was soggy and wasn't even worth eating.
not really hot sex on a set but good food, good beer and good music, that's a lot

pretty good place where you never know who your server is because several different people are waiting for you the service can be slow at times which can get annoying the space is quite big bigger than it looks from the street the food was solo

my significant other had a restaurantcom bundle discount coupon that could sum up the entire trip. I haven't been to many restaurants that participate in restaurantcom that are decent at all. I mean, I wasn't expecting much from this place. I shouldn't have expected anything here. salad with the boolgogee but it was also obvious that there wasn't enough meat to justify a price because the salad and rice probably didn't cost more than doing oh the sushi, all the sushi we had was either super plain or super spicy by spicy, I mean there were just too many tastes at once and it was too overwhelming. bite we paid for the food even after the coupon and i honestly think even at the price it might be a bit of a rip off considering you can get better quality sushi cheaper by the rip this place is a ripoff for sushi in my opinion it's not good enough to justify the high price the sad thing is the interior is very well done if the food was really good this place would be extremely worth it

about to give one star I thought it was because I enjoyed the fresh and open interior of the main restaurant as far as the food which is one star, while having just stopped at the ranch market to do some shopping I was going to eat at the market itself but decided to maybe try a place I had never tried nearby. I took my groceries to the car, decided that since I hadn't tried traditions yet, I would give them a try. I enjoy the food at the ranch market, tasty and authentic, because they are connected. I thought the food would be the same, I was wrong, I don't know who they cook here, but with all the good stuff they have next door it should be a lot better. Salsa should have been the first customer. tacos and i noticed they only really had them on the appetizer menu because street tacos also wanted to have a spit, i thought with it i will get the sampler platter and add a taco, the platter came with mini chimes, mini iquitos, mini cheese enchiladas and a chicken and beef option, everything looked good when it came out, i enjoyed the taco first, the last thing i had to enjoy on this culinary outing, then digging into the chicken enchiladas, the sauce was a mole, it wasn't. a good idea somehow too sweet from someone's idea of a mole yes just because a mole has chocolate doesn't mean it's chocolate sauce and the chicken stringy bland a bit tough everything followed bland not very authentic someone's idea of mexican food it all reminded me of something I would have if in the midwest somewhere and wanted a mexican footnote arizona the only saving grace of this meal was that it was happy hour on a Saturday and the platter was off and the taco was a dollar so I left to pay only instead of continuing to eat at the market I will pass on the traditions

the night was dark and foggy a winter's eve which started with the promise a quick trip to the yelp site quickly revealed that the restaurant in tempe was in fact a brewery this delighted my boyfriend a beer connoisseur and me too being a fan of highly rated restaurants and anything that makes my man happy so we headed to the four peaks with high expectations and high spirits alas our hopes were dashed almost from the start the hostesses greeted us from the sidewalk, they were extremely young and scantily clad in low cut, low cut jeans that didn't cover their clearly illegal butts, the place was packed so we grabbed a tag and went to the bar for our first round, the bartender despite a full house noticed us almost immediately and took our orders the only quick service we received all night the beers well the kilt lifter was a fine example of Scottish shilling beer but the spa raj was heavy on acetyls and but otherwise, a reasonable attempt at an english topknot spa was above average spa with a pleasant grapefruit aroma by the time we were seated we were happily giddy from the beers unfortunately it took almost a few minutes for the waitress to take our orders and another before our meals arrived the food was ok although the side orders were botched we noticed the very nice disposable napkins which were durable but soft some of the nicest napkins I have ever disposable nature views overall, a good people watching experience very loud and crowded with terrible service, adequate beer and generic but palatable food, wouldn't we go back unless invited by good friends overrated

wow, not in a good way, the dashiki was good because all they did was cut it, but it was everything else that made me wish I became real Chinese, not Chinese, making sushi culture thieves ps snow crab is not the main ingredient in every roll

The buffet is excellent, good choice of food, even for me the picky vegetarian naan has a great choice of food plain or garlic naan usually tastes good on the buffet alone. I would have given stars, but I may not return for dinner or takeout. my naan was burnt for that, they only have one good spot for the lunch buffet

Dear Arizona Cardinals, can you please pull yourself together and win games similar to last night so the Phoenicians will love you and you can finally build a fan base while I half enjoyed watching you spank the St. Louis Rams yesterday in the last game of the season while scoring the most points in a Cardinals game in years. shit ears, you remind me of a rich socialite in rolls with no manners, you have a nice expensive mansion but you still seem to be on the wrong side of the tracks, tell your landlords to stop being so cheap, strengthen your roster, spend some money and take some risks and the everlasting glory years might be around the corner last night, one of your jaded and cynical fans said to my friends in rams jerseys in the parking lot thank you for being rubbish today we usually suck and everything but your team was way worse funny and defeatist attitude but what do you expect i'll be here waiting and cheering and hoping there will always be next season five stars for trying one star for the shitty property

the bar itself, especially the outside area, is really nice in the colder months, but it's also close to the university so can get overcrowded with snotty hipsters, sometimes a good place to socialize with reasonable prices and yum oysters

I think the Days Inn Tempe is best described as a place where you can buy the right to sleep for a while. I booked my night on Travelocity for a non-smoking room, but when I entered the room I almost choked, it was disgusting. I have never had a smoking hotel room before and I will make sure not to do so again. have a corkscrew no, Coors Light, these are the towels that looked like they were made of cow's tongue and they missed our makeup call one morning which made me late for a training class that cost me approx. I'm giving one star in addition to the minimum nectar rating because I was able to drink cheap beer by the pool in degree weather for days and there are a few good places to eat and two dollar stores very close by, the dollar store had a corkscrew

I thought Saturday night would be busy at midday but to our surprise it was just getting started, we don't like to go there too often as it seems a lot of older people go, not that I'm a spring chicken, the waiter was efficient, he never told us his name but memorized our order, he made sure our drink glasses were filled at all times when he brought out the bread, there were only three pieces of different types of carrot bread and a other guy we had to ask for another order. My daughter had the chicken pot pie which had pieces of chicken in it. but the sad thing was the crust was only on the top which was golden brown for her, it was fine my wife had the small sirloin steak which came with salad and asparagus, she ordered it medium rare and it was a bit too pink but still edible. a little salty for me but bearable if you looked at the lamb shank you would mistake it for a turkey drumstick
the price is a little high for me they don't give enough bean sprouts without asking for more the broth which is a little too sweet for me too

if you have ever eaten at an outstanding German restaurant you will be ruined for life years ago it would have had stars but after being turned on at a little gem in Gibson City I called the barn tube. My appreciation for fatty meat and spices stuffed into intestine sitting on a bed of sauerkraut and red cabbage was forever changed. Wally World, probably the biggest problem was when they brought out the brown mustard still in a plastic container, my meal was the Nuernbergerkassler combo for one and I had enough for breakfast the next day, their sausages seem to be of lower quality than the sunflower ones and the red cabbage had pork cartilages in it, not that I mind a little pork fat in my cabbage but no chunks and definitely no cartilages. Best part of any of our meals, they have a nice selection of good beers on tap without aventin but if the food was anything other than German it would get stars, it's nice to have a place to get a schnitzel when I'm in the area but I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here

I love German food and as far as food goes at Bavarian Point, they had some great dishes. The only reason I give the restaurant two stars instead of one is the food. Their rind roulade was very good and the red cabbage and spaetzle were excellent, but the quality of the food was compromised by the poor service. walk up to our table to take our drink orders and when she did she was complaining about something and generally looked upset when my wife ordered a beer the waitress told her it would be more expensive because it wasn't available on tap now that might be useful information but the way she told my wife was provocative rather than helpful trust me we gave her no reason to be so sour it was clear that this particular waitress was clearly unhappy, whether with her job or her life, it's hard to say it's really a shame because the food was good but why would anyone want to eat at a restaurant whose employees are nowhere to be found or miserable, not me

what can I say, I'm a bargain shopper, I'm not cheap, but I get more satisfaction from getting a good deal than from spending a ton of money on a name brand item at Nordstrom or Sax Five. That being said you may find a pair of shoes you'll like here but the selection is just okay and its generally full retail price most of the time they have a two for one deal or get the second pair half price it's still never really a good deal.
Pei Wei glorified

I haven't been to Fuddruckers in about years now, I know why the cashier was nice and very helpful. I ordered a bacon and cheese burger combo, the fries were only warm, not hot, the burger wasn't very tasty and it was full of pieces of gristle, you know, the ones that stick between your teeth, lots of trash on the floor after we finished, someone came up and asked me how I was told here about the fries and she offered to buy me more.

I can see why everyone loves this place who wouldn't be okay with so many fresh creamy choices, unless I'm very unlucky and visit on a bad day. This place is on a steep descent. My husband ordered one flavored with strawberry and kiwi and chocolate peanut butter.
I prefer going to Amado, the only thing good here is the bean dip and I only say that so I have something nice to say.

I would normally give this place stars because I've been a regular here for about a year, cheap drinks, great crowd and good music, except I had my first bad experience here the other Sunday that was granted to me and all the other people at my job were pretty loud after a spring training game on Sunday afternoon. Maybe it was the girls laughing a little too much or we were having too much fun for a barbet dive. I will continue to come to this place once I avoid the embarrassment of telling people at work that I know this cool bar only to be treated so rudely in a way that is too snobbish for a Sunday afternoon bartender

so I've been going to penis seduce for about a year, they are located very close to me so it's mostly about convenience, the techs are hit or miss, some are awesome and really do a good thorough job, but overall it's generally a pretty neutral experience the last couple times I've been there they were just rude. flop thursday my eve i went to do the sloppiest manicure i have ever had she soaked my right hand for all the seconds before she started my cuticles when i shook when she cut my finger she slammed her tools on the table she grabbed the bowl of water my left hand was still in the spilled water she got up and said no change manicure polish when she came back, i tried to explain that i wanted a manicure, not just a polish change, she raised her voice and said i was too nervous, everything hurt you good, she did my polish, horrible job because of my cuticle, she looked just terrible while i was waiting for my polish to dry, there was a man who made another woman die, told her times he was hurting her and he just laughed and said that tickled, she said no, it hurts, I'm done with this place, there are plenty of these cookie cutter stores around, they need to double check their customer service skills, this was just wrong
