my brother also posted about our Mother's Day experience, they must be franchises because the Scottsdale and Chandler locations are like eating at a completely different restaurant, this is the second and last time we will frequent this location, the pizza and calzone were horrible

it's a sad excuse for a gay resort much like a worn out version of Palm Springs, we found the zen yard on Maryland Avenue a much nicer experience in a better neighborhood as well as the zen yard is a much better value with full breakfasts included and warm, helpful hosts, not to mention particularly reasonable off-season rates and hosts who are genuinely there for their guests

This is a tough review to write, my family started eating here when they first opened, we were a once a week customer very happy with the food and service, the pizza is delicious, then one evening we placed our order asking for the special. We always get a pizza deal when we received our order, they placed medium pizzas on our table. to ask me to clarify what offer I spoke to the owner of this place, he agreed to make us another medium pizza to make up for the size difference, to which I agreed almost a few minutes later the owner came to our table and told us that if he made us another pizza he would have to charge us for it. I refused and now, almost years later, we have chosen not to return to this establishment. needs improvement, I hope some changes have been made in the last couple of years

for the past three months I have received unsolicited text messages from these clowns so no matter how nice this place might be I will never stay with them or any other affiliated property for this reason alone I complained to the hotel got kicked out, blocked them from my cell phone account and filed a complaint with the federal government since the hotel continues to find it appropriate to turn on my cell phone in the morning with spam texts. I hereby award them a generous nectar rating.

this is the closest coffee shop to a New York hipster style coffee shop I've seen in Arizona, they also serve beer, the problem is the espresso was incredibly bitter, the cookie happy hour is pretty cool though

I was excited about the concept of a haircut and a beer so when I saw a deal from Livingsocial I bought three coupons here's the problem I had a Tuesday night at noon and was told they wouldn't honor the coupon until noon but was told if I wanted to pay for a discount off the standard rate they would take me ASAP no one was in the joint and they refused to take my Livingsocial coupon before afternoon.
has been closed for a long time

this is so promising great promotions great TV area everywhere full bar good food great place to have beers before and after a spring training game but the service sucks I don't understand why I have to be carded at the door carded at the table then carded at the bar there were groups all over the place and we always had slow and crappy service I wish I had better things to say but really the experience completely ruins the good things about this place

we decided to meet friends here Saturday night, I can't guarantee the drinks because I wasn't feeling well that day and decided drinking wouldn't help things. My wife was pretty happy with Red Bull and Vodkas but whatever floats your boat Wendy let's just say she won't be drinking Long Island Iced Teas for a while but I think they were pretty good drinks cut out, said I like it or I can't taste anything anymore, the music was good, the dancing was hilarious and fun as it always is with K. and c I would go back I enjoyed it the vibe uh minus a few want to be porn stars but hey like I said whatever floats your boat is good for a laugh at least

this place isn't all that but the food is ok there are better chinese options for the price try the restaurants in the chinese cultural center the restaurant itself is well furnished and clean but i can't believe how much people rave about this place

the frybread itself was excellent, it's just what's going on inside, it's not that great, I've been wanting to come here for a long time because I've heard so much about it, I had a bean and cheese frybread and the beans came half mashed with whole pinto beans, which I can't stand, the beans aren't very tasty when they're whole, the cheese was a thick shred that didn't melt and it was quite disappointing. i cooked the beef without any flavoring, maybe they were having a really bad night, why have you been betraying me lately, i keep going to these great reviewed places and they suck

are you stalking me, here's a hint, I never know, the crowd is too young, I think the whole Greek scene is too messed up, I think you're drunk, and too retarded, I think oh my God, we just walked into a club and we were only nineteen. there are world famous things there from time to time and a pretty decent chance of celebrity sightings, which brings mystery to huge stars

it's just a poor substitute for the lot dos motions in south phoenix, it's a pale shade on its own, the salsa is spicy but it doesn't have the same excitement, i think it's partly the downtown location in a strip mall, not that the restaurants in phoenix aren't in strip malls, but the mexican pizza and chicken enchiladas just didn't have the same kick and spiciness when you're craving the downtown Mexican, but make room and time to go to the original deal the one with alarm salsa and huge margaritas on head-sized patios and bring a group of friends to treat yourself

I feel like Tops has become more and more angry and bitter as time has gone on. I called on July 4th just to see if they were open and the guy on the other line said yeah and we are a madhouse. Every minute I'm on the phone with you, there's another body at the door and hanging up on me. so I'm calling you back specifically to waste your time instead I'm just going to yell about this repeatedly coming back over the last few months I feel like I'm tiptoeing through the house when someone is mad at me I don't get it there's a serious vibe of negativity going on especially the guy who acted like an asshole on the phone has been petulant and bitchy a few times with me oh and chill your fucking beer i am tired of having to put my shit in the freezer for minutes because the beer or champagne I buy is hot

let me first say this is a nice place, the chips and salsa were some of the best I have ever had, my wife and I both ordered soft shell ground beef tacos, the ingredients were excellent and everything was very good, but I would like to note that the tacos were swimming in grease overall this was one of the best places we ate in the Phoenix area.

I loved the banana republic I stopped at lunch to buy a few outfits I wasted quite a bit of time in this store a degree of annoying the choppy layout of the new store is annoying the clothing line has changed drastically so you look like you came from an overpriced cold beach I was looking to dress neat and professional not wrinkled and haphazard I wanted short sleeves not flimsy spaghetti straps long sleeve blouses and sweaters hello banana republics from arizona new format and collection it's a huge failure

I read the two good reviews here on Yelp so was looking forward to a good Italian dinner, unfortunately it had to be an off night, the waitress didn't want to be bothered and the meatballs and tomato sauce on the spaghetti didn't have much flavor, that's the test of a good Italian restaurant for me if the sauce is good they usually give a thumbs up, this sauce wasn't bad but it was bland and watery even the bowl of spaghetti wasn't good drained so there was a dripping mess at the bottom of the paltry bowl of pasta, this place is right around the corner from my house and Dominic is my brother's name so I was really disappointed

just great, the gluten free pizza crust is really good, make sure you order it crispy otherwise it can be a little chewy unless you like chewy then order it however you like. I really like chicken pizza but I think they might have recently changed the sauce or something that tasted different to me the last time I went, if they didn't change the sauce I might lose my mind anyway, it didn't taste as good this time just saying

like anyone else with good taste I think this place was better when it was called the library ink when their specials were but the first impatient bomb was on a Tuesday night and I will love them forever just for that, there is plenty of space to sit in the bar area, a restroom attendant and generally reminds me of the sports bars you find all over Glendale just with a younger crowd.

I am so disappointed with this place they constantly do a half done job after many disappointing visits, I decided not to waste any more money on crappy car washes from then on, alas I ended up with a free car wash, fill your gas tank, get a free wash, so I gave them another chance to make it better, best wash for more, the floor mats were also shampooed every time. The floor mats were dirty when the car came in and spotless when they were replaced in the car, what a bargain if only the rest of the car. The result was the same when I returned a good few minutes later, the interior of my little car was still quite dirty, a fair amount of dog hair remained and the central area where the rack shift tray and gear lever are located was not wiped down. Let me tell you, there was definitely a reason to clean these areas. Danny started the job but never completed it and luckily for me I was able to spend extra time on Sunday to finish cleaning my car which I paid for but should have paid at either price, it remains very poor value for money.

I've been here about twice for the weekend breakfast buffet and once for lunch, the food is similar to Dennis's so nothing special here, everything here seems grimy and dirty, there was hair in one of the buffet dishes, the service is average but the employees are just as dirty the restaurant won't come here again.

after reading all the raves about the green chile mac and cheese it was a must try and then I immediately regret that the green chiles were chewy and poorly peeled and the cheese in the mac was grainy and grainy, yuck, mac and cheese is by definition cheesy and smooth, not that horrible.

I went to some whores last night to get the basics for making pizza with the most adherence to the process was a three pack of weak yeast and lo and behold, the dirty hippie kids they have working there again didn't put something in the bag and this time it was the yeast. whore food but I'm done shopping for any whore food in a place like Phoenix where you have alternatives like sprouts you think whore food would be smarter or when you try to ask someone who works here where something is and they just walk by with their noses in the air I understand it's important to show your fellow dirt dealers you're a super star but I don't work with you, I contribute to your salary and an overpriced benefits package for a grocery store clerk, so do your fucking useless job. girl who needs a shower and an orthodontist but alas whore foods and its filthy hippie employees have alienated yet another person with a job and a degree by hating everything this place stands for oh yeah one more thing remove the ban on concealed carry guns from your stores that didn't stop Jared Rire from doing something horrible and all that does is alienate the law abiding citizens of their constitutional rights. ass and shower useless mother

I tried this for dinner one night I had the hot and sour soup which was a good partner I had the won ton soup but had to ask for tons of crispy won to add to the soup I had a diet coke to drink but I swear there was alcohol in the glass I sent it back and the same thing happened again I tasted my partners and hers was good I didn't know what was going on there I had King Pay beef it was a little too crispy my partner had the shrimp version she wanted scallops but they were out she said it was excellent I liked the decor but a little pricey for what you get
ideal for saints and lou games

I dragged my husband here because the online menu lists a particular type of spring rolls that I like and when we arrived the menu was totally different, this place is aimed at your typical Arizona crowd, it's pretty watered down with a view food and was very disappointing and expensive, go across the street to the Mekong if you'd rather taste more authentic food with a view

these soggy donuts are hit and miss when I run here for just a coffee, the service is usually very fast and quick when I run there to order coffee and food which usually becomes a circus, there have been times where I have waited minutes for my food, usually it's not a problem but when you have a business meeting to attend it's fast food, bring a sleeping bag

ok so how does it go from being a star actually less than that to being a star they seem better than the last time I worked shopping here. I went here the other night to help my boyfriend find an interview outfit and noticed that the store had a handful of the same employees as last summer, but some clothing areas had been moved despite all the moving and changing they had to do. girl, I remember her from when I worked here and she gave me attitude when I needed to ask her something, turns out it wasn't a one time thing, she's just a rude person that night, there were only two girls at the register and a line of about people. My boyfriend and I were shopping separately and knew one of us was going to get it. a certain item was marked on sale but the same item was normal priced, they wanted to make sure they weren't paying too much, too little and her explanation that they had been in the store longer, it made no sense to them or to those of us in line but she continued to get upset until they gave up on the issue, she put people's items in bags and practically threw them at them and repeated without trying to fake some sort customer service, good night goodbye, my cashier was slightly friendlier but still not great, it was obvious she was having a long apteral night, she was stuck at the checkout with the ice queen, so that was understandable too, I didn't catch her name, but the girl working the locker room was really nice and kept greeting everyone who passed by. I had to call this place to get the manager's name for something I was filling out on a form and was told they had a new manager so I know why it jumped two stars, it could have been four but some things they didn't correct, a rude cashier kept this review at a solid three.

Aside from it being a bit overpriced for some of their items, it's really good food. I tried the Pesto Linguine Fettuccine with Marinara Grilled Cheese, Tomato and Arugula Linguine with Alfredo Sauce, Caesar Salad, their Chocolate Vanilla Cupcakes, and their Chocolate Chip Scone. The overall price for two adults with average drinks is still approx.

I went there on Sunday for the Rockies vs Dodgers game, we got great free seats just to the left of home plate, I love the awning which provides lots of shade for people who just want to watch the game from the top of the seating section, I heard the game was sold out but it looked like the full parking lot might not be too bad for us, we parked in maybe lanes away from the stadium, the food was good, this place just didn't get spring training, love came to love, it's definitely too far for me and I really love the vibe and the energy I get from the crowds at the older stadiums like Phoenix Mini and Tempe Diabolo and even Hohokam and Scottsdale, it just doesn't seem to compare

I don't see why people are so quick to judge a store so harshly, it's a pet store, the service is okay for being a breakfast chain, but it's nice that this place is open for hours because my friends and I need a place to eat whether it's after bar hours or not, the food is still not too bad for a chain and I've been back several times plus it's great for people watching at some hours of the day, happy
ugh, I loved this place but I got over it, I find the food uninspired and below average blah

we used to visit this pub years ago because they had a nice english waitress and great fish and chips for the price, but we went back a few weeks ago and were disappointed that the price of the fish and chips dinner had gone up and they cut the portion in half. No one helped us put two tables together. We had to do it ourselves. Two guests wanted a nice hot English tea and they didn't prepare it in advance. eat fish and chips, especially in North Phoenix

good place to go if you're hungry and don't want to cook breakfast, not great as most of their food goes straight from freezer to pan and just small portions of bland food, great people and great service, just blah food

bad experience horrible service horrible food first of all I was hosting a happy hour and dinner for a retirement party we were having on Friday August 3rd reading the fine print on the website it said the happy hour prices were in the bar although because it was a group we couldn't get in that area one of the attendees called the restaurant and spoke with the manager who confirmed we were going to have happy hour prices. the attendee who spoke with the manager was misinformed and they only gave us a bunch of happy hour prices. Second our server was horrible, there were a few servers waiting for us because there was a table of people anyway, she took wrong orders and didn't listen to our needs and was rushed, then a new person came late to our table and she didn't even get served when she saw her, we had to track her down, I'm sorry but the number of restaurants I've been to was the worst service ever I mean. I had servers who were actually new who were new to the table and took their order once they arrived. I ordered a large size fried green tomatoes, an order of fried okra and a plate of sweet potato fries, the server gave me my fried green tomatoes but gave me fried okra and the sweet potato fries were horrible so I asked the server to take my sweet potato fries because it was horrible, the server took them away without even asking me if I wanted another batch. I don't cook much but I can probably fry these tomatoes a lot better than the restaurant. I told the server I ordered a size of fried okra and she said ok and took it back to the kitchen then she brought the same dish back and said she would charge me just the size of the order and finally when the server gave us the bill they were separate checks and didn't even do it correctly the server was putting things on the bill that didn't even belong on the check so needless to say I won't be coming to this restaurant again.

I stayed here in March and thought the place was fine, nothing exceptional, but here is my experience. The benefits were good for what I was there for work. The nightly rates were really cheap, it had more to do with my business than the property, although a fairly easy drive from the airport, you can almost bypass Phoenix to get to Scottsdale. were actually very spacious and the best part it was like having a one bedroom luxury apartment scaled down to the size of a full kitchen bathroom huge living area king size bed in a comfortable sized bedroom the hot tub rocked no one gave us a hard time having glass bottles there. Once I arrived I had to carry a ton of stuff into a room in one of the back buildings and I couldn't see my rental car maybe I'm the weirdest I like having my car nearby I unpacked my luggage and found out the internet in my room wasn't working I had to call the front desk and they had to move me to a completely different room I just unpacked my luggage. I have had dinner a few times with colleagues in their lounge when it wasn't great so we all ate out in the street the rest of the time just be aware you have a good chance of seeing spiders looming around you you have been warned but otherwise it is very clean I will stay here again expecting to get the same rates as last time but I understand having spoken to the girls at reception we booked at unusually low rates don't get sucked into it in this timeshare bullshit they don't grow like other places I've been but it's never a good investment

always an unacceptable place in my book, especially when a waiter there goes out of his way to private message me on yelp to complain about my punctuation and signing so sincerely that I might lovingly add the waitress itching in a way to keep it classy there

with all the hype before this place even opened i was expecting a lot better so maybe there are some flavors missing from the basic tacos the tamales are so generic and dry the place is nice and clean and the staff is friendly and the little salsa bar is a nice addition i had to give this place stars if you want to get tacos go to gallo blanc or americas

I have been here several times. I like having a restaurant nearby for breakfast and reading the paper, but this one is always understaffed and there doesn't seem to be much management to make things right. The food is generally good, but the staff always seem stressed, perhaps from serving hordes of tip-poor elderly people.

tiros are a quick and easy lunch that's perfect for when you're feeling like gyros. I'm not saying it's the best gyro I've ever had and I'm also not saying it's the cheapest at all, but it gets the job done. I usually only have one gyro meal when I go there. a point to hand out if you didn't bring lunch to work on a given day and the owner is always very nice and friendly

the food was good but I can't say I was terribly impressed overall, the food took a ridiculously long time, even when only one other table was in the restaurant, the starters came out fifteen minutes after our main meals, we had thought they had forgotten it taste wise, things were ok but not entirely memorable. I had a chicken shawarma and the whole ordeal was filling but a little bland.

this place is too noisy, it would have been nice to have a meal without a lady shouting meatloaf across the room and the waiters were a bit incompetent and snobbish the food was delicious but it's not something everyone can do like at home, they are stingy with their bread even though it is now free, lots of annoying things that will probably persuade me not to come back

can I tell you how much I despised destiny with all its pretentious and arrogant bullshit. I should have known the second I realized Blissrebar was in the same building that it was probably tainted with all the remnants of evil and that's how we arrived and the restaurant was practically empty. a minute wait or we could eat on the patio uh it's degrees and the place was dead guess we'll wait we go back outside because there's zero point zero extra room to stand the waiter comes back and says they have two big parties coming up in an hour but we can sit inside now if we can finish in a few minutes it sure is inviting isn't it so we rush inside and do hasty selections, fake comfort food like gourmet mac and cheese offends me, so I go with the veggie sandwich which sounds harmless enough, the food came out right away too fast for a burger to be cooked medium rare as my partner ordered, sure she cut it and it was bleeding and mooing everywhere my veggie sandwich arrives and it looks like a filefish from hell a huge block of something unidentifiable because of the extreme frying, I couldn't help it, I asked the waiter what eggplant was, ok, so it was like trying to eat a fried brick between two pillows, impossible the pretzel bread while delicious is totally inflexible, only Jenna Jameson can put that thing in her mouth, my partner suffered a similar fate with her hamburger bleeding, there was mayonnaise, cabbage grated and boiling eggplant juice everywhere and it was really ridiculous, none of us ate even half of our sandwiches. c'mon mia you think if they tried to hustle us out of there we'd get a fucking check no no no Nara must have not chased someone down and asked for it when it finally came there wasn't even an itemized receipt so even though the total seemed a little low I couldn't verify it I was so over the whole experience to the point I didn't care I left a crappy tip and we we escaped to the bar next door where the cute bartenders gave us free drinks and we downed countless vodka specials for the next four hours, it's truly horrible in every way

had a coupon so I decided to have lunch at Wildflower the food was pretty good similar to other specialty bakeries the cashier wasn't super friendly but the manager would go again I just felt like nothing stood out too much about this place
my love affair with destiny ended when Johnny left the quality of service and the atmosphere took a complete nosedive, go to Sens instead

so i figure half price sushi for lunch oh yeah you bet right even at half price it's hard for me to get excited about so there's no real creativity besides the disco balls during happy birthday seriously um yeah and it's pretty generic fare the stars are really for the fact that the service was Johnny on the spot for miso and salad damage the main fare although just plain lacking you're better off heading a mile or radius to Ra

you can grab a meal here for lunch as most entrees are in the mid-teens and include starters, salad or soup, starter and dessert. A selection of bread and butter is also available for you to snack on, comparing other culinary restaurants I have eaten at I say this one serves decent food but the others are better in terms of preparation and taste. the bowl it was served in made it less appetizing the starter itself was goldfish tasted good and was well prepared but the Black Forest cake mousse dessert was too runny the service from our main waitress was good our water server was probably the most annoying waiter I have encountered and he forgot to bring out some items I had requested but hey I give him points for trying one thing that was weird was one of the instructors came and did a sarcastic remark about how I wanted bread for my dessert because I was trying to finish the last piece of bread on the table I hate wasting food

I have to add to Andrews review, I just can't believe what happened, yes the monkey was good, the starter was good too, but there were bites of bread without chicken in the pain, it definitely would have been better with more chicken, but the girl who works here is one of the worst waitress-bartenders ever. We sat at the bar, luckily a nice guy noticed us looking around and let us sit at the end of his table which he moved away because his whole group didn't show up for dinner. I was so excited when I saw they had cider on the menu and not just one but two I love the waders, pear cider and safe. drinking it was disgusting it was boddingtons when I finally got her attention away from flirting with a man sitting at the bar to ask her for the right drink she told me they were out of safes too how are you running out of two drinks your a restaurant shouldn't it be stocked your right in front of a beam for goodness sake when we ordered our food he ordered the monkey then I ordered my starter and she left she didn't even get her order we figured it was probably for the best we split the monkey and starter and eat less stupid of the waitress to lose money that way but no matter when she brought my food she didn't bring the right things how hard is it to remember that maybe she had tables to service maybe if she stopped testing while she was behind the bar on her cell phone or if she stopped having a conversation with the guy at the bar, maybe she could have done her job a little better

Smith's Bar has the potential to be a chic hot spot in the heart of downtown, just steps from Symphony Hall Chase Field and the US Airways Arena, but this place, despite its pseudo-hipness, fails to deliver in the cocktail department which, along with it, is continually shitty. The music would be the only real reason why you come to this bar, it really is a featured place. that

I personally have been coming here much more often as I have noticed what I feel is a decline in the quality of the food. The carne asama burrito recently tasted good to me, but the meat tasted lower quality than I was used to. The guacamole was a little thinner than I like. I gave them this rating because they have a much better history with me and I hope they had a weak day.

I prefer to be smarter because they have a better selection and better prices. I love peace for their cookie bar so I can buy cookies that are pet friendly. For my pets, that's basically it. I only shop here occasionally due to the location, go to pets inc in tempe instead for a real shopping experience.
this bar is now sold out just under a year ago, see reviews

i hate coming in here because it always stinks, they really need to air this place out, my daughter loves it, she always had a great time whether she was skating or going to a club, great place for birthday parties, she loved her party, she also received a load of tokens with the party package

Honestly, I feel a little bad giving Wildflower a three-star rating, but I'm honestly waiting for the time when I feel impressed by their food. I have been to Wildflower several times ordering something different each time. The first time was a sweet potato and fig sandwich disaster. afterword

if Cowboy Ciao is the best restaurant in Scottsdale then Coffee Crumbs must be just about the worst, this place is terrible, I went there with my family and none of us enjoyed our meal. The handmade chips and salsa were clearly store bought and every one of our starters was always blah, nothing new or intriguing in any of their dishes and the food just wasn't that good with so many good choices in Old Town why would anyone ever eat here

is it illegal to get good chinese in arizona we went there tonight with high hopes of having high quality fresh chinese food and we were very disappointed sad we opened our take out bag and the white rice had been left out we were going to give them a witch pass but on the issue of flavor there is no excuse the sneak dumplings were wilted and flavorless the sauce that came with them couldn't revive them the Chinese mustard was in small packets and didn't need heat Viagra sad the Mongolian beef was so salty it tasted processed the snow peas were stringy and overcooked the general chows chicken tasted old like it was an all you can eat buffet honestly Panda Express is better at least you know what to expect in a mall food court it wasn't cheap. in town who needs a job

this place is losing due to poor customer service which is a shame because the food is good, it wasn't always that way, it was good food with friendly attentive staff but then they changed management. Our first experience with the new management and staff was not great. first of all we were ignored and had several customers in front of us despite the fact that we were there first when they finally decided to acknowledge us, they told us we couldn't pay at that checkout as we had a market purchase rather than just moving on to the next checkout and taking care of the purchase there, they made us queue again, eventually we checked overseas we were overcharged, we didn't realize until we got home and at that point it wasn't worth going back, we decided to give them another chance and came back a few weeks later, this time the service was even slower. before we even got our water a few minutes later our food still hadn't arrived the waitress kept speeding by our table and ignored us we quickly grabbed our food when it finally arrived as we had to go back and went to pay again a long wait as we were ignored for the other customers who came after us then they overcharged us again luckily we caught it this time they made the correction in a hurry without even apologizing they rather acted annoyed that we were holding them back, how about you do it right the first time if you don't want to do it again so that's it, I don't think we'll go back, it's such a shame because the food is delicious and it was one of our favorite places, it's just a shame the new staff sucks, I can get good food elsewhere and not be treated like trash and overcharged

I currently have a clearance sale but it's not really worth the detour. I found most books were cheaper at Amazon then sale price, a few were even cheaper at Barnes and Noble than clearance sale price, which made me say that's probably why you're going broke, try competitive pricing. The place is an absolute disaster.

I have been to the orange table several times and I love the deli and store at the place but I was less than impressed with the food the first time I went for breakfast and I got the jersey girl omelette it was good but not great next time I got the mushroom pizza it was so greasy I had to go through several napkins and I was only able to eat small pieces before giving it all to my friends to sum it up If you're looking for a relaxing place to hang out, people watch and do some little gift shopping this is a great place but don't do it there. for food

I really hate doing this, this restaurant is for those who think Taco Bell is a great place for Mexican food, the buffet was pathetic and possibly had some items without white rice, my sampling of their offerings ranged from terrible to mediocre. who I assumed to be the owner-manager was nice and friendly but that can't make up for the poor quality of selection and food.

decent sports bar, don't get me wrong they have tons of beer choices, decent service at good service and lots of pub food, a few things that bothered me last time, no waitress for about a few minutes after I sat down in southwest egg rolls while the vouchers were tiny compared to other places. Too many TVs had the volume of the football game was impossible to hear, I will return though
their amazing prices are instantly countered by desperate customer service if i want low prices i will go and show good will for this place looks like idiots are on my do not buy list

the fitness part of this place is great the machines are new and plentiful good classes on the program and plenty of cold water and fresh towels now the spa on the other hand is mediocre at best the pool is a bit of a walk and accessible to everyone in the hotel even with the jacuzzi which also means the jacuzzi is outside why no jacuzzi inside the steam room is small and there is no sauna there are only shower cabins with shampoo and shower gel but no air conditioner the lounge area is also small and not at all relaxing and the bathrobes are super thin with a cold room which is not even nice and not very big I had to sit very carefully so as not to expose myself to everyone hello hah the massage itself was very nice but the spa is not relaxing especially for the prices I wouldn't go back to the spa even though the gym is good
the only good thing is the cheesecake, the food is terribly mediocre and I hate how they all seem decorated like ruins, I want damn food, not an expedition with Fernando

I love this facility, it's clean and bright, it has an indoor track, a good number of cardin and weight machines, it has a great indoor basketball court which is sometimes used for extreme workouts and volleyball, it has some nice aerobics rooms as well as a few racketball courts and a climbing wall to boot. lap swim is pushed to early afternoon to accommodate the local swim team, these times don't work for me also during the summer there were close to swimmers per lane teen lifeguards don't enforce slow to fast lane designations and don't remind people to swim in circles. I've never had good lap swimming practice but the pool is immaculately maintained and the changing room is nice except during the summer when the kids make anything sticky a great facility overall.
Pipeline had this resort as its star, but it seems like the employees are nice even though its wife and grounds are nice.

my wife and friends went for lunch the other day and i liked it so i thought i would try this nice place, good menu, good choices, i had the meatball hero lunch, special good meatballs from the meatball hero with extra marinara for the cheese to make it a meatball part, it was way too big for lunch, i would have been happy with half of it with a handful of chips and a pickle spear of charcuterie or peperoni on the side vs just the hero sitting on the plate solo, I hope the owner reads yelp, I'll go back and try something else good the food is well located, it should do well, who mounted all these nice TVs in there, shaquille oneal, your neck hurts watching this high ps, hey food runner when you deliver a slice of pizza and it starts to slide off the plate, don't use not your bare hand to move the disgusting pizza, you know you saw me, look at you doing that too

ok, there you go, I'll start with the bad and end positively regarding the pizza, that's what we went for, I wasn't very impressed, I have to say I'm more my style by the sliced pizza kind of thing, so the pizza didn't hit the spot, maybe a bit too fancy for my palette, you can take a boy out of the ghetto but you can't take the boy out of the ghetto, so for me simple food is always better, obviously there are enough people who love gourmet pizza because this place has amazing reviews so I'm just a simple guy. a fat obnoxious chick sitting right behind me proclaimed to her friend that I no longer invest time in men who aren't available, put the pizza down, get a dry salad and shut up, it's not really the restaurant's fault, but I had to endure this convoy for the duration of my meal. pancake with Stella chocolate powdered sugar and ice cream and it was very very good, I would be willing to come back here and try something other than pizza

I want to get the garage running smoothly it's still a work in progress although three of us visited two weeks ago we were seated right next to a group of year old ladies for a surprise birthday party what is this anyway do you really need to go to a small restaurant with your pack of girls and take up a lot of the dining room do you need all the paraphernalia collages centerpieces hats I've been waiting for seriously seeing a young birthday girl no she was the oldest your age while you're at it you're not a size six plus needless to say it was loud at least one of the party goers apologized right when we sat down like it was a conciliation for the volume snickering first in the garage has good beer it's not a huge quantity but what they have is quality we had wings and deviled eggs with truffle oil both were great I had shrines sausage flatbread and it was great my wife had something I forgot and said it was good friend had a great salad and said it was good too overall the food was better than most so why the three stars you ask for service why do cool places get it wrong it's because they hire nice people or friends who don't want to not really working first on a waiter we were seated at the entrance exit to the kitchen dropped a glass bottle of ketchup five feet from my foot my wife and I had splashes on our jeans and glasses near our sandal clad feet barely a response we were handed a cloth our waiter didn't wonder so friendly oh they almost dropped a bottle of ketchup on you the rest of the night seemed just a little disorganized and not relaxed every waiter seemed in weeds or confused, empty beer and water glasses arrived and empty monkey plates sat there for three for monkey dinner and beers

the people stocking the shelves while cleaning the floors or behind the counter have all been polite so far. I don't have anything really bad to say but nothing really great either, keep persevering, maybe I'll write another review when something scandalous happens, happy.

I came back Sunday afternoon and was pleasantly surprised. Happy hour takes place every day of the week. I received excellent service at the bar which was friendly, quick and efficient. Janessa, I ordered a few drafts and wings with good prices for happy hour, I will be back.

sorry I'm going to get killed here, I'm not very impressed, I was hearing about this place and it was so, at best, the food is sloppy and very expensive but tastes decent, the place was also a bit dirty, just a bunch of sandwiches and the pizza was a disaster, go here if you like quirky places that charge a lot and aren't the best, the waitress seemed concerned about it which is none of our business.

I think Sorta's high reviews must simply be a function of the limited dining options at Fountain Hills, because it's the worst excuse for tapas I've ever had. We walked in and were greeted by a strange musty smell that remained pervasive throughout the meal. We should have taken this as an indication of what was to come and left, but based on the good reviews I decided to stay. turned around and got a prune juice flavor or if that taste was intentional we ordered the olives, fried potatoes, grilled zucchini, shia peppers and four different types of bruschetta. The olives were very difficult to mess up, but also contained compensating capers which we avoided. we chose to avoid the fat which he obviously added to the zucchini, the shia peppers had no spice or flavor and were absolutely swimming in oil. I've never had a roasted pepper so drenched in grease that the waitress asked us if we didn't like the peppers when she noticed all but a few were left and when we pointed out how fatty they were, they politely removed them from the bill. The four pieces of bruschetta were all different varieties. Roasted eggplant, ripe tomatoes, avocado and beans. and grilled artichokes with cheese, the bread was thick and chewy and none of the bruschettas had much flavor. In fact, I think if I had just closed my eyes and picked one at random from the plate, I probably wouldn't have been able to tell which one it was. The fried potato wedges were actually the best part of the meal, which is sad when the best item is a simple fried potato. The toilets were extremely dark and filled with unlit votive candles, so I'm not sure if this was an attempt at cost cutting, but if I had known that, I would have happily spared a box of patterns from home just to create some sort of ambiance while we ate. The place is also incredibly small so I have no idea where the flamenco band and dancers that other reviews have talked about would be performing if anyone tried to move there they would literally bump into the tables whereas I love tapas style meals if this was the only tapas restaurant there was one I would happily forgo the experience needless to say we won't be back

I love supporting these local businesses in my neighborhood and you should too if I worked in the area this would be in my lunch rotation, the customer service here is awesome, it seems like they really care if you enjoy the food you ordered, I appreciate that and think they deserve a huge shout out for that one, the hours are pretty ridiculous, they close during the week and are open Saturday. real excitement, sirach chili sauce helps, but i love this stuff, it's a solid choice, even if it doesn't stretch the imagination

I've been going to pita since they were take out only in the next few years they are getting too big for their britches they started franchising they hired corporate morons and that's where it started to fail, chicken has always been great but it's faltering, there was never a better hummus on the planet until they added all the red oil, be very careful with the seafood. I absolutely love the seafood dishes here fantastic, but they made me sick on more than one occasion. I was even hospitalized once because of shellfish. I have good friends who are still managers so I go back every now and then to see them they aren't as thrilled either too bad all good things must come to an end it was the best undiscovered Arizona gem in years updated more red oil pretty solid but not what it used to be the lentil salad still kicks

this place is so cool the menus are on the walls in Sharpie with the signatures of lots of local athletes, they won't present you with a bill but rather trust you to tell them what you ordered and pay the correct amount the food is excellent artery clogging and comes in huge portions. I love smothered chicken with yams and green beans and I order it every time I still want to sleep the rest of the day also Saturday they do a great rib plate, a good place for those who work or live in the city.

the experience we had was just good food service and wine list were all good. The salad bar was good too. I'm not sure I'll go out of my way to go back, although there are plenty of funky, hip places to dine in the Scottsdale area and this one seems to be like Scottsdale's grandpa dining older and almost quaint.

Tried this for the first time today while my husband's French toast was wonderful and the kids enjoyed their meal. My biscuits and gravy tasted similar to bacon grease and flour. I sent it back and tried something else, which is what I wish I had done, but the server never came back to us until my family had finished their meal.

I started a new job and the bosses brought us here for lunch it was ok I had a combo meal for lunch but I didn't pay the service was really excellent but the food wasn't just plain it's convenient to work so I'll probably come back I just won't have very high expectations

good very good cb average all around the decor was rustic and lodge-like but still open and modern no complaints here aesthetically pleasing and lacking the bright colors and loud mariachi music of more traditional mexican restaurants the table we were seated at seemed to have been randomly wiped down not totally clean our server was fine also quite friendly but generally seemed disinterested in her job and us and wasn't very knowledgeable about the food she was serving the food was good the salsa served with the Fries were perfectly fine enough fresh but not very flavorful, a theme we would soon learn would repeat throughout our dining experience. We started with the avocado spring rolls with a honey cilantro dip. These were the highlight of the meal. The sweet sauce complimented the creamy taste of the avocado well. My only complaint was the price of the standard size spring rolls which seemed a bit steep for what it was but still very tasty. in the first place a lot more standard mexican restaurants wouldn't like them to have more spices the rice side was pretty good but not as tasty as i thought it would be like the veggie tacos are also served with some sort of pickled cabbage and onion salad because the borracho beans that come with the other dishes are cooked with bacon the coleslaw was also good in general the food was okay but a little bland i should also mention that the portions are pretty reasonable two small veggie tacos and a little rice and coleslaw sometimes the portions as more traditional Mexican restaurants are absurdly gargantuan it was nice to see a normal sized, relatively healthy looking Mexican meal full disclosure here our visit to Black Chili was prompted by a card we received in the mail good for any meal so we figured it was worth a shot and it was but maybe not a return visit our discount bill for appetizers and two sodas came if it wasn't at the Baltimore, I say it was a bit steep but given the location it's probably on the verge of going back if the food had appealed to me, especially since it's in my neighborhood but it's not so a return visit is unlikely, there are enough solid, star-studded places around that don't usually make me a repeat customer

the place is ok, I'm just not a big fan of what they have to offer, it's funny to read some of the complaints, people have a good grip, the food is good, the place is cafe style so your service is really up to you, the cookies are really good, my wife enjoys their sandwiches.

this pei wei complies with his orders being proper and clean, my only wish is that the parking lot he shares with the Starbucks sidebar is for larger cars, I don't see that happening, but a girl can wish that, can't she

they had to have a slammed lunch as I arrived by the time I came back from the old station and for a new place the counters were dirty, I hate when the counter eats in the dining room I feel like I'm bothering them, the vegetarian choices are limited and the ones that were good for the money, I ate that at another place in Mesa and enjoyed it more, I won't go back to this one, but if someone else paid and didn't If I didn't give in to other suggestions, I wouldn't die from it either.

this place was just eh for me i was just overwhelmed nor the bar service it leaves little to be desired im not sure what it is like in Scottsdale restaurants thinking they must be snobbish towards people we ordered drinks from a unfriendly bartender and then waited a few more minutes to even be recognized again the food was good the berrimundi he liked but wasn't crazy about the side he came with i had the meatloaf which was good the sauce and the mashed potatoes had a great creamy flavor my sister had the lamb burger with cold fries and not very good tasting there isn't much on the wine list either I probably wouldn't come here again because I don't think it was worth waiting an hour for the crappy service at the bar I would rather venture down the olive and ivy route

I agree with Amanita if you have to shop at a whole foods store this is the one. The only attitude I got was from a few shoppers in cougaresque velor tracksuits, not the staff who were all refreshingly friendly if you stray from the traditional essentials, they are surprisingly price competitive or even cheaper than mass market grocers for normal food, they are still whole foods and still often outrageously expensive, their meat section usually makes me laugh, but if you are looking for something quite bizarre even the sprouts don't contain it there Chances are whole foods will contain it, but they will have an employee who can tell you everything.
the food was marginal, the Sunday brunch prices were stupid and I felt like I was in a New Orleans nightclub, Sunday morning choices
just ok we had the italian stallion it tasted very good but between adults left us quite hungry for money it seemed to be more of an appetizer
I thought the place had a lot to offer with the atmosphere and the ingredients used in all the dishes. I just thought the menu spoke louder than the dish.

one of the worst experiences of my life my friends and I decided to go check out this place because the local radio kept talking about it so the day we decided to go the Colbert Report guy was there making fun of the restaurant and we went there and we thought hey wow this is pretty cool because they were talking about the monstrous proportions of burgers and fries fried in lard but once the food came we sat down and well that the waiters were scantily clad, they all had cottage cheese legs and thighs, we sat down and my friend decides to do their super burger challenge, she said if he finishes his lab burger his meal will be taken home, he kills it and when we ask why his burger wasn't free we couldn't find the waitress anymore and the owner tells us either you pay or I come to the counter, he threatened us with violence which is stupid because all we were doing was to ask what the waitress said to us we would never go there again being Asian he also spat racist slurs at us calling us to go back to where we came from all of us were born and raised in Arizona so I don't know where we would go anyway don't go there either all the customers were all middle aged men who instead of paying attention to their wives and kids were hiding in a bad restaurant that is burgers which aren't even really toasted. If you're a lonely loser, this is the place for you. If you're a fancy guy who wants real food, go to any other generic burger joint and you'll be happier.

friendly and prompt, although I had to point out a few places where extra attention was needed, the tar on one side was initially observed as paint scratches until I told them to check it again. I also found a few spots that could use another wipe or two with a towel and the sunglasses case was never touched and therefore dirty. Make sure you visit at the beginning of the week and not on the weekend to get the best deals I paid for interior and exterior details. I am so pleased with the overall results that the areas between the bottom of my car seats and the floor are completely free of embedded food debris, I live in the middle of the desert after all due to a few accidents over the years

I ate here at lunch today for the first time, eh, that's all I can say, I came and even though no one was behind me in line, the asshole at the counter made me feel very rushed. I ordered a turkey tom, it was basically a big dried out white sandwich with a few slices of turkey, a boat of shredded lettuce, a few slices of tomato and some mayonnaise. one piece of cookie is not even worth eating the whole cookie, really, I see no reason to come back and I don't understand how they can call themselves gourmets

this mimic is near the range complex where we were attending a tournament so after we came here the short version is it's like the mimic in chandler the food is good not great but well the service was ok also everyone enjoyed their food i had the chicken pot pie none of it really struck me as french which is a mimic pattern but it was good actually the kid had chicken ricotta which is italian not french they have quiche so maybe it's enough to claim to be a branch shaped bistro not in my book honestly anyway I call this place average really I should give it stars but it's not an option with yelp a good place to stop if you're in the area and looking for food you could do a lot worse

Totally disappointed, I had bought a voucher from Travelog to try this restaurant and given the location I would have thought it was going to be very high end and we were expecting a lot more. The service was great but the food wasn't worth it. The restaurant itself is very outdated. My husband and I had the crab cakes for appetizer, they were cold when they were served. ounce of this was pure fat and for the price you would expect to get more meat than fat, I ordered a wild mushroom pizza which was ok, this place needs a major overhaul if they want to make money at the restaurant which for a Saturday night at o'clock when we went was empty, I think the highlight of the meal was the cabinet bottle

we made the trek from north Phoenix to get authentic ramen. I wanted to love this place and I wanted it to be worth the trip but it just wasn't the decor, as previously described you kind of go back to the years but it is clean and well loved by its owner. try again for donburis

this place is great to pop in and take a look at the plethora of neat toys and candy they have, but that's about it, the prices are way too high and a lot of the items are not things you can't find anywhere else, they also have a real lack of imported candy. said it was a unique and really cool local business and I love the idea behind it but I don't have a lot of free money to spend on a bag of gummy bears that I can buy at Circle K for cheaper, it's definitely a place for gifting only and not just when you want something sweet to eat

sad, I really wanted to like this place, I really enjoyed the farmhouse but I will review it separately we were greeted by a busy waiter who quickly pointed out self serve drinks, coffee, tea, water and lemonade and we were off and running. We helped ourselves to coffee and lemonade before receiving our menus which indicated what each drink was. no great the concept is great but the way the dishes are prepared is super disappointing

I don't really like this KFC or any other for that matter, every time I've been here the place is dirty, I know they remodeled the place and I haven't been there since so I'm not sure the conditions are the same, the food is just not good at all anymore, not that it was ever great but you could get decent chicken and sides and settle for what they did to the mac and cheese, it's so much the color of the crosstie is just not appealing and the taste is worse. The food at this place has been served at temperature enough times to keep me from coming back

I will never go back, so disappointed when I went to it's a lovely store, don't get me wrong I would buy so much there for my dog ​​but the day I left I went to get a treat for my dog ​​for his birthday. The lady was on the phone the whole time talking about personal matters while my mother and I stood there waiting for her to come down or put the person on hold. It pissed me off because she hung up the phone to say goodbye but not to get a fucking sale. I'll continue to be smart about trying to support a local business, but I guess when you own your own place you can have poor customer service.

good atmosphere inside and out with competent service but the food is not great, very boring, reminds me of the food they serve at Chevrolet but much more expensive, I really have no desire to go back to Scottsdale and any attempt at ethnic food just doesn't mix well.

I used to go there all the time when I was there and on my last trip I noticed some changes in the stores from what I remember, the food court has a good variety but not much. I think the management company has neglected this place for too long.

nice place with average food and terrible service, everything took forever and no one came to check on us, we literally watched our waiter go around the tables and remove napkins from empty tables rather than making himself available to us.
so sad closed well

we left on Sunday just a few days after opening, in all honesty I have to agree with most of the other reviews, even though they are new these things are serviceable so I hope the comments are taken in the right direction, the building is very cool and the atmosphere was energetic on a sunny Sunday morning, there was an abundance of servers but they seemed confused and frantic with no real focus on the customer. arrive even though we saw them sitting at the bar the whole time our water was just gone then the food I ordered the grilled cheese a rare treat and when I order it I want it good it was cold and overwhelmed with thick bread the cheese wasn't melted I sent it back and they just bombed it and took it out disgusting. omelette with several extra toppings the eggs tasted like boxed eggs and it was dull and flavorless we even took the time to give feedback to management but gave a weak smile and came back and tried again he made no effort to fix things either by preparing anything else to taste or by encouraging people to come back there are too many restaurants in town to have to go to a less than mediocre restaurant young people may like it for the bar atmosphere he gives but the majority of tables on Sunday morning were families or middle aged and we saw similar responses at other tables

I've only been here once and for good reason, the service was seriously lacking. I walked in and nothing, they didn't ask if I needed help looking for something, greet me or even greet me until I was about to pay. I guess the magazine the cashier was reading was very important. I've been to several comic book stores and I don't need anyone to hold my hand. I would just like a common courtesy on the positive, it was an organized place and the selection was pretty good.

I ordered here before the generals chicken, beef and broccoli but tonight we had the worst coconut shrimp we've ever had, the average was so bland and the coconut shrimp breading was so thick and nasty I can't even identify what type of breading they used, it actually ruined the sauce.

I really don't understand why everyone raves about this place. I've been here twice and ordered the carne asama burrito. The portions are really small for the price they charge. There is too much tortilla for the meat. I think this place is overrated and there are better places for carne asama in the valley.

my and I drove up from the city parking lot and met some friends here for brunch, we didn't have to wait long to be seated which was great, the waitress came over and took our drink order and right away she didn't seem too happy so I ordered an omelette and asked for turkey sausage instead of the toast or pancakes that came with it, she looked at me like I was asking for a cure for cancer and started to saying I should be charged full price, well duh, I was kinda thinking and since I asked it was probably ok, needless to say we waited to get our food we had to ask her because my omelette was cold I didn't get the turkey sausage I ordered but she added it to the check, thank goodness we had a group otherwise it would have been a total loss, the breakfast club in the old town is better

the owner of Vermont Sandwich Co just contacted me and offered to fix what happened to me on my last visit, nice gesture but I had to decline. I didn't write what I did for a document but I give this place one more star for the deal. Vermont Sandwich Co is highly rated so that the owner trying to correct by one negative reviewer among a multitude of positive ones says something about the integrity of the owners. I think a return visit to Vermont Sandwich Co might be in order.
dirty place bad food tasteless rude waitress yuck

I really wanted to enjoy my experience at Indulge, but I didn't read the local magazine reviews on the website and going by that, I expected it to be a slightly upscale neighborhood restaurant, but it's really no different than a fuddruckers. We were disappointed with the food and hated the environment. Two of us built our own burgers and one ordered a remade choice from the menu. We had the dill chips and fried pickles as an appetizer. interested in going back, it just wasn't any better than what you could make at home and I burn soup, the tables were too close together and the place was uncomfortably noisy our servers were trying to clear plates as soon as one of us put a fork down, no one was waiting for our table and asking for our dessert orders while we were still eating, the whole experience was rushed, uncomfortable and not engaging in any way, I'm so disappointed

as it was a small local place that I always passed by I decided to try it sometime, the decor is so beyond needing an update that it needs a complete renovation if you had a visit from Mr. Ramsey he would say oh damn if you thought the location was great and I think the restaurant has the potential to do better than it is. special and for breakfast for two I wouldn't go back there are so many great restaurants in the area and I love supporting local businesses but this place just needs to start from scratch to make it great

I stopped by late one night, just one guy who probably worked the manager-owner, as he was on the phone and looked like he wanted to avoid his attitude and not wear anything. Quizzes related to most workers make substandard food, it's a chain, it's hard to screw up, but he did it. I asked what size cup to get and he said oh you wanted a drink of course I wanted a fucking drink I just looked at him like a man told him to keep his drink because he has to rerun my card really it's a chain that gives you all the equipment and training to make a sandwich like the other quizzes across the country and you can't do it if you hate customer service don't buy a two star franchise sandwich shop lucky you its not one, I am absent

I tried rare earths for the first time solo, it's often a good way to discover a new restaurant. I sat at the bar which has surprisingly uncomfortable seats, very hard seats that cut into the back of my knees. The wine selection is nice, not big but two or three choices of each variety. I ordered a glass of wine, a small house salad and a pizza. The server being the bar was professionally friendly then the wait started fifteen minutes went by and I still didn't have a salad. the status of the salad but gave the excuse that several people had come around the same time as me a few minutes later my salad and pizza came out at the same time very disappointing I wanted to eat my salad but I didn't want my pizza to get cold note it is an extremely thin pizza like a cracker crust it cools very quickly the waiter offered to send the pizza back to keep it hot but as there were fresh tomatoes on it I didn't want the pizza to be ruined the house salad was fresh, good ones mushrooms and shaved pecorino cheese there were lots of red onions and the house dressing was very strong and vinegary for me the onion and vinegar were just overwhelming and I would not order this particular salad again the pizza had a good amount of toppings and held together quite well even considering how thin the crust was. I would like to try this restaurant again as there were several things on the menu that sounded really good stars for the pizza stars for the salad I ordered and stars for the service

I took my family here for dinner the burgers were really good I got the regular burger and really liked it it was better than most fast food chains but I rate it below the high end burgers from places like fuddruckers or red robin for the price although I was very satisfied my one year old daughter really liked her cheese burger but my other girls didn't like the grilled cheese at all. the sundaes and milkshakes looked really appealing, we will try them next time

it's good to know they still have independent films and have chosen wisely what to play, unfortunately this place seems to attract yuppies. I was shocked at how many middle aged and even elderly people were in Camelview, it was a disappointment
the service was terrible and the food was mediocre at best, I will not return

I wanted to love this place so much considering I lived in Venezuela and hadn't tasted this country food in years but it pains me to write that I was quite disappointed that the waiter who supposedly owns the restaurant is a very nice guy but I forgot my stepson's food and I didn't realize until he dropped off our food my achee was burnt and dripping with butter don't get me wrong the cachapas usually rock with butter but it oozed everywhere, the area was pretty decent and the only light economy of the meal but overall this experience left me wanting more

you'll feel like you've stepped into a time machine and landed in the decor that hasn't been updated in at least years, it looks like it's falling apart, the TVs are mostly S style, although there are a few flat screens too, that's where the trash cans hang in all colors, the pizza was greasy, which I like, but also chewy, which was disgusting, the wings were so drowned in sauce you couldn't find them, might as well get a glass of honey and drink it straight, the service was interesting, the guy working there I wore capri pants and had a higher voice than my girlfriend. The price wasn't bad. I think it was like a large pizza, wings and soda. I'd rather pay a little more and go eat superior pizza on the street.

if we hadn't arrived after a tiring day and paid in advance online I would have checked for missing furniture, safety bar cut, faceplates for wiring, furniture handles missing, bobby pins missing and leftover items on the carpet not vacuumed up.

Been here for a few happy hours, I agree with Charles, no need to pay full price, especially since the regular prices are a bit high and it's better than ra, it's definitely not the best sushi I've had in town, but the drinks are good. Cucumber monitor and the place is well set up for happy hour groups. The servers I have encountered are all very patient with people coming and going within the group and individual checks for everyone knowing how painful it is. happy hour it's a great place and the Tempe Market location is convenient for several friends

ok, I usually write longer and more complex reviews about a restaurant, but for this new establishment I will summarize great decor and ambience, but friendly service from flat screens would be better, but needs more training in food and knowledge about cooking timing. If a table has two or more people, the food should come out at or around the same time, especially when they are not sharing food. If you specialize in spring rolls, make sure they are rolled competently. for the spring rolls, the rotating flavors for the rolls are not good value for some items, but I agree with other reviews that for most items the price is a little high for the neighborhood business and the quality of the food offered overall, a nice place to have a drink with friends and a snack before dinner elsewhere. i believe the owner or chef is inexperienced, i hope this will improve the guys work

we had our first experience on a friday night about the waiters were pleasant the wild tiger has a nice patio overlooking the center but it was a little too hot and they didn't have a misting system the interior was clean with a combo bar and show kitchen we started with the fresh rolls with hot peanut sauce and a nice lychee martini but not the best in town the pure sushi bar has one to die for lychee and lemon the starters are huge and could easily be shared we had the know hot and spicy clear noodles chicken broccoli snow peas sweet onion thai chili garlic and basil mild thai delicious to be fair thai is not one of my favorites but we like to support local restaurants and this came highly recommended glad to have tried it and for those of you who like it hot and spicy wild tiger has got you covered

me and three girlfriends went to pétanque for a happy hour after reading all the wonderful reviews on yap, i was really excited when going there but felt disappointed for me, it was a bit big on commercial, the decor was a bit cheesy, i think the red leather chairs are important wall lights, even a red velvet torn lounge hardly original or intimate enough to be considered an authentic wine bar in my opinion, if you are a chain regular of restaurants, you'll probably think it's a cute place, call me a snob whatever. we are talking about the wine list at this wine bar, it was ok but they were out of our first two choices of red, it was not ideal for a wine bar, then we ordered our skewer for our table of four and were annoyed when it came out cut in half knowing we were sharing the plate, maybe the waitress should have told us, we ended up ordering a second plank for the table so we could each try the variety, I have to say that the skewer was good, we were clearly there for happy hour on a Wednesday evening which I love until lunchtime, but I found it a bit rude that the waitress came six minutes past the hour to ask us if we wanted a second round, there was no grace period so we paid full price, we noticed our full price wine glasses were filled to the brim so maybe the price of the wine don't get me wrong, the place is quite cute, this would seem like a fancy hangout if I was still in college, I would go back with girlfriends but won't go back with my husband, I would have liked to try more food because that seems to be the key to that the ambiance and service of the place is good, not great, oh and the music could use updating, the playlet was interesting, maybe it's my love for the post or maybe it's because I was on Mill Avenue, I instantly judged the place

ok so i haven't been to a buffet in a long time when i'm thinking about the idea of sweet tomato buffets excluded because a lot of salad means a lot of good for you, i feel like i've used the most buffets in my college life where the dining halls were all you can eat anyway, this place just opened and is within walking distance from my house so my neighbors and i decided to check it out overall i didn't not very impressed with the food even in comparison to other chinese food buffets i have been to in the past besides a standard selection of chinese buffet dishes beef with broccoli fried rice sweet and sour chicken they have sushi pizzas for the kids i guess and a hibachi grill section where you can choose veggies and meats and they will stir fry them for you included in the buffet price the hibachi stir fry i made was ok but the added sauce was too salty for me the Sushi was bland and what you would expect from a grocery store, they only had regular high sodium soy sauce, as far as I could tell I tried to ask one of the servers for low sodium soy sauce and there was a language barrier, he brought another staff member back to our table who also didn't understand what I was asking. The egg roll I tried was really salty even without sauce and nothing special. Sweet and sour sauce can usually make even mediocre egg rolls worth eating, but the ss sauce on the buffet was a downright scary koolaidred color, but the fresh pineapple and melon was a nice touch, as were the different flavors of ice cream on the other end of the line, I will say it was pretty cheap per adult, so if you're looking for a lot of food on a budget, this might be a decent option for you personally, even if I just think I'm past the days of eating foods with scary salt levels and artificial colors.

I loved the old menu but the changes made me change my mind, they had the best sandwiches, it was always quiet until you could sit down and eat, the new menu is ok, we liked what we got but we would have left if it wasn't happy hour even though the portions are large, maybe too large, the prices are delayed now the Buffalo chicken offerings were pretty good but maybe too spicy in a bad way. the waiters are generally slow and quite inattentive but the menu brought us back sad to see it change this way

after stopping at Gallo Blanc for breakfast our second and final time, I wonder when the last time Doug Robson set foot in his establishment, we have been going to Gallo Blanc since it opened on a regular basis and finally decided to try breakfast a few weeks ago. When we decided to try again, we arrived about a few minutes after they opened, desperately wanting to guess what the bartender hadn't come yet to go somewhere else, we really wanted a non-judgmental Bloody Mary when she arrived and we walked by and asked if she could make heathens. for hiring a parade of careless, unsupervised mailers who are slowly ruining the excellent reputation that Robson worked so hard to earn

I've been coming here for a little over a year and I can't say I've ever been really impressed. Yes, they wash your car by hand, but I feel like they are the only pro when it comes to cleaning my car. I was never really happy with the vacuum cleaner. I'm not sure they really do anything other than rugs. tires even a stranger told me how strange he found it they missed it they also asked for air freshener and when I got in my car it still smelled like mom it didn't smell fresh and clean I just left there and again I had to ask them to clean the inside door it was covered in dirt and dead grass how did you miss that when I called someone to clean it he then noticed that the windshield was always dirty I mean really and again no air freshener even though I asked for it I gave stars instead of because I appreciate that it's not a chain I'd rather give my money to a family place than a corporate trash the tall blonde woman who greets you is always very nice and helpful I like that I'm not in a rush to get my windshield or cracks fixed a million times and sometimes they have deals on Livingsocial which is great overall I feel like it's a good place to come and just have the surface of your car washed unless you want to pay a lot of money to see a difference inside your car make sure to check your car before you leave to make sure they actually cleaned everything

upon check in I was greeted by the general manager, it was nice talking to you Michael, I hope to see you at the Weston La Palma, the Sheraton is ideal for an overnight stay if you plan on going to the airport. I stayed with my family for one night and took a shuttle to the airport at 10:00, so early, but my driver was very friendly. the bathroom is a bit small, the dressing table is limited but well stocked and you get a loofa. My little sister and my mother also enjoyed the pool. A nice little patio to enjoy your room too if I ever have to fly from Phoenix or to Phoenix and have to stay during my choice, it's definitely Sheraton Phoenix Airport.

I came here one morning a few weeks ago, had about a few minutes before my appointment at the mayonnaise clinic, so I figured a small stack of banana walnut pancakes would get me in and out quickly. I thought the bad staff was friendly enough, but it took at least a few minutes for the server to finally take my order. banana walnut pancakes, they were blueberries delivered by another waiter, my waiter came over to ask if I needed anything else, I heard my complaint and went back to the kitchen to correct it. I was assured it would only take a few minutes to get a new batch, but another few minutes passed before the correct order arrived. Keep in mind it's already been at least a few minutes since I sat down, I only had a few minutes to spare, not enough to enjoy these delicious cakes, the blueberry compote ended up containing corn syrup, the ingredient I was trying to avoid by not using the pancake syrup, but it's difficult. for me to resist blueberry compote, so if I have to suffer, I'll probably visit copies again the next time I'm out and about and have a craving for pancakes, but only if I have a few minutes or more to spare

absolutely waste of time, this establishment doesn't bother to check in with the host for seating as I saw many people sitting although there was a minute wait for others, the rude and indifferent staff could possibly be where all the waiters go who can't get a job in another constraint, a complete shame, I would never give such a place my hard earned money, I suggest you do the same

I loved seeing the Cezanne collection, it's exactly as illustrated in the book I spent time reading about his works and his influence on composition and form, like other museums I've visited, you really can't take photos of their best exhibit, it's definitely a place to wander around for a few hours when you don't feel rushed. I wanted to be surprised to see classical sculptures and handmade artwork and I didn't see any here because I'm very particular about historical eras and movements of interest. High-end borrowed art and a location like this in Phoenix make it a must for residents to see what the civic offerings offer from time to time. This place is half a block from the streetcar, which makes it convenient
