usually i give a place that is in the middle of good and bad multiple odds, for some reason it's easier for me to mark or mark a place after the first visit rather than yapping, stars are not a bad thing, asking for the scene is strange, it's a mix of typical arcadia scottsdale and as this place is more of a sports bar than anything in my eyes with better food than your typical sports bar fare, seriously there is like tvs here the service is quack the food is fresh the portions are very large some things teeter on decenttobland while other things are rather bloated the mac and cheese is a pass in my opinion and not worth it for the small cup you get ah contradictory to my large portions note some dishes taste overpowering while others leave you wondering if you are eating the food or chewing the crunchy water that seems disgusting now that I've typed it the list of beers and liquor is pretty typical nothing to note really a few changes here and there and I could see it as a really decent place, the same could be true for the food I'll be back again, the garage just didn't blow me away but also on a funnier note the garage easily reads like trash on the menu which was pretty comical

yes there is a real bull and a slide, this place has been around forever, I think my parents used to go there in the 90's, I can't say much about the food as I'm only here for happy hour which was pretty decent.

The best time to workout at this gym is early in the morning, I've been several times in the afternoon and it's usually packed. This place has everything I need to work out on a treadmill, weight machines, basketball court, swimming pool and sauna. I rarely see broken out-of-service machines, although the men's sauna bench was broken for maybe months before they finally fixed it.

the owner was dishonest, she posted a menu outside with lower prices to attract traffic then charged a higher priced menu inside, she also charged me sales tax which is illegal in tempe which suppose to be very rude and not recommended

i have been to oh on numerous occasions the night usually goes a little like this i walk up to the entrance i see people smoking outside in a small fenced area i look over and see these groups are looking at me like i have just blatantly readjusted myself in public i give them one more look and realize that in two hours we will all be best friends exchanging pointless stories about our days when in reality i don't give a damn about their new kitten they have adopted and named sunburn but in a few hours I will flourish and cherish each of them their stories and I am amazed that I have never found such intellectual people sooner before I get to the door I feel eyes spying on me I look up to find one of the hostesses looking out the window ready to open the door a second before reaching for it you can't beat them at this price I have tried many times they are good at this they do, just prepare for it and accept it as I enter my eyes I automatically apply it to the top of the bar, I scan up and down the row of seats as I scan down I see two empty seats, I'm not. sure if man code applies to bar seating like bathroom urinals you know what i'm talking about but i usually start the evening without giving anything because i already know things are only going to get downhill from here anyway i start with a big miller light and watch the game playing on tv i continue my beer almost empty then i order beer battered buffalo chicken tenders with extra ranch i stare in the reflection from my phone to make sure my face isn't suddenly disfigured because she looks at me like I just asked for an order of wine and chive toast, I explain that I'm looking to get the beer battered buffalo wings, then she calls for reinforcements like I'm speaking a foreign language, hey Lacey, this guy wants beer battered buffalo chicken wings, they say some things are a little fumble, then come back with, so you want chicken tenders and ranch, I explain to them again, they both tilt their heads to the side, either this beer slammed me and I'm talking nonsense about it or they just don't understand what buffalo wings are, you want a cheeseburger and a side of buffalo sauce, sir, they do a little more team planning and come up with a solution and I end up with bone dry beer battered chicken tenders without sauce and a side of buffalo sauce my friend gets the opposite when we both ordered the same thing except he doesn't have buffalo sauce and a side of ranch, I find that it bothers me less and less each time because I expect it now, their food is really good and their service was bad, I mentioned that their food is really good, I look back, I acted very smoothly and without worries, only to realize that I was watching women's tennis on the television next to me for a few minutes while everyone is intently watching the football match. I'm not ashamed to admit that I continued to watch it. I think it was the loud growling that caught my attention. wait no it's not, it's a dollar, no, it was a dollar no, that was last month, it's money per hour, better empty those pockets, just remember that for every hour you waste gambling you could have fed starving Ethiopians for a month, but in your drunken state you chose to serve like me and play pool or ping pong. she looks at you funny, it's either because you asked her twin or because you asked for buffalo chicken tenders, also if you stay late enough the cops hide and wait for you to leave the parking lot as soon as you get out, but of course you have a designated driver overall the food I ordered was excellent the service was the food was really good

I was really disappointed with my local fresh baba this evening, the lobby salsa bar and even the drinks station were very dirty and poorly maintained. Additionally, my salad had old, dark-colored guacamole and limp lettuce. I hope they read this and do a better job cleaning.

So, following the previously reviewed experience, I received a phone call from the doctor who was very determined to make the situation right, he did everything necessary to make sure we were sure he appreciated our business and apologized for the unacceptable wait the day before. This is precisely how any business should respond to a poor customer experience. The next visit to complete the wisdom teeth extraction consultation was very quick, as was our visit on the day of the operation.

their salad bar here is lacking. I used to go for whole foods when I was too lazy to prepare anything, but I didn't want to feel guilty about eating out. The people who work here are friendly and they have a great selection of canned vegetables for salads as well as other specialties that may be harder to find here. They also have the largest selection of Amy organic frozen foods which I love in my tofu pockets.

absolutely the best sushi in the valley, hands down, the fish is fresh and their spicy tuna is like no other, but the service is extremely slow. We already waited for a few minutes to get our lunch and the restaurant wasn't even full, I can't say much about the food cooked, but the sushi is amazing.

hell I've been here a dozen times and it's such a mixed bag, the best and worst of times, although the last two times for late night drinking with friends have been quite fun, the drinks are cheap and the crowd is lively so for now I'll suggest dos gringos to the college drunk, professional after afternoon drinker, bring friends

Had dinner here for the first time this evening, the wasabi food is definitely not authentic Mediterranean cuisine but I don't think that was the first thing we noticed when we walked in, it was the volume way too loud from an acoustician's point of view, all the hard surfaces and cavernous dining area make for a very loud joint. and vegetables with the dressing, unfortunately it was a bit of a miss for me, the rice was quite mushy and just didn't hold up to the weight of the lentils, the taste itself was quite good but I couldn't get past the texture also if you order this dish be aware that the level of pulses far exceeds that of the vegetables, a huge portion, which is great for the wallet, but beware if you are looking at cars, the salad below was actually refreshing, but overall the dish just wasn't for me. dolmans which were quite good served cold although a little too full for my liking our server was very good very accommodating with special requests the service was a positive definitely although I didn't like the food here it was tasty enough for me to come back and try again

as for amber, these are points that I rate the food, not the containers or the owners, if it makes you feel better eating substandard food because of the American spirit, whether others of us are more concerned about the food itself, I am not downgrading it because it is not a sit down restaurant, even among non catering restaurants or fast food style Indian themed restaurants, this place is mediocre. I have eaten at fast Indian restaurants and they are much better than this one. who appreciate text service, cute containers, and chatty owners, I want to support family-owned, local restaurants, but I also want to support the good ones and not encourage the bad ones to emerge just because there is no competition for Indian themed restaurants here
great pizza on Wednesdays, half price on bottles of wine, ideal for a ladies or romantic evening, nice bar and terrace

tip if you are ordering through the drive thru either there is no speaker system or it is broken when the person wearing an apron walks to the side of the menu and looks into your car it means hello I can take your order there was a few seconds of awkward silence and I was wondering with this person looking in the car before I realized they were there to take our order happy since we moved to the west valley from southern CA we look forward to find a replacement for alberto or taco san pedro Humberto's reminds me of great hole in the wall type Mexican food, but unfortunately still leaves something to be desired with that said here is some info on what we had if you are from si cal and have had a Northgates shrimp machine. Humberto's comes in awfully close verdict device good cheese quesadilla did the job nachos good if you're out late partying and need to satisfy the cravings Humberto's monster should make
maybe I was expecting too much the cutlery was plastic the plates were plastic I felt like I was at a barbecue

happy hour review we stopped to try the much publicized happy hour and were pretty darn disappointed first of all I guess I don't see what's so happy about a spicy tuna roll and a drink second of all like other non-Japanese sushi joints in this city cough cough ra sushi it's sushi for people who don't really like sushi third serious staff but one look at the customer base uberdouchy explains that pass
I stopped in, paid for a few drinks and left nothing to get excited about, but a decent stop if you like Irish whiskey and need a fix.

A long time ago the Salvation Army was the place to go when you thought about thrift stores, unfortunately this place is way too expensive to be a thrift store. I chatted with random other people who thought the same thing about it, way too expensive, sad, I don't know who sets the price for this stuff but they are crazy, probably watching too many storage bidding wars or pawn stars thinking everything is worth a ton of money, goodwill is just down the road and has better prices.

I wouldn't give this place any stars but Yelp wants me to give at least one. I went there with my boyfriend last night for dinner and next to our horrible experience at Yucca di Beeps in Scottsdale, I have to say this one is on my list of most terrible restaurant experiences. The service was so bad that we didn't even get a chance to try the food. reviews because after all you can't knock it until you try it yes the place looks as dive as any food dive yes the place is not as clean as it can probably be but hey all the best I had a vang thai loan which was from some of the disinvests who spotted in town. back behind the register after looking at the menu for less than minutes I usually go for the spring rolls, anything that every time I visit a new place we were ready to order, I tried to make eye contact with our server but she seemed preoccupied with laughing and talking with the preteen girl sitting behind the counter with her. I finally made eye contact with her, she looked at me and I looked at her and she returned to her conversation for the next few minutes. she and the girl she was talking to looked at us and laughed every now and then pointing in our direction and laughing some more. I wasn't about to give up because I was determined to try some of their well-reviewed dishes, but after a quarter of an hour of trying to get their attention with them laughing and pointing at us, my boyfriend and I were fed up with the way they treated us was disrespectful and humiliating, so we walked out and headed across town to another Vietnamese restaurant. We will never return to this restaurant and I suggest you. don't do it either, just as it is not acceptable for customers to be rude to restaurant staff, it is also not acceptable for restaurant staff to be blatantly rude to customers who have done nothing to deserve poor treatment. We do not deserve the type of treatment we received at this restaurant and I am seriously angry writing this review. I don't care how good or cheap your food is. disrespected and belittled just so I could try your cheap Vietnamese food. I have a lot of Vietnamese friends who have mothers who can probably cook better than you and will treat us a million times better than your staff did last night.

had high expectations after being highly recommended by others the breakfast was good nothing out of the ordinary although the service was disappointing the waiter was very forgetful and put off by a few simple requests it doesn't seem like they need my business but considering the queue to get in I probably won't be back

This is a great place to watch a game if I had only been there to watch a game I might give this place stars but I had a long day watching a game and relaxing with a few glasses of wine and dinner. I stopped by recently with a friend while in the area and Rosa seemed less busy. Our assumption that this place could be livelier was perhaps correct in that there were people at the bar rather than the baseball games and various other sporting events we had chosen to sit at the bar for. bar because I still think you get better service there and the restaurant itself was quite slow on a weeknight, this issue of better service didn't really hold up here as it seemed like the bartender was also taking care of issues around the restaurant and after finishing my first glass of wine the glass sat empty for a while before someone came to see a refill, I will tolerate just about anything as long as I have a cocktail in front of me and as pouring drinks is the main function of a bartender, it was more than slightly annoying, we ordered the hi appetizer for a starter, I know I should probably be slapped for ordering something like that at a sports bar. I took a few bites and everything was fine, but parts of the fish were actually starting to turn gray, which can't be a good sign for dinner. We had the salmon and a side dish. The two bartenders on duty praised the flat fare. I don't think they've ever had a dish anywhere else or they'd probably stop raving about these. cheese sauce and a few pieces of chicken, it was edible as a food dish, but what I found off-putting was that the bread seemed to take on the flavor of the wooden paddle it was served on. Yes, I know you can bake bread on wood and it will take on the flavor of the wood, but I'm sure that came from the wooden serving board. I actually took most of it home and the taste was gone the next day and it all served well for about a few minutes in the toaster oven. the side of broccoli that came out with the fish was bright green and flavorful and cooked perfectly the fish was a little overdone and uninspiring I feel like maybe this place should go to a smaller menu so they can have more consistency in the preparation

the ambiance was nice what we saw of it our group had dined at this establishment over the times and we were placed at the worst table in the place on the second floor in the back the food was good and the service adequate when we left the valet asked us if we were coming in the old bmw it is four years old and costs more i will never go back and i will tell all my friends this place is not acceptable
I wouldn't send my worst enemy here

this place is great if you like to be in a snobby environment there aren't many places i have been to that are more trendy than anything else but this is one of them when you try to go to the pink taco it is impossible to find a parking spot once you head to the front the hostess is always too busy testing her friends rather than helping the customer if you are lucky enough to find a spot at the bar you better have a Rolex watch or you won't get served quickly either, or you better be a Hugh Hefner, my spouse I tried the burrito and was disgusted at how rubbery it was.

this place is a must if you are a beer hungry party animal as a student but as an adult who is a step beyond let us get wiped out to get drunk this place isn't really worth visiting the beers are really not that good compared to four Peakspagosun Pusan Tan or any of the other brewery pubs around really wasn't very impressed with the food either the only reason I gave it to him gave it an extra star than one because the service was good of course there was only one other band there at the time

I'm from Philly and had to stop when I found out a rite was open, it wasn't exactly what I remembered, the flavor was just okay and not as intense, not bad but not great. I prefer Repiccis Italian ice cream, they don't have their own store but they are sold at Cookies on Mill in Tempe and they also participate in many festivals in the valley.

I have mixed feelings about the W Scottsdale during the day the pool is poorly managed but in the evening the pool transforms into a pretty fun nightlife spot. During the day the pool is always packed with a pretty disgusting crowd and the guys number the girls by one for counting I say it's not fun oh and by guys I mean assholes and girls who look more like gross skunks covered in makeup at the pool ok I guess I'm a hater but spend a few hours here and you might be a little grossed out by the scene too it's just a really amateur hour here with the poor service and their bad attitudes and their rude customers the only reason I came was because a friend likes to stay at the w when I visit and he too noted that the quality of this place has gone down over the years, he has stayed at four different places from my south to west beach and said this one was the worst and trashiest, it took an hour before a waitress came to ask if we wanted drinks or food when we started to get service it was always a long wait for our pitcher of margaritas or our buckets of beer and food speaking of the food the fries, fish tacos and club sandwich are all excellent the grilled cheese not so much the first pitcher of margaritas was weak tasting almost no alcohol the second pitcher was stronger to be fair Saturday service was much better at night a much improved scene but still not great there are a lot of foreigners as it's a hotel but still a lot of locals too I think it's a good mix of the pants and collared shirts are required so this usually eliminates most of the tank top wannabes from the start of the day at the pool, but really you're just trading a bunch of wannabes for another guy, I'm a hater, eh, well you can handle it, the drinks are overpriced but that's the time you'll be willing to spend a lot of money. I have been in a few rooms at this hotel, each was nice and clean but quite small.

the styles of pizza can be so different that i have a hard time comparing a place like boombox to grimaldi at grimaldi they refuse to carry ranch because they don't want people to dip their pizza in it at boombox they offer ranch as soon as they put the pizza down so no boombox is definitely not the best pizza i have ever had but for their style of pizza they are pretty good think traditional dominospapa johns type crust with unique tiered toppings and sauce, my husband said the crust tasted like breadstick cheese and I think that's a pretty accurate description, we had the sienna with an interesting tomato cream sauce, spinach and tomatoes, the poor quality cheese detracted from it overall but it was still much better than the boombox oregano pizza is relatively new in town but they seem to know their audience well, it was pretty busy when we visited mid week great menu, lots of drink specials, TVs everywhere, plenty of seating, everything a restaurant chain needs to be successful, I'm sure we'll return when dining with finicky family members who are too scared to eat anything. ethnic

I recently moved to the Estate area and although it's not the closest I thought I'd give it a try, it's probably one of the most beautifully appointed and convenient cinemas I've ever been to and for the first few visits I didn't have too many bad experiences in fact, the only thing that was wrong was that the ticket machines outside were broken. Apparently I've heard this happens a lot if they've worked before, this last trip was just bad. I was a little out, but maybe it was those old people's eyes, I could see shadows and lines behind some of the target objects, I arrived a few minutes early and mistakenly thought it would be too late to get a good seat for an afternoon screening, by all means I was about a few minutes too early, they booked the screenings way too close, the credits for previous screenings lasted until about and then as always they took their time to clean the theater once you enter. contempt would have been welcome if just for a little light, that's why God made cell phones when he finally sat down, there were two cans of soda in both cup holders. I literally saw people leaving the theater at the end of the screening. The cleanup should be quick so you can continue your discussion about whose identity you were using to go out that night, but I digress. The soda cans obviously weren't being sold by the slowest concession employees in the world. i hate when people have their cell phones on in the theater because they always want to hold it up so everyone else in the theater has the pleasure of the bright light while they chat on their old myspace account, but in this case it's understandable because no one could see anything in question and i always wanted to ask if the concession stand employees said to take it as slow as possible, well i know they aren't, i'm a former employee and i wasn't not even though the pennies they give generously on paychecks might not be enough fire under them but seriously it's already an insult we have to pay just for a popcorn and a soda but they add salt to the wound that is by making us wait for minutes in a line of people by god I wish someone would open a concession stand with good deals yeah I know that's how they get their money blah blah and I wish someone would open at least one express lane two items or less lane no kids heaven really movies are still relevant even in a down economy maybe you should hire less and pay more im sure that one the guy at the box office would have appreciated that

we really wanted to like the honey bears in that it was a perfectly average meal my side salad was ok the corn was very good the shredded chicken was very dry and the roll it was on had store bought sliders no amount of sauce made the chicken juicier unfortunately the sauce had no characters just sauce while we were at it the flies were all around the sauce my husbands ribs were ok but not very meaty we hit all the joints of the region because we have just moved here we will not return there unfortunately

another do it yourself bridal shop with rows of dresses neatly packaged on shelves in large plastic bags the woman was very quick to swap the dresses in the room as soon as I came out in a new dress she had the old and new dress ready to go and waiting for me in my room. I might have rated this store a little higher but I didn't seem to have any luck here. The dresses were either too big or too small and I just couldn't find any that I liked. It didn't work for me, the dress shopping continues

Friday evening, after a long work week, seemed like a good time to treat ourselves to some new cuisine, so my friend and colleague John M and I decided to visit this Uzbek restaurant. The interior would be rather generic in appearance without the somewhat ornate Middle Eastern curtains and a screen playing Uzbek and Russian music videos adding to the ambiance. cucumbers and sweet white onions lightly drizzled with a dill vinaigrette and blinchik which are pancakes with a savory meat and onion filling. Be careful, the blinchik are quite filling on their own. We also ordered pavlov and lamb skewers. The pavlov was a flavorful seasoned rice dish with carrots and meat and was a good choice. meal overall it was a good meal not great but definitely satisfying and hope to try the soup dishes next time

the estate has a few more restaurants now but still needs more stores for shopping, it's starting to build up but slowly, it was nice to walk around after dinner but the number of teenagers there was a bit annoying, I guess I'm not the mom type

lackluster, I was disappointed both times I visited Houston, their veggie burger is soggy and grainy at the same time, I don't know how they managed to achieve an appealing taste, their famous baked potato was dry and nothing to write home about, frankly I could have done something better for myself and saved some money, the redeeming factor was that the service was okay and the restaurant was overall semi-attractively decorated. the place reopened under a different name, millstone. I hope the new name was followed by a new menu.

I came across this place because it was next to El Brave, a Mexican place recommended by Airways in Flight magazine as a place to try in an airport when arriving in Elbrava. We found it to be a fast food stand with very few seats so it's next door. to el brave and goes through th

we had the potstickers kobe beef skewers red curry clay pot and sizzling shrimp all items were mediocre at best the potstickers were fried and way overdone the beef was also overcooked and somewhat flavorless the curry was very spicy but otherwise strangely bland the steamed rice was extra and came in a cup sized bowl if i had been told the shrimp dish was store bought and microwaved i would not have disputed that the service was normal the music was boring club tunes and also loud for pm overall I'm glad we had a group and didn't have to pay full price for a significantly subpar dining experience

I always get just one thing from Vietnamese places and that is their rice dish with grilled pork chop and egg cake, this place does good, you get a reasonable amount for the price and the fish sauce is perfect

this was my second visit to Arrobas and believe me, it wasn't my choice. I spent the first few years of my life in southern New Mexico and I miss the food like crazy, especially the Green Chile when you go into Arrobas, it's New Mexico this and New Mexico that and the dishes are named after cities and landmarks in the state. the first time we mentioned it to a manager and had the exact same reaction, I also asked if I could have a side of plain green chili and was told no both times, we were being super nice and just trying to start a friendly conversation if those interactions had been better this review wouldn't be here. chicken salad iceberg lettuce gooey greens cooked onions and peppers mushy tomatoes clumps of greasy cheese half melted and very dry chicken piled on a shell yuck without the delicious fresh chips guacamole and the two cent happy hour margaritas I would have been very unhappy I will definitely never come back and this time I mean it

honey bears aren't in Gilbert but I really enjoy it, I usually get the pork sandwich and potato salad and find myself going there, I like the Be sauce and the quality of the meat is good if I'm in tempe and want to be I usually go here

I've been going here for years now because I really try to be a loyal customer. I can't justify spending more money here. The owner is nice to me but still doesn't know my name. I go there at least several times a year, so it shouldn't be that hard to recognize me. I decided to have my wedding dress altered there this year because I knew and trusted her. dress what type of dress uh my wedding dress the only one in the store that hangs right there every pair of pants she hemmed for me from jeans to pants was over an inch too short and she charged me six dollars to sew on a button when I took the button to her I'm sure there's better service elsewhere with better prices

I ordered a thin crust take out one evening, the place was a bit hidden in an industrial area close to the Tempe Market, the staff was very friendly and it looked like a cozy place to eat a meal, I enjoyed my pizza, the sauce was very sweet so be prepared for that.

I only ask two things when I fly to land safely and not be afraid of planes while on them US airlines only ship on one of them and I'm still undecided on the first one that had a late flight due to pox so two hours isn't too bad unless of course it's the longest two hours of your life and you can hear the people in the cabin praying for their lives. the flight of their life oh and when you finally land and thank your creator that you are in fact still alive it's probably best that you don't have to hear the pilots say wow that was scary I'm surprised we landed okay you morons they should pay for the trauma I will have for the rest of my life

don't get me wrong, the white chocolate grill is good and it's definitely a place I'll return to, but there is something that just doesn't click, everything tastes good and the service is quick and efficient, but it's more of a relaxed dinner than a meal you're excited about. I can't say for everyone that I really don't like waiting half an hour for a table, call me impatient, I don't care, I really don't think many restaurants deserve that title, even on a Friday night, I love that they have a full menu for gluten free diners, it's so hard to find gluten. free at restaurants doesn't even mention a full menu I was impressed I ended up sharing artichokes with parmesan I didn't ask for breadcrumbs with my mom and got myself a Chicken Caesar both were okay we ended up ordering a gluten free chocolate soufflé be sure to specify that you want it gluten free as they also had a regular version which was amazing and I would definitely go back just for that overall a good weekday family restaurant which is above average meal definitely a place to go if you are celiac or gluten intolerant
I heard there are better waitresses, the service is better, but if you go in the evening she's not there, the service is lousy.

I'm always looking for cool places to bring friends from the city and this place seemed to fit the bill. It is a sustainable farm that produces only Arizona extra virgin olive oil. I came in for lunch and as I pulled into the gravel parking lot my stomach turned because I was wearing expensive heels and I knew they were going to get beat up. It was inside the building, it was split into two markets on one side, a bistro on the other with seating in between and also outside the market there were testers of all their products, a great idea, but the food testers didn't seem hygienic so I didn't try anything. annoyed by my presence when i went to order my sandwich i remembered i got a free drink with my yap while checking out the girl at the counter sighed and rolled her eyes while i rummaged in my purse for my iphone and she said forget it i got it their sandwich the klamath had its seconds of fame on the food network so i was going to get it but opted for the lucca at the last second because that she has a brief love of brie more than i love most of the family the sandwich was a disappointment all the ingredients were there but it was devoid of any flavor and i couldn't understand why i probably wouldn't bring any of my mates here but i will stop by to buy some produce i fully support local businesses
Pretty nice sports bar lots of good food on TV is typical sports bar food with some outstanding choices I would return if I was in the area
in addition to sucking it's also expensive

ok I'm a die hard Jimmy Buffet fan, a parrot face through and through, but this place sucks, I've been to half a dozen different Margaritaville restaurants and knew what to expect, but this one by far did not meet my minimum expectations. The service is slow, the food is canned and the poor quality drinks are weak and expensive. I'll grill chicken and burgers in the backyard, I'll put the booze in the blender light, the tiki torches will invite people in and Jimmy's jam will be more fun setting sail somewhere in your own backyard than having to endure the flippers of Glendale Margaritaville.

I checked this place out today for lunch as a possible place to watch some draws, took advantage of their lunch menu and got the sliders. I receive my bill and is added to my bill for a drink. I was drinking water, apparently you have to buy a drink to take advantage of the lunch specials. I was not informed of this and I was also upset. the bartender who took my drink order said didn't she tell you I wouldn't return to that place

I can't stand this mall, they have really great stores but the people who work there are obnoxious, most of the people walking around are arrogant as can be and everything is overpriced, the food court has a good selection but is always very busy and you can rarely find a place to sit, parking is terrible
not bad but not great service was really friendly and fast food was me maybe i just ordered the wrong thing

I was here for a business dinner recently and loved their new hummus plate, they put grilled zucchini on it and had fresh cicadas which was great, I wasn't in the mood to be at the time but so I ordered a turkey burger with a whole wheat bun and steamed broccoli. I love healthy options thanks to redbird for helping fight the battle of the bulge.

the only reason for stars is for the service, the food wasn't very good at all, my dinner was hard shell tacos or something that consists of hard shell tacos but when they came out the shells were soggy and you couldn't eat them. The drink specials were good and we had a very friendly server.

nice restaurant good food slow slow slow service I went there with a group and the food was good but the service wasn't great I ordered chicken matsu before the rest of the group ordered tons of cushite sushi which came out slowly but no one cared and then I realized we had been there for hours and I still didn't have my chicken matsu I asked the waiter about it and he had totally forgotten that I finally got my food but everyone was finished to eat, he apologized and we got free dessert but it just sucked for me since I didn't make him eat sushi

I am writing this review only for the optics department. I accidentally poked my eye with a branch yesterday and knew I damaged it, so I went to the Gilbert Costco optician and asked if I could see urgently. The receptionist asked me if I could come back in a few hours. I declared it an emergency and asked the doctor if she could see me, she asked and said no, she didn't have time. patient for years, I admit she had a patient at the time but I said I could wait until after so she could at least take a few minutes to tell me if I should go to the hospital or not, never waste your time going there if you need immediate attention in an emergency because they won't give you room

the food here is delicious I love the decor the ambiance the menu the servers but I hate the feeling of being a hip little scottsdale froufrou when eating here the salads are totally inventive and delicious but a little sweet I love that you can add genie eggs and fresh garlic to your pizza I love the fresh, homemade ingredients and I really love the cute little neighborhood restaurant feel eating here makes me feel like I'm in a bigger city than pox is expensive and definitely aimed at those who want to eat gourmet pizza but the taste wins with all the fantastic and fresh toppings and if you ever get tired of franchised restaurants at cpl go here is a great alternative

we have one of the first to open in the valley right next to us and it sure has a selection of ready to eat or groceries but watch the prices you pay quite understandably to convince and the time saving of their ready to get it. I like their concept and shop there from time to time, more like I just need something quick, their hot dog buns are pretty sweet, which is different, not different, bad, just different as for hybrid parking only, I don't think so, what a happy joke

the food wasn't particularly good on our last visit there and the service was rude and not at all helpful. I even emailed them afterwards to give feedback in the hope that they would make up for it by showing good service that way, no luck, they didn't even get a response, they won't get any more of my business, too bad as I actually had a good mushroom burger there before and would have been a repeat customer but the service last time was so bad I won't be going back.

all year round men in the joint wearing sports jackets hanging out with your beers waiting to catch some hot young cock which won't even happen but you're still lingering anyway in an awkward looking sausage fest throw your hands in the air and say what to the endless video loop of tempe girls trying to figure out the best way to display their moms for their calendar photoshoots like ohmygawd there's no way this don't get picked on for kipwingerscomebackvideo raise your hand in the air and tell what to do to the jumbuck who thinks spinning seconds of every song for years and years into a few megabits is cool, but it's more like the sonic equivalent of Sybil. of a completely different species, like we're human and you're the green kid that Captain Kirk got together with in Star Trek, throw your hands in the air and say what if you could all those bathroom stalls where the door doesn't go opaque unless you close it all the way, but I'm sure the ploy here is that as the night goes on and people get drunker and drunker the girls will come in and maybe lock the random door, but not completely, but they don't care because they have to pee so hard, so they sit on the throne and watch people walk by and think oh my god it's like a one way mirror, it's so cool, but then they notice that the guys are now right there and converge on the other side of the door looking at them straight in the eye and all of a sudden the drunk girls realize that the door isn't a one way mirror at all. one way, but put your hands up in the air and say what to my fellow yappers who made it all completely tolerable and proved that no matter what, maybe with a semi-retarded but really cool Scottsdale venue if you're in good company, you'll still have a great time throwing your hands in the air and saying what and scene
this place reminded me why I don't live in Scottsdale anymore

don't get me wrong, I still like the jog, I just didn't like its pulled pork sandwich and fries, the coleslaw was good but not so fantastic that it was worth it after thinking the pork had too much cloying and sweet sauce wasn't that sweet when paired with the garlic toast dots, but if you look at the included photo you will see that both pieces of bread were under the pork and therefore completely saturated with sauce. I had to take advantage of this afternoon where the pork was the part sticking out of all that sauced meat what a mess to ask for ask the boat of fries was just a complete soggy mess I should ask them to substitute the sweet potato fries instead but why do I have to pay extra to get a perfectly crispy product so again one woman's treasure is another woman's trash and vice versa eh, today was not a good day for me as far as both restaurants in Mr. Johnson see my recent coffee review I hope my next visit to a johnston concept gives a happier adventure
lots of people to help but too busy talking to each other, I left

Decided to try Tempe Market again after reading recent reviews hoping they had improved. I had to wonder if we were visiting the same place. The traffic and parking situation is still horrible and the loudspeakers in the parking lot are unacceptable. Ja's Cent and Targets are crippled versions of their regular stores in other malls. Dowson on this hodgepodge monstrosity

My husband and I stayed on a Monday night just to starve and it was busier than I expected. A huge and very comfortable bed. The air conditioning worked all night and we didn't have the bathrobes advertised online, but the roof terrace had a nice view and the breeze was welcome. We had a drink at the bar and took it up to the roof with us. we were really impressed by the huge bed

I went to this place with my wife because it was new and we are always looking for new places to eat. We were the only two people in this place and would have thought that the owner, to make a good impression and show gratitude for the business he had, could have come to the table to ask how the food was, chat or something. having to go away and cook for the only two customers he had food wise you can grill a good burger at home with decent meat and whatever fixation you want to put into it, in other words it was nothing special and certainly nothing I would come back for. Ultimately, Scottsdale doesn't need another burger restaurant and I wish the staff would have made more of an effort to appreciate our patronage.
great great happy hour fun atmosphere great decor and best garlic mess in the valley

my expectations were exceeded. I had been looking for so long for a dining experience that met all my expectations for a restaurant I should never frequent. Mimic in Goodyear actually exceeded my expectations in October during a visit to the area. I made the unfortunate mistake of recommending that we dine at Mimic due to the good food and service before, but alas, if the old quality of Mimic still existed, they would not have exceeded my expectations for what not to experience in a restaurant. should never patronize this establishment first of all the inside temperature was at least degrees when it was cooler than outside we had to ask for the air conditioning to be turned on then we ordered the artichoke dip appetizer it looked funny it tasted funny the tortilla chips actually looked like pita chips if it walks like a duck quack like a duck it must be a I ordered the chicken cordon bleu which is supposed to be served with vegetables from season and homemade mashed potatoes can someone explain to me how a mix of seasonal vegetables can be served where the steaming broccoli is but the carrots mixed with them are literally still frozen in the middle which is a feat. My homemade mashed potatoes cold, a piece of butter placed on the mashed potatoes would not even melt to graphically show our waitress the problem, even after this effort no offer from the servers or manager. humor never again

maybe I'm being generous but cpl is an ok place for a unique pizza, I've always enjoyed their Santa Fe pizza but this time I thought I'd try their Greek pizza, it was ok, nothing special, too many vegetables without enough meat, cheese and tzatziki sauce to balance it out. some girl was saying something about another waiter who didn't like it, it felt like I was in a high school cafeteria and to top it off it was very cold in there, it's never a good idea to have it so cold that your customers want to get out of there to warm up, but other than my few complaints it's a good establishment although it could definitely improve. I'm sure I'll return but maybe next time I'll stick to my old stand near the Santa Fe.
gross repellent appalling disgusting overrated dirty should be stopped by the csc you get it right

if you have a family with lots of little kids you are absolutely happy with your body and just want to leave your house for a change of scenery this is your place if you are looking for a good workout this is not your place the times are pretty bad and you have to plan your schedule around them the cardin machines are good the weight variety is ok but they are everywhere they have a suggestion box but they don't take them seriously the classes were good but now the quality has gone down the rumba class was my favorite but not so much more they should have different levels but there is only one and it's slow there are kids everywhere I don't understand what parent would want their one year old daughter to learn to shake her butt but I can't judge I don't have a child maybe when I have one I would like her to learn to dance low and shake it so she can be asked to go. I'm not here anymore, what are you doing to your instructors, why are they running away, why are you making it difficult to get good training? I don't think I'm asking for much here, just a place where I can train properly.

their service was above acceptable but rather slow, it was Wednesday evening around noon and only one section of the restaurant was open for only a few groups. Their business seemed very slow there, but I guess that was probably a typical weekday situation.

I still have customer service issues with Fedex, how the hell did they get so big with the crappy way they treat customers? I use the internet a lot for shopping and about the time they screwed up and then their customer service has great difficulty resolving issues. with Fedex but this time they really pissed me off I am getting harassing phone calls from a collection agency saying they were hired by Fedex to collect an overdue invoice from me in the amount of I asked them for details and all I get is harassment so I asked Fedex for help and customer service told me to contact Fedex revenue services which I did I told them I was receiving harassing phone calls from collection agency Byz and the person who keeps calling is called Chris, I also tell them that the alleged amount I am owed and the account is supposed to be in my name, so I ask them to investigate and tell me if I actually have an overdue account in my name for that amount, I know I don't have such an account, Fedex then tells me they can't help me because I haven't provided enough information how much more information can I provide do they want my height and weight, maybe my blood type, maybe I also have to provide my children's names and dates of birth, that's why I say Fedex really blows

falling to three stars on a recent visit I saw two cockroaches on the ground floor of the restaurant, no one seemed to care so I got up and stepped on one, pointed at the other and one of the staff killed it but they didn't seem surprised. I know cockroaches are difficult to control, but having two roaming around a busy restaurant is just not a good thing. likes to get drunk and hang out on the terrace makes me seem like a guy who would have trouble working because the food is always okay and better than anything I've found but I'm looking for alternatives

I went there before the Jason Braz concert and the beers and shrimp appetizer cocktails were very good but the service was a little slow. I ordered the angus cheeseburger and it came with island dressing and pickles a glorified sigma what a disappointment
terrible rolls, the dragon was so so california was bland and the spicy tuna was cat food, seriously it looked like canned cat food and tasted horrible

My sister recently took her new Beetle wish to First Class Auto in Scottsdale for an overheating problem. I'm normally the one maintaining the vehicle, but I was miles away. She described the symptoms as follows. The overheat light came on while she was stuck in construction traffic and came back on once she moved again. they asked him to check the operation of the radiator fan, they told him the water pump was cracked and leaking, needed a new thermostat and also replaced the timing belt and serpentine belt while they were there. The water pump is driven by the timing belt on this engine. I turned down the job and either take it somewhere else or wait until I take a trip. I had work to do that took me almost halfway to the Phoenix area, so I decided to take the rest of the trip to see for myself yesterday. The first thing I did was check the radiator fans. I turned on the air conditioning and the fans didn't turn on at all. who lived most of his life in Michigan, some of the fuses and the fuse panel itself were corroded and caused a fuse and part of the fuse panel to melt. The coolant level was exactly at the maximum level, right where it was after I did the service miles ago, not to mention I checked it before its recent trip to Scottsdale. they were all quite corroded, the larger strip fuses were still fine, the radiator fans now work normally and the car doesn't overheat, the hose coming out of the thermostat also becomes pressurized and hot to the right temperature so it's definitely not a problem. The fans also turn on automatically once the coolant temperature reaches the dog Celsius as if they were supposed to fix the problem. one at the counter, what great customer service, so she could have spent the amount listed and still had the same problem, she just got paid a diagnostic fee for an incorrect diagnosis

I hate the heat, I hate it yet I'm doomed to reside in this heat haven, so when my best friend praised a place where you can sit outside in Arizona and not feel the heat, I had to check it out the moment I ventured downtown to check out this place. Phoenix was experiencing a refresh so the patio was very cozy without the fans and gentlemen, our waitress was great and even chatted about our night and my favorite bar we had the favorite sumptuous and I agreed to the bacon although it didn't look too appetizing it wasn't I ordered a chicken sandwich which was on a French roll the salad on the side was better than the sandwich my friend ordered the classic turkey which was large but average but I think ordering the classic sandwich was an annoying mistake in itself the fries that came with the turkey were greasy and when I ordered an amber and a guy brought a lager I like pale ale so it wasn't too bad but it made me yearn for the amber yes or course I ordered the amber next to the waitress told us the island bar was opening the next day but there were still ladders and paint cans lying around. I didn't notice until my friend mentioned it. The only really cool thing about this place is that it's in a historic building with weird bathrooms, other than that I would avoid it

it's my favorite pei wei, it's always clean and never too crowded, they also have a fantastic covered terrace. I like Mongolian beef or chicken and dan dan noodles and my husband likes pretty much everything he tries here. They had a bowl of beef ramen which was to die for but I guess it was only on offer for a limited time, the food can be salty sometimes but I always enjoy it.

I can sum it up in one word yuck we went to dinner which is part of the problem we ordered a bone in steak and chicken the salad bowl had a hole through the plastic and the steak was very thin we ordered it medium and any steak that thin ends up being cooked as well cooked anyway everything comes with hash browns dripping in grease whether you like them or not at least the staff were friendly enough and the food if you call it that was served quickly, my personal recommendation is if you're not going to have breakfast, go somewhere else
horrible, not sure if it's classified as food, the burrito is a flour tortilla and meat, no salsa, beans, cheese, sour cream, nara guacamole and they won't let you add anything to it.
great place for quick errands

it's nothing but pies, I was expecting a bit more punch, a small selection of pie disjointed by slices, you also have to special order in advance for the more interesting stuff like Italian ricotta, I was going to order something with berries, but what I saw in the case was just runny and moist. the airport coffee maker freshly brewed despite the espresso machine clearly visible behind the counter the pies are barely finished by slice and by pie

I want to give the Cornish Pasty Company another star, but I can't seem to do it. The pâtés I order are really good. They have a nice selection of beers, including Bigmouth Mickeys and a few cocktail options. Most of the sides and desserts are pretty solid. I tend to stick to and really enjoy the more traditional pies like doggie and cottage pie. Depending on personal preference, what really holds CPL back from getting another star or two is the restaurant itself. It is a long, narrow space that is divided by a bar. Seating is along the wall or at the bar with a few larger tables in the back on the other side of the bar from the customers. This is where all restaurant operations take place. but I really don't need to hear the dishes crashing in the sink and I don't need to see all the potential for cross contamination during food preparation right next to the dirty dishes and raw meat right next to the beer glasses. My worst experience was arriving late and sitting at the bar while they cleaned the kitchen and still served food. sometimes because I enjoy the food and beer options and finally came back last Friday the food was as good as it's ever been but the environment will still give me pause or sometimes before I head back I might just have to take advantage of their takeaway and stop at the top booze on the way home for hoegaarden

my biggest tip for newbies, yes, look towards the grill and look up there you will find a nice little menu of sauce formulas, unfortunately I never looked up so I didn't have enough sauce in my case, that was a good thing because the sauce I had tasted like crap so more of the same would have been even more crappy as to the ingredients, lots of choice with fresh vegetables, I have to say the meat didn't look appetizing to me, in fact, I had to ask my husband what it was, I guess it's a Good thing you don't see piles of freshly sliced meat, otherwise it might not be so fresh after all, but in its frozen state at minus degrees F, I discovered I had opted for more vegetables, two sizes available. I went with the large one, filled my bowl until it looked like a small mountain, then wasted more than half of it, so get the small one unless you want leftovers or haven't eaten in several days.

this is what you would expect from any themed place called heart attack, mirrors on the lower part of the bar so you can see the skimpy outfits the nurses wear in the bar van in the drive through section is painted to look like an ambulance. hamburgers are named after cardiac events.

this used to be one of my favorite places to get takeaway pizza and salads every week, unfortunately it looks like they have closed their doors. I tried calling last week and no one answers the phone. I finally walked past the place and there's a note on the door saying they haven't paid their rent. I'm only giving this place one star due to complete disappointment, otherwise the food earns stars. The gluten free cheese pizza was the best gluten free pizza I have ever tasted, they used a thin rice crust with organic tomato sauce and low fat mozzarella cheese the place was small inside and lacked a lot of atmosphere but was a great restaurant delivery togo I will miss you z pizza

I don't like heard pizza and if you go there for lunch there are no specialties by the slice, the ranch tastes bottled and tastes disgusting, the ingredients are not fresh but rather canned as well, the chicken wings weren't great either, the atmosphere was nice for a casual place with a few flat screen TVs on the wall.

eyebrows are a very delicate subject, I am literally convinced that unless you earn a lot of money, finding an excellent and meticulous beautician is like finding a needle in a haystack. I have searched this haystack for three months too long and every time I leave thinking they really aren't listening to what I asked and I wasted money so I decided to no longer tip included on mediocre eyebrows. positive it's good that they send you a 1 hour reminder message but you better make sure you show up because they charge a fee for cardies and shows

two and a half stars really this place is really quite strange coffee bar video i don't have much to compare it to I guess we'll start with the traditional espresso macchiato no microfilm big bubbles in the milk too hot to drink straight away the shot was good but by the time it was cool enough to drink it had lost quite a bit of flavor very friendly service on the other hand given the phoenix foam tends to be below average i tend to think the service and atmosphere are almost more viable measures for successful coffee shops than the coffee shop in Phoenix, the actual place was quite strange, large paintings of Mexican sugar skulls in the back, nice chairs and tables, faux orange finish on the walls, then the video bar item, three huge flat screens on the wall, playing pop music videos from the years very strange in my opinion. I'm not sure Cher and Madonna really go along with coffee, but I guess they're trying something new. I had a great time lounging around and it was relatively quiet with good steady lighting.

I agree it's a great hangout in the city, nice neighborhood, adequate parking in the structure behind and a great atmosphere with great service, the menu is interesting and I'll be back to try more, but here's what our first visit looked like as an appetizer. lunch meat I'm talking precision sliced straight from the fridge but thrown on the grill to reheat lunch meat if you go online to see the menu it's one of the items you can click on for a nutrition chart here's what it reads for meat gyro beef beef lamb water breadcrumbs blanched wheat flour water dextrose salt and yeast may contain soybean oil calcium propitiate soy protein concentrate less salt garlic and onion powder monosodium glutamate so the takeaway here is stay away the gyro but hey the gyro is a pita I expected reasonable execution heck make a gyro meatloaf and slice it at least yes I'm bitter

this place was a group find I won't be returning the girl behind the counter was nice but even though I had the group right in front of me she had to read it multiple times and I had to explain to her what I was supposed to get with the red light therapy is a good idea but the room the bed was in was missing they should hire an exterminator so they don't leave sticky bug traps with dead bugs all over the floor where people usually have bare feet yuck

I wish I could give this place a big fat zero but you can't but I can let everyone know how horrible it is to begin with their automatic doors don't even work. I just think it's appalling, how can your doors not work in your store, how are people supposed to get in there to shop, the manager of this location is nothing more than an imbecile. I asked for help and all I received was the attitude of a struggling supermarket that has filed for bankruptcy. before this place closes

I went to this place with my family for a birthday party and tried various dishes from the menu. I was not impressed with the food and the quality of the dishes. I've had better and won't be returning as there are better places to dine in the valley, sorry to be a bit harsh but I'm just being real.

Came here for lunch recently with active assistant and friend Brett B. I'm sure he will post his own review of the place. It's the kind of place where you walk up to the cash register and place your order, then take a plastic number to your table and the waiter brings you your food, you also grab your drink and go refill yourself at the fountain. i expect that in most places the waiters make a size with their hands, shrug their shoulders and say i don't know like that, so yeah i like that this guy showed me a plate and made a mound with his hand to show me some sort of size of the salad when i ordered just water he went and gave me a plastic cup with a lid and then said you know what, have a regular glass it's more comfortable it trusted me not to fill my glass with anything other than water and I only drank water which was nice and made me feel like an adult not like some places much cheaper than this place they give you a plastic cup like the ones you pee in at the doctor when you order water. I really enjoyed my lunch here. I had a chicken Caesar salad, one of my favorite things to order almost everywhere I go because I will never make it at home with a cheese pizza. The Caesar salad for those who have a love affair with this meal was perfect. even distribution and reducing the pain of having to cut a chicken breast on a salad with oversized utensils like so many other places, it was dressed perfectly too, not too heavy, just right and the parmesan was shaved on top rather than grated or grated. nice to the touch, great flavor in every bite, the cheese pizza was super thin crispy crust, delicious red sauce a little sweet in a good way and the cheeses were mozzarella and the salty taste mixed really well with the sweetness of the sauce and made it simple the taste of the pizza is extraordinary, I had a beyond amazing pizza in New York, I am spoiled and I have to say it was not as good as my favorite thin crust pizza from Totonnos in the pretty Upper East Side, but it's still very good, I'll eat it again. be a great choice for those of you who like to order delicious salads and the service was excellent the manager even came to our tables to refill our glasses for us even though the drinks were self serve from a fountain the place wasn't busy when we arrived but it picked up as we finished our meals good food great service good atmosphere hope this place stays will definitely look forward to eating there again even

oh man, this is not the place I thought I would give my first rating, I woke up as sad and disappointed as last night leaving the legendary old school during after an evening of less than mediocre food and terrible service, sigh, honey, I had a great lunch there a few months ago and was excited to impress myself with the dinner we saw during restaurant week and we were excited about the excuse to get Sneak into one of their cozy booths among bowie-clad staff and velvet wallpaper. experience, should I blame the low rating on their efforts to succumb to a prix fixe menu, perhaps our time at the bar turned out to be the best part of the night watching the bartender mix the martinis like my dads used to do was nostalgia at its finest. in the weeds having been in her place before I'm still trying to adjust to the situation we ordered an appetizer and a few cocktails and waited to order dinner when she seemed capable the artichoke dip appetizer was delicious tortillas and garlic bread and hot cheese dip delivered promised the limited menu was just that ok first course soup options main dish offered pot roast a small steak or chicken fried steak slow cooked steak grilled steak or fried steak really your menu is impressive you really don't want to participate in restaurant week so don't honey I ordered the chicken fried steak as a continuation of the old school vibe. I ordered the trout off the regular menu after pointing out the fish option. I ordered the fish too because the food took a bit but we had a good conversation so it wasn't a problem. The salads and soup were good. The main course arrived and we were all a little surprised by the size of the fried steak. a dollop of thick sauce on top, the garlic mashers were placed appropriately, my trout was supposed to be topped with a lemon and caper sauce, but instead it was covered in a sauce that hinted at lemon and was not at all good for a fish. I don't want mashed potatoes to rule your dinner, we were devastated so the whole experience was not what we came for or expected. I want to give Durant another chance and order a big, juicy steak and let them wow me like they do so many people, but it will be a while before our trek around downtown includes a stroll through their kitchen.

this particular restaurant is not well laid out, there is a section of soups all clearly labeled but further down there is a black kettle of another soup with a very small label that you have to pick up and read in the center of the counter. There is a bread basket, you have to lift the plastic door and hold it open while you collect your bread. other end for cheese lettuce, sour cream and a poorly planned and smaller selection than sweet tomatoes, I would rather pay a few dollars more for a better selection

trendy sushi with loud music when we lived right across the street from sushi brokers j and i used to go there at least once a month for its happy hour we probably went there at least a few times with friends and family i have to say the quality was good at first but has gone down since the price was ok if you go during happy hour at other times a bit pricey with the quality and service it was a place to see with quality sushi

For me, my quality standards are high since I frequent Shea Yogurt and Yogurt in Scottsdale. I'm the Duke of Scottsdale and sometimes I go to Mojo in Tempe, this place has decent flavors. I had the original tart which was a bit tart. The toppings are okay. My friend really liked the fact that they had banana chips, but that's because we usually eat our stuff at home and we were away from home and she didn't have to use her personal stash because it made her happy. put an extra star, I'm cool like this hamlet, let's see they have a snow machine, I'm not really sure what that is, it seems out of place, it's far from my house and not really worth the drive, I guess if it was near me and I had no other options, I patronize this business, this is the one time and only time I will say this, thank goodness I live in Old Town Scottsdale

we were going to the movies when the skies opened up that's when we first noticed we needed some new kinda stupid wiper blades but the only time we use them here in the valley is after a car wash come to think of it so we stopped at this place right next to the old all beef site which is now closed the people who work there stopped me as I was going in and asked the make and model of my car within ten seconds we were in the driveway and had the correct blades for our car wow what a great group a funny one aside as we were leaving I started to remove one of the blades and started throwing the plastic and cardboard into the outside trash bin another shock it was filled to capacity with old blades great minds eh

ok, this place got a ton of flak from previous reviews, I'm not a big fan of the food or the s-style decor, but the people are nice and I was more than happy with the spinach quest dip. I really want it, which draws me to this shiny turquoise and black decor every few months. The lunch menu is very reasonable and the lunch portion of the magnifico surveys was good. Scottsdale and the Giants' spring training stadium. I love the breezy patio, but the big black birds stalking fallen corn chips under your chair are a little scary, but after a game in March, I really look forward to spinach dip and a margarita at Julio GS.

I really wanted to like this place. I had the pork and shrimp spring rolls and the chicken and shrimp vermicelli salad, both were quite good except for the rice paper and noodles which tasted like they were dehydrated with unfiltered tap water, both tasted strange.

take your money elsewhere unless you have kids, I really try to like this place, a family member signed me up for the discount card so I go there more often, but I just don't like it, it's just okay, but the prices are outrageous and the sounds and animatronics are a huge distraction from the solo food. I bet it's better if you have little ones to take

I came for a friend's birthday and really wasn't very impressed. First of all, it took us a while to find parking because this place only has street parking and a few spots in the back on Saturdays if you're there before noon, all alcohol was turned off and some appetizers were special. We had dinner there and the menu was very limited. The food was okay but our burgers were overcooked. Service was slow and it took us a while to get our check.

only one goal is to get the diagnostic fees and split Francisco told me I have to spend more on parts, the manufacturer only charges to stay away. I plan to file a complaint with the Attorney General's office today, I hope they stop this nonsense.

I live very close to this theater so I go there whenever I can, I went to one of the opening Avengers movies, the movie was great, but when I use the restrooms they are very small for the amount of people going there. There was no toilet paper. One was broken, long lines and soap dispenser didn't work. doesn't tip back and the seats start to recline from constant use so you feel like you're bending forward

I had so high hopes for October in Scottsdale, delicious tacoswow, a ripoff just to get into that was that, no shade, unless you buy a drink, most places wouldn't give you salsa or taco sauce with your miserable overpriced taco, they were like vultures who didn't care about the customer, just the ticket they could take from you. ready to leave after a few minutes and my pepsi had gotten hot so I had gotten a cup of ice from the bar I poured it out took a drink and as I was leaving to go back to my car security stopped me and would they let me take it out there might have been some alcohol in it at that point I was an angry little local I threw it all in the trash and told my sweet daughter in law who was about to get mad at me get me out of here she had brought her one year old thinking what a fun way to spend a Saturday morning and support our local businesses no that's not good

I really enjoy writing reviews praising a place for its great food service, ambiance and value for money or any combination thereof, unfortunately this is not one of those reviews, this is a fish story, not about the big one that got away, nor about the time I was fly fishing with my dad and had to rescue him because he went into a deep hole and sank when his waders filled up of water. no starters checked with the hostess and we were told a minute wait for a table, we knew the place was popular so we weren't upset about the wait as we were looking forward to a wonderful dinner, we went to the bar to order wine and that's when our disappointment began. definitely not an opportunity to order a drink, I had just told my wife I wasn't prepared to wait a few more minutes without wine when the hostess pleasantly surprised us by saying a table was ready, our relief was short lived, but after being seated it took about a few minutes before our server came to the table, we ordered wine and water. fries about a few minutes later our side of truffle parmesan fries arrived without trout when asked about the missing trout she said it would take a few more minutes because the kitchen was backed up when asked why she brought the side of fries she said she thought we wanted them first a leap of logic that totally escaped us when our server said she could take the fries back to keep them warm until our trout was ready, my wife and I looked at each other in amazement and made a spontaneous decision given that we were now starving on our original side within minutes of our truffle parmesan fries gone, our trout arrived as I indicated at the start, it saved the day, the fish was fresh, perfectly prepared and outstanding, as good as the trout, but it wasn't good enough to make us ever return to the greenhouse. more in the Phoenix metro area that are significantly nicer, spend your hard-earned money elsewhere
very nice location but the food was horrible there was a chicken salad yuck the service stank a lot

disappointing courage I ended up at the San Carlos even though it was the only hotel in the city center that wasn't full I don't think it was worth the night but I had no choice the shower was incredibly small I felt like I was being pushed against a wall just to wash my hair the walls are super thin I could hear snoring from one room coughing on the other side of the corridor and on the other side just terrible the staff were not very helpful I forgot to set an alarm clock I refused to help when an alarm had been going off in another room for over an hour in the middle of the afternoon and the ghost lounge was very cute and it was a swing night which looked like it would be fun, I would be willing to come back to the lounge but not the hotel that's for sure.

i came, stayed up until the early hours, caught up with a friend who was in town for a few days and staying near a pretty decent bar, was able to talk over the music without shouting, no bullshit was seen and they kiloliter service was attentive, a team effort but a bit robotic, they seemed a bit overstaffed and well bored, did i mention kiloliter

it's a pretty relaxing place to eat at the drinks bar, we went there on a sunday evening after a big meeting that took place at the phoenix convention center, they were able to accommodate a group of about one person without any problems, there aren't many people there, their quesadillas and curly fries are pretty good and i couldn't resist having the nachos over and over again, but definitely avoid their caesar salad, i know who orders salad at a bar anyway
the food is quite decent, the friendliness of the staff is random
food was good, service was slow, this is the first time I have had to go out through a parking lot to go to the bathroom.

Decades ago when this festival was booming and I lived in Tempe I went to this street fair as we called it then a couple of times as it was going on today I went with a friend the festival has grown in blocks now it's pretty big I think they claim the vendors have to include the food vendors I had my frybread taco it was super good and some dollars I was looking for something thing to buy but I left with nothing, the things I liked the most were huge home items and high ticket prices, I saw some interesting handbags but not in my budget Either this festival had jewelry, photography and pottery that a student could afford, it's still in my budget this year unfortunately, but things at that price couldn't be found here this year so I'm disappointed with the festival offerings. the best street festivals in the country, otherwise there's not much to do unless you have deep pockets or want creative ideas
expensive, not my favorite place to buy vintage items, but it's decent to enjoy

I may make a few enemies writing this review and I might even get kicked out of Tempe altogether, but seriously, Four Peaks is not the love of my life, I don't care for beer, so this is more or less a review of the non-beer food and drink atmosphere. I have met the waiters are friendly enough although sometimes the service is a little slow I get something different to eat each time which if you know me is not a good thing when I like something I get it every visit but here I'm just looking for something I like enough to order next time sigh I know I'll be back and I can't say I dread coming here I usually have fun it just feels like there's a lot places I prefer to spend my money

I heard about this company through a living social agreement, I emailed them to set up an appointment, the first available date was a month later, I went ahead and scheduled the appointment despite the wait time, a month passed on the scheduled day of the cleaning in between which I was told they would arrive and no one showed up.

but not enough to give it three dishes, it was just ok and they were out of tuna by noon, they have happy hour all night, very good promotions too, but they close so early afternoon, last call on Sunday

the reviews were so good that my friend and I had to check it out. We were very disappointed this morning trying to eat breakfast and swatting away tons of flies. They were all over us, our food, other customers and it was inside egg sandwiches were served on bun shaped hamburger buns.

I have never been to a restaurant where we were seated at a cleared table with a reservation with no water, no bread, no cutlery, no service for a few minutes before being given a menu when someone finally provided us with a menu, it then took another few minutes to get the wine, we ordered still no bread, still no food, the waiter threw the bottle of wine on the table without opening it and went to get glasses a few minutes later, she then threw the bottle opener on our table so we could open the wine ourselves while she went to get glasses. Most of the wine glasses arrived within the next few minutes and still no bread or food that I needed to continue and although the server apologized profusely she never offered to take anything off the bill or even a dessert on the house for our clearly unhappy group, the food was good, the roommate's burrito is quite remarkable but not a good enough reason to return. Others we were with had better experiences and I hope for the owners' sake that our dinner was an aberration

there have been a few happy hour monkeys here, all flavorless bacon wrapped scallops, bacon, undercooked scallops, overcooked scallops, seared tuna, flavorless pork sliders, not bad but not memorable, service was good, go to tutti santa in the same mall instead

walk the other way, walk the other way, here's how it went at Oktoberfest a few days ago, starting at night, I walk past this place and I see a place that sells a slice of pizza for real, isn't it, hello, a slice of pizza please, man, you buy a drink with it, I don't, just a slice of pizza, man, we don't sell a slice, you have to buy a drink in dollars, I should have pulled a flag on that room at this point but knowing I was going to drink I move forward wanting food in me not a wise man move me so I can't buy a slice man no you buy a drink with a slice of dollars me it doesn't say that anywhere on the menu or the walls man no don't sell a slice me what okay give me slices of pizza man you buy two slices then me yes Jesus Christ yes man topping me no no toppings cheese man we have toppings what is this guy fucking deaf me no thanks i give him the money man it takes minutes you wait i don't think they run the air conditioner in this place so i wait outside the pizza comes out tastes like absolute shit i eat it outside because in september in chandler arizona it's cooler outside then inside this place i think they had the thermostat set so the guy who works or runs the place comes outside and watches me while i eat, I'm sure if you want to eat here you can check the dumpster for plenty of slices to try first to avoid having to pay for one excuse, avoid having to pay for two, but after what I had served myself I'm pretty sure they'll beat you to it. the trash and resell it to another unsuspecting soul.
