I was the only one stupid enough to finish all the food, I wouldn't eat here if there was a natural disaster and this place was the last to be ransacked for supplies, I keep walking, I fail.

how very disappointing hello there was a delicious menu with a range of salads, pizzas and sandwiches not jack if the new restaurant wants to be a pub it should have a greater variety of selections the menu was sad because of the dietary restrictions I asked for a plain garden salad, lettuce, tomatoes and onions and it wasn't very fresh either I guess we will drive north to Pima Crossing to visit hello

I went there with my date Thursday evening, it was pretty empty, I don't think the decor is as nice as other reviews say, so good. The problem I found is that the waiter walks past you during the movie. The color of the screen is yellowish, which makes the film look old. It's more like watching a movie at home when I watch movies.

Yelp pointed me to this place while on a business trip looking for good pizza in the area, a mixed result. The restaurant is located in a strip mall, sort of hidden in one of the back corners, walk in thinking fast food, but turns out it's sit down. Why does it seem like all the burgers and pizzerias in this area sit weird anyway, I got three slices, the quality was ok, a bit mushy and filling, I couldn't pass up the three batches of free refills, it was a nice touch on a graduation day, the staff were really friendly and oh yeah, it's true. was cheap, less than dollars for more pizza than I could eat and bottomless coke, so great value, good service, ok pizza though

what can I say about glam, I really despise it every time I go there, I regret the decision and in my grandiose style I'm going to say why in a cash only listing but listen to this, the bartender will take your debit card, charge you a fee and give you cash which you can then use to buy drinks from the same bartender who just did the whole transaction. imagine the night as hipster, I feel like I'm not allowed there because I work for the man, I don't wear black leggings or razor cut bangs. I'm wearing my mall clothes and my traditional style sticking out like a sore thumb. The music is just a little off. I don't know how to say what I think, it's just okay, okay, the floor is chic, that's about it, sorry, I'm a bar snob and glam deserves my ire.

let me start by saying that after my experience I sure wish they had a half or quarter star and I'm not often at a loss for words but it's going to take some effort to walk around this establishment towards the morning, that's to their credit. I completely understand the crowds on the mill at these times, so I lower my expectations. stock of cups to restock his dispenser, but first takes his hand, fingers placed inside the cup and gives me one yuck, I didn't catch it, so I gave him the first cup and took the cup with the lingering finger taste as my own. Fast forward a few minutes. The guy is there his friends are loud and his face is wide open because of who knows what incident he is arguing about and finally his friends take him out now if I had run this place this guy and his screaming and his problems would have been asked to keep his hands and his bloody shirt bumping and walking past people were chatting but let's just drop that because he is busy and again it's a grinder and it's fast forward a few minutes tell the guy the ice machine is off several minutes later they refill it again, no big deal on that one and with the high temp in the place maybe it killed the fingerprint bacteria in my cup while we waited, I'm wishful thinking for several more minutes, go buy people bustling around wickedly spreading cheese, sandwich wrappers all over the floor as we walked. was trashed I went back up and asked the guy for our order he said oh sorry I forgot I was amused but it's just pizza slices and a pretzel he throws them in the oven and a few minutes later I get them back fine. The pizza was obviously there forever but it was a pretzel pizza that was hard as a rock and couldn't eat it and then the show starts. sweaty face on hand gets money, then makes pizza with topping with bare hand, places it in the oven without gloves, this happens over and over again, then when his friends come there is a series of hand slaps, where did these guys come from, did they wash their hands, so in the minutes I'm here, I don't wash hands with gloves, his hands on food toppings, money, hands face with every possible surface, fucking disgusting, but it gets better, his friends with whom he is conversing are about to ice the cake, one of them, this guy with red hair, reaches behind the counter near the pickup and grabs fries from the trash can with his hands, this happens no less times, another asks him to meet them in the bathroom, uh, yes, this locked bathroom father is closed to customers hmm, my imagination can only wonder what brief activity happened in the toilets. give this guy some points at the end of the night he started taking over the place as it had slowed down nicely, that's obviously his job and they have to clean up at the end of the night anyway but I was surprised at this point and my food wasn't eaten, we finished having fun watching it all and he asked to take our plate. I appreciate that, but honestly there is no excuse for even a small percentage of the actions to have taken place. I see this as a health risk and was more comfortable at taco stands in Mexico than at this establishment. Anyway, I will contact the owner of this place. soon if anything just to see if any changes are made after expressing my concerns if necessary I will be happy to forward my videos to the county health inspector thanks for reading this little novel

I was so disappointed with this place that I just moved here and was craving some Filipino food and found this place based on the reviews even though the reviews were average. I was hoping to catch this place on one of its good days nope, that's not the case, the place doesn't have much to look at and the food didn't look good. two bites and threw the rest away, well I won't come back here, there is another Filipino place in Phoenix so we will try the next ginger one also in Chandler is much better but expensive, I guess it's worth the price when you have your cravings

I was actually really excited to eat at Saguaro Grille the first and last time I went there, finally a reasonably priced casual restaurant not owned by a corporation or crazy people. First of all, the server had no idea what the soup was or what type of bread they had, because apparently their bread inventory looked nothing like the one printed on the menu. on the croissants my dining companion got a portabella burger which is a burger with a giant mushroom cap instead of meat for people without vegetarian friends and I had a chicken sandwich and an Italian wedding soup we had to repeat the order two or three times before the server got it, the server then told my dining companion how she wanted her burger done, she kindly pointed out that portabella burgers only have two possible states and note it's the dichotomy of the mushroom burger genre, wait you want which bothered the waiter he had put it down for a regular beef burger, it turned out they didn't actually have portabella at the place we waited, the soup showed up in one of those skinny coffee cups and the waiter tried to pawn it off on the wrong person, it was a pretty good soup but there was just no way to adjust the seasonings without ruining my sandwich well it was ok nothing fancy I was very hungry and it didn't hit me until I was almost done the promised buttermilk ranch dressing was regular ranch with buttermilk my meal the companions fruit was old and its tuna melt not particularly tunatastic we are masochists we decided to have dessert the only thing on the menu we wanted was of course not actually available so we decided to go with coffee mom ordered cold coffee she specifically said I would have a small iced coffee I ordered a double shot of espresso not too complex the waiter came back for a while to make sure I really wanted a double shot of espresso in my iced coffee absolutely not worth the price or the obligatory trip to the twilight zone
they wouldn't honor pets because the online sale prices are the first time I've heard of them

hot breakfast, no cold food yet when it's supposed to be hot, people are wary of this place overpriced and lack of customer care, seems like that's the way of doing business, still a nice place to visit but don't eat here and don't care
this place is so ok food ok ambiance just a decent restaurant in Buckeye

I went here for dinner, there were only other people there on a Monday evening, even with waiters for people, the service was absolutely terrible, we almost walked out after not being served for about a few minutes, the food itself is not good, but it is entirely edible. with a crowd like this I don't know how long they can stay open

i am a big fan of chipotle but i will never come back to this place the staff looks miserable and is slow the cashier decided she would rather clean the tables then call people so we waited for her to come back most of the tables were already clean so she could have waited to clean the rice was crispy like it wasn't fully cooked and the steak was really soft never again

this place is ok if you are so hungry you don't care what you eat the chips and salsa are great but everything else is pretty bland i am a fan of tamales and would definitely not order it again they do very good chicken tacos but you only get small tacos and it's pretty much no thanks i would prefer taco bell over mi amigos the staff is very nice and the service is good too bad the food is not up to par

I bought a pair of non-Parisian sandals with taxes at the shoe factory. I considered buying online but decided to buy locally. I ended up paying more but assumed I was paying for the superior service. I wore my new shoes to work at the end of the day on Friday. I had developed blisters on both feet near my toes and ankles. I was told that the shoe factory did not accept returns, I have never tried to return shoes so it did not occur to me to ask this question when I made the purchase, but like I said I expected full service from a high end shoe store, I will not be shopping at the shoe factory again, it has been three days and my feet are still recovering, it is a constant reminder of my dissatisfaction with my purchase, I will definitely make random purchases next time.

ugh, my scam should have been the guy who saw me reading the menu and came over to tell me the food was good but I was craving Chinese, I work near coconut center and it was threatening to rain, I scanned the menu, found King Pay chicken and ordered, they told me minutes and they were accurate, the price was reasonable, the waiting room was comfortable and well decorated, the food was inedible. I would get acid reflux if I ate it I couldn't order the fried rice because it had peas in it I learned to pose from childhood trauma the rice was curdled and hard to eat the King Pay Chicken contained a strangely generous amount of meat so much so that I wondered if it was actually chicken I watch too many movies the spring roll was just disgusting it looked like the wad of mushy vegetables were wrapped in cookie dough before being fried the biscuit fortune was stale and fortune was even lame I would have been better off getting wet and taking Panda Express

no I don't want to take the bus to the train, in my opinion they didn't go far enough for the people who live in Phoenix. This may be a good solution for Tempe and Mesa residents traveling to Phoenix, but it is not effective for Phoenicians who want to travel from the North Valley to Cento.

the food is moderately priced and good but the drinks are outrageously expensive in Scottsdale, I admit the lime martini was very delicious, the hellfire chips and Asian shrimp were perfect and I would definitely recommend the food.

so yeah Kelly's review has me more than a little worried thinking we won't be going back for a while, probably a while, I'd rather be sure they took care of this shit literally, but here's why we'll still end up going back, it's all about things, it's conveniently located, it makes you feel like you're eating healthy, the rating doesn't really encourage healthy eating, just a healthy attitude keeps the brownies, chocolate pudding pizza and salads basic of mayonnaise in large quantities, then finally the coupons, they have coupons all the time all the time. special note if you're not very hungry don't go here, go somewhere else where you can share your meal or take home here that a plate of green salads is going to cost you as much as the guy on his plate

it's your regular sports bar that caters to the Chandler crowd, something not so blue, the ambiance is nice, darker big screen TVs everywhere, the waitresses are attractive, a must in these types of places and they are friendly and attentive. we sat on the patio where there is a nice little bocce ball area and it was lovely to enjoy the lovely February weather so we ordered burgers as we were both in the mood for a big hunk of beef, hopefully topped with bacon and other dummies. They have done a very good job of being a sports bar but not impressive they claim their meat is freshly ground but when it is the patty has a different type of shape and is less flat and compacted ok maybe they grind it in the morning and then stock up on patties for the day which is ok the bacon I ordered the all star bacon and cheddar beef was lame thin a bit of a dead end and not crispy the cheese was good i liked that the meat was grilled and so it tasted good also the inside wasn't overcooked and the bun they served it on was pretty sweet and tasty giant actually the sides were blah coleslaw was really boring and literally had ingredients white cabbage carrots sweet mayonnaise something i would expect from chili peppers or Dennis, the burger hit the spot but the rest was plain and boring, Stella wasn't as cold as I prefer, our staff was very good so far, a place ok to visit, but a star location is somewhere I'll probably go out of my way to visit, it didn't make a difference.

a word went out, i know my thai food and this place was pretty much a star, an extra star for good service, i came here with my mom, uncle and aunt and being my first time i chose to order my usual pad, we also ordered coconut fried shrimp, mango papaya salad, tom yum soup and fried rice honestly, the best thing about our order was the coconut fried shrimp, they came out hot, crispy and flavorful, everything else needed help, the fried rice was too overwhelming, it tasted like too much fish sauce and was very salty, the tom yum soup was a little bland and we had to add fish sauce to it and the pad saw that we were way too spicy to be medium mild, it was full of that unpleasant pepper flavor which I definitely wasn't used to in my pad, we too, my aunt and uncle think the place hired a new chef from kitchen or something because as they are regulars the food this time definitely wasn't worth the bill, we ended up keeping the food untouched so we could modify it ourselves at home to our liking, overall there are other places around town with better food star for friendly staff

the management group at this place needs to make a better effort to control the number of people jumping into theaters. My experience in this theater was one of the worst I have ever had. I will never return to this theater again. I felt like it was nothing more than a total money grab.

ok so I wanted to try this place because I heard they were really good so I did and man I should have had the whole scoop on how long the wings were taking after a few minutes I asked what was wrong with our order especially because there were only three other customers there. The employee went ahead and told me they threw away my wings because the others were too small. served quickly, call ahead an hour and you will be fine, the wings are good but an hour for ten wings maybe not

I'm not a big fan of this place, I hate these centers where you have to park in a lot and pay to park. I already pay to go to stores and restaurants. Why do I have to pay for parking too, it seems stupid and not a good way to get people to patronize your business. I'd rather go to Desert Ridge Tempe Market or any other.

This is my first time eating Cambodian food, I'm not sure how it tastes, so it's hard to say if this is what Cambodian food is. A quiet little place, the entrance wasn't intuitive for us for some reason, we walked into the kitchen, it's the door on the left if anyone was curious on a Monday at lunch, we were the only ones there around noon, I didn't know what to order but I like shrimp so I went for it, I opted for the shrimp long rice combo, it comes with rice soup and marinated salad, the dish arrives. a nice square plate so it makes the food look more fancy just because it's on a square plate a lot of shrimp on my plate and they are big the shrimp was grilled and it was good but I wouldn't say it was incredibly good I was in love I ate it and I like it but I wondered what Cambodian food is because the flavors don't seem unique it looks like they grilled it in soy sauce maybe some sugar added more of salt and maybe one or two other spices Friday there's a bunch of green onions in the shrimp, I think they add more flavor, they're not cut into little pieces, it's like the whole stalk but I ate everything, I always eat everything, I don't waste my food, it's almost like a sin to not finish your food unless you take it home, so too bad, the marinated salad was refreshing. the soup definitely makes it better too boohoo my dish was pretty good priced, thumbs up to that, overall I would go again huh, I don't know, I need to try other Cambodian places or maybe I should just have google for maybe Vietnamese food is better apparently the countries are located next to each other so it's similar to Vietnamese food

the service stars that are so rare the food stars my husband and I are a little picky when it comes to steaks we eat goons and maestros but we wanted to try a new steakhouse while visiting Phoenix and Durant had great reviews when you arrive at the restaurant you walk through the kitchen pretty cool to see everything then you are greeted by the host we came for a pretty early dinner and literally every single person on the host's kitchen staff the waitresses welcomed us the decor is pretty cool kind of burlesque all the walls are a deep red there are huge vases of roses everywhere our waiter Fred was awesome very friendly and professional I had their vegetable beef soup good but salty and my husband had a house salad I ordered the trout with a lemon caper sauce which was very bland my husband had Riley and it was also bland which was surprising their cream rule dessert trio was the best part of the meal so to From this meal we decided that if we wanted steak, we'd stick to our usual jerks

yes I shopped here dirty as expected, maybe it didn't start because a big batch, the service is hit and miss and usually they are very helpful sometimes when they ask for discount on damaged items it's a good response from a rare and positive employee, other times even if it's to the manager the clerk is crying with such a dirty look you can hear them thinking you're cheap ex it's already discounted during customs clearance it's still damaged, so what is your beef that wants a little more discount, which we don't need, no stinking discount on discount

if I could give zero stars I would have never spent more time looking for a bar than this one and not like a cool underground dance club in Los Angeles when we finally found this stole sandwiched between two vacant businesses it was barely visible the sign as it looked like it was written with a Sharpie on a piece of cardboard and someone tapped a flashlight on it before we even entered the bar as my friend and I were walking towards two redneck bikers were whispering fags as we walked past them, I don't think he's the kind of guy you'd argue with so I let it go when we walked into the bar, I noticed several no guns signs stuck on the walls, I guess they've had a problem with that before, remember that scene in the Blues Brothers where they go to the country bar and get the look of death from the patrons. the bar for karaoke but apparently they also sell crappy jewelry for some weird reason, I've never heard so much swearing from the karaoke singers, one of the drunk thugs actually got into an argument with one of the tattooed, toothless, morbidly obese girls, where they argued over who was the bitch and who was the pussy halfway through my beer, my friends showed up and they refused to go in so I ran away and never looked back. harley davidson bandana and gear

lees sandwiches has always been a nice place to go since it opened in Chandler years ago from what I remember it was cheap and delicious when I went back today I found it to be cheap in a different way also I ordered the carbon and pork on a croissant and a large Thai iced tea without ice not quite the lees I remembered they called my number and I went to get my food croissant sandwich checking there was no ice in my drink checking the Thai iced name checking my large cup was only half full not being entirely optimistic literally half full I picked up my cup and asked where the rest of my drink was and was told I didn't order ice duh I told him I didn't order a drink and he said he wouldn't give me what I paid for very very disappointed the only thing that saved the lees from the star was the delicious sandwich stars customer service no stars

I came back from vacation and had some amazing soups that made me think about my experience here. I have to preface this review by saying that the owner here is quite charming and I'm sure he has the best intentions, but unfortunately the soup was sorely lacking as a supporter of organic produce. I had way too many hopes. a seat eliminating our initial confusion to keep this review to the point we ordered a bland smoothie, a frittata very small and actually strange like it could have been cooked in the microwave, I need to say more than two bowls of soup, one was a bean with kale, unfortunately the beans were not cooked well and the flavor was not allowed to develop. the soups needed a good development and the herbal infusions which are obviously lacking in the kitchen. I would like to offer a suggestion that might help so that she can spend more time making soup and less time running around the table at the front, and that is to consider a different style of serving. The place is so small that she might ask customers to order from the board if it's legible, then deliver the orders. I wish him the best in his business.

this place is worse than that which is at least what we admit when they made a mistake but these arrogant workers will be caught dead before they hear themselves apologize for the inconvenience or we made a mistake they gave me different information on two consecutive visits I made then slept a lady who obviously shouldn't have been working that day because she was coughing phlegm all over my documents then after asking me to wait at the counter for minutes while their system was updating I waited for hours and minutes later I finally went to the information desk and asked for sleep I was told she went to lunch a few minutes ago and I was told to go talk to another lady she had just fired me and I went to talk to the new lady who was also extremely rude and kept rolling her eyes and interrupting me before I could finish my sentences. Basically spent a total of an hour and a half waiting and having an attitude and nothing was resolved because of their information and hassle, idiotic customer service ethic and pride of the last lady, no one resolved anything and they were all too proud to say we apologize for the inconvenience, I recommend this place if you want to be late. work or more hours and have your mild-mannered patience tested to the max

eh the pasta is too salty just because Mario B says cooking your pasta in salted water doesn't mean you have it too then pouring salty sauce on it I tried to tell the manager but was blown away just because you work for fries doesn't mean you know what good food is also greasy for pizza

quick place for a california roll made with artificial mayonnaise this is where you'll learn how sushi can go bad you worked hard to make swipeandsign maybe you even dropped a thousand dollars to the germans on a worthless jane barnes sweater and discarded canella pants or three grand on a collection of briony blazers whatever your fancy you're carrying a wrist full of shiny rope bags with tissue paper sticking out at the top you just want a break and some cool, refreshing sushi, it's ok but watch out for Nazis and other hot food, beep-beep-beep-beep before they get to you, California and the spicy tuna rolls come very quickly because they come from a vat of mayonnaise, the rice isn't good either, stick to the tuna and salmon dashiki and miso soup if chef Rick is there, consider Kyoto from the empire at Th and Camelback then Chi Ban University in McClintock have him give you a big bob on acid for the sake of time or just go to Starbucks, get ready and find a real sushi restaurant and speaking of the Briony, don't sweat buyers' remorse, I'll get a great tax deduction in Florence

I've been wanting to try this place for a while after hearing good things about it and reading the menu. I now understand why the website doesn't list prices. The mission is horribly overpriced. We ended up on the patio as they weren't yet seated in the main area at 6pm. Our waitress was kind and attentive. She noticed my water had something floating in it and quickly replaced it. My husband's glass of water was dirty too. margarita no free chips and salsa which would be nice if they offered something else like barrio no happy hour either which was disappointing the street corn was good but I've had much better the butternut squash tacos were to die for my husband liked them better than his tacos but I just can't believe they have the nerve to charge for small inch diameter tacos they also charge for avocado based guan I don't know how they have survived in this economy, they must be very slow when the tourists leave for the summer

beware of the hidden extra charge per person for tea even if you don't drink tea the really crazy thing is I'm sure no one even notices the extra cost because who checks the bill when I mentioned it to the cashier she stuttered and stuttered and started backpedaling and said oh this is the first time we can take it off the bill I said forget it keep it I usually give a tip but I'll just let them keep their skimpy per charge yeah definitely worth losing a customer for my one year old daughter even gets the free tea the party fee and she only drinks water is gone the flat rate per item can you say bait and switch so now they are no different from the rest of the dim sum places as sneaky as coo trying to beef up the tip which failed miserably and lost us and our friends as as customers, so in a down economy you're supposed to raise your prices and sneak in stealth surcharges, that's the Chinese way, I guess I'll go back to the King of China for us, sorry the King of China for being disloyal with a brief and sordid affair with the palace, you'll forgive us hah

eh the food was good but not something I was craving I had a pain of chicken shit which obviously came with corn on it, actually it was the adobe bread mesquite turkey, fresh mozzarella, green peppers, corn relish and chipotle mayonnaise. again, if friends were already going there but it wasn't a place I would really mention when trying to think of a place to eat

writing my review made me return to this establishment for a manicure. I arrived this morning, but unfortunately the sign on the door says they don't open until morning. So I ran a few errands and came back to this morning. There was no one in the store and all the lights were off again. It's already warmer outside in the morning. I decided I didn't need such a bad manicure and left.
pool supplies next to quiz subs
What more can I say except that greasy Mexican food is overpriced. I've had better in Texas. The only thing that saved them from being a star is their excellent salsa.

it's getting boring around here, it's been at least months since they opened but they have the same old flavors, I know you've been busy but what happens to the rotating flavors, I don't know if it's a seasonal thing or a cost factor but even the pomegranate toppings are gone although they have pomegranate, not a fan of mine, the competitions are moving in so change isn't a bad thing

stars for uniqueness this place has very interesting food and flavors that are not common here stars for staff everyone was very fast and friendly stars for coolness of location and establishment I mean it's pretty cool that this place is in a nicely redone annual house in a cool part of downtown Phoenix the parking is a pain but besides feeling hip, urban and trendy I also felt hungry and ripped off after leaving, sure I could sit there for hours sipping saki and trying each of their tapas and probably be fine hunger wise but I wouldn't agree with the tab per person, it would surely be for me, it's more of an uninspiring place to go before going out to dinner.

unless you are a regular or look like you have a fat wallet, don't expect the best service, starters cost about silver and anti-pasta between desserts are all silver, unless you have aged balsamic vinegar, they also have a great selection of cheeses. I made reservations for this restaurant and they seated us near the back door. The waiter never explained anything about the menu or suggested a wine to accompany our meal. to explain the menu and go so far as to tell her tables how to eat the cheese it comes with jelly and my meal was good I had the duck she had the salmon which tasted very fishy not fresh at all the wine cost money for a carafe maybe if we had a dollar bottle we would have had better service the dessert was good it was a rich chocolate cake with walnuts and chocolate sauce nothing too special overall the experience was made the meal not worth the money in these times not to mention they overcharged my girls card for drinks at the bar if we don't want to give don't charge it clearly just a warning the reservations and customer service mean nothing we mentioned our complaints to the waiter and manager we received an apology but how come our dessert or something Wyatt won the staff are also rude for the most part two thumbs down
fair prices and no upwelling, these guys are goodbye, be warned, it's as busy as an angry hive on a Monday morning

stars the short, open, clean setup with friendly staff, but it's just carrying kids' food along the south side of Thomas, just west of the street, turning left into the parking lot can be a bear during rush hour, but it's otherwise fairly accessible for people arriving from the west or walking like I did. who appeared to be the head cashier loudly greeted everyone who came through the front door on the other side of the restaurant. My cashier was friendly and prompt, although he seemed a little exhausted from the little rush. I ordered the box combo and a lemonade to go and headed back to my office a short walk away. a mix or carton the box comes with a small container of sweet coleslaw dressed with lots of mayonnaise a slice of soft inside perfectly browned on the outside toast a little slightly crispy thin crinkle fries a container of cane sauce that tastes like burger sauce and of course four strips of chicken unless you're me and you only get three strips of chicken or two small strips of chicken and one large strip of chicken that counted for maybe two but really halfway through the meal you're so full of carbs you're not missing anything besides the extra dollar you paid for that extra strip of chicken, the strips were fine, it was real chicken and true to the advertising, it was fresh, crispy but not as crispy as I was hoping for or even tender and moist enough to not be bad but not special. it's nice if you're like me and want to try all the new restaurants that open near my house or office and enjoy the novelty of places like this, but personally I won't be visiting again, I almost threw my cup away before I noticed the gift tab on it, I won a free slice of Texas toast, how do you like those apples

I usually shop at this store because it is the most convenient and has the best prices and selection in the area for basics such as bread, milk, eggs, meat and canned goods. Prices are generally lower than other major grocery stores. Their Kroger brand products, such as condiments, are generally of good quality compared to store brands from other stores. However, in recent years, vegetable prices have skyrocketed, with the exception of tomatoes, celery and lettuce. making it more difficult to find the items you are looking for and making what should be a quick trip through a Balfour ordeal the aisles also seem to be more difficult to navigate with bulky displays sticking out here and there and it is difficult to get around other customers. What I like is that there are four self-checkouts, so you usually don't have to wait in line. none sometimes due to customer price confusion on receipt it's a little hard to tell if you paid the right price, read your receipt carefully

hell, I'm not asking for much, I ordered a slice of quiche and an iced coffee, they didn't have to cook the quiche, just reheated it. I waited a few minutes and then went to the counter to ask for it. The waiter looked confused and the guy who took my order said he got lost. I heard the waiter apologize to at least three tables, but not to me. the waiter said it was mushrooms and spinach so I had to wonder for a minute what the bright red things in my quiche were twisting I figured out it was mushroom and chard coffee huh the floor looked dirty there was a paper towel in the toilet ok I'm nitpicking now the place was moderately busy the small private parking lot was full luckily I was on my scooter so I could easily squeeze into a non-work space

i love the idea that mexican vegans tried to eat there twice both times they checked their fa page for hours both times it was closed they called their phone number no one answered no sign no explanation about fa pathetic

I love giving these guys a better review because they were very friendly and professional, but I was very disappointed with the service I received. I'll type out the one sarcastic comment that I can't get out of my head, and then I'll get to the more substantive comments. I thought one detail was supposed to be a little more detailed. Here are the positives, because I want to give credit where credit is due. The guys come up to you and are very polite. and the exterior wax job looked awesome on the negatives when I came out to see the work they did I immediately noticed several spots on the interior which they cleaned up after pointing them out I also noticed a scratch on the passenger side leather seat and a hole punched in the carpet near the pedals. Anyone who knows me knows that I am a detail-oriented person. These defects were not present in my car before this job to add to this little disappointment a day later my boyfriend and I noticed they hadn't even touched my trunk. even bother vacuuming when advertising on your website showroom quality i expect showroom quality overall review good work on the outside the attention to detail on the inside was very poor i am really disappointed that the attention to detail just wasn't there i expected so much more from a detail job

met a group of friends here on a Monday evening a large group although the vegans were not informed of our crowd arriving they did well with the service and the beers were served. Fast food took a little longer but with a group our size that's to be expected, the outdoor patio area was great on a hot night, a friend had the sliders and said they were quite tasty when they finally arrived, happy hour prices are decent with a good selection of beers and mixed cocktails.

I guess it's not really the most accessible place, but Frank Albert is located in the spa of the Arizona Baltimore Resort and serves as a restaurant for its guests, since the other breakfast place was just a cafe that served pastries. the waitress was lazy but I thought it was fine the eggs benedict themselves weren't the best firstly the ham they used was overcooked I'm jerky secondly the English muffin was too toasted and too crispy which ruined the overall consistency a bit.

I have a lot of nice and uninteresting things to say about Phoenix's latest venture into serious public transportation construction, a good thing, mainly because it's new, the cars are really clean after living in LA and using the subway, everything seems cleaner than this, let's just hope they keep the light rail clean in the years to come. the current downtown stops are well thought out once you get off, something is always within walking distance, good thing the price of the Allay pass is worth it, unlike public transportation in LA, the light rail is usually on time and a reliable way to get around. There don't seem to be any car companies trying to keep the city going by closing stations like they did in the 1950s. The only logic to taking light rail is that it's basically a car you don't have to park or fill up with gas, it's not. that it's slow but actually only goes slightly faster than the cars traveling next to it on the street, the slowness of light rail comes from the fact that it has to stop at traffic lights like the cars you've decided not to drive. I think the smarter idea would have been to build the light rail above or underground so it could go faster and not have to stop at lights or risk some idiot pulling it and T-boning one of the passenger cars, but I know this experiment is still in the training wheels stage. but I really wish they would build a line that would go to North Phoenix Scottsdale or Glendale. I heard they are planning a route in Glendale, but that will probably take another ten years, even though I live a few blocks from one of the stops. I really wish I didn't limit myself to downtown Tempe or Mesa. Phoenix is ​​trying to kill any chance of building a real nightlife downtown, we're not kids, this city shouldn't set a valley-wide curfew before midnight, metro is more of a word than not, it has its flaws that it still needs to work out and it's a little difficult to judge something that is in what I hope is a very nascent form of what it will eventually become.

I decided to give this place a spin yesterday during my lunch around noon from work the space was nice and airy the staff from front of house to waiters were all very friendly the sheets on the tables as well as linen napkins the only thing was the menu lacked a bit of sparkle the appetizer selection was just hummustzatziki served a selection of olive flatbread a few selections of pork belly I had the lamb burger I ordered medium it was served a rarer but was still good it offered more expensive starters and there were other selections of burgers and sandwiches hence the name castro pub they had good beers on tap

ok now it's a big chain and on average it's good to good and I've been to this place many times but I have to say the last time I went there for happy hour the hot wings were overcooked then I had ordered a cajun steak and seafood combo but after my second brew I thought it was me so I had my wife and son taste it it was salty it was like they had dropped the salt shaker in the food, but my waitress assured me that couldn't have happened because all sauces come in bags. and they are redone disgusting, that did it for me, I got out of there quickly

my wife and I had lunch here not too hungry so we shared spring rolls and a dish, my name it's a good thing we weren't hungry because the size of the dish was smaller than we expected but we had shrimp spring rolls which were basically tasteless just like her peanut sauce dish was ok and the broth which wasn't supposed to be a full soup was excellent.
I give up when you can still see the dough through the sauce and the cheese and the extra cheese and when the manager looks at it and says yes it's extra cheese I won't go back sorry

cool atmosphere and good service the food is good but seems like they are still working on their recipes the free bread was cold a small but important detail and the salsa verde was mediocre I had the orange fennel shrimp and there was too much orange and almost no fennel my boyfriend had the lobster mac and cheese said the lobster didn't taste fresh and the sauce was too rich Ernie the manager came and introduced himself he explained the remodel of the previous concept, we will definitely come back to support a local cityscape place, just hope to see improvements in the food

friends came so a group of us went here a nice little place with a good atmosphere the basic and comfortable wines by the glass were good the bread was a bit stale but still pretty decent we ordered a variety of things the antipasto plate was good with several typical dishes my tomato sausage pizza was good not much need for spice and flavor the halibut on sundries the tomato and basil risotto with asparagus was very good but the halibut was a little overcooked otherwise almost everyone liked the food one person ordered a dish and asked for a little spicy but it was way too spicy and they couldn't eat it, her husband ate it the next day because he could handle the spice but seriously it was way too spicy for most people, it's not a bad place would probably go again but won't deviate as the location is a bit out of the way
refused to call me a taxi because I had a phone

korean food at decent prices, they offer more korean style soups and casseroles, no bibimbap, but their kali tang is really good, huge bowl, lots of kali yum yum yum, they are also open much later than many other restaurants, always a plus

clean, bright and fast I came here with my husband and we both had a comboplatter which included a marsala xhosa, slow and sambar, everything was tasty and way too much food, I guess it's a mixed bag because some of his friends, they all work nearby, come here several times a week for lunch and others swear it's terrible because for me I love the chutney bar it's nice to be able to have as much as you want and I recommend both the coconut chutney and the mint chutney or mix them together like my mother in law does with her homemade yummy, I think this place is quite tasty but I won't come here often just because of the fact that it's a major care overload and I wish the xhosas weren't so expensive, I think they are about for one but that being said it's great for a treat every now and then
cool place but don't try to organize a special event, the owner was arrogant, inflexible and unethical when I organized my friends bachelorette party at the duce, be warned

the food is good but I think the prices are too high for what you get considering there are plenty of other places to go for good subs, salads and fruit platters that would be much cheaper, it's hard to choose duck and jug over them but I'll go here when I don't have to pay why not right

I recently had a shit cleaned at the Intercontinental Hotel in Hong Kong, not cheap. I only mention that because this place charged more to clean this suit almost for a two pence suit after adding their designer brand extra, no I'm not kidding despite the green brand the suit still smelled like solvent, the green silica based solvents never left a smell in my experience, no differentiation to justify these absurd prices, lots of good alternatives in the area be warned.

ok I didn't get good reviews on this place, I finally made it to Lamar before it closed for the day and tried some donuts. I have a few issues here the big one can we please list that only the donuts with holes are a bit misleading just quote the price and call the donuts and have them turn out so much more it makes me want to buy my donuts from someone else these donuts are way overpriced and they are average at best the maple bar tastes just like you do. i eat spoonfuls full of sugar they are so sweet and the rest of the donuts i tried were pretty stale this will be the first and last time i go to lamar give me creme crisp or anyone else for that matter thank goodness for lamar we don't have spudnuts in the valley cause they would be out of business

the food is as good as the coronado location but the ambiance is seriously lacking, the interior smelled funky so we opted for degree heat and ate outside instead. The main reason for three stars instead of four is that they messed up our order, it's not a huge offense, you say right, they put their spicy jalapeño users on my toddlers quesadilla instead of on my burrito, they substituted it but in the end their food is good, I love the carne and pork we will eat here again, but I will check twice to make sure the order is right

yet another disappointing desert sushi restaurant my date and I went here for their late happy hour on a Friday night I noticed it was difficult for large groups to get a table there wasn't much space between tables I played it safe and ordered a plate of salmon nilgiri I noticed there wasn't a large selection of raw fish we ordered the peach penny and spicy tuna tempura from the menu at happy hour I thought I would get a peach penny which is a thicker substance but it ended up being a penny mixed with peach sweetener which killed the alcohol, maybe it was my mistake ordering penny at a sushi restaurant the spicy tuna tempura was a spicy tempura roll fried in tempura batter then sauces dripped all over each cut piece. I couldn't taste any type of kick from the roll. Stay away from happy hour rolls. What I think might be helpful is to describe what is in each roll rather than listing all the rolls on a sheet of paper so you can choose and how much. salad and yoga tend to be the least expensive menu items to prepare. Handing them out could encourage customers to come back. I won't come back.

it's an aquarium in a latino supermarket, nothing special but you have options, they will have pretty much anything you might like, it's not gourmet and some things are just in the pans but at least you can look at what you want, I would go back if I just needed something quick

stay here instead of having a real apartment pros there is someone who makes my bed a feast for the eyes they have something good the girls smoke valet parking though I have a rental car but for the evenings where are the taxis you would think to pay for the night a week you would think they would call one for me when I called the front desk they told me I could get one downstairs no I don't want to stand outside in the cold and wait the parking attendant gave me one very small rooms no couch or real sitting area and no bathtub except for the suites, no jacuzzi, the gym is this treadmill that's collapsing no, it's just someone using it.

Went to the burger joint with our family tonight and will not be returning the average food the burgers were average the lettuce was wilted the tomato was green and nothing exceptional about the flavor I say better options nearby are the farm grill entrance or the culvert the cleanliness was average the floor was a little sticky and the drinks area was very neat the kitchen seemed clean the service was below average horrible the cashier was very rude we all ordered at the same time and first half the food came out about a few minutes before the th part, it was pretty slow by the time we got the fries they were cold, the staff literally acted like they were a group of high school kids who were annoyed that customers had interrupted their hangout. I know that sounds harsh, my experience was absolutely horrible, we won't be returning and I don't recommend it to you either.

a friend of mine usually takes me to this place for dinner and once for breakfast, it's an interesting place, as others have noted, be prepared to wait a bit for service and don't be afraid to go find your server if you feel left out. There can also be a wait for a table and the environment is noisy so be prepared to shout a bit if it's busy, they do beer tasting some nights, I didn't participate but my dad who was visiting made the food varies in quality or maybe just varies in recipe quality, my table friend orange and I shared a pork chop special and it was pretty bad but I highly recommend their grilled cheese sandwich on some sort of bread delicious. The low end cheese sandwich, I haven't tried the deluxe one yet as for breakfast I don't remember it being particularly spectacular but I think it was better than your average breakfast. I may have to go back to try again. what other people eat so that you choose something good from the menu

i got a paycheck and teaching stopped for a while to eat then i got a new teaching to complete my jedi my total was different from the price listed when paying my total i gave them one and the cashier tried to keep all the change for a tip he refused to give me my change until i told him that wouldn't happen my feet were so dry afterward i don't recommend them
don't do it

the staff are friendly but the physical hotel itself is comparable to a star motel, the Holiday Express I stayed in is better than this pipeline misled me when I asked for a star and stated it was a star in the name of your own price. On the other hand they have cacti in the parking lot where when I came home late it was dark and dimly lit and I opened my car door I get out of the car and step on a cactus seriously injuring my foot where I can't walk anymore putting cacti low in a dimly lit parking lot where when you get out of a car someone can step on it getting hurt on vacation is no fun and very painful the hotel room and property are Old as in the 90s, although the boy at the reception told me the rooms were recently renovated given previous reviews. I asked for a quiet room but was given a room where the squeezing noises, thuds and shaking of the walls woke me up in the morning. The neighbors flush the toilet and the running water can all be heard. struggling with him to lock him in, he asked for a single bed, but upon arrival was told it would be an extra night for a single bed instead of the double style tube with pink decor, the bed worn out with the lumpy body in it, the wife costs for hours, even though her signal is only the bar, the air conditioning blasts loudly during the night, the curtains are cut halfway so tons of light comes into the room in the morning, the staff from the location smiles and says hello the cleaning staff does a good job.

the noodles are delicious here i got the vegetarian spicy noodles it contains nothing but noodles and the sauce it would be nice if they could add veggies to it so you chose the type of noodles you want and then the flavor the prices are super cheap and the service is fast the portions are huge and i could have eaten the whole plate if i hadn't stopped i'm curious if they use a cup because it was so hard to stop eating

I sit here as I write this, completely unimpressed with its white walls and scant attempts at decoration. This place is excessively and unreasonably rude although it is not crowded and there has never been more than one person in front of me every time I had to wait in line with two people working behind the counter. best selection of disruptive music that was too loud and annoying, thank goodness for Pandoracom, a good set of deserved and reasonable ladies, otherwise I would never have gotten any work done, the only reason I come back here is if my son had another concert to attend nearby, needless to say I don't recommend it

steakhouses are competitive today and the typical assistant probably has their favorite, my good friend and I was eager to see the type of energy that new investors injected into a local legend the wigwam at Lichfield Park as time passed over the last few years. The Wigwams ballroom has now been converted into a red steakhouse. The service started well with a nice touch of fruit choice for your water. The server had recommendations but also allowed us to think about the menu. We opted for the couples dinner, essentially a prim five with a choice of sea bass salad or steak and shared dessert. We also decided to try the crab cake appetizer just to venture off the menu a bit. presentation with fresh crab and a crispy grilled top and colorful spinach underside the avocado dressing was a little heavy on the crab and looked like fake guacamole in cheaper restaurants but the crab was dry and the waiter brought us more of that dressing the service with the Caesar salad the presentation started to falter the salad is the craze for serving whole stalks of romaine and a slice of toast reminding the waiter of salt and pepper, he quickly provided a set and advised us the salt was also in a grinder, my friend determined that the pepper grinder was broken and did not provide a coarse grind and the waiter asked if we wanted another pepper grinder actually for the price of five. I really wanted the server to politely grind the salt and pepper on our salads. The crouton had no flavor. Our steaks were cooked as ordered, but my strip didn't have much flavor. burning to retain the rare juices, the steaks were true to the server's size, the steaks were served with two stalks of asparagus which appeared to be white asparagus with green tips, a unique vegetable for the plate, a potato pancake au gratin also accompanied the steak and was quite delicious. attentive and sometimes confusing, we were just eating when the waiter dramatically closed the curtains on the window near us. One of the other diners called in sadness about losing the evening sun, but the waiter shushed him and told him they would be open intermittently to avoid dazzling the other diners. Should Reds consider awnings or subtle blinds to preserve the view of our restaurants? The wigwam may not be popping yet, but as we left the restaurant, the three restaurants on Old Lichfield Road, outside the resort gates. were busy as locals may have enjoyed more reasonable food and better service, these restaurants are our next adventure

i failed, i went here based on the reviews i found here only to find a restaurant that is not what it used to be, i guess it was a chef run restaurant, he created a name for the place but whatever it is now it has definitely fallen by the wayside and definitely not good the space is quite nice, i really didn't like sitting at the bar and having to look at the dirty kitchen all the time, the place has quite a nice atmosphere, the food, on the other hand, was bad, I had the tasting of the appetizers in which everything It was overcooked eggplant or overcooked and burned everything that had potential like bread. I kind of wanted to leave after that but I had ordered my salmon starter from the beginning and now the starter which consisted of overcooked salmon, burnt spices on top and raw skin underneath wasn't doing it because for me it came with a brick of polenta edible only by the pool of sauce on the plate. or maybe they just had a bad cook that day. I don't know, I just know I'll never go back.
not recommended if you're not white for me this is the third time someone has thrown racist slurs at my group. I'm starting to think the place is for rednecks and bowling alleys like DB are better.
maybe the bagels are good but I made the mistake of getting a chicken sandwich yuck
the sandwiches are huge, I don't want the fries to be whole and such on the menu, but it's a so I guess that's how it goes

I'm sad to write this: Be Vincent needs to make things better or his place will just be a past memory. I agree that based on the dinner I had there recently, the restaurant was packed, but with people having grouponsi, I only wish my dinner wouldn't have been too much for a weak, sad plate of expired food. We had a small takeaway portion and a solo of sad duck chimichangas, they were ok. hospital style vegetable crazy green beans with carrot shreds and minute white rice we also had the trout was covered in a heavy French white sauce and had the same vegetables crazy and white rice seriously like hospital food great banquet service it was edible but not great everyone had a glass of wine no dessert to sit down was hot in there and the arches and decor reminded me of a taco bell I wouldn't even go back if it was a free meal sad

it's not at a Shell gas station anymore and I guarantee this guy would never visit his show's new location. I ordered the El Pastor burrito and I didn't like it at all, very dry and it's just not to my taste, I will never order it again, but I'm sure there are many people who like it, the salsa was excellent and I couldn't get enough of it. and I would like to try a different type of burrito or carne asama tacos
overpriced for the size of the facility and equipment available, the staff is friendly enough and considering it's the closest fitness place to this area I guess they get away with the price happy
horrible service barely acknowledged when you first walked in slow service and waited for my check for a few minutes before getting up to go get it myself, I won't be back

I have never been to a pawn shop for any reason. Honestly, I can't even tell you what they are for. I've never seen any pawnshop stars. I don't watch television. I really appreciate this signage almost daily. I say that's all, it's the love of a little morning laugh.
now they use a hand drill to polish toenails during their Jedi instead of just a quick file. I can definitely see the difference growing on my nail bed, it's not good.

I went to Nova about a month after it opened and was impressed. I told all my foodie friends about my wonderful experience, the innovative menu and all the little extras that made the meal a truly special dining experience in Phoenix. I went back with friends twice over the coming months and was delighted each time I went back last Saturday and I have to say I wouldn't suggest it again for a special night out, it felt like the magic had gone and the place was showing its age and losing its specialness. really good chef talent shows but too many other disappointments when we arrived for our reservation the place was packed the host was friendly and told us our table would be ready soon and that's when we sat at our table and that's when things started to not go as well as expected sitting in a back corner which I didn't mind noticing the walls were grimy, beaten up and dirty that was my point of view so of course that's all I could focus on the waiter didn't show up for a minute to take our drinks order and when did it take a few minutes to bring them to us he apologized but on a Saturday night waiting for a first drink was no fun when he then sat down with our menus and chose our choices it was then we were told they were out of veal which of course we had chosen to that time and there was only one skate dish which of course the other one of us had decided on, they were out of other items as well. Many items on the menu may be fine when you have a larger menu, but with a small menu to begin with, it's a real disappointment. The pop rocks which I thought were so fun as intermezzo instead a spoonful of something not described was placed in front of us, a simple salad and most of the starters are at least as good but not worth the price, otherwise the starters were special but tasty and served with good presentation. Cotton candy always gets attention and I always love desert. selections, especially the malt which I ate with mini donuts and dips, I think I can overlook the fact that it's really not an appealing calming energy from the kitchen and the tables close together add noise and excitement to the room, but the art and lighting are ugly and now that's starting to look run down as well.

this place is basically a copy of the old wwfathersofficecom fathers office in Brentwood CA it took me a while to get over that fact and try it decently one of the things Deluxe has copied is the famous office burger which Deluxe calls the luxury burger they also bring out the fries in a cart just like fathers office what Deluxe fails to copy but it is the quality of the food and the superior nature of the original and the wines are changed weekly and are all incredibly rare. selections the beers also tend towards the more obscure deluxe seems to focus almost exclusively on the beers and has a decent selection but nothing you can't find elsewhere the wines are available but as an afterthought and certainly not of the quality served for the Phoenicians who never experienced the joys associated with the original fathers office you are missing out it's like being an Eric Clapton fan but not even knowing who Muddy Waters is but all imitation aside I have to say that Deluxe does a pretty good job with everything and they took the concept and adapted it to the Pox Strip mall environment. As for food, everything I tried was ok. They changed their sweet potato fries a year or two ago because the others weren't crispy enough. change that caused them to lose the star for this review, I would rather have the soggy, tastier ones, who know how they make these new ones so crispy anyway, when I go here it's almost always for convenience and late at night, few places of this caliber stay open until morning so that's about all there is when you need a late night meal in this part of town, their star rating is clearly based on eliminating one of my favorite places, fathers office with no star and for ignoring my comments about the new crispy tasteless sweet potato fries less star, they also lose a star for keeping the prices but replacing the quality of the Phoenix strip mall

five guys, it's great for those days when you want to spend on a glorified Eastwood burger, the meat comes in a very thin patty and doesn't really taste like anything, just like Wendy's, the bun has a mass produced taste, I don't particularly care for their fries either, although it's a matter of taste more than anything, I'm not usually one for thick, doughy natural fries of the kind served here. is a double patty and the fries spill out of a 1 oz beverage cup. I would rate the burgers around the mill as smashburger for their delicious Arizona burger and the awesome Chuckbox of smash fries for delicious grilled meat that actually tastes like meat, for tasty meat and some of my favorite fries five hamburger guys seriously why the hell does anyone eat burger

early Saturday night the band was playing, the crowd was just beginning to move further inside in an attempt to avoid the high volume of the band whose audio was being broadcast throughout the restaurant. I failed. I quickly realized that I must have missed sitting in the middle of the dining room as the servers moved smartly from the kitchen to the front to deliver the drinks and food to the customers. I asked a staff member if I was seated in the wrong place and soon service was rendered. restaurant, although the atmosphere was unique, I wonder why the cameras were in the men's room

The red tamales were as dry as sawdust and the green chiles came with a little chile burst. require an opinion from a family of

we had the sage with house smoked mozzarella with wood roasted onions and fennel sausage. I was very disappointed, the pizza was really greasy and just not very tasty, the crust was burnt in several places making it taste even worse.

I have some issues with this place but you can't avoid the bra when you have a baby, there is a convenience selection and a reasonable price, we set up a baby registry here mainly for convenience, it was nice but I started to notice that they were randomly discontinuing items from the registry and about a week or two later restocking them, they are not always the cheapest but when you are short on time searching the internet for deals is not going to happen and that's where bra scores, they know they can get you when you're in a hurry and need all the toiletries. are nice here after being pregnant, saw a lot of bathrooms, looks like a store aimed at pregnant women, new moms and would have nicer bathrooms as it's likely we'll use them multiple times in an hour of travel, staff are generally friendly and store is well organized, selection in store is good

I've been here a few times with my mom because she really likes it, but overall I wasn't impressed. The food was good, but the service was atrocious, it was busy last time we went, but we stood inside the door for probably a few minutes before an employee noticed us. runofthemill bean and cheese or chili ellen I had their chili ellen and wasn't impressed with it but no one refilled our drinks the whole time or checked on us once maybe it's better when you go at a less busy time but the food isn't mind blowing enough to make it worth the bad service on a Friday night

my wife and I were looking for a particular type of rose for our garden, we called this place and asked if they had it in stock and what the price was, they said they did and told us the price for a gallon sized plant, good to go, we drive there and find the rose bush, but it is listed like this, we go to the front and say we had called and drove a few minutes to get this rose and we were told oops, sometimes the prices on my list in advance no she sherlock swill you honor the listed price no so we walked down the street to the A and P nursery on the baseline west of Lindsay and got the same size plant they were selling for because don't waste your time with these scam artists.

Winch foods are all the rage now, will this continue or lose its luster once it's just another grocery store and the new kid in town, there's nothing special about it, it's your typical grocery store, I'm not a savvy coupon clipper or price comparison tool so I can't attest to the savings to be had at a thrifty shopper I know claims the savings are to be had who says there are two negatives that shine brilliantly at treuil credit cards are not accepted and cheap bags don't come here if your income is I just did my weekly shopping and was expecting to charge for them, not a surprise I was looking forward to after waiting in the long lines on my first visit most of the bags were torn at the seam and the handles were split for one reason or another. for tiki punch, take it or leave it

Angela the nurse practitioner was awesome, the baby had goofy eye and we took her to this urgent care office to see if it was pink eye so it could be treated early. It was Friday and her regular doctor was full. Angela said there was no pink eye but she had pus in her ears and had a minor ear infection so she prescribed amoxicillin antibiotics.
as you can tell, this pizza is not that woody, it is inconsistent, I like the shelves much better

not good thai food very bland ugh the two words don't go together bland and thai the peanut sauce was the worst ever the pad thai and tom ka gas soup were fresh bleach buns big but flavorless the service was ok although just disappointing

the US airlines were up there, continental, now they are over there, the fact that they started charging for their food didn't even bother me, but now they are going overboard, I didn't want to bring a heavy jacket to Cabo, so I wore a light jacket and figured the standard blanket they give you on the flight would be enough. The nap pack comes with a crappy blanket, earplugs, an inflatable neck rest to only use the money you were previously going to use to buy your crappy meal online for your standard needs so I refuse and they have to turn up the air conditioning ridiculously to tempt you to buy their stupid diaper bag because the tip of my nose was cold and I just couldn't sleep at all on my flight while I tried to cover every surface of my body with my lightweight jacket lying down and you also suck because you're out of your bought meals that don't pack enough for the flight that pisses you off, even to save money for yourself

I went mid-week and we were seated right away. La table était propre, le service était adéquat mais la nourriture pour moi est à peine cuite et sans saveur et les fameux biscuits ressemblaient plus à des mini miches de pain sans consistance de biscuit et la sauce était honnêtement juste bla après avoir entendu de telles critiques élogieuses. I had to try it once but I don't need to go back a little sad because I love breakfast.

our intrepid critical mass organizer arranged a cycle for us to complete our May ride at this facility. I was excited because the cycle claims to be a bike bar restaurant, we arrived all excited, there were plenty of bike racks for our almost riders, but when we entered the hotel we were abruptly directed to the bar entrance after being in the restaurant before going out to check out the dining room. a mile bike ride I want to eat a drink and sit down not stand at the back of a line at the bar then stand holding their drinks we weren't even sure if we could order food we left almost immediately and went across the street to Portland right after the wedding ordered we saw another group of bikers heading towards Carlos it's not like the bike didn't know we were coming if you know people are coming to your house don't you think you are preparing to welcome them and encourage them to spend freely lame

I judge a soul food place by its fried chicken, a donut shop by its old fashioned, an ice cream place by its vanilla, and a Greek place by its gyros. The gyros here are bland and totally unspectacular and come from the same frozen food purveyor nightclub as every other gyro stop in Phoenix. The cloying, thick pita didn't help either. especially near downtown Phoenix, recommendations are welcome

great tourist fare when we have family in town who appreciate a one ounce porterhouse more than a delicate dashiki, that's where we head, it's quite a distance from Phoenix but the portions are large and the service is always quick and friendly

I've passed this place a million times and never stopped, so today I did, I was basically at an overpriced Subway called Port of Subs, the sub was ok, nothing special, they don't have a good variety of bread choices and none of their subs really sounded that good.

the selection in this store is fantastic but I expect the worst from the sales staff, the only hello you get is from the girls standing at the counter when you walk in and even that seems forced when I actually need help. I feel like I don't want to disrupt employees in the middle of their very intense conversations. I have learned to do my own research on what I am looking for before entering that particular store.

le of and wanted to try somewhere different on our North Scottsdale adventure, so we decided to try the Charcoal Burger. The menu is quite small, which is neither good nor bad. I had the green chili burger and my of had the bacon blue burger and we shared a side order of mixed fries. The burgers weren't bad but not great. taps that are natural, the shakes look good so I'll try them next time I'm in the area

dap you have to go there at least once in your life it's a really nice place with a lot of history the service is excellent it seems to be family run the food is good better than Dennis but not as good as imitate I had all you can eat prime rib lasagna meatloaf catfish chicken mash and diced potatoes stuffing rice homemade apple pie and salad bar I know I'm missing a bunch of stuff they had but you understand they offer specials on prime rib and all that so you can I want to call to see what they're serving the night you leave
good service but the food was horrible poll funding was dry no flavor couldn't eat the tamale it was so bad I won't go back I would have better Mexican off the neighborhood cockroach bus

coffee not great not horrible landscape service ridiculously slow the night we were there the owner came over and asked a group of people who were clearly having some sort of meeting to stop talking because they were disturbing the guitar player chasing paying customers at least I guess they were paying customers they all had a drink at the door weird I don't think I will go back
good starbucks in Happy Valley mall excellent air conditioning in this place and a nice place to cool off from the heat and entertain

I'm not in love with this place and I don't despise it, I'm Mr. middle of the road with staycations, some things he does very well, others are just solo, here are the do's and don'ts, order a takeout sweet potato pie that rocks the house, get the pulled pork sandwich, a solid sandwich and I mean don't order the chicken sandwich. the fries are dry and taste like dirt yeah i said sorry stacy let's go back to the drawing board on those the sauce is all one joint and hers is just ok actually i've had better in a store bought bottle like if you're in the area give it a go if you live in glendale it's probably not worth the trip not sure what bon appetit was thinking when they gave this one one of the best new ones joints from the lady who works behind the counter is funny as hell and is a total sweetheart by the way cash only

when I got here I had half a dozen donuts and one of those bob drinks, the donuts were really good but I wouldn't say they were better than a dipped donut or a creme crisp, the bob drink was so good although I'm really happy they were happy

not impressed the beer was cold but the bar was not interested in helping us the atmosphere was dull the place was small and the take out order was horrible there was no day we were there and I just wasn't feeling the place my husband and I have been missing this place since he closed his original restaurant in Cave Creek we heard he had moved to Phoenix and we found him and went last week unfortunately it had nothing to do with the old smell of hops, a fun, smoky environment from the original, I can see they have a lot of regulars and the bartender knew everyone who came through the door, which to me was very cool, but it just wasn't gelling for me tonight. I guess we ordered fried green chilies and there was so much paste on them that I had to really concentrate to find the chili. I ended up peeling all the paste off the peppers just to have a disgusting little bite. and i also hope that the next time i arrive the smoker in the back will be angry and there will be some truth to be had

I only came here for Transylvania, it's their Friday night industrial goth party, it's okay, I have high standards, sometimes the music is really good, sometimes it sucks, they have things going on and I can always tell when I'm going from the one whose taste I like to the one whose taste I don't like. the people there have all been pretty nice the drinks are nothing special they're not great they're just not very consistent if you need to get lost get poured a few shots at least that way you know what you're getting so when you need to tie your boots wear your eyeliner and shake your ass give it a try

We arrived as a party of six and were seated in a fabulous few minutes considering how many hungry people were entering the restaurant that evening, but we were always lucky to walk straight into Grimaldi's regardless of the location. New Scottsdale has great ambiance and service, but I was sorely disappointed with the quality of the pizza. thicker crust and overcooked in comparison maybe the AC will improve with time I'm sure we'll come back to see

we, my husband, friends and I visited Canola last night because of a review on Yelp, we weren't as enthusiastic, the service was great, we ordered pizza and salads, the salads were fresh, it was a nice surprise, not in a bag, the pizza was good, the crust was thicker than we like, not a bad experience at all, but not quite what we expected after the stars.

I waited a minute and ended up with a very small portion of tortilla with some leftover vegetables thrown in, served in an aluminum takeout box. The tables are folding like the ones you play beer pong on and they have pictures of kids and babies on the walls and signs asking people to send pictures of their kids for the walls too, which has nothing to do with Asian and Mexican food, it freaks me out.

maybe if I had waited outside in the heat for an hour to the point of becoming hungry and dehydrated I too would have thought Matt deserved stars or maybe the star reviews come from people too ashamed to admit they wasted most of their morning with a very average breakfast in my case we came here before noon on a Friday and got the last available seats by the window, the service was excellent. our coffee cups never went empty except for the toast and jam, the food never exceeded the quality, it's not so sad that the best offering in a breakfast is the bread. I liked my waffle because it was a little crispier than what I can make at home with my geriatric waffle maker, but there was nothing remarkable about the flavor. being overcooked, we may be spoiled as we have two great breakfast places within walking distance. Matts Farmhouse Grill and Cafe are just not worth the drive or wait.

I had lunch here and had the tuna dashiki salad, it was fresh and tasty. I also ordered the miso soup which was actually quite good, real chopped mushrooms and green onions and it wasn't too salty, it didn't taste like the standard powdered miso you would get at an average Japanese restaurant. I also tried the cucumber lemonade which was pretty good overall, the service was attentive and our food came out quickly. I was in the mood for this which was just something really light it's a great place for lunch the ambiance is nice especially if you sit on the terrace I'm not a big fan of fusion style restaurants so that gives me a rating but it's a nice place for a quick healthy meal if you're in the area
this place is your standard hole in the wall which they have good taste and spring rolls for cheap happy the cleanliness is really lacking but more flavor for your noodles

if you have to travel to Phoenix, then there's a good chance you'll have to travel via Sky Harbor, there's also a good chance you'll consider flying Southwest, but since the airlines boo at Sky Harbor, you can do worse than Southwest. I'm not a huge fan of Southwest, although I'll give credit where credit is due and the bags fly for free, it's awesome. Combine one of my least favorite carriers with what is probably my least favorite airport and you have a recipe for disaster, but somehow it works in the Southwest, the gates are advantageous. just as hard to reach as other carriers and you aren't banished to the edge of the universe for check in or for baggage claim, they have a decent presence here so you can find a human who can help you if you have a problem, yes they may leave you stranded on the runway for a while in degree plus weather control or force you through the airport with late flight control but every once in a while it's a painless operation

This place was highly recommended by various websites, so I gave it a try when I was in Scottsdale. The service was excellent and the food was good. We sat in the bar which was lively, felt like a neighborhood hangout so everyone seemed like they were friends and having a good time.
