horrible service twice now i've been there and they keep ruining my drink i work for starbucks it's not hard to get a drink trust me horrible service the people who work there all have a bad attitude one lady doesn't even look at you when you order your drink i think someone needs to go and fix it and make it a welcoming starbucks they know for you some of the employees who work there are absolutely wonderful but when you get the one that is just rude it just makes you want to go there anymore I stopped going there, they always make a mistake when my mother goes to get a coffee, it's horrible

second to worst dining experience ever, our waitress was a little shy which is fine but we shouldn't have to wait minutes just to order our food, our food took a few minutes to arrive and while our friends steak came out hot our hibachi steak and potatoes were room temperature. a different waitress to fetch our server and bring us cheesecake menus, we always get the lecher dunce but they brought us terrimisu or junk. I gave it back to the waiter after walking around the restaurant tracking him down and said no thanks, I'll just leave out the cheesecake. location again free food or not

I came to the restaurant specifically because of a recommendation, I am now on a gluten free diet and have other allergies so suffice to say I don't eat Italian often, but I was told they had gluten free pastas and other choices. I was first impressed with the sheet that breaks down their meals by allergen so one knows what is safe, kudos for that, it's more than most places offer, but they have a basil pesto sauce listed as not being gluten or soy free, finding this odd, I asked the server to confirm with the chef and was told there were no wheat products in the pesto, which seems okay, I didn't ask about the soy but I would bet it sneaks in somehow thanks to the cheese, so I ordered your own gluten free penne pasta with pesto sauce shrimp peppers spinach and mushrooms when my bowl of pasta arrived it had all of the above but also had onions zucchini and eggplant but I had to dig around to find a shrimp. and I offered to replace it as I ordered I would have eaten the original bowl and told him so but I was more concerned as I said it was someone else as a side note if these extra vegetable flourishes are an example of cooking skill I would say if a customer orders a simple menu item it might be acceptable but when I fill a nice little checkbook with what I want to create your own bowl of pasta I just want that the items I checked in a fresh bowl later arrived exactly as ordered, except the pasta was undercooked, I don't mean, really firm and fiery, I mean, some were still far from cooked now, I know gluten free pasta takes longer to cook and they probably rushed to the bowl to get it to me, but that bowl was almost inedible. The waiter offered to get me a third. inadequate for management to offer me a three dollar dessert to make up for a twice missed dinner, I have no intention of going back

after repeated visits it only made the service worse, it was like we were held hostage and couldn't leave for a full minute because that's how long it took to receive a time check after multiple requests to several different employees. The female servers can be a little cute but know absolutely nothing about beer and it's a craft brewery. not bitter, it's not a truetostyle spa, so people say oh I don't like the pas and I want something else, their attempt to rename a style of beer is actually hurting them, amazing, the menu was not the usual menu, just a small list of choices to make things worse, the actual menu on each table was wrong, but they kept the menus on the tables anyway, I heard separate tables ordering fried ravioli but they didn't have them no, this place is only in business because of its location.

it's just not a good place for roku sushi, the service was ok and so was the ambiance, but the food wasn't fabulous and the sushi chef had very little knowledge of the food he was serving when sitting at the sushi bar in a fine Japanese restaurant.

first experience, I tried the turkey burger from the skinyalicous menu, the burger was ok but greasy, they served me a salad which went bad, you don't serve salad with rotten vegetables, the Shepard pie we ordered had extra ingredients such as zucchini so they should have warned us about it not being a good Shepard pie. Gordon Ramsay would have been crazy, the service was good only a saving grace

good price for the location but it is definitely outdated and the appliances are extremely old, maintenance people fix things quickly but some solutions are subpar, my neighbor and good friend keep having water intrusion in their house when it rains hard, they have to have their carpet padding replaced multiple times due to water coming in from under the building. are too corporate and only care about money and not the longevity of a rental well paid on time. The only reasons I stay are because the location and price are good, but also because I hate moving around. I anticipate the rent will continue to rise and well above what other nearby apartment properties have to offer, this would mean I probably only have a year or two left before the rents for a two bedroom run out. tenants, it's really unfortunate because I guess companies prefer to have long term paying tenants and negotiate rent amounts and try to weed out tenants who are constantly late or don't pay. Keep in mind no utilities are included, I hope to see some changes in residential equity but due to their corporate status I don't think that will happen
it's a total dive, you need a drink, go get one, there are pool tables, a shuffle board video game or two and a jukebox, the bartenders know their stuff pretty well

I don't know what Bar Smith is trying to be, I feel like instead of just saying ok we're going to be an x music club on Saturday night, they decided to try and appease too many people, rb and hip hop on the first floor, electronic techno on the roof top bar, ok I visited the during the annual pub crawl in the evening, the place was still pretty empty, the drinks were crowded, I'm still trying to find the professional young men in this area I like the bouncers, really tall and super friendly, but again I smiled a lot and didn't give them a hard time about my identity, the last one is what gives it the green light and not completely. I could see having a party there, people love dancing outside and on the rooftops, this has both and the first floor was ok all things considered, I will give this place another chance, maybe it can redeem itself up to the stars.

I haven't been to a chili in forever but these damn gift cards keep me from stopping by every time today for dinner and we ordered the monkey special and appetizers, the food was good, I ordered the spicy chicken fajitas, the chicken and bacon quesadilla and started with the jalapeño onion stack. The jalapeños sucked, but everything else was delicious after a long day at work. our drinks or really check in, the girl who served us seemed to spend most of her time on the other side of the dining room and the teenage host ended up being the one who refilled my strawberry lemonade, so thanks to the young guy manning the desk and not my slow waiters

when Fresh Easy started popping up everywhere it was my new go to place for quick and easy meals, they have a great selection of starters and ready made salads that beat all the way through, the fact that there were always great coupons to receive might have been a big factor in why I came back so often. that they start to deteriorate after or a few days, which isn't very practical or save money when it means I throw away half of what I buy. I am very conscious of item expiration dates and have even found myself throwing items away before they expire so unless you plan on cooking with your fresh items that day I would avoid produce and even some dairy and meat products so what I am saying is frozen or canned goods I am pretty sure your safe with this particular location has also been my least favorite to visit as far as the friendly staff I usually have to visit to bag my own groceries, yes, I know self-checkout keeps prices low, but when you have or staff members hanging out near the checkouts with few to no people in line it wouldn't hurt for someone to take a stab at bagging groceries, it's a little customer service thing that can keep someone from not coming back.

I didn't feel it at all, we don't usually venture to Scottsdale for many reasons, but the siren song of an unpretentious late night restaurant was calling to us unfortunately, unpretentious, doesn't apply to the prices we came shortly after opening day, so I completely forgive the terrible service, the place was packed. oh well we ordered the burger and got mini corn dogs as an appetizer the mini corn dogs left a lot to be desired they were served with ketchup and yellow mustard yuck the corn dogs were only okay the breading around them was way too much bread and it just lacked flavor the burger was huge unfortunately what it lacked in flavor I guess what it lacked in flavor it definitely made up for in size the bacon that came on it was just as huge about inches wide and at least inches long that's what she said oh anyway, I obviously wasn't impressed, we might come back someday because their breakfast really does look wonderful, but I hope they'll have figured out how to efficiently serve a busy restaurant by then.

typical southwest Texas chain, Mexican food in a corporate atmosphere, they have tasty dishes and a killer Sunday brunch, but everything on the menu is a bit ambiguous, the prices here are about on par with most places of this type, I put it in the Appleseed Ti Fridays Charlestons category and I enjoyed my visit to this place better than my visits to the Pa and Tempe locations

apart from the vibe of a rock roll restaurant this place is not good, the food sucks, I came for a birthday party with some people and none of us actually enjoyed our food. We called weeks in advance to reserve a table before a game. When we arrived the table hadn't even been set, we were a few minutes later than expected to get to our table and we missed the whole sleeve and top of the sleeve because it took so long to get our food.

I agree with the other guys, the towels here are disgusting, the staff are not helpful when I checked in, there were no vehicles in the parking lot when I asked for a room that I could park in front of because I wanted to be able to keep an eye on my truck, they said none were available for me if you weren't getting a lot of business maybe you should be nice to the people who show up.

the location has closed again it's not good if you have prepaid washes or other credits as the company has closed some speculation on other locations is that they have filed for bankruptcy again don't bother stopping by to use their services as the facility is cordoned off and a big sign says the business is closed

Thank goodness someone took what was once a pink taco aka yuck city and turned it into something worth stopping in when in Scottsdale Fox Concepts has made it a hit yet again and a place I think I will return to for starters we had a delicious plate of cheese and meats from the anti pasta menu with marinated olives and bread with olive oil just enough to excite our taste buds and just enough to that my boyfriend who doesn't like fancy a lot of things says give me more it went well with our beers they have a great list of my mom's martini which she seemed to enjoy and my brothers gin on the rocks he says they carry a gin which is very rare and delicious but the name doesn't stick sorry all our plates were delicious fried chicken with shredded biscuit mash the skin of the chicken was a bit salty but very crispy salmon with apple grilled cheese sliders and rice that might spoil these chicken salad prime rib dip served with onion soup instead of just yum yum and the potato ghesicuto pasta I know I can't spell but it was delicious too around the table everyone seemed pretty happy my only criticism would be that we were seated right next to the kitchen enough to be able to look inside I dig places that leave it open so you can watch your foot and the chefs are aware that the customer is aware of what is going on but I saw one man at the end preparing countless dishes without gloves he went from cutting and arranging prosciutto to creating their carmel kettle hands corn dessert to preparing what appeared to be the fondue monkey yes there can be worse things that happen in a restaurant but as someone who has worked in catering it made me squirm a little I guess that's why this is called a culinary abandonment oh and the music was a little too loud for me, great joint for hanging out with friends on the way to the bar or i would think for a happy hour but not for a family dinner, my grandmother had to borrow a flashlight from the waitress it was so dark

I like the Thai shack because it's safe to eat Thai they have some of the most adventurous authentic Thai and then they have this I always get the garden delight with beef just basically vegetables and beef cooked in a marinade they always have plenty of servers on hand and I've never been disappointed there's just a little sparkle that seems to be missing I struggled to give it a one or one but I opted for one because they could definitely improve a little atmosphere and parking sucks, they are really close to the light rail Now get off at McdowellCentral and walk a block east on Mcdowell.

I went here because of a group, probably won't return without one downside, too expensive and as other reviews have said, they lack a lot of good things. I know it's something small, but since their menu is changing, they would have to update it online if I had known the menu would be so different. I had a deal, I didn't mind as the ambiance is nice and I loved the extras, we had a few little palate cleansers, the cotton candy was fabulous and although the strawberry dessert wasn't my first choice it was really delicious and I might go back just for that dish. I love the location and the staff was incredibly friendly, informative and courteous, bring the prices down and I at least give it stars.

successfully blending the idea of ​​bar food and airline food into one very disappointing meal a poor choice for breakfast because of the starchy eggs, cold potatoes and bland salsa, even the grapefruit juice lacked flavor

buffalo wings are usually not breaded, i can't stand breaded buffalo wings, the sauces were good, i can't handle the breading, the redeeming feature of this place is that they serve roast beef on kimmelweck, i haven't tried it, i'm sure it was ok though

we went on a Sunday afternoon, the wait was a concern for the people we were waiting on because everyone kept talking about it, man I was starving when we were seated, I had the ham and cheese omelette and everyone shared an order of waffles with everyone else.

a girlfriend and I had been meaning to check out Bombay Spice for a while, but never got around to it until last night. I found a lot of stuff on localdinescom, use ref. if you also register, you registered with Foursquare, we got a deal. A single drink is actually glasses in case you're torn between sharing a bottle or just buying a drink. I recommend the shooting star taxi, it was full-bodied and very delicious. The other wine we tried was the Hob Pinot Nob and it wasn't great. It had a delicious combination of earthy and sweet tones. we had to choose either free hummus or dessert because of my agreement to check in on foursquare power nerd, I know I really wanted to try the mango sorbet but we opted for the chickpea hummus and the rotten bread for those of you like me who don't know what rotten bread is, it is much lighter than pita bread and a bit thinner than a tortilla, it is very tasty, the hummus was very good and they topped it with diced tomatoes, onions and cilantro which I loved, we also ordered the pan fried eggplant. it was awesome it was a large slice of eggplant with a black sauce which was a technical term in case you were wondering they also served the eggplant with a yellow sauce drizzled on the plate which was sweet and very good plus a small scoop of red chili sauce our waitress told me the name and I couldn't remember it for the life of me which was spicy I really loved this sauce it was the perfect amount of spices for the eggplant, I will come back here to try the curry and some of the other things on the menu which I can't pronounce there are lots of vegetarian and vegan options clearly marked on the menu their menu also boasts that everything except or items is completely gluten free, good experience, definitely looking forward to trying it again for a full meal

I used to go there but stopped several months ago, they cost more than other pet food stores. I only buy Wellness brand dog food and their supplements. They were out of supplements when I asked one of the guys when they were going to buy more. He also told me that Wellness had stopped making the supplements and was a little mean to me about how Wellness was now selling in peace. He then referred me to another brand that I didn't like, that didn't work as well. the guy from wow lied to me, the rest of the staff were always friendly, wash my dogs there, i just heard them in the shower stall, it's easier

asking is fair and the hype isn't always worth the wait, I'll keep it simple as there are probably reviews of the place, great hash browns and made from scratch dishes, good specials to keep things mixed, good company and service vs the guy at the front says a little more minutes but really means an expensive hour and minutes for some interesting food people around while you wait to get in the street walkers and the freshly squeezed orange juice is liquid enough to maybe fill a double shot glass overall I would like to give this place more stars if I could walk in without wanting to eat a finger from starvation and leave a little more satisfied, anyone who has eaten at Aryans in San Diego would understand what I mean

I've echoed a few times and have never had a bad cup of coffee, the cappuccino is pretty solid and the zucchini bread I had for breakfast one day was a win if I remember correctly, it also came in a cute little box for some reason.

the last three times I've been here the hostesses have been incredibly rude, I need to update them and give them one star. Last time was the final straw and we left by turning around and leaving. Yes, you work at a popular property that doesn't allow you to be rude and mean, it's weird because that seems to be limited to the front of the house only.

seriously, just ok, the green salsa was horribly sweet and froze like it had no tomatillo taste, the tacos were stuffed to the gills but on average the chimes tasted reheated in the microwave and oddly like sopapillas on top of all ok food but a bit pricey for ok food

sometimes you just want to give an effort or maybe more than a lame three stars, as the other two previous reviews have succinctly pointed out, the man I assume to be the owner was extremely nice. The owner guesses why the traffic was so bad at first, he didn't know, but then he realized the restaurant was closed, he politely recommended we head south and then cross back to the I ordered the Jerusalem falafel sandwich, it was pretty good, but in all honesty, falafels are not one of those kinds of dishes that you can gush over, in my opinion it's pretty hard to mess up the ground chickpeas in frying. two friends opted for the gyros and it looked good the meat was sliced ​​thin which is somewhat different from others I've had, they seemed to enjoy the meal but I don't think they were quite overwhelmed either. We actually didn't mention anything about food during the hour and a half trip home. The food is not bad at Pita Shack by any means. sandwich salad and drink service as previously stated is without a doubt the brightest part of the place as we finished our meal the guy who I assume is the owner offered us lentil soup on the house, we declined after being quite full and satisfied with our respective sandwiches. I believe another reviewer had the same thing happen to him and he had positive comments about it now for me it's the food that really matters so I gave it three stars instead of the four I was about to give if I ever came back to the Tempe area in search of food. a pita, I would definitely give pita shack another chance, if only to support a really nice guys business

yeah I won't go back, the ordering system is confusing, the staff seemed confused as well, the food was very bland and pretty tasteless, this place isn't even in the same league as honey bears near the airport, avoid that bland chain and go to honey bears.

I'm not a regular here but every once in a while I crave an iced mocha that tastes like chocolate milk. Tull's has this, it's the only thing I've ever ordered here. I go elsewhere for my usual espresso needs, so I can't speak to the rest of their drinks, but I don't imagine the rest of their drinks are bad. Their iced mocha is very nice. friendly franchise is super slow, never mind that Tull's isn't my usual haunt but it's good for what it is fastfoodcoffee

I stopped here for lunch the other day, I ordered the Marten BBQ chicken sandwich with garlic fries, the sauce on the sandwich was good but the chicken breast was rather tasteless, the garlic fries were a winner, the bar service was quick and friendly, it was nice to have one to look at while I ate lunch.

I don't know why all these airports are so desperately short of seats. The staff here is friendly and security is quick, but I just wish they would work on the boarding areas and add more seats. I need an example of the new international terminal in Sacramento.

decent bar food with all the waiters dressed in Alice Cooper outfits, I'm open and starting this thing with stars minus one star for being a little overpriced on the appetizer side. I ordered onion rings per order, the onion rings are seriously worth less than a star for not having parking. You have to park a few blocks away in the ghetto area to find a place where you will have beggars asking you for change to and from your car. minus half a star for putting the tip on the bill and charging for it, I hate this bullshit, plus half a star for the waitresses who are dressed like heavy metal and wear bellies with the tramp stamp on them. I always wanted to date girls like that but I was too busy with mothers chasing me yeah yeah yeah and I just know you know, I didn't have time for them at that point in my life, I better stop my criticism now

We stayed at the Point Hilton over the July weekend and were very impressed with the superb pool facilities and poolside catering service. However, I would send caution to anyone considering staying at this hotel if you don't have children it's probably not the place for you. Screaming children have invaded every corner of this massive resort, so if you're looking for more relaxation and less SpongeBob, I suggest checking out the other hotel options in Phoenix.
the food is good but it took a while to reach us

I arrived early Friday morning to buy a dozen and a half donuts for my coworkers, the man behind the counter thought it was strange, I ordered such a quantity, apparently because of the way he repeated my order, in my case a dozen would have been too small, a dozen too many and I didn't want to waste any, which already made me uncomfortable, just fill the order you receive, I'm a customer, it was my first time here after many drive throughs, he asked me what flavors and suggested I make a mix, I didn't have a preference as I just liked an assortment. again i got a bad rap just give me your best selling flavors whats the problem well i guess it was a once and never again the donuts were fresh but the service was way more than friendly if not bad you could have gained a new customer

I hate being disappointed by bars that brag about their large number of taps when I can't argue with the fact that they have beers on tap. I can tell you that very few of them are worth drinking and the prices here are quite high. I would never come back if it wasn't a happy hour or late night price. I asked generally about the undiscounted prices of nine dollars for a Manhattan made with Jack Daniels and beers going for five to seven dollars if I pay seven dollars for a pint at a sports bar. tempe it better be something from the russian river or a stone birthday beer and a nine dollar manhattan seems out of place, it's not Scottsdale or a hotel bar, well the good news the thirsty lion is quite charming inside lots of seating and dim lights, it's really not a bad place to relax and unwind. recommendation, I hope that over time the prices will come down a bit and more craft breweries will be represented, but aside from the beautiful interior and the spot on the happy hour menu, the thirsty lion just doesn't stand out enough to keep me away from the rocks or the taste of the peaks

maybe I should have had a hot dog but I'm craving Chicago Italian beef, I didn't get it here, just old fatty beef, use beef broth if the meat dries out, not a whole can of olive oil, yuck, it didn't have that nice Italian beef flavor, so I asked for the giardinara to add some flavor, it was very fatty too and I had to pay extra for the peppers, whether hot or mild, no stars for this beef, the only saving grace was that it didn't make me too sick, I expected to be sick for days, not just one day

I really wanted to like this place to begin with, I paid cash for my takeout, was owed five dollars and was told we didn't have enough change so had to settle for the type of restaurant that doesn't have change, especially on a Saturday night. The chicken lettuce wraps had a strange fishy taste. with Chinese pepper

this place gets an a for effort but i think it falls a little short, it's cute that the wasabi is actually blue and some of their rolls like the pink dyed rice for the marilyn monroe roll are innovative but the food is only a little above average i liked the rolls ok but the best thing i put in my mouth was the shrimp tempura appetizer in the martini glass this appetizer is to die for the miso soup was pretty good but not my favorite we liked that there were only a few tables and it wasn't a huge place with a million people but the food just wasn't what we expected we will keep looking for our favorite sushi restaurant in Scottsdale. The service here was very good, which made the overall experience quite pleasant.

the hubs and i walk around the indoor market when we are at the farmers market on the weekends they seem to have a good assortment of items even though the prices are quite high but i am willing to give them the benefit of the doubt as they are a local business one morning we were at the farmers market and decided to grab something for breakfast its never a good idea to shop hungry happy i waited in line for coffee while the hubs ordered breakfast, the coffee is fabulous I like my food simple so when the hubs came back with an egg and cheese I wasn't looking for anything fancy eggs cheese maybe a little butter salt and pepper on some sort of bread product I quickly found out it was some sort of hipster egg and cheese lettuce on an egg and cheese which does that it also had tomato mustard and an assortment of spices I am willing to admit it is maybe just me and my simple underdeveloped palette, so if you're a hipster and fancy an egg and cheese this is your place, whatever, make sure you grab a cup of coffee, it's great

I read all the reviews on yelp and thought I'd try the Chinese buffet with a star rating. I expected star quality food. Some were good, but some could be better. First of all, the atmosphere was pretty nice, it was almost like cheers where everyone knew your name even though we didn't know anyone there. probably seasoned and tasted almost as good as back east Chinese food it just wasn't orange brown the chicken was good but a little tough not as moist and juicy as I wanted the chicken was dry it had good flavors but was dry inside it looked like it was under the heat lamp too long the sweet and sour soup was good but I tasted much better the egg drop soup wasn't too good although the ribs weren't bad also a little dry but not as bad as chicken the egg was not good hockey puck shaped or not it was too watery and didn't taste like real eggfooyung everything else was pretty average for the price it wasn't bad I would go back and eat there just so I could have rice and shrimp so quite a few stars for the food and for the ambiance the service and cleanliness was very clean and the service was ok. taste food, other buffets will serve you, so this place could be a gem if the food improves

I visited in January and ordered Thai Basil their signature dish with squid which had a very unique flavor that was a bit masked by the spiciness. I'm a wimp when it comes to spices and I was overwhelmed by the medium I ordered even though the dish was very good. and intimate with booths and tables and the servers are very friendly

nice casino, I am an architect lover, but if you are a slot player for fun or not, this might not be a place I would dump my hard winnings into even if it was just for fun, I was with my uncle and even though I didn't play he was having a great time playing for hours at a time while I followed him from one slot machine to another after blowing a lot of his money down the drain, I noticed that not only did he not get any winnings but no one around was winning either the whole time he was playing, not only was he in the hole but many other very strange ones that I noticed and no one was working the floor asking anyone if they like a drink, maybe I'm just used to the way Vegas does it. I'm curious to hear more comments from other participants here. Did you have any winnings?

we stayed for three nights whilst visiting family for the holidays good bed very comfortable clean funkycool decor which is unique very friendly and helpful staff reasonable price great location not very good overnight parking expensive it was a surprise on arrival no coffee maker in the room this is pretty much standard for most hotels we had to either go to the lobby for a cuppa or leave the site on the last morning before leaving hours before departure with our Do Not Disturb sign duly mounted outside of our door we were disturbed by a raprapraprap of who I assume was the cleaner at

I really try to like Old Town Scottsdale and if you look past all the tourist traps it's actually a pretty nice place with a number of top-notch dining options, but ultimately you can only wander past so many mass-produced native jewelry stores with great deals before it all starts to blend together. bodega and maybe consider grabbing a bite to eat at one of the local restaurants like fob or praying monk and avoid any place with turquoise jewelry in the window while focusing on galleries that don't quite seem to fit the theme.

lunch here is delicious and worth it dinner spend your hard money elsewhere if it's easy money to make and you don't care to spend then by all means enjoy the authentic atmosphere and above average French cuisine just don't order the flat iron steak

the acoustics are pretty good for an amphitheater, the process required to acquire alcohol is a bit ridiculous, but you have to remember you're in Mesa, this place would definitely rate higher if it was located in a town that allowed concerts to go past the afternoon.

I wish I could separately review the cold food stand attached to this restaurant because I want to tell everyone thinking of stopping for a quick sandwich to stay away from the tuna. I thought nothing was worse than slowly starving to death on my flight home, but I found it in the form of this barely recognizable cold sandwich. I think I'd rather eat canned tuna than this.

they serve breakfast all day which is always a plus. I had the tomato soup with grilled cheese, the bread was delicious, tasted homemade, but there was way too much cheese and it wasn't completely melted. I had the eggs benedict which looked really good, she said it was really good and full of stars, I've had better, I've had worse the de a.

the location is excellent the food is mediocre and milder than they advertise the waiters are polite and bland on several occasions which they lacked for more than spirit the bill will be higher than expected don't bother

I should have taken my own advice and stayed away from this place. Our last visit ended in a hurry when I was served rotten tuna and barely got an apology from the staff. I could smell the fish was horribly missing when the hello tuna salad was presented to me by the waiter and I am shocked that the kitchen actually thought they were getting away with sending it out, the waiter disappeared from my table so quickly that I had to go chase him down to point out to him that the bad smell at my table was coming from the food and he took my plate back to the kitchen and five minutes later came back to say ok we all smelled it and there is definitely something wrong not going there, seriously, you had to pass it around to confirm that I'm not crazy when you can clearly tell in ten seconds that that's not how raw fish should smell after all that, their solution was to come an appetizer not the salad and eventually gave me a new salad to take away that I decided not to eat just to be safe, look, I'm not afraid of eating week old leftovers or sushi at a dive club and I'm not really scared by the cleanliness of the restaurants but it could have been dangerous. I have absolutely warned all my coworkers and friends about this place and now I am warning all yaps, this could have been handled in a way that left me confident that this was just another new restaurant problem, but the horrible service made it clear that was not the case and I shudder to think to what new level they are going to sink.

I really like this concept for a quick breakfast but the execution wasn't too delicious if you know me well enough you will know my first thought when we walked in was if there is alcohol the answer is yes I remember seeing your typical breakfast items such as bellini mimosas, bloody marks and so you go in order from the menu at the counter and they bring you your meal and drinks. before and our first impression was a disappointment in the food portions given the prices were also comparable, oddly enough my sausage potatoes and fried eggs had the same consistency so it was wrong for me, they were all a bit soft and soggy. We of course enjoyed the mimosa and bellini, but each is a bit high considering they are at other locations and the boa cafe down the block has unlimited mimosas for a fixed price with food. I thought the location was great and the Sunday brunch crowd was nice. but I don't think I'll come back to find out

this review is about the penny portrait studio responsible for the christmas blessings christmas card that adorned my family and coworkers mailboxes over the past holiday season my girlfriend and i were going to pose in a step brother pose so we had to look the part. I guess the look won't be in fashion or in a magazine this year. No, you'll have to go back to the days when the circus magazine was popular and mom and dad went to key parties. knowing which cards to choose didn't matter if you awkwardly looked in the dictionary and smacked them over the head that's what it was like his pure agony of working there was oozing out of his forced smile anyway I'll just say I'm damn happy I had a coupon for a pack that included two is in different poses and a huge help of greeting cards a pack that sells for around and no even if you pay that price a happy ending is not included

your reviews are hilarious, who was he referring to? i was looking at mars and they were just ignoring me for a few minutes, i didn't want to interrupt the conversation so i waited eventually, i get asked if i need help, no, i was just admiring your huge body and wondering how long it would take me to look like that, idiot on my last visit, a customer said excuse me to the employees behind me in the aisle, i glanced at her and she sighed, rolled her eyes and shook his head as they all ignored him. mom can we help you, she asks to find an item, the customer thanks them, they say you're welcome, the customer leaves and they continue sarcastically at each other, that's why we're here, no, that's not what we're here for, we're not here to find stuff for stupid people, we have better things to do, that's why when I walk past an employee who is working if they look at me they immediately look away and pretend to be absorbed in his work to avoid stopping to help him. save money but the attitude is over the top, there are a few employees who smile and seem friendly at least when I see them and I can report them if not for the events most often mentioned above, I stay out of wm as much as possible which is a lot, I have reduced my trips there significantly but more importantly I have cut out a huge portion of shopping at wm

the place was pretty empty even for a nights rest the service was pretty decent but like i said it was empty i have been here a few times but never when it is busy the prices don't impress me but i say you get a pretty decent price for the money one thing i would like to point out a bottle of dom costs less than dollars but a bottle of dom is if you are a fucking idiot get the l if you are a smart shopper you will get two bottles of l or else just by the glass which even works out cheaper just so you know it works the opposite of costco if you buy a big bottle of dom anyway you probably won't care the decor is red it's very dark here at night dark and loungey rather than clubby similar to Mercy Bar but not as hip or hidden although they try to hide it with curtains it's also pleasantly quiet here easy to have conversations with the patio door open you're going to smell the cigarettes people are smoking outside if you sit at the bar or on the adjacent couch it's a nice bar but I don't know if I'm picking it as a place to go I actually think the Mondrian is pretty nice but that's based entirely on fond memories that have absolutely nothing to do with the place and have more to do with the people I was with at the time if someone rich and hip was here from out of town and was looking to party. The Mondrian is one of the few hotels I suggest, not so much because of the red bar, but more because it is conveniently located within walking distance of so many other best bars downtown.

I don't usually write reviews, but I was so horrified by my experience that I had to go for a bite to eat and a late night drink with a friend. They were quite busy so we sat at the bar as I frequent Moon often. I was happy to see that the bar was also busy. The bartender quickly came over and was visibly intoxicated as she couldn't even tell me the flavors of the vodka they had. the guests had the same look of horror on their faces, we decided to order food as she spilled my glass on us, we refilled it with something completely different and she could barely speak at this point, we saw management observing her behavior and doing nothing as she proceeded to take dirty glasses and fill them with beer. I was so appalled by this that we left before finishing our drinks or food. sad return because we would see the moon horrible times a week

what kind of sports bar doesn't serve sliders, nachos, quesadillas and celery, carrot options, but no slider assumes that goes hand in hand with the no malibu rum option. At least the bartender asked me if their fake option was okay. Hello, no wait service was crap after a spring training game because they didn't have enough staff to serve people. They had to wait for minutes in a booth before anyone recognized us.

First off, I admit I'm not a very unbiased reviewer here, I absolutely love a good bowl of ramen, although I haven't been to Japan, I've been lucky enough to visit some outstanding ramen houses in Seattle, Honolulu, Lot Angels, Chicago and San Jose, while I think this is probably some of the best ramen I've had in Arizona, unfortunately that doesn't really mean much, it was okay, not great. miso available in mitsuwa stores across the country drool the noodles were okay although I wish there was more the broth wasn't very hazy and lacked the depth that really makes the bowl of ramen the silver was really the weak point thin sliced pork with no real noticeable silver quality the vegetables that came with it were nice although I wouldn't say that's what I'm looking for in short I'm saying it's Americanized ramen and not the cheap junk from the packaging but suits an American palate better instead of leaning towards authenticity no fish cake or bamboo shoots no cloudy creamy broth no pork belly money the place looks great and the staff are great I wouldn't reject it but republic doesn't get a fervent recommendation either

if i could give these stars i would but that's because i have been there and so i know how good famous waves can be, there are two that i know of and i have been to both, they are both good, we visited this one near chandler mall for lunch, we ordered off the lunch menu, my wife and i both had the brisket sandwich, i had the wilbur beans, she had fries, it was good, not great, but ok, the breast meat itself didn't seem smoked at all. and the taste when it was smoked and it just didn't have it honestly the meat seemed sort of begging if it had been boiled instead of grilled or smoked and the meat or sauce was excessively salty it wasn't a big deal or I would have returned it but it was noticeable. the corn syrup yuck other than that it's poison to your pancreas it's just not good that's not how it's done anyway the famous waves aren't really anything special the b is ok but not very authentic given the choice I would take it hands down but if you want some and you're far away this will do the job for sure see my review of tomstruly horrible and the beans and the fries are pretty good

bland, dull food that's not worth the price or the wait to get it, we had lunch at Nourrir a few months ago and although we weren't very impressed as they serve healthy food that is in line with our plant-based eating habits, we decided to give them another chance and went for brunch a few weekends ago. tempting, I asked to replace the bagel with multigrain bread, since the bread used to be the best part of the lunch sandwich. The waiter informed me that they were out of bread. How does a restaurant run out of bread when half of their menu items are sandwiches. Very poor planning by management and the only other item available was a wheat roll which I opted for. My husband ordered the vegetarian quiche which is described as zucchini, asparagus, caramelized onions, parmesan and a quinol crust afterwards. an incredibly long wait the restaurant was far from full our food finally arrived my egg sandwich was by far the most flavorless breakfast dish I have ever consumed the airfield egg looked appealing as it would be healthy and non-greasy which it was but I didn't realize that this also meant there would be absolutely no seasoning or flavor at all the sweet potato hash was downright disgusting and I didn't consume it that a cube or two of the flavorless mushy pile that was on my plate as bad as my meal was my husband's vegetarian quiche definitely won the award for worst breakfast item ever tasted. The quinol crust that we were looking forward to because we love quinol dishes was actually undercooked quinol mixed throughout the quiche with no visible crust, giving the whole thing a grainy texture equivalent to fine gravel having been poured into the dish. the strange taste and offsetting texture of the quinol was more than I could handle even in the one bite I tasted. I honestly don't know how my husband even managed to choke down the portion of quiche he made. We also each had two bloody brands during our stay and although each took an incredibly long time to get the first one was tasty and seemed to be very spicy as we requested, but the second was flavorless and tasted like diluted tomato juice while Nourish has a lovely patio and offers views of the lush foliage present throughout the resort, these are not enough to bring us back after we leave with our taste buds horrified by the flavors or lack of flavors in our brunch

anything with the original word in that name always makes me wonder if this place is real, it's very close to the new house and I met the renters there for a burger the other night and to watch the giants fight their ears, I immediately felt a sense of familiarity when I walked in the door, I didn't remember being there before until I walked in but it all came back to me very quickly. You can either go up and order then bring your food to your table or if you are on the bar side you can order from the bartender who is very attentive even with a full bar and restaurant once you get your burger or sandwich you go to the repair bar stock up on the toppings and vegetables then sit down to enjoy they also have good sides and like fried mushrooms, onion rings, zucchini and fries they are ok a little overcooked for my liking but all the rest was great, it's a great place to make a regular stop on your weekly happy hour schedule to watch a sports game, tons of TV at the bar or to satisfy your burger cravings

I know everyone has raved about this place, so naturally I was super excited to try it, I don't know if it was so excited or what, but it seemed like a normal pizza with a really long wait. I met some friends there for lunch. us and they told us they only had two high chairs, not a big deal but definitely not practical either. I thought their menu was extremely limited, only had red sauce and white sauce pizzas and then just a few toppings you could add while the food was good.

it's three stars because I don't know how to rate it I didn't think it was very good at all when I went there the other night during their grand opening but maybe I just didn't taste it the service was quick and polite the food eh I had one of the house specials I didn't think it was very special I think the waiter deserves bonus points for convincing me of a half order rather than a full order complete the lemongrass drink was strong and sweet

very cute quite good sandwich and coffee it's a very good place to stop in between shopping trips they have very good healthy sandwiches and good coffee drink service very fast and good food good and healthy relaxing atmosphere and cute brownie delicious happy

while having a small get together we were able to have a back patio with a buffet style table set with some pretty tasty starters, the chicken sewers were delicious and the smoked salmon was also tasty but something seemed to be missing at the end of the day it was good and I wouldn't hesitate to go back but nothing to make me a raving fan

It's a nice little restaurant with a nice wine list. I ordered linguine with clam sauce and a glass of rose personally. I think the food is actually pretty good, good northern Italian food but the service was ok.

i will explain this to explain my two stars here we go good super sindhi bryan the rice is tasty the chicken is tasty overall a great chicken dish the two pieces of boneless marinated chicken grilled in a clay oven are also tasty but had better elsewhere naan very good crispy and soft stuff in all the right places exactly how it should be made better than other Indo-Pakistani places in the valley the bad chintzy interior which seemed like you just came from you go straight back to Punjab somewhere complete with water stained panels on the ceiling from back then, I don't mind at all but something was wrong and I don't know why a surly aunt guy who stands behind the cash register and doesn't even want to greet you unless you are apparently related to her or going to school with her kids said the aunty guy disappears into the kitchen for minutes at a time so you just stand there and wait and wait, said aunt guy expresses her displeasure non-verbally when you ask her anything. tamarind chutney even though you've been waiting for your food for minutes, says the aunt guy brings back a little plastic cup of thick, goofy tamarind paste, eh, says the aunt guy doesn't say thank you, smile or anything when you go up to pay, even though you've been nothing but friendly and grateful for taking on a regular potential customer, she doesn't care about your patronage, the ugly big screen to listen to a poorly acted Indian soap opera on a former king of Sri Lanka who tries to get along with his maids while his brother plots for the throne by twisting a piece of his mustache, then switched to another channel showing bad unknown songs from their Miss Bollywood movies, although I'm not kidding, the south was a video where a guy and a girl were running and singing in the Swiss Alps, then all of a sudden, in the middle of all this snow, a table appears full of Indian food and an umbrella advertising beer and pretzels, so in the end here is the equation pretty good food questionable dining room type surly aunt singing screaming girly eating curry on the Matterhorn which makes no sense overly excited king of ancient Sri Lanka who no one really needs to see stars bah
a bit too sweet, sweeter than yogurt and red mango, but I liked the lean mango and blueberry flavors, great spread of toppings, green tea mocha and great quality fruit, perfect stop on the grinder
this place is busy but the kids love the pancakes, so much food for the price
the food is ok but the problem is that it is way too expensive, I mean for a simulated locomotive, outrageous

the service here was terrible, we waited patiently for more minutes for our server to come to our table, eventually a hostess came and noticed that no one was helping us and offered us drinks for a few more minutes and finally our server decides to make an appearance saying you have already decided what you want, um yeah, overall the service was poor and the food was just okay, I won't go back.

the family and I came here again Saturday night the food is just as spectacular as it was our first time serving but it just wasn't good our server seemed stunned and confused the whole time we were there and he also forgot things. I ordered a second glass of wine in the middle of dinner and it never came and I never had a chance to remind him because he didn't come back until it was time to clear the plates. sat there not cool and it's not like he was in another section there was a table he was at at different times that was directly behind ours he just chose to ignore ours we will return as we love the food and atmosphere and hope the service improves

I was working in Phoenix and was told I had to try deluxe because they had the best burger and sweet potato fries I would ever have. The fries were pretty good but I don't think they were above average. The burger although I thought it left a lot to be desired, it was juicy but I would actually call it more fatty than really juicy.
All I have to say is what you see on the menu is not what you will get and if you are ok with cockroaches on the walls and floors this is the perfect place to eat.

totally agree with the rest of the reviews that this is the usual greasy meat head Mexican restaurant, no frills, but stomach filling food if you're on a diet or are a fat free lettuce eater, all you do best to avoid polibertosis, everything is shamelessly huge and dripping with lard here, I wanted to get the three taco combo, but since I'm a recent beef I couldn't support the description of the tongue and the ox's head. included in the tacos although I think it must be tasty p anyway I had the chicken taco and the carne asama taco and I got lots of lemon wedges and salsa the tacos were huge the asama was more delicious than the chicken the chicken was topped with lettuce and shredded cheese and had a hard shell which I definitely didn't expect and I didn't like anything other than eating when you are hungry and want to save money

I was so happy to see another station in the neighborhood that I went to fill up like I usually do at any station, not knowing that I was paying ten cents more per gallon than Circle K because I wasn't paying cash or using a Shell credit card. Yes, there are signs on the pump, but really, who would think to look for such a requirement?

I would absolutely not recommend living here, I lived in these apartments for a year and wow, the management staff was a mess when I moved in, my mailbox was broken so I couldn't get mail for a week, they didn't give me a pool key, they gave me the wrong apartment keys, they mixed up all my information and they just weren't very nice. i turned their music down and had to study for school and exams and random people came knocking on the door looking for a girl who had obviously pushed them. The police came to my house in the middle of the night to look for it too once, they gave my garage to someone else even though I was still paying and when my husband came home in the evening with his pickup truck full of expensive equipment, we had to wait for the cops to come and find out what car was parked in our garage, it was a total nightmare shortly before we moved. new employees came in and they seemed a little better organized but wouldn't take the risk for the same money, you can definitely find a better place to live

I think all the star reviews are from people who work here and you have to look at the trend all the time and some. I hate that at first it presents itself as a steakchop house or American grill whatever, it's not a steakhouse despite having butcher in the name, let's start with the ambiance, don't ever sit in the back room, it's so loud it's like trying to eat out of a drum. bar next door the service was lousy there must have been waiters yet the service was slow and inattentive I know the place is new but they didn't even have a printed wine list when we asked for the wine list they first said they didn't have any sitting in the back room I could see the fucking bottles then they sent us the manager who had no idea, her then the bar manager who looked like he used a word to type this that he thought he had he knew the wine at least other than the servers were slow and didn't know the menu well my dad ordered a margarita it was horrible we complained to our server who sent the bar manager the bar manager made him a second one which was passable for that price it should have been great I ordered a spa on tap they were out I got a bottle it was good my mom got one and it was good now the wine way too expensive an average markup is about double it was triple or more here i have a bottle at the store should be in a restaurant this is here no value food me at best the best part of the meal was the cheese plate me and my dad had the riley the meat was drowned in a sweet sauce with mushrooms and cauliflower i liked the sauce my dad didn't like it but the sauce really overpowered the steak my mom had the pork and beans she loved everything about it not the worst meal that I have never had but no value here dessert I wouldn't know I am allergic to peanuts and real tree nuts not a single desert was nut free my mom had the peanut butter cup which she loved also they didn't have dessert wines or after dinner appetizers value a person with food, wine and drinks. I can think of many other places I could go and get a better meal for that price or less. For example, we had dinner at the sweet shop the day before the meal, it was excellent and the drinks and dinner were fully booked.

over the hours I've been to this store, I feel like a big pile of poo, the staff are so horrible, I've read the other reviews and this seems to be a common thing, which really sucks because I would probably shop here a lot more if the staff weren't a bunch of assholes.

my parents love that, so I've been enjoying Vietnamese food practically since my mother's womb, no wonder I love it so much myself that it was always on the weekly dinner rotation when I lived in oc, alas, I moved to North Phoenix and have no shortage of shops or cafes on every corner. of course we had to try it and we were dying for some which for months now we both ordered the beef which and took a seat the place is small but there is plenty of seating and still seems spacious the cashier at the front was super friendly and welcoming which was nice we didn't have to wait too long for our food to arrive another plus which itself has a really tasty broth and the beef was nice and tender i was disappointed with the small portion of bean sprouts, mint leaves and limes that accompanied the soup that I am accustomed to plates overflowing with these vegetables so that I could fill my soup as I wish. Actually my husband usually relies on me to do this since I end up eating all my veggies and leaving most of the double ha beef to him but the lack of sprouts and mint leaves didn't ruin the great taste of that one, what I missed was the traditional ingredients like rare steak and tripe tendons, I know I know it sounds intense but trust me it makes it taste so good I guess I just have a usual when it is about that, so I was a little disappointed that I couldn't satisfy my craving to the highest degree, woe is me, but let me conclude by stating once again that the one here is really good and has an excellent broth flavor. I think my husband and I will return as it is so conveniently located for us that I will definitely do so in a pinch although I'm sure I will occasionally find myself making the trip to buy some tripe.

this is the place to go in scottsdale for italian beef when i visit chicago i usually go to all or tortillas for italian beef and having everything here saves me the trip to the windy city the decor here is nice with several motorcycles on display throughout the restaurant for some reason it is neat and clean and many helpful employees provide relatively quick service. a little greasy for my taste, overall a good lunch and a place to keep in mind when I'm craving a taste of Chicago

oh what is the praise for this place, it's disgusting, it's dirty and the food is not worth it, I came here with my family and we each order a little bit of everything that is supposed to be good and popular there, unfortunately everything is bad, I walked past the waiters and they were all cursing each other very loudly in Vietnamese the table is disgusting and it smells like my cooked oil pickaxe, go to who sen instead, at least it's clean

the food delicious the atmosphere relaxing the service nice spoon the price ehh not my thing here the only way I ate here was because a family friend treated my family but if you're looking to treat yourself or someone you know to some food this is the place to do it. crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside the asparagus I've had better but the Yukon Gold mashed potatoes were silky smooth and made perfectly, they went well with the chicken romano, my dad ordered my strip and they were kind enough to cut it for him since he was disabled, they checked on us frequently, the only thing I would complain about was that they actually came over and asked if I was finished grabbing my plate yet so that the fork was still in my mouth because apparently I was still eating since it ruined my whole experience so far I just told them to take it extra the whole table got an order from the all you can eat salad bar the salad bar was great but nothing compared to the choices offered at soupantation also because I ate the salad in advance I couldn't finish the main entree I ordered I probably won't be back

we came here for dinner for me and reverse happy hour for my wife, we ordered our appetizers and after finishing them and looking at the menu for a few minutes we were ready to jump into the overpriced starters. We were then informed that we could not order dinner maybe when they saw someone come in and tell them they were archers for dinner they could alert them that the kitchen was closing so we could order our meals and not be notified five minutes after closing. i got tipped and we had to go find another restaurant for dinner needless to say we won't give them another chance no good gordon be no good

pros quiet and clean atmosphere amenities are good hot tub outside and inside large steam room sauna nice seating areas outside and inside products shampoo conditioner body wash were ok cons expensive beware of tipping I don't know whose idea it was but I was a little offended by the presumptive tipping I tip well when I deserve it but I like to tip according my own terms the spa hostess at the front desk check in was snooty min massages i went for a swedish massage min the massage therapist was personable and was attentive to what i asked her to focus on, i know the delay wasn't her fault but thinking about a massage at those prices made me feel really ripped off. I had a band to offset the ridiculous cost, but even that didn't make me feel better about the cost. I don't know who thinks a 1 minute massage is enough, but come on, an extra mind wouldn't kill them all.

I met some friends here for happy hour the other day, it's old times and they did an amazing job with a great remodel feel and warm colors to the place. Now I had some crowns, chips and guacamole. The regular menu is better than the happy hour menu and I think I will try them next time for lunch or dinner.

Alison B sums up all the good things about this unique store and I would return there if I was looking for a unique gift for one of my friends. However when I walked in on a Sunday I was among the women in the store, the man working was chatting with the other women who happened to be together and once they left he sat down and didn't say a word to me while I browsed, I walked out after several minutes of silence.
this is my first year attending arizona selling clothes just wondering how busy it's going to be in there not worried can anyone answer me
this place is not close to anything you can find in LA or Oc, liked it out of the bag plain and simple

the mermaids in phoenix are right across the street from the downtown sheraton hotel where i was staying, i was really hungry and didn't want to eat at the hotel so i decided to try the mermaids. The girls are always a nice touch. I really liked this place because it had lots of outdoor seating. The food is what you expect from mermaids. crowd of guys for drinks and burger prices are very reasonable

I'm sad to report that we dined here for lunch and it was inedible. Sad boss Aaron, please come check on your staff. We had the eggplant sandwich and it was a disaster, it was too greasy and the bread and fries overwhelmed the plate. turns around, the decor is cool and the staff is really fun and helpful and we hope to find a great place to visit in the neighborhood

another night meeting friends here I have to laugh, I waited a few more minutes for my beer to be refilled at the bar, one girl even took my empty beer without even asking if I wanted a refill, a new brunette girl who I don't recognize left the bar and sat with her friends on the customer side on a Friday night, another bartender had to ask her to come back and work management pulled your head out of your ass sad to see I have to talk to my friends in another location.

oh porter how i love you let me count the ways i had a ah like in one porter and i felt great and i was extremely happy to have the sweet potato fries instead of the usual fries with my sammie our waitress was pleasant and next time i will ask to be seated outside or at a high table our booth was great for chatting with my friend but i like people watching at the pub now if you avoid sunrise because you remember there used to be something called the Sonora Brewhouse in this same space, you're lucky, the brewmaster Una is still there, still brewing her witches dry, but now you won't confuse them with the Sonoran Brewing Co in north Scottsdale, hooray

I like breakfast better than first wake up breakfast, which is a bit ironic, I guess maybe it should be named second wake up, but what I like, not guilty, your honor, the veggie wrap is good, it comes with a side of hummus, fruit and potatoes. big meal the vera cruz burrito the breakfast burrito was pretty good the vera cruz sauce is a mix of salsa and Hollandaise I never had it before trying it here and it was actually quite tasty the mango iced tea is good and they will give you some to go if you ask for something on the potatoes just don't suit me and like I mentioned earlier the breakfast just isn't my favorite I just don't like their omelets very much, sign up for their email club to get a purchase, get a free meal coupon if you're vegan, order the veggie wrap and substitute the avocado for the feta cheese, also get a side of salsa

the person before me reviewed Phoenix Greyhound Park as a flea market will review Greyhound Park as a dog race. We came here on a July night after many drinks and swimming at my parents before leaving to come here. It seemed like a good idea. I was comparing dog racing to horse racing from Del Mar to San Diego in my head, but during the ride I began to become suspicious. sweetheart, this guilt doesn't work for me, the track is in the open air while the customers who bet on these beautiful animals sit inside the stadium, sitting behind huge glass windows, staring giddily while drinking beer and eating assorted snacks, entry is free, they keep the dogs inside before racing them. of the races we stayed for, it just didn't feel right, everyone had a good time, but especially the winners, how can I be so excited about horse racing but not dog racing, I'm a walking contradiction

here's the thing with jobs, it's at a neighbor's, if you ate at chain stores or cooked at home it seemed like a safe bet and who doesn't want to support their neighborhood pizza place, they started off on the wrong foot with me by not accepting their free pizza coupon they sent me in the mail. for cheap I wanted two the food itself is typical the cheese crust and toppings are moderately sloppy in a bad way the sauce is a little too sweet for my liking but after eating here twice tastes different each time the service was good the delivery took about an hour on Friday the rest of the menu besides pizza is what you imagine the wings not outstanding fried items and some of the sandwiches let's put it that way if I was at someone's house and they ordered a pie work, I would eat it but I wouldn't buy it myself

I've always wanted to go there the flames outside intrigued me so we went Wednesday night around noon we were seated pretty quickly with no reservations for hibachi the music pumps and the crowd is a little older a little cougars the service was it was lacking from time to time he brought me a diet coke after I had only taken a few sips of my drink I have to get new glasses at the end of the meal the soup is your basic mushroom miso soup salad spicy savory had a nice fresh kick the crisp greens fillet and chicken found the flavors lacking, the steak was a bit chewy and the chicken boring, even the dips were lacking for dinner and tip for two. I think you can improve elsewhere, it's not worth the drive to Scottsdale, find a local restaurant closer to you.

you want good food you're better off smuggling goat cheese into your boot and risking an anal cavity search to do it than eating at this airport you want scenery try the desert you want a comfortable seat to wait for your delayed flight well you're in the desert so you're probably better off finding a cactus and riding it face first you want a relatively close connection for your flight nice and hard shit oh yeah they have people movers but a somehow they have this magical ability to disengage people's legs yeah i know it sounds crazy but as soon as people step on these things their legs stop moving and they plant their fat ass right in the middle of the path what is wrong with your legs you mammoth
if they weren't located around the corner I would never use this store. I have taken the products back several times due to their expiration date, so keep an eye on the dates when purchasing.

ok so I'm a fan of a great breakfast that isn't a huge national chain, maybe it's the fact that Orange County is seriously lacking in many good breakfast options. Second, the fact that they have dog-friendly patio service elevates the place in my book. Our trips to Scottsdale aren't complete until we stop here for breakfast. like the breakfast burrito or ranchero shades they knock the lid off the ball, the kids green pork in ranchero shades is fantastic and keeps me coming back for it

I just moved to the area so I use Yelp but was very sad that the experience here wasn't worth coming back for. The only reason I'm posting is because it hasn't been reviewed in so long. I didn't like the fact that the spa pedicure was at a price and then the things you expect in a spa pedicure were upgrades. I want to ask for a pedicure, then lie down, enjoy the chair and read after the pedicure. would have left if she had put on my flip flops before painting my nails, their kid was cute but I'm not going to get a pedicure to play games with other people's kids then to top it off when I paid she asked for my pin as she walked away against the pin it was a credit card usually I wouldn't mind but I was already frustrated at this point

I went here for a happy hour with my wife after work today and it was good enough for me to go back but not the best I've had we ordered the spicy tuna dashiki roll tuna shitty soft shell roll and on the server's recommendation the fake dashiki cooking roll good not great could have been a bit colder spicy tuna roll better than the dashiki but not the epic soft shell crab roll it was actually my tongue favorite it had the right amount of texture and flavor fake and cook they must have used some sort of torch to brown the top probably fueled by a lighter liquid as all I could taste was the burnt part on top would have been fabulous if they hadn't tried to set the food on fire near work I will be back the prices and all day happy hour are both great

I've been here a few times now and I'd say it's decent Mexican food, slightly overpriced, their regular dishes are just ok. I've had their tacos and enchiladas and prefer arrobas next door or Carlos slips just down the street. There's even a mom and dad place near my apartments that equals quality and taste. nachos, I'm not even kidding, four or more people could munch on this, they make it just the way I like it too, lots of cheese, tomatoes, jalapeños, sour cream and guacamole yum, that's what kept me coming back, but after the other night I feel like I'm sure to find a place whose nachos make me just as happy. we weren't even half finished with our nachos when he asked while I was eating, were you done with this not only asking but reaching out to grab the plate and this happened multiple times while we were trying to finish our food, I don't know if they wanted us to get out of there or what and then for someone who was so attentive I waited minutes for a drink refill, make the glasses clear and this didn't won't be that hard to tell if I need more, my friend and I left full but irritated if I thought the quality of service was a one time thing. I wouldn't even put this review up, but the fact is when you pay for overpriced Mexican food in North Scottsdale it's not like your options are slim, I recommend going next door to Arrobas, good food and great service.

the food was good I had the chopped fruits de mare apparently the portion is large as the waiter suggested it may have been too big for me but the portion was typical of a fruits de mare type plate I have had in other restaurants the sauce was nicely spicy and good flavor the pasta was well cooked and the right portion size I think people add too much pasta to make the dish bigger other than the imitation crab a disappointment but not a deal breaker the seafood was well cooked between the calamari mussels and the kids spaghetti was very good i taste all the kids spaghetti since i had kids and invariably someone doesn't finish or even start their bowl the pasta was well cooked the meatball was ok but the sauce was sick and thick not watery which i hate and covered all the pasta which for some reason other restaurants can't seem to make the meals the butter used is very tasty some type of garlic I think the bread was warm, soft and not overcooked now I would have given stars with a few exceptions the decor and slower service the decor was terrible sorry old and dated I think their target demographics are years or older like the photos of the chairs and everything inside screams the chairs remind me of an old conference room the lighting is on the dark side I guess if I was on a date or with retired couples this would be a nicer decor but with adults and children it just doesn't suit quite right for children, not quite, but the children's welcome is more like it, as the mood is darker and the volume of conversations is softer. Having loud and obnoxious kids is not the right place for them overall, the food is good, the servers are friendly but it's not the family friendly place I usually go for.

I saw this company fixing it and thought I'd give it a try. I was tasked with replacing a daylight photo sensor for our front lights. Here are the troubleshooting service call diagnostic fees. Price without problem to replace the sensor on their simple price. They replaced the small recessed photo sensor with one that sticks out from the side of the house. This is clearly not the same room with I phoned Mr Sparky to register my complaint. results, I just believe if you pay for a small photo light sensor you should get a similar part in return, amazing to repair it, they definitely haven't done their research on this company

There's nothing special about this place, it's hardly a place I'm looking to return to, it's in the heart of the old town but doesn't feel Scottish at all. I guess it's a good place to hang out. They have a patio and a cozy interior like truck stop decor but bigger and not as cool. I thought the beer selection was lacking, the service was slow and obnoxious. Phoenix in Boston all the bartenders are annoyed to serve you so I'm used to it but this is Phoenix, damn one guy in particular was standing behind the bar with his arms crossed I'm not sure what his role was in the whole process of serving the bar he didn't even take a drink he just stood in contempt of the customers overall this place is decent but I wouldn't choose to go back. I have a drink then I go somewhere else, I was wondering where all the sofas and fine leather handbags are lol

newly opened Mexican restaurant tucked in the Dowson and German neighborhood I would give the place stars for decor the owner tried really hard to make the restaurant look like old Mexico inside the food was good but not great I enjoyed the tomatillo salsa brought with the red salsa and chips the portions were quite large no room for dessert and I had to ask for take out boxes ordered great seafood tacos with excellent presentation the plato links from carne asama very keen on beef, pork and chicken huge tia Rosa Burro huge I will definitely go back and review but overall I liked this place

decent food at not unreasonable prices the service is good what happens with the hyper aggressive pigeons on the terrace the waitresses hand out water guns to customers to fend off the ever persistent waves of poultry at the end of your experience on the terrace there is a certain sense of camaraderie shared with other customers

I will say the weakest link in this restaurant is the maturity of the staff we went to lunch and asked to sit on the patio, most of the people we are eating at, but then they sat a large group right next to us who only wanted to drink and smoke. I know smoking was allowed on the patio, but since it wasn't the only table available and we were eating food, I think they should have seated them a little further away from us. Our order was not good but we couldn't get the waiter to come back so we just gave it up, the food was excellent There were a few items on the small plates then we had the bacon grilled cheese and the chicken sandwich both very good. My biggest complaint is that we are ignored unless we are actively looking for someone and then grab someone as they walk by. I will try again as this place is still trying to find its way but the service needs to be beefed up for sure.

I've never had Thai food before so I guess I have nothing to compare it to, but this restaurant didn't serve very tasty food, maybe it was just what I ordered, I don't know and plus it had a funny smell, it wasn't great but I won't go back.

yeah not a lot of sprinkles really not worth the wait, not the chaos, not the hype, not the attitude of the morons that work there, other things that are terrible about the sprinkles including the cupcakes are not that great, I ordered two, the vanilla was okay, the cinnamon was dry and chalky and I really didn't like it, this place is a disorganized mess, there is no rhyme or reason in the ordering process, my friends and I looked closely at the ordering process and we actually think they decided to go with the stupidest and most irrational methods of taking orders and handing out cupcakes, that's just stupid, the owners must have deliberately hired only people who can't think for themselves or make decisions, no sane person could work here without being like maybe there's a better way to do it too, the employees were rude, did I mention stupid, so I tried to order a bottle of water. receive the water and pay for it, I pointed out that the water was right there and no one was paying or currently using the register couldn't she just sell me water, she said no and started writing my order just the word water on a cupcake order form, she then told me to stand there and wait for my name to be called so she could give me the water and then call me. helltotheno I said it was pretty simple, just give me some water and I'll give you some money. End of discussion, there are the actual words coming out of her mouth, she looked really angry and also maybe terrified of me and my fury labs, luckily she handed me my water so I didn't have to stab her, which was good because I was too thirsty to stab anyone, I have to be well hydrated to commit crimes of passion and I'm crazy, crazy, passionate about my cupcakes, yo

the sauce particularly appealed to me at this location, as it's one I frequently find myself at for a quick lunch or casual dinner near home. I usually order chopped salads for lunch. Ground Turkey Feta Salad is what I had today.
