I had them add asparagus which was a good choice if I do say so myself. often eats in sauce also he will have a salad or a sandwich the last time we were there together he had the salami turkey prosciutto mozzarella pain I took a bite and was pleasantly surprised there was a good balance of thin slices of meat cheese lettuce tomato and tangy red wine vinegar between two perfectly toasted pieces of bread the thin crust pizzas are pretty decent too depending on your appetite sharing a pizza and salad with your companion can turn out to be a satisfying meal what I like about sauce the quickest, friendly and efficient service in a clean and relaxed environment, moderate prices are also a big plus in my opinion, especially in this economy

whole foods whole paycheck entirely her I'm sorry the prices are ridiculous the only reason I went there is because since I moved here from a very foodie town some items are almost impossible to find and they have them but you will pay my search today was mushrooms not a button but chantreloysterect I was going to have everything on my list but when I saw shallots at the I bought my rooms and divided the shallots to the and of course, there is always the trader does it

I was very disappointed with my meeting with them today, I have been going there for years and thought they did a good job today. I picked up my Tori Burch handbag that I had brought in to get a shoulder strap repaired. The thread they used for the repair was a light cream color. The purse and stitching are mustard yellow, it looks horrible. They tried putting cream colored shoe polish on the tread, no improvement now, the thread just looked dirty. that's good, they wouldn't refund the amount I prepaid just in store or redo it with the correct color thread, they kept saying I fixed it, looks like I'm going to find a new shoe repair place

I went here with an Indian friend so I can't tell you what I ate but it was delicious we went on a Thursday afternoon and it was pretty empty but as the night went on more and more people filled the place, they have a lunch buffet but I'm not sure about the price or quality of the food but if it's anything like dinner our habits are worth checking out

Hands down, the worst public transportation system I've seen in any place I've lived or traveled and I'm an avid world traveler. I use this system from time to time. I've been vaccinating between non-metro cities and here for about years and yes, for a few of those years I would also drive a car here and there, so I have a solid basis of comparison, it's a joke compared to other cities in the US and abroad that have equivalent populations, New York and Los Angeles are so much easier to get around even though those places are larger and more densely populated. Phoenix is ​​easily years behind every other comparable citywide transit system, with times when we need buses that run more than once an hour and it's currently the fastest buses that are on time every day, they are never on time, always way too early without a wait or way too late without excuses, more stops, stops that have actual benches, shade, or posted information of any kind. I can't even imagine how travelers get around on this thing, nothing is ever posted with relevant information or signs. and and and but seriously, it's just horrible and a complete joke to anyone who has ever experienced public transportation anywhere else

I had high expectations after reading the reviews but was so disappointed the food was not good, the service was terrible, they mixed up all our orders, I will never return and cannot recommend this place. One dish was good and some enjoyed the soup. There are places I will visit before returning to this place.

I know I enjoy food when I think about how good it was, days and days later, it's been about a week and I still crave the mac and cheese I inhaled during my happy hour visit. The macaroni was cooked to perfection. The cheese had the perfect consistency and texture and the addition of spicy sausage really set the dish apart while the service was incredibly slow. filled with no bueno, the atmosphere was relaxing and laid back and the bathrooms were fabulous, well lit, good aroma and my choice of cloth or paper towels, the bathroom had well placed mirrors which made the space look large and clean. I will definitely return but next time I might sneak in my own drink

Evans seems to be the place we go every time we visit family at Casa Grand, now it's a pretty consistent experience and it's good enough for us when we're out of town, the food is pretty good, their sauces are spicy but that's okay with us, they're always full of flavor and they complement meals. the jalap o sauce was a bit small but very good the rice that the combinations are served with is just solo their fries are good the salsa is a bit weak the quality of the food is average overall the service has never been better they are not particularly attentive or friendly I felt like we were a bit of a hassle sometimes the last waiter advised us to go for a combo plate as it would be cheaper when it turns out if you do the math yourself it was about more expensive the managers solution was to remove the bill and then come our sodas hmm ok a warning then to all of you who are watching your costs add your items to the card yourself and don't let it put pressure on you in the combo especially if you don't want candor rice beans anyway the menu is also slightly confusing the prices are average the decor is nice the restaurant looks like it could serve large groups and parties very well overall Evans seems to be a great place sure to have a meal and we will go there next time we are in that direction

I had the soppressata with aged provolone roasted peppers, it was a solid sandwich overall, the quality of the ingredients was pretty good but the only part that gets me is the tax on the price wow, all that stuff about supply and demand that I learned in con class wasn't a joke worth trying once but I don't think it's a place I'll eat lunch at regularly
the chicken schnitzel was amazing, the service was slow and the waiter didn't know the menu didn't know what a knish was

chino is a cool place to take someone who has never been before it's strange and fascinating i live pretty close and the food is good but it definitely doesn't blow you away it's the kind of place that makes me want chino so i don't need to go for a month or a year the snickerdoodles are great and come with the meal expect to pay close to a person if you have a drink with your meal

another place that's a short walk from the subway is one of those places where you can't go wrong, you get meals worth a dollar or feet long, the guys are really friendly and aren't stingy with the toppings, I'm not a big fan of the smell of the subway, but anyway, it's just one of those places where I'm lazy and don't want to make a sandwich, plus it helps me keep my girl like Jared figure happy

maybe I ate at a different restaurant than the others or once they got through the soft opening they gave up because this place wasn't good, the service was mediocre at best, they seemed scattered and unfocused, they took five minutes to get water, I gave up on ordering anything else after that, the bland hamburger food which was cooked perfectly in the center, too bad on the outside of the center thumb it was completely overcooked and dry, soggy, grease from fried duck and average sweet potato fritters, let's talk about that coal oven while the burgers are cooked in a coal oven. you can tell from the smoke hovering above the restaurant that they are cooked in an iron pan. I fried the charcoal, the charcoal adds absolutely nothing to the burger overall, if I'm going to spend on a burger with no sides it better be perfect and it wasn't. I also hope this gets me more than two donuts.
I love this stone cold, if only for the fact that by the time you leave dinner at one of the restaurants near the strip mall this place is in, it's practically closed, we had no wait.
I love how every other assistant reviewing this company found the same issues that would never allow me to use their services again. The company is a disaster and should be reported to the manager.

in a nutshell, blah, it's a chain so I wasn't expecting much and in this case my expectations were correct. I ordered the shrimp tacos, but nothing to write home about in my opinion is that the food is mediocre and overpriced and the service was poor.

we got there in November and the service was very bad, the worst I have ever seen and we were treated like crap. We came to town from Los Angeles and Vegas for the tie and saw Mrs. Whites Café working as a foodie and knew the food had to be great. The chicken was excellent but the customer service was so bad we will never come back again. this place just because the chicken is good doesn't mean you treat people like shit, we had to remind the staff more than six times to get our order, we waited several minutes for the other pieces of chicken to finish our meal, we don't mind waiting, but it was pretty rude when you watch other people having their meal when they came in after us, the mac and cheese didn't look like everyone else's, it looked like it came out of a box, you can say it was far from homemade it was clear it was undercooked no crust the sauce was watered missing cornbread was overcooked and under salted the cornbread was definitely not like everyone else's felt like we were given leftovers seriously the worst service we have ever received the place needs to learn to be respectful and just plain nice
Jimmy Johns is cheaper and better, Capriotti food is heavy and it doesn't taste as good as you think.

If it wasn't for the bad food I would go here more than once or twice a year. The meat was dry and tough in my first dish and inedible in my second. Now when my wife drags me here to watch a movie, I order a salad just because they do catering. I suspect they serve leftover food from catered events to their restaurant patrons.

I've always been a fan of the Dill, it's just a delicious sandwich, I can't speak for all the places, but the one in Mesa down south was a real disappointment the other night. I waited almost minutes for a cold turkey sandwich after working all day and sitting in traffic for an hour. for longer than I can remember, but unfortunately I won't be going back anytime soon unless someone can guarantee that I won't have to sit and listen to teenagers for half an hour while waiting for a cold sandwich.

very disappointed I chose this place because of the reviews I read here I feel obligated to give my money we started with jalapeño hushpuppies with their roulade the puppies were very tasty great start to our main course we ordered the fried green tomato salad to share my wife ordered the okra with a side of fried okra and I ordered the fried catfish with double okra on the side the lag time between our puppies and the meal was shockingly long when they finally brought our meal, my wife didn't get her okra, they explained it would take a few more minutes, keep in mind my plate had okra so I guess they must have forgotten hers, it didn't take less than a few minutes before they brought it out when we finally received our meal. The bartender apologized for the wait and explained that everything they had was freshly breaded and not frozen, which is why it takes longer. dead end your kitchen all that being said even after the wait if the food was good I would write a positive review right now the problem is the food was just so so the okra had no flavor and wasn't fully cooked to a nice crispy crust my catfish flavor was ok but the breading was pretty thick my wife's gumbo was a little bland almost like the roux was a little weak I really wanted to like this place after our first experience I probably won't go back

I really want to like Madcap I love the idea of ​​playing old movies and some forgotten favorites Boyfriend and I went to Madcap last weekend to see their Chuck Jones presentation Unfortunately we were pretty disappointed, not that it's completely Madcap's fault, but my biggest problem with Madcap is the price of admission which is more than a new movie. I think I would go a lot more because it has to be something I really want to see and after not being as impressed with the Chuck Jones stuff I'm a little wary there wasn't even a screen in the theater just a blank wall if they were showing new indie films and old films I think they would really have something cool to do I hope they can figure it out because I would really like to see the place become what it could be

we arrived on time but our table wasn't ready, we were offered a place at the bar but told we couldn't order for minutes which was a bit weird, there was a total of eight dishes, some were fantastic, some were mediocre despite being the new thing. A customer should never be told they can't order for minutes that exude arrogance, rather good cocktails might give them another chance.

typical no frills dive bar where you can meet a friend after work play pool watch sports anyway there is a pretty big food menu also i had the nachos once and they were pretty filling and tasty good happy hour also i heard it was a place to watch ohio state sports but it was pretty dead when i went there to watch a football game but it was pretty nice to have a prime seat in front of a huge to and the service was really good

the waffle house was packed heard another couple doing quick swirls with a minute wait ahead of us we decided to try it we walked in it looked like a senior center the tables and chairs were very outdated we sat in a booth the food was still on the table and the cushions were dirty. ok the service was terrible, one thing that really grossed me out was the air conditioning return next to the office door, look up and you will probably see years of dust that has accumulated. I showed the waitress and she didn't care, I told her if I saw that when I came in I would walk out of the waffle house sorry, I will never betray you again.

I wanted to like this place so much after reading the good reviews, I have to admit the decor is much better than the typical nail joint. I too don't understand the point of photos of very long red nails holding bills. Super cheesy, this place doesn't disappoint with the decor, it's like visiting a spa rather than a nail salon. I didn't spend a lot of money if the product is good, but I had to go home and clean off the polish left trapped around my cuticles, file the hard edges of my nails down to something that wouldn't hurt my husband and the massage was like being tickled then rubbed with a stone. mine is filed in a different shape, now I have to do it all again myself, maybe it's because I didn't ask a specific person for the nails, maybe the reviews I read that are stars seem to refer to a specific person, maybe I'll try one more time and ask Kevin who seems to have good reviews if so, I'll post again hopefully with a better rating next time at the moment, this place is definitely not worth it no more than two stars and these stars are only for good location, reasonable prices and nice atmosphere, I give zero stars for the quality of nail polish and pedicure.

phew, what a hike coming from Colorado, although the relative comparison makes it just a first, it's definitely dangerous when we arrived between and on a Saturday morning there were about four or five fire trucks in the parking lot breathing the rescue crews just camped there, I think because of all the confusion not planning accordingly for the waterline or overestimating their ability to make this climb, two different areas of the Echo Canyon trail are particularly steep and potentially slippery, they have so installed metal guardrails to help only if you have gloves or the temperature is moderate uhh that doesn't really happen in Phoenix during the day in the summer because the damn things get hot enough to fry an egg also water water bring plenty or stock up at the trailhead before you go up although the water from that faucet attached to the water fountain is about degrees yuck it was a fun getaway the view was worth it not quite picturesque as far as nature goes but it was a nice view of the town and surrounding area if you go, just be wary of the sun hat and be aware that you will be climbing on and around rocks and such if you trip, they are curtains

based on some people's reviews I would disagree, the report isn't that great. I'm a little perplexed by the almost unanimous stars. I seriously don't think these people from Phoenix haven't ventured across a state line. I had a report here and I was thinking of eating goldstone.
completely shady towed our transport as we moved into our new apartment complex completely unethical and total scammers avoid at all costs

change has a good menu but this place still needs to work on their service every time I was not impressed with the consistency of service also when refilling the water please don't spill it everywhere I know you are in a hurry but points for style are given for not dropping water on the table floor and customers my guests get quite loud so I recommend getting there before dinner for a conversation meal

although it's billed as the largest thrift store in North America, I'm pretty sure it's the isle of misfit goodwill items, the place is huge but I've never found anything good in this store, I don't know how that's possible but I would never go out of my way to shop here, I don't have a bathroom report for this place because I've never been there long enough to go

I love coffee, I haven't been thrilled with my service since I've been at Batista, I've never been behind the counter ready to help myself every time I come in, they follow me out of the patio where they've been smoking, I know you get a break, but sitting outside and chatting with your friends while smoking is not what you're paid to do, either I have bad timing when they're on break or the kids are huge slackers.

this has to be the worst restaurant in terms of hygiene two of my friends got food poisoning after dining here the food is just unhealthy with tons of oil floating on the top of the curries and i don't know if any sanitary hygiene code is followed here the service is poor and the information on her website is incorrect the owner doesn't allow dining after or even though it says the restaurant is open until one evening i saw the owner cleaning the place without gloves and she was kind enough to give us a togo parcel without washing their hands great example from the waiters, I peeked inside the kitchen when the door was ajar and it looked really dirty. I've visited a lot of hole-in-the-wall places around this restaurant, including Haji Baba, the Vietnamese place and others, but neither of my friends nor I got sick from the food. If you need a spicy fix, I highly recommend not trying this place for fear of wanting a doctor's visit the next day.

I don't know if it tastes like Chicago or not, but it's safe to say that things are made to order and always greasy and overstuffed, so maybe it's like Chicago, the atmosphere is cool I guess, but I'm a Bears fan, so it's cool to see the old memorabilia on the walls.

great donuts but horrible service didn't get everything we wanted due to a language barrier between us and the employee limited english speaking she claimed in broken english she only spoke spanish she only understood the word dozen and we got a dozen of what she felt like giving us then she started ignoring us while using her cell phone the donut shops are a dime a dozen and we will never go back to the boss again

I recently went to the breakfast club for the first time with a good friend who I hadn't seen for a long time, it was a weekday so although it was still busy we didn't have to wait to be seated, the food was good but slightly overpriced. My biggest problem with the restaurant, the service, they were slow to deliver our drinks and food but once our food arrived they were swarming like bees every five minutes to take our plates so we could get out of there. a lovely morning with a good friend but instead wanted us to pay and leave after being there for just over an hour and fifteen minutes. The waitress actually told us to leave the table and finish our conversation outside so they could seat other customers. We were mortified. I have never been asked to leave a restaurant in my life, needless to say they have not gained a loyal customer with me.

no, don't go, don't, this was my first visit and it was on a whim as we often pass by another reviewer here who made a wise statement, go to the grocery store and buy some frozen fish, I promise it will be better than that

wow this place is a total trip no i don't smoke but if i did this place is probably the place i would go first the food was ok i ordered chicken wings which weren't really great my favorite was thai curry it definitely had some pop it's one of those that overwhelms you milk please my friend ordered sake which i thought was really good and smooth don't ask me what it was the lighting was dim and i'm fine with it I figured by the time I got there the service was pretty good I guess and then again the place was dead for a Friday night what's up with that I'm sure the place gets busy on Fridays but it's only one day a month I'm sure it fills up quickly the vibe was cool it just reminded me of the years in a way even though I didn't grow up during the s hah but I thought the design and decor was pretty cool quirky I think that was the word I used, the bathroom was blue and that's all I'm going to pay for, enjoy
I'll make it easy for you, just go hand out a hamburger if you don't want to feel gross and poor.

should be called the bad egg in the end, the hotel's free breakfast tasted better than this one and we had better service there. We arrived around morning on a Sunday morning and had to wait about seven minutes to be seated. The staff was pleasant enough. We were seated given the menus with water and she took our coffee order and the breakfast special loaded potato skillet. the pan was supposed to have sausage, bacon, onions, scrambled eggs, grilled American potatoes covered in cheese and sour cream, mine had no bacon, two small pieces of sausage, no cheese and the potatoes were so soggy they tasted like I had thawed them and thrown them away after the fact, it was so unpleasant I couldn't eat more than one bite even after loading it with salt and hot sauce. in a nice way she offered me something else at that time, I didn't feel like eating anything else, I felt a little sick, my meal was prepared and we received an apology, the manager explained that everyone likes this special and the potatoes are seasoned and grilled.

I don't feel the love here went to Hillside on the recommendation of a friend who lives nearby and loves the place. I would like it more if it was my place. We went on a Sunday morning, we knew there would be a crowd, but the line wasn't long and we got a table right next to the entire line while the order taker packed up the to-go portion of my order. The pie my friends ordered at the same time took over an hour to get to the table. a numbering system for tables a person waiting stood behind drinks at the stop yelling my name without even moving I had to stand up and scream because I couldn't find the person who had my food the food was good but living in the east valley I wouldn't drive across town to eat here again

I was ready to have a cold, sweet drink before catching my flight so I headed to the Wendy's next to this place, the guy at this place looked bored so I walked over to his counter to buy the drink, he was quite friendly and very quick to charge me for the drink which was a little cheaper than the same drink at Wendy's, he also said I could either use the coke machine or the iced tea dispensers, he had two kinds of regular iced tea and one green blackberry, I had some of the green blackberry which was very refreshing and quite good, I then went to the coke machine to find that the sign on the coke machine basically said that once you buy a cup you can refill it again and again on the same day of purchase. I'll remember this if I ever have a layover in Phoenix, the prices at Starbucks in that airport would quickly drain my wallet if I had to stay in the airport for any length of time.
great place well maintained it's a big airport with long walks

I am very unhappy with the service I receive from the Republican Party in Arizona. First they give us John McCain, then Jan Brewer, then they spit on us, who we didn't even vote for. I have only ever received bad policies from these people.

everything was good the ice cream was delicious no overwhelming alcohol taste an interesting variety of flavors the service was good the place was clean I will go back but only because I have a sweet tooth and they are in the neighborhood

so this won't be my best review, especially when I expected so much more from this place, let's get that out of the way and on the table first, it's not a bad place to go, but I want my favorite by all means. started the meal with mozzarella cotton berretta porno, it consists of baked mozzarella burrito, served with toasted ciabatta, fried eggplant, lemon truffle and parsley dressing. There were only two tiny slices of ciabatta, which wasn't the first complaint. The second complaint would be that the fried eggplant could have used a little more flavor, perhaps a little lemon pepper in the batter would have been nice. Finally, the dish could have satisfied with just a little more cheese. I was expecting a bit more with the price of two miniature slices of ciabatta and two thinly sliced ​​pieces of eggplant on top of the salad, I don't know about you but when I order a salad I expect a salad, it was a salad but not with a lettuce or lettuce look. We ordered the cares di pomodoro. salad base, then have the tomatoes with cheese and basil, then the lemon with olive oil as a dressing, it was nothing more than what the description said, it was two tomatoes cut in half with a small amount of cheese and a few basil leaves, then the lemon jam mixed with olive oil on top, don't get me wrong, it's absolutely amazing and I would love to have it again, it's just not what I was expecting so it would have been nice to know exactly what I was ordering to make matters worse, our so called salad took about a few minutes to arrive. the table after ordering it took so long the chef actually apologized and told management he was going to send us some soup for the wait we were fine and we weren't in a rush but when we already had our food it was taking forever and told us we were going to have soup we were expecting it the soup never came after an hour and a half for our main course we got our food it was good but nothing to write home about on my polls, Portofino was bland to say the least and was actually a bit dry, the potatoes were ok but again a bit bland my date had the ravioli di mozzarella con salsa allarrabbiata the ravioli pasta was so thick you really couldn't taste the filling and the sauce was too sweet in my and my dates opinion, we did however order a side of the risotto parmigiano and it was simply incredible. this is the decision to go back to alto, it won't be at the top of my list because it's overpriced for what you get and overall just not the best first experience. I will however consider stopping for risotto or going for it when it comes to good Italian, I think I will stick to the grotto Italian or the pane e vino

I guess you really can't put lipstick on a pig, I will say it's nice inside with all the new buildings and equipment, but it's definitely a horse gym, lots of raider hats and eye candy. I would rather go to Moon Valley, all the same new things, but much nicer people. I will say it's nice to see people in a gym who need to be there and it also seems very gay friendly.

jack in the box, this one in particular is mom's busiest, it's definitely better when you're drunk or at least I think that is from the number of drunk customers I see eating there, the food is good, what do you wait for, you got the dime for the tacos which is a must for any meal, you also get the all day breakfast, that means you can get an extreme taco sausage sandwich and a chicken fajita pita in the same meal that is good to eat, please note that nothing about the fajita chicken pita is remotely close to a real fajita, this place specializes in making your food not look like the picture, the picture may show a big soft bun with a juicy burger, but your burger will probably look like someone stepped on it then ran over it with their car, it doesn't change the taste, but it still tastes exactly like you expect from the jib.

Met a few ladies here for drinks a few weeks ago, at someone else's suggestion, we didn't end up playing pool, we just enjoyed our drinks at the bar before moving to a table, we were definitely overdressed and probably out of place but it was a relaxing place to leave loose drinks were ok, food was nothing exceptional, exceptional prices were to be expected

I'm so glad this spot has been revived even though I never had the chance to try it, the biggest plus for me is that this place is only a minute's walk from my work. I met a friend here for lunch a few weeks ago. I had their chicken salad with walnuts. if the muffins are from Costco I give this place one star for atmosphere, each seating area is decorated a little differently, I love the stained glass windows and enlarged photos of places around Phoenix as table decorations, this place really looks local and one of a kind

I always pay cash at these pandas if it wasn't in front of work. I wouldn't go here twice at all. I was charged twice on my debit card for my lunch. I'm not saying it was intentional, but either way, it's annoying to have to dispute a charge with your bank.

After a day full of meetings, I rounded up the bellman and we went out to eat Mexican. I had visions of chipssalsa and margaritas we headed to at the border with staples near the baseline only to find out this place was closed and then we remembered the salty senorita across the street and so begins the saga. we the menus and took our drink orders, he was pushing some type of tequila and I took the bait with the stipulation on the rocks with salt, my drink and the hunters water arrived and we ordered the chips and salsa and our dinners arrived at the same time. Joe Product's attention and he pretended to be concerned but didn't offer to sit us at another table now the hunters are getting angry it's hard to have fun when you chase the ants off the table our stand was near a window but we didn't see any influx of ants coming from the window so we don't know where they came from but they don't stop the hunter mentions it a second time and then again with feigned concern he offers to move us over to another table at this point we are almost done eating and I say let's just finish up and get the hell out of there, dodge our bill we pay and Hunter asks the manager he is even younger than Joe Product and it looks like he just woke up so we will call him Bed Head Bed Head offers to buy us a drink on the house, that's really your solution, he said he would make sure the other customers weren't sitting in that area, no thanks, we wanted just leaving we weren't after free food but the discount offer or some sort of compensation for sharing our entire meal with ants would have been appreciated a free drink, maybe one of those margaritas would have taken care of everything food wise if the chicken enchiladas had plenty with beans and rice and were dry. I like my enchiladas with tons of sauce and cheese and these had very little sauce with a little drawing of sour cream on them. arrived with the drinks and before the meal, thinking we were there on Earth Day so maybe sharing our meal with ants was relevant, the margarita comes out of the limes as it was pretty good

the beach paradise of ixtapazihuatenejo awaited unfortunately, as did a connecting flight in Arizona of all places, our luggage did not arrive at our final destination, various items of our clothing still missing as well as my cell phone charger, not to mention security forcing us to open sealed containers of baby food and my son's milk for litmus tests. I had a brilliant idea, at least we didn't get kicked out.

I went here for lunch today, I wasn't feeling the hot pack I had in the freezer here at work, what can I say, its subway is still mediocre, it's not too fantastic but it doesn't knock my ass, it's a bit like an olive garden sometimes, you just need mediocre food, I don't know why it's an island, maybe I'm the only weirdo, but one thing's for sure, it still tastes the same every time I go there maybe it has that high school nostalgia for me I don't know I also like tail secco wafers so maybe don't pay attention to any of my reviews I get the spicy italian on cheese bread duh provolone cheese light mayonnaise mustard lettuce cucumbers olives onions peppers and lots of banana peppers sp that's how I roll
It's a highway with zero traffic near the city center but the views are beautiful thanks to a dream drawing, I think I just saw a Kurd go by there

I was accused of training my wife for pay and was told to leave the gym or told the trainer to call the cops. I don't know how a trainer confuses me by working with my wife and training my wife in compensation management. He handled this issue horribly, their lack of attention to this showed exactly what a customer has been worth for years.

It was my birthday and my wife, her mother, a dear friend and I went to Fleming Steakhouse in Chandler. We have heard nothing but good things about this place and wanted to experience their unforgettable steak dishes which we did. Unfortunately, the restaurant was charming and the atmosphere adequate for an expensive steakhouse. We were seated immediately and attended to by the servers. specials after which we ordered food and wine after a short wait four large plates arrived I was lucky my steak a large ribeye ordered medium rare which tasted very good despite two big drops of fat sat pretty in the middle of the large plate nothing else on my plate just the steak I looked around at my wife's plate and couldn't believe her filet mignon was sitting there in the middle of the large plate with nothing topping, whether it be a glaze a foil a slice of anything at the prices this restaurant charges, it felt like an insult to each of us to have such a poor presentation of a steak, we asked our server for a side of parmesan mashed potatoes and when they arrived we couldn't believe it, there were no more than two shaggy potatoes made into mash or about a tablespoon of mashed potatoes per no one mind you they tasted good but more per side dish in short we left hungry and wondering why we spent more on the whole meal next time we will go to a well tried place for steaks and more in downtown Phoenix and worth the drive

was I there on a bad day or what I arrived within minutes of them opening and every item I tried was lukewarm or cold, they have items on the lunch buffet and I tried a bite of each one, disgusting and bland. I felt sick to my stomach after I left because I kept thinking about how bad the food was.

otherwise for plane landing and takeoff you will be crazy to eat here, prices are about the same as nie, cleanliness really needs improvement, waiters are not very efficient apart from the menu, they offer brunch for breakfast on sunday
huge queue for incompetent employees who don't even know how to wash cars

I have been eating here for years. I lived nearby and went there often. The quality of the food started to drop and we stopped going there, then they changed ownership and it's good to eat there again. Flamingo Palace is exactly what you would expect from a mall Chinese restaurant. The food is solo and the service is pretty good. We really like the hot and sour soup and the flamingo chicken. back

an upscale Mexican restaurant in the neighborhood seemed like the best thing that ever happened to me. I planned my visit for a quieter evening and reviewed the menu over and over again. However, upon arrival I immediately thought twice that the parking was iffy and the place didn't seem to stand up to the signage. Maybe the art wasn't to my taste, honestly, no piece stands out in my memory. the kitchen where he disappeared for minutes at a time he didn't refill our soft drinks once without being pointed out first those of you who have had the up close experience will understand how ridiculous it is halfway through waiting for our food which easily took minutes the lamp above our table went out we sat in the dark for a good few minutes before they even noticed which was actually a nice change of scenery by compared to the boring beige walls when the food finally arrived we were too tired because we had finished a whole bottle of wine so we left unfortunately we took our food with us I had a sort of starter consisting of seafood with chorizo and a creamy sauce, it's no coincidence that you are surprised by the combination, it didn't go down too easily after losing money on the meal, although we felt obliged to finish as much as we could normally stand, I I'd make sure I got the name of the dish right, but since I recommend you skip it, why bother

I will never know what the food tasted like because they were so rude, I won't go back, we walked in and were given a table, the menus were practically thrown at us, then we waited and waited and waited, we asked a woman who worked there and she apparently didn't speak English and indicated that a man at the front would help us but he was too busy talking, we got up and left, no one even said a word when we we left

it's a hotel bar so expect typical hotel prices on drinks, they have some good tapas to choose from, ask for the calamari but a grilled version on the menu it's really good I had a few of their drinks there but I'm sticking to the monitor but there were plenty of others that were just as good

I went to Genghis Grill one evening while the Beijing Olympics were being broadcast. My experience eating here was probably a lot like Shawn Johnson's experience at the games, not quite the performance I expected, but I still managed to bring home a medal or two. My favorite Mongolian places include soup and salad bars in addition to grilling ingredients. I didn't miss Genghis Grill being able to nibble on a salad while waiting for my first bowl, the ingredients were all good, most seemed fresh but I had to avoid a few of the less popular offerings for the life of me, I don't understand why the boy chop didn't capture the hearts of the American public, the sauces were generally tasty, I think the merchant makes bottled salad dressings and you'll get the idea that the highlight of the evening was when I realized that the shredded cheese which given to me upon request was free and clear, of course it made me wish I would have asked for sour cream too, you won't see a photo of my experience at Genghis Grill on a wheat box anytime soon, but the meal was pleasant enough for a solid three stars

every time i visit my parents i drive past this place and see a long line of curious cars and a good set of luggage that my parents found here that finally convinced me to stop by well it's a flea market wysiwyg there's some good luggage nice jewelry some good food the bad the same authentic southwest stuff you find in any gift shop from san antonio to san diego and the ugly ones several columbus beanie babies i heart I will come back if I am looking for something in particular mainly luggage or salsa or I want to offer a souvenir to a relative that I do not like very much

what a load of absolutely hideous and uninteresting bullshit, take every nectar review written by the wizards below copy them here and you will have a much more eloquent summary of my feelings about this place than anything I can come up with, I have no reason to come here certainly not free will the one time I came here I was forced by a friend meeting another friend

slices or pintos When you are near Tempe Market and don't want to miss the movie you are about to watch, you should check this place out. The slices are more of a New York style pizza whereas the pintos are more of a home style pizza and I don't say that with any disrespect in fact, if I had to suggest either place I would most definitely suggest pintos, I will try to describe my reasoning behind that choice, the slices just have their my style pizza and to be completely honest they don't even do it very well there. there are tons of places in phoenix that do my style pizza and one notable place is venezia in the south and mill not too far from tempe market pintos has my style pizza and sicilian pizza and the latter is actually pretty good on a friday night this place is a little crowded for eating but you can order food so basically you order your food wait until you're seated and then shortly after you're seated you can get your food it worked pretty well the service is also good and the staff are quite friendly the bathroom was small a bathroom for any place but it was clean and well maintained the pizza was very interesting we had a traditional Sicilian vegetarian pizza basically if you could compare it to another pizza it would be digiorno seriously although the pizza reminds me a lot of digiornos frozen pizza this place has a unique homemade feel and even the pizza I'm not saying it's bad it's just unique the crust is actually delicious and I usually don't care too much for the taste of the crust but this one actually tasted pretty good the downside is the way they served it nothing to pick up the slices with and it was very easy for the toppings to slide through the grill when it was hot it became a bit of a pain to handle the first few slices this place has serious selection issues let's see some pork pork more pork and a bit more pork oh and a bit of vegetarian stuff ok so where does that leave kosher meat eaters not at this place if you eat kosher meat and enjoy it on your pizza this is not the place to come to there is literally no chicken or beef available here in terms of toppings this place is pretty good and moderately priced my partner and i shared a sicilian and had waters which totaled something like definitely not a terrible price but for the price i think we could do a little better i guess if we want to see a movie after dinner we would visit this place but this definitely not at the top of our pizza visit list, its good pizza, it filled me up, it was tasty but pizza is a competitive market

Lucas is a good place in the neighborhood to get your health food, come grab a coffee or freshly made pastries or pick up some beer or frozen meat on the way home. I agree with Pamela's sentiment that it is a marriage of ts and health with prices. I've had a few bad cups of coffee here but in the times I've been they have always been very nice and resolved any issues very quickly if it wasn't on my route I might not stop here much even though the trader does and health is right next to each other. camelback and you can save a ton of money if you do it this way
ok here is what they teach if you are a good person it is right and good that you take from others and you give it because you deserve it and everyone is a bad person.

this place is awesome, a friend wanted to go see a movie that had been out for a while and it turned out it was still only playing at this theater and another, it's usually a theater we went to on a Tuesday and it turns out they have a Tuesday so it was even cheaper, you definitely get what you pay for. The Fortis Theater has been around for a while, but it's a bargain compared to the average cost of the cinema gong. reason this place is awesome, there are crazy decorations, life size figurine sets and everywhere, I'm sure I've only really seen about a third of the decorations because it's just sensory overload. I heard they really decorate it at Christmas, so if you're looking for an affordable movie night and don't mind seats from years ago, this is a good option

I went to this place for lunch, I spent a lot of time in Freetown in downtown Detroit so I'm very familiar with good Greek food, the atmosphere is fun like most Greek places and the servers were an attentive and engaging group of young people. The food is pretty good and there was a big enough crowd to justify the minute wait for my meal.

I went here last night with The of and another couple and we all had very high expectations for this place that just weren't met, not to say it was bad, it just didn't live up to the hype. The space is very cute and warm. I like how the chairs don't all match and it has a very cozy atmosphere. it had this delicious onion jam type thing with crackers, cashews, meat and a really good cheese with dill on it, the onion on top of the cheese was so good I could have eaten it for dinner, then we ordered the main course and I shared the chicken and waffles and our friends got the mac and cheese and the flapjacks. the chicken was encased in the fried coating but once you cut into it the fried part fell off it didn't stick to the chicken at all it was also very thick and didn't have much flavor it was very strange the sauce on the waffles was good it was honey butter or something and the chicken was moist but overall it was a disappointment it came with wonderful green beans although they were seasoned and cooked perfectly. the mac and cheese but my friend thought it was good, we finished with a shortbread with strawberries macerated with balsamic and basil and containing some sort of cream, it was very good. I loved the earthy flavor that the basil brought to the dessert and the strawberries were tasty and tasted fresh overall, it was good but not great, maybe I had my expectations too high but I probably wouldn't come here again in the future.

ok i give the taco one more chance, i go in what's your best chicken, same, a burrito or a taco, he asks if you had the burrito, you didn't eat ether, no one ate anything here, i ask the rest of the restaurant crew, they all shake their heads, no ok, so even if the food was discounted or free, no one should ever eat the taco, doesn't matter, i ate a burrito and my worst fears were confirmed, they could have dipped in a taco bell and gotten better food, feed me bad food once, shame on you feed me bad food, shame on me

the fish tacos were good and the hip vibe was nice but the whole thing was a little too formulaic restaurant in a box concept no outliers not a lot of spices pretty bland in the middle of reading wait it's in Arizona ok no political jokes regarding Arizona I was solo with white and will continue to explore next visit

first of all there's nothing gourmet going on here it's basically a subway with free delivery and they have to deliver it for free otherwise there's no way you'll bother with the place where it's cheap flavorless generic food

I don't think I've ever been to a restaurant where I was treated so poorly by the servers. I'm rethinking my green rating because I honestly think this is my worst restaurant experience. The only good thing I can write is that this place is really cute and has a welcoming patio, lots of fairy lights and cute bistro tables. the drafty table in front of the door is the last available place. I don't want to sit in a place where incoming guests will constantly bump into my chair. I was shown a seat in the back and after trying to convince myself that I didn't want that table, the stewardess led us to the back. It's not the worst thing that could happen and it didn't ruin my evening. is on the back of the regular menu it is so small I missed it the first time she told me Friday night was frozen house margarita night so I followed her suggestion by the time I finished getting out my ID my dining partner was ready to order we had a quest appetizer the veggie tacos with a side salad and the pachuca plate while we waited a few other groups came in were greeted and had received their adult drinks, it had been ten minutes since I ordered my drink so I tried looking for our waitress, she finally appeared five minutes later but avoided eye contact with our table when she saw me she quickly ran outside, I understand she may have had a few tables outside but why have an inside section to wait in too the table right next to us had an amazing server who brought them two drink orders in the time it took to refill my glass of water, the margarita was still mia at this point, then the quest came out brought by two hipsters, it looked like a microwaved styrofoam plate in a frying pan and tasted just as bad, my friend tried to make the best of the situation, but I was ready to call the manager, I really really wish I had nasty quest juice leaking all over the table and there was no silverware or napkins to be found and no no one waiting or a hostess to ask for these items twenty minutes after ordering my margarita it was still mia our waitress finally appeared and asked me how the appetizer was. opportunity to ask for cutlery, the waitress made an excuse saying they should have already been on the table and went to get some when she returned. I asked about my drink with another lame excuse that could have been avoided if she watched us during the thirty minutes we were gone. the pachuca was dry is not pachuca supposed to be tender, dehydrated and edible overall, the salsa was the best part of the meal but you can't enjoy a dining experience with salsa alone, it was honestly my worst experience in a restaurant and I won't go back with much enthusiasm

the good virtually any sport you want to watch, they will have it on one of their many TVs for you, the strong drinks are made properly, their bartenders are excellent, the staff is very friendly and generally quite attentive, patio seating is plentiful, as well as a fire pit for the winter and the bouncers for the summer at the door know their stuff and will take out a crazy drunk before you even have to ask the bad one, the food really isn't very good, most of it is food of regular bar that comes out of a package and tastes like bland, boring crayons, their garlic fries and cheese sticks are delicious, although it can get busy on big game nights and, as such, service can get very slow or the servers may not even be aware that you're seated. The hostesses are not great. Sometimes at night they play music ridiculously loud.

I went here to try a new salon and they were very rude when I first walked in, like I was wasting time. I just wanted to know the prices for the tan and they kept trying to sell me other products even though I kept telling them no thanks. gave me a hard time saying I should do less in the end I was like whatever and did less time the only reason I give them two stars is because the beds are really nice and I got a good color from them but it wasn't worth it for me to want to go back

not busy at all but it took almost a minute for our meal to order the trout and was shocked to see a lot of bones hmm well asked the waitress about it and she said they were trying their best hmm isn't this a fish restaurant they cooked the trout but I'm still not sure I'll go back

1/2 stars I finally had my very first experience with Valley Oregano tonight, you'd think I went to the camel one ages ago because I live just a few minutes away, but no, it was the Tempe location that sucked me in, ok, not necessarily sucked me in. sitting down we ordered things I won't eat that resemble anything for the rest of the week, spinach salad, ok maybe I'll eat that cheesy bread, a large thin crust pesto pizza and pinky for dessert. tasty and the cheese bread was ok but the pinky dessert was awesome, maybe it's because I haven't had one since the bus back to college a long time ago but it was damn delicious, the scene was pretty loud and full of like I was all in college but duh, what else, all in all almost everything not good for me but whatever, now that I finally had my experience of oregano, I can move on with my life, nothing like a local pizza chain that holds you back

the place is avenue sushi was good but the red saki sangria was bad, the service was sporadic and we had one plate that they forgot to put the sauce on and a few other plates they tried to give us that we didn't order, I would try to find another place

I like frozen things ice cream frozen bananas snow on the top of the mountains icebergs glaciers avocados frozen cavemen everything is fine a friend introduced me to the golden spoon this afternoon what a treat they have small practical portions for the reasonable and very large portions for the greedy, it tastes good, it costs little and it really hits the spot

I went to this place on a friend's recommendation but only ate the custard, the lemon is quite refreshing and fluffy although I wish it was a little less sweet, it's a great place to visit after a light meal in downtown Mesa if you're looking to satisfy your sweet tooth but not go overboard. The service is fantastic and the parking is large as they have private land. Arizona Sundog will really feel the refreshment
the food is delicious the discriminatory service the bartender the blond gentlemen went around to everyone then finally recognize us it's embarrassing I don't know what else to say
the service was excellent and always an interesting time late on a Saturday night

tavern and ninjas are owned by the same restaurant group in houston, is it a coincidence that the name of the tavern is from someone who only reviewed these two places and gave each five stars, i don't think so, here's my unbiased opinion. The tavern is in Scottsdale in Seville where the boys were, they have a large outdoor patio which will be great when the weather is nice. brought out to start, it was mixed with chips and plantains and two lovely salsas. I also ordered the al carbon steak enchiladas, they were good and spicy, served with what I believe was a mole sauce overall, the quality of the food was good but a little pricey, I would return but it's not at the top of my list.
the owner has changed hands this place is not what it used to be if you want modern quality paper production to scrap happy or cropped girls

it's a good concept if the poor management of the owners had bothered to keep the atmosphere hip or classy, because it's save your money, get fast food mcdonald's has less fat, we had to ask for plates for the appetizer platter, it's supposed to be shared, so the waiter handed paper plates to my daughter, my salad was not a salad, it was a paper plate of mixed greens, really no tomatoes, nothing but lettuce and she threw a packet of Newman dressing on the table just like the ones you get at burger king or mcdonald's my steak it was ok i asked for medium and i got medium good and that was the best part of it all the steak is served on a paper plate and when i asked about utensils i was asked to go get mine from around the corner yeah plastic utensils for steak on a plate cardboard my daughter had a burger and it was so greasy the bun turned soggy brown halfway through then completely fell apart the service well let's pretend this place was do it yourself then everything would be fine the waitress left before my daughter finished her order she never came back and asked how things were really wrong if we were the dinner type it wouldn't have been a problem as she wouldn't have known we were gone daughter actually had to go find the waiter and ask for the bill. that everything is fine with them it could be great but they would need to make a lot of changes everyone would do it again if I could have given them one star I would have we won't be going back

for some reason Mays has a better shoe selection than the Scottsdale mall had last year. I found a pair of Calvin Klein sandals for half price and they have younger, higher end brands, which is a great selection from Nordstroms that tends to be aimed at an older crowd.

I booked a night at this resort hotel because my daughter had a volleyball tournament in the area and they had a special for suites. I wasn't impressed for a number of reasons. First, even after the discount, the rate normally included a resort fee that included things that any other cheaper hotel-motel would offer for free, like local calls. Secondly, for the price I would expect modern things like maybe a flat screen, they have been around for a few years now and a high priced place like this can't afford the inconvenience of others, it was the fact that their high speed internet cost per day I can get free high speed internet at any motel for less than a night. Other annoyances include a remote that didn't work and a shower head so loose it almost came off when I tried to adjust it. I would never pay for a night for this place and would even regret paying what I did.

I love Saddle Ranch for its laid-back nighttime festivities, including watching people ride the mechanical bull Helene, but I can't ignore the fact that the food was disgusting when I think about my meal last Friday night. I think of two words dry and cold. The spinach and artichoke dip was just okay, a little dry and not very cheesy. was dry and tasteless just like the bacon, it really takes some skill to cook bacon without taste, there are a few items the menu has some very unique and fun desserts and drinks that I haven't seen anywhere else yet, I love the giant pile of cotton candy and even though I'm not a big beer drinker the beer tower looks pretty brassy to me, I came and will continue to come for the fun atmosphere but I will definitely stay away food adiós cowboy
this place is way under seasoned, the beans were ok, I hate that they use store bought tortillas, I have no plans to go back, there are better places near downtown Chandler

I wish they had a star option too, the service and food was terrible, just a bunch of kids running the place, the place closes at noon, but when we went there at noon all the employees were too busy cleaning to get back early to help us. the manager lets a group of teenagers run the place and never returns

the stars went solo for lunch on a Sunday the place was nice and busy waited maybe a few minutes for a table to be seated but had to wait a few extra minutes for a high chair because the ones they had next to it were in use ordered the chicken thighs and waffles with fries and beans over rice the food came out with my starter a few minutes before my friends we never brought out the fries or beans and rice reason for that by the waiter there was a big party buddy who was slow cooking the food was good not great the staff was very nice and hospitable I will come back to give this place another chance try something different on the menu as the waffles were super heavy and the doughy chicken was cooked to perfection I swear I could have eaten pieces

I went today to meet my daughter for lunch, we are both huge sushi enthusiasts, the interior and atmosphere was beautiful, well laid out, the service was excellent, we ordered mess, it was good, nothing out of the ordinary, there's not much you can do to spoil it, the drinks were well poured but expensive for what you ordered. one more try, we'll see, I'll let you know if I do
the margaritas were good, the tacos were okay, the small guacamole was wonderful after ten, it gets really noisy in here, they need tequila flights

happy hour in Phoenix from pm to midnight Thursday yes to devils hey it's Phoenix you need to escape the scorching plus degree weather in a laid back place the staff is friendly and the atmosphere is fun and lively notice my warning about Phoenix qualifies my earlier observations of devils is good to be in Phoenix devils is a fun place to get silly and have a good time in a laid back setting it's reminiscent of a frat party though

quite a lot of food combined with poor service I tried the Firebird chicken pasta and had better with the chili peppers I also don't drink soda so I ordered a lemonade and since it was made at the bar without alcohol they were $$ each it looks cheap but $$ for sugar water and lemon then $$ for a second one ok the place was nice and huge inside if I took a customer out I would go there for appearance but for my wife, my son and myself, I think next time I will pass

you want a hotel what really matters cleanliness stars friendly staff and they had some really good barrel candy I agree now that we've gotten that out of the way funky smells in one of the hallways and the elevator at one end of the hallway was broken our entire stay I would come back although the price is solid

not impressed start with the service not professional it seemed the waiters had no idea of ​​table numbers we were given the wrong table order twice a second the food was conceptually a mess no clear theme or flavor profiles the food was very greasy and took forever to arrive none of the dishes were memorable thirdly the wine selection seemed lacking and the sommelier didn't know where the wine she was serving came from not impressed

ok so here's my two cents on the brat, I suggest avoiding the brats, I tried the Thai spicy brat beer, found them a bit dry and bland, also found the pretzels less than fabulous, I suggest trying big meatballs tasty and juicy, much better selection, very cool outdoor patio, cool open space with lots of seating and a big funky art wall, the service was also friendly and attentive and great fair prices overall, definitely worth checking out if you're in the area and in the mood for something different

oh math so what retards they work here came to pay my phone bill and literally stood in line for horrendous minutes, they had two friends in the salesroom this afternoon and the store was absolutely packed, what a genius decided to schedule two fucking idiots who knew anything on a busy Saturday afternoon and no, I don't care about upgrading my phone, I just want to pay my bill and from there, do you really think that after such poor service, I will want to upgrade your commission rate by purchasing an upgrade of my phone with you no

I decided to break the routine and get my hair cut at a great local clip. I called ahead and asked if they had an experienced hair stylist who could do a flat top. The lady assured me that was the case. Gunny and a flock of seagulls, I went home, put the clippers on and finished the job. I wouldn't come back here unless I lost a bet.

chain restaurant that is about okay for dining with friends if I didn't have beer at lunch I would probably suggest eating elsewhere the food is good but in my experience their beer makes the meal I have eaten here about half a dozen times over the past few years while in town for business weekends it is located on the corner of the mill and fifth street in downtown Tempe among many other local restaurants during my last visit. again the beer was exceptional so I wasn't unhappy overall, I love burgers and think I will stick to this as my main choice when eating here in the future. I can't think of any time when the service was particularly unsatisfactory and there were no times when the service really stood out as exceptional. but I can't always get it all down during a short lunch break. I'm a good place to eat if you're hungry and in the city center, but I wouldn't go out of my way to get there.

the beer is good, most of the food is okay but I have a big problem with the bus, they advertise their pizza as Chicago style deep dish when you order one you will know right away why there isn't a single location of this chain in Illinois the pizza is more like something I expected to have ordered at Pizza Hut than anything I had growing up in Chicago, have a beer here before seeing a movie next door, except it There are much better places to eat in and around the Chandler Fashion Center

we tried this last night, will not be returning, there is no indication when you walk in that it is a sit down restaurant, we stood like idiots in the hostess area until someone asked us if we needed anything, we sat down ourselves, then sat down and sat down as there was no assigned server, maybe that is a reason to seat customers so a server knows they finally arrived. The hostess asked us if anyone had helped us and she was very polite and took our order. the food, it would have been understandable if the place had been packed, but that might not have been the case, it might have been full on Saturday and there seemed to be a lot of waiters, there was a big party on the patio, I ordered the vegetarian salad, I can't remember the name of it, which advertised cicada beans with avocado and other delicious things. I emptied one and threw it on my salad it would have been more forgivable if they had forgotten it completely also the white beans were undercooked the pizzas were good I ordered the local organic vegetable one without cheese and it was loaded with summer squash roasted carrots local hmm olives leeks roasted onions and the crust was thin and crispy my husband also enjoyed his pizza I should actually give an extra half star to the hostess waitress who made my salad when I complained about it, I was ready to pay but she offered to take it off the bill the final nail in the coffin may not have been the restaurant's fault but the large party on the patio had elementary school age kids literally running laps around the restaurant for the first few minutes we were there. If ignorant parents are content to let their hells ruin the experience for other diners, I fear it will be up to the restaurant to politely and discreetly ask the parents not to reign them in on such a chance anyway, this place has some things to work on, luckily for us there are too many other big businesses nearby. for us to give him a second chance

if you like terrible service and overpriced food you are in the right place if i knew before going there i would be paying for macaroni and cheese and have the pleasure of waiting an hour to get it while my glass remained empty i would have stayed away that's what you should do the food wasn't horrible although the group cut their mouths eating rock hard bread on their sandwiches the macaroni cheese was nothing special, service was more than mediocre the first and last time I will eat at Hard Rock Café

let's talk about failure baby, hey, if your idea of ​​salad is punishment via tasteless lettuce and mealy tomatoes splattered with the most generic industrial dressing, you've found the right place to improve your tongue, go ahead, I ordered a check of capelin and replaced it with spaghetti. fresh tomatoes from Rome they had the texture and taste of a dying horse's ass more than fresh produce the slightly pungent garlic tasted like it came out of a shaker bottle not a light bulb and mother's respectable check should have more than a teaspoon of microscopically chopped basil this place makes the old spaghetti factory look like fine dining and I would rather starve than be even close to this chain restaurant from culinary hell this place is the brother disavowed junkie of it really is so terrible that I only gave them the one star because the management was incredibly charming and didn't charge for the unforgivable disaster masquerading as edible food that was worth paying for

I went here on vacation to visit my friend, neither of us had been there before but I know they have a lot of places on the west coast so we tried the staff was totally rude before we left, we called to check the hours the guy on the phone was condescending and acted embarrassed about having to give out information.

the food is ok sometimes good was excellent the service is terrible and a minute wait for lunch on Saturday seriously it seems the restaurant relies on a takeaway hostess ignored the people waiting to be on the waiting list irony intended to serve takeaway customers could tipping have any influence we were finally seated there was a pad thai with shrimp and chicken red curry the curry was very good but the shrimp was overcooked and the dish tasted noticeably different from the last visit the restaurant is incredibly loud to the point of being distracting we used to go there often but I will eat elsewhere from now on during Saturday shopping

so what kind of place serves chicken fingers and no ranch dressing the only sauces they had were honey mustard and secret cane sauce can I say new I thought the sauce tasted horrible I'm not too big a fan of honey mustard but I eat it sometimes if there's nothing else and it wasn't even good the coleslaw was horrible too I have to say the chicken fingers were very juicy but also very bland, they were the only dishes I tried, not that there were really any more items on the menu in Texas toast and fries, I think overall I will never go back

I moved to Phoenix from Northern California where I had my Dutch brothers serviced almost every day, so I've either been spoiled by the excellent customer service in my area or the service here is truly terrible. I have been there several times and they have all been extremely superficial and inattentive, not to mention they all charged me different prices for the same drink, one person charges me and someone else charges me, pull yourself together and be a little more friendly and real with your customers.

this place is hit or miss, that's why I would rate it average. I've come here so many times for lunch because it's so close to work and because my coworkers suggested it. I have eaten all the curries and every time the spiciness is different even if I ask for one sometimes it is not spicy at all and sometimes it is so spicy that my mouth burns. overcooked I would stick to the different types of curries red green yellow although it would be safer the curry sauce would seep into the meat and make it more tender the curries can also have different textures I have had it where it is thick and creamy as I like it or more diluted the lunch portions are quite small but I guess it is enough for a lunch meal beware of diapers if you are not too comfortable with spices, just order a lower number and you can add more chili if it's not spicy enough for you, I always do I would recommend this place and try your luck with the food here, you might get lucky and have a nice meal

oh at first you were intimidating, those crazy people coming out of your house shouting weirdly coming from the patio, not to mention your lack of leeway that causes your customers to watch each other drunk all night, but now I've learned to accept you, I don't like you yet, I'm still seeing other people, but I think we can have a future to love you in a few hours.

it's not a great place it's very upscale but the people behind the sushi bar don't really seem to know what they are doing it took forever to get a beer and sake here the worst was the yellowtail dashiki it looked like it was purple around the edges if you want to play it safe and get a tuna roll it will be Safeway quality but nothing too special this place is more about atmosphere and places to eat if you have a glittery Scottsdale shirt that you need to show off
like watching a train wreck in slow motion, I'll definitely go elsewhere for bagels from now on, disappointing, I've been going there for years, the eight day old cream cheese was a nice touch yuck

wow this place was terrible below I should have known since the place was empty on game night the food was greasy and flavorless everything on the plate was flat I said flat bland disappointing food save your money and eat at taco bell you will thank me later
pretty tasty dogs, pretty long wait for a hot dog
not long ago I went to get takeaway and everything tasted like fish

my wife and I stopped by last weekend to watch football and try a few of their beers. The food was excellent, this might be one of the best fries I've ever had, the beer was good, I noticed almost everyone was drinking the house beers so it was nice to see that kind of support for an established micro-brewery. There was a big crowd for the football lots of people wearing jerseys and everyone was really getting into their game. times since my first review and it's really just an average place the chips are the highlight the place is small noisy and well your average pub or brewery

overpriced, overcrowded and every time I've been there I've confirmed they serve the worst martini, but if you're looking to people watch this is the place where the interior allows for a great open ambience with open space overlooking the bar. I think the exhaust system isn't strong enough for the bedpan tables because I smell like fried food when I leave.
